The only negatives are that the hair capture cup is a tad small. There is also a plastic piece that guides hair into the cup that makes neck and cheek-line trimming a little tricky until you get the hang of it.

Overall a great trimmer for those of us real men with beards. A must have!!

The pallet I received contained concealer that does not spread evenly because it is very firm.  I have to either blend it with a dab of lotion or warm it up to use it, but I don't recommend the latter bc it settles in fine lines and makes wrinkles more prominent.  That said, it's a nice pallet and the colors were mostly true to the image shown--they are brighter, but similar.

Quickly approaching (a still, sadly, rather vain) age 40, I have personally spent a small fortune over the years trying to slow the aging process and reverse the effects of too many days spent gardening without sunscreen. I cannot even begin to list all the products I've somewhat foolishly gambled on to get my skin looking better. This product--and several other products offered through the company NEOTERIC (all under the Alpha Hydrox brand)--are exactly the answer I've been looking for. I've used them both alone and in conjunction with a more expensive brand of anti-aging products (for which I've also left good reviews on this site), and I can see great improvements both ways.

I decided to try this brand of alpha hydroxy cream after reading in Dr. Oz's (and Dr. Roizen's) book [[ASIN:0743292561 You: Staying Young: The Owner's Manual for Extending Your Warranty (You)]]. I'd tried several other alpha hydroxy products before this one (i.e. ROC, etc.) and must say this particular line (ALPHA HYDROX) is far superior to any other I've used. That it is also apparently considerably less expensive than most is icing on the cake, in my book.

Regarding this product, I find the key is to use it AT LEAST once a day, and always after using a mild cleanser. At my age I still get acne and, despite my sometimes manic picking, I notice it (and any residual puffiness or redness, and resulting scarring) clears up much, much more quickly than it used to. Also, my skin breaks out much less than before I used this. The tone and color of my skin are far improved when compared to prior to using this product. I've run out of it before and tried to use something else until I was able to locate more locally, and to my dismay the condition of my skin began to deteriorate.

I won't try to insult anyone by saying the Alpha Hydrox line will remove every wrinkle or fix all your skincare woes. If there is a product out there that does this, I want to know! But for now, this is by far the best line of products I've used. I use this item, particularly, with the line of skincare I reviewed previously, as that seems to address reversing the signs of aging better (where this one, for me, just improves the overall condition and appearance of my skin).

I think the pony tail holders may work for my little girls but the clips - definitely not. The clips are literally all the same just with different accessories glued on. I'm sure my girls will be able to use them on their dolls. Such a shame. The organizer box though is nice! I'm sure I'll be able to use it for something else.
Great stencils im just mad that I only like one stencil for my face features.

Great bundles. These bundles Are super soft and truths in length. The hair did not have a smell. I did not wash it before installing. The hair is
Silky And Staight.

I thought this would ne a waste, but boy was I wrong.  I love the shapes of the brow stamps and how they are fool proof.  The color stays on all day long and even through sweat and constantly touching my face.  I love it

Man let me tell you that this closure is not it.  It was beat once I bleached the knots it napped up so much I had to order another closure.  The bundles are not true to length and have way too many split ends, after I cut the ends it was more of 14-16 inch bundles.  The ends are nappy and it leads me to believe that the hair is a blend of human /synthetic.
TOOOOOO many split ends.  already crunchy.  Do not bleach
great for dry scalp.  Makes my 4c hair shine and more manageable.  will order more

I use this faithfully on my girly areas and it get it baby soft no stubble.  Love it.  I can use it in the shower or in front the mirror.  Great battery life/  Oh he likes it too but we fight over it so I am just gonna order another.

This is most definitely not satisfied with product. I tried to bleach hair but color didn’t left. The bundles did have a nice texture to them but hair did not take the color dye and it melted.  Its not 100% human, it is a blend.  be careful
Not enough color for me, and it wipes right off.  In this summer weather it is a must to have you makeup stay and last all day,  my brows were gone in 2 hours.

What an absolutely beautiful mannequin head.  The quality is excellent  just like a living Barbie doll like quality. The eyelashes are actual fibers, not just painted on and her eyes are beautiful.  They did an incredible job with the makeup on this mannequin, but me being me I changed it. She even has pierced ears, love it.  This is the 2nd one of these that I have gotten for a display and she is as beautiful as the other.

Bundles !!! Great hair, no smell, no shedding, no ragged ends.  Hair lasted about 3 weeks then got nappy at the ends.  I would not recommend bleaching.  Its ok quality, hair you get in a pinch when you have an event to attend.  Not birthday hair.  lol

Good colors but I needed 3 coates with these small bottles it will be gone in no time.  Love these colors, so vibrant and feels like spring. Easy to apply, easy to take off - gel polish has slowly made its way into my heart. I love them.
Great hold for lace wigs.
Didn’t work for me.  I guess you must have kind of thick brows to begin because painting skin is not good,  it peeled right off leaving no trace of brow.  too thick to not peel off.  im perplexed
Smaller than displayed. Hair started to unravels upon removal out the pack. It was a hot mess!  Cannot cut them

Awesome product.  Yes the smell is terrible and the ingredients are no better, but I may say it gets my 4c hair straight and keeps me from flat ironing it daily.  Its a lot of steps and not for the faint of heart.  It works for me.  It kept my hair straight for at least 2-3 months and then my curls reverted back slowly.  Will buy again.

I have lost a lot of hair and I can see in my hairline that it was thinning badly, my mom has the same issue and is fully bald in her crown.  I tried all products like rogain and pills. And I found this beauty and omg after just two weeks I see little hair growing in my thinning hairline and now 3 months later and 3 bottle of the hair serum later my hair grow back to normal thank you again very good product and costumers service

Makes my hair fuller, and I did like the scent and how easy it was to use. I didn't like how small the bottle is, how much you have to use to get my hair coated, however it doesn't clean well, and gave my hair any extra volume.
Not full human hair, its ugly and I cant even tell what is the front or the back.
my curls do not last, but it heats up quickly but for some reason my curls will not last.
Lord this hair is nappy  DO NOT BUY

I cut it, did a curl set and steamed the curls with a clothing steamer to set and brushed out.
The shade of blonde is very pretty, it is sort of a lightest ash blonde, not entirely platinum but not as yellow as a #613.

I love the size and shape of this flat iron. I’m able to get close to my roots to make my hair silky straight. This size is perfect for long hair and cuts my flat ironing time in half. All it takes is one pass of the iron to make my hair straight.  Love that it has auto shut off
This hair is amazing! Doesn't tangle easy, easy to braid, and after dipping, they hardly fuzz. I've used other brands, and this is by far the best for the price. Will definitely buy again.

This is by far the best toothbrush ever.  The bristles are super soft and get my teeth and gums clean.  I will purchase over and over again.  I will never change this is the best brush I have ever had the pleasure of using.  This is even better than the electric toothbrush.  Please do not hesitate to buy you will not be disappointed.

cute colors for fall.  Only 2 coats needed.  Nice,  opaque gel polishes that last! All are very unique and perfect neutrals. the shade names are  the color of the shade inside the bottle which is helpful, but the are not stuck on the bottle very well.  Nice size bottles.

I am very happy with this product! There is definitely a learning curve at first but once you get the hang of it it's easy! it’s not as easy as it looks. You’ll have to figure out a good technique that works. I have thick curly hair, I use it after I straighten it, my hair has yet to get tangled in it.

Cheap, Very soft, good quality Marley hair.  I buy braiding hair on Amazon a lot but, never keep track of which I buy. This is my second purchase, different color first time for ombre. I love this hair and it's easy to install.  No itching or irritation to my scalp.  Good smell and color
Did the individual crochet method and loved it.  Some of the twists are bigger/smaller, used the larger in the back.  You will need additional packs if you want a full head.  Love the inches

Makes the most hilarious eyebrows.  I am going to try on someone else maybe thats the issue.  The stencils are too long I have thin short brows and this does not fit my face at all.  Package arrived on time is about this best thing about this product.  Sorry but NO!!!!
I use these containers for very thing when we on vacation from lotions to sprays

cute but thing.  I ordered an additional pack to make it fuller, but that is all I have to complain about.  Others may like it as it is but I prefer big and full hair.  I will order a 26 or 28 inch to make it full and long.  I always wanted a bang wig.

These eyelashes are not for the daily wearer. If you’re looking for dramatic, extremely voluptuous eyelashes, these are the ones you need to buy. For those that are looking for everyday wear that looks natural, I would advise you to look at the wispy type. They have  cross hairs patter that look gorgeous. They lasted for over a week and I slept in them

This did nothing for my edges or flyways.  Maybe I can use it for my brows to make them lay smooth,  other than that its useless for AA hair types.  It does smooth down the edges but they do not stay put for more than and hour.  It might for in a pinch if you forget to lay your edges .

Great ombre braiding hair.  not to many snags, or tangles while braiding.  It dips well and is able to hold a curl for a very long time.  This was enough to do my cousin entire head.  Love it, will order more

I use this to tone my closures after I bleach them.  works like a charm to take the redness or orange out of the hair.  works like a dream and it makes the hair much softer after bleaching, I did not get the crunchy roots.
It has more of a masculine scent to me.  It does not last for a long period of time.  It has an earthy texture and does not mix with my body scent at all.  I do not like it
Do not be alarmed by the peeling or non peeling, it took a few days to get my feet to peel.  When they finally did peel it left my feet looking younger and softer.  I will purchase again
Heats up fast and has extreme drying power it dries my hair in 15 minutes instead of the usual 30-40 minutes to dry my thick hair.  Gets my hair shiny.

This is super cute but its needs some tlc.  It needs to be thinned out and layered for my liking. If you are able to do that this can be a great unit.  I thinned out the sides and layered the top.  Its really cute now.  Its synthetic and not a lace wig but you can make it look catural.

They ok, not the best lashes..... I like em full and long.  these are church lashes (LOL)  but they work, they stick to your eyes momentarily they last about 2 days whereas my usual lashes last for about 4-7 days.  Says reusable but you will have to clean them well.

I use this for sun burns, and other burns.  I also use on my face and skin to calm down my irritation after wearing a face mask for 12-16 hours a day while at work.  I place a quarter size amount in my hand ans massage through my skin.  It soothes my face and leaves my skins feeling soft and supple.  I love this stuff

These are fashion lashes, not for daily use.  They are very long and noticeable.  Great for nights out and picture taking.  Not really intended for work or school.  They are easy to put on and take off, but they rip easily.  They are very dramatic and long so be aware.

Great for daily wear, I even sleep in them.  They come off easily when I need to remove and do not pull my own lashes out.  They do not feel like mink lashes and seem more of a plastic feel, but are soft and mimic mink lashes great.  They are think and luscious but are not cartoony.  I have had this pair on for 4 days now and still look great.  Everyone thinks I put them on daily but, nope I sleep in them and they do not get bent, fold, or lift while I sleep. They are easy to put on, I prefer using hair glue and install them directly above my lash line to prevent my lashes from being removed.  I will order more.

Good lashes but not dramatic enough for me.  They are lightweight and stay on for at least a week almost two.  The length is good but the drama isnt there.  These are good for everyday use for me.  I would buy again.

Great lashes, soft and east to put on.  they look so real and make my eyes pop.  I have used them several times and they do not fall off easily.  Very full and dramatic but natural.  Love them.  will purchase more.
I was very hopeful for this item but sorry it does not work for me I have oily skin and they do not stick after a while.

I am more of a thick hair girl so I was not amazed at this wig.  I have a large head so the wig looks very thin on me.  The construction is superb and the  knots are bleached and the hairline plucked.  perfect if you have a thin face.  The length is fine

got this to add to my bundles,  HORRIBLE, sheds, is nappy, and brittle, I have never had  closure this awful.  EVER.  I wet it every hour and as soon as i look n the mirror its poofy, nappy, and ZERO waves.  I wish i could return.  PLEASE DO NOT ORDER THIS CLOSURE!!!!!!!!!!!  ive had it for two weeks installed. and cant take it anymore.  i am replacing the closure this weekend
its balding
i purchased this to match other hair.  blended perfectly.

bundles are thin.  i have an undercut and both sides shaved  i used all except 1/2 bundle.  hair sheds, ends are thin.  so thin in fact i cut off about  4 inches off the ends.  it doesn't tangle that much.  no smell.  hair is dry and doesnt hold curls well.  the curl patter fell straight out the pack.  the hair is not true to length.  the 28 is more like 24 and after cutting the ends its like 20.  not the best or worst.  wont purchase again
good

the bundles are ok. I bleached them and died them and they are still soft. received the same day which was awesome for hair. If u need in a hurry this is the place. true to length ( in spots), no odor, bleached the knots and did not thin out the hairline it was ok. The frontal was super large, which i found crazy cause i have a large head. but better it be big than small and tight. Overall a good purchase for my first wig making adventure. probably would order again if the seller can guarantee the frontal and bundles match.

Update: a month after I have made my wig, the 360 frontal holding up. the bundles are ok. I have died and fried this hair many times. it is holding well.

My husband used this kit and took, when asked to do a bit of a review on it for me, took it very seriously. The price isn't cheap so he wanted to make sure to really look at everything as he used it. Here is what he had to say:

"You have a pack of accessories here so I thought I would run through them in turn to tell you what you are getting and my impression of it

Shampoo and body wash.
Okay, I ran through this way too quick and used all of it. It's good. It's really good and I couldn't really get enough of it. So that's a plus and a negative in that there isn't really a lot of it to begin with.

Face wash.
I love to get In there and give my face a right good scrubbing. This helps. The wash is thick and gel like with the exfoliating, and it does feel like you have given your face a good scrub after use. You do feel cleaner after use.

Shave cream
I'm not one for using cream very often. I prefer basic foam from a can. But wow. This stuff leaves your face feeling clean and fresh after shaving. Not only that but incredibly soft.

Moisture cream
This is really not something I use at all. I would think it best to use after shaving because you are stripping moisture from your face, but in that regard the shave cream is sufficient. I just don't personally have a need for a separate moisture cream. So it is sort of hard to form an opinion about it.
What I can tell you is that it doesn't really have a scent, my face does feel super soft. On the downside it is a little messy and I found myself wiping away the excess.

For the most part then I really like this set. It comes in a handy pouch you can use long after the accessories are empty. However, that won't take too long because the bottles are very small. It's something for people who aren't concerned about the cost. It's very expensive. Is it worth the cost for me? Not really. Not in terms of either quality or quantity but if the price was lower I would be recommending to everyone."

There you go guys and gals. That's what he thought about the set. He's still talking about it so he did like it, just thought it was a bit much.

This is an excellent shampoo and conditioner set. It's nearly perfect. I'm putting this at a 4.5. Now I don't know if this is just my hair being obnoxiously dry or not but that would be the only thing that I could say anything remotely "bad" about. The conditioning was just not quite enough on the ends of my hair. Great on the already healthy stuff, just seemed to ignore the drier ends. Figured I'd get that over with and move on to the good stuff.
This really gave my hair a nice shine to it. My hair is getting old with me and it no longer wants to be as manageable and tame as it once was. With this duo of delight my hair looked healthy after it dried. It looked good when left to air dry, when dried with the hot air brush, and when left to air dry. It looked shiny without the added matching shine spray (which is also a wonderful product) and with. I left out the word smooth in this so far but let me tell you! It was also smooth and sleek without having to use other products to make it stay that way. Granted, under all that grey old hair there has always been fairly thin straight hair so this just really put it back to looking like it used to in that regard. The shampoo cleaned it to the point of being squeaky clean as well.
Give this duet a try if you can. It works really well and smells alright to boot!

My husband is the one that used this because he was going through a rough patch. He is more prone to acne than I am and recently he's been getting more and more breakouts. I asked him to let me know how he felt about it after using it. Here is what he had to say about it:

"So like many people i have been wearing a mask all day. It's hot and it becomes humid under the mask. Perfect breeding place for acne. It was forming all around my mouth. I'm not going to complain about it. Just that's how it is now, and we have to work with it.
This serum seemed to be working at first. It's easy to apply using the dropper. Just squeeze a few drops on to the affected area and let it dry in.
You will notice when you use it that your skin appears to be tightening. Also with continued use the red marks on your face will lighten and eventually fade.
I had to stop using it. I believe it was working at first but after some continued use it was making things worse and the acne was spreading. I have a slightly oily skin type and this may not have been best suited to me.
Glad I tried it and I have a feeling that it may work better for a different skin type than mine."

There you have it. That's what he thought about it.

This is a very good set of brushes and combs, especially for the price. They work great. You get four things in this set. You'll receive a paddle brush, a rectangle comb, a detangler hair brush, and a tail comb. I don't really use the combs as much as the brushes but did give them a bit of a testing so I could type a review. I absolutely love all of these brushes and combs. They are sturdy and work very well. When used for what they are supposed to be used for specifically I thought they all held up well and did their jobs. They detangled perfectly and when used for styling they were easy to hold on to, didn't get in the way at all, and worked the hair into it's style nicely.
I would recommend these if you are looking for a good set of hair brushes and combs that won't cost you much. These are terrific for that!

These are terrific! I really like these hemp and rose under eye mask patches. If you have puffy tired eyes that crave some tender loving care then these just may be what you need. They work so well. You put them on under your eyes after washing and drying your face. Just leave them on for 10-15 minutes and when you remove them you gently massage the product into the skin. That's it!
The one thing that isn't so great is that they are so hard to separate when you first open the packet and take them out. They stick together and to themselves and it's very frustrating trying to get them without losing the liquid and getting yourself all covered in it. Other than that these are a definite win.

My husband put this kit to good use so I asked him if he'd mind letting me know what he thought about it. He didn't mind at all and this is what he had to say:

"Very comprehensive, quality kit for men. If you're like me you will find there are items in here that you likely won't really need. I personally don't use hair pomade or those light shave creams. I prefer foam and my hair just sort of keeps my head warm.
Aside from the items I can't use there are some great items in here for everyone. The body scrub soap like and feel a good bit more fresh after using it. But my preference, and where I really came to appreciate this, was with the facial moisturizer and lip balm. I don't usually buy those items and let the winter have its way with my face. I ride a bike everyday. But using the items in this kit really helped me keep my skin from drying, and my lips. The lip balm tastes and smells great, too."

That's what he had to say about it. He did genuinely seem to enjoy using this kit.

This shampoo and conditioner leaves hair feeling clean, soft, and manageable after the first use. It smells nice, too, which is also a plus!
My hair is not that of a teen or even young adult anymore so it's been through a lot. When looking for shampoo and conditioning products I tend to look closer at those that claim to make hair stronger, reduce breakage, and things with words like "restore" and "fortify". These hit the mark so I decided to give them a shot.
I've been using them about three weeks and I think that they are definitely doing my hair some good. It looks healthy and feels very soft. The conditioner does a good job with tangles and knots. I do sometimes still use a leave in conditioner or separate type of moisture just because it's winter my hair is increasingly dry on any given day depending. I can't tell for sure about the breakage but it does seem stronger. I suppose in many ways they go hand in hand. It has more pull to it so it's not snapping and breaking as much.
I like this. A little goes a long way as well which is nice.

Unfortunately I wasn't a fan of this one. It didn't do much to help my lips. Rather than exfoliate it actually just seemed to dry out my lips and not just a little bit. It wasn't fun. I tried it a few times, as directed. Just apply a small pea-sized amount to the lips using a finger-tip, scrub gently in a circular motion to remove the dead skin cells for about 30 seconds then rinse or eat off remaining sugar. All of that was done, rinsed not eaten though the one thing that was good was that it didn't taste half bad. Alas, my poor lips were left in worse shape than ever. Dry and roughed up. No matter how hard or gentle I used the stuff over a three week period. I finally gave up and had to admit defeat. Perhaps others had better luck?

This mask is very nice. I have never used a mask like this one before. It's heavier than the usual thin almost paper or gel like masks that a lot of them seem to be. This one definitely has a bit more to it. It's also a two piece mask which is great in some ways because sometimes I looks like a one person comedy routine trying to get the masks on right while they flip and flop all over.
With this mask you put the bottom part then the top by your eyes, it makes it a lot easier. Then you leave it on for at least 20 minutes ( though it says to leave it on for 30 so I did that). When you take it off you gently pat the left over into your skin.
It leaves your skin feeling so soft and really well moisturized. I feel like it did a very nice job with firming up the skin as well. I have only used two of these so far, one a week over two weeks, and have really liked the way my skin looked and felt after each use. I would recommend giving these a try if you can. Perhaps in summer as they have a nice cooling feel to them that I bet would feel great in the summer heat!

(3.5)
Beautiful scrunchies. These scrunchies are very nice. They are made from 100% real natural raw mulberry silk. What makes these special is that they are not supposed to pull your hair as much or get stuck like many others do. That is true of these! The scrunchie works great. It goes in nicely, holds the hair back, doesn't slide out, and when it's taken out there is little to no hair caught in it.
However, I can't really see that the price for one is a great one. This is something you have to sort of weigh the options out though for yourself. I have noticed less hair pulling and loss with this hair thing, but the cost is up there. It's a good scrunchie but it's truly up to you if you'd spend that much on one. Maybe the other options make the prices seem less daunting?

These underarm sweat pads are just the thing for that extra protection in times of need! Sometimes no matter how much or what kind of deodorant you use, you just can't seem to stop the unsightly and ever so embarrassing pit stain of doom. With these placed in your shirt the sweat never reaches your shirt and your garments are saved!
These work very well. To use them you simply lay your shirt down flat, remove the covering over the adhesive, place firmly in the spot needed, and you are good to go. When you are going to take it off remember to very gently remove it because it can become pretty sticky. It mentions this when you read about the product above but it is worth the reminder here!
These work very well and are a good option if you have problems often or occasionally with sweaty underarms.

A few things here …

LES ENFANTS is French for CHILDREN

It doesn’t refer to infants or toddlers. For those who don’t know, a quick note …

Newborn – birth to 4 weeks
Infants – 4 weeks to 1 year
Toddler – 1-3
Preschooler – 3-5
Child – 6-13

That said …

It does state NOT TO SPRAY IT ON A BABY’S SKIN. “Applying gently on clothes” is the preferred method. Though to be honest, I’d say this is more for ages 6+

While baby cologne isn’t something I would use on a baby, it could be better for adults who want a light scent and not overwhelmed by a perfume.

For almost $30, this is an 8.5 fl oz spray. Compared to some perfumes and colognes, this is moderately priced.

Smell? It isn’t the greatest. I do like it as a light, after-bathing scent. It seems more suited to a room freshener than a perfume. But, it isn’t the WORST perfume/scent I’ve smelled.

The generous size means it will last a while.

Would I get it again? No. Nor would I recommend it either.

I honestly don’t even know WHERE to begin with this review 🤷🏻‍♀️

I have, in my lifetime – and, wearing “fake” nails for OVER 25 YEARS – NEVER seen this type of … idea 🤦🏻‍♀️

I’ll be as short as possible with this …

Most anyone who hasn’t had an amputation, usually has 8 fingers and 2 thumbs – total of 10 “DIGITS” ✋🏻🤚🏻 And, in MOST cases – the nails are usually shaped the same.

Thus, in a set of nails you’d need:

💅🏻 2 – Thumb nails
💅🏻 2 – Index fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Middle fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Ring fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Pinkie fingernails

I know – sounds almost silly or stupid to mention, but that’s math. Total “NAILS” needed: 10 … (“Luxury 12pcs press on nails kit comes with 10 different sizes which is pre-numbered 0-9 in a box” … “choose the most suitable size that fits you every finger”). Hard to fit every finger when the nails are different sizes.

And, we’re NOT all sized the same. Hence why some packaging is no less than 24 nails with 12 sizes. I know because I’ve bought nails like this for YEARS! Just look up KISS and you’ll see what I am talking about.

This?

Was this a joke? This is a set of TWELVE (12) nails – 10 different sizes! 🤷🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️

Unlike the model hands – I don’t wear my nails OVER the edges of my finger. That is NOT how you wear these nails to begin with – and definitely NOT with nail glue. Even being “fake”, the nails should at LEAST attempt to look realistic. See how the salons do them, look on Google (or your favorite search engine).

Who thought this was a great idea? And, these HAVE to be the LARGEST sizes for the particular “nails” I’ve seen. These really are a fancier version of the Lee and Wet N’ Wild from the late 1980’s/early 1990’.

What’s worse? Even the PACKAGING states: 24

Did they not think anyone would notice that detail?

I’ll admit, these are pretty. And, thinking it was a HALF package, I contacted Amazon for a return/replacement. I cancelled the replacement, but I am returning these. As I told the rep – they’re pretty useless as they are. There is NO way I can use these. I would, at MINIMUM, only get 4 nails worth of coverage. For this price? Nope. Not at all. And, I feel sorry for those who do have to pay.

In addition, the nearly $16 price tag (excluding sales tax) for 12 nails? Unreasonable. In my case, I’d need TWO (2) sets which would run $32. For that price – I might as well just wear a mask, go to the salon, and have them do it for me. My nails would definitely last two weeks, and I wouldn’t have to do them myself.

I will not be getting these again and DO NOT recommend them. The seller might have a better set out there, but not this selection.

This is an exfoliating facial cleanser that really didn't feel that great or give me that much in benefits. For $23 it is not something I'd get again or recommend. It was slightly overpriced and overhyped.

This is, for less than $10, a lovely comb.

Can function at a wedding or other event. However, the cons outweigh the beauty.

Given how delicate this is, there is NO storage box or bag. So, after use – where does one put it? That is an issue for me. Even a simple velvet type bag would be a good idea.

Second? The comb itself.

While absolutely stunning in design – function is a bit questionable because of the construction. The combs are “OPEN” design – thus loose hairs can weave in, particularly those with thick and curly hair. This makes removal or readjusting a bit difficult if not a tad uncomfortable.

This is also for thicker hair, not thin, and thus circles back to the issue I just presented.

While pretty, it isn’t something I am particularly pleased with. It isn’t something I would get for myself again. I also wouldn’t give it as a gift.

I think a lot of us want an easier way to remove hair. Shaving, especially for a bigger girl like me, is not that easy. It’s worse when you have long legs, short arms.

It’s bad when you have certain chin hairs (thankfully not that much it isn’t manageable another way).

I tried some sugar wax kit back about 20+ years ago. That was a NIGHTMARE! It was supposedly edible. I think you microwaved the container, spread it on, let it cool, used a paper strip (supplied) to remove the hair. It didn’t work and stung.

I then moved to a hair removal cream, that partially worked.

After that? Back to the hold stand-by –> shave foam/cream and a razor. For my main body parts, that’s always worked. Tough “chin” hairs –> using a tweezer work. No, the dermaplaning tool didn’t work on them.

I got a wax warmer, so I thought all beads/beans were equal.

These came with ZERO instructions, and the after spray bottle was busted. The warmer kit at least had some. And, my warmer kit had specially made, disposable “cups”.

These beads/beans, in a smaller cup, took over 90 minute to melt. And, the warmer was on 180°(F).

I tried a small amount on my arm. The wax was sticky, not liquidy, and it cooled almost as soon as it hit my skin.

I let it sit there for a few minutes (over 5), and peeled the max off. It didn’t hurt, sting, or cause redness – then again …

THE HAIR WAS STILL THERE

Okay, so my hair on my arm is a little thin. But, if this removes thick hair, shouldn’t it remove thinner hair?

I found another patch, got some warm wax – tried it again. Nope. Tried legs, arms, and under my chin. Nothing. Then again, I see I'm not the only one experiencing issues with these beads/beans.

I may have gotten a bad batch. But, I definitely wouldn’t get these again.

As most have said here – these are great for travel, especially when you can’t find soap around but have water. Though I wouldn’t carry a bar of soap, I have used “travel” size body wash as a hand soap. If it cleans the body, should clean the hands, right?

Anyway …

The metal container I got was dented, but that is okay as I don’t intend to travel where I won’t have soap. So, I’m using these at my bathroom sink.

LET ME STATE THIS AS A WARNING: HANDS MUST BE DRY BEFORE GRABBING A SOAP SHEET.

I know all caps is yelling, but trust me – it is for a VERY GOOD reason. As one reviewer said, even a drop of water can damage these.

Basically I grab a one with dry hands, hold it in palm, turn water on, let it dissolve. Good lather, I don’t really smell a “scent”, hands wash clean. They don’t dry out, but I do use a moisturizing sanitizer, and hand lotion after.

I wouldn’t say these go years – if you’re like me and using them as an alternative to other hand soaps to preserve waste, they might last about a month (8 washes per day, 30 days). If only as travel backup – they might last a few years. Again, it depends on how they’re used.

I personally find them a bit on the pricey side at almost $10 before tax. That’s just me.

I do have other soaps, and these should last me a while. I would not recommend them as a body wash. As opposed to carrying a bar of soap, try a travel container with body wash. Just my suggestion.

This product as a lot going for it. I love the idea of the individually gift boxed tubes, the cap is wonderful (huge and easy to use), the product is generously sized.

The problem is that this stuff is runny, doesn’t absorb that well on me, and the “scent” that is there – it isn’t that great.

For $15 before tax, that is roughly $3.75 a tube, and while they’re smaller – I’d honestly stick with Bath & Body Works.

This isn’t something I’d get again and I wouldn’t recommend it. I also wouldn’t give it as a gift.

Colorful manicure and pedicure kit for home, gym, or travel.

Has most everything needed and easy to store. Love the pretty case. Price is great as well.

Each tool is functional and works great.

I have been trying, for well over 30 years, to get a curling iron that actually did what it was supposed to – curl my hair.

Hot curlers – no good results

Curling Irons (¼, ½) – no good results

Wrap-Around Fabric Curlers – nothing there

I saw this and thought it couldn’t fail. Simple to use – plug in, turn on, heat up, section hair, and use – put hair in, count down.

Works in theory, fails in execution. First up – there is NO heat seating guide for SAFE curling. THIS DEVICE IS CELSIUS (C) ONLY, NO FARENHEIT (F) OPTION. Google is strongly needed here.

According to Redken: “For those with fine or thin hair, keep your iron set below 200 (so below 100°C on this device) degrees Fahrenheit. Any higher and your strands may burn. For those with coarse or thicker hair, have your curling iron set between 200 degrees and 300 degrees (148.9°C or on this device 150) Fahrenheit for optimal curls” [9 Curling Iron Secrets You Need to Know About/Redken]

Using that, as well as Glamour’s 8-10 second rule [How to Curl Your Hair Correctly: 7 Mistakes to Avoid – Glamour; “Drill it into your brain: You should hold an iron on your hair for eight to 10 seconds max”], along with using thinner groups of hair – I should have SOME wave. Nope. I even went 25 seconds. Nothing.

As my hair has become a bit thinner, has been color treated, and exposed to SO much – I wasn’t about to turn this up hotter.

The curler is designed much like a crimper, but the “width” can make it difficult to handle, especially by yourself. There is a “guard” which heats up as well and it is easy to burn yourself.

It wins with innovative idea as well as the digital temp gauge. Also, it does heat up SUPER fast, as well as cool down just as fast when lowering the temp.

For use by myself – this is a two star deal. Perhaps if someone else were around it might be easier, but this definitely did not work well.

I really wanted to LOVE this scrub – there was just too much wrong with it to even LIKE it.

First of all – this is FAR TOO THICK to squeeze out of the tube. I had to SMASH it with my arm to get it to MOVE.

The scent? If you’re looking for Bath & Body Works type of Cherry Blossom, you’re not going to get it.

Once you get it out, and can take the scent – after it is applied, it is a soft, moisturizing and no slip scrub.

This isn’t something I’d get again or recommend.

This UV/LED lamp is by far one of the best I’ve used. I have another one by OVLUX (one of my favorites). So, when I saw this, I didn’t hesitate to get it to have on standby.

There are a few issues with it, but I’m overall pleased.

Very easy to use.

Be warned, this is NOT “dip powder”. This is indeed acrylic powder in VERY small jars.

This does not come with instructions though – at least mine didn’t. So that could make this a bit hard to work with.

The colors are pretty though.

This isn’t the best kit out there, I have seen better ones. The packaging isn’t that stable or durable. I ended up putting the jars in a pencil case.

I honestly wouldn’t get it again. As far as durability, I usually do my manicure every week or so.

I mainly got these for a “home-made” gel soak off (using foil).

And, they worked! They don’t pinch at all; even my mom used them and said she could barely feel them.

Light weight and fairly durable. There are enough for two people to use at the same time, or extras on hand if they ever break.

If used for poly gels, I’m sure they would work just as well.

Pretty standard nail drill.

This is similar, if not identical to most of the nail drills used in the salon.

Best used to remove gel polishes and/or nail tips to prepare them for other polishes or plain removal.

Thank you in advance to the Amazon VINE program for providing an item to review. A positive review was not required, nor was it requested, and all words are my own.

Getting my nails done is not just a relaxing experience, but it is also an expressive/creative one.

Seeing this colorful and glittery set – I had to get it.

I don’t know about others’ experiences – mine did not come with a brush or applicator for the little “gel pots”. I remembered what my nail techs used to use – small make-up brushes – and thankfully I had some. That seemed to work.

The black polish is necessary to get the desired effect. I chose the purple glitter gel and after a few awkward moments – I got a pretty decent manicure. More of the black showed through, there were moments when the purple glitter reflected, but it wasn’t what I thought.

I haven’t tried the other colors. But, this is fairly decent and easy to use. Not my favorite as there are other brands out there that are even easier to use.

Overall, I’m not too unhappy with it. It’s not something I would likely purchase again.

I'm disappointed. Mostly in myself as I should have read the ingredient list carefully. This is just a glycerin soap with chemicals and a negligent amount of honey and lots of heavy perfume. It's a bit drying for my face. I will probably finish this as a hand soap.
I'm going to continue to look for a better, more natural honey soap.

The Multivitamin Sleeping Mask by Vitamasques is made in Korea. The tube has a foil safety seal under the cap.

I liked the concept of a face mask I could wear to bed. I’m not as good as I should be at keeping to a proper skincare routine. So I thought this sleeping mask would be great. Put it on before bed and wake up with a hydrated, healthier face.

The directions say “Apply a generous layer before you sleep or whenever your skin needs a nourishing boost.” I started with a small pea-sized drop, which was enough for my whole face.

The mask has a gel consistency and goes on clear. But it did not absorb into my skin. After fifteen minutes, my face was still sticky and tacky. No way would I go to sleep like that, my face would stick to the pillow.

So I washed the mask off, which was a disappointment since it’s supposed to be a “non-wash off mask.” My skin was a little softer, but having to wash my face because it was still sticky defeats the purpose of a mask that I’m supposed to be able to wear to sleep.

This jelly facial cleanser from Vitamasques is made in Korea.

The tube has a foil safety seal under the white cap. The cleanser is brown with a jelly-like consistency. It does have a scent, a mix of green tea and tea tree oil. I do notice the scent when using the cleanser but the scent doesn’t linger.

A small drop is enough to wash my face and neck. It doesn’t make a lot of lather but does feel silky going on the skin. I really like the consistency of it.

And I really like how well the cleanser works! It cleaned two layers of sunscreen grime and sweat off my face. Some face washes don’t remove all the sunscreen residue, and I have to keep washing my face or use an exfoliating scrub. This cleanser? One wash and done. I was amazed by how well it worked.

I’m in my 30s, white, with sensitive combination skin. The cleanser did not irritate my face at all.

If I have a choice between a plain headband and a unicorn headband, well, I’m picking the unicorn headband every time!

These headbands are super cute and colorful. The faux fur is soft and doesn’t shed, and really adds to the unicorn aspect. The horns stand up from the headband, and are sparkly silver. The ears don’t stand up as well, they’re a bit floppy, and also have sparkly silver on the backs.

The headbands are on the smaller side. I measured approximately 6 inches across the opening with a headband unstretched, and about 9 inches when fully stretched. I like that the headbands are tight, they stay on my head and hold my hair back. I don’t have to keep fussing with them, they stay in place. They are about 2½ inches wide, which helps with comfort.

This pack of 16 nail files from Keiby Citom is a great value.

I started doing dip nails at home, and the worst part is getting off the old manicure. I have to file off the layers of top coat, which can take a while if I don’t have a good file. I prefer a glass file for actually shaping my nails, but they’re not good for removing layers of polish.

Using one of these files, I had the top coat filed off all my nails in less than ten minutes. The 100 grit side is perfect. I actually asked a nail tech friend what I should use, and she told me 100 grit.

The files come in a zipper seal plastic bag that can be used to store them.

The edges of the files aren’t sharp. I’m talking about the edges that touch your skin; sometimes these can be sharp, especially on pro files, and need to be seasoned to prevent cuts. No problems with that here.

The look of the Lassie hair dryer is what caught my eye first. It just looks cool! I have the PinkGray color. The gray is a medium shade with a smooth finish that won’t pick up hairs and dust. The pink is a metallic magenta that really pops.

The speed controls are on the handle. The slide button doesn’t move easily, so there’s not a big chance of accidentally changing the speed/temperature without meaning to. On the back of the handle is the option for either cool or hot temperature.

The hair dryer doesn’t dry my hair any faster than any other hair dryer I’ve used. But I like that I can set the temperature to cool to lessen damage and not have to hold in a cool shot button.

The hair dryer isn’t as lightweight as some plastic models I’ve used, but it’s weighted pretty well. The weight of it is distributed evenly on both sides of the handle.

The attachments have little tabs that line up with notches on the nozzle, and then you twist them to lock them in place. I like it -- there’s less chance of them popping off while I use the hair dryer.

The bottom of the hair dryer says the rated power is 1800 watt, which is contrary to the description which says it is 2000 watt.

This Aloe Vera Gel by Sdara Skincare takes a few minutes to fully absorb into my skin. I worried it would leave behind a sticky feeling, since I could feel it on my arm the whole time it took to dry. But once the gel finally absorbed, I couldn’t feel any residue left behind. I didn’t notice much of any scent either, which is another positive for me.

The gel is clear; the plastic bottle is amber colored to help keep light out. I wish the bottle had a flip top or squeeze lid instead of a screw off cap.

The list of ingredients is what gives me pause. I’m not sure why sodium bicarbonate (baking soda) would need to be added to the organic aloe leaf juice. The product description mentions “we perfected our serum by enriching with Vitamin E, & Citric Acid for improved nutrient absorption.” I don’t see Vitamin E listed in the ingredients.

I will probably end up using this aloe vera gel to make hand sanitizer. The gel is thick, so it should be good for that use.

The description for this Aloe Vera Gel by CIMIY Skin Care confuses me a little. One of the uses suggested by the manufacturer is to put the gel on before going outside, “which can protect skin from sunburns.” This gel has hyaluronic acid listed as an ingredient, which can actually make skin even more sensitive to UV rays.

Aloe Vera is great for soothing sunburns *after* exposure. This gel absorbed into my skin after about a minute, without leaving behind a sticky or tacky feeling. I’ve used some aloe vera gels that have left me a sticky mess, but not this one. So I like the quick absorption.

The gel does have a slight scent to it. It’s a fresh-smelling scent that sticks around for a while.

This Aloe Vera gel would also be great for homemade hand sanitizer.

This gel is manufactured in China.

For me, I like the Hand Cleaner and Barrier Cream the most in this bundle. I found that the Superior Healing Hand Cream was just average. These products might seem dude oriented, but they work for anyone.

Superior Hand Cleaner with Activated Charcoal (individually 4/5 stars):
--Works great to remove grease and odors. I like the pumice in the cleanser, as it gives me a real clean, scrubby feeling.

Superior Barrier Skin Cream (individually 4/5 stars):
--Actually does help prevent grease or oil from staining my hands. Also helps keep my fingernails from becoming a dirt mess when I weed without gloves. But doesn’t provide much of a moisturizing effect.

Superior Healing Hand Cream (individually 3/5 stars):
--Truly unscented hand lotion. But it’s just average as a lotion -- it took a few days of 2-3x per day applications to help heal my cracked hands.

Kale Leaf Extract (Brassica Oleracea Acephala) is the 14th ingredient listed out of 23 for the Cancun Collection Kale Firm & Smooth Body Lotion. This lotion is made in Canada.

The lotion absorbed quickly into my skin, but did leave behind a slightly tacky feel for about 5 minutes after application.

It’s currently the middle of winter where I am, so I was able to see just how moisturizing the lotion is for me when I already had dry skin. The lotion has a medium-weight consistency and gets the job done for about half the day.

What I don’t like about this lotion is the scent. The scent is subtle, sort of like vanilla coconut, and it’s fine at first. But the scent lingers for several hours, and after that time, I’ve had enough of it.

I spend 99% of my life with chapped lips, so I’m always looking for a chapstick or lip balm that will actually work.

I was intrigued by the hemp oil in the Pharmacopia Tangerine-Flavored Lip Balm. But not all of the ingredients are listed in the product information. I am allergic to beeswax, which is the second ingredient in the lip balm. So I was unable to use it.

I’m including a picture of the tube, but for reference, here are the ingredients: helianthus annuus (sunflower) oil, beeswax/cire d’abeille, olea europaea (extra virgin olive) oil, aroma (flavor), cannabis sativa (hemp) seed oil, rosmarinus officinalis (rosemary) leaf extract, tocopherol (vitamin E), aloe barbadensis.

If you’ve never used a water flosser before, there’s a definite learning curve. Expect to get wet the first few times, if not more. The learning curve and mess is worth it -- my mouth generally feels cleaner after using one -- but I don’t love this particular model.

I wanted a water flosser that wouldn’t take up a lot of space on my bathroom counter. This one is a sort of all-in-one, with the reservoir built into the handle, but I kept getting water bubbles in the tank/tip, which made flossing take a lot longer.

There’s only 3 speeds: low, medium, and high. The low is quite low. And because of where the speed switch button is, it’s really easy to accidentally switch speeds while using the flosser.

The flosser charges via USB, but with a proprietary end (not A or C or anything like that).
Overly rose scented and it upset my scalp. Left it red and flaky.

It is a pretty small bottle for $25 body lotion. Also, a little does NOT go a long way with this one and I had to use more than I typically do. Overall, I would say it was decently moisturizing but not amazingly so and certainly not enough to merit the price.

As for the smell, it was just odd, like slightly organic but not strong. Just off-putting. Faded quickly though.

I was a bit skeptical before trying because I find most hair masks to be more hype than anything else. This one however was great for my long thick wavy mess of a head of hair. It left my hair soft, manageable, and even a bit shinier than before. My hair felt hydrated without being weighted down, and wasn't left straw like which has happened to me in the past when I try to deep condition. I can usually go about 3-4 days between shampoos and didn't find myself needing to wash my hair any sooner than that. Obviously, if you shampoo more often on the regular you will have a different result than me. But basically it didn't leave my hair feeling dirty the next day.

My process: I shampooed and then like most masks and conditioners I kept it away from my roots and only applied it from the midshaft to my ends (otherwise I end up with oily roots). Then I waited... and waited... and waited. Since I was reviewing the product I wanted to make sure I waited the full 10 mins to give it a chance. I was out of stuff to wash and shave after about 3 min so the last 7 were pretty boring. In the future I will probably only wait 5 min. I didn't apply any other conditioner other than my normal heat protector I spritz onto towel dried hair. Blow-dried as usual and the results let me skip the flat iron.

I was pretty please. I find this an easy mask to recommend. I have spent much more and gotten less of a result. I also like that it didn't leave my hair smelling perfumy afterwards.

I was hoping there would be a price available at the time of this review, but currently it wasn't posted. Bath bombs come in a range of prices and quality, without a price it's hard to say if this is a good value. Kiddo loves bath bombs, but he values toys and water coloring over quality of skin softening or scent. So for this set he was not of any help. I tried one and found it to be nice but not as skin softening as some of the bigger ones I've tried. These are really more midline as the fizz is just average, scent was alright and not off putting but not amazing.

If these are under $15 I'd say great value, above $20 and I'm not sure they are worth it, but not a terrible deal.
Not a fan of these. They have very little swab so are hard and not padded well. The stick breaks easily and then its sharp. I can't recommend.

I tried a couple other charcoal peel off masks before this that were MUCH much easier to use, both a bit more expensive but neither crazy so. Luckily I had no issues with the bottle splitting like some others reported. Here is what I did not like about the product.

Issue #1: This one didn't peel off in nice big patches more like you had to chip away at it which was messy time consuming and harsher on my face than it needed to be.

Issue#2: It also was ineffective, it didn't unclog anything. At most it removed a top layer of dead skin making my skin feel softer (and dryer), but after rechecking my pores with a magnifying mirror (if you want to hate yourself buy one and then freak out at your skin, lol) there was no real difference. The before and after of my pores under the mirror were nearly identical.

So all that work and annoyed skin for nothing. Mostly though I was just aggravated that it came apart in a million little shreds rather than actually just peel off my skin. That's the best part, booooo.

[[VIDEOID:5c532f5f5d94b55721fdf6748ddcc641]] I want you to try these for two reasons, first of all because I often make my own DIY cosmetics, including lip balms and glosses. These applicators are perfect to use with those.
Also, have you ever found that perfect shade of lipstick that you can't live without, only to find that it's been discontinued? These applicators help get every last bit of lipstick out of a tube so that you can enjoy it longer.
As you can see, the colors are pretty bright. I think that these would look more upscale in more muted colors, and if that's what you're going for, I would suggest getting the other color option in these. To be honest, what I would prefer, is if they were paper or wood instead of plastic. A little more environmentally friendly.
Still, they're good for what they are. The doe-foot tip Is slanted, just like with your favorite tubed liquid lip products. They are fuzzy, so they hold the lip product.
Makeup artists, as well as their clientele, will appreciate that these can be used once and then tossed. No spreading of germs and bacteria.

Not only are these sheets good for do-it-yourself masks, but they're fabulous at making any good serum a high-end mask.
What I like to do is open one of the individual packets and pull out the tablet, which is a compressed mask. And then, I take very hot water in order to get it to open up. After cleansing my face, I will load it with serum, and then put the warm mask over my face. It's easy to pat it into your skin to make it stay.
Lean back and relax, I generally do it for half an hour.
Remove the mask and gently massage the remaining serum into your face, and continue with your facial routine of moisturizer, sunscreen, whatever you use next.
So, whether you dip them in pineapple juice, apple cider vinegar, or whatever your DIY routine is, or you use a prepared serum from your favorite brand, these are convenient, easy to use, and relatively inexpensive.
I especially like the individual packaging because they stay sanitary. I can pop a couple of them in my makeup bag and always be ready to go on any adventure that requires an overnight stay.
Thanks for reading.

Definitely a clean fragrance that's fine for anyone.
To me, the scent is pettigrain, orange blossoms.
As you would expect, it doesn't have a lot of longevity. But after application it's quite uplifting. Not overpowering.
Absolutely suitable for babies and toddlers, as well as teens and moms.

From pin-up girls to starlets, from old Hollywood movie queen royalty to the girls at the automat, certain red lipsticks have dominated makeup counters for decades.
This is one of them.

Everything about this lipstick, except for the modern wearability, is vintage glamour. The shape of the tube and the shape of the lipstick itself harkens to another era. Perfect for making the ultimate Cupid's bow pout. It even has that slight fragrance that will remind you of vintage lipsticks.

I normally wear red that has a little more blue in it, so was surprised that this clear red was fine for me. To me that says that it will flatter a wide range of skin tones.
After swiping it on my wrist and then wiping it away, it left a nice stain. If you aren't interested in that drop dead gorgeous look and want something a little more subtle, it does double duty by leaving a pinky red stain when blotted. But go for the high voltage dramatic red if you want to be noticed.

Very comfortable lipstick, but I didn't have a problem with it bleeding. Non-drying and non-cracking. Opaque coverage with one swipe.
Another plus, it makes your teeth look super white.
I hope that this review as well as the photographs can help you to make a decision about this lipstick. It's really hard buying such things online, especially when it comes to luxury brands like this.

If you don't want to think about having to touch up your liner all day, and I mean ALL day, you'll love this clever eyeliner.
Dual tips means you have one product that gives you 100% precision.
If you like to get artistic, if you like to play with your makeup, those tips are so much fun and you can create so many looks. From slim cat eye to thick Cleopatra.
Very nice, definitely a keeper.

I got these because they have aloe vera.  I have sensitive skin and these do a nice job of gentle cleaning, low odor with no ill effects.  They are also nice and portable as I can put them in my bag when I travel.

As a big fan of hair masks, this is one of the better ones that I've used.
I have fine and fragile hair, that is thinning due to heredity and age. This mask smooths it down and makes it look to be in better condition.
Even the ends don't look as fly away.
If you have hair with issues, this is a good product to try.

After taking this wig out and giving it a good shake, the cut on this is fantastic! It's the super trendy wolf cut.
The color is fun, but I have no problem wearing this wig out and about.

The built-in brush makes this product easy to apply. If you need to put your makeup on in a hurry, this stuff is really great.
You can control how much comes out onto the brush and then use the brush to apply it evenly. It works as well as most primers in that it hides some of the medium, if not the large, pores.
Easy to tuck in your makeup bag.

This review is for the large size. The size is something you might want to consider if you have thin or fine hair. Just know what you're getting.

They hold well and are super cute.

These are wonderful for freshening up face and hands. On the box, it's suggests that you can wipe down surfaces. They aren't antibacterial, and they don't clean, but they will leave a nice refreshing scent. On many surfaces, they will leave streaks, as well as not really cleaning.
I suggest using them mainly as a quick way to clean your hands on the go without alcohol or chemicals that you might not want on your skin.

Perhaps it's just me, but I found this product to be very artificial looking. Nothing natural about it including the color.
Please keep in mind that it might be just the right color for you, but this didn't make my salt and pepper brows look any better.

It's probably happened to just about every busty woman.
You're wearing a top, and are justn't even particularly revealing but it might be a little loose. You bend down, and when you look up you notice somebody's eyes popping out of their head because you've showed more than a little cleavage when you bent down. Especially if you weren't wearing a bra!
This helps not only to keep those situations in check, but it also helps when a button is at the wrong area and creates a gap.
Not just for movie stars wearing super revealing fashions!

This set is good because these types of tools wear out quickly. It doesn't make sense to spend a lot of money on them because you're going to have to replace them frequently.
If it's a really cold night, unbelievably, a horse can get an undercoat just that quick. The gloves are important to get that undercoat in check, all year long.

I actually hadn't intended on doing a before and after photograph, but there was such a difference after I massaged this lotion into my hands, that I wanted to show you how much of a difference it made. With just one application.
Now I understand why this is used at hospitals. It is amazingly effective as well as being allergen-free. Steroid free. Fragrance free. There's a little bit of a natural aroma of the ingredients but it is not offensive. It smells like just about every other fragrance-free product The big difference is that this one is way more effective than most other products of this type that I've tried. This is one that makes me wish I had given the others lower ratings. It's that good.
Not high priced. No splashy logos. Just an extremely effective lotion for extremely dry skin.

Although this is a pretty cheaply made set, it actually does the job reasonably well. Not just for puppies. I have a standard poodle that has a curly coat that is cropped for the summer. It works very well on his tight curls.

For some reason, it's hard to find extensions in this color. It seems that anything with a mixed gray isn't very popular, or at least not popular enough to mass produce.
That's a shame because it's gorgeous. Not only if you have gray hair, but if you want a really interesting contrast color.
Clip-ins are easy to use if you are a novice.
This goes on dark, but doesn't deposit enough color for me. If you like just a subtle look, it's fine. I confess that I use it without rinsing it out because otherwise the color isn't enough for me.

You can't beat these for adding some volume and thickness. There's a bit of a learning curve but thankfully there are plenty of YouTube videos out there to help you with installation, even if you're doing it by yourself. It helps to have two mirrors so that you can see the back of your head.
Very pretty and a good value.

I love the chocolate and chestnut colors of this silky wig.
When you first remove it from the netting, there's a lot of static so you do need to spray it down before wearing it. It's one of the better scalps on wigs of this price range, as you can see in the photograph. Not as fake looking as most.
In my opinion it's a very good wig for the money.

This is a Place on, Pat on mask.
You remove the mask and carefully place it on your face and smooth it down, and leave it on for about half an hour. While it's on it feels just delightful. It contains hyaluronic acid on a biocellulose sheet that clings to your face. It's as if you can feel all that good stuff soaking into your skin. Also contains ceramides, another skin-loving component.
After removal there's no need to rinse. You simply pat any remaining solution into your skin.
A great way to pamper yourself as well as nourish your face.

Although I had to trim the bangs a little bit as they were too long, this is a very pretty wig that has natural gray coloring.
The hair itself is soft. Other than trimming the bangs, it's ready to wear right out of the package.

Packaged perfectly for gift-giving, these hand lotion tubes are not the most hydrating when it is compared to long-lasting healing creams, but the light fragrance is delightful.
And don't get me wrong, these will leave your hands soft and moisturized. I just found I had to reapply a few times throughout the day to get the hydration I like.

Definitely not for the professional, or for precise work at home, but good enough for little touch-ups.
The price reflects the quality, or vice versa, so it still gets four stars. If the price were higher, it would be different.
The tip of the cutting scissors is not to a point, but the blunt isn't filed down either. So these are going to need the same amount of care that you don't poke someone's eye out as you would with a needle point scissors. Kind of defeats the purpose of them having been blunted.
Comfortable enough for my average size female hands, and a nice feature is the rubber nub that keeps it from clacking together as you close the scissors.

Decent enough but wish they were sharper, especially at the ends. I use the ends of the snipper to do hang nails and trim the corners of the fingernail itself. Granted I use them for more than cuticles, which wears them out faster, but when I think of the name Soligen I expect a product of superior quality.

Clip-ins are so convenient. And I find that they're one of the easiest types of extensions if you're doing it yourself, without anyone else to help you.
For the money, you'd be hard pressed to find better extensions. The hair is very nice, the color is stunning.
The clips are nice and sturdy, I expect no problems with them in the future.
It's important to remember to wash them carefully. Dip in water that has a little mild shampoo, and gently squeeze. Carefully lift up and place in fresh water.

Highly fragranced set, beautifully hand packed with tissue.
You can order this with confidence if you are giving it as a gift, because an outer cardboard box protects the gift box itself from any shipping damage.
Just opening it up is a delight. The aroma is soothing with natural fragrance. Not a hint of off chemical odors, just fresh essential oils, blended for a peaceful experience.
I especially like the petite candle that is a lovely way to complete the experience. You can have a candle lit bath using the bath gel, and spray the linens with the pillow spray for a calming and sleep inducing experience.

Very caring gift for someone facing challenges and stress

Love the way this balm and conditioner is fragranced. If you like oud, with it's mysteriously sensual scent of woodsy incense, this is for you.
The jar looks uniquely elegant.
Although it's a solid balm, it melts easily in your hands. In shipping, it looks like it seperated a bit, right down to staining the presentation box.
While that might be an issue if giving as a gift, it does not affect the quality or use.
A little goes a long way, and that amazing scent stays on a good while.

These little tubes of hand cream make wonderful gifts because they are packaged each in a special little box. Great stockers or just a little token of appreciation.
This review is for the olive variety.
I didn't find it to be the most moisturizing hand cream that I've tried but it isn't too bad. Considering that it's so giftable, I feel that it's definitely worth the money. You can always try one before you give away the others.
Very light fragrance suitable for just about anyone.

I'm so glad but finally the United States is getting access to some of the top skincare in the world that originates in Korea.
As the listing states, these are gentle exfoliating pads that peel away and dissolve microscopic dead skin gradually and gently. Within a week you can see brighter healthier skin that was hiding under the surface.
And it does it all without irritation!
As with any acidic facial care product, it's important to remember sunscreen if you go out.

I found this mask to be quite comfortable as well as easy to breathe through. Suitable for any gender, and it's even a little stylish with an on-trend color as well as a very helpful strap. Now when I choose to take it off, I can have it hanging around my neck, ready to pull it back up if necessary. The ear loops are adjustable with a little bead that by now most of us are familiar with using.
It claims to be antimicrobial because of some copper content. It's also quick drying as well as offering UV protection.
Made in Korea.

This line uses the well-researched benefits of olive in order to create a skin care that rejuvenates and heals. This particular product is great for morning puffy eyes. I keep it in a cosmetics cooler in the bathroom so that it's colder than room temperature when I pat it on.
Makes you look bright eyed and ready for the day, even if you had a rough night.

I like these so much that I purchased more.
This German skin care line is one of my favorites because of the quality of ingredients and the effectiveness of the product.
No irritation, even around my sensitive eyes.
The serum preps your skin for the next step of skin care, such as moisturizer. Your day or night cream sinks into your skin better, creating a noticeable difference in fine lines.

Harnessing the power of olive, these are wonderfully skin soothing drops. Not only do they moisturize, but they seem to heal minor irritations such as the little red spots that I get.
Expensive, but definitely worth it, especially on little imperfections that you wish would heal faster

You can pay a pretty penny for a skin care product that has a percentage of squalane in it, but this is 100% squalane.
I really like that this is plant based, as opposed to being derived from sharks, after all the result is the same.
A few drops and parched skin is instantly soft with just a touch of glow. Or you can mix it with any other skincare product or even a foundation, in order to make it more hydrating.
No fragrance whatsoever, so scent sensitive people will love this.
Another thing to appreciate is that the bottle and dropper are both glass.

Bottom line:
On its own or as an additive in a DIY creation, this may be clear, but it's liquid gold.

It really IS like a mild Botox treatment!
Ummm, I may or may not know that from personal experience, haha!
Okay, yes, I know it from personal experience.
As a little background, paracress has been long used as an anti-inflammatory and numbing herb, it's even called the toothache herb.
It also 'numbs', as in relaxes, the skin.
Guess what, that's exactly how Botox works.
While it isn't going to have nearly the same dramatic effect, I found it to be enough of the difference to where this is always going to be in my makeup/skincare bag.
Clinical trials using it in this way have indicated that it works on all but about 25% of the participants, so there's a chance it might not work for you. I'm thrilled to be in the percent that it did.
It has some of the same chemical components as Szechuan pepper, which has got to be safer than the botulism in Botox, right?

Paracress is almost unheard of outside of Brazil. This will be our little secret!
For reference, I'm in my early 60s. I've always taken care of my skin and stayed out of the sun, so I probably have fewer wrinkles than most people my age, but trust me, I've got them.

Hopefully this review will help you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to make the rather substantial investments in this product. It's definitely a risk since it doesn't work for everyone. And I can't stress enough that it's not going to be super dramatic change. But heck, I'm excited at even small changes.

xxoo

Although I'm not thrilled that this didn't have a safety seal on it, the cream itself is very good. It's a heavy cream, despite the company identifying it as being light and whipped. It looks whipped in the jar, but it is not light on the face. I don't think it would be suitable for all ages. Because of the heaviness and intense moisturizing, I believe that mature skin is going to benefit most from using this.
For reference, I'm in my early 60s, in a dry climate, with combination skin (T Zone) and some wrinkles as a point of concern.
This cream works very well with all of the above. I don't put it on my nose, of course, but when I feel like a splurge I put it on my hands because it's so moisturizing.
The claim that it moisturizes 24/7 is indeed true. Even in this dry area, my face feels hydrated all day when I use this cream.
It contains milk protein, yogurt extract, blueberry extract, rice protein, and a host of other skin-loving ingredients.

I hope this review has helped you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to invest in this product. It is indeed generously sized at 3.4 oz, and it has a very high quality ingredients. But like I said, it's not going to be for everyone.

xxoo

Do you like champagne cocktails? This one smells like a combination of peach and champagne, and even looks like it!
It comes out like a gel. It's activated by water, so after washing your face, leave your face damp and put a thin layer of the gel quickly all over your face. Include your neck if you like.
Then with each passing moment, it's going to get foamier and foamier. That's why you have to have a very thin coat. You only need a small amount of product. If you use too much, your face is going to foam up like you have shaving cream all over!

After about 5 or 10 minutes, you massage a little bit with warm water and then rinse. After you dry your face it's going to feel squeaky clean. If you have dry skin, you're ready for a moisturizing serum and cream. If you have oily or acne prone skin, use the appropriate products for that skin type. I don't feel that this mask is drying, but it does leave you very clean.

So, in my opinion, this is good for all skin types, as long as you use it as a brightening mask as opposed to a hydrating mask.
This is just what your skin needs if you have overdosed on hot humid weather.please look at the ingredients to see if you have any sort of allergy or if any of them are a trigger for any skin issues. Because I have sensitive skin that can be triggered, but I only left it on for about 4 minutes. I had absolutely no irritation, but I think if I had left it on longer, I might have. That doesn't mean it's bad for you. If you leave a mild castile soap, which is so gentle, on your face for any length of time, skin will be irritated.
Made in the USA, from Tonica Skin in Marblehead Massachusetts.

I hope this review has helped you to make a decision about whether or not you'd like to try this fun mask. It really does leave your skin feeling and looking energized, but it's a bit of an investment. Nice splurge for a spa night, and because the product comes out via a pump, it's going to be sanitary for all the participants.
It's going to make for some really fun and Instagram worthy photos!

xxoo

PS, my 'spa night' pal doesn't look too impressed 😆

Having never used a micro-needle patch before, but often using a derm roller, I expected some discomfort, but that wasn't the case.
Although there was not a huge difference, there was indeed a difference.
When you stop using them, you will be back at square one, but there is definitely a softening of lines for about a week after the treatments.

This is pure genius.
After unscrewing the top of the cap, you'll see the film that protects the batteries. After you remove it, put the top back on and separate the light unit from the jar.
The red LED light will be activated by pressing against your skin. Does that light actually do anything, or is it a gimmick?
There are a number of high-priced red light units on the market. They were first used in dermatologist offices and med spas. When they first came out, I had a red Tanda unit. This is exactly the same concept, and yes, you will have a slight difference.
The amount of cream gone in the jar has been for about 10 applications. I do it at night so I can relax while holding the unit at various places on my face. The red light goes on when you press slightly on the metal ring, as you can see in the photographs. As you press it to the area of your face that you want treated, slide it from the middle of your face outward, for 3 minutes. Then go to the next area. This way you get a little bit of a lymphatic massage. If you suffer with sinus headaches, this action is very good at offering some relief.
The cream is very lightly fragranced with a fresh scent. It's a gel or mousse type of cream.
After purchasing this, you can get the cream refill.

So much cheaper than buying an LED light device like a Tanda.

I'm a sucker for beautiful packaging.
Here we have a gorgeous tea canister that is well made and beautiful. It also closes tightly, keeping my tea fresh. A good tea canister is not cheap, so I didn't have sticker shock with this product.

Thankfully, the company thoughtfully puts out refill packs of this delicious and calming tea.
I'll definitely be ordering a refill because not only do I like it myself, but after going through so many different calming and sleep inducing teas, this is my spouse's absolute favorite. Not just because of the taste, but it helps her to totally relax and even sleep throughout the night. Other teas and sleep formulations such as melatonin and valerian supplements just don't do the trick.
For me, it's more about the delightful taste. Slightly floral, slightly sweet. Yes, it does relax me and is helpful as part of a nighttime ritual, but not as much as my spouse. We both love it but for different reasons.

And I just adore the look of the canister. A lovely gloss ceramic, with an Art Deco nod, that fits in any decor. No hiding it, it's proudly on the counter, ready for anytime you need a little tea comfort.

This brand of mask is not off the chart expensive, but it's always helpful to try things out before making the big investment.
What a terrific way to try the various masks that this company offers! The quad pack includes skin resurrection for rejuvenating, chillax for calming, magic mushroom for moisturizing, and glow and go for brightening.
Perfect for a pajama parties with a spa theme!
The ingredients are similar in all of them. They all contain skin-loving aloe vera as well as cucumber extract, and even manuka honey. And all of them are pleasantly scented and very refreshing to use.

When skin is stressed, every little thing bothers it. Too much heat, too much cold, too much wind, too much dry air.
Those of us with sensitive skin know exactly what stressed out skin is. We need something that will soothe, without any irritation.
This particular cream hit that goal for me. I used it during a rosacea flare up, to help the redness and discomfort calm down. It worked very well. Not a miracle, but it worked well.
If you have skin like mine, I hope it works for you.

I wanted this oil because it's a blend that contains both lavender and patchouli. I absolutely adore patchouli, although some products that contain it don't have that wonderful incense sent.
This blend is delightful. You get the patchouli and spicy lavender mixed with a little bit of citrus as well as yang yang. There is even a touch of nutmeg to add even more warm spice.
I also love the elegant dropper, so much nicer than a rubber dropper. The gold top has a button that depresses to dispense a drop at a time.
A very special oil. You don't need a carrier because it's already in skin-loving avocado oil.
