Interesting that, out of 76 5-star reviews, NOT ONE was from a verified buyer.  I was going to try these but not when the positive reviews are such flagrant lies.
I love facial scrubs -- but not this one.  It felt too oily and made my skin break out in whiteheads.  I did like that it gave my face a good scrubbing but it wasn't worth the breakouts.

I've tried a couple of different types of epilators over the past 15-20 years. While I was usually happy enough with the results, I rarely used them since it always seemed like you had to wait until the hair got long enough for the unit to grip the hair in order to yank it out. And rarely did I really want the hair on my legs to reach that amount of stubble. Not to mention the pain that is involved with epilators. Yes, I am a weenie.

This model of the Braun Silk Epil removes much shorter hair. It claims to remove hair that is as short as a grain of sand (0.5mm). I personally find it requires it to be a bit longer than that to grip; but it does do a much better job of reaching short hair than others I've tried. It has a pivoting head which lets it work around all your body contours. A light on the unit allows even the palest, finest hairs to be visible.

In addition to hair removal, this epilator refines your skin. A sonic massage system and high-density brush scrub away old skin cells. This exfoliation helps to stimulate the regeneration of surface skin cells in order to create a smoother skin tone. I do notice a bit of a smoother, more even skin tone on my legs now. This sonic massage is my favorite part of the device...in part because I really don't like the tweezing part.

This model can be used wet or dry and uses rechargeable batteries rather than a power cord.

Unfortunately, I find that it still hurts...although not nearly as much as it used to. With regular use, the hairs on my legs have become fewer. Plus, the already pale fine hair is becoming even thinner and weaker. Braun claims that it will keep your body free of hair for up to 4 weeks. I usually find it to be somewhere in the 2 to 3 week range for me. Still, that's nice for when you're going on vacation or heading off to the beach for a week or two. I allow the growth to get to the slight stubbly stage and then I'm perfectly smooth for a couple of weeks.

All the L'oreal was 40% off at Rite Aid so I grabbed this, not realizing that it was something I passed up when it first came out bc I thought it was kind of a gimmick (still do). The sponge applicator comes to a small point and I was surprised to be able to do a pseudo wing shape at the outer corner. You do need to use a blending brush to work the fade and I also do a transition color using another brush. I do find it quicker than using brushes and powder alone, but since you have to re-dip for more powder even when it's brand new, I'm wondering how much effort it's gonna be once the product starts to get used up. You will probably have to not only twist the sponge applicator all the way back into the cap to pick up more, but also tap it to release more powder onto the appllicator. That would be annoying.
The color is pretty - a lighter, brighter purple than I expected. Overall, I'd say it's ok. Not great, not awful. For $5 I don't mind that I picked it up and I will keep it.

I blight this drying rack because it had a good price and good reviews.

When you take this out of the packaging, you need to need to take off paper tap from the pieces. Luckily for me, they came off easily. If you have any issues, use a bit of water. I did wash the pieces before using because they had a bjt of a smell (plastic?).

I washesban assortment of brushes. I put them all face up while I was cleaning and when I finished, I picked up the top piece and flipped it so the brushes were upside down.

The brushes took a bit of time to dry (12+) but the long time could be because of where I live and the lack of heat/light.

Overall, I like this product a lot and will be using it every time I clean my brushes. My biggest problem with the rack is the size of the brush holes. I have some thin brushes that could use smaller holes. Also my oval brushes had some issues in here.

My favorite thing is that it's easily to transport or put away. This can be assembled/disassembled in 30 seconds. It also doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart any second when it's filled with your brushes on the table.

Wanted to love them...but immediately after getting them in the mail i washed 1 brush and about a chunk of 30 hairs fell out. I wash all my brushes with the same method by hand in the sink with the same soap and the ones that are made well don't do this. I know these are cheap, but that doesn't mean they're supposed to fall apart in the first wash. I actually bought these after i was extremely happy with a cheap kabuki brush i bought on amazon so i went to try out some more brushes. For the record these are soft though, and the handle length is perfectly easy to use but is more of a travel size. Brushes are about 4-5" long.

Love the eyeliner... BUT... After the initial point was dulled, I couldn't get another point on it! Shaved twisted & turned, & it always has wood around it! They need to sell it WITH a SHARPENER that works! I have 3 & none will do it correctly!

If you are a road warrior you better keep your old razor. Don't be fooled by the Aritec's sleek appearance, the hardshell travel case for the Arcitec is big. You will not be able to throw this in a breifcase and go. Even the countertop charging stand is big.

And bring a scissors; the tube clipper is ineffective. It is concealed behind the large rotary heads, even when it is extended it is nearly impossible to use. It can only be used in odd angles in order to see what you are trimming. For example, I sometimes trim hair growing over my ears - but not with the Arcitec - you can't trim in that direction.

On the plus side - the shaving head is very good and offers a nice close shave. It says in the manual that you have to use this razor for a while to get used to it. I had no trouble adjusting to the shave, but the jury is out on the other aspects of what makes a good electric razor. Recommendation - unless you just like the novelty and asthetics - look for a more practical razor.

*EDIT: I continue to be wowed by this wig. I ordered another one in case I messed this one up and then went ahead and straightened this one with a flat iron. I cut the lace, used a wig band and it's not even glued down. Still love it, maybe even more now!*

To say I'm pleased would be an understatement. I've been looking for a wig that matches my hair color!! My biggest complaint is that I have a round face so I NEED bangs or fringe or something. A hairline on a non-lacefront makes me look even ROUNDER and that's not the look I'm going for! Most wigs require a lot of trimming and shaping to give me the look I want.

I love long hair but not every day. So ... i thought I'd try this baby. Not only is the hairline beautiful but the color is perfect, the weight is amazing and the length is just right ... not too long like many are. I'll cut the lacefront eventually but these pictures are literally how it looks just plopped on my head, with my own hair peeking out. If anything, I might try to give it more volume because i love big hair but ... a few bobby pins, a wide-tooth comb and I'm SET.

This wig is beautiful. I've included a picture of my real hair for reference. I've never given a wig such a glowing review but this is literally plug and play and, for me, that makes all the difference!

I was able to get the conditioner bottle open, but not the shampoo.  The bottles have an interesting opening mechanism.  You turn the top and squeeze the product out through a mesh hole on the top.  Unfortunately, the top on our shampoo bottle is defective and none of us can get it open.  The conditioner is very nice though.  It is thick and smooth and detangles well.  It also smells nice.
This product is AMAZING! Removed my stubborn stains and plaque in a few minutes, I am so freaking happy I bought this, please do yourself a favor and but it RIGHT NOW!

I ordered this 3-pack of Salux towels for the shower to help with rough bumpy skin on the backs of my legs, and to have an easy way to scrub my back.

They take some getting used to, partially because they're so long and don't immediately lather like sponges do. I prefer to keep it folded, wet it, add some soap or shower gel, and rub/scrunch it together until a lather forms. I used it folded on my body, and then unfold it to full length to use on my back (like the picture shows). You have to keep it out of the stream of water, or else the soap will wash right out of it.

They were definitely much more harsh than I expected - I can only use them very gently, and can't use them at all on especially thin areas of skin like my shins, the tops of my feet, or my chest. I'd absolutely never use them on my face or neck.

After the first use, I noticed an immediate improvement to my bumpy skin. But after I began to scrub with them daily, I felt like it actually exacerbated the problem. Plus, it was just another item to keep in the bathroom and worry about washing every week. As a side note, I wish they made these in white or grey instead of the bright colors - I feel like they'd match so many more peoples' bathroom decor and I wouldn't feel as bad about leaving one lying around the bathroom.

Now, I just use a Salux once per week as an exfoliating treatment - they're definitely too strong to be an everyday thing for me, but it does the job and helps with my bumps overall.

Let me start off by saying that I am really unhappy with this product.
Packaging: Really wouldn't consider it packaging if its in a clear plastic bag. I would say it came damage because the ears were all messed up. One ear was shaped like a mouse's ear and not a cat's ear and the other was totally bent (not into any ear shape)
I was reading a lot of other people's reviews and I don't get why they're giving this product a 4 star.. I mean this is kind of a waste of money. It's really cheap material. Literally the ears are made of one thin wire that shapes it and it's covered in cheap lace.
I could already tell right from out of the packaging that these pair of ears were cheap looking. They did not even make any effort of cutting the lace right. One ear has more lace material than the other and it's kind of bulging out. Plus the lace is already falling apart. There were a few pieces of lace that came off already and I literally just opened the packaging like 10 minutes ago. I had to re shape the ears just to make it look decent, like an actual pair of cat ears and not mouse ears. I really don't like giving bad reviews but this product was so bad that I had no choice and I wouldn't want other people wasting their money on this cheap product.

Update-the caps/nozzles are not snug enough on the bottle. When you pull off the clear cap (over spray nozzle) the ENTIRE spray nozzle pulls right out of the bottle. It doesn't stay snug on bottle threads. Horrible bottles. Mine are headed for the trash can.
I like these bottles since they are plastic instead of glass. Perfect for my use. Size is great. BUT.... the plastic "hose" inside doesn't even reach the bottom of the bottle. They are at least 1/4" from the bottom. It will waste a lot of product in each bottle. Picture shows the "hose" being so long as it wraps around just a bit. Definitely reaching the bottom of bottle. And, in packaging - which they were just thrown in box - a couple of the bottles have arrived with scratches in them. They don't appear "new" when they arrive this way. If I were selling something in them, it would be unacceptable to me.
UPDATE 2/18/16 These bottles are going from a 3 star to a zero rating, as far as I am concerned. After I filled these with some e.oil air spray, I found that the nozzles LEAK to no end. With just one or two sprays, there is fluid running down the nozzle and bottle soaking my hand. Not a good feature when you want to sit them on granite or wood surface. This little bottle will ruin those surfaces. If I had discovered this a week or two earlier, I'd send them back. Beware

It smells. Like, I thought I'd risk it because it was a Black Friday sale and, really, how bad could it be? Bad enough that I've only used it once. I legitimately can't tell if it's supposed to smell like this or if it's off but it doesn't matter because I simply can't stand it. It lingers for like 20 minutes and it's awful.

I bought this brace after a fall in which I'd injured my knee, as well as my ankle, and needed to keep my knee completely immobile -- no lateral tuning or twisting at all, and restricted flexing and extension.  It was the third brace I ordered -- the first was not nearly strong enough, and the second sizing was off. I'm so glad I found this one: It's a superb brace -- fine, sturdy stays,plus hinges that let you adjust both flexion and extension. I initially thought that latter feature was something I wouldn't need, but it turns out to have made a huge difference during this first month of healing. (Needless to say, I could not have handled a sleeve-type brace -- the open front/wrap style was mandatory, and made my life so much easier.)  I've been wearing the brace 24/7 -- night as well as day --  for more than a month and it's been my saving grace.  Service has been superb, too: Before I ordered, I measured my thigh, knee and calf; I was on the cusp between sizes, and so ordered up. That seemed like a good idea at the time because it allowed me to wear the brace over my slacks, as well as under -- but after almost a month of continuous wear. the thigh (which was a little larger than I needed to begin with) seemed to have stretched out; I couldn't wrap the upper portion tightly enough and even with the straps cinched tightly, the brace slipped after an hour or two or wear. I wrote the seller and asked if there was a solution -- this brace was costly enough that I didn't want to have to pay out of pocket for a second one -- and they offered to send  me a smaller size. It arrived within a few days, accompanied by a label for free return of the first.  I couldn't have been more impressed or more grateful. I'd recommend this brace, and this seller, to anyone.
Terrible

The diffuser is great, it's pretty and it has a nice large reservoir so it lasts awhile. It puts off a good amount of scent. Unless the room is totally dark though, you cant see that it lights up. Which maybe some people like that.. I didnt care either way... just making readers aware. Overall, a good diffuser, esp for the price, I gave it 5 stars.

** One flaw is that it's very hard to get the top off. My hands are fairly small, and due to the coned shape there is no easy way to get a grip on the lid. The first time trying my hand kept slipping off... I literally couldn't get the top off. I had to use my nails and grab the seam. Eventually I worked the lid off, but once theres water in it, i couldnt do that again because i had to lay it sideways to do this.

Now that I've used it several time the lid comes off easier, but in my opinion, there should have been some kind of lip on the back to hold onto.

If you have larger hands, you probably wont have a problem. My husband got the lid off with no issues.

This wonderful product allowed me to continue using my favorite T3 Featherweight blowdryer with my new Xtava Black Orchid diffuser!! I didn't have to buy a new blowdryer! I will admit that I measured the wrong thing when I ordered the SnozzlePro adapter (I measured the base of the concentrator nozzle that came with the blowdryer and not the actual blowdryer nozzle - oops!) My blowdryer is actually a little wider than the measurements given for the SnozzlePro. It was so close, I was determined to make it work! I was able to do it with a little manipulation and a slender tool to give just a little extra stretch to get the SnozzlePro over the end of the blowdryer nozzle (used a tool WITHOUT any sharp edges or points, nothing that could damage the SnozzlePro or the blowdryer). **I did this at my own risk - knowing that I could possibly damage the SnozzlePro or my blowdryer!!** Very gently, I was able to get the SnozzlePro onto my blowdryer. I made sure it was evenly attached all the way around before adding the Xtava Black Orchid diffuser. I attached the diffuser to the SnozzlePro AFTER I put the SnozzlePro on the blowdryer - the opposite of what the instructions advise you to do. (also note that before attaching the SnozzlePro to the blowdryer, I put the diffuser on the SnozzlePro a couple of times to make sure it fit properly and that I would be able to attach it without needing to use the other end of the adapter to make sure it was secure). After getting everything in place, I'm happy to say that it's very secure and there's nothing that is loose or has any wiggle room whatsoever!! I'm never removing it!! It's there until the dryer kicks the bucket or something breaks! It's working beautifully! It holds very tightly and securely, it hasn't slipped or moved at all since I attached everything!! You can see in the pics how tightly it's holding. I love drying my hair with this diffuser! My hair looks amazing and dries faster than when I used to use a round brush! No more work drying with a round brush! Just using this diffuser and moving it to different sections of my hair, it's easier than ever to dry my hair! Thank you for making this product that allows us to use this wonderful diffuser on other brands of blowdryers! I will be recommending it to everyone who has curly hair!

Update - the adapter and diffuser has come off a couple of times and it takes a little bit of work to get it back on because my blow dryer is a tiny bit bigger than the measurements but I can get it back on. I think it came off because I accidentally held it by the adapter or grabbed it by the diffuser. Definitely only hold it by the barrel of the blow dryer (like in my 3rd pic) or the handle for the blow dryer!

This looks very nice when it's assembled and you use it to store your brushes. A word of caution when you assemble it, attach the rods to the bottom piece first, then when you attach the top piece, make sure that the holes line up before you attach the top screws. They don't all line up on every set of holes. I had to undo it and reattach it to get the top and bottom slots to line up correctly! Once I did, it works beautifully. It would be nice if the bottom holes were a little deeper to hold the bigger brushes better. A little tab to pull the protective plastic would be nice too, I was afraid of scratching it while I was trying to get the protective film off! Overall it's well worth the price and I'm glad I bought it. It holds my brushes and looks very nice. UPDATE: while this looks like a nice brush hokder. It's not very practical for everyday use. The slightest touch will move the brush out of its holder. The bottom holes don't hold the brushes securely. My brushes are constantly falling over and sliding into the holder.  I wouldn't buy it again, already looking for a new holder. I'll probably go with a regular style brush holder, as long as they aren't falling all over the place!

Finally, after over a year of having these, I actually tried them out! I’ve never worn false lashes before and was hesitant to use them (obviously since I’ve had them a year without using them - lol!). I’ve seen so many false eyelashes that are so crazy over-the-top obviously fake looking. These are not that way at all. You get a generous supply of them (see photos) and they are reusable too. With the rate I’m going, mine should last forever!
I don’t have get up close vision so it was a little bit harder for me to apply them than it would be for someone who can see better. I used a magnifying makeup mirror though and did fine. The photos of the eyelash after it was applied was my first attempt ever to do this so it’s definitely not perfect but it was much easier to apply than I expected it to be. I am sure my results will improve with practice. These are secured in place with magnetic eyeliner (I guess I am pretty ignorant about these things but I had never heard of that!). The eyeliner goes on smoothly; actually better than some liquid eyeliner that I’ve used in the past. It’s a little tricky to get them in the best spot. Like I said previously though, I think this will get much easier the more times I try them. It comes with tweezers to use but it was almost easier for me to apply them without using them. Once in place, I was amazed at how well they stayed in place!
They were easy to remove and the eyeliner did require makeup remover to get it off, but it also came off without a problem.
I didn’t wear them long. I will have to get used to how they feel; it wasn’t uncomfortable, just different for me. I have very thin, light-colored eyelashes so I think I’m really going to enjoy these!
(Excuse my bad photos too - no other makeup whatsoever on and first attempt so I look pretty awful - lol But I actually love the lashes!)

Pretty, came in nice box, small and lightweight. Feels great when this is rolled across your face because it feels cold due to the marble (or faux marble) that it’s made of. Didn’t include any instructions whatsoever. Would have been nice to have something telling you exactly how you should use this or if there is any benefit to using it at all (other than it’s cooling to your face). I’m just not really sure what to do with it.

Once again Amazon won't post my review! Reason: They claim my review is FALSE & the product is authentic. Hmmm below is my original review: It says NOTHING about this product not being "AUTHENTIC".
HEY AMAZON, the review is ACCURATE because it talks about HOW THE PRODUCT is SHOWN to work & it doesn't deliver! People NEED TO KNOW THAT! This product's Video SHOWS hair that is SMOOTH & SILKY SHINY! That is the PROMISE! IT DOESN'T DO THAT!
Not sure why my last review was removed, but it IS 100% honest and accurate! This product doesn't work AS PROMOTED! I've got LONG hair that is long enough to sit on, keep it well cared for. The video shows "silky smooth & super shiny" hair after using this product. I've used the entire jar now (that's 4 treatments by the way for hair like mine) and though yes my hair IS soft (but it ALWAYS has been) its' over all look & condition has NOT changed at all! I was hoping for the silky soft shiny hair shown in the video as I have very curly hair (not looking for STRAIGHT hair, just SMOOTH & SHINY) & it doesn't work! Over all I would give this product no more then 2 stars since it does smell good, and does leave your hair soft, but so does every other bottled conditioner out there.
Not big on the menthol smell
Love it.

These tattoos are too cool! There are some really cool and original designs in this set!
There are twelve different sheets of tattoos in this set, and they are all different! There are birds, cats, feathers, letters, henna designs, and so much more! You and your friends can definitely find a few temporary tattoos to show off your interests for your next girls night out concert! It is so much fun to dress up, and this is a form of dress up! It is a way to express yourself, temporarily! Haha!
These are great for kids, too! My girls love them! They love how different they are from their "kiddie" temporary tattoos and they think its so cool when I wear them with them! Haha! As I said above, it is another form of dress up, and what mom doesn't like to dress up with their kids?! It is so fun! And it is interesting to see which tattoos they pick and how they determine which tattoos they are going to wear for that round of dress up! They get so into it! I love it!
In addition to the many different designs that are in this set, there are also metallic and white tattoos! Metallic tattoos are so cool! It is like jewelry on your skin! And the white tattoos look really cool in the summer time when my skin is tan! They show up really well for white tattoos, even when I'm not super tan, I was surprised! I really like them!
We are definitely satisfied with this purchase, we have had a lot of fun! We will be recommending this product to all of our family and friends!
I received this product at discount in exchange for my HONEST review. The discount did not affect my review at all! I take all of my product reviews seriously, whether discounted or not! I rely on these reviews to make informed purchases, as I'm sure you do as well, so I do my best to give my honest thoughts and constructive criticism, if needed. I hope you found this review helpful!

This makeup storage bag is just fantastic!

The backpack is very sturdily made and will definitely hold up to heavy use for years to come.

The zippers zip and unzip smoothly, and run in both directions, making it quicker and easier to unzip in a hurry and not worry about them getting stuck.

The main compartments are roomy, and allow multiple items to be stored inside. I took the boxes out in one photo to show the room available if you need it.

On one side you have a smaller zippered comparment which has a thermal lined pocket inside which can hold hot tools such as straighteners and curling irons, and also allows for storage of extra items such as brushes and combs, or miscellaneous items.

On the other side there is another zippered compartment which allows for more products, plus has an netted portion which opens to the outside to allow for tissues to be dispensed quickly and easily. There are slots in this pocket also which allow for small tools like scissors, combs , brushes, etc to be stored.

the top handle is sturdy and has a nice grip that's easy to hold on to and carry around.

I stored my blow dryer and some brushes in the top compartment, straightener in the side compartment, tissues in the other side, and filled all three boxes with makeup products, and then still had plenty of room left.

All compartments are extremely easy access, whether holding the backpack with one arm and grabbing something out, or sitting it on a table or chair and unzipping with one hand. I love that the front compartment is velcroed so that once unzipped, it's still easy to close quickly and will keep everything secure until you have time to zip back up.

This is fantastic whether you are a makeup artist heading to a show, or just a glamorous girl with lots of products on the go travelling.
Even at home this makes for great storage and easy accessibility.

FANTASTIC!

Product provided for my inspection and review, all thoughts and opinions are my own

This is a really nice spa-like experience for me!

I had a similar one but it has only the rough, scrubber side, unlike this one which has both a scrubber side that will scrub off dead skin, as well as a SOFT side that you can polish your skin with after scrubbing. It feels really nice to flip over to the soft, gentle washcloth-like side after using the loofah side on my back.
The handles are long and easy to grab onto comfortably, without having to strain and try and twist your body just to clean and get rid of dead skin.
I think the soft side makes this much less likely to harden up and become difficult and uncomfortable to use. After several uses, I find it pliable and maneuverable.
In my photos, I've added both the scrubber side and the soft side to show the difference.
I used some body wash on the soft side to help clean and polish my skin, and have to say it feels incredibly pleasant.

*product provided for my opinion and review

I received this product a few days ago but wanted to use it more than once before writing my review.  I also wanted to have my daughter try it as well, because we have two different skin types.  I was given the opportunity to try this product as part of a promotional program at a discounted price in exchange for writing an honest and unbiased review.  I wanted to insure that the review I gave was accurate - I know that money is hard to come by these days and I wanted to be as accurate as possible when describing the product.  It arrived well packaged and in a timely manner.  The box holding the tube looked sturdy and professional - it looked like what you would expect from a high quality product.  I product dispenses easily and is easy to apply to the skin.  It goes on smoothly and evenly, doesn't dry out of make your skin feel tight, and doesn't have a strong or unpleasant odor.  My daughter and I tried the mask together - I have very dry skin, along with some fine lines and wrinkles, her skin tends to be oily and she had a few blackheads and larger pores.  We left our masks on for 15 minutes and washed them off with warm water.  The mask was very easy to remove and left our skin feeling very soft and looking radiant.  An additional bonus for me is the fact that mask contains argan, avocado, and jojoba oils.  Those added oils left my skin well nourished and moisturized.  I applied a light moisturizer because it didn't feel like a heavy one was needed.  My daughter was also pleased with the results.  She had concerns that the additional oils may cause her skin to break out or leave it feeling oily.  The mask washed off her face very easily, her skin felt smooth, her blackheads were gone, and her skin looked radiant.  We concluded that this mask is helpful for any skin type and we are planning another mother/daughter spa day soon.  We both liked the product and plan on continuing to use it.  I can recommend it without hesitation.  It's a great product!

These are really pretty brushes. Even the box it comes in is attractive. I kept the bottom part to use as a tray.

The eye brushes are way too big for my eyelids! Seriously! I don't think most people could use them because of how large they are. I tried them. They do pick up the product well and they blend well. I unfortunately can't get the looks I want with them because of their size.

Also, they are scratchy. I read that you have to hold your brushes slightly different when using natural bristles and not press as hard. I don't know if that is true or not. I have limits to how much I want it to hurt to look pretty, lol

I have to use hair conditioner after I wash the natural bristle brushes so that they don't fray as much.

I'm keeping them because they look great on my vanity/cosmetic area but I ordered a higher end set of eye brushes that work better for me (JS).

I received this product in exchange for an honest review. All opinions herein are my own and are not swayed by the company.

I was absolutely ecstatic to receive this product in the mail to try! I am always have issues with my hair. One of these issues is that fact that it ALWAYS lays flat. It is the most annoying thing to me to not be able to make my hair do anything other than straighten it.
I am so thankful that I have been introduced to this product because I know I have a new favorite hair-styling product. Zotos is cheap! It's only $12.99 on Amazon. If you're interested, you can also check out their other products on their website.
Not only do I love the fact that it definitely makes my hair have more volume, but I completely adore the fact that the smell is amazing! This product has no harsh smells that some hairsprays have. It actually smells like you're getting your hair done in a salon with that amazing hair salon smell that I love!
This product is extremely unique because it has a blend of clay and silica. This enables the spray to feel dry as it goes on as well as help build texture that lasts for a whole night of partying, (or whatever you enjoy doing). It's also color safe which is an absolute huge bonus for me!
This is a super easy product to use as well. You don't have to have a special type of brush to use it to style your hair. All you do is open the cap, shake the product, spray onto dry hair. I like to blow dry my hair after I put it on because the heat helps me when I'm styling.
If you actually want to style your hair rather than just put it on and go, just do whatever hairstyle you want, spray the product, and voila! Amazing hair results in a short amount of time.

[[VIDEOID:f7a496b8573ef75cce856e43697157ad]] What I do like:
1. The color is vibrant.
2. It’s very cute and does give the oversized look when wearing it.

What I don’t like and why I didn’t give 5 stars:
1. It gets “runs” easily. You can see from my picture there’s several “runs” like would happen to a set of tights. When you’re wearing it however they’re not obvious at all.
2. This might be a no brainer because of the size but this is not really a wrist scrunchie, it’s so large wrist wear isn’t practical. You’ll need to either commit to wearing this all day or have some bag or purse to keep it in, this is slightly less practical for daily use then I personally like.
3. It’s not tight enough to be used alone, you’ll need to first use a regular hair tie and then add this for decoration, I prefer scrunchies alone because hair ties hurt after a while but this scrunchie is too slick to stay by itself and would need to be folded over several times eliminating that cute chunky oversized look that this is supposed to give.

Although I’m a little let down by the practical use potential of the product, I do like this and will definitely continue to use it for special occasions just not daily wear.

[[VIDEOID:19bb6cb5b35b75de6cd429e3da29e779]] These gel polishes are gorgeous colors! I found things I liked and disliked about them.

What I liked:
1. The kit comes in a pack of 10 and the color variety is good. This is a lot of polishes for the price.
2. The colors look the same wet and dry *see video* as well as on the bottle swatch.
3. They have lasted very well for me and I work with my hands a lot as well as play guitar often with no pick. This will chip your nails quickly, but this hasn't happened yet.

What I disliked:
1. This kit does not come with a base or top coat.
2. I already have a few base and top coats hanging around the house and the first attempt I made using this polish I used a base and top coat that was not comparable. It would not dry even when under the UV light for quite some time. The second attempt I switched my base and top coat to another brand and it worked. They should really just include the base and top coats if this is a potential for customers. Just keep this in mind if you find the polish isn't drying the first attempt.

Given the pros and cons as long as you can find a compatible base and top coat you'll really like this product, if you want to avoid the frustration I'd suggest finding a kit that includes the base and top coats already.

I ordered this more for the brow filler than the stencils. I actually have a few sets of these stencils and they're very hard to use properly. If you are heavy handed at all then your brows will end up much wider than you're wanting and if you use a light touch to apply the makeup it's difficult to keep the stencil in the same place long enough to finish them.
Overall the stencils are a great guideline if you have some patience but that's about it.

The brow cream itself was great quality though! I really couldn't tell much of a difference between it and my much more costly name brand cream brow filler. The brush that was included isn't nearly as fine and high quality but I have my own so that wasn't an issue and the makeup alone was well worth the cost of this whole kit.

A great value for the makeup alone, the rest of the stuff I just view as extras and if they happen to work well for you then that's a fabulous bonus!

This thing has blown me away!

Mostly got it because I thought a straightening brush would be faster than my traditional flat iron. I wasn't wrong, I was able to go from my before pic to my after in less than 5 minutes which is impressive enough but that's not the best part!

It doesn't fry your ends!

I was very skeptical when the description said that the steam made it healthier for your hair and caused less damage and kept it moisturized.
After using it I'm a believer.
Usually when I straighten my hair my ends end up looking and feeling like straw. Literally. It looks horrible no matter what type of conditioning product, heat protector, or oil I use. I was blown away when I saw my poor over bleached ends were as smooth as the rest of my hair! It's like night and day.

It's super easy to use and it comes with a little bottle to fill the steam chamber with water. It took less than a minute to heat up and it didn't pull hair or burn my scalp.

It is hard to get some of the baby hairs well with it but that's really not a big deal.

It has clips to help section your hair into layers and I don't think I've ever been able to straighten my hair so thoroughly so quickly!

I was surprised because when I opened it I felt like there was no way it would work on my hair but it was so easy to use!

If your hair is damaged I would 1000% reccomend this to help keep your ends from looking fried.

It's as affordable as most traditional straighteners and works so much better!

Get it.

I tried a more budget friendly at home laser hair removal device a while ago and was less than thrilled with the results, but decided to give it one more try with a better device. I'm glad I did! This is a significant improvement! I wanted to wait several weeks to write my review to see if there were results and after 6-7 weeks of use I'm definitely seeing a significant reduction in hair! The device is super easy to use and instead of having to manually select the correct level of power for your skin tone, the device analyzes your skin tone and makes the selection for you. It literally could not be easier. There's little to no irritation if you use it correctly. If I get lazy and try to use it with any sort of stubble, then it stings a bit. But if I shave prior to use then it's quite comfortable. It's absolutely worlds better than epilating for sure. But that's a different story for a different day. (Ouch.) The one thing that's a little tricky about using this device is that you're not supposed to overlap the rectangle of light, but there's really no way to see exactly where you're placing it because it's up against your skin. Other than that, this is a breeze to use. In the 6-7 weeks I've been using it I've seen probably a 40-50% reduction in hair growth and what is growing is lighter and more fine. I don't expect to be completely hair free even after the 12 week treatment program, but even a significant reduction in hair would be fantastic! Bring on the shorts and tank tops!

This is a nice set of glittery nail polish. I personally wouldn't wear this on it's own since it's quite sheer, but it's perfect for putting over a color. I ordered this set because my 3 year old LOVES all things sparkly, so it's perfect for kicking solid colors up a notch and making them fabulous enough for a preschooler. It took two coats to get enough sparkles for her taste. It's kind of tricky to get them even, which for makes my inner perfectionist feel a little crazy, but she's 3 and doesn't care. The sparkles are almost holographic so they are intensely sparkly. These nail colors arrive in a nice box with a foam cutout for each bottle. My only complaint about the packaging is that nowhere on the bottles does it say the name of or show the color. There are color dots included if you'd like to make your own color dot for each bottle, but I would much prefer that it arrive with the color on the bottle already so I don't have to. I don't understand why you wouldn't include the color on the bottle. Other than that I'm happy with these.

Oh. My. Word. *Excuse me while I go throw away all my regular nail polish.* This is a Game. Changer. I'm a busy mom and honestly, I just hate going to the nail salon, and who has time to wait for 300 hours (Ok, maybe not quite 300) for your regular nail polish to dry, only to smudge it or have it chip within 2 hours? I had pretty much given up on nail polish and just been resigned to the fact that I would have boring nails forever. This stuff is seriously incredible. You just paint it on, cure it, wipe the top with the cleanser to remove the tacky finish, and VOILA! Perfect nails! I did mine last week with this set and they still look AH-MAZING. When this set arrived, I was a bit bummed to find that there's no color included, just base and top coat. I live an hour from the nearest mall and so I couldn't just pop into the store and get a color, and yet I wanted to try it out... Like, right now. I did some reading and found that you can actually use regular nail polish to make a "Gel-y" sandwich. Once you have the base coat on, cure it, then paint your regular color over the top and wait the "300 hours" it takes to dry. Then paint the top coat over the regular color, cure, wipe with cleanser and enjoy your stunning, long lasting nails! The only thing I would change about this set is the light. I wound up buying a larger light because the one that comes with this set is quite small and I wanted to be able to fit all my fingers or all my toes in at once. This light is great for storing and being portable, but I personally wanted something bigger. Overall a fantastic set. I'm never going back to regular polish ever again!

When you open the lid of this lava scrub, you'll think you just stepped off the plane landing in Hawaii. It smells so tropical, so dewy, and so tasty I almost tried it. And it's no wonder, with ingredients of coconut oil, papaya extract, and macadamia oil.
I tried it a few times on my face (mixed with soap, of course), and it was a little too strong for me. The sugar crystals are large and sturdy, requiring a vigorous scrub to dissolve. It didn't cause me to break out, but I did notice that the rest of the day and the following day, it looked like half my skin got taken off. Dips, discolorations, and small zits that were hiding beneath the surface were all visible - but after a couple of days everything went back to normal. Those of you who have tried chemical or acid peels on your face know what I mean.
I get it, if there are that many impurities on my skin, it's a good idea to scrub them away. But I don't really like looking at my face like that in the mirror. So... now I've switched it to a body scrub and use it in the tub. Perfect! Arms, legs, and chest are now totally smooth and smell great.

As the product information boasts, these makeup wipes don't burn your eyes and cause tears when you use it! As someone with sensitive eyes, I would be the first to report if there was a problem. I'd also be the first to report if the added vitamin E oil caused a breakout, and it did not. I don't use foundation makeup, so I only used it to wipe off eye makeup, but I didn't get any breakouts near my eye area or forehead.
There is an odd smell to these wipes, but if you chalk it up to the 'healthy' aspect (we all know health food stores smell weird) it shouldn't bother you. It's not long lasting, so you won't smell it as you drift off to sleep. These are easy to glide over your face, and with lots of acreage per wipe if you do wear foundation. I also tested it with waterproof mascara, and it took it off extremely easily!

The best way to describe the scent of this exfoliating scrub is to say it smells like you just walked into a day spa. It's a truly lovely smell, light, fresh, salty, and luxurious. I've actually tried using it as a lotion instead because the fragrance is so nice, but it didn't really work out. It's very creamy, though, and when you put a dollop in your hand, it might seem like there aren't any salt crystals in it, because the cream is thick like lotion.
There was quite a bit of settling in the packaging when I opened the jar, and since I ended up using quite a bit in the shower, I don't think it'll last very long--perhaps a month. The salt crystals are very small, and when I tried to vigorously scrub, it washed away before I could properly exfoliate.
How I recommend using it, in order to get the best use out of the Himalayan salt is to wet your leg before you step unto the shower, so it's a little more than damp. Then take a dollop and scrub your leg, and when you're done with whatever appendages you wanted to exfoliate, hop in the shower and rinse it off. Somehow, when my legs and arms were really drenched, the scrub just slid right off. Less moisture helped it adhere better. The smell really is great and refreshing, and once I've figured out how to use it, I've started enjoying it more.
Sucks sucks sucks sucks!!! Dont waste your money please dont!!!!!!!!!!! DONT BUY!!!!!
Me las pinto, las pongo en la máquina... Antes de eso pongo base coat y luego top coat y se me cae al otro día .

Didn't really need another dryer but got a great deal on it.  It does alright for the most part.  It doesn't seem to get as hot as I feel it should when on the high setting but it eventually gets the job done.  Increased my dry time by several minutes.  I also have an issue with the button locations on the handle. With the location as is, it is way too easy to hit them while holding the dryer and change the setting or even cut it off.  If they were in a different location it would be a much better product.  I have to stop several times during the process and reset the buttons as I initially had them.

I purchased this for my upcoming wedding. The flower (called a "fascinator" in the bridal industry, I'm learning) is very nice, and I will definitely wear it. I may cut the wires with the bling off, but that's just me. I'm having a simple summer picnic wedding with a white, cotton halter dress, and the bling might be a bit too much. I am going to ask my best friend before making this decision. Either way, it's a nice piece.

The birdcage veil, though, wasn't really how it's pictured. In the photo it seems to have a lot more conformity to a human head than the actual piece that showed up in my mailbox. The real thing starts out unruly, and popped up in weird places on my head. I tried calming the thing down with bobby pins, but it still looked unshapely. Finally, though, after watching the company's videos (they give you a piece of paper with a link to some instructional videos) and keeping it near the shower for a few days to get it to calm down, it did actually look good. I have a large head with puffy hair, and I found that if I put the comb towards the back of my head on the right, and allow the veil to come up over top my head from the back right, hanging down around my face, that the veil's large size is actually an asset, because it covers my puffy hair without flattening it.

I was so worried about the veil that I ordered a separate, handmade birdcage veil from etsy for $30 (see it at pompandplumage.com) that I hoped would be more what I'm looking for. When it arrived, though, it was too small to wear without wearing my puffy hairstyle slicked back, which isn't how I plan to wear my hair. I actually went back to the cheaper veil I bought here on amazon.

Whatever you end up doing with the veil portion, the flower/fascinator is nice enough, and cheap enough, that it's still worth the purchase. The flower/fascinators on the same site on etsy where I purchase the other birdcage veil, pompandplumage.com, are $60-$70, and look similar, so even without the veil, this was a good deal.

Is it just me? I have purchased this exact product several times--happily--in dark brown, grey brown, and chestnut (red brown). My eyebrows are, like my natural hair, about a level 4 or 5 dark brown, and the grey brown is probably the closest, though the other colors are handy for changes of color to hair and makeup. My brows are thinning, but a little filling in does the trick, and these pens are my favorite tool for the job, as they both color in where you need solid filling and can be used to make feathery strokes for a more natural brow look. This pen came with a useless little razor and three eyebrow "templates," only one of which I might consider useful (if you are new to shaping your brows).
The problem:
In the past I have received (I see now from other sellers) at least two or three pens for $6.99 to $8.99. I can't believe I paid over $8 for just one pen from this seller "Generies." Going back over the seller page, I see that indeed, by the pictures it appears that one will receive two pens. A sneaky little trick, showing the same photos as the sellers with better deals, but neglecting to include the "2 CT." If you are busy or distracted in the least, you might fall for it, as did I--and doubtless, as have many customers.
I really dislike writing negative comments, but am doing this to save others the trouble and disappointment of feeling ripped off. Needless to say, I will be buying this product from other sellers in future--the ones with the more reasonable--and honest--deals.

I believe I have had this long enough to determine it's value. It is well worth the money. This is a must have for any beauty routine. It comes very well packaged and protected. It comes with the charging stand, plug, charging cord, little filters that go inside the product and three Microdermabrasion tips. The tip that comes already on the Diamond Microdermabrasion is the normal one, then there is one for sensitive skin, and the last one is a precision tip. When you use this it gently uses suction and the the diamond tips to pull away the dead skin, black heads and even small whiteheads. Afterwards lightly wash your face. It does leave your face a little red but only for a few hours. By the next it was gone. I did have some areas of slight  bruising from going over the same area to often. It wasn't really bruising it was more like a suction mark on your skin but it was gone by the next day. I have used this several times and I absolutely love it. My skin looks and feels much better. This is one of those things that I won't be able to live without. I love it. Had I not seen it on sell, this is one of those things I would have never tried but since it was discounted I am so glad I got it and I think you would have too. I highly recommend this Microdermabrasion device.

I was very disappointed with this wig. Not so much with the color although it was not what I expected. There were some blonde highlights were more pinkish red than blonde but the worst of it was the top of the wig. The top of the wig was made in such a way that it looks as though the take a bundle of hair and lay it on the top and sew it on. The best I can describe it is it is like looking at the scrub pad part on the back of a sponge. Matter of fact that is also what it feels like too. A sponge. There are bare spots on the top of the wig where you can see all the way down to the wig cap. I am assuming that is why the top of the wig was done the way it was to cover the those bare spots. Wig is cheaply made.

I have a toddler, I need a no-slip option for the tub. I searched, for a good option that was also cost effective. I didn't want a mat - to me, they are too thick and get grimmey/slimey around the suction cups. This was a fun print that is also a good alternative. I had to buy 2 packs (I bought 1 turtle and 1 penguin pack) so there would be enough to fit my standard sized tub.

Pros: The colors are vibrant and don't quickly fade (I am writing this review almost 2 months after purchase/install... 2-3 showers are taken daily in the tub where these are located). These stuck easily and have adhered nicely - they have not moved or lifted (i put these in when the tub was clean and dry). My toddler likes that there are animals in the tub. The no-slip surface isn't too rough and it does prevent slips!

Cons: I just wish there were more in a package - I had to buy 2 packs which wasn't the worst thing because I was able to get a 2nd print. A variety pack would also have been nice with a few different animal prints instead of all one print but I still love this purchase!

Did you find this review helpful? Let me know!

This was my first experience with a wig that wasn’t from Spirit Halloween and I can’t say it was much better. After trying this wig I decided to learn a little more about wigs and I found a ton of info out there about them and how to do a little work on the less expensive ones to make them look better. (ie: thinning them out, plucking the part and hairline, etc.) I also learned about the features of a wig that make it look more realistic, such as synthetic vs human hair/human hair blend, pre-plucked and lace front. Now that I know a bit about wigs I feel more optimistic that I’ll be able to find ones that are affordable yet look more realistic and/or that I’ll be able to work on them a bit to make them look more so. In summary: The part and thickness on this wig are what I think need the most work. There’s virtually no part and the hair on the top is much too dense and puffy. This could be rectified by plucking but the wig is just not worth the work, IMO. The style of it is cute—The length and the waviness of it were exactly what I was looking for. I can’t say the same about the bangs but that’s the part of the wig that would benefit from some plucking and thinning out. The softness is pretty good for a synthetic wig.  I can’t comment on tangling because I didn’t keep the wig long enough to see how it holds up. The color is hard to comment on because it looks so different depending on the light—It can look like an ashy light brown with subtle highlights, a darker, less ashy light brown with no dimension to it, and in others it appears to have a mauve-like tinge to it. (You can see the differences in the pics.) In the end I returned this wig and after doing more research I decided I wouldn’t buy another inexpensive synthetic hair wig and instead look for a human hair blend that may be a little more expensive but looks more realistic. The bottom line: I recommend not buying this wig unless you know how to work on a wig to make it look more realistic.

This product was okay for minor maintenance of hair loss, but at about the three month mark my hair thinned in gobs across my scalp. Given that yes, I have scalp problems that are not genetic, but other products have worked better. Redken is a brand that works. I have a few issues with this product that are not limited to the failure for it to help my hair problem.
Cons:
This does not increase volume and thickness, it coats the hair in a waxy substance that makes the hair feel disgusting. If that's volume, it's not worth feeling that way consistently.

This product has soy and wheat ingredients in it, both of which have no actual use due to the high content of phytates and lectins binding all nutrient content away. Any claim to nourishing hair is automatically refuted because of the science behind these seeds.

The price for an ineffective product is too high.

The ingredient list is a bit long, but not filled with artificial chemicals.

Pros:
The shampoo smells good.

Can help with extreme minor maintenance, but is not very good long-term as far as I could tell.

Effective against seborrheic dermatitis and general dandruff.

Contains beneficial, natural ingredients, but the soy and wheat are unnecessary.

Overall, this might work for someone, but not me. I'll be trying other brands because of this setback.

Honestly... this is one of the most drying shampoos I have used. (And I have tried ALOT)

I have very long hair that I try to take good care of and after shampooing with this, my hair felt like dead grass and was matted up. It stripped the color and is very drying... it might be ok for guys or ladies with very short hair but not for long hair.

Not a shampoo I would recommend.
I have long hair, there is enough room and the elastic is snug enough not to let in water.  Would purchase again.
Here's the deal:  I discarded them. Yep, discarded them.

Convenient and simple hair dryer. It comes with an attachment that you snap on. I must admit it’s not the easiest to slip on an off but does a good job or channeling the air.

When I turned it in the highest setting there was a slight burn smell, which I’m not sure if that’s from the inner parts of the the heating up to produce the heat but I’ll have to keep my eye on it during long term use.

The cool button option is pretty neat if the air gets too hot for your scalp, you can just hold it down to temporarily change the temperate.

Update: I was told the burn smell is from protective oil protect in the dryer and after using several uses, the smell will disappear. On my second use I didn’t smell is as much

Very disappointed. I was trying to replace my existing hot air styling brush (LUXE Brand) before it breaks. I quickly realized the LUXE brand has been replaced with another name, that being Jinri. There are other names for this same style, one of them, Sultra which is SUPER EXPENSIVE ($149.00) for the SAME dryer. CRAZY

The reason this Milanta brand is being returned is because the 1 1/4 brush does not have those little balls on the end of the bristles therefore my hair just slides right off. If you use your hand to hold the hair in place, of course your hand gets too hot. The small brush is difficult to hold on the tip, it is slippery, it needs BIGGER Ridges to grip. The Big brush bristles are much better and they DO HAVE the little balls on the end. BUT the TIP of the brush does not have a enough space to put your fingers on while you are turning the brush.

The picture above shows my old styler brush in the middle and their (Milantia) brushes on either side.

Anyway, I found the Jinri on Amazon and ordered that one, it looks exactly like the one I have. 1000W is the same as my old one. YAHOO

I really enjoyed this and I think a lot of others will too, if you have oily skin and want a mask that will steadily peel off of your face and take all of the dirt from the day with it then you should try this kit. It comes with a step 1,2, and 3 with the mask itself being step 2. First you use step one "Export Black Heard " which helps pull the black heads out of your skin and it does a really good job on its own- I acutally bought this set twice for the first step alone! MY bottle tipped over without the lid on (thanks to my awesome toddlers!!) and I almost immeadiately ordered a whole new set. I could see results before even putting the mask on just from the prep. When you put step 2 the mask on your face you want to make sure that you dont make it too thick of a coating because it will take longer to dry (but this one still will unlike a lot of peel off masks that end up being scrub off because they dont ever harden and do what they claim they will. The third step is also a really good one it closes the pores to prevent them from immeadiately accumulating dirt again. The instructions are in a foreign language, but there isnt too much going on here that is too copmlicated to understand.  I like how my face feels clean after usinmg this

The mirror broke off already I have only had it a couple weeks.I didn't use any excessive force or throw it down and stomp it so I'm going to assume that it's just not very durable. I looked really cute though the design is very appealing I would just suggest that you are very gentle with it. Mine broke at the joints where it swivels.

For this outlandish price, I was expecting two of the nicer fat padded Shut Eye adjustable masks with darkening flaps and received two of the cheaper versions. "Sleep Mask" is on this label, they are really cheap and  flat. I have purchased other brands, similar, for under $4 for myself. I don't usually write negative reviews but this was outright a cheapo bait and switch. I needed a mask to replace the original Shut Eye adjustable mask my son requires for a good night's sleep. Why should I have to go through the hassle of return? When a seller misrepresents, a buyer should not have to deal with returns. Don't waste your time or money!

I was hoping for simple satin bonnets, but because of poor reading comprehension on my part I found these to also have a waterproof lining of a plastic type material which would make them great for many other things, too. I will likely cut the plastic out as I wanted them to sleep in for when I curl my hair and want the curls to last through a good night's sleep. AWESOME product, though. I have a very large head and they fit, though I could always use more room. These might even be nice to line victorian era ladies hats for costume or a wonderful addition to a girl's costume.  The price is good, too.
Very cute.

First, I love the look of the blue glass bottles. They looked so nice until I filled them with liquid. I used these to mix up a homemade bug spray using essential oils. We were going on vacation and needed to take bug spray with us. After I filled the bottles i put the tops on and noticed they leaked when turned upside down. So, I tried to tighten the lids a bit more while trying not to overdo it on the plastic tops and over-tighten. I was never able to screw the tops on and keep them from leaking. Very disappointing when you are trying to pack them for a trip. I guess they would be fine if you know you are going to be filling them and they will stay upright.

As much as I wanted to like this wig, even with no reviews - I didn't.

First, the cap is SMALL. You have to have a very small head to get this on without half of your own hair exposed. Even with a wig cap, the bands of the wig are visible.

Second, it's THIN. The cap, albeit airy, is visible throughout the wig, especially at the top of the bangs.

Third, it's quite shiny. Even for a gray-based color, but dry shampoo does help a little.

Fourth, the texture is stick-straight. The picture looks a little wavy, but it's not.

Fifth, the hair texture is a bit odd. It's actually slippery, so glossy that a barette or band slides right out of it without any effort. The photo looks a lot more natural.

In conclusion, it's a fail, It might work for someone else, but sadly, not me.

This is a very thin, clear oil. It isn’t as thick as baby oil and runs almost like water. I would never put oil or an oil-based product on my skin because it clogs the pores. Some people might be able to get away with it, but even though I have dry skin, my skin will break out if I put oil on it, so I have skipped that test. I did rub it into my hands and it dries fast without leaving an oily slick.

What I did use this for is my hair, which is very thick and very dry. After shampooing, I poured a little bit of the oil into my hand and rubbed my hands together. Then I ran my hands through my hair, keeping the oil away from the scalp area. Afterwards, I blew my hair dry then applied more oil. Usually, I apply a gel in the same manner that calms the frizz and leaves my hair with a nice shine to it. However, the oil did not produce the same results. My hair still had flyaway ends with no gloss to it. My newly washed and dried hair always looks better the next morning after the hair product has had a chance to calm the frizzy hair shafts, but the morning after I used the oil, the results were no different than the night before.

I’ll stick to my gel product to end the frizziness of dry hair.

I was so excited to try this as I don't want to use a curling iron all the time. I followed the instructions and watched a few videos. I woke up with terrible hair to the point that I had to wash so I can style it. No way I could leave the house looking like that. The curls were loose and uneven, wack waves and broken off ends. Just terrible. Here are the things that didn't go as expected:
1) It's not so easy to put them on and takes 5 tries before one is on
2) The velcro pulls hair and makes it messy and fizzy
3) Very hard to keep the ends secure, so I. had chunks of broken tips on the floor and sink as I took them off
4) The waves are not round as you sleep on it and some look bent depending on how you slept, so more of a kink than a curl
5) No way 8 rollers can cover the whole head, so you need at least 2 boxes to do it properly
6) the front of the hair looked awful, as it turned into my forehead with a kink

All and all, it was a waste and I'm returning them. Watching all the hair that was left in the rollers with the velcro and on the floor from breaking off, I find it damaging.

Although this product works well to cool my under-eyes, I was pretty disappointed with the quality. There is a black dot baked into the large roller that could not be removed with water or scratching at it. There are several bubbles in the small tool. More flaws can be seen with the naked eye rather than in the pictures (I tried). I was mostly disappointed because I thought that they were sending me a product made of pretty stone, and these are clearly not stone & are most likely some sort of resin. The small roller does not roll very easily, but I could have looked past that. I hope this was helpful.

After 30 years of shaving with the old shaving gel and razor routine, I entered the 21st century with the Norelco 7885XL and am extremely pleased that I have. The convenience of being able to shave on-the-go and the closeness this Norelco provides are both well worth the investment. Although, I've got to mention that I got a little lucky price-wise because the Norelco 7885XL magically appeared as one of my Amazon "Gold Box" promotion items so I jumped at the chance to buy this model at an incredible savings! Other than an excellent shave, my favorite features are the "time remaining" and the "needs cleaning" indicators on the LCD screen. The unit quickly charges to the full 45 minutes of run time in about an hour and is easy to clean by simply flipping open the head assembly and rinsing under the faucet. Did I mention quiet? Yep, the 7885XL is whisper quiet. Did I mention close? I'm getting a closer shave than I've ever gotten from a hand razor. Price, convenience, money-back guarantee from Norelco (use it for 21 days and get a full refund if you're not happy) - Buy it! Chances are, you'll be pleased you did.

I will let the pictures speak volumes! I don't tan in the sun, I usually spray tan! I have used tons of self tanners, which have always turned my orange ! This one really took me by surprise! Make sure you exfoliate your skin then apply to clean skin! It would help if you have someone too do your back . I even got brave the next day and did my entire body, yes even my face! It works with your body so you should sleep in it , the next day is when you really see the results! The pictures are immediately after one application! Use the mitt that comes with it, take your time and spread! You will have a nice tan!

These spiral ties from Gomayee are very handy. They are inexpensive. Except for the original brand of these, all of the ones I have found on Amazon have the little rough and uneven part where the the circle is completed. Thicker bands definitely have it show less though. The lower the gauge (if this is the same way earring posts are measured) the better the tie.

These are extremely thin and stretchy. I have a couple of photos with blue text that show the difference. The thick one is actually too big for my thinner hair. These are also rather loose on my thin hair. I have some smaller ones with thick plastic that are my favorites. I would think these are good for big buns and maybe for thicker hair? I can twist them around about 4 times for a pony tail. Still they don’t damage or tangle my hair and I will use them. They feel fine on my wrist too for when I take it out and don’t want to lose it.

I purchased this neck cream over six months ago. Just surfin' the net about neck creams, I found that it is discontinued, and more than one site advised reading the warning on the label. There was no warning on my tube, and I no longer have the box to check.

Anyhow, I contacted the original seller to see if they knew if I should still use this discontinued cream, for instance, if a problem had been identified with it or its ingredients. The seller emailed me back saying they had seen something about a discontinuation and possibly a warning, and gave me the phone number for BORBA. I called the number, and it is no longer in service. I checked, and it is the number on the BORBA website. Then, I went through their website email screen, filled out the information, and still haven't heard from them in almost two weeks.

I kinda liked the feel of this cream, but no longer trust BORBA, due to the above. I do not recommend purchasing this product, because (1) it is discontinued under suspicious circumstances and (2) manufacturer is unavailable to contact by phone or email.

This product is just okay. For me to contour I had to keep building up the color because when I would blend the color would disappear. My dark circles are not that bad but I felt like I could not get the product to conceal completely. I do not feel like the pigments of this palette held up. It needs to be set with powder. An expert makeup artist would not use this palette but, is good if you are just starting out.
*Sample provided

This cream has actually made a slight difference so far. I have been using this for almost two weeks and I'm starting to notice my breasts do feel fuller. They are still the same size but the shape has improved. I am a former bf mom so they are not as perky as they once were. I wouldn't say this is a replacement for surgery or anything though. For me just seeing any improvement is exciting, so I am satisfied with this cream. I wasn't really expecting this to work in the beginning, I began to see a difference around the third day. I used it twice a day.

The smell is a little different. It was musky to me. It doesn't smell bad.. but it could be better. The size is probably enough for a few months, I still have tons so a little goes a long way. The consistency is thick and really blendable. A little nickel sized amount is about what I use each time because it spreads easily. It really just feels like lotion on your skin, it isn't sticky or gel like.

The only thing I didn't like about this was the fragrance, the scent is not a scent I would normally wear but since it does seem to benefit my breasts it
Is a scent I can live with, I just spray perfume over my shirt and it covers it up.

Overall I am happy about this cream, even with the change being suttle so far it still has some affect and that's better than nothing for me. I'm hoping I see more improvement with this in the long run and I will continue using it.

I did receive this product at a discount or for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I do express my reviews honestly by the actual experience I have with the product.

I have this wig in two shades. The shaded praline and the creamy toffee. Both are terrific, though I found the shaded Praline to have more permatease at the roots for some reason. Maybe because it's a rooted shade. Anyway, lace front makes it look very real and I even barrett it back sometimes. Easy to wear. Fits well, I have an average and a 22.5 inch head circumference. Highly recommended for confidence!!

They have really improved the eye mask. Just not too many years ago, you had to settle with 2 lb. eye bags which smashed your cornea and your vision was blurry for hours. or you had to settle for faux fur, or "memory form"  stiffness. Or a well-meaning aunt gives you a spa package with an eye mask that was silky but looked like you had a panty liner on your face. NOW, these are available, in fun colors. The best feature is that they are concave, formed, so that you can bat your eyelashes inside and your REMs will not be suppressed. You can open and close your eyes ad libitum, thus giving you more freedom and less of a claustrophobic feel. These are light, easy to pack, or store, comfortable, SO, comfortable, and they block 99% of the light. With a little jiggling and arranging you can tighten them up and block out 100% of any ambient light. And if I can sleep with them on, anyone can. I'm Princess and the Pea picky.
I don't know how anyone that does nail art ever lived without this! It's perfect for testing color combinations, stamping, and making decals.

I used to love these vinyls, but have so much trouble removing them, I have given them all away to another unsuspecting user to struggle with.  They constantly tear half way through removal, which messes up the design. I've struggled with them for months before trying a different brand and have no trouble with them.  Let me add, I am not a newbie and am very experienced at how vinyls and stencils should be used.

Yes, it may seem a little pricey.  I was hesitant.  I must have a million dollars by now invested in various nail polishes.  But I bit the bullett to try this one as I liked the fact it was plant based.  I read the claims and was impressed.  Well, I received it a month ago.  It took a few days to arrive but came packaged well.  I immediately took it out of the box and tried it.  I layered it daily as directed initially.  IT HAS NEVER CHIPPED! I've had it on for almost a month. It is shiny as well.  I now have a full set of lovely long strong nails......I only used the clear.  I still work so I'm typing all day long.  I do my own cleaning so my hands are in use in soapy water, etc regularly.  My nails aren't pampered.  I have always had brittle weak nails with ridges, etc.  Had acrylic for years [over 20] and covid put a stop to that.  I'm so glad I found this product.  I just today did one nail in the neutral color that came with the set I purchased.  I'll see how long that one goes without chipping.  You just have to try this!  You won't stop looking at your lovely natural nails.
Bristles are very rough

My review consists of the good, the bad and the ugly. First,
the good - I finally found a curler that 'fits' my eyelid. Huh, you say? Well, it appears that most of the manufacturers believe I have golf balls instead of human eyes. The tool's shape is long and shallow enough of a curve to catch most of the eyelashes. It is comfortable to use, but takes a bit of practice. Once you are comfortable with the scissor motion (sorry, no other way to describe it) used to make the curl, you are rewarded with a nice, non-crimpy curl. The pad in this one is the best I have used. This tool also opens wide enough that even the most nearsighted or lush lashed amoungst us can get it close to the base of the upper lashes. The design over all is very well thought out. I recommend using an magnifying mirror if you have to use bifocals (I do). All that said, now...
the bad - there is no replacement pad and I am questioning how sanitary this is going to be in the long run. I agree completely with folks here who advise to REMOVE ALL EYE MAKEUP before use. Ain't nothing pretty about an eye infection. I am wondering out loud how to properly clean this curler to be certain it remains safe. If you are prone to sties and other types of infection, I would be asking the same questions. Which leads to...
the ugly - until you practice and are used to it (won't take long) the results are a bit odd looking. The black pad is plushier and looks to be made of silicone and not the usual hard rubber. I have found that the hard rubber pads are chiefly responsible for that weird ugly crimp you can get. Not so with this one. I mentioned before the squeezy scissor action your thumb and index finger have to use can be tricky. If you have coordination issues, well - things could get ugly.
SUGGESTIONS for use...wash your hands before use. I keep the little plastic clip to keep the tool closed. You could follow the advise of one person here to heat the tool with a dryer, but I think I may skip that. Use a makeup mirror to assist you. Practice when you have some time. Enjoy, Ladies - get out there and be lovely.

I have used ionizing brushes for over 30 years—since they were first sold by Sharper Image. The negative ions work very well to flatten the surface of the cuticle of each hair, making the hair less likely to break or split, and also softer.

This particular brush works well, but the one I received has a minor design flaw: the brush part pops off so easily that I have to hold it tight with my thumb, making it less ergonomic than it might be... not an issue for me. As for the vibrating part, I couldn't tell, but that's not what I bought it for. This brush generates NO heat, which is exactly what I wanted. Unlike some similar products, there are NO seams that could catch the hair.

TIPS FOR ALL IONIZING BRUSHES:
(1) if they don't need electricity (cord or batteries), they're not the real deal
(2) heating elements, just like heated blow-drying, tend to dry out your hair and make it more brittle: even oily hair can get dried out
(3) brush your hair SLOWLY to get the best result
(4) if your hair is flatter after using it, and you don't like that, bend over and brush it upside down to get more volume

I ordered this palette in the 15 shade option. I wasn't expecting much from this makeup palette but I was wrong. Now granted, I cannot use most of the colors as I am super fair-skinned but I am able to use most of the left side of the palette.

First, I have terrible dark circles. They are sort of a reddish-brown color. The yellow in this palette conceals them better than any skin-toned concealer I have ever tried. It not only covers but also brightens the area too. I also have a brownish spot on my cheek that bothers me every time I look in the mirror. I have tried everything to cover it. I went to a department store makeup counter hoping they could cover it. The makeup counter girl tried for what seemed like an eternity to no avail. She called her manager over to assess my situation. The manager tried to cover it as well, packing more and more concealer and powder but she also could not cover it. She finally said that it was texture and you cannot cover texture. It sounded like a copout to me. It has no texture, it is just a spot. When I apply the yellow in this kit is does wonders for the spot. It is barely noticeable, almost not at all which is better results than I have gotten in the past.

I use the green to cover redness that I have around my cheeks and nose area. I just make sure to blend really well and then put foundation over it to get rid of the green. The purple is used to brighten your complexion. Just like with the green, I blend it well and cover with foundation.

The best color that matches my skin tone for concealing is the color directly to the right of the purple. For reference I wear MAC Matchmaster SPF 15 Foundation 1.0. Nine times out of ten I am the lightest shade in any foundation. This color matches and is great at concealing.

The darker shades are good for contouring but I prefer to use powder contour rather than cream, just a personal preference.

Overall I really like this kit. It does a great job of concealing areas that are a constant bother to me. I am including photos of before and afters of my dark circles and the dark spot on my cheek. Hopefully they come out well and you can see the difference.
