This Argan Oil hair serum is amazing. It helps calm my frizzies and provides the hydration my straw-like hair is craving this time of year. It comes in a 1.69 fl oz bottle with a pump dispenser. This hair serum smells like lilacs to me. It is a very lovely scent. It has a medium consistency to it, not to thick but also not runny. I have long, fine hair so I start with one pump on my fingers, rub it all over my palms, and apply it to my parched ends. When there is hardly any left on my hands I smooth the top of my head to tame flyaways. This serum also gives my hair shine which is another great benefit. I love this product and I will definitely be repurchasing when I run out. I think that will be a long time though because I can easily see this bottle lasting me at least a year.

After reading some of the reviews on this item, I was wary of buying this item, but I'm glad I took a chance because the item really does live up to its promise to help organize your purse. The item is made of durable, quality material, and I can see it holding up for years to come. The price compared to other purse organizers is much more economical and I like that it has a bottom-it makes switching purses much faster than if I had to fish out the organizer and then move my loose items.

A concern listed in a couple of the other reviews is that the organizers smell-I did not encounter that at all, and I'm very sensitive to smells. The smaller organizer fits into my standard size purses and really does help keep me organized. I wish some of the pockets were of a different size, but overall the organizer fits my needs and I'm very, very glad I took a chance on this item.

I bought it through Amazon instead of the TV offer so I didn't have to worry about sneaky S&H charges etc, and as a minimalist, I only need one set, not two, and I certainly didn't need their "special bonus gift".

However, as far as products go... I really love everything about the way this company presents itself, it's design, it's product and how well the product performs. It has a great warranty (my last one from a different company died in less than 5 months with no recourse), and it came with a bunch of great stuff, including this weird little paddle (the green & white thing) I couldn't figure out at first was a cleaning utensil, and now I really love. It helps you pull the hair from the brush.

At almost 30 years old this year, I had spent most of my life hating my hair with a passion. I would wear hats, I would wear wigs, I could not figure out anything that could make me happy... and it's because I was completely inept with styling tools and doing anything that wasn't simple. So I was beyond happy when someone recommended a straightening brush to me in the first place. Then I stumbled upon the best heat protection spray/frizz stuff ever... and I don't know what happened, for the first time in my life, I'm confident with my hair. So if you're on the fence about getting one of these, because you really have tried "everything" and you still hate your hair....I don't know, maybe try a straightener brush. All you do is brush your hair with it....and it changes things a lot.

This brush though. I can not have enough good things to say about it. It came with everything! A heat protection glove (especially great if you have thick hair like me and need to go all the way up to 450 degrees!), the cleaning tool, a silicone bag to protect it, OH and the cord swivels. I absolutely love the shape and curve of the actual brush, and the sturdiness of the design. I can't see this thing actually needing replacing any time soon, honestly... and that makes me happy because I'm tired of buying stuff on Amazon and having it fail on me.

Of all the purchases in the past 2 years on here I've made, this is easily one of, if not the best.... and I wanted to share the pictures of what it does to my hair, so you can see. That is what my hair looks like after being blow dried, and then straightened with this brush, which doesn't take long at all. Maybe 10 or 15 minutes, and my hair is super thick.

I gave this 3 stars for "Softness" because the brush is average to a bit firmer than what would be ideal and comfortable to use on your back, while the loofah strap is average. The brush bristles are kind of scratchy and not the "good exfoliating" kind of scratchy. They're more like the "ouch, that's scratching me" kind of scratchy. Overall, though, it's acceptable and average.

Next, I gave this 2 stars for "Easy to use" because I don't find this easy to use. The brush is separate from the stick that extends it to reach your back; you slide the oval-shaped brush onto the stick by inserting the stick into a cut out section on the back side brush. The problem here is that it doesn't stay on firmly at all. I ended up with 2 options: either not on firmly enough, so it kept popping off, or pushed on so much that it's very difficult to get off of the stick to use separately. The loofah strap is really easy to use, though. It's nice and long so there's plenty of length to comfortably hold each end and move it back and forth at most angles, no matter how thin or thick your arms or body may be. That's a real plus! But I still couldn't give more stars if only half of the set is easily usable.

Finally, I gave this 4 stars for sturdiness because there's no doubt, it seems pretty sturdy. The bristles on the brush have stayed intact. The loofah strap is firm and sewn solidly -- but it may be too firm. It's hard to get flexibility out of it. The elastic strap handle on the brush is flimsy, but overall, it's a solid set. The wood is a good, solid, well-finished wood without splits or cracks. It doesn't seem like a cheap product that's going to warp and break easily if you keep it away from hanging to be soaked when it's not needed for use. Putting it somewhere nearby where it stays dry is best.

I usually get packs of cheapola showercaps from the dollar store (like a six pack of plastic bags with a rubberband, you know?) but they don't last long... So I had a vinyl one that lasted longer, but was really just that same old design that was just plastic tied to your head with elastic...

This shower cap is... well, frankly, after the other ones I've used... luxurious. The material is not plastic, but more like the soft nylon on my windbreaker jacket. It's much quieter when I'm in the shower, which makes for a more peaceful bathing experience. It is also more comfortable, as the headband is more fitted. It's especially comfortable if you wear it over your ears... there's no pressure anywhere, but it still keeps your hair dry. I, personally, like to have my ears "out," so there is some pressure to the top of my ears where the headband sits, but I don't mind it.

The headband does stretch a bit for head size, but not as much as you might be used to if you've used shower caps with elastic bands. I kind of liked this... It makes it easier to get all my hair in it. I flip my head upside down over the shower cap, and the cap just kind of catches my hair like a bucket, and I can just tuck in any stragglers before flipping my head back up. If you need to tighten the headband just a little bit, you can re-tie the bow for a slight adjustment.

No shower cap is going to be completely, perfectly water tight. You're always going to get a little bit of water around the edges unless you're really careful in the shower and take pains to avoid direct spray. I use a shower cap when I take a shower before bed and don't want to go to sleep with wet hair... a little bit of moisture doesn't bother me, as I'm not trying to protect a hairstyle or anything. I really just like the comfort and feel of this cap a lot!
Did not and have not received my order. Very upsetting as I was so excited to try and loved the colors.

I wanted this to work for me, mainly because I don't have to be clean shaven that often with my job. What I was hoping for is when I needed to be clean shaved that I would be able to grab this and get the job done. That didn't happen! I have always used clippers to trim down the initial facial hair, and then come in with either a manual razor, or and electric razor to finish the job to get a super close shave. I don't know if it because my facial hair is so thick, but it required multiple passes on areas like the chin, or the necks and still did not get really close to the skin!!!  I would say this shaver would be great maybe for a person maintaining their clean shave, but not to get that initial clean shaved look! The shaver itself does charge fast, and is easy to clean.

This is a beautiful oil to treat yourself, but the bottle is misleading. If you look carefully, you can see that the liquid does not reach the bottom, that there is another glass bottom a ways up, making the bottle appear more full than it is. I took a star off for that because that's just not cool. They could make it in a smaller bottle & people would still pay $48 for it. It's a nice product. I wish, however, that it didn't have the olive oil in it, because that's what I think is causing acne in a lot of girls skin. For those with acne or if you just don't want to pay this much, you can get the same "velvet" results with rosehip oil. The Ordinary has one for 10 bucks. Rosehip oil can help reduce your inflammatory acne, get rid of acne scars, and clear your skin. Rosehip oil is an anti-inflammatory, able to reduce swelling and fluid buildup. Rosehip oil has a low rating of 1-2 on the comedogenic scale (a.k.a. not likely to clog dem pores). Plus, the linoleic fatty acids in rosehip oil have been shown to reduce oil production in oily skin types which can help prevent future acne. I received this Velvet Skin Drink as a sample & like others, I was impressed, but I found it for brand new & sealed for $24 on Mercari. Personally, because of the olive oil filler and the bottle deception, I wasn't willing to pay $48. They do some great marketing, evidently, as it's out of stock all the time. They make it sound like it's made of purely grapes, which it's not & the bottle deception just isn't worth the hype. Yes, the product is beautiful & makes your skin very soft, but is it softer than my Ordinary Rosehip oil? Nah. This is something nice to splurge on if I find a good deal, because of the of Sarantoni grapes, Resveratrol and lactic acid. But there are no studies on the benefits of these grapes over other grapes & they don't say how much Resvertal and lactic acid they use. I wouldn't consider this an active of any of those products. The Ordinary has both for cheap.

The concept of these is great, but I don't recommend them for 2 reasons.  First, they are so liquidy, it's impossible to "paint" anything with them!  They are the same consistency as your average conditioner, and they don't stay on the side of the bath wall as kids try to draw with it.  It ends up dripping right into the water.  The second problem I have with these is the price.  Amazon is usually pretty dang good with offering the best prices around.  I paid just over $19 for the 6-pack of these, which I assumed was a reasonable price.  That is until I found them for $1.49 at Walmart and $1.99 at Kroeger.  It's pretty bad that these are over 50% more expensive on Amazon than in the store.  Terrible deal, and impossible to paint with.  I would stay away from these.

I've loved Primal Elements soap since I was a kid, but it's expensive to try by buying full bars, and they keep raising the price of this sampler, which they used to call a grab bag and charge a bargain price for (since it's the end slabs they can't sell as full bars), and they keep filling them with a grossly disproportionate number of Christmas soaps.

I ordered 3 samplers direct from their website when they offered a special in mid October, and 10 out of 23 soaps that came were Christmas-themed, and 2 of those were duplicates (2 each of Rudy and Skyward). Another 2 of the non-Christmas soaps were also duplicates (2 each of Primal IPA and Paw Prints). The Primal IPAs weren't even in different boxes - they were stuck together, right next to each other, in the same box. (If you're going to bill this as a sampler rather than a bargain pack, and as gift-worthy, at least make sure the soaps within a box are distinct!) Though it's early-mid autumn, there was not a single autumn scent.

When I've ordered in the past (whether through them, or Amazon, or RockinGifts), there was a similarly disproportionate amount of Christmas soap, except when I ordered in mid-late spring and got floral stuff instead of Christmas. I've never had luck getting autumn or "oriental" soaps in these packs no matter when in the year I order. This is probably the last time I buy a sample pack unless they add an option to pick the scents included.

This is my guilty pleasure. It is definitely like gambling. But once every month or so I take the chance and roll the dice. Some times I get colors I do not have and other times I get 4 of the same. But guess what!?! You can mix these colors and get something that you like. That is what I do. I have mixed some shimmery colors with solids and came out with a beautiful shade that didn't exist before! And for around $1 each it is such a great deal!!! Dollar store price but top salon quality. This polish has been discontinued which is really sad because it is my favorite by far. It goes on smooth, love the wide brush and consistency. It helps my nails grow and keeps them healthy and protected. Also it lasts forever. I mean the polish in the bottle will last forever. Like no expiration date. ** This is copy of my review from same product but bought different times and vendors***

This a great price for 20 polishes. Buying them in the store would be like $6 or $7. I have to admit this is my favorite guilty pleasure. It is like gambling lol. For around $1 a polish this is such a fun way to try new colors!

I absolutely love this polish. I have used it for years. The nice thing about these polishes is that even after years they still perform as well as the new ones. I love how easy it is to apply. If I am in a hurry, one coat is fine. I like to take my time with my nails so I have steps (below). I like to change my polish every week so chipping isn’t a problem for me. Also I wear gloves when I do dishes or clean to extend the life of my nails.
I love that this polish dries fairly quickly if you don’t put it on too thick. I mean, put on a coat while watching TV or on the PC. Careful not to touch anything! But let it dry thoroughly.
Then if you need a little more tint slap a little thin layer to make it pop. Also here are couple tips I learned through my years of doing my nails:

1. Use the SH Complete Care 7in1 or 170 Clear'd for takeoff as a base coat. (I am pretty sure that is why it’s called that... It makes sense to me) I know they say you don’t need one with this polish, but really it is for easier removal. It makes your life so much easier! Especially with darker colors that seem to get in the creases and under your nail that are a pain to remove.

2. Use a white polish (121 let’s snow for example) under any color to make that color really pop. You don’t need a really thick coat of white either. Just enough to give a canvas for the bright color to pop.

3. This polish is a little thick so mind that when you apply it. Put one streak down the middle of your nail (your first application to each nail) this will be a little thicker then go to each side and touching the outskirts of the middle line to grab some of the excess there to spread to the sides.

4. I use Sally Hansen Salon Manicure Top Coat as well to seal the color in if I am not using a Salon Manicure Glitter Overcoat. I think they both help preserve the color.

4b. I know glitter can be intimidating because it’s such a pain to get off. Don’t let that deter you. If you like the look of glitter go for it! There are polish removers designed for that now. As well as the polish remover in the jar that you put your finger in to remove color. There is one that has little ridges (or brushes) inside the center wall that help strip the glitter. Can’t tell you where or who. But I can say you probably have one in your town.

5. For those of you that like a little shiny nail but not necessarily color. I use the 170 Clear’d for takeoff and add some drops of any sheer color (Arm Candy, Sheer Ecstasy, Sweet Talker, Shell We Dance, Pink Slip) it just looks like a natural nail with clear polish only it hides blemishes! And your nails look super awesome! I get compliments all the time about how healthy my nails look when I do that.

I hope these tips help. These are things I have learned over the years. I love doing nails and I am glad to share the things I have discovered to save someone else some frustration or time.

This stuff is great for Making Cannabis Tincture. Great price for a gallon anywhere online and also anywhere in store. I filled 3 huge jars and still have a bunch left for next time. This is also Kosher.

My tincture instructions:

Fill jars with leaf matter
Fill with Glycerine Tincture
Leave a little space at the top.

Screw on Caps. Mark dates on top of caps.

Leave for 60 Days.

Put jars in the over for 20-60 Minutes on 100 degrees Fahrenheit ( some people argue to do this first. )

Filter out Leaf matter with cheesecloth and funnel into dropper bottles.

said it comes with glue and tabs. the glue tabs are a joke they don’t actually come off, the glue on the other does come out but didn’t actually harden to keep the nails on. Total waste of money. Pass on these and just pay the extra few bucks for Kiss, they look way better and actually come with tabs and glue that works. These were so thin and looked like they were made by my 3 year old.

I like this heated eye mask, for the most part, I especially like that it exists in the first place! I was searching Amazon up and down for a heated eye mask that can be worn like a sleeping eye mask to relax my eye muscles after sitting at a computer all day when I finally came across this one. I don't care for the color or the kitty design, but the purple material is velvety soft which I do like.

The mask easily covers my head, though I do have a small head, and the strap fits around the back of my head pretty well. I do choose to wear my hair up at night when I use this heating mask otherwise the strap slides up my straight fine hair slowly if I move my head from side to side. And I somehow never wake up with it on, though I'm thinking that has much more to do with me removing it during the middle of the night vs a product error.

The power cord is composed of two pieces, the first has one end with a USB and the other as a round female piece. Connected to the mask on the right side is the other piece of the cord. This piece has a male round piece and connects perfectly to the female piece. I imagine this design is intended to allow the cord connected to the mask to easily be pulled out if the person moves during sleep.

I plug the cord right into my USB-hub with my phone charger and it works perfectly well.

The controls on this are odd, and you are provided zero instructions. There are two buttons I believe one is a (-) that is indented and the other is a (+) that is raised if my memory serves me right. You have to keep one side pressed down until the unit turns on, then I press the indented button because the numbers go up to 60 on this side. The numbers displaced are bizarre and I have no idea what unit of measurement they are - though degrees Celcius makes the most sense.

The one thing I wish this product had was sewn in contours for the nose and eye sockets so it was able to lay more flush with your eyes. This would allow your eyes to feel a more direct heat. Usually, to counterbalance this I place one of my arms over the heating mask to apply weight and increase the intensity of the heat.

Since becoming a mom, I've been trying to live a greener, less toxic lifestyle. I've started cloth diapering & using un-paper towels. I've switched to natural body & laundry products. However, for some reason, I had been holding out on switching to chemical free cleaning and fabric/air fresheners. I'm not exactly sure why I was so hesitant. These bottles made making the switch fun and easy!

These bottles have both a mist and a stream spray option, as well as an option to turn off the spraying mechanism. Currently, I have one bottle filled with a 1:1 ratio of water to vinegar for use as glass cleaner. The mist option works well on my mirrors and shower doors. The mist option also works very well for both my homemade room/linen spray and my pest repellent spray. (Peppermint essential oil diluted with water and sprayed on the baseboards/around door and windows.) I use the direct stream option for my tub and tile cleaner. It works very well for spraying directly onto the grout.

At 16oz, the bottles are substantial but are not heavy in hand. The trigger is easy to squeeze, yet not flimsy. The glass itself is a gorgeous, deep cobalt blue. I keep my homemade air freshener in one of these bottles on the bathroom counter and have been asked multiple times about where I got it. They really are just so very pretty. Too pretty to be hidden under the sink like most other air freshener or cleaning supply bottles.

Often times, when you purchase cleaners from the store in inexpensive plastic bottles with these same mechanisms, the spray head tends to leak after a week or two of use. It never fails. These, however, are sturdy and seem to be much more heavy duty. I've used these bottles nearly daily and have not had any leaks whatsoever. As beautiful as these bottles are, this is what impressed me most. I'm extremely happy with this product and would highly recommend them!

*I received a discount for this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.*

I was looking for a shower cap that wasn't flimsy or hair-eating (I have mid-back length hair and showering very often results in a wet ponytail that takes forever to dry). This cap is very comfortable, I like the pattern (it's not immediately apparent that it's shower-related) and it looks very well made: over-locked edges, a not-slip trip along the forehead and a sassy bow on the side. The fabric is velvety-soft on the outside, very pleasing to the touch, and waterproof on the inside, but it does not make any crunchy/rubbery noise like an old raincoat. I'm very pleased with my purchase, and this looks like it can be a very nice self-care gift for others.

Not really a buffer... But not quite a file... Pretty but really didn't work as well as a traditional buffer.  Yes it provides a little shine to the nail but you can't get close to the sides easily and the part it does shine takes more effort than a regular buffer/shine block.  It's more like a fine grit file... too fine for edge filing but not quite a buffer/shiner either.

First, the solid cream is solid. At first application I tried just putting it on my face directly from the tube and stopped almost immediately because I did not want to tug at my skin. Instead, I did the bar method of application by using my fingers on the top to warm it and then tapped it onto my skin. The next morning I let it sit on my cheek an extra moment and was apply to seamlessly apply with little to no tugging.
It's a a balm texture from the tube, but then melts into an almost oil/cream. While I find it takes a little for the oils to fully settle onto the skin once they do, I don't find it to be greasy or heavy.
I put this under my SPF in the morning like a serum, and it doesn't pill or bunch up or affect my sunscreen or makeup application after.
At night it's just the right amount of moisture to keep my skin happy and balanced. I have not had any break outs. There is no noticeable scent, neither on opening, applying or after wearing.
If you are new to solid face creams, serums, etc. give this a little time to find the right balance of how much, how long.
The price for the amount is a great value, and I really like the brands ecologically sound stance. I've been a fan of their haircare and am happy to branch out into the skin and face care.

I wasn't sure what to expect from these compressed facial masks in terms of quality, as reviews were across the board. But, they far exceeded my needs and expectations!
They are about the size of three dimes stacked, and are embossed with little flowers on top, which is really just a pretty presentation.
They expand easily with moisture, I mixed up my own serum solution with essential oil, and it was easy to soak and unfold. I worried I would have to be super delicate so as not to tear the paper, but these are more of a fabric than tissue.
In fact, I opened one up to test it's durability. I used some warm water, added some dish soap and went to town scrubbing my basin. No tears, no ripping, no holes. (In fact it cleaned up really well). I used some extra pulling pressure on the cut parts, mouth, eyes chin, and as expected had tears and stretching happen, but that was with abnormal applied pressure.
They didn't smell, they didn't feel weird, and they fit great. For the relaxing usage of a home facial these little compact masks are perfect. I know exactly what I'm putting on my face.

This is actually a decent palette of eyeshadows. They are not super pigmented, but very easy to work with. This is a very nice beginner palette, especially for the under 10 price.
That said, these need a primer. They last an okay amount of time, but will fade quickly if you don’t use a primer.
Simple cardboard container, very similar to colourpop and bh, but doesn’t have a mirror. Still it’s sturdy and all the pans arrived unbroken!
The shades are arranged nicely, it really has a visual appeal, and makes choosing an eye look easier.
It’s realky not bad, and while my tastes typically run towards the more luxury and pigmented, this is a good entry for a beginner or lighter makeup user.
I will be looking into other palettes by this brand.

I’ve been single-blade shaving for about 5 years. I enjoy trying out different blades and soaps. This is one of my stand-byes so I can recommend this soap.

1. SHAVE: EXCELLENT. Mitchell’s is very slick and leaves very little tendency to cut or scrape. It results in a close, smooth shave in two passes. Most premium soaps result in a good-to-excellent shave.

2. SKIN: EXCELLENT. This product contains lanolin and results in the very best and softest after-shave experience of any soap I’ve tried. Most premium soaps result in a fair-to-good experience for me.

3. VERSATILITY: GOOD. Some soaps seem to shave very well with one brand of blade and not others. Mitchell’s doesn’t seem to mind. I use ASTRA and generally sharp blades.

4. LATHER: FAIR. This soap deposits easily onto a wet badger brush, sufficient to lather onto the skin and shave well. It does not whip into a full thick lather if that is important to you. It is also reputed (I have no direct experience) to be difficult to lather at all if you have hard water.

5. LATHER DURABILITY: GOOD. The lather on the brush lasts OK during the shave. Easily enough for two passes.

6. PUCK DURABILITY: EXCELLENT. I tend to rotate among several brands of soap, and most milled soaps collect enough water from the brush to decay and dry out somewhat before the puck is finished. Mitchell’s lasts to the end.

8. VALUE: FAIR. Mitchell’s is priced about the same as other premium milled soaps. However, if it is sold as a bare replacement puck so you will need a shaving bowel or other container.

I got this set because I was curious about the spiral thingies and figured, for the price, it might be fun to pay a little more than I would if I was just buying the spirals elsewhere and have some stuff to play around with. Most of the items turned out to be pretty meh, so now I'm the proud owner of spiral thingies and some clutter.

Pros:
The spiral bun holders are great - both for holding my hair up in a neat bun and for putting my hair in before bed. If I wear them to bed (on not totally dry hair), I'll have nice waves when I take them out in the morning.

I like the medium size donut hair thing too. These are super easy to make out of an extra sock. So... maybe not worth buying.

Cons:
I ended up getting excited about the the 'topsy tail' things - but they both broke. I put my hair in a pony tail, wrapped some of my hair around the elastic to hide it, and was using the little topsy tail thing to pull that bit of hair back through the elastic / pony tail holder when it snapped. So I tried doing the same thing with the bigger one and it snapped too. There's always room for user error, but it seems like these guys should have been able to withstand pulling some hair through a pony tail / pony tail holder.

The rest of the set is pretty meh and/or useless.

Provides a decent shave, particularly after the beard has been moistened as it is immediately after a shower. The question is, for how long, considering the flimsy construction of some components and the already below-specified battery life.

Things they don't describe in the mostly worthless manual:

The charging indicator is a steady red AC plug symbol.

The LCD indication at full charge is 99. A RED (not a far more intuitive GREEN) battery full symbol is shown at when the charge reaches 99.

A low battery is indicated by a flashing red AC plug symbol when the charge number on the LCD reaches 10.

Charge time was tested and found to be 82 minutes. The manual claims 60 to 90 minutes, so they got that right.

Use time is specified in the manual as 50 to 60 minutes. The run time was tested and found to be only 30 minutes in 5 minute on, five minute off intervals, just free running and not being used to shave which should further reduce the run time slightly.

The charge indicator was at 52 after 25 minutes and then rapidly dropped from that to 10 only five minutes later causing the low battery indicator to flash, so I would definitely NOT trust the charge indicator to be an accurate indication of how much shaving time you have left. They are apparently not calculating percent charge remaining and displaying it on the LCD, they are simply and far less usefully displaying percent battery VOLTAGE which drops off rapidly at what is called the battery's discharge "knee." A cheap route to take revealing that the LCD display is nothing more useful than a gimmick.

The manual states that the razor should be unplugged from the charger (this razor package does not come with an AC to USB charge adapter) when the charge number reaches 99, so I suspect this charger might not have an intelligent charger which stops the battery charge process at full charge to avoid battery damage over the long term. So, I will not put this razor on charge and just forget about it until my next shave like I can with my Norelco with its intelligent charge system.

Other information:

The space under the heads which catches the beard shavings is very small. Cleaning often will be a must. We'll see how the hinge and head locking mechanism hold up.

When opening the shaving head to clean, put a finger on it to slow its opening, otherwise it will rapidly flip open and if a razor element isn't locked into its place by its flimsy and not very intuitive to correctly replace locking ring, as it wasn't in my case, the razor element and its parts will be vigorously projected into an alternate universe. Luckily, I found all of the parts. Had I been standing over a sink, some could easily have gone down the drain. We'll see how the razor element locking rings hold up.

The jars look as pictured. They are 2 inches in diameter and 1 & 3/4 inches in height. They are double-walled, sturdy but lightweight. Made of PP #5 plastic which is supposed to be better than other kinds of plastic but all plastic will leach chemicals. I had ordered 4 sets (10 per package) but one jar and lid were missing from one of the packages, otherwise I would have given it five stars.

Edited 1/2/2014: The jars I had originally bought are NOT the jars shown here as of this date. The jars I bought were domed (lid and base), double-walled and the lids made a perfect seal with the bases (no space, no lid overlapping the base). They were nicer looking than these. Please see photo under "customer images of product" and my name "jamie".

Edited 3/25/2014: Why does amazon continue to use my review for a product image that does not match what I actually bought?
Despite all the reviews saying they dried out quickly, I ordered these. Both pens worked amazing the first time. It looks so good! And then they're dried out after one use.

UPDATE AS OF 03/16/2019 All the previous info still applies. Now that I am 16 days out from using this product, I want to add that my feet are STILL peeling. I have been using this type (not this particular) product for a couple of years and the entire process is always completed at least by day 12. Thus, besides the horrible odor, this product is not particularly efficient at exfoliating. So, basically there is NOTHING about it that I can recommend.

No matter how good these are at exfoliating, I cannot recommend them due to the offensive/clingy/cloying/LONGLASTING odor. I have used products like this before and there is always some odor during use...but these, well, days later after soaking my feet in baking soda water and then vinegar water, the incredibly floral+chemical odor still wafts around my head--yes, all the way from my feet! It is sickening, offensive,, and embarrassing when I am around other people. Also, the socks I put on after using this product have been washed in hot water and laundry detergent and they are just going to have to be thrown away because the odor DOES NOT come out. I threw away second set of these bootees because I cannot subject myself to the odor again no matter how badly I want my feet to be soft without rough skin. DO NOT BUY if you are sensitive to odors and/or simply do not like strong odors wafting around you for days on end.

I soo much wanted to Really love this deck! I Really love the art work but as oracle cards it lacks. Since each card has the meaning printed on the back (left photo, "Courage", right photo is the 'couragous' cat) a lot of the illustrations are too subtle, not reflecting the meaning enough or at all.
Also, I wish it allowed the reader to pick a card without seeing the cats (or the meanings), the only way to do so is close your eyes and pick one!
For a $20. Oracle deck with no booklet and a design that's pretty limited, I wish I bought a print or calendar of the cats instead.
The ingredients are just alcohol and water. I almost purchased this. Glad there were pics of all sides of the bottle... Shop wisely.

This is a wonderful invention! I have a hard enough time getting ready in the mornings without having to spend time drying my hair. I have very thick hair, when it was long it would take around 35 minutes to dry, and now it is very short and still takes 15 minutes to dry. Now, I simply leave the dryer on above me while I put on makeup and get dressed in the bathroom, and that's it! Anything that saves time is an improvement in life quality, it's been a wise investment.
*I paid full price for this item and strongly distrust any paid-for reviews where the reviewer’s opinion is bought by being given discounted or free products.
Product leaks around the roller and gets everywhere not worth the money due to poor quality very disappointing
These are NOT THE ONES IN THE PHOTO! They are the super-cheap variety, and half of them fall apart upon opening! “NOT AS DESCRIBED”!

I wish this was available in stores in the states so that I could have gotten a better match, but alas, it's only available through the internet here. I'm glad I also ordered 53 light beige because I usually end up mixing the two to get it just right. Maybe in the winter this will match better. I also wish there were more shades available, but then ordering over the internet is tough with foundation when you can't compare in person. I apply it with a Real Techniques sponge, and it goes on nice and smoothly. I tried it with a brush, but it kind of looked streaky. Since I also have dry skin, the sponge works better for me anyway. It feels really nice. It feels almost like bare skin but slightly better, like nicely moisturized skin. With a makeup setting spray, I get pretty good coverage for about 8 hours. It might last even longer, but that's as long as I've worn it. Once it seemed to wear off early, but I didn't use setting spray that time either. Also, it's summer and humid here, so I think that makes all makeup wear sooner. I think it would be a great winter time foundation for the extra moisturization and the shade I have is just a shade or two lighter than I need. It is fairly light to medium coverage, but I can build up to good medium coverage. A lot of people comment that it has a fruity smell, and it does but it's not like I pump it into my hand and go 'oh fruit' every time. I have to smell the pumped product on my hand or sponge directly before I notice it. Definitely not overpowering but pleasant.

I usually buy the color Vanilla in Too Faced foundations and this one is SOO yellow. It makes me look sick like I have jaundice.

Other than that the smell is a little overbearing (and I typically like their scented lines). It’s quite thick, very creamy. Not as dewy as I thought it would be.

Regardless, none of it matter because the color is so atrocious.

I’ve been really into gel blushes lately and I kept seeing this pop up in my feeds, so I gave in and bought it.

For the price you do get a lot of product. It’s quite large and it’s probably going to last a lifetime BECAUSE it is SO pigmented. Seriously, its almost too pigmented. You literally only need a pin sized amount because it’s so pigmented. Its difficult to control how much comes out because when you squeeze it.

It’s hard to get this blended in before it started staining and setting. It’s hard to control the pigment and every time I’ve tried it I end up going to low with it in order to get the edges blended out.

Frankly, I prefer Maybelline Cheek Heat over this product. It’s much more sheer and easier to work with and I like the dried down finish of it better because it’s a bit dewier than this product.

For the price I wish I liked it more.

This foundation is a tricky one. There are things I really like about it and things that I don’t.
I bought it in the shade 04 Honey. In the bottle it looks like an almost exact match to my skin, but when I put it on it’s much paler with a decidedly pink undertone, yet it doesn’t look orange or too pink in my skin. I prefer a neutral undertone though since my skin can be both yellow and pink.

I love the bottle and packaging. It comes in a frosted glass bottle with a pink pump and pink cap that snaps on tightly.

The coverage is much higher than I expected and it is heavier than expected for a luminous foundation.

It covers blue tones better than redness. I have typically had to build it up in areas I have more redness (and we’re talking average redness, not anything extreme) and doing this makes it look much heavier so I end up using a concealer instead. The problem with this lies in the finish.

So this foundation’s finish is very confusing and hard to describe. It is very glowy and luminous without being shimmery but it has the heaviness of a matte. I know, confusing.
Areas can look too greasy or too dry. It settles into fine lines and creases around the eyes and nostrils. For this reason this is not a foundation I choose for the daytime. It’s much too heavy and shiny for the day, which is a shame because I enjoy it’s longevity. Once I set it with some powder around the eyes and my nostrils I really enjoy it for a night out.

I should also mention it is heavily perfumed with a floral scent so those sensitive to scented foundations will likely want to give this a pass. It’s not bothersome to me personally but fragrance can irritate really sensitive skin.

All in all I don’t use it as much as I hoped I would and probably won’t repurchase based on that and how heavy it is. At 36 I want a foundation with decent coverage but a lighter feel. It’s also not the easiest foundation to completely remove and when I wear it I have to use a cleaning oil and a cleanser both AND a miceller solution.

I have combo skin that can be prone to breakouts with certain brands but I haven’t broken out from this foundation.

I enjoy Holika Holika’s BB cream which is why I gave this a shot (and I like a luminous foundation) but I’ll probably stick with the BB cream in the future since it’s lighter.

First, I want to say I bought this at full price....period!

I've been very lax over years, at any kind of skin care routine. My skin isn't really showing any effects of bad skin care, because I was blessed with really good skin, but....I'm 52 now and decided I really shouldn't push it any longer. So; I purchased Tree of Life Beauty Vitamin C wash first. I was very impressed with the ingredient list, the amount used to wash my face (neck, chest, and shoulders as well), and the way my skin felt afterwards.

So when I saw the toner was 93% organic, I decided buy the Tree of life Beauty Toner, to go along with the wash. First of all, I really am impressed with the ingredients this company uses. I grow all organics herbs, berries, vegetables, etc. and use as many organic ingredients that I can. I would love to be a purist, but my budget says "NO!" This company doesn't use a lot of needless filler ingredients to stretch the product. So when you think of the product being only 8 oz, you can be assured that 8 oz (when used properly), is a good amount of product that will last. I can't say how long yet, as I've only been using it a week.

Secondly, being an herbalist has taught me that your skin is your largest organ! You should be careful what you put on it. Your pores soak up every last drop of whatever you put on your skin. Parabens are absolute poison and should be avoided like the plague! (Sorry all of you Vicks and vasaline lovers out there) From what I've read about Tree of life Beauty, we're on the same page and I don't feel I need to be concerned about them hiding any in their products.

And finally, Vitamin C is essential to your body in too many ways to go into. But I take a vitamin C daily to help with the absorption of Collagen 1&3 (Which is important for hair, skin, nails, bones, joints, etc). I had not realized the benefits of vitamin C for your face. I absolutely love the way my skin feels after using the cleanser and toner. I let it dry well, then follow up with moisturizer both morning and evening.

So far, I'm quite happy with Tree of Life Beauty products and will probably transition to more of their products as I use up what I already have. We'll see how it goes after using these items for 30 days.

The name “Honey Bee Smooth Bath & Body Scrub + Moisturizer” just evokes good thoughts, doesn’t it? If you love honey, it just sounds amazing. I know I love honey and I love using it or having it in my beauty products, so I was looking forward to receiving this product to test it out.

There are some actual product packaging concerns that really should be addressed by the company that makes this body scrub. First off, the jar is pretty sturdy, I’m not going to dispute that and it’s amber, which is always good in helping keep out UV rays. The ONLY seal is the Amazon barcode label (One of the photos shows the label, but I cut through it, it was intact when it arrived - so that was not the issue). There was no shrink wrap seal, neither was there an inner seal, nor one of those inner lid liners. This jar also does not have ANY other labeling except for that Amazon barcode and the top label with their website URL. This was a standalone jar, no box. There is no product information on the jar, no ingredient list, no product name, no manufacture or expiration dates. This brings up heavy red flags for me – quality control especially.

The product description sounds rather amazing, right? Ok, keep in mind what I previously mentioned about quality control. In their description they advertise that you can EAT it. I’d recommend against it because of the lack of quality sealing. It would be one thing if this were given to me by someone who I knew personally that had made the product, but since this is coming from a company that I don’t know and that doesn’t have anything other than the description on Amazon, I’m not sticking this product in my mouth. I know the anti-bacterial properties of honey, however, that doesn’t mean that it can’t be contaminated by anything else -1) it’s not pure honey, there are other ingredients within, 2) who knows the health/sanitation practices of this company, right?, 3) with there just being the barcode label as a seal, who’s to say that someone couldn’t have tampered with it in the warehouse?, and 4) their only label – the one I mentioned with their website URL – if you go to the URL, it comes up with:

“This webpage is not available

ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED”

I don’t know about you, but without anything reputable to back up the product or company, I find it very hard for me to trust this.

ALL of that aside, if you can look past those packaging and trust issues, getting to the actual product…

When you open the cover, it does have that very rich strong scent of honey. The brown sugar and other ingredients have settled to the bottom, so some stirring was necessary — the honey is also pretty solid, so a cosmetic spatula (not included) was not adequate enough to stir it. Once you do stir it, the scent of the brown sugar comes through. Because it’s honey, it’s really sticky, and like any sugar scrub, it has that gritty sugar texture which is great for exfoliation. If your skin is dry when you apply, you may have a tough time spreading it, to avoid this, moisten your skin prior to smoothing this along.

It does its job at exfoliating, removing a layer of dead skin, but I didn’t expect that it wouldn’t. The product itself is good, leaves the skin smooth and smells good – I used it on my leg.

It’s not proprietary though, since there are a ton of DIY tutorials on how to make sugar scrubs out on the web nowadays. But if you’re not into making your own and if they change the packaging and labeling and get a working website up, then this would be the way to go.

I really hope that they get the concerns I mentioned in the beginning straightened out. It would have been a decent product all around if not for those issues. If they do, then I'd be more than happy to bump the rating to a 4. This product was given to me complimentary in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.
These come in handy!
Dry

The glowing reviews about this product are accurate in a sense - yes, this product shows a noticeable improvement in the appearance of skin over a short period of time. It does contain enough glycolic acid at a decent ph, it does exfoliate well. Whatever praises people bestow are germane but only to a certain degree. The fact of the matter though is that the entire line of products contain many unefficacious artificial ingredients at best and downright harmful toxins, in effect, at worst.

It has plenty of potential but does not deliver. It seems to me that the makers are not truly interested in answering the riddle to great skin. It is a start devoid of middle or end notes. It does not cater to the skin as a complete system. It will give you a minor improvement and waste a lot of your time.

But don't take my word for it, try it for yourself. If you love it and are happy good for you. I will not throw cigarette buds on anyones Eden. If however you are not a believer like me and want to try another alternative try something with ONLY natural ingredients. Anything else and your skin will be in a constant battle with adversaries you put there, everyday, and leave there to do damage, because it's absurd to think that the body could assimilate such artificiality in any positive long-term way.

The choice is yours my friends.

Love these masks!!! I can’t take the thick full medical masks anymore. I’ve been getting bad acne, marks all over my face, my nose runs, and also bloody noses from wearing those masks. I was very pleasantly surprised that this kind of mask fit my face perfectly and is 100% acceptable inside places. I don’t have a big face, so that’s maybe why it fits way better. With the medical masks they would swallow my face and ride up to my eyes. I was constantly pulling it down (touching it). Like I said every face shape is different so, other reviews may say it doesn’t cover, but for my face it covers what NEEDS to be covered without compromising my breathing!! It catches all the “mouth spray”, covers my nose, and allows me to breathe without smothering me to death. I feel safe with it around people and so far vice versa!! Highly recommend!!!

I love the Mane Club hair masks. They really are a miracle and each packet gives me 3-4 uses on my shoulder length hair. But these prices are ridiculous. It's available at Ulta, Sally Beauty, and on Mane Club website for half this price. I don't mind paying a little extra for convenience, but this is gouging.
Nailtiqes charges $7.50 for these!!!!!
This stuff is awful!! It does not work and SMELLS TERRIBLE!! Not worth the 10.00!!

Beautiful looking set and what you see is what you get.....for about two weeks and this is with very gentle use and no washing detergents or dishwasher machine clean.

I wanted this style angler for my long hair and saw it everywhere....decided to pay a bit extra and get the set. Arrived in a beautiful flawless condition and even my trendy daughter was impressed lol. She’s away at school and tends to borrow my makeup, hair products of all kinds, clothes, etc. Sigh! Lol

Normally, I would have attributed the damage to her as she is young and it’s easy to be roughshod on mom’s stuff when mom is pretty laid back minus a few clear things!

But, nope. Just me using it. Boyfriend skeptical but impressed by the detangler and decided the overall metallic “paint” rose gold was striking, yet pretty. He’s a die-hard boar bristle wooden brushes fan. Lovely but this was the detangler I needed (it works) and the case and other brush/comb were a splurge. A gift to myself. Nice!

Only I used it and never dropped it. Less than a month and the paint is flicking off and it’s night and day and looks....so cheap and damaged. I have supplies to patch up the chips and did fiddle with the chips but it was like an unraveling sweater.

Tired of picking the flecks off the bathroom floor and pitched it all in the garbage. It’s my fault for not seeking refund as the items were defective within the return window. This is a wonderful facial cleanser! I have very sensitive skin, and I'm always nervous the first time I try out a new product, but I've had no reaction or irritation of any kind after using this morning and night over the last week. I also haven't had any type of breakout which happens often with other products I've tried in the past. That alone makes me very happy!

I also like the consistency of the cleanser because a little goes a long way and making it much more cost efficient. There are also these little conditioning 'beads' that kind of break apart to add jojoba oil to the cleanser. I found that the lather amount is about right and the scent is very light to almost non-existent (in my opinion anyway).

Pros:
*Department store quality at a reasonable price
*Small amount goes a long way making it cost efficient
*Little to no scent
*Conditioning jojoba beads
*Rinses off easily
*Non-drying
*Non-irritating to my sensitive skin
*Amount of cleanser for the price (6.7 oz)
*Money back guarantee

Cons:
*None noted

Even though I did receive a discounted price in order to use this cleanser and give a review based upon my experience with it, I was in no way influenced by the seller on the actual review. Because I mostly shop online these days, the reviews I read help me to decision on which products to buy, I am determined to give the best information in my reviews for others to make their purchasing choices. I feel very comfortable in recommending this cleanser if you are looking for a high quality cleanser with added benefits of conditioning/exfoliating using the best natural and scientific technology to also treat your skin.

I am already a fan of Josie Maran's color stick in Rosy which I purchased at Sephora late in 2010. I still have half of it left and expect I will run out of it sometime in mid-2013. What a way to stretch a dollar! I saw this color, Love, which is not available in the store, and was attracted to what appears to be more of an earthy, rich and darker color than Rosy. I ordered it and it arrived yesterday. I was disappointed to find a pale mauvish color and did not have high hopes for how it would look on me, as I have never liked mauve colors on me. This morning I tried it anyway, fully expecting to hate it. Within about 20 minutes I noticed the most natural-looking vibrant bloom in my cheeks, attributable only to this! I love the silky texture and it does not feel sticky or greasy on my face at all. Just pure healthy moisturizing (thanks to the argan oil in it) color that I am so glad to have. It has more of a matte effect on the skin than does Rosy, which is more glossy and sheer. Both colors last all day on my face, even in extreme heat and humidity.

The price may seem expensive but considering my first one is still fresh and going strong after 19 months, it's actually a steal! Smells pleasant, too - rather like fresh berries. Just be aware that it is not going to be the dark berry color shown in the photograph.

I've had this shaver for years now, buying it as a replacement for my previous Norelco that I dearly loved. But I had put so many years on that one, and when it was time to replace the battery and heads (about $80.00 total), I figured it was time to just get a new one.

This was the first frustrating part of the process, finding a replacement. Norelco makes so many models. I was looking for one on sale as to limited funds. I soon found out a lot of things I didn't like. These shavers are no longer made in Holland, to fine exacting standards, but are now made in China. They are of varying quality, even within the same model, so you get the luck of the draw. This new model, for twice the money, did not have a battery charge indicator on it, and they no longer have the head height adjustment. And it was LOUD! All for TWICE the price of my old Norelco shaver that was made in Holland, had the battery indicator, and the adjustable heads.

So right away, I considered rebuilding the old one. I should have. This shaver grabbed my hair (still does), gives me razor burn, is made out of a more flimsy plastic, doesn't hold a charge nearly as long as with past models, and is just all around a poor replacement, for, did I mention, TWICE THE MONEY!

So I've put up with it for years now and am at the same place again. The heads and battery need replacing for a cost of over $80.00 and I'm sure not going to put that into this shaver. So it's off to the reviews again to find a new shaver. I understand that now that Philips has purchased Norelco that their quality has begun to come back up while their prices have stayed the same or even gone done some. I hope this is true as the alternatives don't exist.

In a word, you get what you pay for and with the 6843XL Reflex Plus, you don't get much!

This was the most perfect foundation I've ever used. I bet I used it for 12-15 years, and it never let me down. The formulation was consistent, light with medium coverage, no fragrance, slightly yellow enough to be the perfect color. It was worth every dime. My skin transitioned into middle age on this foundation, and I didn't realize what a rare thing that is. Most of the products on the market are made for younger skin, though they don't necessarily specify that. This one transcended a range of needs, including aging, blurring, SPF, tone...

The new line that replaced this one is heavier coverage and not the same quality product. Now the line doesn't work well with older skin, and Benefit doesn't really have a line that is made for older skin. Also, their other lines don't have the warm/yellow undertone. They are more orangey. So thanks for being really clear about your ageism and market. That's too bad.

This product is designed to change the alkalinity of your hair, so that it stays smooth and shiny. I accomplish that with light argon oil. Truly, I couldn't tell that this product did anything. I see no merit to its use, and would look toward other finishing products to smooth hair and restore shine. They're also usually much cheaper than this Mist.

This hand soap really reached out to me, pun intended. The signed card with a photo of the couple, really shows who your buying from. I might be a sap when it comes to having heart strings, but that just plucked my heart chords.

With every handsoap, conditioner, body wash, pretty much every kind of fragrance imaginable ---- can be completely customized. Want more gunpowder and more bonfire? or maybe more of just everything? heck, what about old fashioned scentless? To me, as a fragrance fanatic, this is a complete solid. I wanna come out smelling great, wherever I may tread. These two got your back, so Buck up, cowgirls and cowboys, this ain't your normal (soap) rodeo.

I do not claim to know soap or how its made, but I can tell you when a real company is looking out for you and has it's best intentions for you. Don't be scared to get your hands dirty this time, partner, this brand is one for outlaws only.

TLDR: great soap, you can customize it to a hand wash to body wash to even salve cologne. New company with inspiring couple that you can get behind.

I recently used this scrub and felt inspired to write a review about it for those that aren't sure if they should get this scrub or not.

Before buying this scrub, I was aware coffee scrubs have been trending for a year or so. As others, I was very skeptical about it and wasn't sure how I felt about this beauty trend. The only way I was going to find out was to give it a try.

Here's what I learned after using it that I think will help others should you decide to try it:

1) Prepare your environment and set aside time before using it - Prior to using the scrub, decide where you are going to use it (shower, bath, fenced backyard, etc.) because I'm warning you now, it's gonna get messy. I have a regular sized shower/bath, so if I plan on using this again, I would get myself completely wet, sit in the tub, use the scrub all over my body, rinse off (still sitting), then finally stand up to complete washing off. If you have a private fenced off backyard where you are near a hose, that's a good setting too. The whole process took approximately 40-50 minutes (I like to take my time). I used the whole pack because I literally used it all over my body, but you can use whatever amount you want. Just know that you will need time to really work it into your skin and let it set for a few minutes before washing it off.

2) Be honest with yourself about your skin regimen - What I mean is, if you are not disciplined about your skin regimen or don't want to take time to use this scrub, then honestly I don't know this product is going to work for you. Personally, I'm committed to a regular and consistent skin regimen and set aside time to use this product to get optimal results. I am just saying this isn't like a typical scrub and takes more time to work it in to your skin.

3) You'll likely need soap to get the rest of it off - Even after a rinse, it will stain, just like coffee will do, so I used some shea butter body wash and a body brush to get the rest of it off. Once I was completely clean, I dried off and used body shop cocoa butter all over my body (it's what I usually use anyway).

4) For people with very oily skin be aware - Since this product has coconut oil and you are highly prone to breaking out, I'm not sure if this is a good idea; the amount of coconut oil is definitely noticeable so just be aware.

The verdict: I will say, this made me feel amazing afterwards. My skin felt very smooth and soft. That being said, I bought it without having any expectations. I tried it mainly out of curiosity. As there are advances in beauty products, I am naturally going to want to try new things. I have heard that coffee scrubs reduce cellulite or supports regeneration of new skin cells. Honestly I don't know if that's true and frankly find that doubtful. However, I can say it is better than most scrubs I've used in the past, and it's a wonderful treat for the skin from time to time. I would buy and use it again for occasional use.

I think the eyebrow pen would have been awesome if it was brown black, or black or even actual dark brown but it has a red tint to it and just a weird color, I have dark but thin brows and I think if this color was closer to my Natural brow color it would have been awesome, same with the brown powder, just a weird shade of brown and the eyeliner is definitely not even close to smudgeproof or waterproof and to make matters worse only 1 of the eyeliners wasn't completely dried out and it's almost dried out after 1 atrempt at using... I was really curious about receiving this product - as I LOVE the concept. I am constantly looking for a cover for my razors - both to keep them clean and to prevent my little ones from coming in contact with the blade. Unfortunately, this design just really falls short. There is a metal plate within the clamp like pod which the blade sits against when the pod is closed. I understand the metal was likely placed there to protect the blade and prevent unnecessary dulling and the build up of gunk. Most razors on the market today have a strip of lotion or emollient along the top of the blade. Unfortunately, the metal from the pod kept fusing to the strip causing both the strip to come off and the plastic of the pod to pull free - resulting in both a broken pod and a damaged and unusable razor. I would also caution this company regarding the name and claim of the product. Although the product is meant to provide a protective cover to the razor -  it by no means provides any sort of sterile environment.... thus I do think calling this a “steripod” might be a bit misleading.

When I ordered this, I thought it was a regular ol' hose nozzle. It's not -- you can actually attach it to a pressure washer as well. I was not overly impressed with this at first. The pressure washer attachment came connected to the hose nozzle and it was an absolute pain to remove (my husband had to use pliers to get it out). It was easy enough to attach to the hose but somewhat a pain to take off. It also only seems to have 2 spray patterns, not 4 like advertised (a hard "line" spray and a softer line spray).

I was not comfortable spraying my flowers with this because it seemed to spray fairly hard, even when I turned the nozzle to reduce the spray. So, I started spraying off the mold on my sidewalk. Our house faces north and is fairly shaded in the front and, since it rains a lot in Florida, tends to get mold build-up on the front sidewalks. As you can see from the picture I posted, this nozzle does actually help spray off mold. It's not quite a pressure washer but it was able to remove the heavy stuff (but, remember, it does come with the pressure washer attachment). I am giving this four stars because it's not quite what I expected but it does help remove mold from cement, which makes it worth having.

I was disappointed that this product did not come with instructions.  I am new to doing my own nails.  I couldn't even figure out how to change the drill heads (I had to get my husband involved and he had trouble getting the lock to release).  I would have given this a higher rating if it had just come with instructions (as in this is how you change the drill heads or this drill head is for when you want to do XXX, etc.).  That aside, the kit is nice to have for anyone who maintains their nails.

EDITED REVIEW as of 9/25/21.

I came back to edit this review and to lower my rating from 4 stars to 3 stars. Here's why:

After a few weeks of using this cream, I started to develop some sensitivity to it. When I say sensitivity, here's what I mean: 1) The scent bothered me more than it did when I first used the cream. In fact, I started to sneeze most evening after applying it. 2) I'd used the cream on other areas of my face, and noticed minor breakouts in those areas.

Basically, I think the cream was just too oily for my skin. Even around the eye area, which has virtually no oil glands, the non-absorbency of the cream left me feeling sticky and greasy even though I gave the cream plenty of time to absorb.

End of Edit.

***************************************************************************************************************************

Everything else I said in my original review still stands. But the above edit may help you decide if this is the right eye cream for you.

If you're looking for a natural, plant-based eye cream that is ultra-thick and rich, you'll find it in this 2 oz. jar.

The jar will last a VERY long time, because you only need a tiny amount of this cream to cover the undereye area and the corners where crows feet form.

I'd advise putting the cream on a couple of hours before bed, since it takes quite a while to absorb into the skin. (If you don't wait, you'll end up depositing most of the cream on your pillowcase.)

I've also used a small amount of this cream on other areas of my face (nose to mouth lines) and the results were the same as around my eye area.

So what were the results? The skin around my eye area looked smoother and brighter after one night of use.
The results on other parts of my face were less noticeable, but I believe continued use of the cream will improve the results in both the eye area and on the face.

I'm rating the cream 4 stars instead of 5, because of one major issue I have with it, which is: THE SCENT.
The cream has a rather strong minty (?), menthol (?) medicinal smell that takes some time to fade away.
Since I prefer NO SCENT in eye/facial products, I deducted one star from my rating.

That aside, if scented products don't bother you, and you want a thick, rich eye cream you will probably enjoy using this one.

I ordered this for my partner, who has been using a 3-head rotary shaver to shave his head. This one does a far better job! It has many great features, including:

1) It arrives fully charged, ready to use.

2) Along with the 6-head shaving attachment, It has just about every shaving accessory you could want; a facial cleansing brush, sideburn trimmer, nose/ear trimmer, face cleaning sponge.

3) It is washable.

4) It comes with the USB cord for charging, and you get approximately 90 minutes of shave time after 1.5 hours of charging.

HERE'S THE BEST PART: It gives a QUICK and CLOSE shave to my partner's head, with no tugging or pulling.
He said "This is like having a riding mower for my head, versus a push-mower". LOL! I think that's a pretty good testimonial.

As a final note, the price is reasonable, especially considering all the good features of this unit.

P.S. to the ladies: I think the 6-head attachment could make a great shaver for your legs, so you might want one of your own. :>)

I've tried many brands of purple shampoos/conditioners in the never-ending battle against brassy tones.
This is one of the better brands.

First of all, I love the scent. It is vaguely floral, definitely a feminine scent. It smells wonderful in the shower, but I like the fact that it fades quickly once you rinse it away. It doesn't linger all day, meaning it won't compete with any other fragrance you are wearing.

Second, I like the fact that this set is gentle, and non-drying. (Some other brands have left me with straw-like hair after a few uses.) This combo cleans gently, and leaves the hair feeling silky.

Third, the toning is effective. There is a visible difference after just a couple of uses. I saw the yellow/orange tones had faded after the first use, and after the second, my hair was shiny and showed highlights, but there was a marked difference in the amount of brassiness.

Fourth, I like the fact that the shampoo is natural (made with botanicals) and is sulfate and paraben free. It is also cruelty free, another big plus. The pump bottles are also great, making the shampoo and conditioner easy to use in the shower. They are plastic, so no breakage issues.

Finally, the price is right. The shampoo and conditioner bottles each contain 16.9 fl. oz of product. A good buy.

Bottom line, this is a solid 5 star set. Recommended!

There are four bottles included in this nicely packaged set. The set comes in a dark brown "textured" heavy cardboard box, wrapped in a clear plastic sleeve. I mention the specifics of the packaging, because the pretty packaging makes it gift-ready. (Just add a bow or a ribbon, a name tag, and you're done!)

Despite the fact that I'm calling this a "sampler set" the 20 ml bottles are good size. (Not tiny little things.) There's plenty of product to use each fragrance for awhile. (You can really get to know the aromas this way. It's not a one-and-done type of sampler.)

All four fragrances are pleasant, clean, and crisp. My partner likes Oxford Bleu and Riviera the most. He says these have a "fresh" smell to him. (I agree!. The Oxford Bleu is my favorite.)

If you're not familiar with English Laundry scents, this set is a great way to try several of their offerings. If you already love English Laundry, here's a chance to enjoy some of your favorites.

Yes, it's true. This is a good switch from even the latest Gillette multi-blade wonder. Even the replacement lotion (or gel) cartridges are much cheaper than those blades or the multi-pack (whole plastic ones with a handle) throws-away.

I recommend spreading the lotion or gel with a finger rather than relying on the 'glide rings' as this will make it go further. Also, any basic model without the bells and whistles will serve you just as well.

I suffer from a heavy growth/sensitive skin combination, and find this razor to be the best Phillips/Norelco device, yet.

I bought mine about eight months ago, and even shave my head with it. Not quite as close as the 'naked' blade, but as mine grows to stubble within a few hours - who cares? My wife LOVES it, too - and can't stop kissing and sniffing my face and head after I shave!

Now for the going shopping bit:

I highly suggest going for a factory refurbished unit. This is by far the best value for your money at about one third the price of a new one. I found mine at Goodmans (also available through Amazon). These are simply shavers that someone has tried and returned because it didn't suit them. Mine is absolutely like brand new, and arrived in the same sealed packaging as a 'new' one. Obviously the heads and cutters have been replaced, making them perfectly clean and safe.

Yaba-daba-do. I'm a very happy camper (shaving camper, that is)!
