I received this gift for Christmas. I have course,curly and thick ethnic hair. This curling iron worked amazing! It took only 40 minutes (significantly less time than usual to style my hair) to curl my entire head. My hair when it is straightened is about 30-40 inches long. This curling iron got hot enough to curl my hair, I am still amazed. This curling iron was easy to use and I was able to choose between tight and loose curls. I highly recommend this product for all hair types!!! It is well worth the money. I am going to get rid of my other curling irons.

I was skeptical at first, but I absolutely love the curls this bubble wand produces! I have stubborn, hard to hold curls kinda hair, but I curled my hair before bedtime and woke up still with nice curls! I went to work at the hospital and needless to say, it lasted my entire 8 hour shift without hair products/hair spray! Everyone loved it as they never see me with curly hair unless I’m going out LoL The on my thing I don’t care for is the stand for placing it down, as I had to keep flipping it up and down when I was curling my hair. One thing I can recommend is to section your hair and when curling, only curl a small section at a time because if you grab too much hair (I have a lot of hair and thick hair too), then it won’t curl well. Another thing is, I can’t guess how long to hold my hair on the wand before releasing so I’m just guesstimating and pray I’ve held it long enough to get the curl I want. I’m too afraid of holding too long, damaging my hair. I purchased this item bc it was on sale for less than $19, saving me $20, so I figured I’d give it a try. I also purchased a TYMO airflow flat iron/curler (on sale too) at the same time as this purchase and tested both products and since I love both, I’m keeping both! I’d recommend either products or both! Woman can never have enough hair styling products, makeup or skin care products LoL

I just got my first Norelco model 8825 XL, after 7 years using a Braun 4501. I considered these two brands the top in the electrical shaving industry. In some aspects I founded the Norelco reigning over the Braun and in other aspects the Braun is much better. So, the question you should ask yourself is what type of hair are you trying to shave?
Let first look at the Norelco series:
The different between the Norelco's Spectra (8000 series), Quadra (7000 series), Advantage (6000 series), and the Reflex (5000 series) is one major feature added to each series. The Reflex sports the basic "Lift & Cut" system. The Advantage is the same but include a lotion dispenser. The Quadra's "Lift and Cut" system has two types of head with a slot and hole. The Spectra series has what the Quadra does, but include a comfort control. Both the Quadra and Spectra don't have lotion dispenser. There are also more special features that can be found in each series by looking at the 2nd digit. For example the Spectra 8894 have a digital screen where the bare-bone lower number Spectra 8825 have just a green light.
The performances, Norelco vs. Braun:
I have soft hair in the beard area and thicker hair around the lips (mustache and chin area). The Norelco does a superior job in the beard area; it cut it clean with a couple of strokes. When using the Braun (older model 4501), I sometime have to use a long trimmer and then go back over with the coil. The Norelco three individual heads move over the sides of the face a lot better. Braun does do a superior job over the mustache area. It coils has more and bigger holes then Norelco. The Spectra with it dual slot and hole head is good but takes longer time to cut down the thicker stub. The old Braun battery (NH-) is dying on me. Norelco battery (NiCd) is replaceable and you use it charged or just plug and play, which the Braun could not do. Overall, I prefer the Norelco's design.
The features I like:
I am still playing with the Personal Comfort Control and am not sure if it is necessary. The more sensitive the level is the long it takes to cut so far. The long hair trimmer is great, but that is almost standard in most models, but not the Advantage's Series. Plug and play is great, since I don't travel every day. Cleaning is simple; just rinse it in the sink. I like the solid construction the Norelco's design is, the rotating machine is fun to use and is very smooth.

This product is very disappointing. Initially I was excited to find a non-peel nail polish that was water based - I'm allergic to harsh chemicals, so traditional nail polish isn't an option. I've used Suncoat peelable nail polish before and liked it a lot because it was completely odor free and did not cause any allergic reaction. It did not last long on my nails, but I figured it was essentially meant for kids, so it's OK it if only lasts for a few hours. I was only wearing it out for dinner, etc. Then I've found out that Suncoat also makes water based polish that is non-peel. I figured I would give it a try. I've read multiple reviews stating that with proper application the product would last a few days on the nails. 2 or 3 days of wear are more than enough for me as I like to change my colors often. Also, I understand that water based polish would never be as durable as the traditional polish, so I was perfectly OK to change it out every couple of days. As soon as the product arrived I applied it as instructed. I did it shortly before bed time so that I wouldn't get my nails wet and allow the polish to cure. By the time I woke up it had already chipped! So, I reapplied and went to work. By the time I got to work it was chipped again! This was embarrassing; I spent good 20 minutes trying to scrap the polish off my nails. Luckily, it came off easily.

What's even more disappointing is that Suncoat customer service does not seem to care about customers. I've contacted them asking if they had any helpful advice and so far received no response.
There is absolutely nothing about this wig that resembles any amount or trace of "human hair". I don't believe that it is a blend, as listed.

The One Million LUCKY is my favorite scent on my husband. He ran out and I missed the smell, so I ordered more. However... One of these things is not like the other. Or rather, one of these things is like both...

The left bottle is a genuine bottle of One Million Lucky, the center bottle is what I just received, and the right bottle is One Million.

The bottle I just received.... Notice the one on the left has the chrome/gold front and clear glass? The one on the right has a gold front and amber glass? Hm. The one in the center has the chrome/gold front.... But amber glass??? It also smells nothing like Lucky. It definitely smells more of the regular One Million.

I have reordered and only HOPE this is an isolated incident and I get the correct thing this next time.
-----
I rec'd the bottle I reordered today, and thankfully everything seems to be legit with it and I can resume sniffing my husband.

had no eyeliner in it at all. Its almost as if they never put it in this pencil to begin with. I am extremely unhappy. This was a gift from someone else so I can't return or replace it. total waste of everyones time and money. at first I thought I just needed a sharpener to reveal the end but I sharpened down almost half an inch and it's still dry like wood shavings.
UPDATE! I had to shave away over half the pencil, there was a hollow space and then I finally accessed some eyeliner. Less than 4 inches of pencil at this point, but at least it's not a total waste. I still do not recommend that anyone buy this pencil.
Reviews are NOT matching this product! Please, remove. Thank you.

I love this product! It comes in a small container so I was kind of bummed at first, but what little product is in here packs a powerful punch. I highly recommend this if you're looking for a clay or mud type of mask to clarify and clear your skin. I suffer from deep cystic acne and broke out earlier this week. I put on this mud mask and I could not believe how great the results were. Within one day my pimples had disappeared and even my damage spots seem to be less noticeable. My skin felt super soft and clear.

I have a pretty sensitive skin but I didn't have any irritation from this whatsoever. The package says to leave the mask on for 10 or 15 to 20 minutes but I noticed that even after 20 minutes, the mask still was not dried so I did leave it on for longer. It is a bit of a drying mask so if you already have dry skin, you will want to use a moisturizer following the mask. I found that when I combined it with my acne medication that contains benzoyl peroxide and salicylic acid, it was just to drying for my skin. Therefore, I would recommend maybe skipping a day of other chemical products when you use this mask.

The mask it goes on really nice and smooth. I used a Q-tip to mix up the mask material as the directions say to stir it each time you're going to use it. Then I just used the Q-tip to apply the mask and I from layer on my face. The mask has a cooling a fact and isn't a dry or itchy at all. It was a very pleasant experience overall. It wasn't messy at all to use either.

I posted some pictures below of the material in the jar as well as when it was on my face. That way, you can see how quickly I put the mask on my face. I hope the photos are helpful.

Again, I recognize that this is a smaller container than I had previously thought, but you don't need much to cover your entire face. Although I can't say for sure, I am guessing that I would get at least 10 to 15 masks with this product. That is quite a bit considering how much is charged for mud mask facials at spas. Do you make sure that you see all the container tightly and store it in a cool or dark place as it will dry out quickly if you leave it open.

I love this company's products! This is it my first purchase of temporary tattoos from this company and so I am familiar with their brands and products. I would definitely recommend their products if you're looking for high-quality tattoos that are modern and stylish.

These are super easy to put on and tends to stay for several days versus some of the other tattoos on the market. The one I have in the picture below has been on for four days now and it still looks just like the day I applied at.

I love all of the different packs of variety so that you can get a pack of that suits your style and needs. I would definitely recommend these. Application is really simple. You pick the tattoo you want and place it in side down on your skin wherever you would like it to be. Just make sure it is straight and where you want it before you apply the wet paper towel. You just take a wet paper towel and place it over the paper side of the tattoo. The other side you adhere to your skin. Then hold it there for 30 seconds, and when you left it off, the tattoo stays on your skin and the paper peels away. Then, just let it dry.

Love these! I highly recommend them. Happy shopping

I LOVE these!! I have recently gotten into dyeing my hair crazy unicorn colors and I've gotten sick of ruining my really expensive hair clips with all of the permanent dyes. So I decided to invest in this 6-piece set of clips since I've seen my hair stylist use these when she is separating my hair into different pieces.

Anyway, I have really long and thick hair. So when I'm dyeing my hair, which I do at home, I really need to section the hair pieces off to make sure I get all of the strands saturated with color. Otherwise, well, I'm not really into striped hair at the moment and uneven dye jobs that LOOK like I did it myself at home after drinking too much wine ;)

I got the RED color because I have purple hair and wanted the clips to stand out. I do not plan to wear these out of the house--they are only for my styling needs at home. Otherwise, I would recommend getting a darker color because the plastic isn't super nice or stylish looking. I like that these clips open easily and don't have a super strong grip. Some of my clips are way too tight and I end up pulling my hair out or getting my hair stuck in the coils. I like the more flexible feel of these and that they have more give, so I can move them around. Even though they are flexible, they still hold the hair in place, but just do it less harshly, if that makes sense.

I like the set of 6 because I tend to lose track of my clips and so this way, I will have a nice sized supply and won't always be running around my house searching for clips.

I was able to purchase this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I hope you found my review helpful and that I provided enough detailed information so that you can determine whether or not this product is right for you and your lifestyle needs. I've been wanting to try the glass nail files now for several years. The cost of them was always a deterrent until I found this great 5 piece value set.

I was so excited to get them and try them out. I was so tired of buying nail files over and over again only to have them break or bend in my purse or just wear out after a month or two. I wanted to invest in something that would last a little bit longer even if it was more than the usual dollar store Emery boards I've become so frustrated with. It seems the cheap files I had been buying were constantly had to replace them.

The nail files were shipped to me promptly and they are not only extremely functional, but beautiful. I ordered the rainbow set of 5 and they're soooo pretty. My favorite is the emerald green one, which is so much more vibrant than it appears in the stock photo and In my crappy phone photo. I love them. The set comes with a hard case to store them in. And the 5 files in their cases come in a larger zipped pouch! they are the perfect size to throw in a purse, keep in my desk at work, stow in the console of my car, and store in my makeup bag while still having one extra in my medicine cabinet at home. When you consider how much I spend on files for my nails and feet on a monthly basis, and I should never have to replace these --- they come with a lifetime guarantee. That is just crazy to me. I will be buying these for gifts for sure. I can’t wait to tell everyone about them.

I rely heavily on reviews before I make a purchase so I realize how important they are. Hopefully, you have found this review helpful. Thanks and happy shopping!

I'm puzzled by this product. I loved the idea of having a natural, non-toxic nail polish remover. I paint my own nails quite often, skipping the nail salon to save money and time. I've been giving myself manicures and pedicures since 6th grade, so I'm pretty good at it (if I do say so myself) and am well-versed in many of the products out there. I typically use a 100% acetone remover, which is AWESOME, but I hate that there are so many harmful chemicals, not only on my nails, but also in the fumes I'm breathing in every time I use it. So, when I saw this product, I was excited and motivated to try it and like it.

When it arrived, I was also pleased with the size. I had assumed it would be pretty small because of the way the dropper looks next to it in the picture, but it's actually a good sized bottle. Before using any product, I read the directions and particularly with a new type of product like this non-toxic, all-natural nail polish remover. That's when I saw that you have to leave the product on the nail for 2-5 minutes. I don't understand this because once you use the dropper to apply the product to the nail polish that's on the nail, it immediately starts dripping down the sides of the nails onto your hands and makes a bit of a mess. It's also pretty inconvenient to sit there for 5 minutes when I could use my regular nail polish remover and would have clean nails in 30 seconds to a minute. I decided instead to try pouring the product into a shallow bowl and soaking my nails in it instead. This did make it much easier and created less of a mess, but it also requires you to use a lot more of the product than you would just using the dropper.

I waited 2 minutes and took a cotton ball to swipe the nail to see if the polish would come off. It started to, but just the top layer. I re-soaked them in the product for 3 more minutes, and I was able to remove the polish from my nails. I should also mention that I use Orly bonding base coat, which helps the polish adhere to the nail. I also had 3 coats of polish, and a top coat, so that might be why the polish was so stubborn to come off. Plus, it was a deep red, which is difficult to remove no matter what you are using, and it usually dyes my nail beds a bit when I'm removing the polish anyway. As a positive, I did notice that this product was MUCH less harmful on my nails. My acetone remover immediately dries out my nails and strips all the healthy oils from the nails and nail beds. This did not do that. My nails had a nice, healthy shine to them and the nail beds retained their moisture, which is nice.

So, in summary, I love that this product is natural and non-toxic, but it's just not practical for me to spend 5 minutes soaking my nails to wait for the polish to come off. However, if you are super green and more willing to commit to being patient in order to be able to use something that has no chemicals and is good for your body and those around you (which I commend you for!), then this is a great substitute for chemical nail polish removers.
'Meh', compared to their volume lashes...
For some reason this just leaves my face patchy, my old 805rx worked better, maybe the new SpeedXL is better.

I got this it worked great just trying it out on One Nail that day but a few days later when I went to do my nails it didn't turn on and since then it hasn't turned on I'm sitting here right now dealing with it and still nothing and I go back and read reviews and wish that I had read a little further down the list because everyone is saying the same thing that happened to me this sucks because I actually thought it was a great e-file I really wish I could get my money back it says it was accepted but I haven't gotten any money back so I'm cool it's been a while now but it's unfortunate because I truly broke I might as well stay right after the first time I used it and I didn't use it for my whole hand at that so this is sad some taking these people's money including mine or lower that price and make it be a disposable $2

I have very sensitive facial skin and cannot tolerate perfumed face products. This cream has a scent to it and made my face itch. I will use it as general moisturizer--just not on my face.
It is fairly thin cream and spreads easily. At first I thought it was leaving a greasy trail but this disappeared as the cream was absorbed. A bit pricey for the amount you get.

I tried the Lavanda. It is way too strong. It's suggested to spray it on clothes, on the body and perhaps even in air.
The spray is ejected in a tiny amount. I thought to myself it was too tiny an amount until I smelt it. It has all the good labels, no cruelty to animals, gluten free (I did pan on eating it!), etc etc. With just a small amount on my wrist, the smell was overpowering. I thought it might wear off but I ended up washing it off. It was just too strong. Smelled chemically to me--not a bit like flowers. Can't imagine putting this on a baby or baby clothing.

I have a number of pink ombre wigs. This one is Ok but not my favourite. The top section is mostly dark but it looks more chocolate brown than black (I like black). I like the length of this. The pink sections are very nice and I like the chade of pink. Not salmon but not dusty pink either. The hair has a nice wave to it--nothing too extreme. It's soft but doesn't have that static thing that some wigs have that causes the hair to stick to your arms. '
The mocha coloured lace cap is nice and stretchy but it is a tad big for my head. It does have adjustable straps inside. The biggest issue I had with this is the shape of the head section. It's rather dome shaped. I think the cap is overly wide.

This is a super wig and I'm very happy with it. The stretchy lace cap inside is a sort of cafe-au lait colour which matches the wig. The wig looks a slightly different colour than it does on MY screen but that can't be helped at times. IMO the green is prettier. In person it looks like a pale Jade. Plus the colour is not uniform as there are lighter hairs too so the overall effect is FAB. The bangs are great. Had to trim just a bit (as expected) and they help with the hairline.

Of the three wigs here, the purple is the best. I would give that wig 5 stars. The colour is fantastic; it's not the same purple all over; it's got different shades and the hairline is fantastic.
The black wig is bad. I'd give that 2 stars. It's super shiny but the worst thing is that there is NO way I can hide my hairline unless I pull the wig farther down on my forehead. It's also not cut that well, but that's possible to fix. The hairline issue is not fixable.
The grey wig---I love that one too. My second favourite. It's got those great dark roots. It is very long so tangling may be an issue depending on use. But it looks great, fits well etc. So.. 2 out of 3 ain't bad.
Overall a great deal as long as I accept that one wig is fairly useless for me.

The best thing about this wig is the colours: fantastic fantasy cosplay colours: it's just beautiful. The 'hair' is soft and not too shiny. Too shiny would really spoil this IMO.
The hair is REALLY full, so it's going to either look The Shining scary, or else, you are going to need a crown or something to keep the hair off your face. You can also style it off your face too.
The hair is cut in a long shag style, with some bits in the back much shorter. This gives it the full look. The hairline section is the wig's weak point and it looks fake--well it looks fake anyway with the colours, but it's hard to make the wig look GOOD. Again back to styling, crown, or some type of headband to smooth over the hairline section.

My head measures about 22 1/2 around. On me the wig seemed to be on the small side. The hair is obviously fake as it is meant to be so so problem there, and it's a nice quality nylon or nylon type material. I love the colours.
It comes with a hair net, 2 wig caps, a pearl-type clip and a pair of druzy post earrings. The latter were a surprise and a pleasant one.
I had a hard time getting the wig to cover the very front section of my hair. I think anyone who has masses of hair, or really long hair may find this wig doesn't cover easily.
The hair hangs awkwardly. It falls forward into the face. I trimmed it a bit.
IMO this is a great wig for costuming and/or teens, but those with masses of long hair may find it problematic.

I just recently started using purple shampoo. I have grey hair, btw. I liked the results I had with another brand so was eager to try this brand. First, at least at the time of this review, the price is decent.
The purple shampoo is a deep violet. I applied it to my wet hair and worked it in. Loved the purple lather. Then applied the conditioner which is more of a deep inky blue. The instructions said to leave it in for a few minutes. When I wash it out, my hair feels differently--it feels as though there's still something there on my hair, but deeply mixed in. It feels differently than when I use regular shampoo.
Anyway, I love what this does for my hair. It seems to brighten the light silver and darken the darker grey. At least that's what it seems like. No frizzies either and that's important for me.
I used Great Clips brand before trying this, and while I really liked what Great Clips Purple shampoo did for my hair, I prefer this brand. Anyway, I'm sold. I like the tones and depths the purple shampoo gives my hair.

This is a very pale mud mask. It spreads really easily. It's not as 'mud' looking as most of the other ones I've tried. Makes you look like a ghost appearance wise or someone who is very pale.
I left this one for about an hr. It never cracked, but it was there as a very light mask. Easy to wash off. My skin felt very soft afterwards. I was surprised really as I had left it on for so long I'd almost forgotten about it.
I feel that the mud mask did have a restorative effect to my skin. It also has a very subtle (and I mean subtle) flower scent. I liked the scent but was happy that it wasn't too strong as I have extremely sensitive facial skin and perfumed skin products make me itch.
My skin still feels softer 24 hrs later.

I wasn't sure what to expect from this product, but it is really fun. Who thought that pink eyelashes would look great?
I am not a make up expert and I don't think I am that good at it either, so I have no problem admitting that MY end result did not look like the pictures. And I will also admit that this may be my fault.
The pictures show eyelashes that look solidly pink (or whatever colour you buy); mine did not come out like that. The brush tends to carry a lot of mascara so I got some clumping.
My eyelashes, which are black, ended up pinkish over the black near the base but with pink tips and I actually think it looks better than the professional pics. The only way I could get solid pink eyelashes ended up with too much clumping. So it was possible to get solid pink eyelashes and I did, but then I had to gently wipe off all the excess mascara and that left me with pink tips.
Honestly, I liked it that way, I think it looks more subtle and not so obvious. The pink mascara goes great with mauve or nude eyeshadow IMO.
This needed a couple of minutes to dry but after that it didn't smudge. And it really does lengthen and thicken lashes. I'm happy with the look and like it more than the professional photos on site.

If you look at the ingredients listed, there are a lot of oils: coconut oil, Jojoba oil, Clary Sage essential oil, organic Ylang Ylang essential oil, neroli essential oil, geranium essenatil oil, sunflower seed oil, lavender oil, rose absolute, Jasmine absolute and a vitamin E oil blend. I think I got them all.
The name of this item says 'cream.' It is an oil. It is far too greasy for my face. I used it on my arms and legs and liked it but as you can expect, it leaves an oily shine. It had a woodsy type scent not too strong. If you are expecting 'cream' this is not it. Oil, yes.

The box is the best thing here. I had high hopes for the mascara. It's string, so it doesn't go on easily. It clumps. And I also found it very difficult to remove, Of course it is waterproof and that feature works. It took many swipes with oil to start to break this up and off the lashes.

I have very sensitive facial skin so I have to be careful with any products. This did not irritate my skin. I would say that it is a very mild facial scrub. It didn't take much to use on my face, but it didn't feel as though it did a while lot either. Pleasant enough but I wouldn't be tempted to buy it.

I liked this clay mask a lot. The mask cream is very thick indeed, and it takes a squeeze to get it out of the tube. It goes a long way, but at the same time, this is a small tube (3 oz). It dries quickly. And it's the type of mask that makes your face feel TIGHT. The type where you can't smile.
After about 20 mins, I washed this off. It was easy to remove. After using a few times, I think it does indeed have a brightening effect on the skin. It doesn't moisturize. At least it didn't for me, and I had to lather on cream afterwards as my skin felt a bit dry after the mask.
Overall I liked this. I like how it worked but it is on the pricey side.

What's that saying about necessity being the mother of invention? Well here we are in a pandemic wearing face masks. Someone came up with the idea of a head band with buttons to hold the mask mask in place.

This is a thin material. Think very thin t shirt type material. The headband measures about 18 inches and just over 3 inches wide. I like the material for a headband. However, its use as a mask holder is iffy. Many people complain that the elastic that holds the masks in place makes their ears pop out. That is definitely true of some masks. They can also be wearying on the ears, having that elastic against your ears all day, so this headband is a great concept.
I put the headband on and as I stretched it over my head, I heard a pop, so some stitching gave somewhere.

I attached two types of masks, one at a time. First, it was a bit fiddly to get the elastic over the button. Once it just sprang off.

One mask using the buttons fit well. Another did not. The latter mask opened up on the sides.

I would hesitate to wear this out thinking that everything would stay put for hours. I like the headband as a headband. It's nice material. A sort of light grey merle, but if you are looking at this for long-term safety, I would say no.

I purchased this bag to keep my art journaling supplies together and handy (pens, markers, scissors, washi tape, journals, watercolors, etc.) when we travel. It is the perfect size and interior layout for this purpose, and it is a very nice looking bag, too. It is described as being made of ‘PU leather’ and did not investigate any further.  But when I opened the package, I was surprised by the shiny soft and slick surface, and it has me a bit concerned. Normal cowhide leather will naturally scuff over time, especially with travel and frequent use, but I am not sure yet whether this material will scratch or perhaps even tear after a while, or worse: start to get that sticky feel to it as the material’s composition breaks down. It feels more like soft plastic than leather, and it does not smell bad. Overall I am pleased with the design and features of this bag and plan to keep it. I will update my review again after a few months of use.

I’ve had numerous extensions in my life. I bought these as a cheaper alternative to the Bellami volumizing weft, which is expensive (definitely an investment). I have fine hair but a lot of it. The problem I have with many extension companies is blending the extensions with my own hair, since most of them are so thin my hair peaks through. I also have shoulder length hair, which adds another level of difficulty when trying to blend extensions.

Pros
• The hair is soft
• The hair doesn’t tangle easily
• The color is nice
• The clips are amazing. Once I clip them in they stay.
• They are convenient. One weft and you’re done (usually)
• They are cheap, and a good quality for the price
• Good starting off extensions

Cons
• The hair is thin; it is heavier on top and thins out to a v-point. As expected my hair peaked though. I ended up tying up my bottom layer and putting the extensions on top. It solved the problem of the hair poking though.
• For these extensions to work for me I would need to buy at least two more packs of hair. Having 3, five clip wefts wouldn’t fit around my head comfortably.
• These will not give you volume; they are too thin to give you any thickness
• If you have a lot of hair these will not look very natural

This hair is best suited for someone with thin, medium length hair who is looking for some length. Also, if you have layers in your hair it could help blend the hair. I got my own hair thinned out a little at the hair salon and it made a huge difference.

This hair will not work well with short hair or thick hair unless you are willing to work hard to blend it.

I will be buying one more weft in order to see how that works out for me. I will update this post once I receive my new weft.

My experience wearing 2- five clip wefts

I have bought several makeup brushes sets in the past and this one by far was the worst. The bag had a very strong smell of chemicals and plastic which made me think the brushes were not even safe to use. I returned this item.

The brushes did look good but I wouldn't use them. I tried to leave them opened for a couple of days and the odor was very strong still. I wouldn't recommend this product. I always think that having a good set of brushes is a must and tried to buy this set to try but was highly disappointed.

I received this item with a discount for my honest review.
Great color since I went grey!! Love it!

Wow...seriously disappointed with this product!!! The brush is too wide and the polish is too thin! I have never written a nail polish review before...just return what I don't like, but I am really disappointed because this product has Salma Hayek's name in it. I had expected to find a beauty product with a celebrities' name on it...one known for her appearance, would be a pretty good product. I didn't expect t to be the best polish I ever owned, but I never thought I'd be complaining about it!!! I now have 2 dried coats on and the color is still not consistent from one part of my nail to another! Very disappointed. And another one bites the dust!

I really like the idea of a portable water pik. When I travel I have to pack up my standard water flosser and it's kinda bulky and doesn't travel well. So having a single integrated unit is appealing.

However, the implementation is a bit weak. For starters the tank is either glued or heat welded along its entire perimeter and it will, I'm sure, be a weak spot that eventually leaks. As you use it, since it's all one piece, it's really hard to hold on to and the water runs directly down from my mouth on to the unit, making it even more slippery. Maybe the pik head should be angled to allow for the water not to run down on it.

If you're someone who travels a lot and you need to have a water flosser with you I think this is worth a try. With some practice it might become less awkward to use over time.

I am very impressed with this razor. I have used electric razors most of my 35+ years of shaving. I was skeptical using it for the first time, I thought it wasn't working because it is so soft to the face and so quiet. It didn't sound "agressive" like my other razors did. WRONG!!! The shave was close, my skin was not irritated at all, and it cut smooth basically in the first pass. This unit is first class.

My previous razor was a Braun foil. I bought one for myself and another for my son from Frys because of the price. JUNK!!! We both have heavy beards, he more so than I, and both of us had terrible 5 o'clock shadows by 10:00AM! And the skin irritation on my neck, just horrible.

I took a long time comparing all the available models. For me this model provides the best mix of features and price. I definitely recommend the Speed-XL shaving heads. Other nice features are it can be cleaned under the faucet, it charges quickly and maintains that charge for a long time, and it provides what I consider one of the best shaves I've had in a long time. The heft and feel is good. Materials are good. Workmanship is good. The only feature I'd like to have is a battery charge indicator.

The other Speed-XL model is the 8160. It includes the cleaning system with a much higher price. Now there is the SmartTouch-XL which may be overkill. But if price is not an issue...

May, 2012 - I can't believe I wrote the original review almost seven years ago. I'm still using this razor and it still works just as I expressed back then. The battery still keeps a great charge, and the shave is still excellant. I went on a 10 day vacation last year and the charge held for the whole trip. This is truly a great product.

WOW!! When I first recieved this I was really intimidated. Its HUGE! I was worried about even being able to use it. But I'm always up for a challenge.
First let me say I have fine but thick hair and shoulder length. Normally I use a blow dryer and a circular brush to give myself some volume.
This unit comes with 2 brushes, one for shorter hair,one for longer. The brushes have nice soft bristles that won't rip at your hair. So if you do get a tangle it slides right out. I used the shorter brush myself.
At first it was difficult for me to use because of a bad shoulder. The size was an issue for me. But with a little practice I got the hang of it. Realizing that it actually takes the place of 2 tools. The blow dryer and circular brush all in one ( still old school I guess 🙃) And in the long run I found it easier on my bad shoulder because I had to use only one tool instead of two! 💃
I also takes some real practice to use the rolling feature. If there was anything I would change, that would be it. There is one for this. And it's very easy to accidentally go the wrong way (😜 believe me not a good look)
Once I figured out to just roll it enough to get the hair on and let go of the button, hold it for a moment while the dryer works then pull it through. And WOW it gives you such volume that lasts all day. Leaves your soft and silky too. I'm so impressed!
I immediately made the room for this new tool in my bathroom.
I would highly recommend it. It's a little intimidating.. So worth the challenge tho!
I stepped out of my comfort zone and tried it... You should too! Sometimes new products are a real improvement on the old standbys.👍

If you found this review helpful could you please pop 👆 the button below👇
Happy Shopping😊

This electric manicure kit has everything you need to use for artificial nails 💅. Well except for the products. The drill is strong and you get a total of 11 bits with it. Be mindful that it is elecric and the switch is on the cord, not the drill itself. Which makes it a little difficult to use. I feel this drill set is not for beginners. You need to have the knowledge on how to use it. In picture #2 I have displayed the instructions that were included. Just one small page and not informative at all.
This is a nice package if your already comfortable with applying artificial nails.
But not for beginners.
Leaves a horrible taste in my mouth

I love it!! the shampoo and the conditioner; nevertheless, for me to have a few drops of each of the product, I must take the pomp out in order to get the product and use it. It is too thick. In other words, it is too difficult and annoying to depend on the pomp of both bottles, the conditioner & the shampoo. The texture of the product is too thick and is too difficult to manage it, too hard to get it from the bottle. A jar will be easier for the customer. I'm very happy with the product results. Please Share this tomment with the manufacturers. Thanks ND

I didn't get Plexaderm trough Amazon; nevertheless, I said the results don't last long. On the contrary, even though I have no wrinkles; only tired eyes and poufiness appearance, I noticed that after the product gets dry, the skin gets with some crepe vertical line on that area. I don't recommend it.
5/26/18

I saw the reviews that said it doesn't do anything, but I was hoping it was more subjective and maybe it might work for me. Nope, it really doesn't brush anything.

- Bristles are weak, arrived bent
-Maaaaybe could work if you have super thin hair
- Thin and flimsy feeling if that's a concern

I use "wet" hairbrushes that are designed like this, and I have to say that the quality really varies. I have a couple that I love and work wonderfully--brushes tangled wet hair painlessly, evenly brushes hair to tie it up. I've only tried 4 brands, but this is the worst I've seen. The bristles are weak--they're really thin, even for wet brushes, and they arrived bent (not because it was used--it was in the plastic wrap and everything). I do have thick hair, but this is the first brush I've used (of ANY kind--tiny travel ones included) that feels like it's literally going on top of my hair and not through it at all, even when I try to press down. It maaay work if you have thin hair, but I mean really thin hair, and even them I'm doubtful.

I bought this hoping I could use it as a travel brush, so I wasn't too picky as long as it brushed relatively okay. Obviously not, but the plastic is also lighter and thinner than I expected it to be, again, even for a small travel brush, so I'm doubtful it or the hinge wouldn't break easily with pressure while trying to brush thick or tangly hair.

I don't think this item should be marketed as a "universal diffuser." I tried it with a mid-range Remington, a high end T3, a mid-range Conair, and a low end generic dryer. The only one this diffuser worked with was the Conair. Unless you have a BIO IONIC dryer you run the risk that this item will not fit your dryer.

When I finally found a dryer that worked with this diffuser, the diffuser worked well. This diffuser is very well made compared to the diffusers that come with most dryers. First, it's larger than typical diffusers. Second, it swivels to open and close the air vents. I find that it's best used when my hair is nearly dry to put the finishing touches on. I was a bit skeptical of what a diffuser would offer at this price point, but I think the build quality warrants the price.

Overall, I proceed with caution when ordering this product unless you have the BIO IONIC. If you do own the BIO IONIC, this item is fantastic and I highly recommend it.

I've been using this razor since it arrived, approximately 2 weeks ago, and thinking long and hard about the score I'd give it. I actually intended to give it 4/5, the reason being that, while it's an excellent razor, the price point is rather high. In the end, though, I'm so impressed that I really need to give it a full five stars in spite of the price, with the caveat that you may want to take a look at one of the less expensive, stripped-down models; this one is the flagship, but all the models should be similarly excellent (please bear in mind this is the only one I've used).

And excellent it is. While my feelings have already been summed up in the opening paragraph, read on for similarly styled (but moderate) hyperbole.

I've never gotten such a good shave with an electric razor. Norelco does recommend that you give the razor a full 21 days of your time exclusively (i.e. not shaving with anything else) before making a judgment. I haven't had the luxury of giving it a full 21 days, as I need to get my review in; however, I've already adjusted to it so well that I can't imagine going back to my old razors. It will only get better as I get more used to it, although I'm perfectly satisfied at this point and unsure if it could get any better.

Not only do I use it to shave my face (which is obviously what it was designed for, and it does a great job), I use it to shave my head. It's not going to give you as close a shave as a traditional razor, but it's also not going to scrape against your skin like a traditional razor. You'll also save money on shaving cream (the only extra expense is buying a new razor "head" for it yearly, the price of which I am uninformed of). It works "dry". This is nice for me, as it takes a lot of cream to shave both my face and my scalp, and it does, in fact, do a decent job on my head. It's a little stubbly, even right after shaving, but honestly the only thing that would do a better job would be a blade, and that's a difficult way to shave (I was previously using a Headblade). If it can shave a head, where my hair was very thick, I imagine it would be adequate for even the bushiest of beards, and, again, it's designed for faces, not heads.

If you look at the features list, you'll see that this model is full of bells and whistles. Truthfully, they are mostly extras you could live without; the lower-end models would likely be just fine, so I strongly suggest examining them as a money-saving alternative. The meter that shows you how many minutes of the charge are remaining is sort of handy, the icon that lights to remind you to clean it is somewhat useful, but to say they're necessary would be a grave overstatement. In fact, the "wash me" icon lights up after basically every use, so its necessity is particularly dubious. (As a side note, it's marvelously easy to clean.)

In the end, the product does receive my highest recommendation. I think if you tried it out, you'd be pleased, and even if you had to send it back and didn't like it after three weeks via their guarantee (it does take time for your skin to adjust), there would be little time/money wasted. I would, however, encourage you to check out the lower-end models. Ultimately, even the high price point wasn't enough for me to downgrade to four stars. I'm normally quite critical.

This is a nice mask for the price. I have short hair & can get 2 uses from each packet (you get 10 packs). The softness is better if you also use the Royal Oils shampoo. When I used a different shampoo, the results weren't as good. Next time, I am going to use a cap and maybe even some wet heat to see if that helps. I think the issue is that my hair doesn't love coconut oil which is one of the ingredients - even though it's the 6th of 11 ingredients.

The packs are pretty hefty and I think that I could stretch the use more by adding more water to my hair beforehand. But to be honest, I think that the R.O. conditioner works better than this mask!

Love the R.O. line and I think this will work well if I use heat or leave it on longer than 5 minutes. Keep in mind that I have REALLY dry 4C hair... I have almost the entire R.O. line and love all of them but this is my least favorite of the set & I won't buy any more of the mask.

3.9 stars

1. This is MUCH darker than expected (tho I happen to like it). One coat will give you a purple look but more than that, this gets dark enough to look purple-black.
2. This dries super fast - which is a big deal to me - and that's nice until you start getting to the end of the jar. Once this gets down to the last part of the jar and begins to get tackier, it's hard to get a smooth coat on. Adding any kind of thinner makes the polish effect dull and ugly.
3. This is kind of a small jar or the price.
4. This looks really nice and smooth when the bottle is new but the polish chips easily with more than 1 coat.

Overall, this is a good polish if you want something of a darker color, but it doesn't last very long.

I don't know what it means that I want to buy some more of this color - even though I think the price is too high.

Finally tried this after using a much pricier whitening toothpaste. This works as good (or better) and I can actually afford it. The other paste (well-known brand, starts with "R" lol) was good, but the price was too high and I stopped using it because of that. The other day, I found this in a two-pack at such a good price that I decided to give it a try. Guess what? I could see really good results after about the 3rd time using it. That's just as good as the other expensive brand. The taste of this one is nice and mild - which is a Plus because I don't like overpowering flavors. I can't believe it took me this long to try this one. I could've been saving so much money all this time...

This has the very, very *very* faintest plant-like scent (which is clean and pleasing). It's also thicker than I expected - almost like a whipped lotion. Before I used it on my hair, I rubbed some into the back of my hand to see if I'd have any kind of skin reaction. I did not. What I noticed is that once this absorbed, there was absolutely zero residue. I don't know what that means, but I was just curious. When I rub in other types of hair masks & treatments, I always get a sense of something left that I need to wash off. When I used this on my hair in the shower, I left it on for about
2 to 3 minutes after I had massaged it in according to the directions. (I have to stop and mention that I was also using the Daelong shampoo and conditioner set beforehand. That might be why I got my results.) This rinses out extremely well. My hair felt conditioned but with a lot less of the residual slip from other conditioners. That kind of worried me. I like to know that a treatment is doing something & the only way to tell until you've used it for a while is by the way your hair feels. Where I became so happy with this is an hour after rinsing it out. I have coarse and "nappy" natural African American hair. My hair tends to be extremely dry - especially after washing. A good conditioner keeps things in check until I can apply my leave-in products (oils, butters, sprays, etc.), but this time, my hair stayed soft and easy to comb through for at least 2 hours. It might have been longer, but I went ahead and applied my usual leave-ins. Still, I know that this did soften my hair (the day after, my hair is retaining softness without any more leave-in applications) without making it feel fragile. With they type of hair I have, I have to worry about breakage. I realize that I have probably been clogging up my scalp by over-doing it with the oils and butters. I like that I haven't had to use more of them for my hair to feel manageable. As a test, I'm going to try easing up on using so much leave-in stuff while I continue to use this.I think these guys are on to something here. I will have to come back and update this review as I use this for a while but, for now, I love the way this makes my hair feel, even after just one treatment. Normally, I only fully wash my hair once every four weeks or so. I will do a co-wash about every other week to keep it clean without stripping it. While I am testing this out, I plan to use it at least once a week as my co-wash. Like I said, I am also using the shampoo & conditioner of this brand. That might be a big part of why this worked so well for me, but I think that this would work just as good on its own. By the way, I'm going to alter my washing regimen for a while to use the shampoo and conditioner at least every other week. I almost forgot to mention the other thing I was concerned about: the label says that this makes the hair "straight and silky" - which is exactly what I, personally, DO NOT want. I love my texture and want to keep it. My texture is the kind that is prone to slow growth (because of breakage) so... I'm not worried about losing my naps. I'm thinking that this aids in stopping breakage more than anything.
I got this at a very steep discount.

This works and works well. The reason I can't give it a full  5-star review is because of the price. There is a very similar product that is way cheaper and works as well or better than this one. I found Sole Magic online for about a dollar cheaper than this one. In superstores and drug stores, I found it for a couple of bucks. This one does work and I can't say one negative thing about it - other than the price. When a pedicure is around $20 (even here in Alaska where prices are high), and I can do upkeep with a similar foot smoothing pad for about $2, I just can't see paying almost $9 for this one. If other customers do want this one, I can tell you that it works, the shape is nice and makes it easy to grip and use with either hand. It's also nice that their is a coarse side and a finer side. One thing that I disagree with is that you could use this anywhere but on your feet. I don't know what would have to be going on with anyone's elbows or knees for them to use this on! All in all, a great product, but a bit overpriced when there are cheaper alternative items that are just as effective.

Love, love, LOVE this moisturizer. I love it so much that I may have replaced my Avon Anew. This one costs quite a bit, but the tiny travel sized tube will last a while. This is a VERY watery product, but that's great for 2 reasons: 1) a little bit goes a long way, and 2) it absorbs really well into the skin. The best way that I have found to apply this is to tap the lotion onto my fingertips, then just sort of dab it onto my face before rubbing it in. This saves on product and keeps me from spilling any from the tube. Like I said, this has a very "wet" texture, so you won't have to use much. The price is way up there but, compared to using a lot of a cheaper product (that doesn't work as well), or a same-priced product (but using more of it), this is the best value overall. I'm going to see how long the travel-sized tube lasts while I save up for a larger size. Since this is something I have to save for, I really wish there were more size/price choices. Still, I love this and I think my skin is getting addicted to it!

I like the smell and it is oily, first I feel a. Little bit annoy for oil but when I wake up next morning my skin is very moisture,I like it so much , I am going to buy again after I finished this one

I own a Galaxy S6 Edge Plus... AND an iPhone 6 (Work Phone), AND a Galaxy Tab4 10.1, AND a New Trent Battery 12,000 mAh Pack. With that said, each one of these devices is using it's own charger and because of that, I had to resort using a power strip by my bedside JUST to charge all my devices.

The current chargers I use are all stock (1 Apple Charger, 3 Samsung Chargers). One of the Samsung Chargers is directly from the S6 Edge Plus (supports Adaptive Fast Charging/Quick Charge 2.0), yet it fails to work 80% of the time on my S6 Edge Plus for whatever reason...

Another issue is when I go away for overnight trips somewhere. For a day, I could probably just get by with just the iPhone charger & Samsung charger, but when I have 3-4 night stays due to work, I have to pack all of them!!! It's just a big hassle. That's when I decided I'm just going to resort to buying a GOOD multi-port charger. I've used Ankur devices in the past and I've been very pleased with all of them. After reading various reviews, I decided the 3-port is perfect for my situation.

For $25, you get a 3-port charger: 2 PowerIQ ports and 1 Quick Charge 2.0 port (which the Edge+ takes advantage of).

I've used the Ankur PowerIQ tech before via an Ankur Car Charger and I can definitely say it's almost as good as the Quick Charge 2.0 technology. What I like about it is that it supposedly "detects" what kind of device is connected to it and charges accordingly. Whether this is true or snake oil, I can say that it charges my devices fast and never has any kind of power dip when you have multiple devices connected to it. I use these two ports for my iPhone, Galaxy Tab4 and New Trent Battery pack.

The single Quick Charge is dedicated to my Galaxy S6 phone and right out of the box (same cables and all), it would fast charge my phone 100% of the time. Unlike my old stock Quick Charge Charger, it never seemed to work. So when I'm charging my phone and seeing it will fully charge within an hour makes me happy!

The only initial turnoff is the $25 sticker price. Yes you get a multi-port charger, but I think maybe that sticker price will scare some people. But after experiencing and using this product, I think that $25 is DEFINITELY WORTH IT. Never have a poor quality/flaky charger again. I'm 100% pleased with this item!
Its good product, but it's half the price if you buy from Sephora.

I have been using the oil-free eye makeup remover for several years, so I thought I would try this. I don't recommend it. It did a good job of dissolving mascara, but really just smeared it around. I had to use several pumps of oil to get the mascara dissolved, but then could not get it to rinse off. I tried using a cotton pad, but still had mascara residue around my eyes. My eyes were irritated and blurry (that stuff hurts when it gets in the eyes) after using this, even when I rinsed with water. I ended up using an additional product to get all the mascara off. The instructions on the bottle make it sound like you can just pump, massage, and rinse off your makeup. That is not the case at all. I love Neutrogena products, but can't recommend this one. I will return it and go back to their oil-free eye makeup remover.
DON'T CARE FOR THE SENT, BUT A GREAT BUY.

My hair has already improved. I've used this like e times and am pleased. The shampoo is thin and you have to use quite a lot but well worth it. The conditioner is great. I had the yellow in my gray but no longer. Great product. I will be reordering.
Smudge proof not waterproof. Color of Brown is light brown. Definitely junk.
After curing It for longer than the recommended time it’s still didn’t dry chipping in peeling hours later

I Liked this product, those that did not like it, probably didnt use it correctly. I received this bar as a gift from a student. So I am not a verified buyer, as it was gifted.

If one read directions and you don’t apply it like regular shampoo, it must be applied at the scalp directly first then run down the strands, this is probably why some people complain about greasy hair, they probably didnt part their hair and apply at scalp.

My Tip for using this product, is to be sure you apply at scalp. I applied before getting in the shower at the mirror, to save water, and parted my hair at finger width intervals, wetting the bar as I went, rubbing it my scalp, before showering, took less than 10 minutes, then once in shower I wet my hair a little bit, and it really lathered up.

When I rinsed my hair, I could tell it was clean, felt different from bottle shampoo. You could feel the clean. It felt lighter than usual too..

I would give it 5 stars, but I dont like the peppermint scent, but then I don’t like food scents in my toiletry products. The bar is also really slippery and hard to handle when wet. I was thinking Shampoo bars need a gripper, I might invent one if no one has beat me to it.

function - same as any clay mask
Smell - DISGUSTING ! and the smell stays with you all night .
Even if your face looks good no one will want to get near you !

The clear skin is likely a result of scrubbing to get this smell and dirt off your face !
Terribly slow air velocity.  Heat works well but without airspeed it's a piece of junk for me.  Will return ASAP.

I bought this because I wanted to use hemp oil soap. Hemp oil is like the fourth ingredient. You fail to mention that the main ingredient is soybean oil in the product description its all hemp hemp hemp. I thought I was buying pure hemp soap not soybean oil with a touch of hemp...

As other reviewers have noted, this face cream looks more like a yellow face gravy. While the texture is a bit off putting, the worst part is the fragrance. Very reminiscent of old lady cosmetics I remember from childhood, and that was a long time ago! BUT i decided to give the product a try and it did give my skin a lovely glow. And my combination skin felt moisturized all day, which was impressive given I'm living through a Michigan winter which is equal parts cold and dry. The fragrance doesn't seem to linger . . . it's just a little perfumey the first few minutes after application. I like this product enough to keep using it but I probably wouldn't purchase it again, especially at the current price.

Small and oddly shaped. There's no curve to the comb so it doesn't lay properly against my head. The bronze color might be ok for some hair colors but it blends in with my light brown hair making it almost impossible to see. Definitely not worth the price.
So I’m not sure if you need special polish for this or what but it did not work with my gel polish. Really disappointed. Was excited for these!
YOU NEED THIS PRIMER!! this is the most blurring primer ever! The set is fantastic I use it often!
didn't do anything for me, brush felt pretty dry to me like I wasn't even putting anything on. also recommends putting it on day and night
colors are alright. color payoff is decent. I feel like this powder doesn't stay on as well as my others. they're not my go to's.
Pretty color, nice formula. Stains the lips nicely too! Smooth texture!
these are curled the wrong way and super short imm not sure who they're supposed to be for but they didn't even work for my 4 year old.
Awful brushes. If u want them to do actual makeup I don’t recommend these. The bristles were literally flaming off in chunks. They’re so top heavy they’d be hard to work with.
Don’t buy these. They break all the time. They’re stuck together in the package, they’re just cheap.

Ok so first of all I’m really impressed with the color match like it’s spot on with my hair!! I love it! It feels like my real hair as well! Super awesome! Now what I was disappointed in was that when I tried to curl it on a low heat setting it wouldn’t curl. So I turned up my wand, and when I turned up the heat it melted the hair to my wand :(  but I caught it quickly and it was a small piece so the extensions weren’t harmed too badly. I’m going to try washing, air drying and the. Curling and see if it helps.

Ok so I know this is probably supposed to something like the dyson, I’ve never tried that so I can’t compare it. But here’s what I think... ITS HEAVY AF! Compared to my revlon hair dryer it’s half the size and twice the weight! Not a fan of that. I have curly hair and I was super interested in the using his to diffuse my hair. It took FOREVER on the highest heat setting compared to my regular drier. Like twice as long literally. Now I will say that my hair did seem to be SLIGHTLY less frizzy then when I normally dIffuse it. Is it worth it 🤷🏻‍♀️ I honestly see myself going back to my revlon. But we’ll see.

The product itself is beautiful give a really nice bronze glow, but this packaging is awful! I hate it. It’s so hard to get the container to twist open. Pain in the butt. Should’ve been a flip top for sure.
So handy to use while applying my makeup instead of tying my hair back in a pony tail! I love them! Super soft and comfy too. Comes with all the colors as well.

Item came half opened but it does the job. There is quite a bit of remover in the bottle. Almost too much I’d say. But like I said it does the job it’s intended to do and it’s a larger size container which is nice.

This lamp is ok, it’s a tad smaller than I would like. And when you put your hand in you have to have to have your hand in just the right spot for the light to come on. I do my own poly gel and gel nail polish and about half way through I was so flustered by this lamp I got out my old one. It comes with gloves and says it was to come with nail files but I didn’t receive them. Overall this is just ok for a beginner it’s probably fine but for someone more experienced I’d say pass.

The colors aren’t really at all what they look like in the pictures. Maybe the two middle pinks but that’s it. My daughter likes them so it’s ok I guess but we were looking forward to the sparkly purples. The top and base coat however seem to be holding up well. And since the top and base coat are 8$ it’s really not a bad deal to pay the extra 2$ for the 4 polishes! That’s basically why I did it.

I tried this on thick curly 3c hair. The results were quite decent. You first wash your hair with the pre-treatment shampoo to clarify the hair and remove dirt and oils. At this point, make sure to detangle the hair well and section it into smaller parts so that you can apply the keratin treatment. The hair should be 80% towel dried. You then comb in the keratin treatment to each section of hair. I recommend wearing gloves. Allow it time to process and then blow dry and finish with a flat iron. The hair came out quite silky and smooth, but it began to revert into fluffiness as the day went on. Adding a bit of hair oil helped to restrain the humidity. For an at home kit, it is decent, but it is not as strong as salon treatments.

Was I given the wrong product? This wig looks awful. The lace is terrible and highly visible because for some reason they sewed two different types of lace together at the front of the wig. This is the worst wig I have ever seen. It is completely unwearable. The hair quality is good and I will be taking this wig apart to save the hair. This wig was constructed wrong and is overpriced. I do not recommend this product.

These are ok for a quick wash when you are in a hurry traveling or something, but it seems too small and inadequate for regular use. It broke apart while I was using it. I felt like I was better off just using a regular wash cloth and soap.
Nice texture. Easy to install. Beautiful hair overall.
These combs are very pretty, but they are not practical for hair combing. These combs were very sharp and ruff against my hair. It didn't feel good at all and I won't be using them again.

This acrylic makeup organizer by MelodySusie is part of my ongoing effort to get myself more organized. Until recently my makeup was an absolutely disaster. I finally got sick of that and decided something needed to be done, so after gathering everything up (and culling a huge amount that I just do not use any more) I started sorting and putting things into this organizer. With several drawers and compartments it was easy to arrange everything in a compact space so I could still see everything. I also really liked the flexibility that this organizer offers. I currently have the dividers in place in the bottom drawer since I am using it to keep my most often worn pairs of earrings easily accessible, but if I were to ever get more makeup I could remove the dividers and use the drawer as it, and setthe divider on the counter on its own to hold additional items.

The organizer itself seems to be well made - nice and sturdy with parts that fit together well and are well finished so there are no rough jagged edges. The included drawer liners are a nice touch and they help to keep things from rolling or rattling around each time I open and close a drawer. I like that the top section is a separate unit that can be removed as this makes cleaning much easier. I wear powdered foundation (that famous brand that you swirl and tap) and particles of it seem to get into everything. With a removable top tray, when it needs a deep cleaning I can just remove all my makeup from it and rinse it under the faucet without messing up the items that are in the drawers. That's not possible to do with an all in one unit where the top tray is attached to the base drawers.

All in all, I am very happy wih this organizer. It works very well for my makeup, though I can also see it working well for other uses. As an artist I can see it working very well in my studio to organize art supplies as well.

I did receive this item at no cost for the purposes of testing and review. All opinions are based on my personal experiences using the item.

This is an interesting way to market a Konjac Sponge, i.e. for your pets. I have to say though, it's pretty brilliant. I've only worked on my white chihuahua-blend's tear stains once with the All About Health Network Charcoal konjac sponge, but it did seem like it lightened his tear stains a bit. They're pretty significant now since he doesn't like his face washed. What was most important to me is that he actually seemed to like me cleaning his face with the sponge. It's very soft once hydrated, and the shape meant I could be careful not to get too near to his eyes. I also have a white frenchie who absolutely HATES having her face washed, but needs to have the folds of her face cleaned regularly. I'm going to order a second one because this has made that process much easier as well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I don't yet know if it can remove tear stains, but given how hard they are to get rid of I somehow doubt it. I'll update the review if it works well over time though!

My hair is starting to thin out so I have been trying different hair products along with a biotin supplement to help this.  This has many natural ingredients, which is what I have been trying to use more.  This actually made me loose hair!  This also made my scalp burn, not a slight tingle, but burn.  I have never experienced that with any other natural shampoos or conditioners.  When I rinsed my hair, I got a small pea sized clump of hair come out.  I tried this conditioner a few more days, but had the same burning sensation and pea sized clumps come out.  I went back to using the other shampoo/conditioner I was previously using and I did not get any clumps of hair, nor did my scalp burn.  I guess this is just me since the other reviews seem good, but I cannot use this.  The only thing I did like was the way it smelled.

I saw this and really wanted to try it since it came with both shampoo and conditioner. You always have to purchase them separately. The price is actually pretty good for what you get. A little goes a long way. I haven't been using this very long, but I have already noticed a difference in my hair shedding in the shower. Both have a good scent without being too overpowering. These actually leave my hair feeling and looking healthier. My hair has started to thin out and I wanted to stop it before it got too bad. It really leaves my hair feeling clean and restored. I do wash my hair daily with this shampoo and conditioner, but the bottle has lasted a long time. I put the shampoo on my wet hair in the shower and massage into my scalp, leave on for a minute, and then wash out with the warm shower water. I then do the same with the conditioner. I love all of the natural ingredients and that they do not test on animals. I would recommend this to anyone.

Not many people know this, or give it another thought sometimes - anything you put on your skin gets absorbed through the skin and ends up in the blood stream. This is why I am rather careful when picking my skin care products. I have been staying away from most hand creams for a while now just because for the most part there's at least a few potential carcinogens lurking among the ingredients. Even though the big famous brand creams make your skin feel wonderful the question is if the trade off is worth it.

Unfortunately, even so called organic products aren't always that safe. Provided, manufacturers of this goodness are disclosing all the ingredients on the label (and not hiding anything) this cream looks safe enough to eat. Therefore, I have been happily slathering it all over my hands (and any other body parts needing additional moisture) in the past few weeks and I am quite pleased with the results.

This white fluffy goodness feels surprisingly light and absorbs quickly into the skin. I must admit, it is a tad thinner in texture than I had expected but on the other hand this lightness ensures there's no oily residue left on your hands. The cream has no scent whatsoever which is a definite positive for those who are sensitive or don't particularly appreciate scented products. I'm adding a drop of essential oil of my choice (whatever I feel like that day) when I apply the cream if I feel like smelling something nice. Basically this cream is your blank canvas and leaves much room for creativity.

One thing I would probably change about this product is the packaging. (At least maybe as an option for buyers to choose from) I really think that tubes are better for hand creams - way easier to dispense and so much more hygienic (sticking your fingers into the container doesn't really help keep it germ free). Other than that I am happy to give this product my approval.

I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review, all opinions are based on my own personal experience with the product.

[[VIDEOID:5e37579b01c9e26d7c0d83a26f8153a7]] *as a licensed cosmetologist, I'm reviewing this item from a personal as well as professional standpoint*

I am almost 30 years old, and still suffer from breakouts. I have seen dermatologist and tried a lot of things but they often dry out my skin too much, causing my skin to produce MORE sebum (oil) combining with the medicines side effect of dry dead skin sells. This is a fast way to disaster skin-wise and often causes my skin to worsen. Because of this, I have tried many different facial cleansing devices, and here are the points that I like about this one.

1) Rechargable! Nothing is worse than needing to use a facial scrubber only to find that the batteries are dead. I cannot tell you how many times that the batteries have died (in other models) and then to make it worse, I often discover a mess of rust when I open up the compartment to change the batteries. The fact that this unit can be easily charged through a micro USB is not only convenient but also costs less and is safer.

2) Variety- all the different attachments that come with this unit is a nice little bonus. I can't genuinely say that I would use all of them (remember, trained in skin Haha) but as a consumer I still appreciate the additional options.

3) Quality- at this price point, it's surprisingly well made. I was a little concerned with the rubber cap that protects the USB port, but other than that, it's sturdy. The plastic does not flex at all, and it feels solid.

4) Sound- I never thought that something like sound would bother me, but I definitely noticed how quiet this unit is compared to other models I've owned. I have two small children, so I'd often have to go to a bathroom further away from their bedrooms to cleanse my face at night, but with the noise level of this cleaner, i'm just genuinely not concerned with waking them.

The only 'con' that I've found personally is the speed of rotation vs the softness of the bristles. I feel like it would be more productive to either have the head rotate faster or have harder bristles. Having said that, skin is very thin, especially when it's sensitive like mine. I DO prefer the softer bristles, because they are much kinder to my skin and I don't have to worry about causing more damage to inflamed areas. However, the brush's rotation was just too slow for me, (please see my review video for a short view of the rotation) and I felt impatient at how long it took to get a thorough round of cleansing and sloughing to my face. Because of this, I cannot rate at 5 stars because it's just simply not as good as it could be. But, all things considered it's still a good sturdy competitor at its price point in today's market.

[[VIDEOID:f2b369e0d51ead5b1e259f05074a0f65]] I was actually shocked when I looked at the pictures I took of my face of "before" and 7 days "after" using this miracle massage tool. I have been using this tool once per day at night for 7 days (I missed 1 day out of the 7 days) in combination with my normal nightly face routine. Prior to using the face tool, I apply a liberal amount of my eye cream so that there is still some that is not completely rubbed into my skin (the instructions recommend using an eye gel or similar product). I then use the wider, blunted tip on the tool and slowly move the tip around my face and pause in each area for about 5-10 seconds per the instruction manual.

The tool itself is about 6.5" long and feels like a wide marker when held in your hand. It is powered by 1 AAA battery (not included) and has a power button with 2 intensity levels. When turned on, the tool emits bionic waves via the tool's tip when it makes contact with your skin (see demonstration in video). The lower wave intensity is supposed to be used for slight to moderate wrinkle reduction and the higher intensity is meant for deeper wrinkles. However, during my testing, I used the higher intensity level exclusively (all of my wrinkles looked deep to me lol). The instructions state that the tool can be used up to twice per day (with at least 6hrs between each treatment time) and should be used on clean skin. Treatments do not cause any pain/discomfort and do not leave any marks or redness on your face.

This wrinkle eraser is incredibly easy to use, though does take some time dedication if you follow the recommended 5-10sec per skin surface area. I have already begun to see results (thanks to remembering to take "before" pictures) and will 110% continue to use this tool indefinitely. Now that I know the tool works, I'm going to start using the smaller tip on the wrinkles just under my lash lines in addition to using the broader tip around my eyes. I am looking forward to seeing more results, and I would highly recommend this product to others.
