I LOVE these bun makers!! I have an old bun maker that I've been using for years, but that one just got tossed in the trash because these new ones are SO much easier to use and the finished product looks much better!! These bun makers are unique in that they are foam, which helps to grip your hair to better hold it in place. They also have a very strong inner wire that holds them in place in a perfect circle. I have relatively long (just past my bust line) hair with long layers - the trick to getting all of the end pieces of the layers to stay tucked in place is to pull the bun maker down the length of your ponytail just before you reach the end of the shortest layer. Then, fold all of the rest of the ends upward over the hair piece and tuck them inward towards the center of the ponytail. As you roll the hair piece upwards, continue to tuck any loose ends in so that they are held in place by the rolled hair. The other trick to getting a perfectly round bun is that once you have rolled the hair piece all the way up with your hair, fold the ends inward towards each other to form a circle, but make sure to tighten this circle as much as possible by pushing the ends as close together as you can. Otherwise, these hair pieces are fairly self-explanatory to use, and there are step-by-step instructions included with each of the four bun maker pieces. In addition to these four pieces, this product also includes 2 sets of 8 bobby pins -- 1 set is about 2" long each and the other set is about 3" long.
*I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest, unbiased review.

This eye cream was far different than I was expecting -- but in a GREAT way. I'm 29-years-old, so the lines around my eyes aren't terribly deep, although they are probably deeper than many other females my age due to my sun-worshiping in earlier years. I do suffer, however, from severe seasonal allergies and am constantly plagued with dark circles ("allergic shiners" as they call them) and extreme puffiness of both my upper eyelids and just under my eyes (the infamous "bags").

To be honest, my impression of this cream at first glance wasn't too great. For starters, the jar of cream was much smaller than I had imagined, but I guess that's my fault for not noticing the (very) small-printed "0.5 fl oz" on the label in the picture. (I do think that this was a little deceitful though, because the size/amount of this cream is not listed anywhere on the product description.) In addition, while trying to read the teeny tiny print on the jar, I also almost immediately noticed a spelling typo on the front of the label that reads "Nautral & Healthy" rather than "Natural & Healthy." I know this seems like a rather minuscule and knit-picky detail to point out, but it did make me at least wonder about this company's quality control standards.

Despite my initial impression, I gave the company/cream the benefit of the doubt and have been using it for the last few days. With my first application under my eyes, the cream felt more on the "thin" side (similar to a lotion rather than thick cream), but while rubbing the cream into my skin in a circular motion, the moisture that the cream delivered was far better than I anticipated. It takes at least 3-4 minutes before your skin feels like the cream is completely absorbed, which gave me ample time to slowly massage the area during absorption (and felt very soothing and relaxing). I had absolutely no issues with any side effects or skin reactions such as burning, tingling, redness, or irritation. I noticed a small "immediate" reduction in the pores and fine lines of the areas I applied the cream, though not as impressive as some of the Retinol and Vitamin C serums that I've used in the past. There was no obvious difference in the dark circles or puffiness right after application, however, within about 30-45min, the puffiness started to visibly decrease and the area all around my eyes felt less tender/achy in general.

With each subsequent application, I noticed the same resulting decrease in puffiness as was observed initially. My puffiness did return each morning, but I expected because I'm still constantly being exposed to my allergens. (After all, the cream is meant to relieve a symptom of my allergies, not be a miracle cure for my chronic systemic condition.) I've noticed that if I apply the cream immediately before bed and spend more time rubbing it into my skin in the circular motions, I do have a noticeable decrease in the morning when I wake up compared to before I started using the cream. As far as the under-eye dark circles, I can't tell a difference so far - but in all fairness, I've only been using the cream for 4 days (twice daily) so there's still hope.

Now for the best part (in my opinion, at least). On the second night of using this cream, I had yet another one of my throbbing headaches (allergies are the worst!!) About 15-20min after my evening cream application, I noticed that my headache felt a little better -- I'm not saying that there was some miraculous change here, but it did feel less severe. This was very unusual for me, as I hadn't taken any ibuprofen or Zyrtec at that point (my usual go-to medications when my headaches are severe). The only thing I could think that I had done differently this time than any other time was that I applied the cream -- it was a strange connection, but stranger things have certainly happened to me. I went back to look at the ingredients listed on the jar and saw that it had rooibos in it. I had absolutely no idea what this was (and probably didn't notice it the first time I looked because I don't have a magnifying glass), but I looked it up online and read that it's an herb from South Africa with a laundry-list of health benefits -- including antioxidant properties and... headache relief?!?! Although still relatively skeptical that this was just a coincidence and that I had gotten "lucky" on my google search, I was still optimistic and proceeded to rub the eye cream on my temples and at the base of my skull to see what would happen. After a good 30-45min, my headache was almost completely gone. I know this headache thing sounds ridiculous and obscure, but I encourage anyone to research this mysterious Rooibos for themselves. I haven't had a headache as severe as that one since, but I have had a few headaches start to come on, and with each headache, I applied the cream to my temples, under my eyes, and to the base of my skull and the feeling has gone away each time within about an hour.

With all of this said, I couldn't rate this "eye" cream turned headache remedy anything less than 5 stars despite my initial less-than-thrilled first impression. Because the cream is light and only requires a very small amount with each application, I think the small jar will actually last me a reasonably long time, too. Between the headache relief and the disappearing eye bags, I would be confident in recommending this product to others. I was also fortunate to receive my first jar of this cream at a discounted price or free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this silicone pad to place on my vanity so that I could rest my curling/straightening irons on it while getting ready without having to worry about scorching the wood vanity top. Overall, it works well and it just small enough to squeeze between the two drawers that come up on either side of my vanity. I have a love/hate feeling for the little raised "dots" that cover each side of the mat. I like them because they raise the hot tool when resting on the mat to give extra heat protection to my vanity top underneath it. However, I also put my makeup on at my vanity and because of the silicone surface, every little drop of makeup powder is attracted to and clings to the silicone mat surface. The silicone isn't that difficult to clean (I use either pledge spray or a lysol wipe), but the little raised dots make it difficult to get into all the little grooves in order to get the mat perfectly clean. I could move the mat while I put my makeup on, but I don't have many places to put it on where I get ready, so this would be a huge inconvenience. Plus, regardless of where i put the mat, it will still collect dust overtime and have the same cleaning issue.
As a solution to cleaning the mat, I started running it under warm water and using a dish brush with bristles to scrub the mat and get in those difficult grooves, which has been successful as far as perfectly cleaning the mat - it's just a little more tedious than I'd like it to be.

So when you hear "natural" nail polish remover what comes to mind? For me I thought "there is no way this is going to work". So what do I do I order it anyways because hey I love the earth, but I want to be pretty too. I've had this stuff for like a week already and even though my toes look like they have been through war I still just keep staring at it. Well today I finally decide to take the plunge. I read all of the instructions and see that you have to let it "sit" on your nails for 2-5 minutes. It's very difficult for me to stay still that long, so I figure I'll try it out and see what happens. Mind you I am not trying this on any regular nail polish, no. I have the polish from my last pedicure which is a light pink glitter polish AKA the worst type of polish to try to remove. I feel like I'm setting this stuff up to fail, right. So I grab the dropper and fill it up. I place a few drops on each toe (for those of you keeping track this is a watery formula and will not stay well if you move at all). I did keep moving about my business for 5-6 minutes. I then return with some cotton pads. I wipe the big toe not expecting much and almost the entire polish wipes away in one swipe. I kid you not more than 3/4 of the polish was gone in one swipe. I'm in disbelief at this point, so I stare and pick at it like it's going to talk to me. After a few minutes in awe I finish the rest of my toes. I did have to go back and do it one more time because my toes are very curved and like I said I cannot sit still, however it didn't bother me at all. This stuff removed disgusting glitter polish in less time and less smell than any other product I've ever used. I am so impressed that I keep staring at the pad I used to remove the polish. It's like it just melted it into a sheet and it just slides off of my nail. It's really cool. I am impressed also that I do not need a ton of this stuff to remove all the polish for my toes so I'm thinking it will last a while. I will re-order this stuff once mine runs out. I highly recommend this product to anyone who wears nail polish ever. I do need to mention that I did receive this product for free to review. Please understand that my review is based only on my own experience with this product and the cost has no impact on my review.

I hadn't had much experience with waxing, however I have tried wax pearls before and that definitely wasn't working for me, and though I usually just stick with good old fashioned razors but I thought I would try these easy to use wax strips. They are pretty easy to use too! The instructions are on the back of the box and they even have pictures for you to follow. To heat up the wax strips all you have to do is use your hands and rub them and the heat from your body allows the wax to warm up enough for you to pull the paper apart. You simply stick the wax strips on the area that you want the hair removal. It didn't really say how long you should leave it on before removing it but I feel like it needs to cool a bit to get a bit harder before you pull it off. One of my issues is that I didn't feel like it pulled off all the hair that I wanted to be gone within that area that I put the strip. If I am going to go through some pain for this hair removal I don't want to have to do it multiple times on the same area of skin. To finish up you are supposed to open the post cleaning wipes, however they left my skin oily and feeling kind of greasy and I didn't like those. I preferred to finish up with some of my own CBD lotion. Overall I think it worked, but not well enough for my liking.

This product is actually really cool and just as easy to use in real life as it seems like in the pictures. Comes with a silvery tone putty type substance in a little container all you have to do is put your hands in kind of rub it around your hands and then run it through your hair. It was really the easy to do on someone else but takes a little bit more time to do on yourself though if you get some on your skin or ears or wherever you can just take a wet damp towel or a white or something like that and wipe it right off. In the picture that shows you doing it too long hair but I tried it on my long hair and absolutely did not work I could not pull a comb through it and it was hard and strange and it definitely works better on men's hair that is short. When it was dry it got kind of hard like a gel or something like that. It's really easy to make it look nice you just have to continue working it through the hair until you get the desired color and style that you want. We tried it on a beard as well and it didn't look as good on the beard it kind of looked better on the medium to short hair but not super super short like a beard. We even used it and my boyfriend's hair who is African-American and it came out pretty cool. Kind of makes you look like you have silver gray hair. It was really easy to wash out renting it out just with water gets a lot of it off but a little bit of shampoo get it out in just a second. I don't recommend going to bed with this in your hair as it will leave silver glimmery stuff on your pillowcase to make sure you wash before going to sleep or laying down on anything.

So far I couldn't get this product in my routine for long enough to see how well it works at all. I don't want to give it a bad review because of my lack of ambition with it, but I don't want to lie and say that its an amazing product either. This Biotin Infused Zenlash Eyelash Growth Serum is definitely easy to use. It comes in a little wrapped bottle similar to a mascara bottle, except the brush looks more like a detail nail polish brush. The idea is simple, you brush it on your lash line everyday and wait and watch. It was a bit hard for me to get my lid closed all the way and brush this one, but I am not one who uses make up much either. If you do use make up it will probably come a lot faster for ya. I did accidentally get a bit in my eye before and I was happy to see, though it doesn't feel good, it didn't irritate me much either. I really wish I could say that I saw a huge transformation, but after only managing to use it for one straight week, I didn't see much difference.

~Thanx~

This ShungHO Hairband Cap Woolen Braiding Knitted Headband is much better quality than I was even expecting. It came in just a clear plastic cover. The braiding and knit of the yarn is very nice, with no frayed or loose hanging ends that I could see. The braiding looks super cute, and would go well with some braided boot socks. It does feel like wool, so it is a bit scratchy but not uncomfortably so. It was thicker than I expected it to be and keeps your head nice and warm. I did notice it seems to ride up on the back of my head a bit which I do not like, but that is no problem of the product, just the nature of the design. It looks a bit strange with your hair down but looks pretty cute with it up in a messy bun. I think I would have liked it a bit more if it was a bit less wide, because it covers so much that it looks a bit strange. I do however, like the fact that it covers pretty much half of my ears as well, to keep them nice and cozy during cold evenings and frosty mornings. Quality product.

~Thanx~

This Black Intense For Men is so refreshing. A bit intense when first sprayed on, but very mellow shortly afterwards. It reminds me of a lot of scents that say "refreshing" or "water." I absolutely love the smell. Its not even super manly either and could almost be worn by a woman without much notice. I definitely love this smell on my fiance and I think it is my most favorite of all the polo inspired scents by Watermark Beauty. Of course like most of the other ones my biggest issue is that they not not last all day long. They start puttering out about halfway through the day and will need to be re-applied, and also like most others it comes in a large 3.0 Fl. Oz./ 90 ml bottle, so it should last a while even with a second application every day. It is inspired by Black Cologne but I have not had the chance to smell it so I cant tell you how close they are, nor do I care because this scent is amazing. Recommended! I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

The biggest issue with all of the colognes by Watermark Beauty is the fact that they do not last strong or long. You need to reapply to make sure you still smell good by the end of the night. That being said this leopard For Men, Eau De Parfum smells amazing. Its very manly and I love the scent of it on my fiance! It reminds me of a water fresh shaving cream or aftershave and is very nice smelling, sort of aspin-like, light and not too strong. The bottle is relatively large and at 3.3 Fl. Oz. / 100 ml even if you have to reapply during the afternoon it should last a while. The bottle is sleek and modern looking with its flat black matte surface. The black clear lid does not snap on well however and comes off easily. The spray pump makes it easy to apply, and its definitely one of my top 5 scents that my fiance owns. I received this product at a discounted rate.

Thanks <3

Wow. This Super Star For Women, Eau de Toilette by Watermark Beauty is strong. Not my favorite by far, but lasts well throughout the day. That being said when I spray myself it is so strong I have the need to want to wave away some of the scent it really invades your nostrils. The first whiff is overwhelming of alcohol, and needs some time to disperse to make it smell better. One spray should do just fine, so this 2.7 Fl. Oz. / 80 ml will last for a long time. The bottle is very cute, and the pink liquid in the clear glass makes it look very feminine. It even has a plastic top that looks like crystal, very cute. Inspired By Juicy Couture Perfume, but I cant imagine Juicy would smell like this.Overwhelmingly floral, its okay, but its more like something my grandmother would wear. I received this product at a discounted rate

At first I did not know if I really liked this Diva Scent For Women, Eau De Parfum, but after a few days of wear it is really starting to grow on me. It is supposed to be inspired by Juicy, however I have not ever tried Juicy before so I cant tell you how close it is unfortunately. I can tell you, however, that it smells very fruity with a milk floral scent. Very sweet and refreshing and very hip for the younger women. Almost like a fruity dryer sheet, but in a good way. It comes in a rectangular clear bottle and the perfume itself is pink and very girly, it even has a pink bow around the spray nozzle. I think this 2.8 Fl. Oz. / 80 ml bottle should last quite a while, and after 3 good sprays in the morning I cold still smell it on my shirt at the end of the night. The only thing I did not like was that the golden cap was on so tight that I actually pulled off the bottom piece when trying to get the lid off, other than that I really like this perfume. I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

This Lady Passion For Women, Eau De Parfum is supposed to be inspired By Paris Hilton perfume, however i do not have that perfume so I really can not describe the difference. However, I can tell you that this Lady Passion perfume smells nice. It has a very distinct citrus smell, almost grapefruity type smell. Its nice on the nose but not really my favorite kind of scent when I want to wear a perfume. It comes in a very large 3.3 Fl. Oz./100 ml glass bottle that should last you a while, however I did notice that the scent dissipated quite dramatically from me as the day went on and if I wanted to keep the good smell to be continuously noticeable I would have to reapply, but its price is very affordable. It comes with an easy push squirt application nozzle. I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

Its one of the grossest things in the world, blackheads. But lets face it, some of us women are so fascinated by them! We love to pop and pull and squeeze and get all the gunk out of not only our faces, but our spouses. Eeeewww. Until not long ago I did not realize how much popping pimples is so bad for your skin! Leaves holes and scarring and no wonder I have such big pores... So after learning that I was so excited to try out this Deluxe Premium Blackhead & Blemish Remover Kit by Mac Professional. This set comes with so many different tools its hard to know where to start. There is one tool in particular that is the coolest, though a bit dangerous. It has two heads that screw into each side for safety and can be removed and screwed on the sides, and has a lancet and another head. Its extremely sharp and you must be careful with it, this is a "professional" set so I really don't use more than the ones just to remove blackheads, very nice set, and I love that it comes with a case that has inserts to safely store every piece. I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3
The instructions on the packets are not translated appropriately. Super weird.

My natural hair color is light to medium Ash Brown, depending on how manufacturers label their colors.  (Unfortunately, there's not alot of uniformity in the industry when it comes to color labels).  I look for #8 if the color number is given.  Even then, you can NEVER be sure unless you see it in person, and Ash Brown is particulary hard to find.  The picture of the "Dirty Brown" bun looked to be a close match to my hair, but the pictures often lie, too,....and "Dirty Brown"??  In all my searches for ash brown hair pieces, this is the first "Dirty Brown" color label I've come across. I took a chance, and it is ALMOST a perfect match to my hair color.  Even though it doesn't say that the Dirty Brown piece is ombre dyed, IT IS, and the lighter ends would not be my choice. Still, the darker "roots" of the piece are almost perfectly matched to mine, so I think I can pass it off as real.  I have very fine hair, and I do NOT like thick hair pieces. That's another hard thing to find,....hair pieces that aren't unrealistically thick and "weighty"!  This piece is full, but not TOO full, not so thick that it looks fakey or heavy.  The "messy" feature is definitely very messy, the hair is completely straight and a bit spiky looking, yet very soft to the touch.  The center opening is too big, the elastic to loose for me to wear it over my own ponytail or bun without additional fasteners.  I use a couple hidden bobby pins at the top of the piece to secure it to my own hair.  It's easy to do and unnoticeable but can sometimes get a little heavy and "pulling" if worn for hours.  I change the position of the bobby pins, move them off to the sides, if it starts to bother me, so it's not a deal breaker.  This messy bun (more like a mess pony) is very well suited for around home, when running errands, or for any casual event with casual dress.  I don't think it would work well (and I would not choose it) for more formal events or dressier attire.  I really, really like this piece!  95% of my life is "casual", and I know I'll get alot of wear out it.  These things don't last forever, so when I find an affordable piece that matches my natural hair color and my life style, I usually go back and get a "spare".  That's a winner in my world, and this one got a medal, so I'm back to buy the spare!

This seems to work well but I'm not crazy about the scent. It has a floral scent and is kind of annoying. I wish it smelled like banana or chocolate or something but flowers? Yeesh. It is a nice darkening formula and even after one use, I noticed a difference. Goes on smooth and absorbs evenly. The scent is so strong for me however that my sinus's immediately flared up and got stuffy and after trying to wash it off my hands and chest area, I couldn't get it off.

Got it for $9 at Walmart. Don't waste your time paying inflated high prices.

I was highly skeptical about this gadget, but when I ruptured a disk in my back, I decided to take a chance. I should have listened to my instincts.

Let me put it bluntly. This contraption does not work in ANY way as advertised. Anyone saying otherwise HAS to be a lying SHILL!

The suction cups don't stick to the floor of tub or stone shower. At all. This makes every other feature kinda worthless. The point of this toy is to not have to bend over to scrub the dirt or smooth out the calluses on your feet. But since it won't stay put, there is nothing easy about cleaning your feet with this thing.

Since the suction cups didn't stick to the floor, I tried jamming the thing in a corner and holding it there with my other foot. But even if you can get it to stay still enough to rub your foot on the brush, the bristles are weak and cheap. They flattened out with the third attempted use. The stone is small and even more useless than the brush.

This is the perfect example of a sucker product! Wouldn't it be great if this worked? But it doesn't. SAVE YOUR MONEY!

A long handled bath brush/pumice stone combo actually does work. If you use it while seated, there is very little bending involved, saving your back.

I have tried a number of these brushes. What I like about this one is that it goes down to 80C (176F). It was so cool that I was not sure it was on. I have fine hair, high porosity that is 5 months post-straightening relaxer. And, I find that light heat with a silicone-based glosser helps to gently close the cuticle and to keep my roots from tangling. What I don’t like is that this brush design does not have the round guiding bristles around the edges that help to pull your hair into the hearing plate. So, it feels like you are brushing your hair with your elbow and that it is not penetrating to the roots. You have to grip the hair with your other hand so it feels like you are only getting the shaft of your hair. So, the brush is best for people with longer hair who do not have curly roots or those who need the super low heat setting as an option.

If you would like to be able to rake the brush over your roots to tame curls at 250 F and up, other bushes to consider are https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FGV9NQG/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&th=1 or https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B071HFQGJX/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1. Note - My glamfields brush malfunctioned after first use which is why I ended up trying this one, but I decided to give Glamfields another chance because it is great when it works - never had results like that before. The BuTure mini is like the Glamfields brush but smaller. Both feel better (more like a real brushZ) than this one.

Not recommended for women of color. It is only lightly pigmented and chalky; the colors very pastel. It will hardly show up on your skin. The three colors on the lower right look nearly identical in the pan and all three look like faint dark streaks on skin. The 3 colors on the left side (lilac and 2 light browns) do not even show up on my palm. The purples in the middle of the top show do show faintly, but all of the shadows are dusty and brush off in a few swipes. I threw mine away.  I recommend choosing a 5 star rated palette instead.  For example,  Ucanbe, De’lanci, and Prism palettes are good examples of $11 eyeshadows that are -highly- pigmented, long lasting, and blend well.

I cannot say enough good things about this Retinol Serum. I have tried several things from the Baebody line of products, and they have all been very high quality and very effective. I am a huge fan of Retinol and how it benefits the skin. I am at a crappy age where I still get breakouts, and I am starting to get wrinkles. I hate having the same gross skin as I did as a teenager. And I have tried everything! Prescription meds, prescription creams, ProActiv, micro-dermabrasion, chemical peels, etc,etc. Nothing seemed to help until I started using this Retinol Serum. Retinol is just a fancy word for Vitamin A and apparently me skin is in desperate need of it. It acts on DNA to promote healthy epidermal skin cells. It does a great job of moisturizing my skin, which helps with wrinkles. And it also does a great job of preventing breakouts. If I do break out because of hormones, it helps clear them up without drying out my skin. Sometimes it clears up my skin within a day or overnight. Vitamin A is a really potent antioxidant that protects your skin from free radicals, generates cell growth, and repairs damaged cells. Retinol belongs to a family called retinoids, and is one of the only substances that is small enough to penetrate the outer epidermal layer to the layer where collagen and elastin reside. It is really strong at first. It is really effective and it is tempting to want to use too much too often, but it can end up irritating the skin. I started using it every other day at first and then built up to using it every day. I also like to use a Vitamin C serum, but using Vitamin C and Retinol together tends to decrease their effectiveness. And sunlight decreased the effectiveness of Retinol, so I use the Vitaming C serum in the morning and the Retinol Serum at night. I let it work it's magic while I sleep. It has helped clear up my skin and help heal sun spots and acne scars. My only regret about it is that I didn't start using this years ago! I was able to try this Retinol Serum at a promotional discount for testing and reviewing purposes and in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

I am so very disappointed with this product line by Amorepacific. I love their other brands, IOPE and sulwhasoo. But I was in the search for a more affordable toner/emulsion/serum and was excited when they introduced this line and gave a discount. They really sold this beta-hyaluronic whatever that works 1.5x better and I thought it was a new patented technology. But no. Contrary to their marketing claim, there is no such thing as beta hyaluronic acid. Yes I looked up patent registry and trademark registry and Amorepacific didn’t register anything new in the past few years related to hyaluronic acid. They just put a new spin on beta glucan, which according to some studies works 20% better, not 150% like they claim. Also beta glucan is toward the end of the ingredient list, meaning we have no idea how much of it is even in there. It’s so disappointing that Amorepacific decides to just flat out lie to customers about it. Makes me go wonder what else they are lying about.

Now I would not have done all the research if the serum worked well in the first place. But it came with no safety seal which made me go um. The packaging felt cheap. The liquid felt cheap and diluted. My skin smelled like plastic. My skin didn’t stay hydrated like other serums and that’s when I knew something was up. I bought toner, emulsion and serum. The emulsion was sealed but the toner and serum was not. I didn’t even bother trying the emulsion. I’ll be returning these all. I will also be seeking new skincare products that are not made by Amorepacific. Goodbye.

ANOTHER UPDATE:

My dermatologist told me that unless a Vitamin C serum contained the L-ascorbic acid form of Vitamin C, I was wasting my money and doing little to improve my skin. I found a serum here on Amazon that contains 17% L-ascorbic acid, and I've been using it for approx. 3 weeks. What a difference! I can definitely feel it working for one thing (it burns for about 5 seconds), but more importantly, I can SEE the difference in my skin already. At first I thought my eyesight was going downhill, but then I realized my skin really did look smoother and had a new glow. Do an Amazon search for L-ascorbic Vitamin C serum to get the good stuff.

Having said all this, I have added a LOT more spinach to my daily regimen lately, so I'm sure that's contributing to my skin's appearance too.

UPDATE:

I finished the bottle which gave me about 5 weeks of use. If it made any difference in my skin, it's at a microscopic level. I'm buying another bottle - mainly because there's got to be SOME truth to all the 5-star reviews. But if, after another month or so of use, I still don't see improvement in my skin, I'm asking a dermatologist for a Rx for Retin-A.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I've been using this product for three weeks, and I have yet to see any improvement in my skin. I'm amazed (and not a little skeptical) about some people seeing results in two weeks. I also wonder how many 5-star reviews were written by people who were given the product to try.

I'm very methodical about using new products on my skin. I use a 10x magnifying mirror, establish a "baseline" area of my skin to observe over time, and take close-up "selfies" of my skin to compare with photos taken a few weeks later. No difference so far, but I'll continue to use this product until it's gone.

I DO like that this retinol doesn't irritate my skin, which is highly unusual. So unusual, it makes me wonder if it indeed contains any retinol.

In conclusion, and not a critique of the product itself, but the product won't dispense through the pump. It's too thick. I'm having to pull the cap off and shake the serum on to my fingertips. I wish it came with a dropper instead. I changed out out the pump with a dropper from another bottle of serum. I'm surprised I haven't read about this problem in other reviews. Another reason I'm leery of all the glowing comments.

I'll update with my progress, or lack thereof, at a later date.

Sometimes I'm just bored and get to ordering nonsense to see if it really works. Sorry to crush your dreams ladies no way is a bar of soap going to tighten your vaginal walls . On a brighter note it smelled good and wont throw off your PH 💁🏻‍♀️
Waste of money . Not for professionals.  Not very much power ... I use it to trim my puppy's nails now 😝.

I had a little bit of a hard time at first braiding my hair onto this heatless curling rod headband . The head band is very soft and feels like good quality that it will last for a good amount of time . It does feel a little slippery since it is satin so make sure that the hair clip that secures the headband is well placed .

I used it after blowing drying my hair to mostly dry and had to re-wet it a little bit to make sure it would be wet enough to lock the curls in . As you can see my hair looks a bit frizzy because it was a bit wet but the curls look really beautiful and that was after 4 hours of wearing the curling rod .

I didn’t try to sleep with it in my hair since I can’t sleep damp hair nor hair pulled back at all .

This is a cool heatless curling rod which I do recommend since it is a handy product for women who don’t want to damage their hair with heat and still get beautiful curls .

It's lovely, looks nice on the counter. However, I warn y'all, if you ever want to feel bad about your skin, look at it at 10x. I'm not completely sure about this, but you know that "related items" thing that amazon puts on the bottoms of pages. I'm willing to bet it should include scarves, balaclavas and burkas. ;)

Pros: The lights are bright, but not blinding.
Battery or wall power
Light turns off after a set amount of time
Looks nice, easy to keep clean

Cons:
The concave of the mirror itself means that there's a sweet spot where you can see clearly, but distortion happens along the edges in the magnification side.

The "warm" color is more yellow than I prefer.

I bought this shaver approximately 6 months ago. From day 1 the razor performed badly. It is very, very slow to cut on 1 day growth (for me) and virtually doesn't work at all on 2 or 3 day growth. My facial hair is not that hard to cut either. I have replaced the blades a number of times - they are expensive - with no improvement.
The trimmer is a joke and also hardly works.
I just bought a Panasonic ES8043SC Pro-Curve razor as a replacement - it works great - I am on my way to trash can after writing this review to dump the Philips razor - an expensive waste of money.
Philips - shame - shame...

Summary: Nothing not to like!

Background: Previously, I owned the earlier model of this razer. It was the same exact razer except it used to be blue. I loved this razer, but it was eaten by a dog! I didnt want to cough up the full cost of this direct replacement, so I used a lower-end Norelco. As you may know, the lower models do not feature the "Speed-XL" shaving heads (which have 3 concentric rings of blades (per head)). Instead it had the single outer row of blades, which is pretty typical of any non-high-end razer.

Why this razer is good:
The point of my background story is that there is a SIGNIFICANT difference between the Speed-XL models, and older style heads. In fact THERE IS NO COMPARISON! With the cheaper razer I had to go over my face at least twice as much, and usually more like 3x as much as with this razer. As with all electric's, you're not going to be able to make a single pass and get everything, but as electric's go, this razer (and all the Norelco's with Speed-XL) works great. Both myself and my dad (who is used to foil razers) agree that Speed-XL is the best electric we've used!

Some niceties of this razer are that its VERY easy to clean. Usually you can just pop the top and tap most of the hair out, maybe use the brush real quick. I dont feel like I have to do a deep cleaning (taking the heads out and apart) very often because it doesnt seem to trap a lot of hair in the heads. But if you want to, its very easy to access everything.
The body is waterproof, so you can clean it out with water as a middle ground between just tapping hair out and dissassembly.
The charger is now VERY small, and takes up only a single plug (even on a strip), and the base is also small.
Battery life: lets me shave for multiple days (at least 4) before it needs charging.

That said there are some minor quibbles. Like most Norelco razers, the charger doesnt shut off automatically, so you need to be careful with leaving it plugged in all the time. My solution: leave the charger in a draw, keep the stand on my countertop to hold the razer all the time, and then just get the charger out (and plug it into the stand) when the razer actually needs charged, which for me is only ever handful of days. this also has the added benefit of saving some small amount of energy by not having the wall wart plugged in while you're not charging.
This razer now comes with a form fitting travel case, and you cant put the razer in it with the hair gaurd on it :( so make sure you clean it before you travel with it. You also cant fit the charger in the case...its really a case JUST for the razer, to protect it in your regular toiletries bag.

All in all any of the speed-xl razers will cut the same, so just buy the model that has the accessories you want. I think this model represents the best value because its the cheapest :) personally i dont care about a multi-step battery readout, or a cleaning station...but if you do buy those versions.

This lightweight spf foundation comes in a nice compact with the pad separated from the foundation. It’s a good size to keep in your purse and gives a light coverage. It made my skin feel greasy as the day wore on and my skin broke out all over where I had applied it after just one day of wear! See attached pictures. I have never had an allergic type response to anything in my life, so this was concerning. I won’t be using this product.

Lavender is my #1 go-to essential oil. I think I use it in 90% of my blends, whether in the diffuser or in topical blends (or sprays, etc). The only thing I definitely don’t use it for is my home-made cleaning products where citrus oils are the only essential oils.

This particular oil is a very delicate scent – some lavender oils can pack quite a punch in terms of the scent. This is certainly floral and has a ‘high note’ to it. You can easily pick it out of a blend. It’s my first oil from New York Biology and I’m very pleased.

I love blending lavender in particular with chamomile, as it has an almost instantaneous calming effect. Also love to blend it with bergamot, ylang ylang, mandarin, and a drop of lime.

The bottle is very large, a dark brown color to protect the oil from UV rays which can damage the oils and decrease the shelf life. My favorite way to dispense oils is with the eye dropper (the euro droppers found in smaller bottles tend to gush several drops at once, so that’s definitely not my preference) – you can really control how many drops you dispense with these eye droppers.

Arrived well protected in bubble wrap and there was no leaks.

* I received the oil for evaluation and review

My mother asked me to find her a moisturizer with matrixxyl and peptides. Very specific and she didn’t want anything that did not have at least those two ingredients.

The reason is a conversation with her dermatologist. Matrixxyl is made of 2 peptides, palmitoyl-tripeptide and palmitoyl-oligopeptide, which stimulate collagen and elastin production in the skin. And peptides form a long chain of amino acids to become proteins, penetrating the top layer of skin cells and signaling the cells including collagen.

The Cazbe serum works really nicely in tandem with my mom’s Ponds cream (she has used Ponds as long as I remember). The serum absorbs pretty rapidly and unlike other serums, doesn’t seem to leave her skin feeling sort of ‘tight’ or dry. After a few minutes (she will put the serum on before brushing her teeth, and then follow with moisturizer after teeth), she will apply the Ponds cream to completely moisturize her face. I’ve tried this a few times and find I can only really use it around my eyes – it dries out my cheeks and chin. If used just around my eyes, it feels a lot better.

Her skin is looking beautiful. I think in combination with a really solid cream to sort of ‘seal in’ the benefits, after washing your face, and just before bed, it’s a great part of your beauty routine.

* we received the serum for evaluation and review

I have many Majestic Pure products (from skin care products, to hair care, to essential oils), and have always been very satisfied. I am also pleased with the retinol cream. Having very sensitive skin, I tend to use products containing retinol quite sparingly (aka, every few days, vs. daily) as they tend to cause my skin to become quite irritated or scaly after a few days of daily use. I’ve been using this around just my eyes every evening (about 1 hour after applying a hyaluronic acid serum), as my skin is so sensitive that using anything with retinol on my entire face seems to really cause a lot of scaliness. And, this is where the fine lines are really beginning to show.

The results – after using a cream with retinol in combination with hyaluronic acid serum for 3 weeks, I’ve been noticing a definite reduction in the fine lines. They are still there but they were becoming really noticeable.

The cream has ingredients that are highly moisturizing (again, which I like to follow up on a serum with). The consistency is pretty thin (not thick and creamy like a lotion), and there is no noticeable fragrance. It seems to absorb quickly and is not oily.

Some note on the ingredients:

Retinol 2.5% - Retinol is another name for Vitamin A, which is an antioxidant (helps reverse the damage caused by free radicals, apparent in wrinkles and aging), encourages the production of collagen, and elastin.
Jojoba Oil - closely resembles sebum (a waxy substance produced by our skin glands), packed with vitamins and minerals - Vitamin E, B, copper, zinc, selenium, iodine and chromium.
Green Tea - Tea is high in anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, whether ingested or applied topically. Green tea contains tannins which can reduce puffiness and inflammation of the skin. It also contains polyphenols, which can combat free radicals (which contribute to aging). The catechins in tea can combat the bacteria that contribute to acne.
Propolis - Propolis, “bee glue or bee penicillin” is the resinous material gathered by honeybees from flowers and leaf buds of various plants. It contains dozens of anti-oxidants,
Shea Butter - The moisturizers in shea butter are similar to those produced by the skin’s sebaceous glands, making it one of the best choices for super-dry or cracked skin. Shea butter also contains anti-inflammatory compounds – great for applying to inflamed or irritated skin (think eczema, chapped skin, bug bites)
Vitamin B5 - A humectant (a water-binding substance that attracts and retains water). Particularly good for the skin as it stabilizes the skin barrier, increasing hydration and improving softness and elasticity.
Vitamin E - A powerful antioxidant, that neutralizes the oxidant effect of free radicals, which are molecules that damage collagen and cause skin dryness, fine lines and wrinkles

*I received the retinol cream for evaluation and review

(+) Smells great (my hair smells nice all day after using it)
(+) Texture is a high-quality conditioner: very thick, easy to run fingers through hair while applying
(+) A little seems to go a long way
(/) I love the products from Opulent, like the heat protectant spray ([[ASIN:B013ISGICY Heat Protectant Spray - Cut Your Hair Dry Time in Half! Blow Dry Spray for Flat Iron - Infused with Argan Oil, Jojoba Oil, Keratin and Collagen for Thermal Protection and Hair Care - 8oz]]) but give the repair mask only 4 stars because it feels more like a high-quality conditioner than a “repair mask”. I didn’t notice a dramatic difference in my hair like after other masks or deep conditioners, just a nice softness to my hair from a high-quality conditioning product.

The bottom-line: I’d recommend this for daily use or several times a week but more as a regular conditioner than a deep repair mask.

*I received the hair mask for evaluation and review

I bought this to begin (and win!) the fight against the wrinkles that are appearing around my eyes (crow's feet). I guess the best solution is not to laugh, but then what fun would life be...

What is Hyaluronic acid? According to WebMD, "Hyaluronic acid works by acting as a cushion and lubricant in the joints and other tissues. In addition, it might affect the way the body responds to injury."

(+) Does it work? I've used the Hyaluronic serum every night for a week now. Not sure if I can say 100% that I have noticed no fine lines around my eyes, but I've had 2 friends remark that my skin is looking great. As we women know, that's a good endorsement right there.

(+) Texture: As you can see in the photo, the Derma-nu serum is a clear, slightly viscous consistency that goes on clear. You can feel it on your skin for quite a few minutes afterwards. It does NOT leave your skin feeling greasy (big pet peeve of mine) when you wake up in the morning.

(+) Smell: This is not a scented beauty product. There is a very slight almost medicinal scent - that's the best way to describe it. It is not unpleasant, it is extremely mild, but it smells like it has some ingredients that 'have a purpose', vs. beauty products that have fragrances added.

(+) Packaging and ease of use: The pump is well made - it dispenses a small amount of serum, which I am finding is enough for applying to the corners of both eyes. I'm having to "prime" the pump about 2-3 times before it dispenses the serum, so be careful, you don't want to double pump the serum unless you are OK putting possibly 2x the amount on your face than you might have intended.

(+) A little goes a long way. I travel a lot, so the compact bottle and efficient dispensing from the pump are bonuses for me.

(/) Organic. The bottle indicates that 72% of the ingredients are organic. It doesn't clarify which of the ingredients are/are not organic. It would be nice to see this get to 100%.

Bottom line: So far, my skin has felt good, I've had a few compliments, and I'm pleased with the way Derma-nu packaged the Hyaluronic serum so that it is easy to dispense.

*I received the serum for evaluation and review

I tried electric razors ten years ago with a Braun model but my skin was too sensitive and I received nicks and cuts and a poor shave. Three years ago, I tried again with a Remington, and it worked great for my head -- not so great for my face. Lots of nicks, and spread a rash. I was especially disappointed that it didn't get my neck very well. Both shavers were straight foil shavers, as I thought they would shave closer than round heads.

Then, I purchased this Norelco over 2 months ago, and it has worked like a dream for me. While the first week wasn't especially close, it was convenient as I was traveling for work. By the third week, however, the shave was CLOSER than my regular Mach 3 blade shave!

One huge difference: I bought some Letric Shave pre-shave liquid, which makes the whiskers stand up, and also disinfects the shaving heads. I haven't had one cut, and no rash, in over 60 shaves with this unit. Since then, I have used the Norelco every morning, along with the Letric Shave, and have been thrilled with the results. I have also wondered whether my previous experience with an electric would have been better had I $3.49 to get the pre-shave splash!

I have to agree with one poster who complained about the plastic parts - the only reason I didn't give the product 5 stars. I don't really know how long this unit will run. I do know in 2 months, I have already saved more on this unit than disposable blades would have cost. And, travel is a snap. Charges quickly, runs quietly, and usually holds its charge for the entire week. I'm a VERY happy customer!

To preface my review this is my first attempt with at-home waxing & I'm Trans MTF. I've waxed plenty in my lifetime, but always at a salon by a professional. Now I'm sitting here typing this review with an incredibly thin layer of wax all way down my still very hairy left leg.

I purchased the wax roughly 3 months ago, so I don't think the wax is expired, and it was stored in the original packaging in the meantime. I think the main issue is with the roller unit in general. I was literally pulling more hairs out just rolling the wax onto my leg than I was will the couple of strips I did manage to try. I don't have an issue with pulling hairs or anything. Tweezing nose hairs, or threading is WAY more painful and I don't have an issue with either of those.

It took the unit forever to just warm up enough, instructions are laughable at best (broken unclear English), the included wax cleanup wipes are useless & dry (I'm about to google how to remove all this excess wax off my leg in a moment here). I feel if I could break open the unit and heat the wax over the stove it would work 100% better, but I don't want to risk my cookware.

Update: #1: I was able to successfully microwave the cartridge for 3 mins in a bowl of water. 5 minutes would likely work better for you as my cartridge was still warm when I started. The wax rolled much nicer this time around, but still required some pulling, however it started to pool on one side of the roller resulting in the whole roller stopping again and even got a spot onto my bathroom rug that I had been carefully avoiding... The irritation from the wax is worse than using a depilatory cream (such as Nair)

Update #2: After oven an hour of attempting to remove the wax with various products. (baby oil, oil-free makeup remover, acetone, rubbing alcohol, body wash, and finally olive oil in that order). The olive oil and now trashed white washcloth finally did the trick. I really can't recommend avoiding this product enough. I'd be willing to try hard wax, but I'm not about to attempt anything from home until I consult with my local salon at my next nail / hair apt.

Just received it and the adhesive cover that is "easy to peel off" is so hard to remove I've given up trying. It's cut perfectly to the mold. If I try any hard I'll need a very sharp knife or will end up breaking a nail.

FYI Easy to peel should mean attached pull tabs at the very minimum.

My Optometrist recommended this product for eye mites. Gross! It seems many of us have an over growth of these devils as we age. It is eliminating the itching effectively. There are RX level products available but they cost hundreds of dollars. I would definitely try this first. It is easy to use.

I have fine, thick hair that is almost waist length and when I put my hair up in one of these, at first I really liked it. It's nice not to have to go around your hair multiple times like I have to with most scruchi/elastic type holders.

Unfortunately, getting this out of my long hair was AWFUL. There's simply no way to get this out of your hair without it rolling and when it does, it takes hair with it until I had a mess that required a pair of scissors and my husband's help to get it out without ripping out lots of hair. I stretched the band out as best I could while my husband clipped it with the scissors and thankfully only clipped the band and not my hair.

I think these would probably be fine with shorter hair but with my long hair, it just rolled it right up into a snarl.

Normally I really like this brand and I've bought lots of their products but this just wasn't for me.

I want to start by saying this is "Authentic" Dermacol. I verified the product code & packaging. My issues are not with the seller. Product was as described & shipped
quickly. I have used this product 3 x since receiving. Basically this is traditional pan make up in a tube. It's very thick & quite greasy on its own. I have tried to make good use of Dermacol, unfortunately no matter how I prep/prime/set/apply this make up broke down within in 3 hrs. My skin is normal with an occasional break out. I have not experienced any break outs. I feel this product is truly for stage/photo use. The amount needed for "full" coverage would be akin to literally wearing a mask. The product did not blend & basically sat on top of the skin. As it breaks down it becomes a thin, speckled look. Primer, setting powder nor spray made a difference. Then it settles in ALL your fine lines & imperfections. It's a hard pass for me. I would like to also add, the promos with product covering tatoos etc is just hype. It May be water proof but be advised it's not smudge/rub proof.

I bought this product, the Neutrogena Wave because I wanted to take my skincare regimin to the next level. I looked at the competetors but settled on this product due to the price of $12.97 at Walmart. It comes with the massager, pop-out attachment for the cleansing pad,(14) and a AA battery along with 14 cleansing pads. First, let me say I'm in my fifty's so skincare is important to me but I don't have the luxury of spending hundreds on skincare products. My skin is now starting to show signs of aging by fine lines and deep wrinkles and circles under my eyes. My main goal from this product is for my skin to improve in the following areas:

more even skin texture
more radiance
more firmness
more softer, subtle feel
help with deep skin cleansing and exfoliation

I used this product today for the first time following the instructions carefully. The product is very well made so far as the size as it comfortably fits in your palm. The attachment which holds the cleanser pad comes of easily and the cleansing pad attachs to it with no problems. Simply wet the pad with some water and push the button to start.You can also re- wet the pad if more is needed later. The vibration is both somewhat quiet but not irritating on the skin at all. You don't need to push on the product while holding it as it does the massaging for you!! The cleansing pads have a nice smell to them- nothing too perfumy, just a nice clean smell. Simply guide the skin massager over your face concentrating on the areas that you feel need the most attention. You control how long you feel each area needs to be cleansed.
I found my skin afterward to be more soft and brighter than before I used the Neutrogena Wave. It was easy to use and control and can ber used in the shower. The cleansing pads are available for about $6.49 for about 1-2 months worth depending on how often you use the product. It is gentle enough I feel you could use it every day depending on yourt skin type.
Bottom line is, if you don't want to spend alot for a "skin rejuvenator" than consider the Neutrogena Wave! I think you'll like the results and for alot less too!!

I'm not going to lie and say using this particular wand was not time consuming...it definitely was, but the results are worth it.  I have very long hair, so wrapping was a bit of a struggle because the wand is only so long.  I was able to wrap around both the balls and the indents, giving a unique curl effect.  Works best to physically unwrap the strand of hair you're curling rather than pulling downward as with a traditional clipless wand.  Any reviews stating this wand does not give curl either has too short of hair, isn't using a high enough heat setting, or is completely doing it wrong.  You really need to use your right hand over your head to curl the left and vice versa for the right.  The black cool tip should be pointing downward as you curl.  There are some informative videos on YouTube for how to curl with this wand.  Anyhow, I'm pleased with this wand and look forward to many great looks from it.

This will not fit a standard sized shadow palette (think Too Faced Chocolate Bar, Sweet Peach, ABH Modern Renaissance etc...).  Also not deep enough for the square ELF face palettes -- they stick out way too far when the organizer is standing up.  Also not wide enough for the smaller Too Faced tin shadow palettes (Cat Eyes, PBJ, Boudoir Eyes etc...) to fit between the dividers.  So, with that being said, it's not much use to me but I didn't want to go through any return hassles, so it's holding some single blush and highlighter compacts right now.  I don't recommend unless you have something very specific that will fit the dimensions.  It is a nice quality item...just wish it would actually fit a palette.

I really wish I didn't fall for every beauty gimmick that appears and I should have skipped this one!  While the product itself is well made, it just doesn't deliver a flawless application like a sponge or brush.  Seems to just smear the foundation and leaves it looking streaky...I end up having to blend with a sponge anyway.  Seemed to work a bit better for concealer on my skin.  This is definitely not a replacement for your favorite sponge blender or foundation brush.  The only real pro is that it's very easy to clean...otherwise it  just makes a mess of foundation application.

OMG. Microfiber? Anything but a 100% natural material is going to make you hate this. Can't wear this for more than 45 minutes it gets uncomfortable!

Simple cotton fabric breathes. And it's way way more comfortable.

I bought this in summer time to decrease the temp in my massage room. Even with the ac cranked the excess heat from the hot stone warmer filled with water in my room was cooking me.
This stone warmer heats up in about 20-25 minutes, stays consistently warm and even after 8 hours the stones aren’t too hot to touch.
If you are a massage therapist and on the fence about this, treat yourself to this clamshell. Honestly one of my favorite tools I’ve purchased so far.
Small,

Ok sooo I don’t know about this one. Clear vitamin C means it is 100% potent, but having an ingredient list that potency is no longer 100%. So upon seeing clear thick serum I was skeptical. Soon as I opened the bottle I added several drops to a small old bottle I own and left it open exposing to air, lights and anything else that causes oxidizing to the vitamin c. It stayed clear. After one week straight no changes. I even popped into the microwave for 8 seconds still clear. Had it contained ferulic acid I would have been less skeptic because FA is a Vitamin C stabilizer. On its own Vitamin C (L-absorbic acid) is unstable and begins to oxidize once the seal is broken. Yes even pure vitamin C in water it will turn a slight yellow and begin to darken.

But my skin did not break out a good thing. Even if it doesn’t contain vitamin c the other ingredients are a plus especially glycerin as the second ingredient ... which is a natural humectant, anti microbial and antiviral all meaning moisturized skin that won’t get clogged and controls acne. I do get acne (thank the skin gurus) but I do chemical exfoliate with acids and use a retinol. Two things that cause dry skin. If I should break out from a product then it is pure trash and the PH is way off.

So it has it pluses and minuses.

I have four daughters aged 6,5,4 and 11 months. So we can truly never have enough bows. Every chance I'm given to try new ones, I take it. So I of course ordered these when I seen them. Upon arrival I was very pleased with them. I absolutely loved the packaging especially the box the bows arrived in, which can be used for storage when not in use. We took them out right away and couldn't have been happier. These bows are made very well and seem to be very sturdy. The colors/design are very nice and put together well. The colors are great and they should definitely match with anything you may need. The ribbon on these is of nice quality and it shows. They are infact the size mentioned in the add, which can sometimes be a surprise upon arrival. They are on alligator clips, which was exactly what we were wanting. These particular clips have grips on them which make them even easier. They stay in place with no problems, even during rough play. One of the best things about these is that they are very light weight. Lighter than most of our bows, especially for the size. These have a soft of silky-ness to them which I have found helps tremendously when trying to clean them. I use a baby wipe and have no issues wiping off anything that has managed to get on them. I'm so glad I found these and we were able to try them out. I have no doubt that they will last a while to come, being they are made so well. I'm completely happy with my purchase and I will be recommending them to my friends and family. These would make a nice addition to any little ladys bow collection.

I received this at discount or free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review (good or bad) NO one nor nothing influenced my opinion and all the above statements are my own personal experiences

I've been a user of the Alpha Hydrox products for several years. I'm 38 going on 39, and some people still mistake me for 25 to early 30's. I especially love the 12% Souffle cream. Trust me, if you purchase this product, it will work SO well that you may take it for granted someday. Don't! I made that mistake, and it almost cost me my skin!

I had run out of the souffle and was lazy one day when repurchasing my skin care products, so I bought a drugstore brand of a popular new "Simply Radiant" skin care system with fancy "Soy Proteins" in it. I wanted to even out my skin tone (African-American, with a couple of dark dots left over from a few small pimples). After using the moisturizer for a week, I started developing cystic acne-type bumps on my face!! BIG pus-filled lumps that developed in clusters on my cheeks and forehead. I was horrified. I immediately stopped using the moisturizer, and the cysts stopped developing, but the damage was done; I had slowly-healing cystic acne bumps on my face. When I returned the cream to the drug store, the clerk took one look at me and quickly gave me my money back; the bad skin reaction was that obvious.

I ordered the Alpha Hydrox 12% Souffle as soon as I could, along with the Alpha Hydrox 14% AHA swipes to help accelerate my skin exfoliation. I used the swipes 3 times a week, and the souffle morning and night. After a month, I finally got the acne under control. After two months, my skin was smooth again. After six months, I was able to take the most gorgeous headshots I've ever had done, and the graphic artist only had to retouch "shine" on my forehead and chin. There's only a pinhead-sized indentation left over from the acne scars, and all the deep-colored hyperpigmented spots have completely healed and disappeared. My skin is baby-smooth, even toned, and if I had told you that approximately eight months ago I had deep acne scars on my face, you would never believe me.

I'm back to just the Souffle morning and evening for maintenance, but I'll NEVER take using my Alpha Hydrox products for granted ever again!

I bought this trimmer two months ago. I use it to keep my hair very short. I have not gone to a barber ever since I bought this. I simply turn the dial to set the guard to level 5 and cut all of my hair the same lenght. Definitely easy to use. On my short hair, I can probably get four complete haircuts in one charge. This is a good trimmer for those men who like to keep their hair very short all the way around. Use it two times and it would have paid for itself due to the fact that you were able to avoid going to a barber.
This is my second Norelco trimmer. My first one was a T6000 that I bought back in February of 2001. The battery stopped taking a charge four months ago, after almost 3 years of use. I called Norelco to have the battery replaced, and I was then informed that they do not replace the batteries on these trimmers since replacing the battery would cost as much as buying a newer unit. So, I ordered the newer T860 from Amazon. The T860 functions just like the older T6000. In addition, the T860 can also function as a corded trimmer, in the event the battery stops taking a charge. The service life of the trimmer can extend beyond the life of the rechargeable battery by using the cord. I am satisfied with it.
By the way, the reason why the battery got damaged in my older T6000 was that I kept the unit plugged in the charger stand for very long periods of time. I later learned not to do that, as that practice will damage the battery over time. Overcharging even a little seems to damage the battery over time. It's best to read the directions so you will know how to properly care for the battery. The battery basically will determine the life of the unit. The cutters do not wear out, from what I can tell. The motor seems durable. So the life of the unit is really how long you can keep the internal rechargeable battery working. Norelco's internal rechargeable Ni-Cad batteries can last a long time, if given proper care. They seem to be of good quality.
I had a Norelco 885 razor, and the battery was still taking a charge after nine years. The razor had the advantage of having a five level battery meter that tells you how much charge is left in the internal batteries. Basically, you want to wait until there is only a little charge left before you put the unit in the charger. It seems this trimmer is a bit different though. The instructions on the T860 unit say to completely drain the battery. Which would be a bit inconvenient. With the T860 trimmer, it takes 10 hours for a full charge. Recharge fully. That way, you can minimize the dreaded "memory effect" or voltage depression and extend the useful life of the rechargeable batteries. The rechargeable batteries are permanently soldered inside the unit. This trimmer unit, T860, does not have a charge meter. I refrained from getting the pricier unit with a charge meter in order to economize. However, my advice to you, if you're not too cost-sensitive, is to get a unit with a charge meter. That way, you will know when to charge the unit and when to remove the unit from the charger. That precise practice should help extend the life of the battery, and hence, the unit.

This is the latest shaver in Norelco's Quadra system. The shaving heads are mounted in such a way that gives them the freedom to depress independently of one another, to better adapt to the unique contours of your face. Another advantage to this razor is that the shaving heads can be washed under the faucet. This is a feature that the Quadra system razors share with the more expensive Spectra system razors.
This razor is light-years better than my previous Norelco. My last Norelco was the 885, bought back in 1991. That razor always irritated my skin, especially the neck area. Although it did last nine years. Three years ago, I switched to the Braun Syncro system. The Braun worked very well for me. Anyway, I decided to give Norelco another try. I was very surprised, and impressed, to say the least. This Quadra shaves just as close and just as comfortable as the Braun Syncro. And, it is very quiet. So far, I am only getting 35 minutes of shaving time per charge. But, I believe that the battery will reach its full capacity after a few more discharge and charge cycles.
For me, it is an even choice between this Norelco and the Braun. I can readily recommend either one. I suppose you just might have to try both and see which one will work better for you. One thing is obvious though. Either one will save you money in the long run, compared to using a blade shaver like the Mach 3, for example. The long-term cost of periodically buying replacement blades for a Mach 3 or Sensor Excel can easily exceed the price of either one of the electrics. I will admit, however, that neither of the electric razors can match the closeness of the Mach 3.
Smells awful not like the store

For many years I've always straightened my hair because I cannot seem to get the hang of using curling irons to make pretty spiral curls. Wearing the same hairstyle all the time with long hair can get a bit boring so I decided to search on Amazon for styling tools that are easy to use. I initially ordered the [[ASIN:B003FBI9LS Bed Head Deep Waver]] and really loved the results so much that I also purchased this Rock 'n' Roller styling iron, which I affectionately call my "bubble curler."

The Bed Head Rock 'n' Roller Ceramic Styling Iron comes with the iron itself along with a black protective glove to protect your hand from the heat of this iron since there is no clamp. The iron measures almost 15 inches in length, with the heating barrel measuring about 5 3/4 inches. The balls measure about one inch in diameter. The cord measures almost six feet so there is plenty of length to move around with it. The iron has a black ball at the top so you can hold it while using it, a safety stand that works well, an on/off switch, a temperature dial that allows you to choose among the low, medium, and high settings as well as the temperatures in between all of them, and a swivel cord so you can easily move the iron around as you use it. I found that it heats up quickly and cools off rapidly as well in case you need to pack it up in your suitcase soon after using it. The glove fits well but I didn't end up using it since it feels a bit awkward to use while trying to grip strands of hair so I took a chance and kept my hand bare, with no problems as long as I styled my hair in front of a mirror so I could watch closely what I was doing.

I found this styling iron a bit difficult to use at first but it gets easier with practice. I just winged it and have included some pictures of my end result. There is a chart in the instructions as to what heat setting is most likely appropriate for your hair type but they recommend you start with the lowest setting and increase the heat as needed. I have wavy to medium hair so I started off using the low setting but ended up using the medium setting. I have long hair and it was fairly simple to wrap my hair around the barrel. When I got toward the end of the strands of hair, I carefully wrap them around the barrel, holding my fingers as close as I can to the styling iron without actually touching it. Then I roll the styling iron towards my head as close as I can so my hair gets curled as much as possible. I hold my hair in that position for about 40 seconds and then release it and curl my whole head. It probably took about a half hour to style all of my hair and then I finished by spraying it with hairspray. I didn't add any product to my hair before I started although you probably could if your hair works better that way.

Overall, I am happy with this styling iron and really like the end result. Hopefully it will get easier to use with time. I found it a bit difficult to use because, without having a clamp on the iron, I had to hold both arms up in the air and my muscles got tired pretty quickly. I'm in fairly good shape but perhaps this will get easier with time. I actually prefer the [[ASIN:B003FBI9LS Bed Head Deep Waver]] because I feel it's easier to use and I love the beach waves I get from it so I will most likely use that one more but this one is still good to have. If you want spiral curls, I'd purchase the Rock 'n' Roller Styling Iron but if you prefer beach waves, I'd purchase the Deep Waver. The price is just what I wanted to spend and I like the fact that I can have more hairstyles than just straightened hair! I recommend purchasing this styling iron if you want to add some variety to your hairstyle and aren't comfortable using a regular curling iron to get spiral curls.

I've got serious problems with my feet and have for almost a decade.  My heels split, crack, bleed and it is extremely painful.  I've used this product many times since getting the stick and it helps only a tiny, tiny bit.  The key is to apply it to heels that have been soaked, rubbed, scrubbed, pumiced, etc.  Apply the product and then cover in an aloe-infused sock.  If you don't do these things to your feet in addition to using this item, it does nothing for it.  I do think the product works but not for SERIOUS problem feet.

I read, on a leaky gut blog, about dry brushing while doing detoxes so I ordered this brush to give it a try. This thing is pretty cool to be honest and I am so glad I opted for the brush that can be modified as such. I hate having “stuff” so anytime I can consolidate a product to be multi-use, especially living in a small space, it really helps. So using the brush does not feel entirely unpleasant but I am sure it will be something to get used to. It came wrapped in cellophane and really pretty tulle that it actually looked like a gift (a note for anyone ordering as a gift there is really no need to pay the extra fee for gift wrapping services). Also there is a velour draw string bag that fits the brush when it is assembled. The purple is gorgeous kind of reminds me of a Crown bag. I tested the brush out on one arm at work (I have packages delivered to me at work) and my coworker said my arm feels softer than the other. Oh and the TMI factor-I am calling it fairy dust for now but the white dust that flew off my arm, presumably dead skin, is kind of gross to see. Makes me want to go home and brush every bit! And so I will! I rarely give all 5 stars but I already love this thing

This is one product that really intrigued me. To be honest, I was a bit skeptical, but this cream really did deliver positive results! Now, this cream is in no way intended to take you from a A cup to a DD cup. That being said, it really did enhance my C cup breasts and give me cleavage that I never had before unless I used one of those super padded push up bras. I'd also like to mention that I have very sensitive skin and because this cream is made out of 100% all natural herbs, I had no adverse reaction or side effects at all!

I used this cream, which basically has no scent, twice a day and within a few days, I was seeing positive results. My 45 year old breasts are no longer on the saggy side. It really perked up the girls! All it took was 5 minutes to thoroughly massage this cream onto my breasts, being careful to avoid my nipples. This cream comes with a very detailed set of instructions on how to massage it onto your breasts, which actually felt very relaxing.

I was offered this product at a slightly reduced price in exchange for honest evaluation and review. It is my honest opinion that this cream does indeed deliver the desired results that women my age want. I would most definitely recommend it to a friend and plan on continuing to use this cream myself. The results speak for themselves.

I love to pamper myself with deep hydrating/anti-aging facial masks. After all, why do I need to spend a fortune on spa treatments when I can have that spa experience in the comfort and privacy of my own home. I received this particular mask at a special price for the purposes of product testing and reviewing. Everything contained in this review is my own personal experience using this mask.
First I made sure my face was freshly washed and found a quiet area where I could apply the mask and lay back and relax for 20 minutes. By quiet area, I mean I made sure I was home alone so no one would bother me, I turned the television off and played some soft soothing music to relax myself and to really give myself that spa experience.
Applying the mask was super simple and it completely fit all the contours of my face evenly. Thereby giving my face all the wonderful benefits of this rich hydrating formula. Then I just relaxed and let the mask do all the work. I have sensitive skin and was pleased that the all natural ingredients in this mask did not irritate my sensitive skin what so ever. In fact, it actually helped improve the look and feel of my skin after just one use. After the 20 minutes were up, I was amazed at how soft and hydrated my skin felt. I had no idea I had let my skin get that dry. I plan on taking time out for myself at least once a week to give myself a deep hydrating, anti-aging mask. After all, the key to younger looking skin, is keeping it well hydrated. I love these masks and would also recommend them. They make you feel great afterward!

I've been using this eye gel for over three weeks now. I've tried and tested several eye gels in the past. I'd rate this one some where in the middle of the pack. I'm glad to see that the price has come down from the $40 price tag it was when I was initially sent a bottle at a discounted price simply to provide my experience and opinion about this product. It does have some wonderful ingredients and I appreciate the generous size bottle and the fact that the print isn't too small to read both on the box and the bottle. Thank you for that. I also like that it's paraben free, not tested on animals, contains no dyes or fragrances and is made in America. I don't like that it contains Alcohol. It is on the bottom of the ingredient list but I'm thinking that it's needed to combat the stickiness. It does a great job at waking up tired eyes. Within minutes, fine lines fill in as this product seems to plump up your skin. Where I find it to be a problem is that I have to follow it up with another eye cream to lose the stickiness before applying makeup. On days when I don't wear makeup, it's not a problem. Probably because it has more time to penetrate the skin. Overall, it's a nice product that is now priced right.

They say the cure for cancer will be found in the sea. I've long been a fan of Dead Sea Mineral products so I was excited when LeliaSea sent me a sample to try and test as a consumer for the purpose of this review. Here's my opinion:

It's packaged quite nicely. I don't detect much of a scent at all which is nice so it won't compete with my fragrances. However, I think it's quite small for a body lotion.
