It's the size of a hand cream. So given it's size, I feel like it's a bit pricey but it is a nice lotion. It soaks in quickly to dry skin and is highly moisturizing. It works well on my legs but on my hands it feels a little greasy. It's best to use on the driest parts of your body. Overall, I think it's a great lotion for extremely dry skin.

This is a wonderful serum. When it first arrived, I was most impressed with it's packaging. It was sealed. So many are not largely because it's not required by law so I was pleasantly surprised to see that the box was sealed. When I opened the box, you're immediately greeted with a beautiful bottle. The cap snaps on and off firmly like it should. There's a pretty rose design on it as well. The serum has a pleasant scent, it's clear and just the right consistency. Some others are runnier than I like. Best of all, this serum is non drying yet firming. I put it all over my face and neck twice a day and followup with a quality moisturizer. I've been using a variety of Vitamin C Serums as a avid product tester for the past 6 months with excellent results. This one ranks in my top five and not as pricey as others I've tried. A great value. Sample provided to test as a consumer for review purposes regardless of my honest opinion.

I actually purchased the Aneomne Wind Flower Hair Dryer by XTAVA but was sent the Peony by mistake. However when I opened the package I just fell in love with the bright pink dryer!  Pink is after all my favorite color!  The Peony is compact and will fit in a suitcase with ease for traveling. I love the multiple speeds and the different heat settings. I have fairly short hair and this dried my hair in a matter of minutes on medium speed. It would have taken less time if I didn't have to use brushes to style with.  It does come with two concentrator nozzles one for long hair and one for short.  I love these because I use a round brush and this allows me to direct heat to the area I'm working on and the rest of my hair isn't blowing around all over the place. It is a bit loud but that doesn't bother me and I don't find any any heavier than other dryers I've had that are made by XTAVA. All in all I love the dryer and expect to have years of use from it as long as my nieces don't steal it just because of the girly color. I was offered the Aneomme Wind Flower Dryer at a substantial discount for testing and providing feedback. Please know that Amazon offered me a mailing label to return the dryer so I wouldn't be out any money for returning. I'm happy that I kept it!

Guys buying this stuff are doing it as much for the great scent as for their skin after shaving. The cream, soap and splash in the Venture set are not sillage monsters but they have far greater scent strength than the balm.

Since balm is the final step of the shave, it should have a bit more fragrance I should think.

So same great Captain’s Choice balm properties as all their flavors. But the beautiful Venture scent is unfortunately too weak to warrant a repeat purchase.

If, however, you plan to use a cologne, the upside is this stuff won’t get in the way, and your face will feel terrific.

I admit I’m a shaving hobbyist. Soaps are like Pokémon, gotta catch ‘me all.

But we hobby shavers end up using these soaps once or twice and if they aren’t in our top 20 we put them up on the Reddit shaver trading boards. This way we can try ten soaps for the price of two, keep the ones we like and trade the rest looking for more winners.

Ladies and germs, this is a winner. My first Ogallalla product, I tried it on the recommendation of a guy I frequently trade with whose tastes are similar in many ways and who likes and demands the same performance characteristics of his shaving soaps. When he recommends one I sit up and listen.

So let’s talk performance. This soap, with my 26mm synthetic shaving brush, makes a ton of lather. A surprising amount. I kept adding water to get it down from “cake batter” to “pancake batter” to the soft whipped peaks and glossy sheen that lets me know it’s hydrated enough for maximum slickness. A nice thirsty shaving stick. Hooray. The ingredient list is vegan. I generally prefer soaps with tallow bases and added lanolin but I’m open minded about it. There are some vegan soaps in my keeper drawer.

Slickness was very good. Not quite what you can get from B&M’s “Reserve” line or good old Mitchell’s Wool Fat but very close. Lather, once worked to a good sheen and soft peaks, did not dissipate on the brush or dry on my skin. Maintains hydration well. Once again, B&M does it better, but for over $4 an ounce it ought to. For $1.50/oz. this stuff performs very well indeed. And as a bonus they include the plastic stick dispenser you won’t get from Arko or Speick. I just found my go-to travel shaving soap.

Scent: clovey but not as clovey as Ogallala’s matching aftershave, particularly the double strength. I found following my shave with Ogallala Bay Rum + Sweet Orange aftershave, regular strength, left my face smooth, disinfected, hydrated, and smelling like a Christmas tree but in a good way. The traditional clove top note fades on the dry down, leaving you with a really good scent for the rest of the day.

Some guys hate cloves. They get their bay rum fix from B&M, which uses no clove in its bay rum products. I like that too.

But this is a fantastic shaving experience for a shockingly low price, with added travel benefits. I’ll especially use it as the weather cools. I’m not keeping it because it performs well relative to price. I’m keeping it because it performs well regardless of price. The low price and portability are bonuses.

If you are a spice aficionado like me I recommend you try this shaving stick and don’t skimp on the water.

Of the traditional great shaving soaps, MWF is the postshave king. Barrister & Mann, L&L, Wholly Kaw, A&E, Italian Extro, there are wonderful soaps out there. They all have great scents and most can match MWF in slickness, cushion and glide. And they’re really close on the post shave. But good old MWF still rules the post shave roost. I love Mitchell’s Wool Fat. I have a Simpson’s Emperor badger brush that was very expensive. Tried and tried to get it to work with MWF, couldn’t get a lather no matter what I tried. I liked the stuff anyway. Then I got a $20 synthetic Plisson knockoff brush. It is the missing link. Loads in 30 seconds, face lathers wonderfully.

If you are having trouble lathering MWF do what I did and get a fat synthetic brush. It transforms the Mitchell’s experience.

Combined with my favorite razor, the Rockwell 6s set to “3” with a Feather blade, a good aftershave lotion and cologne, I’ve got an awesome shave here.

Provides plenty of slickness and cushion like any traditional tallow soap. But the addition of unsaponified lanolin (which also makes it hard to lather) gives this stuff its unparalleled post-shave feel. You will love your soft face after shaving with Mitchell’s and so will your wife, girlfriend or both.

Clean off with a hot damp washcloth, then pat dry and hit with a generous amount of Speick aftershave splash. Your pores will immediately tighten up, whiskers will retract, and you will have a perfectly smooth face.

If you are going to use Feathers, the samurai sword of DE blades, you need a slick soap like Mitchell’s to keep from cutting yourself. Mitchell’s does its job well.

Get some. It might be your favorite too. I will always keep it in my rotation.
Thin and flimsy. The pump clogs. The pump line needs to be cut down. And at almost two dollars for ten cents worth of bottle it's way too expensive

This is really wonderful stuff. The application directions are unusual. Following them, I put four drops (that's what works for me) in my palm, then rub my palms together until they feel warm. Then I pat my face with them, applying the serum all over. I spread it gently afterwards to make sure I haven't missed any areas. The solution is very quickly absorbed and leaves my skin feeling as soft as a baby's bottom, as the old expression says. I'm mean it's reeeealy soft, and not oily or greasy at all. It's AMAZING. What really has me addicted is the smell. It's not floral or citrus, or really like anything I can put my finger on. If I had to, I'd say it's faintly sweet… possibly herbal? Well, whatever it is, it's intoxicating to me. It lingers just a while after the serum dries and I thoroughly enjoy it. I'd wear this scent as a perfume if it were available. It's not strong or offensive; it's just unique and pleasant. I recommend this with enthusiasm!!

I recently started using one of these with loofa on it. It works for me, even if loofa does take a while to break in. However, it also absorbs quite a bit of soap. I like this one much better.

I was a little hesitant to order it. How would silicone feel against my back? It turns out that it feels fine and works well. I like that it needs much less soap since it doesn't absorb it. Instead of spreading it all over the thing - I like the side with little bristles like a brush - all you need is to put some in the center. Moving the brush over your back spreads the soap out nicely and does the job without a lot of waste. It squeaks a bit on un-soaped skin, but that's pretty easy to get over and doesn't last long. It was just a surprise, initially. It feels like a gentle scrub, and that's the important part. It also rinses off easily and dries quickly, an important point here in our humid climate. The interior relative humidity in our house hovers around 55% in the summer, so things can get moldy fast. That's what usually happens if a loofa or any other kind of absorbent surface isn't dried properly. I just hang this up on the thoughtfully provided suction hooks and forget about it. It's great, and I'm really glad I gave this a try!

I know that loofahs take a while to break in, but I think this product has other issues. I'm a woman with smaller hands. This is just too oversized for me. It's difficult to hold and control. It's also overstuffed with a very convex surface, so only the center of the raised area actually touches my body. It doesn't mold itself to the surface of my skin, so I feel like I'm scrubbing in thin lines, and it doesn't really do the job in the dips and grooves a human body has because of that. It does dries quickly, even though I don't have anything to hang it off of. I'm pretty disappointed with this order and I can't recommend this product.

I had some reservations... I’ve seen the round wood ones around, but never made the leap. I was afraid the ceramic would make this too heavy and bulky, but it does not. It’s quite lightweight and because it’s vertical, saves some space. It comes with extensive directions - a nice change - but is really very easy to use and set up. It’s very hot and humid where I live, so I was also worried that adding more humidity to the air would be a bad thing, however, the air that comes out is quite cool, which seems to cool down the area around it (and by “it”, I mean me). I found it very comfortable.

I wasn’t sure how I felt about the colored lights option, but I love it! You can choose red, or a brighter red, and also green and a soft lavender blue with their corresponding brighter shades. You can choose to have your color, or opt to have the unit cycle through them all. It’s quite restful. You can, of course, just use the white light. You can set the steam for a continuous output or intermittent.

The until must be cleaned after 10 hours of use. It doesn’t hold a great deal of water, so I was wondering if that was going to be inconvenient. I ran it for two continuous hours and I could tell that filling the tank twice would be about 10 hours. So THAT’S easy to keep track of!

All in all, I couldn’t be happier with this unit! It checks all the boxes and I can enjoy my essential oils in an peaceful, comforting environment. Highly recommended!!

I am a female in my 60s. I have tried a number of anti-wrinkle creams, products and this serum. I used it for several days around one eye and left the other eye untreated. The difference between the treated eye and the untreated eye was barely discernible. In contrast I have found two creams by other manufacturers that make a noticeable improvement. So I will not buy more of this and cannot recommend it.

The quality of the wig is outstanding and the style is very similar to the picture with a little trimming/thinning/styling. There is a lot of hair, evenly distributed through the lace cap and has sewn in clips to attach with ease. It was a little large at the top of the wig and it was very easy to sew a few tucks to take out some of the bulk.

The write up clearly states the color may be different than what is in the picture due to the monitor or lighting. The wig I see on my screen looks like a light brown with blonde highlights. The wig I received is the color of the highlights in the picture and is more blonde than light brown. If you are looking for light brown with blonde highlights, you may be disappointed. I like to play with different wig colors and styles and I am ok with the color. At this price you are getting a quality product and really can't go wrong, unless you aren't willing to do a little trimming or accept a slightly different color.

I had a leg and bikini wax with this product and liked it a great deal.  In the past, I've used soy wax (Nufree) in salons and this is also a great product because it doesn't bond to the skin making it much less painful and more to the point doesn't cause near the amount of skin irritation.  The Plum Smooth wax does the same thing but with the added bonus of having a more pleasant smell.  I also found that I had even less post-wax irritation with this than with any other wax I've used.  For my at-home waxing I've used consumer available wax strips like Veet, etc.  but these universally are low quality and, in addition to being more painful (even to an experienced waxer like me), cause irritation and sometimes even bruising/broken skin in the more sensitive areas where the skin it thinner.  This product is better than anything else I've tried and here's hoping that the results continue to be as good as the first couple times of use.  As a side note - the other reviewer had negative results and correctly stated that what works for some people may not work with others - in my experience people that have not had good results with soy wax or the Plum Smooth due to irritation it has been because of allergies or incorrect use of the product, but these are generally considered to be much gentler on the skin than any sugar waxes or products you can purchase as a consumer.

I have tried just about every volumizing powder on the market, from the cheap to the pricey. They are usually pretty similar in results, with the only big differences being scent and applicator.  I used almost the entire bottle of this brand before I gave my opinion, making sure I tried using it in every way one could. Final opinion is: Major Fail. It doesnt come out of the applicator easily,  coming out in tiny chunks rather than powder UNLESS you squeeze the bottle while you shake. That results in product going everywhere and you waste half of it. (See photo of product on my shirt! Chunks!) The amount which DOES manage get in your hair works, but no better than other brands.  I'm disappointed and annoyed with this product and wont purchase it again.

At the suggestion of my periodontist, I purchased this Oral B Vitality Precision and am having a difficult time rating it.  Yes, I think it does the job.  When the brush vibrates at the two minute mark, I am able to keep brushing because it does not stop until I turn it off.  The problem with me is that I have been using the Oral B Cross Action battery operated brush for years and in comparing this new brush to the battery operated, I believe the battery operated Cross Action brush did a better job. My mouth felt cleaner after using the battery operated brush.  Perhaps if I buy the Cross action brush heads for the Vitality Precision, I will be more positive. Since the periodontist told me I was doing a great job brushing (with my Oral B battery operated), perhaps I was too fast to even consider a different toothbrush.

I never had luscious lashes. They are also very short. I had to use a lot of mascara in order for them to even be seen. As I matured, those problems became more pronounced. So one day I decided that I was going to be brave and try false lashes. That day came in my 64th year. I struggled with putting them on so much! I put on too much glue or not enough glue or it wasn't tacky enough or I put them on incorrectly-so many ways to fail, and I seemed skilled at every one of those failures. The few times that I did venture out wearing them I felt like Carol Burnett in her comedy show portraying Marlena Dietrich. Then I stumbled upon these . Not only do these go on easily but they've taught me how to put on eyelashes. So now I can use glue and position other types of lashes and so forth due to the practice I was allowed with these pre-glued ones. They weralready glued all you had to do was make sure it fit your eye and then stick them on. Hallelujah! I have eyelashes!
DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME, THEIR TIME TO PACK IT, OR DELIVER IT.

This doesn’t work as described at all. It’s terrible. I do not recommend this product for anyone. There is suction but not enough to clear any pores. There was a card in package asking for 5 star review in exchange for a gift card worth almost the price of the product. I started a return and missed the return window, now I’m stuck with this garbage.

These are just adorable!! Such a great variety of colors, we have one for almost any outfit. The ONLY reason im rating it 4 stars, instead of 5 is because 2 out of 10 of the hair ties are so long and idk how many times we will really use them. Other than that, these are just fabulous and have been used every day since weve recieved them. Ive already recieved so many compliments and wouuld definetly recommend these to everyone!! They are cute for adults and children. LOVE LOVE LOVE! They even came with an extra scrunchie!  Bonussss

Updated review: I've changed my rating from a 4 to a 2 and the only reason it's not a 1 is because I love the variety. These peices dont stay in their hair. Not 1 piece has made it threw naptime or even a 10 minute car ride. I constantly have to redo or tighten them because they just slip out, no matter how tight. My daughter is 2 with hair passed her shoulders so Its not like im grasping at fuzz either. Definitely not worth the price.

Ive been so excited for these and am not disappointed at all. I do have to say that I think the price is a bit steep for hair ties but i have yet to experience a break which is a huge plus. I hate getting my 2 year olds hair just right and when i go to tie it up, the dang tie snaps. Iv used about 6 different ones so far and they've all kept their hold and didnt stretch out either. Love the variety, all the different colors and animals make it fun for my little one too, she likes picking them out on her own.
These are great! Extremely sharp but have a strong handle so you dont have to worry about slipping. Effective and nice presentation. I would definitely recommend these.
Was really hoping this qas like a si.ilar product by this company and it's nowhere even close. Bring back the sugar amd salt one pleaseee
I barley used them and the sprayer doesn’t work on all 4 after a couple of months of very light use.

Would live to say that this was the best hair dryer diffuser I have ever used... the problem?  The "universal" diffuser would not fit either of my blow dryers, which are your basic brands and sizes. The diffuser must be used with a dryer that is either narrow or tapered. It appears to be a quality product, but doesn't meet my needs and is destined for the charity bin.

I've had a beard for 3 years. It's pretty thick and heavy and tends to grow in thickness/volume and not length. It's more like a face afro, if you will. Overall it's a pretty healthy beard but I decided to give Wild Willie's a shot since I like their beard butter so much.

First off I when the bottle arrived i really thought they werr small. So for $30 i wasnt sure if it was money well spent. Time will tell.
Second I love the peppermint smell. I don't feel it's overpowering at all and find it refreshing in the morning. The shampoo lathers really well and a dime size goes a long way, even in my thick beard. We do have soft water FYI, so that usually helps any soap/shampoo lathers better. It feels like it cleans really well with out drying my beard out.

The conditioner goes a long way as well. About a dime to penny size drop is all I need depending on how thick my beard has gotten. I let the conditioner sit for about 5 minutes to let it really work in. It leaves a nice cool tingling feeling on my face and has the great peppermint smell. When I rinse it, it doesn't leave a heavy conditioner feel and rinses cleanly.

Overall I think it does a good job. It leaves my beard moisturized and not dried out and somewhat soft. Definitely keeps my beard looking healthy and shiny. In fact, while I actually get a lot of compliments on having a really great beard; once I started using these products I got so many more compliments. Now, that may just be a coincidence.

Overall I'm so far satisfied. Both shampoo and conditioner have lasted about a month with less than half used. Both of which I use on a daily basis.
Ok

I'm a tweezing/waxing maniac. Although it does hurt to wax, it doesn't suck as much as having to shave all the time, so I prefer it over shaving. The downside to that is that it is so expensive. In my town, an underarm wax can cost $22 plus tip, and since the hair will grow back at different times you may end up wishing for another wax just a week later. You also have to wait until it's long enough too. Since I was tired of the cost of waxing and I don't mind the pain of waxing or plucking, I thought an epilator would be a good buy. I did a lot of research on each type and finally settled on this one about 6 months ago based on the positive reviews. I made the right choice, for sure, and it has paid for itself at least 5 times over by now.
Pros:
*It is actually better not to let the hair grow long, so that means you don't have to be hairy for long periods of time
*You can do it at any given time, if there is anything to pull, which is way better than a once-per month trip to the waxer's shop.
*It doesn't hurt as bad once you are consistent with it, just like with waxing.
*It is fairly easy to clean and easy to recharge
*The flashlight is a great tool to help see those hairs you would miss just off the ceiling lights.
*You can use it almost anywhere, or anywhere you have help from another pair of unwary hands. Bikini line, chin, upper lip, underarm, leg, arm, you name it. My underarms and bikini line are my favorite places to use it.
*You can use it in the shower
*The battery lasts pretty long, like an hour
Cons:
*If you try to give yourself a brazilian wax with it by yourself, you are gonna have a bad time. I tried and failed. Luckily, the top part came off before it could do any damage, so it was really just a bit scary. It jammed when that happened, and wouldn't turn back on, but I just plugged it in for a charge and it was back to normal.
*It hurts pretty bad. As opposed to waxing, which takes it all off in one go, it pulls hairs one at a time like tweezing, but at a fast pace. That means there is a lot of breath holding and holding of skin to keep it all tight because you don't know when or how many hairs it will find and pull out. I suggest taking 600mg of Ibuprofen a half hour before you intend to do it... or maybe a few glasses of wine if you'd rather not use traditional drugs.
*The hair will fly EVERYWHERE, but where else would it go, I guess?

Just had my first shave with this. I've used two electric razors in my life. One was an already ancient one that my dad had, about 40 years ago. Ripped each of the few hairs in my face out one by one. Then an early Norelco 3-head circular job, about 30 years ago that either sucked or I didn't know how to use. Very even stubble was the result of that. Hence my refusal to try one until my memories have faded.

This review reflects one shave - not a long term review.

I'm impressed. It's slower than I expected, I half-thought I could activate an app on my phone or something and I would be shaved (I'm joking!). It's pretty darn close to a manual 5-blade fresh razor.

Here are the conditions under which I'm reporting:
- I'm 62, so my skin isn't exactly taut on my face.
- Not a heavy beard, I need to shave every day now, but not until I was about 35.
- This shave was with 2 days of stubble.
- I usually shave in the shower, using Braille to tell when a patch is smooth.

I used the razor dry. The manual said to charge the razor before first use, but it came out of the box showing 100% charge so I went for it. The manual also says not to apply too much pressure, so I was tentative at first. It helps to apply fair pressure while moving the razor SLOWLY through that fungus that seems to grow constantly on our faces.

Stretching my skin with other-handed fingers in most spots helped. I used a mirror just to watch the progress, but you can use your sonic sensors, AKA ears, to tell when the blades are and aren't removing stubble. I don't think a mirror is at all necessary, YMMV.

While I've been writing this, I've used Braille again to check on the usual trouble spots - I can just grab the mower and run it over the rough bits while I'm doing this. You could do this easily while driving somewhere - no risk of a small knick, and the aural attention that it takes doesn't really distract from driving.

I didn't notice when I ordered this razor that it came with an extra foil. Nice detail, since the foil is easy to damage being thin (as it should be). The kit comes with a carrying bag, which is nice to keep everything together while traveling. I would find a small rigid container for the extra foil if I were to travel with that - it could easily get bent in the carrying bag knocking around with all the bits. The foil is too long for the old canisters from film cameras, but a cut-off from a roll of Xmas paper would suffice.

The grip is comfortable and makes the shaving head easy to maneuver. The carrying bag contains everything in a small package - I'm a Cardinal (Archbishops and above don't shave) in the Church of Small Luggage and I will happily carry this instead of a couple of manual razors on any trip.

Finally (applause erupts from the crowd), very nearly close shave as a manual razor, a little slower than a manual razor, works very well dry (absolutely unlike a manual razor, though I've tried that also and it does sort of work).

Buy it. Try it.

This unit is well designed, quiet; feels good in the hand and super-easy to clean. The shave was comfortable and did not irritate my face. The price is quite reasonable. Unfortunately it didn't shave close enough for me. If I made many passes I could get a close shave but would find that by 4pm I would need to shave again(not that my beard is so heavy). Like all electrics I've used it does a sub-par job under the chin and on the neck. I've decided to send it back and go back to my Braun. Right now I've used the Norelco and then finished with the Braun, which even with year-old blades is much closer and just as fast.

This is electric shaver number five for me (4 bought thru Amazon). I started ~15 years ago with a norelco 5xxx series, and was satified for a few years. Despite changing the blades (perhaps my beard got tougher)I became dissatisfied with the shave. I switched to a Braun 5000 series which was noticably closer with the exception of the neck which required many passes to shave adequately.

The Braun lost it's edge after about a year or two, and I decided to try one of the Panasonic ultra-high speed, wet-dry units (10,000)strokes/min. I got a good deal on a close-out unit. I liked the build and the wet-dry feature, and the ease of cleaning, but I found that this shaver irritated my skin. I went back to the braun, and later upgraded to a Braun 7526, which I bought refurbished without the cleaning unit. It does a superior job and next time I upgrade I may buy the unit with the cleaner. It needs new blades yearly for best results, and it too doesn't do a great job with on my neck; but everything else is excellent.
IT WORKS.

The Maybuy Professional Hair Clippers/Beard Trimmers comes with 3 attachments, 1/2 inch, 1 inch and 1.5 inches. These attachments simply clip onto the head of the trimmer. You also get a small brush for cleaning the trimmer and a charging cable which strangely is a USB to Mini-USB even though at the bottom of the trimmer is your standard two prong charging connector.

Being able to charge this via USB however is great for when you need to go on holiday/vacation as you always have some kind of USB charging device with yourself (usually for your phone). On a full charge the clippers will roughly 2 hours and are small enough to just throw in your toiletry bag.

The trimmer itself has a nice shape to it and is comfortable to hold in your hand. It also has a fairly nice heft to it, not too light but not heavy. It feels like you are really holding on to something though.

The head is fairly wide which can be a plus in that it doesn't take long at all to trim an area but can also be a bit of a minus depending on the shape of your face if you are trimming your beard. The action is smooth and has a nice gliding feel to it, even if you don't use any attachments and just use the trimmer head itself.

It would have been nice if the Maybuy came with some sort of carrying case to put it, the attachments and the charging cord in but it doesn't unfortunately. The attachments do come in a small Ziploc bag.

Overall a nice trimmer, nice action and makes quick work whether trimming your beard or hard to reach places like around your ears.

I am not impressed with this makeup organizer.  This organizer reminds me of the inexpensive makeup box I use to buy my girls when they were 6 years old.  I expected a lot more from this organizer considering it cost almost $55.  This is a plastic organizer.  The organizer has some scuff marks on the body and then a couple on the clear top lid.  I am disappointed with this organizer especially at this price point.

So as I have stated in previous skin care  product reviews, I am EXTREMELY vain. That is probably due to the fact that I suffer with Adult Acne. Never had acne until I reached my mid 20's. So as a fair skin woman in her mid 30's my focus is to lessen the severity of my outbreaks, and to keep my skin looking youthful and CLEAR! Like other women in my predicament I have spend loads of money on what seems like millions of products sometimes they work, then after a couple of months they cease to have any effect. So besides incorporating multivitamins into my life (B complex, Flaxseed oil, MSM, DMAE, etc) which I take pretty consistently, I drink plenty of water or as much as I can take, eat fairly healthy (no soda, no juice, no candy, no chips, little to no fast food) and of course I exercise. All these things will play into how healthy your skin will and can be! So on a recent trip to South Carolina, I ran into a Marshall's and I always check out the skincare section. Now within the last couple of months my skin will begin to clear up completely then BAM I will get a medium red nodule, or inflamed whitehead.... UGH! And though you are not suppose too I always pop mine to relieve the pain and pressure. I always do it with clean hands, and typical wash my face with my 10% sulfur soap I purchased here on Amazon. So when I ran into this Brightening product for $6.99 it caught my eye. With all the sulfur and scrubs and acne drying products my skin was looking pretty dull and kinda flaky. I needed something to help diminish my acne scars, moisturize and smooth out my skin... and the fact that this product claimed to help with anti aging was the icing on the cake... so I took it home and gave it a whirl.... its been about 2 1/2 weeks I have used this product 2x a day each day as it is not heavy and provides the extra moisture I need. I have noticed significant difference in the color and size of my scars. my skin feels smooth and soft. I feel good about this product sofar I have had no adverse reactions to this serum. With any product it takes a keen eye and diligence to becoming successful in your skincare goals. I will see how I feel about this product once I finish the bottle. If this product continues to show me positive gradual results I might purchase another product as this is cheap and effective. As we head into a new year I am looking to go more organic in my skincare products and spend alil less than I have this year and previous years.

The plastic is thick but other than that, this isn't good quality. The zippers are flimsy and hard to close. While the bag is large with many compartments, I couldn't get very much inside. In fact, my much smaller makeup bag holds more. I don't think it's good for travel cause it's gonna take up so much space. There are better options out there.
They look really cheaply made to me...

Too expensive - I use organic coconut oil that I get at TJ’s for 5 bucks or so and I add a couple of drops of high quality iodine from heritage and then afterward I use ipsab. Works so well on my gums and also my chronic sinus infection goes away. I do it every day. much cheaper than this.

Ok, here's my summary review of this trimmer.

I've had a T900 trimmer for a few years now and wanted to upgrade to a new and hopefully better trimmer. I've had it now for two weeks and here's what I think...

* The vacuum is great, period. When shaving with my Norelco T900, the shavings would fly all over the place --- in the sink, behind the faucet, in between the handles of the faucet, and on the floor. With the vacuum set on low, I barely see any clippings now! Now, my wife doesn't get mad any more!

* The height adjustment can be easily set, and unlike other reviews mention, I haven't accidentally changed the setting without knowing.

* The clipper works great and easily cuts/trims without any effort. This is an upgrade from my T900.

* Battery holds its charge pretty well. You can use it with a power cord also when the battery is low.

* The smaller trimmer is a now a separate attachment. My T900 has it attached to the trimmer, and it can be popped up or down when needed. To me, this is a downgrade as it is not as convenient.

* The parts seem somewhat delicate. I try to be careful as to not cause damage.

Overall, the price is good, it works well, and I'm glad I purchased it, and would recommend it to all.

Baebody Retinol Serum 2.5%: Best Anti Wrinkle, Anti Aging Serum for Face. Helps Reduce Appearance of Wrinkles, Fine Lines. Enhanced Organic Ingredients with Vitamin E
Pros:
I have tried a couple wrinkle serums. The one is a little thicker than some, but I like it as it doesn't run on your skin then. It's seems quite gentle as I use it daily. There are no side effect that I can see. I've only been using it for under 2 wks and will update this post if I see any good/bad changes. The bottle is nice sold and it comes with an eye dropper to make applying easier.
Cons:
I would prefer a pump or just dabbing it on.

Conclusion:
I like how my skin feels so far, again will update along the way. I will purchase this again.
I received this Baebody Retinol Serum 2.5%: Best Anti Wrinkle for a promotional price for testing and evaluation purposes. I was not paid for my review and was asked only to provide unbiased honest feedback regarding the product, whether it be positive or negative.

There’s a learning curve. I’m relatively good with liquid liner, but the applicator brush for the magnetic eyeliner is junk. Next time I’ll try capping some product on glass and using my own brush to apply. The lashes are pretty good compared to other brands. The 5 magnets as opposed to 4 is nice. I had some trouble with the corners staying down. It’s a little tedious to get the liner timing and placement of the lashes just right. Not the most comfortable, but what falsies are? The eyeliner is really difficult to remove even with eye makeup remover. A dab of coconut oil on a Qtip worked the best but did not entirely remove the product., which is why I took of a star. Last think I want when I remove makeup is any residue stuck on my face.

To be fair, these are decent. They are not as nice as MoxieLashes, but they are also 1/3 of price. Compared to MoxieLash I’d rate them a solid three stars, but based on the price point, I’d say they are four stars.

Sidenote: if you are ever needing a heavy duty waterproof eyeliner, you could use the magnetic liner with or withojr the lashes because it does not budge. Was surprised my to exit the shower after deep cleaning my face to find my eyeliner exactly perfect still. Not what I wanted at the time, but worth noting for when I need that kind of staying power.
These are junk. Do yourself a favor and invest in a quality brush. It makes all the difference.

Initially a 5 star review but I’m now changing it to 1 star. It worked great when it worked. I used it 4 time to do my acrylics and on the 5th use It initially worked great for removing gel polish from one hand but the would not turn back on when I tried to start the other. I’m replacing the fuse to see if that works. Not sure if that’s what’s wrong but if not I’ll be having to buy another unit elsewhere. The return period On this item conveniently ran out 6 days ago. Totally disappointed that this didn’t last long at all.

I'd rate these a 5 out of 10. They cheapo clippers aren't very sharp. They get the job done on normal to thinner fingernails, but I think if you have thicker or harder nails, these won't be good. I don't expect they'd be very good on even normal, healthy toenails, just in case you were hoping to use these hand clippers on your feet, too.

This is the 2nd set of clippers I've had to buy here on Amazon because the first ones were too dull. I returned those first ones I got and bought these after reading the decent reviews on these. They'll suffice, I guess, but they are by no means the sharpest or best clippers. I actually wouldn't recommend these to a friend. Unless it was a guy friend; these would be okay for guys, but not for pretty girl nails. And there's NO WAY these are cutting thru acrylic nails.

Go ahead and splurge and just get the higher priced clippers. Save this cheap junk for your 'tween boys and the men who bite their cuticles and don't care if their clippers tear their nails rather than cut them.

WOWWW!! Why didn't I buy this months ago?! This is by far the prettiest, and now my favourite, out of my 4 wigs! I think I'll be buying several more of these so I'll never be without one! It's not shiny at all, very real looking. Is soft enough to feel like real hair. Will probably get matted at least slightly-moderately while wearing since ALL synthetic wigs do, so keep a pick in your purse and keep the unit conditioned with an appropriate wig spray or maybe a little silicone-based leave-in hair gloss, like Biosilk. Wig experts or YouTube videos can advise you on this best.

Running my fingers through it right out of the package, to detangle and fluff it, I noticed there was absolutely no shedding. When combing it, there was no shedding. I was quite shocked. My other blonde wig from Kryssma sheds LIKE CRAZY and already has huge bald spots in it after brushing it only 5 or 6 times since purchase.

I hope this wig won't be the same!!! To try to ensure against it, and because this wig is so much curlier, I'll try to only finger comb it.

I have very sparse eyebrows so powders, gels, and pencils always looked fake. I bought this pen to try before considering real microblading. I am so happy with this product. You can really control how much product you put on your brows, and the tri-tip is awesome at creating a more authentic look. It also stays on much longer than other products I have tried. I will definitely buy this again and highly recommend!
this gel flaked on me. it's snowing in April

I was shopping for replacement cutters and combs for a Norelco Micro Action (formerly Lift & Cut [formerly Rotatract]) shaver and noticed that for less than $10 more I could have a whole new Norelco shaver. I was sold.

Norelco Reflex Plus shavers combine 4 features pioneered by Norelco and improved over time. Rotary heads reduce the vibration common to reciprocating shavers. Floating heads individually hug the skin. Lift and Cut blades gently pull whiskers into the cutter for a closer shave. Everything rides on a set of pivoting platforms that bulge slightly at the center of the head assembly. The bulge allows the heads to maintain contact with the contours of difficult to shave spots like the concave hollows of the neck below the chin.

I've been a Norelco man from my first crop of peachfuzz to my current orchard of gray quills, so the first shave wasn't a surprise for my skin. It was as close and comfy as I'd expect from a Norelco.

The real revelation was the sound. The previous Lift and Cut was like shaving with a Black & Decker DustBuster. The Reflex Plus is so quiet, you can actually hear the cutters slice off the whiskers and then fall silent on the next pass over the same area. This is a real help for those times when a mirror isn't nearby. You could actually shave by the sound alone!

A somewhat poignant note: Models at the economy end of the Norelco line are now made in China and lack carrying bags of any kind. When I travel, I roll my shaver in an article of clothing, usually a T-shirt, so the carrying case is no biggie. Still, I miss seeing the words "MADE IN HOLLAND" on the bottom of every Norelco I've owned.

Times may change but at least the quality of the shave has only improved.

I really loved this product for the first two days... after that... not so much. I had really high hopes for it so I went into it with a positive attitude. I've been using it for weeks now so I feel like I can write an accurate review. First of all, it tells you to use 30 pumps on your hair if you have long hair. That is basically the whole bottle... so if you can afford to spend $30 on every shampoo, maybe it will work better for you. I used one pump on the top of my hair, one pump on the bottom and then after I rinsed it out, one more pump to leave on my ends. The first two days it made my hair look supermodel perfect... after that, it was so disgustingly greasy that I couldn't handle it. I started to work back a shampoo into my routine here and there to help with that- but now every single time I use it, its nothing but grease and weighed down matted down hair. Also, my hair is back to frizzy and not shiney... I would not recommend spending the money on this. I am having far better luck with organic shampoo and conditioners.

Let me start by saying, I did NOT order this from Amazon. I ordered it from Sephora. The reviews here regarding whether this product was a fake or not made me a little leery. So, I'm reviewing the real Josie Maran Vibrancy foundation and not the Amazon version, real or not.

As usual, I ordered the lightest shade, RG5. It's a nearly perfect match. It's described as being for fair skin with neutral undertones. I typically prefer foundations with pink undertones, but this actually worked really well for me.

The consistency is on the thin, runny side, which isn't surprising since oil is an ingredient. Having said that, this foundation sits on the skin so beautifully. It looks like real skin. It's definitely not a matte foundation, so if that's your preference, this is not the foundation for you. This foundation gives you more luminous, dewy-looking skin. I don't typically care for dewy foundations, but again, I was surprised to like this one. It just made my skin look healthy and plump. It didn't look at all heavy, which is great because it didn't settle into my fine lines. I did notice it took a while to set. Again, not surprising considering the oil content, but you'll want to make sure you set it with powder before trying to blend blush/contour/bronzer, etc. Otherwise, you'll likely look pretty streaky.

Many reviewers here have mentioned a smell. I didn't notice that at all, which is another reason I think the product people are buying here might not be legit.

The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because my t-zone gets oily fairly quickly while wearing it.

I'd recommend this for more mature skin and dry skin types. If you're oily, you can definitely still wear it, you just might have to blot a bit more than usual.

Overall, though, a great foundation. Just make sure it's what you're looking for. It's a very specific look.

3.5 stars

I have many thoughts on this wig. We ordered this to compliment my daughter's Mad Hatter Halloween costume and honestly, it looked like a hot mess when it arrived. The bangs were going everywhere, the curls were tangled, there was no part...it was awful.

My daughter, who is 12, has long, VERY thick blonde hair. When the wig arrived, we tried it on with her hair down to make sure it fit. It did. Fast forward to Halloween...I braided her hair and pulled it into a knot at the back of her head. Lo and behold, the wig wouldn't fit...it just kept sliding off her head. That was my mistake...I should have tested it with a bun when it arrived. Having said that, my daughter is incredibly petite...her doctor predicts she won't surpass 5' when she's full grown Obviously, her head isn't that large. My point? If you're an adult or are purchasing this for a teen or big child, it likely won't fit. I finally had to put her hair in a low bun at the nape of her neck to make it work.

Unfortunately, because her natural hair was so low, we couldn't do the up-do we had planned because her bun showed if we did. We ended up leaving it down, brushing it out, putting bobby pins in strategic places to help it frame her face and to contain it, and then I hair sprayed it in place. Styling was especially difficult because the wig is sparse. It's a lot of work to hide the netting underneath. The netting is a yellow-beige color and stands out like bright white against the purple and teal. We finally got it looking decent though, and she actually got many compliments on it throughout the evening, hence the higher star rating despite all the complaints.

Once the wig was brushed and styled, the waves looked beautiful. Just don't buy this expecting it to look great out of the box. It won't. It takes work.

I can't speak to whether or not the product sold from Amazon is fake or not, as I don't order it from here. I usually buy it from the salons or from trusted sellers on Ebay for a much more reasonable price. Having said that, I really like this shampoo. It smells amazing, the lather is plentiful and silky, and I can genuinely say that my hair does feel a bit thicker. While I don't think this shampoo has caused new hair growth, I do feel as if it's strengthened each individual strand to give my hair a slightly fuller look. Don't get me wrong...it's not an Earth-shattering change, but it's a step in the right direction.

The reason this didn't get 5 stars is because every single shampoo bottle I have ever purchased has been faulty. They leak, the pump either breaks or doesn't work from the start, and the plastic is flimsy. If it's been mailed to me, it inevitably leaks all over the package and I lose a substantial amount of product, which is pretty frustrating.

Overall though, a great product!

I’ve done my own extensions for years, and every time I try to save some money by buying cheaper on Amazon, I regret it.

This hair felt soft out of the box. But. They’ve been in for 5 days - haven’t even washed my hair yet - and they’re already matting and tangled. (I know how to take great care of extensions)

I got the sense they might be synthetic heavy when putting them in (that extra bit of elasticity) but thought I might be judging them since I bought the cheap ones.

Nope, they’re definitely not fully real hair.

The wefts will not blend together. I had to cut a ponytail holder out bc the hair had somehow snarled itself around it and I couldn’t get it out for anything.

Installing keratin extensions is time consuming, especially if you’re doing it yourself. I am not looking forward to removing these so soon after *just* putting them in!!! I ended up cutting them about chin length to keep them from getting further matted and buy myself a few more days.

Buyer beware - do not!!! buy these
The product was horrible! The smell was rancid, not manageable and the color was a mix of yellow, blonde and a tint of green under sunlight............
AMAZING!! I started with the cream but found the spray more convenient with twist or braids. I do take a multivitamin with this regimen.
MINE MESSY TOO

My wife always hated when I trimmed my beard because of all them little bitty hairs all over the sink. The T780 is not perfect but it does catch about 90% of those pesky little hairs. The trimmer is powerful and has no trouble with my dense beard. The batteries last a good long while between recharges.

On the down side if you are a little aggressive with pressure as you trim it can slip to a shorter setting and it is a little heavier then some trimmers I have used in the past. All in all though it is a well designed trimmer that I enjoy using.

So it's honestly not bad at this price point. It sheds a bit but all units have some shedding. For the mix brown I give 4 stars.The face front is about 2 inches and is meant to be cut and plucked for a natural look. I did neither in the photo. I just folded it under the the front as I'm afraid that cutting will make it look lifted in the front and obviously show it's a wig without some glue to put it down. The color is not exactly what I wanted. I was hoping it would be a darker brown. It's kinda a mousey brown and alittle strange in my opinion. It will need to be restyle in the front as some waves/curls flattened out by how it was packed in transport. The part is both a plastic fake skin and a mesh on top. You can see the mesh upon close examination. Makeup might help to conceal this.... Or make it worse. What I did like was the fullness and length. The weft was not too easy to be seen even when pulling hair apart. This is good compared to other brands where the wefts are often very visible, especially in the back and crown of a unit. Because the simulated scalp is narrow, you won't be able to change the part. It's also a bit flat near the part so it's gonna take some work to give a bit of volume. I would have enjoyed this much more had the color been a rich brown and if the scalp was a bit more realistic. Would I wear in public? Probably not. Would this be good for photo shoots or costumes ? yes. Would I buy other colors from this brand? Yes and I haven't done that with other brands on Amazon. For the purple ombre: I give 3 stars. It doesn't have the lace in front. This is more pure costume. The black is very shiney and the front of wig where the part is shows a bit of the black backing for construction. If it laid more flat and had the lace I would have given the purple ombre 4 stars. Dull the shiney with some powder like dry shampoo or maybe even dark eyeshadow. The fake scalp is actually better on the purple ombre compared to the brown mix. The ombre for the blonde is also a 4 star. Hair at the crown is a bit flat but the rest of the style is beautiful. The brown to blonde has the 2 inch lace like the long brown one. It's not as full on the head but you don't see the wefts unless you pull it apart a bit.  I feel the color is much more realistic. Hair feels pretty good for a synthetic. Note if you play too much , it will get a knotty feel. Again, good for photos. Some people might actually wear it daily but I don't know if it took take daily abuse. Length is great.

So I felt they did a good job of hiding the weft and had alot of hair. The unit shed pretty bad just by touching it though. The hair was shiney but powder should control that. The length was there. It had one spot near the bangs that looked like someone fried it. And that would be hard to conceal. The bangs looked nicer then most but it just wasn't for me. Fake scalp also not best I've seen but concealer would probably fix that. The top had no volume and I don't mean amount of hair. It was slicked down really tight. I tried to shake it a bit with my fingers to see if it would gain some life but it didn't, plus a bunch of hair fell out.  This super flat look near the fake scalp and with a mid part that cannot be moved is just gonna make me look like the Amish. I would look at this company again if they had a unit without the bangs and maybe a more flexible part. A mini front lace would probably help.

It's just a weak press on nail. Does not flex and form close to your own nail. Lifts very easily and will snag and pop off. Okay if you have maybe a photo shoot and your not a hand model. But don't expect to use your hand or nails without these popping off within mins of application.

So they came packed nicely but not in the s-noilite package. No logo. Just staples to a cardboard slip and wrapped in a pink bag. The hair feels nice. However, I bought the same one twice. First one was brassy in color. I was ordering the #60 in platinum. The thick version. Alot of hair. But totally brassy. So I saw the price drop so I was like okay I'll try again see if they get the color right. Nope. Still brassy and the second one was not the thick halo version. No more then 50grams. Both have double thick wires which don't hide well compared to other companies. The thin version they sent on the second ordee  had clips as well. Why doesn't the thick version have clips? It would help so the ends stay close to the head. The wire was also short. So not happy based on color, difference in style sent even though I ordered same style twiced, and not package from s-noilite. My seller was us fashion outlet. I'd be sceptical to purchase from them if they are the only seller.

The magnet is strong. I bought the two paid sandwich style. I tried the videos, and the hacks that say cut them ...I tried applying with special lash tweezers... Nothing works to get them close to the lash lid. The magnetic is strong so I'm sure it won't fall off, but it's so strong that when you start to move the under lash toward your eye with the upper lash laying on top of your lashes, the magnetic pulls and moves is soil quickly that it always ends up locked half way through your natural lashes. And I'm a contact wearer...so it's not like I have  fear of putting stuff near my eyes. These probably will work well with lash liners. The lashes themselves look nicely constructed. It's just the application as intended is impossible.

My dentist recommended I purchased a water flosser but the one he was selling in his office was almost $100! I looked them up and found that they were all considerably cheaper online. I’m extremely happy with this one! The best feature is that it’s cordless (with the exception of when it’s charging, of course). I’ve had mine for a few weeks and I’ve only had to plug it in once so the charge is lasting. For those of you who’ve never used a water flosser before, they can be powerful and messy (with water getting everywhere) so it’s best to keep and use them in the shower so that the water is confined/contained inside the shower during use. This was actually my dentists recommendation – so this being a cordless flosser was very important! I usually get about 3 flosses in before having to refill the water reservoir (which is very simple). This one does come with several tips so I tried them all after settling on one. I think having several different options is nice so that you can find the pressure and kind of tip that works best for you and meets your own unique needs. Overall, I think this water flosser is great. It does exactly what I need it to do and I got it for a fraction of the price from the dentists office. I would confidently recommend it to others! For anyone looking to buy water flossers, I hope my review is helpful to you!
Left my skin dry, red, and itchy. Will stick to Jason.

Love being able to access electrolysis at home! I have been going to a professional for months now and when the 2020 pandemic began and all service providers closed up shop, I wasn't sure how I would deal with unwanted facial hair. Where other methods of hair removal can encourage stronger hair regrowth I did not want to regress. Then I found this! I have had this product several weeks now and am very happy with it. I wish I had found this earlier. Not only can I do a treatment whenever I want, I am able to target hairs when they first appear as opposed to waiting for an appointment. It is very easy to use. I was afraid I would be unable to target the follicle in the right spot but that has not been a problem. It has a high pitch buzz when the current is delivered to the follicle. Most of the time the sound is my only indication that anything is happening. I do not find this painful. I can tell it is working because when I go to remove the hair it comes out with no effort. I do keep the power at the highest setting except for the delicate area above the upper lip. That can be a painful area at home or at the salon.

My only complaint with the product is that the tweezers included are useless. Just use your own.
I bent the stylist at first so I did order extras to have in case that happens again... so far so good as I haven't ruined another. I don't think that is a product flaw as it must be very delicate to do the job right... just be careful.

If you are unfamiliar with electrolysis, do not expect that one shot will forever kill a hair. I suggest reading articles on the subject as this can be a long term process. But considering other methods are a FOREVER process... go for it !

My husband has complained about shaving irritating his skin, so when I saw this shaver I ordered one for him. Here is what he had to say after using it:

I've used Norelco shavers for years, but never a "wet" system, so I was quite interested to compare the Cool Skin 8040X to my old shaver. When I first opened the package and set the shaver up, I had to not only charge the batteries but also fill the shaver with Nivea For Men shaving conditioner. This was no problem following the easy to read instruction manual.

To begin shaving, you first press the on/off button on the shaver to turn it on and then press the conditioner release button. This pumps a small amount of conditioner out of holes in the center of two of the three shaver heads. Then you shave as you normally would with an electric shaver. I found that I use three pumps of conditioner while shaving: one for each side of my face and one for my neck.

Although I have a tough beard, I have sensitive skin. Because of this, in recent years I've starting shaving every other day. So when I shave my beard is a little bit longer than most men's would normally be. The shaver has no problem coping with this. It cuts clean with no pulling on the hairs. However, it begins to have problems with three days of growth.

I also have a mustache and goatee, which has always caused me to use a razor to shave along its edge. The same applies when using the Cool Skin, but with less irritation as it is now being done with skin conditioner in place instead of on dry skin.

The shaver also comes with a beard trimming device. Just snap off the triple shave head and replace it with the trimmer. (Conditioner cannot be used when the trimmer is installed.) The only real fault with the Cool Skin is this trimmer which, frankly, is useless. It just doesn't want to cut any hairs. But then, the one on my old Norelco is the same way.

I also find the conditioner application button is in a position that I want to place my fingers when using the shaver, so occasionally I'll get an extra, unneeded dose of conditioner. A pretty minor issue.

The Cool Skin can also be used in the shower, but I have not tried this as I'm blind as a bat without my glasses on.

I find that the results of my shave are the same whether I use my old standard Norelco or this new Norelco Cool Skin 8040X, with one exception: ­ there is much less skin irritation with the Cool Skin. I like my new shaver.
I mean... they work for what they are, but theyre not a great quality product by any means. But, they get the job done.
My husband did not like this American Shaving Co Beard Wash and ended up throwing it away after the first use. He said it was runny and he didn't like the scent.

I am not a fan of this GLO Science Teeth Whitening Pen. The clicking mechanism is super annoying- a twisting mechanism would have been so much easier. The thick, bulky, silicone tipped applicator is annoying as well and a lot of the gel gets left in its little bumps and grooves. It doesn't apply smoothly or evenly at all. I have been using it twice per day but have not seen any results. The taste of the gel is absolutely horrible- there's like a weird floral perfume quality to the taste. Do not like.

I don't know why these types of hair ties are popular. These Teleties - Spring Collection Hair Ties were super awkward to use- like tying your hair back with a phone cord. I can only wrap it around my ponytail twice but it is not at all secure. It also rips my hair out when I take it out. I am going to stick with my traditional elastic ties.

I'm not sure what I was expecting when I received this Jade Rose Quartz Roller for Face 2 in 1 Gua Sha Set. It seemed kind of gimmicky but I have read about jade rollers on blogs before and decided to try one for myself. I guess it feels nice on my face, especially when it's cold but beyond that it doesn't do a whole lot. There weren't really any instructions for using the little scraper part so I don't even know what you're really supposed to do with that. I have not seen any difference in my skin's tone, texture, smoothness, elasticity, or anything like that. The quality reminds me of something you would see at an ethnic discount store. I don't know, maybe I'm not doing it right or maybe I'm missing something but I don't see the point of this product.

I was a little leary about a spray but it feels so refreshing to spray on. It also makes it much easier to use a light amount. Considering the light amount you use, the size of this bottle is going to last FOREVER. This really makes me more likely to use it daily vs just when going out. It really does make a nice smooth surface to apply makeup to and reduces the powdering or blotchy look of your makeup.

Do not let “moisturizing” fool you though, this isn’t like a bb cream, you do still need a separate moisturizer. Also keep in mind it is “minimizing”, it doesn’t make your pores magically and completely disappear, especially if you have any enlarged pores. It works great on my chin and forehead to reduce pores but I have some enlarged pores on my nose that it doesn’t touch.

I’ve used other primers that work slightly better but at a MUCH higher cost so I save them for going out vs every day. I think this makes a good every day primer. And since I still use a separate moisturizer that has spf I don’t have to worry about this not having it. Between the affordable cost and the refreshing feel and scent this has definitely converted me to a daily primer user.
This is a MINI SIZE. Travel size.....and it’s basically baby powder. What a rip off.

I have about 5 different colors of this Mofajang Hair Color Wax Temporary Hairstyle Cream, and I purchased them before I got this gray sample to try. what I like about these products is that they add a temporary color to my already light grey hair- such as a pink or purple tinge or even a darker gray or darker blue gray...you get the picture. This easily adds a pastel color to my lighter hair with a smallish amount of product.  I could see that to change up dark hair or to get a strong/intense color tone, you'd need to pile this stuff on, and I think that's where this gets a bad rap. Yes, you can glob this on to higher opacity and change your dark colored hair to the color shown in the jar. BUT, you need a lot to do this, and you may not like the sticky, waxy result -it is wax, after all. If you are using a little bit (about a quarter sized blob) and adding this through your washed and wet hair and then blow dry, your hair will still move naturally and have the lighter tone of the product, provided your hair was fairly light to begin with-- just my two cents.

Every other self tanner, even ones that were marketed as having no scent, had that awful, make you sick to your stomach odor. Except this one.

I am not sure how they do it but they did it.

And, it's a great product. It works fast. I typically put it on after I towel dry from the shower, then wait a few minutes while I brush my teeth. The key to a non-streaky appearance is to use a mitt!!! This one came with a soft velour mitt and it works wonders. I still get spots that I miss but that is due to user error - and it would be easier to spot these gaps if this tanner was tinted a little bit more. I wouldn't take a full star off for that but I would love it even more if it was easier to see where I had already put it on.

It arrived super fast and sealed, not leaking out like with many other products.

It lasts only about 2-3 days, and it's a lot thinner than other tanners - it's not a cream, much more of a lotion and a tiny bit too liquidy at that. But, overall i love it.

The brush on this is like one of the $1 mascara brands - incredibly short stiff brush that hurts your lashes and barely holds any mascara. No ingredients are listed! Product smells! Sadly, a product made in China that could be toxic - or just junk.
Too small for my head. This appears to be child size in my opinion

Ok...I'm going to try to not write a novel here, but I am sooo in love with these polishes!!! I read a ton on reviews on these peel off polishes and finally chose these not expecting a whole lot. I have 100% no complaints!!! But I will say that I guess it all depends on what you are wanting out of your nail polish. If you are wanting it to last like it lasts on artificial nails... this is not for you. If you are wanting options and to not have to deal with nail polish remover...THIS IS FOR YOU!!!

I have loved painting my nails and having polished nails since a kid. I've always hated nail polish remover. I have thin nails and can't change my polish often because nail polish remover dries my nails out and makes them even weaker and it stinks...even nail polish stinks for that matter.
To make the polish last I've always added a top coat about every day or two and I've learned how to do touch ups that hardly show when the polish on tip of the nail (natural nails) chipped or wore away, so that I didn't have to use acetone any more often than necessary. But it was really self defeating because the more polish I had on, the more acetone I had to use to remove it.
So anyway...I got these little gems in...they are small....but then again, when you compare the price to buying regular polish ( I buy OPI normally ) and the fact that you are getting several colors of these for the price you'd pay for 1 or 2 bottles of decent regular polish, it's not a bad deal at all.
I tried them right away and
#1...they are hardly smell at all! I don't smell them unless I actually hold my nails or the bottle to my nose to smell them.
#2...the polish went on fine. It's a little thick, but it settles down smooth as it dries.
#3 I love some of the colors and some will be just for having fun, but they are fun t play with. 5 colors are opaque and 4 are transparent, so they are fun mixing and matching. I like using the transparent ones as top coats on the opaque ones.
#4 They lasted about 3 days with no chips and very very little edge wear (with the daily addition of a top coat for shine) until I couldn't stand it any longer and had to try to peel them off. Some of the reviews said they were hard to peel off, but I had no problem at all. And all but one came off in one full piece! Amazing!!! So easy and NO ACETONE!!! And the other thing I like is that with regular polish, I would sometimes try and peel of as much as I could before using the acetone and some would come off but my nail always seemed super dry under the polish even when it was peeled off. That is not the case with these at all. My nails were not dry at all. They were still healthy and not dry at all!!!
Oh and the BONUS ....since they peel off, any polish that gets on to your skin peels off easy too after it dries. :)

LOVE IT.  Obviously I must have ordered from a few vendors as I've given other reviews.  This stuff helps my pain (not a huge amount but every little bit helps!).  Wish doctors (pain docs and orthos) would have told me about it on the sly (not FDA approved for people) years ago.  Love the cream more than the liquids - use on knees, elbows, shoulders, neck and low back.  Never had any ill effect - although I do think the first time I used (especially on sensitve areas that don't see light often) may have itched slightly, but that went away quickly.  LOVE IT!

These nail polish appliques look great - even on short nails! I don't know if the pictures actually do them justice, but they're very sparkly and look like 'real' nail polish.

They're extremely easy to apply but are very stretchy and can tear easily, if you don't take your time. Just be careful when you apply them. Once in place, I smoothed the polish strip down with my thumb and then gently slid a soft tipped orange stick over it to make sure that all the air bubbles were out and that the polish strip was securely in place. The package also includes a mini nail file so that you can file off the excess and get into the corners of your nails, which may be hard to do with a larger nail file. The instructions on how to apply them were clear and it took me about 10-15 minutes to put them on.

It's been about a week and they still look great!

I've been looking for something just like this, so when I was given the opportunity to review it, at a discounted cost, I jumped at it.

First off, I wouldn't really consider this an eye mask for sleeping. It's great to place over your eyes or forehead for relaxing, headaches, itchy/watery/puffy eyes but without a strap to keep it on your face, I wouldn't sleep with it on.

When I first took it out of the package, I was met with a powerful smell of lavender, so I knew that this definitely had enough potency to last for a while.

Heat: After it was heated, the smell was initially little overpowering but after a while, it faded. It says to lightly spritz the mask and then heat it for 30 seconds in the microwave, which I did, but since it didn't feel hot enough, I put it back in the microwave for another 30 seconds and, for me, that was the perfect temperature.

Cold: I tried freezing it to use on my eyes, since my allergies have been killing me this season and my eyes have been quite puffy and itchy, and I must say that I was rather pleased. It was cool, but definitely not too cold to place directly on my skin/eyes to soothe them. This time around, I could barely smell the lavender.

Overall, it's a good product but I wish the company had also enclosed a nice bag to seal the eye mask in when you're done using it. In the directions, it says to keep it in a sealed bag to help keep the lavender smell last longer so I had assumed that they would have included one with it.

Disclaimer: This product was provided at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review but it does not change my opinion of the product.
This is just like Zudaifu. The best cream for my skin problems!!

I originally purchased this product several years ago from my hair salon and loved it. I then moved and had to find a new salon. :( They didn't carry Global Keratin products, so long story short, I ended up using various other products. As I began to gray, my hair became drier and more brittle, and the products I was using were NOT working. I found GK on-line and within 2 weeks of using it, I noticed a HUGE change. No more dry, brittle hair, only soft and shiny.  Even my little granddaughter noticed the change!

I am on my second bottle. The first bottle was amazing!!! It's smelled good adn cleaned my blackheads like nothing I had ever experienced. I loved it so much I left that bottle at my boyfriends house and purchased another $40 bottle. This second bottle is NOT THE SAME PRODUCT!!!! It smells and feels different and is not as good as the original.
The first bottle felt tingly almost like peppermint on my skin and it had a very pleasant scent to it. I enjoyed using it. The second bottle smells off putting and no longer tingles. It cleans but not like the first order.
My boyfirend owns a business, his motto is "Be consistent. Consistanly bad, or consistantly good, but always be consistant." This product, so far is NOT consistant and at this price people are going to expect to receive the same product for the money spent.
Another thing that bothers me about this company besides the inconsistant product line is with every product you order they send a card stating "contact us" - Tell us what you think and we will respond with a coupon code for 10%-50% off your next Amazon order. I have 4 products, 2 More Than Clean and 2 - 100% Confident (I have not yet opened the 2nd bottle of this, so I don't know if it is the same as the first. The first product was discounted due to a special coupon code I found on Facebook which is what prompted me to try it, every time I have re-ordered I follow the instructions to receive another code... they NEVER respond. Stop making offers that you never respond to, it is frustration for customers.

I understand that there are differing opinions on this trimmer, but after using it back to back with the Remington Precision Pro MB-400 Titanium Vaccuum Mustache and Beard Trimmer, there is no comparison on the following counts:

1) quality of the trimming accessories - the Norelco has a flimsy cutting guide, and its all on the verge of breaking everytime you use it. Anyone who has had a previous Norelco product points this out.

2) a ridiculously designed sideburn trimmer - It is so hard to get the trimmer set-up! a poor design

3) A terrible cut - if you have even a medium beard, the trimmer is very uneven. you can certainly do better.

The items above are enough to walk away from this device. The reviews that critique the vaccuum are probably being unrealistic. It is in part Norelco's fault - they set you up to expect more from the vaccuum than you get. But simple physics will tell you it is going to miss a lot of hair.

It was such a bad experience, I had to review it.

The Remington is superior in every way.

There are only 3 reviews and I feel inclined to share my complete dissatisfaction. As someone said, during the pandemic, worth the buy, even at $20. Or so I thought. Put a mask on and within 10 minutes, the ear hook popped. Thankfully, I was prepared JUST IN CASE and carried a second mask. That one popped off too! Not worth the money. You’re better off with a handkerchief...
Ok lotion.

I love Easydew and have been using their cleanser, ampoule and efg cream for a while and love this cream as well but the cream I received expire in just 4 month!
All other easydew products I got last year(2020) won’t expire until 2023!
Korean skincare have 3 years expiration date since manufactured date so all other easydew products I got last year was manufactured on 2020(same year I got) and pretty fresh but this cream is expired in 4 month that means this was made back in 2018....
Yes, it’s not expired yet but getting 2018 products when it’s 2021 seems kind of bummer.
I only use this cream when my skin feel sensitive or had trouble like pimple and etc and I don’t use everyday but now I feel I have to as it’ll expire in 4 months!
Check the date when you receive!

This mask is way too thick and heavy for my taste.
I love korean masks and have been using goodal, dr jart, mediheal, dewycell, huxley, SNP, neogen, dermal and many more brands and this was the worst!
It's way too thick cream and doesn't absorb at all.
After you take the mask off, your face is completely covered with WHITE cream.
I had to wipe off everything!
I really don't uderstand this mask.
Too bad as I love abib Yuja essence and was hoping this would be good but no.
Packaging is simple and good though but that's all to me.

It did actually make my pimple a bit smaller next day but what I didn't like was exp date.
All Korean skin care have 2.5 years expiration date from manufacture date. It is Korean law to print exp date or manufacture date on skin care products and makeup products.(Makeup products have 3 years instead of 2.5 years.)
Product I receive is April 2021 exp date, that is only 10 month away and that means this was manufactured on Dec 2018, that sound pretty old as it is June 2020 right now....
Yes it is not expired but I have been using many korean skin care brands and almost always I get the products that have at least 2 years or longer exp date.
This is not something you use every day like toner and I only have 10 month to use and there's no way that I can use whole bottle by April.
I think it's good product but hopefully you'd get longer exp date product than mine so you wouldn't waste your money!

This palette has become one of my favorite nail tools. I've been using it mostly on acrylic dip powder, but have also used it on top of traditional polish with a clear coat on top. if you apply a light/thin layer (or on dip powder base that has NOT been buffed), it adds a subtle shimmer. If you apply it more thickly AND buff it with the eyeshadow-type applicator, you can achieve a solid chrome look that's really fun as well. I enjoy putting it on all my nails, or just on one nail for a fun accent look that still matches my overall color scheme. I've also enjoyed using it on a relatively plain nail for a fine-textured glitter look while other nails have full-texture glitter. It's really a lot of fun and goes a super long way (basically as far as a comparable eyeshadow palette would go). Strongly recommended

UPDATE: I've ditched my acrylic powders (long story - I kayak too much) but couldn't let go of this shimmer. Turns out it works on traditional nail polish as well. You can apply it directly on top for a chrome effect, or BUFF (not file) the surface gently then apply for a soft shimmer. In both cases top with clearcoat. I still love this palette!

This works OK as an emollient better than some and worse than others. It doesn't sink in much, so it's better to apply as a sealant on top of already-moisturized skin than to use it on skin in desperate need of hydration.

If you haven't used one of these before, they're great for curly hair - holding things in place without potential breakage. I've been buying them often since my previously-straight hair turned curly a year or two back, and they're super helpful. I love this bulk package since this type of hair tie does tend to break occasionally (especially if you pull them all the way tight, since that's not the intended usage), but these seem stronger than most, and they cost significantly less than the other ones I've been buying
