I bought several brands of Magnetic Eyelashes and liners: Newcally, Yiwamica, CARETHYS, Coolours, and LAMIX. This one, CARATHYS was the worst. The eyelashes looked "unkempt" compared to the others and less natural because the fibers were double layered. The magnets on the back were such poor quality! They had weak magnetic power (compared to Newcally, LAMIX, and Coolours but same as Yiwamica) and they were glued on haphazardly. The spacing was uneven and they were all crooked. Yiwamica had magnet issues too, where the magnets were weak and some even fell off, but at least those lashes looked more natural. This brand was the worst.

Two pros:
--Lashes fibers were thinner so looked more natural compared to the better quality brands and slightly less black
--The liner wasn't too bad. The consistency was actually pretty good, neither goopy nor too liquid, but the lash magnets are bad so not going to keep just for the liner!

I would recommend Newcally for the best quality (but least natural). LAMIX and Coolours are also good choices.

Update: The top pair in the 234 was my favorite because it's the most natural looking but after 2 uses, one of the magnets fell off! This brand has quality issues. I decided to order many other brands of magnetic lashes (Newcally, LAMIX, Coolours) and I found that the magnets for the Yiwamica's lashes are considerably weaker. The other brands lashes would pop on and when pulled off would pull my skin a little. This brand's magnets do not do that. I have to press the eyelashes on and then corners would dislodge. I thought it was due to the liner but no, it's the magnets! Between the magnets falling off completely and the weak magnets, I'm downgrading from 4 to 2 stars.

As for the styles, I bought 3 sets from this listing: 230, 231, and 234. See my photo.

The 234 is a set of 3 with a natural pair, a denser natural pair same length, and a longest natural pair. The length difference is probably 1mm, very hard to tell on the tray (I didn’t measure with ruler or anything) but you can tell in person when wearing them. I think only the first pair looks truly natural on me for everyday use because I have small Asian hooded eyes. The other two in the 234 tray are sort of natural but I would not use them for day time use.

The 231 has 2 pairs that looked the same as the longest pair in the 234 set...again not natural enough for small eyes for day time use.

The 230 has crisscrossed lashes where it is longer towards the outer corners and shorter towards the inner. These lashes are longer than those in the 231 and 234.

I ended up returning 231 because it was a repeat of my least favorite pair in the 234 set.

The 230 box had quality issues. One of the lash strands was super long on one of the lashes. The 230 set was also glued to the plastic holder instead of magnetized to strips on the tray like the other two sets. When I removed the lashes from the holder, the middle magnet fell off 2 of the lashes!

I also got a eyeliner and 2 lash pair set from the same company. You can see in my photo. That eye liner turned out to be really bad so I returned that.

Instead, I use the Aroama brand of magnetic liner also sold on Amazon (the one with over 1,000 reviews) with these lashes. The magnetics in these lashes are sorta big but since I have to draw the liner really thick for them to stay at all, it’s tough to even notice the magnets. The thick liner could also contribute to the lashes not looking as natural.

I want to mention the magnet spacing is inconsistent across this brand. There are always 5 magnets but some are gapped evenly while others you get 2 magnets on each end and one in the middle with a huge gap on each side. The ends of the lashes do tend to detach from the eye easily for me as compared to the middle so the configuration with 2 magnets on the ends helps me. The spacing is purely up to your preference though. Pay attention to the product photos to see which magnet spacing you would get.

I'm confident more women than men get this brush and it is a little feminine for my style but I wanted to try something to see if I could improve my skin condition. I've only recently started to use a cleansing brush as part of my evening routine after watching the success my daughter had using one on her skin. I decided to give this a try and found it very good ... it was so good in fact that my girlfriend stole it from me!

The brush feels very well manufactured and the design is aesthetically pleasing. I got the brush handle and all of the brush wet and had no issues. I didn't learn until later that some brushes recommend you don't get anything other than the brush head wet. I treated this kind of like I treat a razor. I did not submerge it nor would I. The brush definitely loosens up dirt and oil on your face quickly. I felt the LumaRx had a significant power for scrubbing my face.

The brush comes with multiple brush attachments, to be honest I haven't completely figured out which attachment is best for what job so I use the softer brush. I have used this a few times in the morning before shaving and it does a very good job of helping me get a much closer shave, I believe because it deeply moisturizes the whiskers and helps them stand up better for a clean cut.

The brush comes with a travel bag and charger, the heads are very easy to change and are durable. Charging is quick and I've used it more than a dozen times on one charge.

I think I must have talked too much about how much I liked this brush so my girlfriend decided to start using it and I'm afraid I'm not going to see it again!
I LIKED THE WAY IT WENT ON HOWEVER IT WASNT WATERPROOF -- VERY DISAPOINTING WHEN YOUR YOUR EYEBROWS RUN DOWN YOUR FACE

I already own several of the clear acrylic drawers from the famous Japanese brand that starts with M... and just like those (as you can see from the photos I attached to my review), this one is crystal clear and well-built. In the past, I ordered a different brand of acrylic drawer on Amazon, and it had a bluish tinge to the acrylic that made it look cheap. When you want your bathroom counter or your vanity to look pretty, you need something clear and well-made, otherwise it just looks bad. So on that front, I am super happy with this.

I also love that it comes with two extra pieces you can fit on top of the unit, or use separately. These two pieces have smaller segmented compartments that make them ideal to display items that come in bottles you want to stand upright, such as foundations, primers and setting sprays.

The product came very securely packaged. I thought I would mention this because this is something that makes me feel wary of ordering fragile things online. But no worries in this case. As you can see from my photos, this was packed very well in a box of its own. It came without a single scratch or dent.

Overall, this unit looks beautiful on my bathroom counter, next to the acrylic drawers I already own. I highly recommend it!

I received this product at a promotional rate in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are my own and solely based on my experience with this product.
This arrived as a single sheet inside of a bubble mailer envelope. I don't know why it was sent in a bubble mailer. It isn't fragile in the sense that it could break, but it was fragile in the sense that it could bend and fold.
There were no precautions taken to avoid it from bending and folding (e.g. no thick, hard cardboard insert, no box), so the single sheet with the tattoos on it was wrinkled. Because of this, I couldn't apply the tattoos properly.

Sprayed 1 spray on the back of my hand and all I got was a stringent bitter scent. So strong I could taste it. Not joking. I don't know who in their right mind thinks this smells anything like Creed VIW because it doesn't. You might want to get checked for COVID-19 if you do because your sense of smell is really off. The scent is as if you were eating a piece of the skin from a lime. That sharp sour taste is what this scent compares to. I don't recommend this one. I will say 10 scrubs later and the smell was still there. Guess you could spray bugs with it outside. You could use it as air freshener when you have guests over who won't leave. Only you will have to leave as well.
May the force be with you if you dare to try this one.

Bought this through eBay for 5.00. Same company provided it. Have been looking all over for a back scrubber like this one so I was really excited. Second shower and the end 'puff' thing with it's handle fell off. Can't reattach it because the strings are so short.
UPDATE 8/22/2013
Went through Buyer Protection on eBay and got my money back. Found the same item at Rite Aide for same price and it is doing just fine. No more dealings with All Top Bargains.
This mascara is great if you want spider leg looking lashes. It is really awful.
The shave is really close, but I cut myself every time I use it.
All the negative reviews and they're still allowed to sell on Amazon. What a joke.
I really like these headbands they are pretty and sturdy but I had to send them back because they were fairly tight on my head.

[[VIDEOID:5d843061e7b4147c44093084035ebf7d]] My almost 16 year old granddaughter has long, very thick, very curly/wavy hair that she likes to wear rod straight a lot of the time. Her normal hair prep time on school mornings is anywhere from 20 to 30 minutes. She uses a flatiron, because the heated brush I got her won't straighten her hair enough. She has to be really careful, and even so has often burned her fingers and the skin around her face trying to straighten the tiny tight pincurls that encircle her face and head. I have been hunting around for a better, faster solution for her and found it in this wonderful salon quality ceramic heated comb by KingdomCare.

I was originally going to save it for her birthday in the fall, but seeing her daily struggle with the curly locks I opted for an early gifting. I have to say, and I use my granddaughter's word, this curling comb is “awesome”. I watched her do her hair and noticed that she did not have to use such small segments as she normally does with her flatiron. She was never concerned about her hand getting burned, nor was I. You could touch the outer shell of the heated portion and not be burned. Likewise near the base of the hair, no worries about burning tender facial skin. And the curls disappeared like magic as they skimmed through comb's tines.

Additional features I like about this heating comb are the swiveling cord, the six temperature settings (with lighted buttons to let you know how how the setting is), the smooth feel of the surface and the cool pale pink and silver color of the comb as well as the easy grip surface on the handle. There is an on/off button, heat up/down arrows and temperature displays in both fahrenheit and celsius. This curling comb also reaches higher temperatures than other heated brushes. The one I use tops out lower than the lowest temp on this device. That makes this comb particularly great for thick, wavy hair.

The ceramic heating elements also do a nice job dealing with fly away hairs and static. My granddaughter is really ecstatic with her new beauty tool and is already anticipating all her friends being jealous and wanting to borrow it from her. I definitely award this straightener five stars. It absolutely lives up to its reputation and does not cost a fortune to own.

This item is a discounted sample provided by the vendor for review consideration.

If you are looking for a hair straightener brush that really works great on long hair (past the middle of the back) this might just be for you.
I have very long hair that has terrible ends. I'm in need of a good hair cut! However, this straightener brush really made them look so much better, almost healthy! I used it with the steam feature and I don't think I've liked a straightener this much in a very long time.
I should probably mention something more about this device. This has a 30 second (to a minute) fast heating time, three different heat settings, a steam feature, an anti-scalding feature, and constant temperature protection. It also comes with a glove to protect your hand from the heat, a little water bottle thingy for the steam feature (I think), and a hair clip to use while straitening.
I really like this. Usually this type of thing takes me at minimum fifteen minutes or so. This took me about 7 to get a decent effect.
I recommend this if you are looking for a hair straightener that will give you a near salon look.

This is an interesting way to get some very nice curls in your hair. It’s a long soft rod type thing. The material is the usual you’d get for a curler wrapped in silk. It’s all bendy and what you do is sort of braid your hair onto/with this. After that, you use the included scrunchies to hold it in place at the bottom.

This sounds all well and good but, maybe it was just me, it was difficult to get my hair twisted correctly onto the rod. My hair is long, reaching about mid back and perfectly straight. If you get it on there right, it comes out looking very nice. It just takes a whole lot of practice. Also, as a side note, if your hair is a little damp, it works better.

This comes with the main curler, two large scrunchies, two smaller scrunchies, two hair clips, and a nice bag to keep everything in. The scrunchies are silk.

This works nicely and it’s worth trying out if you want heatless curls. For me it was difficult to get the knack of but if you are good with hair, which I am just not, you might find it quite easy from the start.

This Melao lavender exfoliant foot peel works very well. The box contains one set of booties for one time use. It’s real simple to use these. You have to start off by cleaning your feet well. It doesn’t hurt to give them a bit of a soak for a time as well beforehand. Just to get them good ready. Next, you place the booties on your feet. It’s recommended that you put socks over the booties to hold them firmly in place since you have to wear them for an hour. I did just that and think that’s a mighty fine recommendation to follow. When that hour is up, you take all that off your feet and give your feet a good washing with soap and water. Now comes the waiting game. At first, I thought they did absolutely nothing.For days, I thought they did nothing. Then, around the 4th/5th day my feet just started to peel. They were shedding skin. It was so weird! They continued to do that for a few days and when it was all over my feet did look and feel really nce for quite some time. Just remember to keep moisturizing to keep them looking and feeling nice for a long time after.

The thing about this product is that you can’t expect instant results. It takes a few days and you have to still use the same moisturizers and stuff you were using on your feet, or at least I did. I have really dry feet in spots and I despise it so to have something actually work for a little while was great. You would have to use these every so often though, I think, to keep them as nice.
At this time, when I type this, there isn’t a price listed for these so I can’t tell you if it’s worth it or not but they work well and could be.

I love being able to get in about my face with a good exfoliating wash and scrub away all the stuff. I don't know about you but I tend to wander a lot in this tiny former coal mining town where the people live and breathe in dust, and I wear it all over my face, I believe.
So scrubbing away all of that once a day feels brilliant. This isn't a harsh face wash. It's a gentle exfoliant but you can feel the grain in it while you wash your face. It's working well too. My skin isn't dried out and feels generally better than where I was using normal soap. And I like how you don't really need to use much of this to get it all over your face.
The scent was a bit of a let down because it's sort of nice but a bit weak. You might think this daft but I love a good scent that smells like a delicious candy while washing my face, or perhaps a nice lemony scent.
This is ok but it's working very well to clean my skin so no complaints really.

I purchased this item as a replacement, and it is so bad. It will not keep a charge past 90%; does not work when it's plugged in and charging; AND THIS MORNING IT LITERALLY SHOCKED ME AS I USED IT. My face was not wet and it still shocked me. So poorly made. Never ever buy HATTEKER. Shameful.

Ok

I was looking at this as an extension to the [[ASIN:B000EG8HLE Philips Norelco BG2020 Bodygroom Shaver]]. Not really its intended purpose but it does work pretty well in that role as long as you are careful. Emphasis on the being careful; it can, and will, grab loose skin.

Overall I'm pleased with it. It cuts through hair quickly and easily making it easy for quick touch up trims. It's also fairly quiet, much quieter than my electric shaver so it doesn't affect my hearing when trimming sideburns and hair that's grown longer than my ears. It will also operate in either corded or cordless mode, handy when the battery dies.

Only a few negatives from my view:
-The charging LED in the handle does not shut off when the unit is charged. It is lit the entire time it's plugged in. Little annoying considering almost very rechargeable device will let you know when it has completed charging.
- It does not charge at the same time you are using it while plugged in. Not really a big deal, just something to be aware of.
- Only the head portion can be rinsed; the base / battery can not get wet. Again, not really a big deal.
- Hair trimmings get stuck in the lubricant grease inside the head. Not a lot, only a few very small pieces, but if you're a perfectionist it can be a little aggravating.

I'm expecting this will also work well to trim out the tufts of overgrown toe fur that my cat gets. I can, and do, trim with scissors periodically but it takes a bit of time due to being careful. The longer it takes the more annoyed he gets. Using this I should be able to trim the fur much quicker so he gets less annoyed. Less annoyed cat == less annoyed human. We both win!

Update: Dec 1, 2010
15 months later and I'm still using this. Does a fantastic job of keeping the hair around my ears trimmed just enough so that it isn't touching or rubbing. Very quick and quiet. It still irks me a little bit that it doesn't tell you when charging is complete. The other nitpicks I've gotten over.

I can't say how well it works on trimming toe fur on a long haired cat. The shaver is in one room and when I see that he needs a trim we're in a different one. I did use it once to snip out some matted up fur and it did a decent job.

I write this review on another brand of this exact same soap. However, I found the price to be better and quality is exactly the same. I have tried every single product I could get my hands on to clear up an ongoing infection on my neck that put me in the emergency room. I thought it was shingles and was even diagnosed as such. The Doctors gave me antibiotics and sent me on my way. Over a year later, whatever it is/was kept on spreading. I have dealt with this nightmare and it has consumed my life and sent me into a terrible depression. My skin was itching, my neck would burn if I turned it too much, it was sore all the time and I would get these constant breakouts, like acne but I knew they were not acne. I have never felt so miserable.

In the past I have tried turmeric (internally and as a mask), green tea, sulfur, benzoyl peroxide, pro-biotics, internal oregano, tea tree oil, manuka oil, manuka honey, antibiotics, changing my entire diet to eat healthy and lots of fruit and vegetables... The list goes on and on and not one thing helped. Not ONE!

Then, about a month ago, I was researching folliculitis and many of the symptoms matched what was going on with me. I do not remember how I stumbled upon this soap but I thought, what the hell. I tried everything else, lets see if this does ANYTHING at all. It has been about a month now and my skin is nearly completely healed. The itching is nearly subsided completely, The burning sensation is GONE. My skin is starting to feel normal again. I prayed and prayed for the pain to just stop and now, finally it has.

You need to give this soap a try. I will never let my friends, family or anyone I ever come in contact with go through what I went through now that I have learned. If you do some research online, start with Wikipedia and you will see what I now know.

Be careful, this soap does burn quite a bit and takes time to get used to but the burn never damaged my skin, I can actually feel it working. I am grateful I finally found something that helped me get better.

I thought it was going to be a bit harder to apply, it did take me two goes, but I was able to get it on my Orchid without too much hassle. My dryer is a Babyliss Pro Portofino Titanium (I hope those are all the right words in the right order) and I couldn't find any reviews anywhere from people who were trying this combo. Having measured it, I learned the dryer nozzle is 1.5", so I bought this. I didn't remove the inner section of the diffuser or anything special.

It works a lot better than my ghetto rubberbands-and-tape trick, no air is escaping from anywhere, so it's all actually going out of the diffuser.
Also, the creator sends a card with your name in it, and she actually spelled mine correctly. This is what convinced me to leave the review, not gonna lie. I know you're thinking, surely the name was right in front of her, but bruva...the misspellings in my life have been nuts.

My only complaint is with the pen itself... you should be able to turn the base a couple of times to get the needed amount on the tip, BUT the last pen I received, no matter how much you turn the base it will not move up. So I had to pop the top & use a q-tip to use it.
Product absolutely does not work. I just cancelled by subscription and they are not wanting to refund my money.  I have a 100% money back guarantee!
Not all that impressive, gives a very subtle tint. I prefer Loreal Sublime Bronze Medium. Color is prettier and has gold highlights. Loreal is MUCH less expensive. Tan Physics not worth the expense.
Orange and crappy looking.  Was so disappointed.

Unless you’re just interested in trying a new hot tool I wouldn’t recommend buying this. I had seen someone else use this hot brush and it intrigued me so I purchased it. My first impression was shock that it was as large as it is. I thought it would be comparable to a flat iron but it is bigger than my largest paddle brush. It’s really easy to use as you’re essentially just brushing through your hair repeatedly but I’m pretty sure it took me twice as long as my normal blow dryer even though it seemed to get pretty warm. I wouldn’t agree with the reviews that say it kept frizz down because I still had to flat iron my hair afterward to get rid of the normal blow dry frizz. I wish the bristles were more tangle friendly as it got caught in my wet tangled hair many times. I wouldn’t say it made my hair more voluminous either. Also, the buttons are listed in order but the power is not in order. The “middle” setting had the lowest blow dry power. Overall I think it’s a fine tool and I’ll be keeping it, I just don’t know how often I’ll reach for it over my traditional blow dryer. Like I said before, I wouldn’t recommend this purchase unless you’re just interested in trying something new.

So the ad clearly says there's 8 pieces and so does the packaging. Well mine only came with 5 and they weren't even secured by the gold tie either. I'm missing a second single weft, a second triple weft, and a second quadruple weft. Not to mention they are all rolled up and STUCK in the position (as pictured) the packaging was very basic and boring and didnt even have the companies name or logo on it. Yes the extensions are soft and some wefts are thicker than others but they are also all frizzy. I did a lot of searching this time, and I mean like for days, before I finally decided on which set I was going to buy, and I'm not overly happy this time. Rather, a little disappointed actually. I've bought much cheaper extensions from amazon a few times throughout the years, and this one is lower on my list of recommendations.

**UPDATE**
So here we are on November 8 2019, and I'm still in a back and forth argument with INMANY HAIR about just re-sending the package for compensation. The ad clearly states, repeatedly, how many pieces are included, not to mention that the ONLY wording on the entire package itself is simply and very clearly 8 PIECES. My issue has yet to be resolved in any way. Thew only offer I recieved from them was a $12 credit to my account. WHAT?! Where does that number even come from?!!!!! I'm so not happy at this moment. 😤😠
Great
Doesn’t work well 👎🏼
Not One person said it made the hair shiny and that's all I wanted to know WOW!

OK so I think this kit is OK, it is good if you are trying to learn and don't want to pay a ton for a kit.  I think it is a small kit, learn and move on to better quality products, is my opinion.  It does work, takes practice, my nails came out OK, but clearly not salon quality, they are the experts.  but you could try it and see if you like it and the more you do it the better you can get.  the smell is super strong on this kit.  that kinda stinks (literally) LOL.  it comes with what you need, but not a lot of it.

this is a great set of face and body paint, perfect for halloween or a kids party.  It was easy to use and works well.  it comes with the brushes, which is nice.  Non-toxic is important for this type of make up so that is great.  It works well.  great color selection.

I wasn't expecting much from this, but it is surprisingly good. it has a ton of choices and I found one that works well for me.  the color of the stamp was great for me.  this kit comes with everything and it works well.  I am very happy with it.  it looks great.

this is a great set of 10 reusable lashes, they will last a long time.  they work well and look nice on.  Made well and a variety of styles.  I am very happy with the set.  Use glue to put them on.  they stayed on. My daughter has smaller eyes and has had to cut some of them to fit, but that is very easy to do.  Works great and looks great.

These are great lashes, my daughter wears them all the time.  they work great for dance competition make up as well.  they are  made well, can be reused.  I think they stay on well also, but that is more about the type of glue you use.  they look very nice on, very dramatic, not a natural look, more extreme.

These are very cool, I would def do this again.  I love how easy they were to use and the options for colors.  I am not usually good at painting my nails, but these were so  much easier I thought.  I really like them, and they seemed to help let nails grow and not break.  they stayed on well also.

I like this body scrub, it works great and smells nice too.  It works great in the winter to get rid of that dry dull skin.  It left my skin feeling soft and smooth.  easy to use and left my skin feeling great.  A lot of things in one scrub.  very happy with it.

This is a nice hair curler.  It took me a little bit to get used to it. It is a new style, but works well.  It leaves very nice beach curls in your hair.  You have to be careful using this, it is very hot. I use gloves made for this type of curling and that way you don’t accidentally burn your hands.  It seems like it is made well.  Great temperature as well.

I am happy with this new tool.  I like that it actually does work and is easy to use at home.  the problem I have is finding the time to do it or remembering to do it.  It doesn't hurt at all, you feel it, but it isn't painful.  worth the benefits and the science behind it makes sense.  I don't know if it is as good as what you get at the doctors, because I have never had this procedure, but my understanding is that at the doctors it goes deeper.

This is a nice facial cleansing brush, it works well and comes in a nice case.  This one comes with a variety of brush heads.  A lot less expensive then the Clairsonic ones but works just as well.  This one is pink and it does come in a few other colors.  case is great for travel or storage.  You will want to let the brush air dry so that bacteria or mold doesn't grow on it.  replacement brushes can be purchased and should be changed periodically.  Works well to clean skin and remove dead skin cells.

I just love how these sponges work.  I am converted.  wet sponge application is perfect for the times when you have already flawless skin and want to apply a light foundation or concealer.  It works well for under eye application as well.  I reach for a brush when I have a blemish to cover, because I like the thicker coverage.  These work well, just need to be cleaned once a week or so, depending on how often you use them.  Very happy with this product.  the shape of this sponge allows you to get into small creases and angles of the face.  Very cool.

I have owned several Braun Epilators and this new one, tops them all. I was surprised that they could actually improve what they had, but the addition of the exfoliating brush is a great thing.

PROS:
* Less pain than other brands
* Nice color
* Can be used wet/dry
* The light really makes a difference to see hairs
* exfoliating brush makes your legs really smooth. It can also be used for rough heals, elbows, or dry winter skin.
* Epilating in general - Your hair grows back softer and with few hairs. Over time, very little grows back.

CONS:
* Not as gentle on underarms as other epilators I use
* Epilating in general can take some time, along with the exfoliating after to prevent ingrown hairs. (but with epilating, once you do it on a regular basis, you don't have to do it as often as shaving)

Great job Braun! Another great epilator.

I love this product. It is true what other say about the sensitivity. I would recommend using sensitivity toothpaste while you are using the strips, it helped for me. It made my teeth noticeably whiter. I would suggest you take a picture of yourself smiling before and after. I noticed the whiteness of my teeth when I saw a picture taken recently and I couldn't believe how nice they looked. I just had to dig up an old picture to compare and it was a big difference. After I have noticed this in the new picture, I love smiling for pictures now and showing my teeth. I was alway self conscious about it before. That alone makes it worth the price.

I was very satisfied with my results. Make sure to read all the instructions before using.

It just became a part of my bedtime routine, not a bother at all. I just put one on while I was watching my evening TV programs and just kept an eye on the clock.

Also, I recommend that after you have finished your pack that you use the Crest whitening toothpaste. It really helps to keep your teeth staying white.

Great product and it was recommended to me by my dentist.

I am not sure what is in this but I had a huge allergic reaction to the point of anaphylaxis!
I will only order from the actual Ordinary company moving forward. It happened twice and when I stopped using it I never had another episode.

after receiving this product, I was very disappointed because I was looking for a cream and not a thick shea butter that clumped on my hair when applied. In my opinion, it seems as if they scooped Shea butter in a small container and marked it as a buttershine. Also, when I received my product it looked like someone had stuck their thumb in it and sealed it anyway; that made me a little skeptical. For 18.75, I was looking for something more than a thick greasy like substance (which was yellow) and more of a white cream (as they had shown before on their videos) because if I wanted to get just Shea Butter, I could have gotten that from my local beauty supply company for 7.99 in its raw form. Not a Happy camper!!

I just purchased an 8-Bar Pack of this Australian Botanical Goats Milk Soya Bean Oil Soap for $18.00 here on Amazon from A Seller Called, Asset Liquidation Sales. I expected allot better quality, moisturizing & clean rinsing Soap for my Face & Body with this Goat Milk Soap that is Made in Australia... The turnout from me with the first use of this Soap for just Three Days was not appealing nor was it moisturizing to me in any way! When I washed my Face with it in the Mornings & Evenings, it lathered up quite well. However when I rinsed it off, I could feel & right away noticed that it was not a clean rinsing Soap. It left a kind of sticky, oily residue feeling on my Face & Hands while rinsing it off. Then about 30 to 45 Minutes after washing with this Soap, I really noticed the unwelcome & unwanted Soap Scum residue left over from this Soap on my Face & my Skin was no longer even one bit moisturized but instead, dry, Soap Scummy Residue feeling & was becoming very itchy because of this non clean rinsing Goat Milk Soap. My hands were really & truly showing the left over Soap Scum Residue from this Soap as for they were turning very White scaly, dry Color about an Hour after use & cracking which they were not near this bad before using this Soap.

Therefore, in my opinion, this Soap is of not great quality, cleans Skin very poorly & does not rinse clean off of the Skin at all. Thus leaving behind a hidden but noticeably delayed Soap Scum Residue which from me does not earn this Soap no crazy rave 5-Stars like many others here have reviewed & given this Soap. I won't buy this Soap again or even this brand of Soap & am simply donating the remaining unused 7-Bars to my local Salvation Army Thrift Store just to get rid of it out of my House & Hands.
These lashes are so pretty but do yourself a favor and buy them from Walmart for about 8 bucks. For this price you can buy yourself like 3 packs (15 pairs).
Love the soft fragrance. I don’t care for strong flowery smells and this has a very mild fragrance. Leaves my hair nice and clean the gray looks nice not yellow or dull. I felt the it’s price fairly.

This wig looks really cute, and I was able to get it to mostly blend with my natural gray hair around my face and with my widow's peak, which is pretty hard to blend in with a lot of wigs. I don't like to use any kind of glue or tape, so I depend on a wig grip and bobby pins to hold everything in place. This fit my head pretty well, and I have an average size head, but I think slightly larger heads would fit too. I'm not sure it would do too well if you have really long and thick hair, as it might take up too much space in the cap. When I had it on, I didn't notice the tracks, but when it was off I thought they were pretty noticable, and I was a little worried. Also you know how on some wigs, they add those short annoying hairs that inevitably end up poking through the longer ones and looking weird? Yep, I noticed the hair towards the back of the cap does that. Coincidentally, that's the place where the tracks are most visible as well.
The thing I like about it, is the actual hair, and the color, the texture, and the ability to flip it from side to side (even though it's parted in the middle. The style of it is most like my natural hair of any wig that I've purchased so far. I did add some dry shampoo. The color looks really awesome indoors. Outside in the daylight, it is a little much. It looks pretty white outdoors, but has a nice silvery-gray color indoors. So there are some negatives, but I could see wearing this as a daily wear wig. It didn't tangle too badly after a full day of wear... even with me running my fingers through it and flipping it like I do. I was easily able to tidy it up by finger combing at the end of the day. I wish the back side was slightly longer because the front that frames your face is longer and the waves in the back can look a little shaggy compared to the slightly curlier waves in the front. Overall, it's still cute, but I think the price is too much for this short wig. It should be closer to the $20 range. I'd love to own a 22-24" version of this in the same color or even a slightly darker gray or gray mix.

I was super skeptical of a product like this, you see it all over Instagram and I just assumed it was to make money. So I finally bit the bullet and ordered a reasonably priced one.
The first time I used it, I was pleased but also disappointed. It wasn’t as satisfying as I expected. I gave it another shot about 4 days later and gave my face a little extra steam and it took out so much gunk so fast. I would say once a week for sensitive skin, and work your way up to the highest setting. Don’t forget to steam your face so your pores are open!

I actually really like this palette. I love the banana color. I have very pale skin, so finding a highlighting shade that is actually lighter than my skin is really hard. This shade is MUCH lighter, but it is definitely lighter. I LOVE that there is such a variety of darker shades, it makes it possible for me to bring out some features more than the other when I contour, which isn't an option for a lot of other palettes. The powder goes on very smooth and effortlessly. In earlier reviews it states that this doesn't have good coverage, but it's a contour palette, it isn't meant to cover anything. I don't need to use much of the powder for it to show on my skin, I definitely don't want "harsh contour lines" so I only use about 3 brush strokes of each color. My highlighter came broken due to Amazon's poor packaging, but I was able to use the broken powder to test out the product before my replacement comes. I have tried a few other contour palettes in the past and this one goes on the best, while at the same time using the least amount of product.
I was VERY excited to receive this in one of their recent promotions, and I definitely recommend to anyone that is starting out with Contouring or anyone that just wants to try out a new palette for a good price.

This is the best mask I have tried so far. The texture is strange, it doesn't have the mud texture, but rather a chocolate gelatin pudding texture.
You just use a thin layer, so you don't need a lot, and the bottle is huge so it will definitely last a while! Then you leave it on for 15 minutes. After having it on for about 10 minutes it started to burn, I could literally feel all of the impurities being sucked out of my pores. It was only a slight burning sensation so I wasn't worried. I have extremely sensitive skin, so I was nervous to see how my skin reacted once I took it off.
I love that it doesn't make a mess in the sink when you take it off like other masks do, it just turned the water a slight grey color.
After taking off the mask, certain areas of my face were red but that subsided within about 20 minutes, but it literally looked like it sucked all of my impurities out of my pores. I had 75% less blackheads after I used this mask. I was AMAZED. I never thought I would see results like this after just one application. My face felt incredibly smooth, clean, and hydrated. I love this mask, and I will definitely make it one of the staples to my beauty regimen. I definitely recommend to anyone that wants to help their skin.
I was very excited to receive this product in one of their promotional offers in exchange for a honest review.

My first thought when I opened my package was how nicely kept they were. You get 3 bundles 12inch, 14inch, and 16inch. They each come in their own sealed plastic bags and then they are all in a nicer zip lock bag with the company's name on it. I wasn't expecting to get so much hair ! I don't do sew ins so I also got some extension clips and I'm going to sew them on to the band at the top of the hair that keeps the hair together and make my own clip on extenripms and I can make them as thick as I want and any length that I want so they will fit my head perfectly ! I can't wait to get started with them. If you're looking for good quality hair extensions I would recommend giving this brand a try. I've had multiple hair extensions and these are some of the nicer ones I've had.
***disclaimer I got this product at a discounted price for my unbiased review based on my personal use.

This stand is beautful and it goes together so easily. The legs have magnets on them which just stick to the little magnets on the body of the display. Unfortunately, when I put my nail polishes on it, I coul only see the colors of the bottles on the first (lowest) row. The bottles lined up so that they covered up each other and I couldn't see the colors. I had to pick up each bottle on the upper rows to see what color it was.

So, if you want this to contain your polish bottles and keep them together neatly, this would totally work for you and be great. However, if you're looking for something that will display your polishes, and let you see rows of colors, this is not it.

This is the first glass nail file I've ever used, and I'm really impressed. My husband said it sounded like nails on a chalkboard, but I didn't think so, and I was able to change how I was doing it and make it almost silent so it didn't bother him.

I loved that there was practically no dust with these files. I don't know where it went, but it wasn't all over me for a change and that was awesome! Usually I have to brush it off my shirt and pants and there just wasn't anything to brush off my clothes.

The colors are pretty and I really like that they each come in a separate case. I've stashed one in my purse, in the car, in the bathroom, on my bed table, and in the kitchen.

I feel like the quality is excellent and these will definitely last me forever.

Just start off with saying I did not purchase this product via Amazon I bought it at a Whole Foods near my home.  Also that I am thrilled with the design, carrying case, cleaning brush, and cap that come with the product. I do believe the design prevents back flow of mucus but I do not believe there is anyway to 100% guarantee that pathogens cannot be inhaled.  I stand here with a scratchy throat as exhibit A!  Sorry but this is not the first time I feel I directly and immediately contracted an infection through use of this type of aspirator.  First time was with the NoseFrida which is why I switched.  I thought the hose was getting old as I had had it for a year and decided to get a new frida.  When I saw the ecopiggy on the shelf I decided to chuck the filters and go with this far superior design/concept.  Well I feel think the back splash of what ever pathogens exist in my baby's mucus have found their way into my throat through inhalation.  I do not have a degree in science and I cannot deny that I may have already been infected and am just now showing symptoms but I just feel the device is suspect and have read many other similar comments. So just decided to put a public service announcement out and let people know so maybe some more research will happen to get us that 100% safe rate we want to keep using this wonderful concept!

I’ve always wondered what this product can do and if it does in fact work. So even through the reviews weren’t 100 percent satisfactory, I thought I’d give it a try. It came in a plain white flat box filled with 300 of these (I haven’t actually counted each one so I don’t know if there are actually 300 of them) I googled on how to apply these stickers which wasn’t that hard to follow.
Cons: they do not seem to stick well.
They aren’t invisible to the eye so you can definitely see you have tape on the side of your face or where ever you decide to put it on.
They also make your skin itch. Maybe I recently developed sensitive skin. Who knows. But that’s not a good sign when your skin turns red and feels like it’s burning & itching simultaneously.
Pros: they are stretchy
The end.
So, to sum up my review, they don’t really work. Well for me that is. Instead of returning it, I decided to just keep it to perhaps use it for something else

Winky Lux Orchid Gelee Serum | Skin Brightening Serum | Hydrating Serum with Hyaluronic Acid & Ogliopeptide (30 mL / 1 fl. oz)

(Written by my Roommate)
The first thing I love about the Winky Lux serum is the smell! It smells very floral and light. It feels good, I use this in my skincare routine before a moisturizer, after I get out of the shower. It feels okay on my skin, whenever you dispense some product out- it appears some of the flowers come out and they do not dissolve very well or rub into the skin. They come out in small flakes. That’s the only downside of this I would say. I did use this on a dry patch of skin I had, and it recovered within 3-4 days. I would buy this again.

Ingredients: Aqua/Water/Eau, PEG-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Panthenol, Propanediol, Betaine, Phenoxyethanol, Acrylates Copolymer, Ethylhexylglycerin, PPG-26-Buteth-26, PEG/PPG-20/6 Dimethicone, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Sodium Hydroxide, Benzotriazolyl Dodecyl P-Cresol, Sodium Phytate, Parfum (Fragrance), Calcium Alginate, Agar, Gellan Gum, 1,2-Hexanediol, Propylene Glycol, Dendrobium Nobile Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Citric Acid, Benzyl Salicylate, CI 77891 (Titanium Dioxide), CI 73360 (Red 30 Lake).

For Beloved Girl Extreme Moisture Mineral Cloud-Silk Facial Treatment Mask for Sensitive Skin, (25g x 1PC)-

I actually liked this mask quite a bit. It’s not quite up to par with the other mask I’ve tried by this brand (the other was a completely different style of face mask though). This is a good sheet mask. It is rather thin however it didn’t rip at all when I applied it. It is a little tricky to put on though. It comes with a plastic frame to help guide it when applying. I still did have that issue where the mask rolled up a little in the corner when I peeled off the plastic frame. I had to try to unravel the sections that did this after it was on my face which eventually I was able to do.

Pros-
Refreshing and hydrating.

Does moisturizes very well. They put enough of the product in that I was able to apply the extra over areas the mask didn’t cover.

My skin felt very soft after using this.

Cons-
Difficult to apply evenly. It’s not too much worse than the average sheet mask though.

I don’t like the full ingredients list isn’t available or at least not easy to find. I see they highlight the “key ingredients” but not the full list.

Overall I do like this mask because the results were very good for me. My face felt cleansed and hydrated. I do think it’s a little on the pricey side for the type of mask it is but it’s not by much so I would reorder this. The ingredients not being fully transparent is something I wish they would change. The results were good for me though.

Spa-Da Immunity Support Soap 6pk | 7 Essential Oils Clinically Evaluated to Boost Immunity and Protect | Moisturizes with Sweet Almond Oil | Healthy PH for Skin Microbiome | Handmade in Ohio-

Pros-
Great for exfoliating
Hydrating
Skin feels great after usage
Made in the USA

Cons-
The scent is very strong of clove (too much so for me) It's the only scent I can smell from the soap.
Breaks down very fast
Fewer suds than traditional soap ( more suds than I would have thought but still less)

I was a bit thrown off by this soap. Before getting it I was thinking it was going to be like regular soap but when you see it it’s anything but regular soap. My roommate and I were both a bit confused thinking perhaps these were bath bombs because the look is similar to bath bombs more than it is to bar soap. I had to revisit the listing to double-check that it is meant to be used as soap.

Usage is interesting. It does break down very quickly though it stays intact long enough to use as bar soap. You just don’t get many washes out of each bar. With water, it does suds up a good amount which I like. It also gets a bit milky looking and the gritty texture does exfoliate too.

After using it I like the feeling of it on my skin. My skin feels a little tingly, refreshed, and soft. So it does work well for me as a soap but it just doesn’t last long.

The scent is not my favorite at all. Some might enjoy the scent but it’s very strongly clove-scented. It’s a bit too overbearing for my tastes. The scent also seems to last on my skin for a little longer than normal bar soap would. If I was more fond of the scent this would be a good thing.

Overall it’s a decent product but it’s not really for me. I just don’t love the scent and it’s a bit too different from normal bar soap for me. I love the exfoliating ability of this soap. That is the one area I really liked and I would buy this if I found a scent I enjoyed. The price is reasonable given that you get 6 bars. I would say they last maybe 1/3rd to 1/4th of the length of most bar soaps and that might be a stretch.

FOR BELOVED ONE Melasleep Brightening Lumi's key Bio-Cellulose Facial Treatment Mask (33g x 1PC)

This is an impressive gel face mask. I love the feeling of this mask. It’s a heavy gel mask that is anything but dry. It’s extremely refreshing.

I will say the directions are brief. When you take it out it’s tri-folded (the one image above are the two outer layers and the mask was in between those). It does rip if you aren’t cautious with it. There are 3 layers. Once you gently unfold it you peel off the first layer. Then apply to the face and after doing so peel off the outside cover. It is much easier if you pull out the eye holes and mouth hole before placing on your face. It does have a fair amount of staying power once it’s in place for a minute. Directions state to leave it on for 10-15 minutes. I left mine on for probably about 20 minutes.

The end result was great. My skin felt clean, rejuvenated, and soft. I really am impressed with the results given my hesitation to try a brand I wasn’t familiar with. I wish I had more of these because I would love to use them on a regular basis but the cost is a bit unrealistic to me.

Thus the one negative with this mask. The price point is very steep. I’ve had many masks that worked very well for much less. Now I did have a particularly great result from this mask so don’t get me wrong it may very well be worth the money to some. I’m just not one of those people that could justify it to myself. However, I do love the feeling I have after using it. I am not going to knock the product rating for the price point because that is really the only thing that I don’t like here. The product itself is really good and I’m happy with the results. I would just reiterate that the listing is for a single mask.

NEOGEN DERMALOGY REAL CHARCOAL PAD 5.07oz / 150ml (60 PADS)

These wipes are absolutely amazing! I was super impressed by how refreshing these feel. Despite the charcoal, they are rather smooth but do exfoliate to a degree.

First off these are very well packaged. They come incredibly moist, not dried out at all. Hard to believe there are 60 of them in the container but there are. Despite it being a little small one wipe is more than enough for a single usage because of how much moisture is in each wipe.

These work really well on dry skin. They don’t feel oily but they certainly feel like the ingredients are being absorbed by my skin. They have a faint scent that is pleasant and just as refreshing as they feel. The price is fair given how many you get and the quality of them. All around this is a great product.

This hose head is really made well. It’s solid metal and has a nice heavy duty feel to it. I was a little confused at first because it comes with that smaller screw in attachment already screwed into the base. I almost though I got something that wasn’t for a garden hose but you just need to unscrew it an take that piece out if your using with a standard garden house.

The water stream comes out very strong and it is adjustable by turning the head. It does have the little metal clip so you can lock it and not have to keep holding the handle down. What I really like though is the water pressure aspect. I’ve been using those expandable garden hoses and they tend to not give you much pressure. This head really gives you the extra pressure and makes it so I can reach the further spots of the yard. I’m very impressed with this. All around it’s a well made product.

High quality tools with this remover. I really only needed the removed though. Would have preferred a larger bottle instead of the tools. This stuff is super effective at removing gel nails however the bottle only has enough to remove 2 full sets of nails. By the third time I used it I was only able to apply thin coats which was far less effective and more time consuming and still had to pull off nails which I hate to do. I don't know if there is another method or product for removing gel nails. As crazy as this stuff is I can't imagine an alternative. Getting even a tiny bit any where on your skin or clothes and your going to feel it! I treated it like wet nail polish the first and was just careful. Now I'm sure to use the rest room first make sure I'm not gonna be changing the channel on the TV or moving at all! I threw on my coat n took the dog for a walk. Bad decsion. My clothes were fine and so was I really. Once i washed it off I was totally fine but that stinging sensation is extremely unpleasant. The remover reminds me of putting hydrogen peroxide on an open wound. The way you see the white fizzies. Only if it was a giant glob consuming your gel nail. Leaving on a thick layer for 15 or 20 min I was able to completely wipe away my gel nail. When i was less patient I'd wipe and apply more every 3 to 5 min and had to clean up my nails a little after. Instructions do say to use a file to rough up nail surface first which I did not do this time but does make it faster
First pic of my nail (gel polish over clear tips using solid nail tips gel and uv light to attach them instead of nail glue) is before remover
Second pic is one coat of remover about 5 seconds after application
Third pic is second extremly thick coat probably third and fourth coat also. Applied right over first one a few seconds after application
Forth is about a minute or two later with no additional application. It looks so gross but it is stuff just consuming my false nail
If I didn't have the tips and it was just straight gel polish I'm sure I could use less and it would take less time. But I wouldn't use this for that I do not think. Haven't yet. I should add I have had no damage to my natural using this stuff or pain on my natural nail. On my skin doesn't feel so hot but it does wash away and there's no redness or discomfort once washed off. I can't even believe I'm leaving a review like this, this stuff can't be good for humans but then again I am no stranger to chemicals in beauty products.

I love this stuff, it's truly miraculous, I deducted one star for softness because the conditioner could be a little more hydrating, but other than that I love it, takes away yellowing from my white hair and leaves just a hint of purple which I love

I have very thin, brittle nails. They are like paper and just tear at times. I got this nail gel kit to apply to my nails, to give me nails. To make my hand look pretty. My natural nails are so pitiful looking. Unfortunately, the glue, that you use is UV based, and it just wouldn't hold the nails on. It's not due to my thin brittle nails, because although thin and brittle, they are fairly long. Long enough that these fake nails to attach too. I tried several times, on a couple different days...but never getting more than a couple hours worth of nail wearing, before they were popping off.  I'm giving this product 3 stars.

I have very short hair and just cannot get it to grow past my shoulders, no matter what I do...
I see all these ladies walking around with these cute ponytails hanging, and it makes me so sad, I just wish I could put my hair into one. But it just won't grow long enough. While shopping around on Amazon, I found this clip in ponytail. And the fact that it's real human hair, and just a smidge off from my natural shade of color, I had to give it a try...I'm so glad I did. Now, I'm the one walking around with my head held high, and my "ponytail" swinging. I love it so much. I HAVE to give this 5 stars, how can I not? It's perfect for me, and if you too have the same problems with your natural hair as I do, you may be just as impressed with this product as I am.

Well this is the second wig I have tried. One long hair, because I used to have long hair. That was a BIG NOPE! So I seen this one, It being the color of my natural hair, and shorter, I thought I would give it a try...Still a NOPE! Maybe I just cannot wear a wig...or maybe just not yet. I do still have hair. To me, it seems I'm about bald, but to others I've still got plenty of hair...I don't know, I'm just used to having hair, and I want hair, so I was trying this wig to rush along my need of something to give me hair, when I'm truly not ready for it yet. Because it's a nice wig, nice color, length and style, I rate this wig with 4 stars. It's not the wigs fault I'm not ready.

The colors and very pretty. But when putting the liner on my eyes, I dipped the liner in the color, and went to apply it to my eye, but it's just not that great. It starts out going on smoothly, but its like it dries out mid stride across my lid. So other than the beautiful colors, I have nothing more good to say about these liquid eyeliners.

I use the polygel nails, and from time to time, I need to clip it on to hold it on until it gets completely dry. I got these clips to help aid in holding my nails in place. But for some reason, these clips leave dents in my nails. I  had to redo them totally. 1 star is the lowest  I can go.
Unfortunately, when I first used this, it caused a rash. I passed it on to a friend of mine, who seems to like it. Saying, "her skin feels so soft and smooth."
This product did NOTHING that it claims it does. It is ZERO EFFECTIVE. People should have to tell the truth about products.  SCAM! SCAM! SCAM. Do not buy.

I have very dense, thick, and long 4C hair, so my texture is the most coarse texture of hair to possibly test the durability of this blower-dryer comb. Anyone that has coarse or thick hair such as yours truly, likely runs into the same problem as me when you blow dry your hair after a washing. The dang blow-dryer comb keeps popping off and/or the teeth bends and snaps off. So annoying! Since this is very expensive for a blow-dryer comb, I'm sure ladies will appreciate this critical review before purchasing. Here are the pros and cons I've come across.

Pros...The material is the highest grade of plastic (not at all rubber) I have seen in a blow-dryer comb. It appears to be equivalent to the "plastic" material cooking utensils are made of, so the teeth does not easily bend/break. The finer and less dense your hair is, the longer the life-time you will have this comb. If you attach it securely, the comb actually works without popping off.

Cons...This seems to only work for dryers with a narrow barrel, and not so much for the dryers that has a bubble shape. It will pop off dryers with a bubble shaped barrel, because it will be impossible to secure it on a nozzle tip that is not cylinder-shaped. All you need is a phillips screwdriver to attach it. Since I have 4C hair, I did actually notice slight bending of a couple teeth, and the bending increased after a 3rd usage. After my 3rd hair drying, I tried to hand-bend the teeth back in place, and 2 snapped off! $40 bucks (cost and shipping) down the drain :-( Also, what you don't know until you see it in person is that there is a metal bar inside the comb, that is being raked against your hair as you are combing it, which will eventually cause heat damage with prolonged usage, especially if you dry your hair on high.

My overall assessment is that, yes it worked better that expected. Although 2 teeth broke on mine and others slightly bent, I plan on buying another one to have on-hand, as I currently have not come across any better options. But, I'm going to take a break from this comb for a while, and try drying my hair with a paddle brush and my dryer because the thought of that metal bar inside the Willie Morrow comb, raking against my hair with every usage is alarming, and will surely heat damage my hair.

It's okay, but I'm not loving this water flosser and would not buy it again or recommend it.

Main reason -- Even after rinsing the "tank" several times before use, it makes the water have a "terrible" plastic taste. I did resolve this a bit by adding some of mouthwash to each tank of water before I use it, however I can not use it without adding the mouthwash because it makes the water taste terrible and did want to be able to use it with only plain water.

Secondly, it is rechargeable, but only via a USB connection, not a standard "home" electrical out as I had I expected (NOTE: It says it's 120/240V compatible) which is why I thought it would be charged via a standard electrical outlet versus a USB Port. USB is okay for those who own computers, (I do), but we certainly don't keep our computer in the bathroom. I have to charge it in my office, which is a bit inconvenient for a bathroom product.

On the upside, it does work pretty well, once you can get used the the water taste and it's nice that the are three settings. However, I feel the tank is too small and need to refill it for each use. One full tank is not enough to clean all my teeth, even on the "pulse" setting.

Overall, it's okay and does serve the purpose, but would be MUCH better if it did not make the water have the awful "plastic" taste and if the take was larger. If I could have returned it for a full refund I would have. But, since it's NOT defective and there is not a free trial period, I'm stuck with it. I'm going to use it for the time being and continue to look for a better product.
The wig  didn’t fit comfortably. Misportion size.. too small  . Wouldn’t recommend for adults

Great concept, however the carabiner clip is too small for the bottle. When I forced the clip to fit on the bottle like the picture, it pinches the plastic and cracks it, allowing the liquid in the bottle to leak. SAVE your money....this was a waste. 👎🏽
its ok. Please *READ AND UNDERSTAND the label*. I got it as a gift and it works ok-ish. Lots of toxic stuff in it. I won't be using it in the future.

The kit was amazing had fun playing around with it was a bit difficult to put on since but got the hang of it. While putting the gems on ready to show it off the next day I wake up and all the gems fall off! I was so disappointed worked so hard to put them on the glue does not work at all! The gems will not! Stick on at all! Gems Only lasts less than 24 hours. You can not eat anything cause it will cause them to fall brush your teeth or sleep with it on. The kit is over priced for something that does not last! I’m heartbroken. I was looking forward tho this.

Before purchasing I had read the reviews and believed any issues were isolated and decided to purchase. Unfortunately I was only able to get 4 small tattoos out of the entire pack. Printing was relatively simple and the ink did not run or bleed out. I used photo quality and matte paper for my settings.

The issue is with the adhesive. For the tattoos to work you have to first print the item on the paper; then using the clear adhesive sheet cover the tattoo. All the clear sheet is used for is a transfer medium to move the adhesive onto the image. Where I ran into the problem was getting the adhesive film to release from the plastic sheet and remain on the image. Separating the image side and the clear plastic sheeting resulted in varied degrees of torn images, half the adhesive sticking, or the entire image sticking to the clear sheet

One tip would be to have someone hold down the adhesive/image side as you remove the clear backing. This has its own set of problems since the adhesive side sticks to your hand and gets stretched out or bubbles up.

In summary the idea is great but the adhesive needs to release from its medium easier to make the product more user friendly.

4 stars for the amount of brushes this comes with.

Deducted one star because of the terrible plastic paint smell and that it's not specified what type of animal hair fibers are used. Still waiting on an answer for that.

Received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review

As with any makeup brushes make sure you wash them before using to minimize shedding
I received nail clippers instead

I have an aunt in another state who is a hair dresser. Years ago, she asked me if I wanted to perm my lashes when she came down to visit. I thought she was crazy! This was like 10 years ago. I never heard of such a thing and I didn't do it. Well I don't know what happened recently for this to suddenly now become popular. One of my friends and I were talking about lash extensions and lattisse. I was telling her how my eye lids turn red when i try to use lattisse. I even tried the RF brand and same thing! Anyhows, then i've been doing exentions for about a year now but I am finding that my lash is getting worst and worst.. like when my extensions fall out, I barely have lashes! I used to have average lash that  I could curl. But now it seems like I barely have anything. So this is why I decided to finally consider perming my lash. So perming the did not make it longer by any means! What it did though is made it look like I had lashes that were longer but it curved up! My lash tends to grow straight. It may have have to do with the fact that I have asian eyes. So the curling has always been important when I used to wear mascara. The thing is I hate that sometimes it poked at me and the curler would yank some lashes out!  Also I just hate it doing it every day. With perm lashes, you don't have to do this. However, I don't know if I could have done this alone. I had to get a friend to help me. She said it was pretty easy. What took the longest is us reading things over and over to make sure we weren't going to make me blind! I think it took about an hour or so? I can't recall exactly as we didn't time it.  The reason I am giving it 4 stars is that you really cannot do this by yourself.  Now it may not look drastic to most people bc they don't usually notice your lashes. But you would b/c you know how they look before. Then add mascara and you can definitely tell.

I originally got this thinking I’ll give it as a gift. But I ended up keeping it for myself!! The moisturizer is so nice. In the cold season, I have real bad dry skin on my face. Ira horrible. Or gets flaky at this. I have used some moisturizer that felt too thin (but great for  summer).  It seemed like it was doing a good job then then the flakes came right  back so it was very surface  and didn’t penetrate. Then I’ve had very thick moisturizer  like the one you use at night. The problem with this is sometimes it made like little balls. I’m not sure how to describe it but it kind of made a layer and then peeled  off. So I needed something in between. This wa a perfect. It is actually thick but liquidy. In other words it is very moisturizing. After you put it on, you need to let it soak in and dry a little. But it works great. Normally  I have combo skin. I use deep moisturizer only in the winter.

I have the worst tangled hair ever from all the highlights and dying it I've done over the last 15 years. My hair is so damaged. And also because it is so long, it's almost impossible to manager. I also have a TON of hair. When I go to the salon, they usually have two people blow drying my hair. Anyhow, I have a detanger brush, I've bought hair mask, I've used leave in conditioner, and I've used different detanglers. (I've done the it's the 10 product also). I have to say I was very impressed with this bottle. Right off when I sprayed it, I noticed it came out different. It wasn't a spray, it was more of a mist spray so it sprayed more powerfully but evenly and wide. I used it right after I showered and towel dried my hair and then sprayed it and brushed. And it worked. i was able to detangle my hair. The only thing I wish was that this bottle was bigger. It's pretty small!
I returned this. Not worth it. was not as expected. Can't get a response

This product is life changing! It gets the brushes cleaner than you could by hand and whirls the water out for fast drying. So happy! No more scrubbing on silicone pad and rinsing over and over and over to remove soap and then waiting forever for brushes to dry.

If you’re planning on buying this for the mia secret monomer don’t do it . That monomer it’s too strong and this is not going to help . I switched to the Young Nails and it works, but not 100% you just have to add 10 drops or more depending on the amount you use .

I deliberately ordered Northern Lights silver holo topper after reading about how thinly scattered the holo bits are.  When I do galaxy nails, I use 2 or 3 of the scattered holo toppers, layered with a super thick, quick drying top coat, so it gives depth and dimension to my nails, and for the stars that appear farthest away, I prefer a micro-micro glitter that is not densely packed, and apply those coats in reverse, with the  smallest/thinnest one going last.  I also prefer holo toppers that don't have colored glitter added, and this Northern Lights formula is perfect for me, with just the standard silver holo particles and no bonus colors added.  I generally don't like gold color items, but am going to get the gold version of Northern Lights too, because this particular holo topper is very impressive.  The way I look at it, the more intensely packed toppers don't look like a galaxy.  They can be used to create milky way looking area, but this topper makes deep space look better.  It's kind of difficult to explain making galaxy nails to a non nail person, which is who I'm aimed at.  Those, and the newbies, are my intended readers. So I hope this made sense.  But I love this stuff!

I've only had this for a few days, but the package says it thickens nails in 3 days. Had I read that in the description page, however, I never would have ordered it.  Nothing can strengthen or thicken your nails in 3 days!  I need help getting my nails strengthened and thickened, not just a thick top coat to make them feel thicker.  I do multiple coats of polish with my nail art,  and that helps, but I still need stronger nails, which means I need something to thicken these babies, not just make them feel thicker. Thankfully, I ordered 3 items to help my nails.  This was the last and cheapest thing I bought.  I had hoped it would help, and will use it, but that one statement about how it works in 3 days ruined it for me.  I will happily post a follow up if it eventually does work, but I won't be holding my breath.

Scent - somewhat floral.
Texture - very sticky. I like this but you will need to wash your hands after applying
Moisturizing - standard.
Mask - has the annoying eyehole flaps. I pushed them to face the skin so I could use them as eye masks.

Each pouch has 12 pineapple ring shaped slices you can stick on your face. It is not enough to cover my face and I can wear the average sheet mask.

If you have used circular cucumber eye masks that various brands make, you will find these masks to be similar. You are receiving small rounds in a packet rather than a full sheet mask.

However what is awkward is that unlike cucumber eye sheet masks, you get 12 slices rather than just 2. While this seems like it would be better, in reality is that means you need to commit to using all 12 slices of fruit in one go because there isn’t an easy way to reseal the mask package. It doesn’t come in a resealable pouch.

Because you end up with 12 slices of mask to use you end up covering maybe half your face with slices and you’re basically doing more for less mask. The instructions do say this mask can be used anywhere on the body but I don’t know how that would work in practice. What areas need sheet masking and where will the rounds stick?

I think if Kocostar had made the slice line of masks into a fruit salad deal with multiple slices of fruit per pouch that would’ve made more sense. If they had sold these masks as 12-120 rounds in a container like many eye masks are sold, that also would’ve made sense.

I think if you intend on sharing these masks with others (Eg six friends each taking a pair of slices) or want to store the opened packages or want to use masks to target specific areas of your face or body this could be a good purchase.

These mini masks were moisturizing but dried out faster than a full size sheet mask. I don’t know if that’s due to size or formula.

Honest review:
Okay so I have worn this wig since Saturday and today is Tuesday. My take on the wig since its been washed, knots bleached and flat ironed.

Pros:
Wig didnt smell
Is very full and has body
Knots bleached easier than expected
Lace blends well against skin..may want to use glue rather than hair spray bc it don't hold well.
Wig looks good and dried well after washing.

Cons:
Alot of fly aways, thinner ends in frontal
Construction isnt the best. The wig has a track seperating the frontal from the sewn bundles which is irritating because the part isnt that long which leaves me with the only option; remove it or monitor whether its showing or not which is uncomfortable bc a wig shouldnt expose you. This irritates me BIG !!!!
The frontal of the wig is whispy and not as full as the back. Im not sure if its the humidity outside or not but I flatironed it this morning and it looks more of a body wave in the front and straight in the back. Most bobs dont look like that, so this was is a must for me.
Wig cap is HUGE. If tou have an average sized small head you will have to customize this unit. I do understand that they make them to where they can be adjusted to the customers liking abd or big head friendly bc everyones head comes in different sizes but I struggled today lol. I reconstructed the whole wig in the back. I took four tracks out the back and cut the comb out and replaced it to help on the track line and sewed it through the cap for the much needed support. I had to cut the sides down as well bc it was really bulky. I sewed the band that came with the wig into the wig as well to hold the bulkeness down more. When I say I was tired I was but all in all I like it better now, my head is just small. Hopefully I can figure this seperatung track out. I may just use this wig when I want to pull the hair up or something bc I cant be worried about this. 😬 Im not sure of anyone else experienced this with their purchase, but it may have been just mine. I will update once it get colder as far as the hair spray sticking good and the the whispyness of the sides that cant seem to stay straigh all day.

[[VIDEOID:c7ea1ada61f6bc13ccf9a564082e2c55]] I have relaxed hair & decided to order the 10 inch kinky straight clip in extensions. I hoped the kinky texture would be similar to my own hair but it was not. In my opinion, this feels like Indian hair that has been crimped. Very silky, very soft, & affordable so I'm not mad. I haven't noticed any shedding and I only needed to use 3 pieces since I was only trying to add a little length. The clips are very secure feeling in my hair & it was super easy to install myself. I am definitely a newbie to hair extensions so if you're nervous about being able to do this yourself, don't be!! I will say the hair did smell like burnt hair. Ya know the salon smell with all the hot tools on? Yeah that's the smell lol. Also I will note that it is very difficult to straighten the hair from the weft to about 5 inches down. If I would've known the hair wasn't a truly kinky texture, I would have gone with the regular straight. Overall I'm very happy with the product! I recommend highly.

Oh and sidenote: just for those who may be wondering. You can totally put your hair up with these clip ins. I do suggest getting a longer length though for a ponytail or high bun. No less than 14 inches in my opinion. Also if you're looking to add fullness to your hair, I'd recommend buying 2 sets. As stated earlier, I just wanted a little length in the back b/c my hair is already super thick so one set worked perfect for me.

I tried the Lume cream stick and really wanted to like it. The consistency never felt like it dried, left me feeling like I was sweating and stinking even more, and would leave residue everywhere! I hadn't bought Lume in almost a year and even tried children's deodorant thinking it would help since puberty hits super hard so kids' stuff has to work right? NOT.

The Lume solid stick is a lifesaver. It goes on super smooth, doesn't have a dry time, smells nice and strong, and best of all, no smell! I haven't tested the sticks lasting time since I shower every day, but normally coming home from work, there's a faint BO wafting around me. Now, I don't even think twice and don't regret purchasing the solid stick. I'll try different scents later since the cucumber melon is just a little too fake for me, but this restored hope!

I am a professional stylist, the only way these work is to have your hair colored to match. It is wonderful after that's done. Easy, convenient, and inexpensive. These are very full and will last a long time of you take care of them. I gave 3 stars because the highlighted style has a drastic change in tones that don't blend all that well. Order solid colors, they are beautiful ! 💯

I ordered this styling head so that my daughters, who are ages 6 and 15, and I can learn various hair braiding styles and techniques. This is a good styling head for us to practice on. It is easy to attach to tables and countertops. It stays securely in place without moving or falling off. I ordered this in the fun and vibrant Rainbow color because it looks cool and fits in with the decor in my daughters’ room. This styling head came with a small pack of hair ties and a hair clip. The synthetic hair tangles easily and comes out whenever we brush it. We like the thickness and length of the hair. For amateurs like us, this is a decent styling head to practice new hair styling techniques. I am glad that I got this instead of the styling head doll that my daughter originally wanted. The size, quality, and price of this are much better than the toy versions.

This clay mask is nice because it is sheer enough so that it doesn’t harden and become too stiff and uncomfortable. It is lightly scented with a clean fragrance that smells pleasant when applying this to my face. The directions state to leave on for 5-10 minutes, and then to rinse it off before it is completely dry. I have noticed that if I do leave this mask on long enough for it to completely dry, it develops an unpleasant scent that smells like sulfur  when I go to remove it.

This is unlike any clay mask that I have ever used before. This product is water based and does not dry on my skin like most clay masks do. After I apply this to my face and leave it on for about 15 minutes, it still feels moist and slick when I go to rinse it off. The texture of this mask is more gel-like than it is clay. It feels lightweight and does not leave my skin feeling too dry and tight. This mask is effective enough for use during the winter, when my skin tends to be more dry. The product packaging looks attractive, but I wonder if they intentionally misspelled the word “moisturizing” as “moistorizing”.

I usually only stick to créme lashes the (ones on the left) but I thought I tried these ones out. They feel good they aren't plasticky or hard to bend. They could be more fuller though.
