I haven't actually wore them yet, but they seem like they will hold up okay, shipping was fast as well. Not much to complain about. 👍

I will start off by saying, I waited a few weeks before I wrote this review. Before I buy a product, I always read the best and worst reviews. Well, here's the facts.

1) I met the devil in this device.....I'm not sure whether to compare the pain to the most sensitive/worst tattoo of my life, or a dilation-8-pre-childbirth. To sum it up, it HURTS. I did both my underarms and my upper lip. The upper lip hurt the worst, hands-down. The under-arms were maybe dilation 5. You know, you're starting to feel it good and are at the point of whimpering because you just can't hold it in anymore....yeah, that. I will admit the 2nd time using the product was a little better. But barely. This is my first epilator. It won't be my last. Despite the pain, I'm a lifer. I like NOT having to shave for a good 3 weeks.

2) The charging is just "okay". I made it through a complete round (1st time), and into one underarm weeks later. I was almost finished with the first when it died. I had to wait until the next day to finish. That was a bit irritating but given the price, it's to be expected.

3) Perfect size. I have small hands so I really wasn't wanting some bulky device that weighed a ton. This is small and light. Big plus!

Overall, for the price and outcome, it was WELL worth it. I almost bought a $200 device but decided I'd test the waters with what an epilator was to begin with. Don't waste your money unless you're wanting to do your legs or a bigger project. This baby works great! Not great on the legs though. I tried it. I'll stick to shaving those.

Plump it is definitely hyped up but I do have to say I personally like the product. It does work for a little while but it doesn’t last as long as it says it does. It also turns your entire mouth incredibly red so you should apply it before makeup. The burning sensation is something you get used to after a while of using the product but i’d suggest using 2 or 3 pumps when using it because it does in fact burn like hell. Overall I probably wouldn’t spend $40 on this product again but it wasn’t as awful as people are explaining. Your lips DO look slightly bigger it’s just not to the extent everyone is hoping for. The fact that plump it literally posts people with lip fillers and naturally big lips doesn’t exactly help and is probably what some people expect to see within their own experiences. Don’t be like those people lol.
Not worth it
Feels greasy once on, even using as little as possible. Did not care for it at all.
Was broken

The bottle of slip solution was inside the boxed closed and fully sealed but empty so I was unable to use the gels with it.

I tried both gels and they cure OK, I watched videos online did flash curing and additional curing for permanent gel overlays but the gels never got hard enough.

Without the solution to keep the gel bound to the nail, I was able to peel the gel right off my nail an hour later.

The forms included did not work well, it could be again because the slip solution was missing.

The gels descriptions also say non-sticky and all they did was drip and get sticky once they touched my skin. I had to get acetone to clean things off and that worked well enough.

I think it these gels have potential but I will have to purchase additional materials in order to make them stay on.

I have been wondering what the big hoopla is about crystal face rollers so I obviously had to try one for myself. My favorite crystal is rose quartz so I decided to go for that instead of jade.

1. This comes in very well-designed packaging that makes it suitable to give as a gift.

2. If you like rose quartz you will love this. It's really pretty and well-made

3. I have been trying oil cleansing lately and I personally love it, so adding the rose hip oil as part of this set was a good idea. The oil didn't make the roller slippery.

4. I had never tried crystal rollers before and I liked the feel of it. I barely used any pressure and the roller did its thing which felt like a massage but definitely not the kind you would get from hands. It's different in a good way.

5. This is not a miracle, work immediately kind of thing. I enjoyed the feel of doing it and it's my personal opinion that added to a regular beauty routine, this could yield some positive results. I followed the roller and oil with a foaming cleanser and a honey mask and my face looks amazing this morning but it's very likely the combo of it all.

Now that I bought and used the T980, my cool slacker goatee is attracting too many women. I'm not getting any rest.

Naturally, a product that causes grief should be down-rated, but I won't here because this shaver is just doing its job.

And, we all like things with "turbo" in the description, however loosely that term is applied. It makes it go faster with a cool noise, so even in a shaver that is attractive to many.

Electric shavers for beards sure beat the heck out of scissors! The Norelco has a wide range of cutting depths and my beard comes out a uniform length. I did not feel any pulling or other discomfort. The charge seems to last for days and the charger itself, like the shaver, is a decent and modern design.

The little detail cutter is easy to attach and does a great job of defining the beard area and also clipping any stray hairs under the nose where the big cutter head cannot reach.

Some people think the closest cutting position is still not close enough for that short-stubble look and that does seem to be the case. I don't want mine that close, but I understand those who do and I take off a star for brotherly solidarity. Actually, I'm sure that if it was to cut more closely, that would take it into the realm of regular shavers, an expensive world of high-tech blades and lubricants. Actually, if you press down a little, you can get closer.

The turbo thing works well. It vacuums almost every hair into the storage chamber. I didn't expect the vacuum action to work so well. I think the turbo button should be the only button, but there it is. The non-turbo setting is less noisy...

The parts detach easily and the little supplied brush works well to clean it out. The little travel pouch is nice.

The T980 works just as it should, for me, and the price is reasonable. I think it will last a long time and I am glad I bought it.

As for the women, I did exaggerate. One did make a favorable comment which is one more than before. That is an improvement, eh?

I agree with most of the other reviews. This is the best electric shaver I've ever had--lightyears better than the Braun Syncro I was using before. I don't expect to get as close a shave with an electric as with a blade, so I don't think it's fair to judge them by that standard; the only thing that makes sense is to compare them to other electrics, and this one is outstanding. It's quiet, it charges quickly, and it shaves your beard. I like products I don't have to think about.

I'm not pleased by the fact that this model doesn't have a low-battery indicator. That's a demerit. The stand is a little gimmicky. You can charge the unit without using the stand; the stand just makes the product look a bit more pretentious. (My shaver came with a free "personal groomer" for beards as well as ear and nose hair; this was a nice addition, but not enough to make or break the sale.)

Lastly, to the guy who had a hassle at Target: don't blame the product for the fact that you don't like Target's return policy.

FYI - IF I'd taken a bit more time it would have been straighten more but weeeeell worth the price! I have various lengths of grow out from an undercut and this does a very quick job of evening out all the different layers. I have wavy short hair and I am very pleased! I had the device warmed up my hair straightened and ready to go by the time it would have taken my old iron just to heat up!

- Lazy girl approved!
- I wash my hair every other day approved!
- the glove and heat slip - will be traveling with me.

I bought 2 of these. One for myself and one for my Mom. My Mom liked it but I did not. I have always used wooden back brushes with natural bristles but decided to try a plastic one to see if it would last longer. I have never liked nylon bristles and sometimes they irritate my skin. The description said that the bristles on this brush were boar bristles.

First problem I noticed was the handle was shorter than I was used to. I am a short average build guy and I have some difficulty reaching my entire back easily with it. Second issue, the bristles are some sort of soft plastic not boar as advertised. The bristles are tightly packed which is nice but very soft. They didn't irritate my skin like some but the softness left me questioning how clean my back was getting. The tightly packed bristles seem like a great feature but after you use it a couple of times you realize that it makes air tough to get through the bristles so the brush takes longer to dry than most. If you don't really sling the remaining water out of them and/or pat down with a cloth the brush may still be damp the next time you go to use it which doesn't seem hygienic. The last issue I have with this back brush is there are no grips or non-slip material where you hold it. It can become kind of slippery and cumbersome when the handle gets wet.

This does seem to be a well made brush that should last a long time, it just wasn't for me. It is definitely better than the the plastic back brushes you find in most retail stores. My Mom loves it. She kept hers and I was easily able to get return authorization through Amazon with no issues for mine. Going back to a wooden natural bristle brush. Sometimes it's better to stick with what you know.

If you've been reading any of the reviews here lately you will know the 8000 series foil/cutterblock combo has been replaced with a new combo now called the series 5 Combi 51S. You will receive this replacement even if the picture on the product page shows "8000 series" as it has been discontinued for over a year. Braun merged the replacement for the 8000 series (Activator) with the 360 Complete. This new foil/cutterblock is garbage! The cutterblock has wide blades, as opposed to the thinner blades of the original 8000 series, which pull your stubble and take MANY passes over your face to shave. They are prone to premature failure and I have gone through 3(THREE) of these in 6 months! (I bought one and two were free through Braun after complaining). All the free replacements in the world weren't making the shaving experience any better. I longed for the days when my Activator 8595 cut smooth, close, and comfortably. After all, this shaver had been my favorite for 6 years so far! I was very close to dumping the whole shaver and moving on when I happened across a reviewer on Amazon who suggested using the 7000 series replacement foil/cutterblock in his review. It worked PERFECTLY! The 7000 series replacement looks just like the much coveted original on my 8595 Activator - down to the thinner cutting blades! It didn't pull my stubble, it cut smooth as butter, and was comfortable: JUST LIKE NEW! I'd like to thank the original reviewer (James L. Walls "sixtoe") for the very good advice.

***Update: August 10th, 2011***
I hope people are happy with the replacement I recommended. I sure am! I just wanted to update the product link for the better replacement: [[ASIN:B001VH6F9G Braun Series 3 Combi 30B Foil and Cutter Replacement Pack (Formerly 4700,7000)]]

***Update: January 13, 2013***
Unfortunately, the Braun 30B Foil and Cutter Replacement Pack is now the same terrible cutter block design as the series 5 (8000 replacement). I ordered another 30B to replace the one I bought 2.5 years ago and was highly disappointed when the package came. I will have to do some research to see if any of Braun's other replacements are the good, narrow blade versions. I have read some reports that the narrow cutting block is available, but without the foil. If I cannot find a narrow blade replacement I am going to throw in the towel after 8 years of service from this shaver. Shame on Braun for putting out those ill performing wide blade cutting blocks. Terrible...

***Update: January 18, 2013***

It appears the highly elusive narrow blade cutter block can be found on the 31S replacement pack. The unfortunate news is the included foil is not compatible. Therefore, a replacement foil for the 8000 series/Activator/7000 series/360 Complete would be needed in conjunction with the quality cutter block effectively doubling your cost because it is difficult to find the foil sold by itself. This would be a combined expense of roughly $55-$60 in order to bring your shaver back to the "like new" shave we all want. Remember - the "direct" replacement combo for this shaver series will leave you highly disappointed due to the WIDE cutter block which pulls hair and easily nicks skin. Another facet to influence your decision in spending $60 to refresh your Braun is many of these shavers - due to their age - are in need of new motors and potentially batteries. The motors gradually slow down with time and I noticed a HUGE difference when I replaced mine 2 years ago. Now, these motors are almost impossible to find at this point and for me, personally, it is getting to the point of diminished returns. I hope this post helps you in both informing you of the available narrow cutter block, but also in weighing your decision in either keeping your Braun chugging along or researching a new alternative.

I love this product! I travel often, and I’m always freaking out that the plastic diffuser that came with my dryer will get broken during transit leaving me to deal with bad hair for my entire trip. This diffuser fits snugly on my dryer, even with my dryer’s somewhat oddly shaped end. There is no struggle to put it on or get it off. I simply put the collapsed diffuser down on a flat surface (typically the bed) and press my dryer into the end. I do not have any issues with it collapsing during use. I actually get more air flow with this one versus the one that my dryer came with giving me a faster dry without sacrificing any curls. A very satisfying purchase!

I have been using this in hopes to make my 5.5 incher a bit longer.  So far I have been using it for the past 2.5 years on average of 3 hours 5 times a week.  It requires dedication and commitment in order to get any results.  Even though i have been using it for 2.5 years I have seen very little difference.  After i have it on for 3 hours my penis looks longer flaccid for a few minutes because it had been stretched out. Within a few minute it reverts back to its tiny size. When erect I can honestly say I dont see any difference at all.  It hurts if you put it on incorrectly and can be very fiddly.  For men who have a smaller head it is very difficult for the contraption to stay on as it continually slips off.  I only use it when i am in bed or at home.  A few times i wore it to work and within 30 min of arrival i had to take it off because it started hurting really bad.  The logic behind the contraption seems to make sense , stretch the skin to produce more cellular structure, but that takes time even years to work.  I have not given up on the contraption and I am still using it 3 hours a day. I am sure if i used it longer hours it may work quicker but for me after 3 hours My penis just cant take the pain anymore.  Good luck guys.

I LOVE these discs! I thought I was getting benefit from using the green PMD body discs on my arms and legs for my KP, but then I decided to purchase the black and yellow discs for more exfoliation, and oh my WHAT A DIFFERENCE!!! You definitely can't start with these right away, but after you get used to the PMD, then I absolutely recommend using the most coarse disc you can safely stand! I honestly prefer to order these from Amazon vs directly from the PMD website because sometimes they go on sale on Amazon, but mostly because the shipping is MUCH faster. I read a review that sad their discs they ordered were fake because the packaging was different, but the package I received from Amazon is the exact same as the package of discs I order directly from the manufacturer, so mine were legitimate. The package arrived fast and completely intact. The discs work exactly as I thought they would. Absolutely 1 complaints from me!

I highly recommend these discs!! Happy exfoliating :)

I probably have the world's thickest face hair which is a nightmare to shave. I usually use a double edge razor and do a couple passes. Came across a Facebook ad for this razor so decided to give it a shot. I received it yesterday and wow am I blown away. With just one pass this razor cut closer than my other razor. And the way the blade is made it actually forms to your skin while shaving. And it's easy to clean because the blades have space between them.

Update: these blades last forever. I maybe go through one blade a month. I've never been so impressed with a razor in my life. I have now bought one for my wife, my daughter, my brother, and my nephew. I highly recommend that everyone purchase this razor.

I had pretty high hopes when purchasing this shampoo, especially after reading all the glowing reviews. Over the past year, I've actively been reducing the number of chemicals in our household and have saved body care for last as I struggle to find things that work as well as mainstream ones. Pretty bummed to say this but I'm adding this to the list of products I've not been a fan of.

The good - it smells fantastic and there are far less questionable ingredients in it than most. It does seem to make my hair soft, too.
The bad - While soft, it almost gives my hair too much volume or something? (I have fine hair but a lot of it.) Anytime I use it, I end up with all sorts of cowlicks and hair sticking up in odd ways no matter if it's styled or air dried. Thought it was just my hair at first but this only happens when using this shampoo. Finally, the bottle that was sent ended up having some weird manufacturing defect where the top wont stay shut. It now has to sit upside down which is kind of a pain considering the design of the shampoo bottle doesn't easily allow for that. I'm constantly scared it will tip and spill, and this stuff is far too expensive to waste!

EDITED: Wanted to return to add that I've recently been using this product consistently and my hair has never felt healthier. Maybe it just took some time for my hair to get used to? Not sure if it's due to this shampoo, the supplements I recently added, or what in particular but I am starting to really love it. Only left one star off for the minor annoyance of product defect. Fingers crossed that won't happen next time.

I'm very into nail art so this was one of the coolest things I've tried out in a while!
This is a pretty complete set - it includes any brush or dotter you'll really ever need. They're also in a cool case with a little info page explaining the different brushes.

- The case is sturdy and makes the set very, very giftable! It looks pretty great.
- There are 2 brushes for acrylic paint, 6 for regular nail art, 2 for gel polish, and 2 double sided dotting pen/tools. That's a pretty complete set. If you're gifting it, you could sweeten the package by including polish, a bottle of polish remover, a small painter's palette, and precision-tip q-tips! But, all the brushes are included in this set.
- The two dotting pens are double-sided so there are 4 different dotters that give you a fantastic range. Can't imagine you needing any smaller or larger ones. They also have really cool sanded wood handles. I like the feel of them.
- The brushes have an awesome range, too. They're colour-coded and labelled by type (acrylic, regular polish, gel polish).
- Now the info sheet says to use polish thinner (or rubbing alcohol for gel polish) to clean them. I tried this and it just made it clumpy (maybe my thinner isn't a good brand for it!). It specifically says to avoid acetone but I used pure acetone to clean them which worked fine EXCEPT that it stripped the paint off the handle of the brushes. NON-acetone remover cleaned the brushes, didn't damage the bristles, and didn't strip the paint so that's what I recommend, personally. Non-acetone polish remover is your best bet. Just be gentle, no matter what you use, to avoid damaging the bristles.
- Overall, I love this little set and it's a great addition to my nail art collection.

I bought this discounted in return for my opinions and review.

Keep in mind…. The description says “lip tint” but it’s anything but. Ladies.. this is a heavy full on lip gloss.  The only thing that makes this a tint is when it’s fading off, then it stains your lips red. I wasn’t expecting THIS! It goes on like a gloss but it’s sort of like a cream. So hard to explain the consistency of this product. I didn’t like the feel, it’s quite heavy on the lips. No weird after taste though. I don’t even know what’s in this for the labels are all in Korean. Yeah, I’m not a fan. FYI it literally stains everything. Do not wipe off excess with your finger. I applied it yesterday and my lips are still stained red!!!

Winky Lux has a forever customer! I’ve officially tried all their products from this line and loved each and every one of them. This serum has a light scent and is not sticky during application. It absorbs into the skin and makes your face feel soft and amazing. The serum is clear and is in a glass bottle. The bottle is so pretty by the way. It’s another thumbs up from Winky Lux. I purchased this through the Amazon vine program.

I was offered this tea tree oil through the Amazon Vine program and I purchased it for myself. To be honest, I don’t diffuse tea tree.. I’ve been using it for a toenail fungus that I’ve been battling for several years. I also put a few drops in my foot cream and my daughter uses a couple drops in her moisturizer that she applies to her face every morning and night. This oil is USDA certified organic with no additives or fillers. Also, it’s made in the USA. These are things that I look for while using it for medicinal purposes. The bottle is a brown, glass bottle, which is what oils are supposed to be packaged in.  The bottle is much smaller then my regular brand.... it’s only 1/3 fl oz. But, keep in mind.. less is more with this oil. If you’re going to use this on your skin, make sure you use with a carrier oil or an unscented lotion. I’m very happy with my purchase.

These extensions are made from beautiful, extremely soft hair. It is healthy & shiny, and the "light brown" color that I ordered is PERFECT!!! (Don't rely on my photo for accuracy.. it's much prettier in person) I'm in love with the color- couldn't be happier. The reason I only gave 4 stars is because they are on the thin side :(( I was surprise by this because they're double wefts, which means more hair than typical extensions. The seller says they are160 g... I don't know about that, but it was enough for my full head so I'm keeping them.

They are very easy to clip in & they STAY PUT, but if you've never used clip in extensions before you might want to go on youtube & watch a video on how to apply them. The quality & color are top notch, and the price was very reasonable. I just wish they were a bit thicker. You will definitely have to trim them, which makes the ends healthier looking. Overall, happy with my purchase.

This Seller needs to tell prospective Buyers that this product DOES NOT FIT the newer designer faucets that have recessed aerators, which are the most popular faucets now days. These are not like simple the aerators on other faucets. It's recessed and screws up inside the faucet tip. Standard aerators are just screwed on to the end of the faucet tip and can easily be removed by unscrewing them with a pair of pliers. My Delta faucet needs a special key/wrench to remove the aerator that you can purchase on Amazon, but it's likely this product won't fit anyway, based on the other reviews I read.

I really wanted this product to work, because I have a Shower Breeze (purchased on Amazon) attached to my shower head, and I love it. This product looked identical but made for sink faucets. The Seller needs to make an adaptor that fits recessed aerator faucets since none are available. I returned this item.

I purchased this directly from NailsInc on their website. I was so excited for a simple way to apply polish. This product, sadly, doesn't work. In practice, yes ... you get to spray on nail polish and wash away the excess. The issue is that the polish looks hideous. It's clumpy and goopy looking. I don't have a pic, but my nails looked exactly like another reviewer's ... it looks like you tried to use 10 yr old nail polish - old and gummy. I work in a professional office environment and there was no way I was going to leave the house with nails looking like that so I immediately removed the polish. What a waste.

I have had the Oral B Vitality toothbrush for about a year. It really does a great job, and my last dental visit was my best ever - no cavities or gum issues, my dentist was impressed. I've tried both the single and dual action heads, and have a preference for the latter (it just feels like it cleans better).

However, I have one major complaint. After only a year, the toothbrush has stopped charging. (This after I fully discharged and recharged it regularly, like they say you should.) I suspect everything in the product works well, except for the rechargeable battery locked inside. However, I must now throw away the entire thing - charger, plug and all - because I cannot change the Ni-Cd battery itself.

Braun, please make this product more environmentally friendly...
Perfect!!

Nice styling dryer even on my short hair. The spin function added a bit more body to my fine hair which is a nice outcome.
Easy to hold although a bit heavy but my hands did not get fatigued at all.
The different heat settings go from warm to HOT, gotta watch the hot one, and from high air to low air with that changes with the heat settings.
The spin function buttons are very sensitive, you barely have to touch them. The brush rotates in both directions or not at all.
I like this styling brush.
I have not been able to try out this nail file as I cannot get the pin out of the top to put attachments in.  So, because I can't use it, I cannot give a review.
Pretty.  How ever once it fits to your head and loosens up.  Does not stay in your hair
This brush is great for reaching your back for a good scrub! The bristles are soft and do a great job of exfoliating. The handle is curved ergonomically. The loop makes it easy to hang.

I've been using this over my entire face before bed, not just around the eyes. Love the way this feels on my skin. It sadly hasn't done much to brighten the undereye area, despite a great blend of ingredients for that purpose. This doesn't surprise me, as dark circles have many causes, largely genetic most of the time and therefore notoriously difficult to fix. It did however help soften the undereye lines caused by some overzealous retinol treatments, and alleviated eye bag puffiness. And although this doesn't really matter much, I absolutely love the light citrusy scent. I've tried an outrageous amount of skin care products, ranging from super cheap to obscenely expensive, and this is one of my favourites.

This product is intended for permanent skin lightening and will require weeks to take effect. So if you are looking for immediate results, I recommend Shouvy's BB whitening cream with SPF30; it is a cosmetic lotion which gives instant whitening but does not physically alter skin tone.

This is a blend of effective natural whitening agents with additional properties beneficial for skin. These ingredients have been demonstrated to even skin tone, lighten hyperpigmentation, build collagen and inhibit the production of melanin. The skin lightening agents in this product are as follows. Google each for further information, but in brief summary:

Glutathione has been called the mother of all anti-oxidants. Clinical research has shown glutathione significantly lowers the skin's melanin content in as little as 10 weeks.

Kojic acid is derived from mushrooms, used as a skin lightening agent because it inhibits the protein tyrosinase from producing melanin. Kojic acid alone has shown effects faster than most other lightening agents, beginning at about 6 weeks.

Even faster is Artocarpus Lakoocha Heartwood extract. Used alone, it has shown significant whitening effect after only 4 weeks of application.

Coenzyme Q10 aka ubiquinone is a chemical substance naturally produced by our own cells. Applied topically, it can help lighten freckles, age spots, acne scars, and other discolourations. Q10 may also help enhance regeneration of skin cells, thereby reducing the appearance of wrinkles.

Vitamin C provides surprisingly high level lightening and increased UV protection while helping to fade sun/age spots and freckles. Vitamin C is also proven to boost glutathione levels which further helps lighten skin. It also enhances collagen synthesis and increases cell turnover, which makes it a popular ingredient in anti-aging serums.

All together this should be effective in treating melasma (dark pigmentation), acne scars, freckles and age spots. The company does not mention SPF but the inclusion of titanium dioxide, coenzyme Q10 and vitamin C would be expected to provide some degree of UV protection.

Before applying whitening lotion, you should perform a patch test. This is a good practice before using any skin care product, but especially those containing parabens. (common allergen) Just dab a little on your wrist or inner elbow and wait a few minutes. If you experience any signs of irritation such as redness, itch, or swelling, of course discontinue use.

My skin is somewhat pale, but tans easily, so I always have one arm darker than the other simply from being exposed to sunlight in the car. I will conduct an experiment using this lotion on the one arm only, and report my findings. Whitening creams do require several weeks to produce results, and the effect increases over time. For now I can only say that it goes on smooth and silky and has a pleasant scent.

***EDIT - I've now been using this product for several months, and just raised my rating from 3 stars to 4. Yes this lotion actually does work. Not surprising, with those ingredients. If you don't mind using a product that physically alters your skin's production of melanin, and are willing to use this daily, it will absolutely lighten your complexion a shade or two. Just be patient and give it two or three months to achieve full lightening potential.
Curls doesn't pinch
Smooth and Soft Skin will continue to use Serum

I'm really loving this curling iron. I am not a curling iron type of girl at all. I hate the old curling irons and have been hesitant to even bother with these wand style irons. Not only that, but what size do I get? This iron is exactly what I needed. I love the wand style. Much cleaner looking, smooth curls. I love that it comes with mulitple, interchangeable sizes all in one nicely boxed kit. Saves space and works great. Really happy with it and the results :)

This thing is very frustrating for me. After tey8ng for a loooong time to get it to work, I finally figured it out. I unfortunately didn't like the process, feel or the results. It feels like it's grabbing my skin and it just doesn't seem to be consistent. Others wsy like it, but I don't :/

My thoughts and criteria for products I review: (Amazon’s Rating Criteria in Parentheses)
' 1 star (I hate it!): Feel it's a waste of money. Will never use it again. Would never recommend. Not safe to use. Either throw away or return it.
' '2 star (I don’t like it): Don't like it and wouldn't use it again, but may still have at least 1 positive thing about it.
' ' ' 3 star (It’s ok): Product has both positives and negatives, and I may or may not continue using it. Someone else may like it more and is potentially still worth purchasing.
' ' ' ' 4 star (I like it): Item as described in functionality, purpose and quality. May have 1 or 2 things I don't care for or would change, but not big issues. Would recommend if asked, but wouldn't say I love it.
' ' ' ' ' 5 star (I love it!): Practically perfect. Nothing lacking in functionality or quality. Love it and would not only recommend, but would purchase for others and continue to purchase for myself.

I was so excited to try this product and I am not impressed to say the least. I have large pores on my cheek, forehead, and nostrils, and after two weeks of using this product 2x per day, I haven’t noticed any difference. Obviously I don’t expect change to happens overnight, so I will keep using it until I run out and update my review with any new findings. I will say though, the scent is mild and pleasant, and is the consistency. It’s labeled like clay but it’s a bit looser than clay. I do like that part and it has a very light tingle. It does not warm if that’s what you’re expecting. I feel very clean after washing and it leaves a layer of moisture on your skin so you feel silky under the water. Overall, Unless I start to see a change in my pore size, I feel like there are other product just as well suited to clean my face if that’s all it’s good for.

Update 1- after a few days of posting this review I can’t attest to any new findings yet as far as effectiveness, however, I thought it worth mentioning to add that the pump dries out. The clay crusts over and the pump gets stuck. 1 you only end up getting one small pump out of it and 2 the hole where the product release has clumpy dried up clay too and clogs super easy so not much comes out without poking a hole in it first. The pump design wasn’t a genius move for a clay like product. Poor design in that aspect.

I really wanted to love the Kylie polishes. I bought several different colors and the top coat. First..it fits not go on smooth like the other sinful colors. It's a bit chunky. I thought it might be a bad bottle but it's all of them that have any sparkle to them. After about 2 strokes on the mail it gets thick and stringy like old nail polish. Does not go on smooth or even. Not even after 2 coats. When using the step 2 top coat if your color isn't 100 percent dry it will pull the color off.  It takes an incredibly long time to dry.  And when your finally ready to remove....make sure you have time. I tried every method...leaving the cotton ball soaked on my nail for 3-5 minutes did little to speed the process. I had to file down the top coat to get the remover to penetrate and it still took tons of friction and remover to remove. It took me over 20 minutes just to remove the polish. The colors are gorgeous but it needs some work on the formula.
Love the color love the look, it does seem to tangle but nothing some wig spray and a brush can't fix.  Great density.
I loved it.  Hair was soft an I did not have too much tangling problems

I have been using this product about a week now and I really like it. I first began using hyaluronic acid serum (another brand) a couple months ago and I was getting low on my bottle so I decided to give this one a try. I love that there are only three ingredients in the bottle, but I can see how the labeling "pure hyaluronic acid " could be misleading. It also contains water and benzyl alcohol. This serum is really refreshing and I use it every night on my face and neck. You can use it morning and night, but I just chose to apply it before bed. I pour about a third of a dropper full into my hand and rub it in gently. I have severely dry skin and it has helped keep the dryness and flakes at bay, which is wonderful. It recommends just using 1-2 drops, but that would probably work for someone who does not have really dry skin like I do. The bottle it comes in is glass and it comes with a nice glass dropper as well. The serum is clear and does not have any smell. The reason I cannot give five stars is because it is a little bit more watery than the hyaluronic acid I was using previously, so I believe this one is diluted down a bit. But, with that being said, this brand is also cheaper in price. I am happy with it and will continue using it. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All comments and opinions expressed herein are 100% my own and are not influenced whatsoever by my discounted purchase price.

I purchased this hair because I loved the colors.  I did 6 goddess braids on Sunday.  I nearly scratched a hole in my scalp from all the irritation it caused.  The style lasted 4 days. The hair is soft and thick but it does not work well being dipped in hot water.  It frayed horribly within 4 days.  My scalp is so sore all I can do is throw on a wig.  I wanted to love this hair but I'm highly disappointed.
I love these earrings.  Perfect for any occasion. Colors are very vibrant.

Firstly, I'll say that I've had nothing but Glam-Seamless tape extensions in my hair for two years now. I've tried everything from the super-blue to the basic tape, and recently got this for my first time.
Ok not sure what junk these complainers and low-star raters were smoking, because there's no way you could say anything but amazing things about this tape.
99% of the time I have my extensions put in with other tape, within 3 weeks and maybe 9 + washes, the first few of my extensions are slipping out. By 6 weeks, I have few, if any still in, with 2-3" between my scalp and the extension, therefore, they're popping out of my head and look ridiculous.
After my first time using the Duo-Pro, not only did NONE of them slip out in 8 weeks, but they moved slower away from my scalp than ANY tape I have EVER used. They're amazing. If I didn't want them refreshed and tight to my scalp like I prefer, I could have left them in for quite a few more weeks. This is THE BEST adhesive tape I've ever used and the only one I'll ever use going forward.

Clean up: raw coconut oil to saturate the strands and rub between the tape bond, despite how strong the tape is, it comes out easily, pain free and you'll lose almost no hair at all. You just need patience taking them out.

I love the idea of these makeup removing rags. It saves a lot of money to be able to buy one product that removes makeup, oil, and dirt without having to buy makeup wipes, cleanser, and all the other products that we spend money on to clean makeup off of our faces.
I will be comparing this product to the name brand Makeup Eraser http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KBPSUYC?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o05_s00 that I bought off Amazon as well and have had since June 16th 2015 so I can see if they are the same of different.

Makeup Eraser Claims:

Makeup Eraser removes 100% of your makeup with just water.
Removes mascara including waterproof mascara in just seconds.
Cloth is approximately 7" wide x 16" long.
All natural, no chemicals, and machine washable.
Use up to 1000 times and everything comes clean;no stains and remains soft. Promotes healthy skin.

Makeup Remover Claims:

Reusable. Simply clean it in the wash for a brand new cloth, again and again.
Absolutely NO harsh chemicals on your face
Super soft material that is gentle on the skin
Clears away hard to remove makeup with less effort

Makeup Remover (purple) Pros and cons Vs. The Makeup Eraser (pink)
* Both cloths are soft and both sides feel the same as the other.
*The purple cloth is a tad bigger than the pink cloth which is nice.
* They both remove waterproof mascara easily along with other regular makeup.
* They both wash up the same.
* The makeup eraser feels thicker than the Makeup Remover but does not affect the makeup removers ability to remove makeup.
*The price is quite different. The Makeup Remover (purple) is around $13.00 and the Makeup Eraser is around $20.00 for pretty much the exact same thing.

If you are looking for a way to save money and want a cheaper version than the Makeup Eraser but performs the exact same, I would go with the Makeup remover. Save that extra money because this cloth performs the same thing as the Makeup Eraser.

* I was sent the makeup remover cloth at a discounted price for my ubiased review. I bought the Makeup Eraser at full price. All opinions and comparisons are my own.
Good

of the 5, one is correct: the red/white stripes and then the dark blue w/ white stars.
of the rest: 2 of them are supposed to be red/white/blue but w/other designs. one is red w/a bunch of stars and the other has arrows but still red/white/blue to look like the flag. the red is ORANGE. I put right next to the correct one and it is def ORANGE. so it in NO way would look like the "America" colors that would be used for 4th of July or other events as that was the point. the other two are supposed to be red/white stripes and then blue/white stripes, each w/a different combination. one has the blue on the bow, the other on the band. well, these are blue and LIGHT BLUE and NOT white at ALL. so they are red/white stripe and blue and light blue stripe. again, not at all what would be appearing to be American flag colors. would not spend that money for just one so have to send back. Am wondering if the blue/white ended up being light blue b/c the color bled into the white stripe next to it. if that's the case, then that means the color could in fact transfer to one's hair if it got wet too? or clothes. yikes!

This is my first foray into the use of beard oil. Over recent months, as I grew my goatee longer, I started noticing some flakiness on my chin (always clean and well groomed), and that my beard hairs were becoming drier and stiff. It seems time is against me, as the gray hairs in my beard are noticeably stiffer and scratchier. After reading reviews of several products, I chose the Fragrance Free Beardsmen Beard Oil. I didn't want any scent that would compete with anything else I chose to wear. I specifically chose Beardsmen after comparing ingredients with other brands. Formulations were similar, all using several types of natural oils to create a moisturizing product. Two things convinced me to try Beardsmen. First, the quantity. For less money than some other products, Beardsmen offers a much larger quantity of oil than pretty much anyone, so they definitely win the "bang for the buck" award. Second, Beardsmen is the only one that has a flow controlling dispenser, so you don't have to mess with ridiculous eye droppers and such. Oh... and the product itself? I LOVE it. No more flaky chin skin, and my beard is soft and smooth. This is obviously a plus as far as my wife is concerned. There is only the very slightest hint of a light "oil" smell when you first put it on, which is not strong enough be more than barely noticeable for a second or two, and definitely would never be noticed by others. After using this for about a month, and giving a small quantity to a friend to try, I still have most of the bottle full. This stuff will last forever, and when you finally do run out, you'll likely panic and jump on Amazon to get another bottle. I know I will

I bought this as a blind buy, as there were no reviews on this fragrance.
I used to really like the original Candies, from back in the day. I was so upset when it was discontinued.
That said, my nostalgia got the best of me when I saw this on Amazon. I don’t recall what the original Candies smelled like, so its hard to say how close this is to the OG formulation, but this one smells really sweet. My initial response to it was “aqua net hairspray with citrus magic”. It is very ‘orangey’, and the citrus is huge here.
Once the hairspray smell goes away, it smells rather nice. It doesn’t smell expensive, you can tell it’s not a high end fragrance, but it’s nice. I wouldn’t buy another bottle, though. Same thing with the Candies Black (which I also bought- blindly). I wouldn’t renew either of these, but it was not a waste. They smell “OK” enough to wear out, and the projection is intense. These “new” Candies frags will make people around you get a headache, if you take a bath in them. A few sprays is literally all you need. Both are extremely strong, and the scent lasts a while on the skin, and a very long time on clothing.
It has a little bit of a gourmand thing going on after it dries...it smells like lemans and oranges. I suppose wanting to eat it is why it’s called “Candies”, so in that regard, kudos.
There’s something going on beneath all the citrus, but I cannot for the life of me put my finger on it.
Just know this is very sweet, like Invuctus, but “cheaper” smelling. It’s really not terrible, but they’re not for me.
A teenager may love these Candies fragrances, but if you are over 30, you may want to think again.

My mom and I both received these as gifts.  It does not stay put and can actually throw you off balance when it goes sliding.  The actual product for both of ours is also different from the pic on the box.  Ours both have very long, firm bristles top and bottom that are difficult to move back and forth through, and there are bristles completely surrounding the pumice stone so that you can't really get to it.  The pic on the box and the advertisements show no bristles at the back of the "shoe" behind the pumice stone, only in front of it, so that it's actually accessible.  The way these are made, the stone might as well not be there, because you can't use it. I'm not even sure it's an actual pumice stone after running my fingers over it--it feels artificial and has a different texture than pumice.  It's a good concept, and will at least take off surface dirt--if you can hang on to it.  I actually worry about it causing seniors to fall, instead of preventing it. I have to think there are different models; I looked online at the commercial and the plastic looks different and there are several colors, plus no bristles at the back.  It says EZ Feet on the box, but it looks like this may be a cheaper model than the one they push on their site and their commercials.
NO BENEFIT WHATSOEVER....MORE EM;PTPY PROMISES FROM AN INOTHER ZERO EFFECT PRODUCT.
It's all very synthetic smelling. You will smell like a stinky old lady with every one of their fragrances. I bought the sample ones and was completely dissapointed with every one.

This moisturizer is a light tan color and has a kind of gel texture. It smells a little medicinal and comes in a jar. I get it out with a cotton swab to try to keep it from getting germy from my fingers. My skin is dry/combo, aging, dehydrated and acne-prone. I mostly need help on my cheeks this time of year, so that's where I've been using it.

I spread this on my cheeks and it immediately leaves a slight cooling sensation. It takes a while for it to soak in/dry down completely and it feels a bit tacky until then. Once the tackiness is gone, my skin feels very soft to the touch, however, when looking in my makeup mirror, my skin doesn't look hydrated at all. It looks just like it did before using this moisturizer.

I think this might be more suited to someone younger and with oilier skin. The ingredients are nice, just not for my skin, unfortunately.

These pads come in a double-sealed container. There's the screw top lid you open to find a pop top lid with a little tweezer on top to get the pads.

The pads are very thin and flimsy...I have a hard time sliding them around on my face unless I use 2 or more. One side is textured and the other is smooth. The pads are extremely wet, as in dripping, so there's plenty of essence on them. It takes a while for my face to dry because of this. I don't detect a scent, nor is there any tingling or anything when I apply.

These dry out my combo-oily/acne-prone/aging skin, so I must use a moisturizer after my face dries or I get that tight feeling and "pull" marks on my cheeks. These add no moisturization at all to my skin. The good news is these pads do tighten up the looks of my pores and are helping to keep acne at bay.

As long as moisturizer is used after this step, I like these.

I was really excited to see this become available in the Vine program as I'm a skincare junkie. The ingredient list is impressive and I definitely need help with my oily, acne-prone skin.

I've used this 3 times now and have noticed two things: After using at night, I'm waking with what seems to be some kind of reaction to it as it's causing prominent red blotches on my forehead that aren't there unless I've used this. Secondly, the listing says this has the "Delicate scent of rosewater," but mine smells old...you know, that kind of smell when a lotion hasn't been used in a long time. I immediately checked the box and saw that my bottle doesn't expire until 5/s022, so I'm not sure if I just got a questionable batch.

Unfortunately, I can't recommend this. Again, maybe I just got a bum batch, but it's causing blotchiness that isn't usually there and smells old.

These are some high-quality loofahs! They're very thick and a good overall size. The handle makes it very easy to hold and I find the loofah part plenty scrubby for my skin.

With anything like this, it's critical it be allowed to dry completely to cut down on bacterial growth. I've included a picture of how I rigged mine to dry. I took one of those suction hook thingies, wedged it between two metal pieces of my shower caddy, and hang my loofah to dry. The important part of this is that in doing it this way, no part of the loofah itself touches anything. I read years ago that wherever something like this touches something else while drying, bacteria can collect there. I'm no scientist, but it makes sense to me, so that's how I've hung stuff like this for years. Works like a charm. I also love that I can throw these in the washing machine.

These are very nice loofahs and I recommend them.

I've kept a squirt bottle of water under my sink for years. I cut my own hair, so I spray it down before doing so. With a regular spray bottle, I always end up getting a lot of water on the floor when spraying my hair, then have a problem cleaning up the floor after cutting my hair as my hair is stuck to the wet floor.

This bottle has solved my problem. The mist from this bottle is consistently super-fine. No rogue giant droplets. I can spray my hair down and not get water everywhere. The bottle is easy to hold, is a great weight and is balanced well. The trigger is easy to pull.

This bottle is perfect to use for homemade wrinkle reducer for clothing as well. I just mix one cup of water and a tablespoon of fabric softener, shake well, then spray on fabric while pulling down on the fabric. The micro-fine mist dispenses a perfect light spray, so the fabric dries quickly.

This bottle is very easy to clean so I can use it for several things, but I'd like to get more so I can stop switching the contents out.

Definitely recommend.

When I went through chemotherapy, I lost most of my hair, and as a woman this was a real blow to my self image. This trio of products was recommended to me by the woman who runs our local health food store, and along with taking an oral biotin supplement (5,000 mcg per day), I used this three-step system (shampoo, conditioner, and leave-in serum) to wash and condition my hair. Between the two approaches, both oral and topical, I re-grew all of my original hair, and now my hairdresser swears that I have more hair now than I did before I was diagnosed with cancer and went through chemotherapy. It does feel thicker to me now, too, and my husband has also remarked that my hair has never looked better.

The only caveat is that if you have longer hair you may need an extra conditioner for the ends. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this product (plus oral biotin supplements) to anyone who has had hair loss due to chemotherapy. I was very satisfied with the results. Minus one star only because the conditioner doesn't work quite as well on longer hair, but it is more important that you apply this product to the scalp, so again you can use a more silky conditioner for the ends.
Nope

As I hit the dreaded middle ages, fine lines & wrinkles creep up all over my face, especially around the corners of my eyes - a true testament that battling Father Time is a losing proposition & I need help. Hence, I practice my daily skincare regimen religiously! My daily skincare regimen includes using serums, moisturizers, oils, eye creams. Sometimes I indulge in a spritz of Rosewater for refreshment.

Now I use my face serums to do two things. First, of course, is for the benefit to my skin; and the various serums produce different effects simply because they consist of different main ingredients. Most all of them help protect against environmental contaminants, help reduce the appearance of lines, and some even help dark spots to lighten. Merlot Sunrise Serum uses natural grape seed antioxidants as its main active ingredient. (If you check the Merlot skincare line website, you'll see that their focus is on the use of grape seed antioxidants in all of their products.)

My second use is my own personal "spa" massage. I literally massage the serum into my skin. I focus on my temples, forehead, jaw line, nasal bridge, between eyes, and crows feet areas. I apply a firm, upward rotating massage with my splayed fingers. I thoroughly believe this helps me to relax, relieves tension, and massages the lymph system to aid in drainage. I just feel this is good for me. I even do this more than once a day when I have a headache or a particularly stressful day. This will work with most any serum.

It works well with the Merlot Sunrise Serum because it in itself is refreshing, a light hint of "fresh air" scent, and literally feels good on my skin.

The recommended use is twice daily - morning and evening - on cleansed skin. Then followed by moisturizer. I am totally enjoying this lovely serum.

💞💓💕💯👍 HIGHLY RECOMMENDED👍💯💕💓💞

As we hit the much dreaded middle ages, most of us will then realize we ain't going to win the battle against Father Time. As such, we can, probably do, use a little help such as Retinol & Hyaluronic Acid based skincare products.

While It is widely known that it's the collagen that gives the skin its firmness, but it is the Hyaluronic Acid that nourishes & hydrates the collagen.

Most Hyaluronic Acid found in night creams or serums are traditionally extracted from rooster combs, and now it is mainly produced via streptococcal fermentation.

Through Amazon's Vine Voices Program, I came across this 『Brittanie's Thymes 100% Botanical Hyaluronic Acid Serum』. Botanical Hyaluronic Acid is derived from a plant called cassia angustifolia, protects the skin, strongly binds to water, and fills in wrinkles and fine lines.

The VERDICT
==========
Unboxing revealed that this bottle comes in an 8 oz (or 236 ml) of Botanical Hyaluronic Acid Serum which, even if used daily, should conveniently last me 3 months as part of my daily skincare regimen. I have been applying this "Botanical" version of Hyaluronic Acid Serum for about 2 & 1/2 months, I can see that it really performs better than its "synthetic" counterparts. In general, botanically sourced ingredients are better for the skin than their synthetic counterparts. As a result, Brittanie's Thyme Botanical Yyaluronic Acid holds 1000x its own weight in water, making it an essential ingredient for hydrating skincare products.

If you've already using some sorts of Hyaluronic Acid based skincare products (mostly synthetic types), nothing wrong with it, and it's working for you, GREAT! However, if you're looking for a more effective one, I highly recommend that give this botanical version a try.

💓💞💕💌👍 HIGHLY RECOMMENDED👍💕💌💓💞

After a hard day's work or workout session, there's nothing better than nothing than soaking myself in a bubble bath with epsom salt - it really helps me with relaxation & pain relief. I also love to turn off the lights, and light some aromatherapy candles & music. There's only one thing that's missing, a bath pillow so I can lay back & rest my neck as well.

Through Amazon's Vine Voices Program, I came across this 『Charyeah Bath Pillow for Bathtub/Spa』.

Unboxing revealed that it's a decent sized bath pillow, not too large that it takes up too much room around your bathtub, but large enough to hold your head/neck comfortably.

INSTALLATION
🛁🛁🛁🛁🛁🛁
Since I've never owned one, it would have been nice to have a picture of how it should sit in the tub; but eventually I figured it out since there's really only two ways to place it. For those of you having issues, remember to put the thin, rectangular strip portion around the rim of the bathtub, and the wide part on the slanted portion of the tub & that's where your neck and head would rest on while soaking in the bathtub.

REMOVAL
🛁🛁🛁🛁
A few words of cautions, after you're done, make sure you slide the bathtub pillow suction cups off the tub instead of pulling them off, trust me - you pull enough times, the suction cups will no doubt be severed from the pillow main body.

The VERDICT
🛁🛁🛁🛁🛁
I think this bathtub pillow works well, allowing me to get the true relaxation bubble bath experience that it's designed for. As long as you follow the aforementioned tips, it really does the job. It would have been nice to have a hook so that upon removal I can hang it inside the bathtub area like bathtub caddy or showerhead allowing it to dripdry.

We all may want to age gracefully but aging does take a toll on our face in the most bothersome way. Sagging skin and age lines look utterly unappealing and make us self-conscious. While there are myriad of facelift choices, such as Botox, facelift surgery, non-surgical facelifts, etc., a large section of women still look for less painful and less expensive options to achieve the best results. An instant facelift is also in pretty high demand to restore a more youthful look and here comes the importance of a face tape. The affordable solution takes years off your face immediately without the use of harmful chemicals or painful injections.

Through Amazon's Vine Voices Program, I came across the 『Crystal Lemon Face Lift Tape』.

Unboxing revealed that it comes in a 40 band-aid lookalike patches of various sizes for different areas of our faces where you'd like to tighten the skins a little. I'm skeptical to begin with, but unless I try, I don't like to pre-judge anything, and let the results speak for themselves.

The Premise
==========
These face lift tapes are basically a ‘band-aid solution to a mature face’. As the name reveals, it is nothing but a simple facial ‘tape’ that pulls back and stretches the skin to create an illusion of a tighter face. The tape is usually breathable, hypoallergenic, and of medical-grade. This non-surgical option gives a mini facelift instantly by smoothing out wrinkles and fine lines in a sagging and aged face. Since the last few decades, the facelift tape has been very popular only among Hollywood celebrities. But now, it has become a fast and easy at-home fix for anyone developing premature signs of aging.

The VERDICT
🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏

When used correctly, this Face Lift Tape could make dramatic changes to your aged look by reducing fine lines and wrinkles instantly. They are effective in smoothing out very fine lines around the eyes and firming up the jaw, which is really difficult to achieve even with makeup. However, this typically works better in older seniors like my mom, they didn't quite work, or make any difference, as I'm not old enough. Remember it's easy to go from F to D, but not so easy going from A to A+, if your skins are not wrinkled bad enough, it's nearly impossible to see a difference 🙄😏🤔😁😄

🙏🙏 If you find my review helpful, pls hit the 👍🙏🙏

It got this for my son, but he refused to use it because of the extremely strong scent. I tried a bit on my hands and it gave me an instant headache. We both likened it to the smell of Axe deodorant, which I think is really odd for a face lotion. I passed it along to my husband, who said he will use it up as a scented lotion for his body, but definitely not on his face. The consistency was too thick for a face lotion, and a bit greasy. The packaging and quirky wording is fun, but at almost $20 it seems rather expensive for the size.

I wanted to love this C'est Moi Cleansing Water. The packaging is absolutely beautiful and I like that the ingredients are on the more natural side. I will say that it's amazing at removing makeup; it's effective and non-greasy. You can see on the dirty cotton ball that it took off every bit of my mascara and eye shadow. Unfortunately, it stung my eyes a little, like a mild soap would, and that's pretty much a deal breaker for me with eye makeup remover. As for use on the rest of my face, again it was quite effective. Just out of curiosity, after cleansing with the C'est Moi, I did a second once over with a cotton ball soaked in Micellar Water - my face was already completely clean; no makeup had been left on my face at all, but I did feel that there was a slight residue sitting on my skin. I didn't feel squeaky clean like I prefer, which lead me to believe I would be better off rinsing, but that kind of defeats the purpose of a cleansing water, in my opinion. So while I really liked the idea of this product, and it worked, I would not purchase it again.
THIS STUFF WAS LIKE GLUE & THE TASTE WAS ABSOLUTLEY HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!

At first I thought this was the greatest razor ever. It provides a smooth shave, probably the best shave I've ever encountered. I have very sensitive skin, so I have to be selective. First impressions: It is a very sleek and cool looking razor. It is so fancy, that I am afraid of breaking it every time I touch it. The problem with this razor is not its performance, rather it is the maintenance. The lotion is expensive, and to make things worse, it is nearly impossible to find, unless you are willing to spend lots of money and buy it online. But, the razor works, so I stuck it out.

Next problem: Norelco suggests that you replace the cartridge for sanitary reasons each time you refill the lotion. OK, but when I ordered the lotion (which is supposed to come with the cartridge), THERE WAS NO CARTRIDGE! So, I decided to stick it out anyway. Each time I replaced the lotion, I would just remove the cartridge and clean it myself. That seemed fine, until this morning when I accidentally broke a piece of this fragile cartridge. Now, I can't get the lotion to come out, so the razor is ineffective. I tried to buy a new lotion with cartridge at Target, and the lotion came without the cartridge, so I have to return it.

I know Phillips-Norelco has excellent customer service, so I called to see if they could help me. It turns out that the lotion does not always come with the cartridge (although it is advertised that way and I was told that it came with the cartridge by a customer service rep before I bought the razor). So, it's kind of like a little guessing game. Where can I find the lotion and cartridge together? Fun! I asked if they could just send me some cartridges, no lotion, just cartridges and I'd be happy. But they could not do that, so I am going to return this razor and get my money back.

I still have a previous Norelco shaver (dry) and I will try that again, although it is not as good. I think in the end I may have to resort back to the painful manual razor shave. I have been a Norelco customer for many years and up to this point I was always very pleased, this is disappointing.

To summarize: This is an excellent razor, but it is not worth the money or the hassle you have to go through to make it work effectively!

I welcome any shaving advice to help my sensitive skin!

I placed a small piece I cut, onto a lumpy area behind my left ear. I have been using it for about a week and I haven't noticed much of a change in it's size. It didn't bother me as far as the stickiness goes, but it did snag a bit when a few hairs became attached (scalp hair, not body hair). Once I pulled it off it (wetting it first) it did not irritate me at all. Although my skin is light, pigmented but light, there was noticeable redness but it went away fairly quick. I was pleased that her hair reverted back after I washed it. It's great to finally see more and more cosmetology mannequins with African textured hair that actually reverts back to its coily texture after you wash it. So often in the past, sellers would advertise cosmetology mannequins as having afro hair, then you washed it and the coil pattern was completely gone. The money I lost trying to find a real African textured cosmetology mannequin back in the day, was unbelievable!

A few things to note.....While washing her hair there was tons of shedding. I've come to realize this is quite normal. However, after the washing is said and done, the shedding is minimal. Thank goodness because there are cosmetology mannequins where the shedding continues in massive balls even after washing.

The ends are thin and stringy and that's where I'll take a one star deduction. She'll be gettin a good trim here soon, but I definitely recommend her. I'd say her hair is in the 3b/3c range? I could be off about that because I'm still a bit shaky on the hair typing system. Either way, you'll definitely be satisfied with your purchase.

I've attached pictures of before washing her hair, after washing her hair and what her hair looks like after I dried it and dry combed it. Lovely soft hair. I almost didn't wanna ruin the rod set because it was so cute but I always wash the hair of any cosmetology mannequin I buy, right outta the box.

The seller really should change their description of this hair dryer.

First, the pictures make it look as if you can use the concentrators in either the vertical or horizontal position and this isn't true at all. In the horizontal position, the concentrator will fall off because it will not lock.....see promotion picture and my uploaded photo.

****This may not seem like a big deal until you start using it and have to adjust the direction with your wrist.****

Second, the description states the wattage is between 1800 to 2000 but the label says 1800 watts only....see description paragraph and my uploaded photo.

While the blow dryer is cute and an obvious design copy from the Dyson blow dryer (seems China has been copying Dyson these days but can't match the superior quality of Dyson), it's kinda heavy and gets too hot, even on the medium heat setting. I had to turn on the cool shot to offset the heat.

If you have hand arthritis, carpal tunnel, shoulder arthritis, etc, this will give you some trouble due to the heaviness, along with the inability to switch the concentrator into the horizontal position.

2 star deduction for the deceptive advertising, lack of concentrator versatility and heaviness.

I was dire hard fan of Nair Roll On Wax Hair Remover until they stopped making it but where Nair failed with their roll on wax was the mess......dripping bottle with no way to stand the bottle of wax upright unless propped against something. In comes Belle!

Let me just say for the record, I bought the purple one with the base because apparently they have the pink one shown that doesn't come with the base. (I'm gonna order that one but I'll get to that in just a minute). This system is wonderful.....no mess, nice and clean and you can keep it on the base so that means it's upright and no worries about dripping wax. Once you've used it, I'd suggest wiping the wax head off just to get the wax residue off from your usage.

The base comes with an additional plug outlet on the side which is why I'm ordering the pink one for 14.99. It appears you can heat two cartridges at the same time and I'm ecstatic about that.

The wax it came with went on smooth and to my surprise only needed one more application to remove my underarm hair. Put a little baby powder under your arm prior to waxing as this will create a smoother process and absorb any oil and moisture. With the Nair Roll On Wax, I sometimes had to do three to four applications to get all the hair and ya know that's not good for your skin when you're waxing.

Now for the one star deduction.....I went back and forth with whether I should give 5 stars or 4 stars but I think 4 stars is still pretty darn good. The reason for this is the time it takes to heat the wax up. It took mine 25 minutes. That can seem like a long time when you're used to putting wax in the microwave and it's ready under 2 minutes. It's only a minor issue however the system definitely makes up for this plus you can order more cartridges in different scents.

Overall, great buy and you won't regret it. If you were a Nair Roll On Hair Remover fan like I was, you can kiss the days of paying for overpriced Nair rollers on Amazon goodbye, since they've discontinued it and third party sellers are trying to make an insane profit.

Edit to add......so apparently the pink one cannot be attached to the extra outlet. That outlet is for a different voltage but what the heck, I ordered it anyway. Can't go wrong with more than one hair removal system. I'll do a separate review on that one once I get it.

In the words of my Sister.
The UJM Magnetic Eyelashes comes with a nice compact case which is great to throw in your bag.
The Eyelashes themselves are bold and have great length.
The Applicator was a decent size and easy to use.
The Case fits 2 sets of Eyelashes and the kit comes with 3 sets of Eyelashes.
The Eyeliner did have a particular smell, which you do not notice after application.
The Eyeliner Brush was thicker than I am used to, which at first bothered me, but after using a couple of times. It makes sense to have a thick line for the Eyelashes to adhere to.

The only issue I had with this Eyelash kit, was the Eyeliner. It dries too quickly and the instructions say to apply the Eyelashes while it is still wet. This makes it difficult to get a good smooth line and apply quickly. It takes some getting used too.
I ended up applying my normal liquid liner, then going over it with the Magnetic Liner to get a more even look.
I do suggest giving a good amount of application to the Eyeliner to reassure they are secure.

The Removing Process definitely takes some time. You really have to soak your Eyelashes with remover to get all of the sticky pieces of Magnetic Eyeliner off.

All in all, they are good Magnetic Eyelashes. I would definitely recommend them. However, they do not get a full 5 stars, because the Eyeliner dries pretty quickly and it does take quite some time to completely clean the Eyeliner off.

Oh boy. This didn't remotely pass the sniff test. There was no way I was going to want to smell like it. I know what you're thinking. How could they mess up vanilla? Well, when they use old soybean oil as one of the main ingredients, you end up with a scrub that smells more like rancid soybean oil with a hint of coconut oil more than anything else. I thought I was being persnickety. But when my daughter (who doesn't have the strongest sense of smell) picked it up saying she wanted to use it, she had the same reaction. I hated throwing it in the trash, but I didn't want to use it and smell like trash.

I got these after running into a nest of seed ticks and finding myself in a constant state of itch for about a month.  Using these in the shower on my skin was one of the few moments of relief I had.  These contain a piece of loofa stitched very well onto a cloth pad with a piece of elastic over the back to keep on your hand. I didn't realize until recently that loofas are made from the dried insides of gourds. So, no, they're not a product of the sea like a sponge. It's amazing to me that they're able to be stitched so well into cloth.  I really like these. I just read that it's possible to machine wash loofa but that you shouldn't put them through the dryer. Eventually, my loofa got moldy from hanging out in the shower so often. I threw it away, but next time I'll know that I can put it through the washing machine before it gets to that state. Luckily, this is a 3-pack.

This review is for the 3 Pack (White/Slate/Lake blue) of the Niutop Watchband Style Band for Fitbit One. I received a promotional discount on this item in exchange for providing a review. I have been using this item daily for a little over a month and wanted to share my experience.

First Impressions
* The items were exactly as pictured, the colors really bright and crisp.
* It took some work getting the FitBit One in and out of the band. It gets a little easier the more you use it. I do not view this as a problem as I know its not going to fall out.
* Was not easy to insert the fasteners on the one end of the band to the connectors on the other. This is still and issue, but again, I do not view this as a negative as I can trust that it will remain secure, but it can be a pain, easier with help, to fasten it.

Observations from wearing.
* The FitBit One was very secure in the band, never worried nor experienced it falling out, coming loose, etc.
* Once fastened securely the band never unsnapped by accident.
* After the first week or so I started to get a rash on my wrist. I switched it to the other wrist and experienced the same thing. I took off the band, removed the FitBit, then washed the band in soap and water. I wore it for several weeks after this, on the same wrist, and did not experience any issues.
* I was used to clipping my FitBit to my pocket or shirt, and do not normally wear a watch. I did not have any problem wearing it, was very comfortable and often forgot I even had it on. It did take some getting used to, remember to remove for a shower, and not getting it overly wet while washing my hands, but I got used to it very quickly.
* I did notice a few occasions that if I made exaggerated arm movements it would trigger as steps on my FitBit one.

Overall
I would recommend this for anyone looking for a watchband style carry for their FitBit. I use mine daily and I not even considered going back to clip style carry. I do recommend that when you first receive it that you wash it with soap and water, rinse and let dry before using. You will never need to worry about the FitBit becoming unsecured from the band.
The defining curl dried my hair and left it very hard.  Back under the cabinet it will go.

I have used electric razors for over 35 years all have good points and all have weaknesses. Norelco razors have two problems.

Hard to clean. As the cutter and blades fill up the motor is not able to maintain the speed and nicks result. You must take the blade and cutter assembly apart to clean properly and if you cut longer hairs by accident(side burn area etc.) it will wrap around the cutting blade and really slow the motor down. The motor slowing is the worst on the new "3 blade" called the Speed XL, they just seem to be underpowered.(just as a note the older Spectra blade replacements fit these razors and seem to work better). Think of this problem like a paper shredder that has not beeen emptied and hasn't room for more papers in the bin.

Hidden Build up. I have changed batteries in several of my Norelco shavers and the build up of gunk where only disassembly could find and cure it, is remarkable(same with most brands). I suspect this is gunk is high in bacteria and the cause of most skin infections from nicks. The stuff you never knew was there is nasty!

Now for the cure: Norelco 8060x! This razor blade assembly has open backs for the stubble to fall through as you shave. I use mine in the shower so no mess. The blade assembly is completely seperate from the motor unit= no place for gunk to build up! The unit is entirely water proof. The blades disassemble easily so you can get at those occasional "longer hairs" that wrap around the cutters. The cutters have more blades on each, so the shave is faster and the motor seems stronger than previous models, hence less slowing. The Nivea solution is great, but you can use regular shave cream or gel. I like the Nivea Gel for Sensitive Skin, it seems to be the right thickness for the razor and works alomost as well as the cream you load in the razor.

The only negative for some people might be the size or shape of the handle, it is smaleer and lighter than most shavers. Some people with larger hands may find is inconvient and others may find it easy to drop.

Overall this is the best all around razor I have owned, there is a brief time required for your face to get used to any new razor... This ones worth it!!

From the female of the family: this is a relatively expensive product, and the write-up is technical, so you do want to know it works, right? It does, at least for me. I'm careful to treat my facial skin with care and good products, and while I know you cannot really stop the aging process, you can both plump up and repair dry and irritated skin.

This product does all of that. It contains some things you've probably heard about -- reservatrol, which does help rejuvenate, a concentration of an ingredient found in red wine, something of a miracle product in itself. Then there's hempseed oil which calms irritated skin and St. John's Wort, a venerable ingredient know as well to sooth and heal.

I wash my hands well, then my face and pat it dry. I drip a little serum in my palm (not touching the dropper so I don't contaminate the product in the jar), dip in lightly with the tips of the fingers of my other hand, and lightly massage it over my face. A little goes a long way, so don't overuse it.

I don't use a lot of makeup, so the problems some others had with the combination doesn't bother me. Nor do I find it too sticky -- again, don't lay it on thick.

Here's the full list of ingredients: Water, Glycerin, Pentylene glycol, Niacinamide, Centella asiatica extract, N-Palmitoyl serinol (Neuromide), Bifida ferment lysate, Acetyl glucosamine, Phytosterols, Cannabis sativa seed oil, Allantoin, Panthenol, Sodium hyaluronate, Sialyllactose, Hypericum perforatum flower extract (St.John's wort), Carbomer, Adenosine, Ceramide NP, Resveratrol, Heptasodium hexacarboxymethyl dipeptide-12, Glyceryl acrylate/Acrylic acid copolymer, 1,2-Hexanediol, Polyglyceryl-10 distearate, Glyceryl stearate, Caprylic/Capric triglyceride, Sorbitan stearate, Stearic acid, Glyceryl Caprylate.

I like the results a lot, and the highest praise I can give is, I'll be ordering again.

I will give each item I believe is important in hair a star. Weft, price, color, condition, and style.

1- PRICE 1☆. I would give it a half star, but that's not an option, so I went with 1. The price was good, but I think if I paid for something a little more expensive, I would not have had the two below issues.

2-COLOR 1☆. The color was really nice, even, and very pretty, ll.

3-CONDITION 1☆. The hair had no split ends, wasnt dried out, and was in really nice shape.

4-WEFT 0☆. Again I would give it a half, but with no option, it gets no star. The weft was way too think. My stylist had to spend time cutting it down. Time that cost me time and money.

5-STYLE. 0☆. I would give this less than 0 if I could. I bought the wavy style, because I dont like straight hair, as my natural is curly. Well, after one was, every single wave is gone. We all know that it is suggested we dont use any type of curling irons, of flat irons to the hair, because it could damage the hair. So, my choice is damage the hair, or wear it straight. So, that's my opinion in a nut shell. Hope it helps...
