So, I bought this set because I had a very big project that could only get cleaned by using a product like these. The project was to clean all this nasty glue and dirt off of the floor pictured in the included images. There is a before and after image for those who want to know how much I asked of this product. And while the razors themselves are very good quality and last a decent amount of time per razor the actual razor holder is what I ran into major problems with even when I bought a more professional one at my local hardware store. Now while my project was unique I would have to personally say that if you have something less intensive than what I did you should not really run into many problems. I completed the clean by cleaning the tool and razor after each and every tile that was scraped making sure that no moisture stayed on the device or blade as that is what mainly cause the issues however I did have to eventually go out and buy a more rugged blade holder as the mechanical part to remove the blades and to slide the blade in and out of it malfunctioned quite often and eventually both broke.. only 1 razor blade actually ever broke which means that I still think that getting so many decent blades at this price made it worth it even though the tools broke. I hope that these images and my experience can help any potential customers to know about benefits and problems of this product and again I would overall recommend it.

I usually buy extensions but I just recently switched to wigs so I don't have to dye my hair to match the extensions I buy. The wig itself is decent, Looks like real hair, I get a lot of compliments on my hair while walking down the street. Forewarning - you will need to cut the wig, it comes very choppy and looks super odd. The first few times I wore the wig it shed A LOT - I was pulling out handfuls of hair all throughout the day, but now that I've worn it for about 2 weeks it's getting better with the shedding.
It gets frizzled easily, if you straighten it make sure it's not super hot so it wont melt the "hair". It will get poofy and scraggly looking, if this happens, mix water and conditioner in a spray bottle, spray the wig so it's damp, and then brush it - good as new.

I admit that I felt silly buying this...but I HATE to blow-dry my hair because I have very thick, wavy, and frizz-prone hair. So usually when I blow-dry it, I can't use the brush properly like a hairdresser would to really work the frizz out and dry it properly and it ends up look dry and poofy until the next day when it settles down. I typically let my hair just wet-dry and then style with some cream and a curling iron to smooth my ends. But when I saw this, I just had to try it despite having a small bathroom and thinking "do you really want that thing hanging on you wall?" The answer is..."Not really, but I really want a free hand to dry my hair."

So I bought it. Although I was still really unsure about the safety of sectioning this thing to my wall. I imagined it crashing down and smashing my toiletries, injuring the cat, or crashing onto someone's head. I wondered why I decided to buy it. But then I received it in the mail, opened it, and was really surprised at how incredibly heavy and solid this thing is. Everytime I buy a product that is supposed to "suction" and be strong....it isn't. Well, this one is REALLY strong.

I first tested it by suctioning it to the wall (not the mirror as shown in the ad) and left it there for about 2 days just to see if there was any sliding, slipping, or loosening. I pulled HARD on it various ways to try to get it to fall down. This thing is 100% solid and the suction is super-strong. If it stuck to my painted wall, this would never come off a mirror! Then after I inspected it a good bit, bent the arm around, tried out the bungee, and figured out which way the holder that the blow-dryer goes in is supposed to go....I placed my hair dryer in it. I had a hard time, at first getting my dryer to fit because I still had the holder upside down. If the large bolt is pressing against the back of your dryer, it's upside down and it won't seat properly and the bungee will be super-hard to clip (or not at all). So I was like "great this thing doesn't fit my dryer". But you have to twist and move it around to figure out which way yours fits and then it's all pretty much smooth sailing from there.

The "arm" that bends is also really hard to bend and very solid and thick. Merely bumping it (which I did several times), walking into it, or yanking your dryer around doesn't make this flop around. It requires two hands to bend and stays firmly in whatever position you place it for drying. Keep in mind this means that other than minor adjustments, if you need to totally change the dryer position while drying...you will need to take a second to move the arm and reposition it a bit, which is not a one-handed job. I really like that about this. When I finally tried using it after my shower (after days of leaving it hang up to ensure it doesn't fall, playing around with it, and letting my family get used to it being in their way because of our small bathroom) I was delighted that when I moved the dryer lower to blow straight at me....it stayed firmly in place, even after accidentally slapping it with my hairbrush and hands several times. I moved it into a "downward" blowing position about halfway through to get the back and was able to not only use a brush and my hands like a normal person, but I noted that I was able to get my hair dry in half the normal time (I assume because of extra brushes and hands). My hair even looked less frizzy and more like what it should look like after I go to the salon! My significant other came home and laughed when he saw me awkwardly using it and trying to position it right....but he thinks it's cool, too.

It made my life much easier and really DOES function like a permanent fixture if you want it to. I plan to leave mine up all of the time for ease of use rather than redoing the suction and placement each time. It's easy to just take the arm and push it up really high when you're done, take the dryer out of it, and it's out of the way of anyone walking through, opening cabinets, etc until next time you want to use it.

This is a pretty innovative product and I don't feel like I wasted money on it because it has made a loathsome part of my beauty routine easier...even if it did make my bathroom just slightly uglier :-)

In all seriousness, if you have space or really hate trying to use a brush and properly dry your hair, this is worth it. If I had more storage nearby, I'd probably take it down in between uses because it really is easy to suction and adjust once you understand what goes where and how it works. I had fun trying this out and using it on my hair and plan to keep on using it in the future. It's an odd device, for sure...but doesn't hesitate if you're worried it will be "cheap" or flimsy. This thing could be a deadly weapon, it's so heavy and clearly intended to stay in place. If that's what you need in a dryer holder, absolutely buy this. I don't regret my purchase and I doubt you will, either. I hope you found my review to contain useful information and I am happy to answer any questions you may have. Thanks for reading and happy styling!!

I do nails quite often....usually fancy or cute designs; minions are one of my favorites to do. This set is exactly what a girl (or boy, lol) needs to complete nail artwork!!!! This set has been one of my better nail art investments.

What do I love about it? For one, it comes in a handy storage case which makes it hard to lose all the brushes and nail dotters. Plus there is a see through vinyl flap that covers them too. It unrolls three times after you unsnap the buttons and spreads your array of brushes and dotting tools. You end up with a total of 14 brushes that range from fan brushes to fine tipped brushes. There are five double-ended dotters and no, they aren't all the same size. I think a few are. There is also a dotting pen with just one small dot which you could use for line work if the brushes are too hard for you. The entire set is compact and portable.

As for cleaning them....I've had no issue with mine. I cleaned the polish of with nail polish remover, wiped that off, then washed it with dish soap and let dry. One of my brushes became a little stiff but all I did was run my finger across it a few times and smooshed it on my table. The bristled softened right back up.

I will be using this set A LOT! I've included pics of the set and the nails I did for my daughter and niece (before the edges were cleaned up though). did receive this set at a discounted price in exchange for an honest opinion. Everything I have said is based on my experience with using this set.

I should have listened to the negative reviews. I just figured the people that didn't like this curling iron didn't know what they were doing, didn't follow the directions, etc. and that was why they didn't get the results they desired. I'm not the most skilled at styling my hair, but I can do a pretty decent job with a blow dryer, hot rollers or a regular curling iron, so I figured I'd be able to manage this Bed Head curler just fine with a little practice.

Boy, was I wrong! Despite following all the instructions on various youtube videos, all I got was a frizzy mess. I will go back to using a regular curling iron or hot rollers when I want to add a little curl. I'm sorry I wasted my money on this thing.

I had one of the first Epilady back in the 1980's and really liked it. In fact, I bought a second one when the first 'gave out' after 5 or 6 years of continuous use. Really like the smooth result when using it - no scratchy stubble on legs. Even as hair grows back it remains soft and barely noticeable (and I have had dark hair).
When I needed a third Epilady the original style was no longer available. I bought and used the 'new' style but did not find it as satisfactory -- took longer to obtain good results -- but it was better than shaving or other alternatives. It did remove underarm hair well, better than the original style.
But when I saw the option to buy the first type Epilady again I did and am very happy with it. I would recommend using this type device to others although I know many think it hurts too much -- even my sisters and a couple friends who tried using the Epilady quickly gave it up.
But nicks and cuts from shaving hurt and look bad too -- soooo. After a very short time I no longer even noticed any discomfort. This hair removal product has worked well for me for many, many years and I wouldn't be without it!

I am very religious about my skin care and surprisingly I have never used a jade roller until now. I use a derma roller, a facial stream mister machine, a24ct good vibrating and and LED light therapy. I guess I figured I didn't need ANOTHER skin care device.. But I've been proven wrong. I've been using it once a day now for over 2 weeks and they really do show results. But only the immediate and temporary lifting effect you get right after using but now I can clearly see the contours of my face much more clearly, and sharper than before. My skin now looks tighter and almost like a had a mini face tuck.  I admit that I honestly did not think a jade roller was really something that would live up to the hype about it in all the beauty and skin care blogs /magazines, but I underestimated it.  I know a lot of people put their in the fridge prior to use, but I find the stone itself is cool enough Ashdod my skin without putting it in my refrigerator.. The stone is very delicate and easily breakable and I can just imagine my Daughter or Fiancee accidentally knocking it into the kitchen floor.  I love that it has 2 sides.. A large roller and a small one for areas such as your eyes and around your mouth. I have no complaints whatsoever with this particular roller.. It shows results, glides over my skin smoothly.. The roller never skips it gets stuck, and it even came with a little diagram showing you the best direction to roll in on each part of your face for optimum results. So, if anyone has been curious about jade rollers, I recommend you give it a try. Just follow the diagram to see best results and follow the care instructions so that your roller lasts as long as possible (just includes cleaning of with a damp washcloth and doing with a terry cloth before putting it back in the box. You'll immediately notice just how much faster your skin care absorbs fully and deeper into your skin. I always use either the Sunday Riley C.E.O. Glow Face Oil, Loreal Age Perfect Face Oil during the day and either the Biossance Squallene Oil or S.R. Luna Sleeping Night Oil as my last skin care step before using the roller and the time difference is it if this world. I used to get super impatient waiting for my face oil to absorb so I could start applying makeup or finish my night routine,but the recommended 10 min a day with the roller and there's not even a trace of an oily residue in my face!  I did receive this product at a discounted price but if it ever were to break, I'd definitely buy another Jade a roller to replace it!

I love highlighters... Especially liquid ones. I ordered my first powdered Highlighter when I got this. This is one of the better liquid highlights I have (and I have a nice collection) I was unsure of it at first because of the color and consistency. It looked like it would just blend into my skin like a very thin lotion leaving no color behind. Since I was going to use my new powder Highlighter. I applied this after my primer, under my foundation and to my surprise it left A VERY nice glow(no glitter or sparkle) that peeked through my foundation making my skin look 10 yrs younger. After stopping on some of the powder. I used this liquid in the inner corner of my eyes, cupid's bow, around my eyebrows, and just the finest bit at the very peek of my cheekbones. The end result was so eye catching and naturally beautiful that I couldn't believe it
... I felt like a whole new woman. I even used it in the very center of my lips to accentuate my Ombre lip look. When my fiancee got home that night, he complimented me on how my skin looked (unprompted) and asked what I had used that day. This is great for the pricr
.. I like it better than my $25 Highlighter and would recommend to anyone

Wow.... You talking do get a ban my foot your buck. This palette has every color you could possibly want. I bought this because I had no metallic eyeshadow in my beauty arsenal and I figured this would be a great way to check it out. The colors are nicely pigmented and bright,  blend easily and stay on (I do use an eyeshadow primer and setting spray) I do NOT use the cheap brushes that come with it but an actual makeup brush set. The only con is you do get a lot of fall out from most of the shadows. I would definitely recommend.... It's a great value that goes well beyond the price

I got this to keep my many toiletries organized,  because they take up so much closet space and it's not always easy for me to find what I want.  This definitely does the trick.  I'm much more organized and I've cleared out slot of closet space!

These 10 mini polishes are perfect for sampling the brand without a big commitment.  They come in 2 gives for easy storage,  the colors are beautiful and they go  on smoothly,  look great and long lasting.  Definitely would purchase again

Very fashionable Headbands that came in 3 colors that will match just about anything.  It holds your hair firmly in place without being too  tight  or having the plastic ends digging into your ears.  Perfect for dress up or casual.... I really like these

This is a pretty good eye shadow with long wear,  I just wish it had more glimmer to it.  It has a good amount of colors,  but a lot of the colors are really similar to each other.  I'm hoping maybe the darker colors have more of a glitter effect.  All in all,  not a bad product for the price
It looks great on but after a while,  the sides start to dig into your temples

My daughter and I liked the 4 set we got, so we got this matching set. We were disappointed when we saw one of the peices, it was missing one of the 3 decorations on the small clips.

These are clued on with a glue gun, sometimes you get glue strings that you may have to take off while that is not such a bug deal, one of the hair clips only had 2 of the 3 peices of decorations on it. The peice was not even in the bag either, if it was we could have found a way to reconnect it but was not even there, so we were extremely disappointed. 😞

If you order these, just know that you may need to skim them over and remove any loose strings of glue. These are cute and stylish. Great for teens or for photo-op.

(As long as there are no missing pieces, like we had! But, I do not know if this is a common occurrence or not. It could be uncommon for this to happen, maybe the person glued it on and it fell of before packaging? It seems as if that is the case, because the peice was not in the package with the clips. I know the makers are human and mistakes happen, but I thought you better know about it, so you would be better informed before purchasing the product.)

Other than the fact that there was this missing peice, these does seem to be nice and my daughter and I both like them as well as others in my family.

Note: I think the one clip, that was missing the peice should had not passed through quality control and got to packing and shipping.

(I also believe the worker needs to pay more attention to what they are doing, to me it seems as if someone was distracted and forgot to clue the 3rd peice on.
It doesn't seem to have had any glue in that spot, from what I can tell.)

I just want people to be aware of what they are getting and make their own choices on if they want to proceed with the purchase or not. (This is the 2nd item I have gotten, the 1st one was the 4 peice set just like this one.)

We personally Like these Items,
dispite one being Unusable.

Note: We are thinking of modifying it and removing the two other decorations off of it and using a Glue Gun to clue 3 new Decorations onto it. -- It would personalize it and make it our own; my daughter's birthday is coming up and I may do that for her BD. Just an idea and atleast we will be able to use it then, since it isn't usable now as it is....

My daughter and I love these!
These clips are just to cute, she has gotten compliments when wearing them.

My daughter, does not usually like clips because they do not "stay still", but with these, she has not really had a problem, they are cute and stylish!

I would recommend these for you, your daughter, wife, best friend, mother or your female in-laws. These would make a great add-on to a gift bag or basket.

Also, perfect for Weddings or Prom!

I absolutely love them!!!!

I love these, these are so cute and would be great for a photo-op. They are great items to put into gift bags for your bridesmaids.

I think that these would be so great during the summer, and amazing if someone was having a beach wedding!
(Also, if you are having a girls weekend Bachelorette party, these would also be a great gift for those girls of yours, you all can wear them and match!!!! And then you can have the scrunchies for your wedding!!!)

I can see many opportunities for you and your girls to use these.

A little touch like this, can be fun and I love the heart glasses because they are so cute, but I also love the touch of humor on the scrunchies. The bridal party would love the fact that it says, "to have and to hold your hair back". It makes me smile, every time I read that! It adds abit a humor to it.

These scrunchies are extremely comfortable, my daughter usually hates scrunchies, they usually fall out of her hair easily but she seems to love these. As for the sunglasses, my daughter didn't care to much for it, she said it doesn't sit on her nose correctly but it seemed to look good on her. I actually love the sunglasses. It adds a special touch that we needed.

I would recommend these for a wedding on the beach or in the summer, or if you expect it to be a bright sunny day!

I would also recommend these as items to put into bridesmaids gift bags.

The quality seems to be exactly what I had expected and I am quite pleased.

I would like to note: You may not want go wear the sun glasses all day, but for a few hours here and there, it is quite cute and stylish.

These sun glasses and hair bows would also help coordinate your bridal party, without braking the bank. Little touches like this, really does make a difference.

(These are to be used for wedding next summer.)
Turns hair purple

I have used this for a couple of weeks now. I have eye bags, so that's why I tried this.
What I like about it, is that it feels really gentle, does not irritate my eyes, moisturizes, and it spreads easily.

I have not noticed any reduction in puffiness, but I have never really found a product that noticeably reduces puffiness. So I didn't really expect much there.

All in all, a decent eye cream.

I am using this twice per week, and have only used it 1 week (2 times) so far. The instructions say that results will be visible within 30 days. I don't see much visibly yet, but I can already feel a difference when I run my hands over my face.
Also, the instructions say that the day after you use it, you may have redness. I have not really had that except for maybe a very slight flushed look that actually looks better than my normal skin tone.

As far as the way it feels, if any of you have a husband/boyfriend with prickly beard stubble rubbing against your face, that is very close to how this feels. It's very doable.

I am taking photos each week, and when I get to week four, I will post them. Based on my experience so far, I fully expect to have visible results in 30 days. Of course if the tool breaks, or if I experience any adverse reactions, I will definitely adjust my review accordingly. For now, I have December 22nd on my calendar as the day to update with before/after photos. Stay tuned!

Love that these pinks are similar to nude or neutral colors. I bought this set because I really liked the way the Mia shade looks.

My only dislike with this is the same dislike I have with other Zoya lighter shade polishes; that is that I have to apply 3 coats in order to rid of streaks and to prevent lumpiness. However, I’m still impressed because even with 3 coats, Zoya’s polish is still light as a feather!

I wish I would have read the reviews. These polishes do NOT have a mirror finish. For the price you pay for these you might as  well goo the  grocery store and buy shiny polish, it's the same thing and at least you know what you're getting. I would give zero stars if possible. I hope this review helps others avoid the mistake I made.
My wife tried these lash and it was super rough and hard. It didn’t felt soft like all the other brands she purchase. The lashes was easy to comes off the strip.
For the size it could be wireless.  Its not that powerful also.  Speed is controlled on the wire.

I got these for my 8 year old daughter and sadly they were too small!
She said they were too tight on her head, and indeed they were, so unfortunately she didn't get to use them.
She has an average size head, so I'd say these are made more for like 5-6 year olds.

This is a nice gel polish set that includes a variety of pretty colors, base and two different top coats (1 matte & 1 shiny). The polish is easy to work with and isn’t too thick. The first time I used it, my left hand felt sticky and the polish didn’t cure so when I polished my right hand, I applied the coats thinner and that cured perfectly so definitely use thin coats. I love the shiny top coat but HATE the matte. It definitely looks horrible and seemed as if the polish shriveled up on my nail and left air bubbles in it. I didn’t take a pic of what it looks like because it’s that bad so you’ll just have to take my word for it. I’m not sure who would even like the matte top coat because it’s not pretty at all and the shiny top coat looks like nails are still wet and is so much prettier. Anyway, the polish does start to show some wear and tear (peeling & chipping) after a couple of days. To remove the polish, it says to soak off. I don’t remove mine that way, I just peel it off. I’m not sure if that’s healthy or not for my nails but it’s the easiest way for me. This is a decent set and I like that it includes a nail file too which I find very helpful.

I am picky about my mascara. It has to be waterproof, has to be lengthening and make it look like I have eye lashes. It can't cause irritation when I wear contacts. The reason I tried this product was because I was out of mascara and was being adventurous in trying a new product. This product was dark, made it look like I had lashes, and made them look longer. I don't remember seeing anything about being waterproof but I wore it my first day when it was hot and I didn't have black eyes by the end of the day! I don't see much "thickening" going on with this product though. My lashes are very thin and minimal due to wearing mascara for so many years. I feel this product helped in making them stand out, but not so much making them look thick and perhaps fake-ish. I began layering this on with my other go to mascara and it definitely helps. Not a bad product by any means, just not your product if your main purpose is thickening.

I did receive this product at a discounted price for my honest opinion. No matter the price I paid for it, all statements are truly my own and are no way altered. People rely on reviews before trying a product and I believe in giving my honest opinion to help others make their decision. Just remember, what works for some may not always work for others. We are all different after all.
I think the photos say it all. First time using it, my face got tight and hot within minutes.

I have extremely thick, somewhat wavy hair. Not curly, not straight. This product didn't do much for me. I am a tender head also so it was nice to brush through with no pain. If you are going to use this here are some tips: brush your hair before. I keep reading reviews that say "it won't brush through my extremely curly hair." Well of course it won't! It isn't a magical brush that will glide through hair. When using the heated brush, I used my regular brush with it because the ends wouldn't get straightened. I had to make sure to keep my hair held tight all the way through so I used my regular brush in the other hand. My hair didn't turn out to be "bone straight" but it's better than when I started. My ends didn't get straightened but I also just really need a hair cut so I am not blaming the product for that. But it is true what people are saying, it doesn't get hot enough. I have straighteners that (claim to) get 300 degrees Fahrenheit. This product is in Celsius, so I'm not sure of the conversion but it gets up to 230 Celsius. If it was hotter, I'm sure it would work much better. Basically, I will use this a few more times and try to get the hang of it and hopefully like it more.

Pros-This makeup brush set has everything you would ever need to create a certain look. The brushes are firmly attached to the wooden handle and I liked the compact carrier case it came with. It's a great beginner's set and will get the job done.

Cons-The brushes themselves are cheaply made. The synthetic fibers of the brush leave your makeup streaky and leaves little black hairs all over your face. The brushes are also not full enough and don't pick up enough of the makeup you're using (Especially highlighter with the fan brushes) and so you have to go over them again and again to get full color.

Conclusion: A good brush set for beginners, but you'd be better off splurging on a better brush set than trying to save money with these junky brushes if you're a makeup guru.

This stuff could be used as a torture device in interrogations...after using it on my chest, stomach, shoulders, and groin, it feels as though I have been laying in the summer sun ALL day. Imagine bright red sunburn with bubbly skin, as though you've gotten sun poisoning. I spot tested it and everything seemed fine. I was so incredibly wrong. Rinsing in the shower really just made it burn even worse, even with seemingly FREEZING cold water. The "Calm Balm" was almost like squirting lemon juice into a fresh, open wound. Even a whole hour after using it, while having a fan blowing cold air on me from outside, it STILL feels like one of the worst sunburns I've ever experienced. Worst part is, I don't even have slightly sensitive skin... Only after using nearly half a tube of Neosporin did the pain begin to subside. However I now look like a giant, shiny, "sexy" red lobster. And I want to scream like a lobster does in a pot of boiling water. I now know their pain. I used the product exactly as directed...using the sticks, waiting ten minutes, and then using the exfoliating glove, which itself caused extreme discomfort while "lightly buffing" the skin (imagine taking 100 grit sandpaper to a sunburn). In fact I think the exfoliating glove is what started all of the pain. I figured "Hell, I'm a manly man, BUFF THROUGH THE PAIN!!!" But holy balls it was like trying to use a hairdryer to put out a forest fire.

In closing, this product is AWFUL, and I want to jump into the nearest frozen lake I can find, in hopes of dying of hypothermia & drowning, because that would be less uncomfortable than these tubes of terrorist cream. To angry wives/girlfriends, this would be PERFECT if your man has been cheating on you and you seek revenge. Otherwise between that, and the previously mentioned terrorist torture techniques, I truly see NO market for this product. Any review that states otherwise is clearly written by a terrorist or angered girlfriend/wife.

I plan to contact the manufacturer for a full refund. This is crap.

Best renewal exfoliator I have used to date and leaves skin lovely and soft. The product is just as described, I'm really satisfied with it. The exfoliant leaves the skin soft, smooth, clean and moisturized! Great for any skin tone. I Although, would say mine is particularly sensitive, I do have a reddish tone (blotchy almost) when using some products, and it does not flare up so I would imagine it's great if you do have this kind of sensitivity as well.

~How to Use~
Apply to clean skin by using a cotton pad.
Rub onto the skin and let stand for 1-3 minutes. Rinse with warm water.
Use once or twice a week.

Pros:
1. No strong odors!
There is no nauseating perfume smell, just a gentle clean scent that doesn't overpower. It is a natural product rather than a mixture of chemicals.

2. Perfect texture, not too sticky or slimy
The texture feels soft and natural, instead of chemically-enhanced. I like that I can adjust the amount of texture by simply rubbing my hands. Feels much more cleansing and safe for my skin than other cleansers I've tried that simply dispense a dollop of chemical foam.

3. Perfect pH balance for cleansing and moisturization without dryness:
The solution cleans just the right amount. As someone with combination skin, I need something that can clean thoroughly to prevent acne breakouts. I was pleasantly surprised that this product did not leave my face with that dry, salicylic acid feeling AT ALL. I was very happy about this, as I've spent way too much money on products that leave my skin completely dehydrated. I suspect it is the pH balancing that makes this an ideal cleansing agent for the sensitive skin of the face.

Cons:
1. All my other cleansers feel neglected and abandoned in my shower now :(
2. My mother in law can't stop using it, which means this bottle is going faster than I expected.TIME TO HIDE IT ASAP..LOL!

Great product, excited to stay a loyal customer and see what other offerings get released.

This is my review for the "APTO Surface Renewal Exfoliant APTO" by New York Biology, and no discount was applied to this product.
I try to review items I need or have a strong interest in so in order I can provide a review based on a real genuine trial so my opinions and experiences with the product are an actual true reflection of my personal experiences with the item.
Because many of the products that I review, I have not been discounted or given this product for free. I chose to review so others can see what a great product this is. I do though still try to supply as much information as I can in terms of my initial experiences with the product, and the contents of the product as well.

There is much to appreciate about this Zeroid Intensive Lotion for Severe Dry & Disordered Skin. This is a Korean-made product and I do tend to be a fan of most Korean skin care products.

This arrives in a 6.76 ounce bottle. It was nicely sealed. I was modestly concerned about the product's clearly labeled manufacturing date 3/11/2020 indicating I'm receiving it over 16 months after the manufacturing date. While this isn't always an issue, it doesn't particularly instill confidence.

This lotion uses what the manufacturer calls MLE Technology along with Defensamide and Ceramides along with Squalane for moisturizing. It is noted as being good for all ages including babies and children.

While I had some concerns, I'm overall pleased with the product's performance. This is a white, smooth lotion that applies easily. I'd actually just had some seasonal allergy reactions on my skin while working in the yard and opted to use this on my skin. It soothed my skin greatly and has gone to work surprisingly rapidly to calm down my inflamed, swollen skin. I'm actually quite impressed.

There's no scent that I can detect.

In terms of value, this is fairly modest. While this is being advertised as somewhat of a premium lotion, I'm not sure I can justify continued use - we'll see how it continues to do and if I notice a definite improvement over other products. However, I definitely can't deny that it's effective and it is definitely making my skin look and feel better.

Zeroid is noted as the #1 Dermacosmetic in Korea for the last decade. It's easy to understand why as this product works incredibly well and surprisingly quickly.

Overall, while I am a bit concerned about the manufacturing date and the price point is a touch high I'll continue to use and compare it to other available products. For now, I'll say I'm impressed and happy with the lotion's performance on my troubled skin.

There's much to like about Tonica's Sparkling Oxygen Mask, a unique spa treatment in a bottle offering oxygen skin-energizing treatments in a less than two-ounce canister that one can do easily at home in a matter of minutes.

The experience itself is pleasurable, the canister's pump action offering a bit of the energizing mask that contains acai, resveratol, and grapefruit cell extract to infuse the skin with oxygen, help clear up free radicals, and brighten/even skin tone.

I will admit my initial impression was a bit low given the relatively small canister arrived with a slightly uneven label. This is something I wouldn't expect from what is undeniably a more premium product. I set aside that concern and enthusiastically tried the product. It seems like when the mask settles in the canister that it takes a couple of pumps to get it to dispense, though once it does everything is fine. These are minor bugs, but if they want to tap into the premium market then presentation matters.

It takes very little to apply and it smooths out evenly on the face and you let it activate over the next 5-10 minutes before rinsing it off. I could definitely feel it activate and I will definitely say my face felt vibrant and energized throughout my work day each time I've used it. I noticed on video meetings that I even looked more energized. So, that's pretty cool.

I'm not sure I'm seeing anything resembling a long-term benefit with the mask. This feels like something I'd use on a day when I have an important meeting or am really dressed to impress. The way that it brightens the skin makes me look healthier and more alert. So, it's not a daily use kind of product for me but it's certainly something I can see turning to when my face needs that extra boost because it definitely gives it a rather remarkable boost that looks and feels wonderful.

While packaging and presentation could use some tweaking, I'm still inclined to give this a thumbs up and it's a product I'll continue to use and then I'll evaluate any future purchases once I see how my face looks and feels once this canister is gone.

The first time I used the Sia Botanics Vitamin C Face Wash I wasn't super impressed, but there was something about it that I liked so I kept using it on a daily basis. It didn't take me long to realize that I really, really loved this face wash.

It arrives in a relatively small 4-ounce bottle. The face wash includes 20% Vitamin C along with Organic Aloe Vera, MSM, and Organic Rose Hip Oil. It utilizes the actual lemon peel, a process that is noted to contain 5-10 times more vitamins than the lemon juice. The wash is designed to naturally exfoliate, remove blackheads, and naturally lighten the skin.

While the 4-ounce bottle seems quite small, it takes very little to do the job. The wash comes out as a sort of milky lotion that lathers lightly yet effectively. The lemon peel contains citric and phytic acids and I felt that sort of acidic quality on my face, but it was lighter than a typical exfoliant. It left my skin cleaner, but in a healthy way rather than in a glowing way.

This is designed to be a daily face wash. I'm not completely sure I'd use it on a daily basis given its price point, but I have to admit it feels so natural and has been so effective that I may be convinced otherwise by the time this first bottle is actually done. I love the way that it's making my face look and feel and I'm super pleased with the healthier appearance.

For me, this has turned out to be rather gentle giant of a face wash. It's light yet super effective and isn't particularly showy but accomplishes quite a bit in terms of facial health and appearance.

The pink is a real bright pink that hardly fades at all. To get the maximum effect you definitely have to bleach your hair first and then use a toner to seal it in after. And be warned, every towel you use and pillow case you sleep on will be pink. But despite this color transfer the hair itself does not seem to fade much in between touch-ups every 6 weeks to keep up with root growth. I do not know if the same can be said if you don't pre-bleach and seal after.
The product is very thick and easy to apply with a brush. You will use one bottle for very short hair, 2 bottles for short hair, 3 for shoulder length and easily 4 or 5 if you're doing a full head of long hair.
Make sure you wash it out in a sink that you are not worried about staining, although it does come out of the bathtub with bleach, you have to clean it as soon as you've gotten the dye on it or it might be permanent. I have not been able to wash it out of the towels or pillowcases even with bleach.
The color is extremely vibrant and shiny and stays beautiful, unlike many other colorants that get splotchy after a few weeks of washing. I have been using this for 4 years and have never gotten a bad batch.

I bought this product because I am in love with their toner and figured if the ingredients were so awesome in that, they must be great in this too. BUT, like I said in my toner review, I have extremely oily skin and it has taken me years to nail down my facial product routine so I was not about to mess with it. I bought this product to try to deal with the sun damaged skin on the backs of my hands. Many brown spots (from too much sun exposure), wrinkles, dry skin, and crepe like skin. I did get some filler in my hands as they were starting to look like skeletons, and that made them look years younger, but the skin still needed a lot of help. I couldn't wait for the bottle to arrive so I could read the ingredients and I wasn't let down: Organic Aloe Vera, Cucumber Distillate, Botanical Hyaluronic Acid, Vitamin C, Organic Sunflower Oil, Tamanu Oil, Organic Borage Oil, Organic Flax Seed Oil, Organic Evening Primrose Oil, Organic Rosehip Oil, Vitamin B5, Wildcrafted Arnica, Organic Lavender, Organic Calendula, Organic Chamomile, Macadamia Nut Oil, Kosher Vegetable Glycerin, Glycolic Acid( to give a very slight peel with each application), Organic Coconut Oil, Squalane, Palm Oil, Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Cocoa Butter, Organic Beeswax, Organic Jojoba Oil, Coenzyme Q10, Phytic Acid, Phospholipids, Grapeseed Oil, Wildcrafted Oregon Grape, Wildcrafted Green Tea, Camellia Oil, Avocado Oil, Wildcrafted Eyebright, Helichrysum Essential Oil, Organic Licorice, Lemongrass, Vitamin C Palmitate, Tocopheryl (Antioxidant), Pyrus Malus, Citrus Medica Lemon, and Sugar Cane. WOW! I was more than impressed. I started by using my Clarisonic on the backs of my hands with a gentle cleanser and patting them dry and applying a small drop of this moisturizer to each hand while it was still moist.The first result I noticed was around days 3-5 yhe dryness was just about disappearing, my skin was soft and smooth. Brown spots took a bit longer, about 2 weeks, to really start to fade, but that is probably because the skin on your hands is so different from your face, and these were some bad brown spots. The wrinkles were the last to respond. While I could see mild improvement at 2 weeks, it took 4 weeks to see significant results. Now I am not hesitant or embarrassed when I have to shake someone's hands. I know my hands look and feel good. Now I use an SPF 85 and I can't wait to see how much better they will look after I've been using the product for 6 months!

I bought it specifically because so many people were saying it fit their dryers that were my brands. Unfortunately I got it, took it out of the box to look at it, didn't realize my husband threw away the box when I wasn't paying attention, and by the time I got it into the bathroom a day or two later and check if it fit with my blow dryers I didn't have the box to return it. I have three completely different hair dryers, you would think it would've fit at least one? Nope, it didn't fit any of my three blow dryers. I have a vidal sassoon, conair, and a Revlon. Again, they are all different and different sizes too. It did not fit any of them!! I offered it to my friend, I said just bring your dryer over tho to test it first. Hers (different than all mine) didn't fit either!! I walked it over to three different neighbors and None of theirs fit!!! I am so curious how this is fitting so many other people's? Is there an attachment needed? I am very dissapointed as it was not cheap. So now I'm out the money plus I still need a diffuser and this thing is rather large and taking up space in my drawer because I don't like throwing away anything new. Be careful when buying it, apparently it doesn't fit many dryers at all.
Didn’t like it and product seemed like it had been previously opened.

This stuff works! It keeps your makeup in place all day and minimizes transferring makeup fingerprints everywhere. I have extremely oily skin; on the scale of 1-10, my oiliness is a 50. My face starts shining 15 minutes after washing it. But this helps keep my makeup on throughout the workday.  I still get shiny but if I dab my face with an oil blotting sheet or even tissue, my makeup stays in place. I highly recommend it. Despite other reviews, this product has no foul scent. It has an almost invisible tiny smell that isn't offensive at all. I would describe it as a mildly scented water.  Honestly, you barely smell anything. If yours stinks, you may have gotten a bad package.

I have hair about as kinky as possible and this product did give me lots of kinky, spiral curls. For that, I give it two stars. I won't give more stars because #1. The smell. It smells like a cheap men's cologne and it never dissipates! I could smell it while I was trying to go to sleep last night. I was tempted to get up in the middle of the night and wash my hair to get rid of that smell. If you touch your hair, it lingers on your fingers. I found myself hesitant to pet my cat because I didn't want to transfer whatever is in this stuff to her fur then she licks it off, digesting it. #2. My hair looked decent (not nice but decent) while it was damp but as it dried, I looked like a fool. #3. The day after. I woke up to a mess. My hair was dry, hard, brittle and kinkier than normal.

I will be returning this for a refund and exploring other curling products.
A nice body butter that absorbs quickly..,..my skin feels softer :)  Wish it  had a light scent but then it wouldn't be all natural

This is definetly the best retinol serum that I have ever used.  Some mornings I can feel the dead skin on my face when I  rub it.... then actually see it when I use the wash cloth. Hope to see the wrinkiles disappear soon!!

First I love the Aromavita Oregano Soap from Aromavita. I just do not know if this is the handmade bars from Aromavita. In my picture the bars on the left is what I received. It states Teliaoils Oregano Soap. The bars on the right in the picture are a previous order from Aromavita. The sellers description shows Aromavita Soap and states it is. Not sure what to make of it so starting a return.

In this day and age when almost all portable electronic products are universal power based, I regret to inform you that the Norelco Trimmers are mono voltage and cannot be operated outside the US. The unit can be charged only from (110v /120V). Neither the Philips nor the Amazon websites point this out to buyers.

Since I travel outside of the US quite a bit, it is a big hassle to use this trimmer with a voltage converter. I wish Philips would seriously consider this issue and improve on the product, hence two star rating.
This hair is the worst quality ever!!! Bought this twice in two different curl patterns and it tangles so much. Big waste of money and so expensive. Ridiculous!!
This hair is the worst quality ever!!! Bought this twice in two different curl patterns and it tangles so much. Big waste of money and so expensive. Ridiculous!!

I wish I tried this stuff sooner. I tried their deodorant and it worked EVERYWHERE, which shocked me how I had 0 smell after wearing no socks in vans in arizona heat (for 8 hours). But I didn’t like how it didn’t prevent perspiration for my underarms, just smell.

Their technology is astounding. Just buy it, trust me. I can’t get through a workday without my down there having a scent at the end of the day. 2 days w/ no shower and it’s completely scentless. And weirdly it doesn’t dry like any other body wash I’ve used. Fabulous stuff, I won’t be buying a single other down there wash ever again.

For the scents:
Unscented - light soapy smell. Very light.

Peony - like the cousin of a rose. I don’t like rose scents but this one is so lightly floral and complex

Sandalwood - not like I thought it would smell. Just a light scent that’s slightly sexy and gender neutral. Very light scent

Cucumber - smells exactly like ramune soda or seven up. I actually loved this one, candy scented for sure.

None of the scents really stay on the skin which is nice.

It’s been roughly 2 weeks since I dyed my hair and the color is already super faded and patchy. The whole process to bleach, dye and final wash took me almost 4 hours, two boxes of product, one towel and now a blue bathroom sink. My hair did not get fully “hay blonde” that Splat suggests and that’s after using 2 bottles of bleach. I used 2 dark blue dye bottles and only one of the teal.
I waited over 48 hours before I did the first real wash and then have washed my hair every third day to try to preserve the color as long as possible and I can literally see it fading hard every shower and that’s using color safe products. I’m at the 2 week mark and my hair is now green and patchy with bleached hair showing through. I followed the box directions precisely and did everything I was supposed to. I even contacted Splat to get further tips and tricks on making it last and still it sucks. I understand this is an at home kit and I wasn’t really expecting too much from it considering all the reviews I read before hand but I expected more than this. Even the glove are too short in my opinion. They barely go to the beginning of my wrist which meant the dye was able to find its way under the gloves. This dye does truly dye anything it touches so cover literally everything before hand to prevent accidents. I was able to remove it from my skin using some baby oil and a towel so that’s easy but my sink is now blue.
There are further instructions that they should have stated on the box so beginners can get the most out of the box. Like wrapping your hair with a plastic bag or towel during the bleach process to hold on the heat and help with lifting color.
I fully understood what I was writing into when I purchased this. I read everything I could and watched every video I could find so I’m not judging this product on that factor. I gave it two stars because it took way too long and there’s too much maintenance to do to it to really equal out the lasting ability. I have to blow dry it every time I leave the shower or get it wet at all, meaning sweating or if it rains, because it will bleed hard.
I don’t recommend this if you’re looking for something even semi permanent because it’s not. I’d say if you’re looking for something for a couple weeks to go crazy or for a Halloween project but nothing more.

CHEAP BEAUTIFUL HAIR! I LOVE THE COLOR! I PURCHAED NUMBER TWO AND IT WAS REALLY BROWN, NOT NATURAL BROWN AS I WAS EXPECTING BUT I DYED MY HAIR TO MATCH IT AND IT LOOKS  GREAT!...... USING GEL IS THE BEST WAY TO KEEP UP THE LOOK OF IT, NOT CURLING LOTION OR CURLING CUSTARD. ITS NOT HUMAN HAIR SO ITS BEST TO BE TREATED WITH GEL AND THAT MAKES IT LOOK LIKE ITS HUMAN HAIR .
Nice shower cap but miss marked!!!!!!  These are NOT for women!  Children, yes
Why would they put such awful ingredients in a kids toothpaste? SLS?! It caused my kid to get a canker sore after just a couple of uses. I would warn against it.

I thought I would give Argan oil a shot after having some success with coconut oil as a moisturizer.  I chose this one because it was organic and cold pressed.  I am blown away!  I have never been able to use chemical ridden beauty products...they just make me break out.  Coconut oil helped a little with the breakouts, but was too greasy.  Argan oil is AMAZING.  I've been using about a month now, and today I am proudly going to work without any concealer on!  There is NOTHING to conceal!  It's helped to calm my breakouts, but has also lessened the appearance of some fine lines that have started appearing (I'm in my mid 30's).  I even used it on my hair to tame some fly aways with great success.  I think I'm in love!

I have tried many, many  trimmers, even name brand ones. This is the first one I can honestly say did not knick me while trimming my sensitive  areas! SO HAPPY!! I have so many before that have made me bleed, knicked in some very unfortunate areas, and never got that close close trim I wanted. I just tried the round, smooth touch head and the wide trimming head; so so pleased! Very close trim👌
the lashes and packaging was nice but both magnetic lash glued were  completely dried out

I had high hopes for this body scrub. It’s priced high so I expected it to be high quality. I was disappointed as soon as I opened it, the product was separated. All of the thick gritty stuff was on one side and all of the liquid oily stuff was on the other side. I had to physically stir it up before I could even use it.

The smell was overpowering. It wasn’t necessarily bad, just was too strong. I also thought the scrub was way too rough. I used it on my knees and it was border line painful. There is no way I could use this on sensitive skin areas like my stomach or chest. After rinsing off the grit in the bottom of the tub literally hurt my feet stepping on it.

I also do not like how there is no ingredients list on the jar. I like to see what I’m scrubbing on my skin.

Overall I do not recommend this body scrub.

The number one thing I like about this product is that it does not come in a plastic bottle. It’s packaged in a recyclable cardboard box.

Upon first opening the box the scent was a little overpowering for me, very natural woody smell. I was concerned it would leave my hair smelling too strongly. But to my surprise I really liked the scent while in the shower and it did not leave a strong scent in my hair once dried. I like that you can use the bar only where extra conditioning is needed, like on the ends of the hair, and skip the scalp. It didn’t seem to be as moisturizing as some traditional liquid conditioners I’ve used, but it gets the job done and doesn’t leave a grimy feel on the hair.

What I don’t like about this product is that the first two ingredients are alcohol. Alcohol is drying. So it just seems a little counterproductive to use alcohol as the first two ingredients in a moisturizing conditioner.

Overall I do enjoy this product and I would recommend for daily use!

Product is nicely packaged and I like to support small business. Problem is, if you sweat AT ALL, shed one tear, if a sprinkle of water or try to wash your hands , this stuff is coming off! It looks great when applied but i at least thought you needed soap and water to remove it.. or water with some scrubbing.. it comes off much easier than was described.. you have to be like the wicked with from Wizard of Oz...stay away from all water or that tan will dissappear. Dissapointed!

Love this product! It changes with every color you apply it to. Use in thin applications and with the pretty diva no cleanse top coat.I photographed my nails with a hot pink graduated to a lilac shade. The pictures do not do it justice. Wait until you see it in the sunlight....amazing!

The colors turn out darker than the picture shows. I experimented with other gel shades and came up with some brighter options.
Must use gel polish and "no wipe gel topcoat".
Use a tiny amt. Of powder over the top coat. Rub in. Dust off remaining loose powder and add 2nd topcoat.
Powder flies everywhere so cover your workstation for easy cleanup. Wear a smock!
*photo #1show all 12 powders over black.
*photo #2 shows 4 of the powders over black. The samples opposite of them are the same powders done with other gel colors.
Experiment with them to find shades you like.
Did not pick up stamp regardless of the brand of stamping paint. I have several different stampers from squishy to firm. Just cant seem to figure this one out. Good thing it was only a couple bucks.
A section of the bulbs are already out

This wand curler works perfectly with all types of hair. As an African American woman I was worried that the curls would not stay and that it would take a even bigger miracle to get it to curl. I have natural 4c hair and other wand curlers failed to curl my hair due to its thickness and length, but not this. It curled magnificently and stayed curled for over a day and a half before I had to recurl it. My daughter uses it also and she has relaxed 4A hair and it lasted even longer and with her short hair she ended up with a messy bob that all of her friends loved.

My only issue with this was the glove. although it was heat resistant as advertised, the material itself continuously got caught in the hair and at one point almost resulted in a hair catastrophe. its really easy to use with out the glove so there really is little chance of burning your hands while using the product without the glove.

One star only because price is INSANE. Not sure if this product is the real deal or not, but the real one from Sephora is only $15 and it definitely works amazingly well. (Not to mention that Sephora has free 2 day flash shipping right now) Hydrates and makes nails stronger. Health food for your nails. I would NOT pay $34+ for this. Don’t do it.
This goes on easy, and dries quickly, but, it doesn’t deeply moisturize like I was looking for....

These are the first set of cryosticks I’ve ever used and, overall, I think the idea is as great one. The rejuvenating feeling of icy coldness can’t be beat, especially as a way to combat redness\swelling from allergies. These are very smooth and slide across the skin without any issues. I also appreciate that it’s a set of 2, since I keep them in the freezer when not in use and can easily switch between them.

Now for the reason I give these 3 stars: they are terribly balanced and have teeny, tiny handles. The globe part that contains the liquid is sort of heavy and very difficult to manage. After a few minutes of struggling, my fingers and thumb are sore from having to holding on so tightly to a stem that is less in circumference than a pen.

It’s a really silly and short-sighted weakness in an otherwise nice item.

I love apricot kernel oil. It definitely one of my favorite carrier oils because it has so many uses. It's nice to have a 16 ounce bottle of cold pressed oil to work with. Here are just a few of the uses for this wonderful oil:

1) Apricot kernel oil for Skin
Apricot kernel oil is good for people with sensitive skin. It is non-irritant and soothing for the skin. It is light and quickly makes the skin soft and smooth. Apricot oil penetrates deep into the skin. It is easy to apply on the skin as it quickly spreads on the skin. It soothes irritated skin. A massage with apricot kernel oil is good for dry, parched skin. It can be used post shower to lock the moisture into the skin. Since it is light, it wont leave a greasy residue. Once absorbed into skin, it provides moisturization for hours. Apricot kernel oil is one of the best carrier oils for massage as it penetrates nicely into the skin and also improves the delivery of essential oils and other herbal agents. This oil is also good for infusing with herbs and absorbing their essence. It can be utilized for various kinds of massage that require an oil.
2. Apricot kernel oil for Hair
Apricot oil is loved by many people around the world for their hair care. When applied to the hair shafts,it helps to detangle hair. These are the health benefits that organic apricot oil provides to hair. It promotes hair growth because of the nutrients in it, especially Vitamin E. It reduces dry scalp problems and helps to achieve gorgeous shiny hair without any greasiness. When used as a hot oil treatment, it conditions the hair and provides them nutrition. It softens the hair, so that they are more manageable and easily combed.
3. As an Under Eye Cream
Apricot oil can be applied just like almond oil for healing under eye skin. It aids in reducing dark circles, puffiness and helps to strengthen the skin around this region. With regular application of apricot kernel oil, one can reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles around the eyes.
4. Face Oil
Apricot kernel oil is a nice face oil, especially when compared to other heavier oils. It helps to improve skin tone, nourish the skin and lower the appearance of aging signs, like wrinkles, lines and blemishes. However, this oil should be avoided by people who are suffering from acne or are prone to acne. That is because it has a comedogenicity of 2. This means that the oil is mildly comedogenic and it can clog skin pores. This may result in acne breakouts and blackheads.
5. Heart Health
Consumption of apricot kernel oil can be a healthy choice for the heart and the cardiovascular system. This oil has demonstrated the ability to lower the risk of heart attack in rats and can possibly perform the same function in humans. You can use apricot oil as a salad dressing and by using it for cooking certain recipes that go well with the flavor of this oil.

I received my oils at a discount for my unbiased review. Thanks for reading and I hope you found my review helpful.

Thank goodness! I had a really painful nail growing into my right big toe. I looked for my old clippers for a day or so.. then broke down and purchased this kit (I’ve been meaning to get the tools that help lift the skin). This clipper is almost twice the size of my old one, but that didn’t effect precision like I thought it would. I used the skin lifter to uncover the bit of nail pinching my skin and then clipped the bit. Instant relief! Easier to use than my smaller pair, tools were helpful to prep and then finish, I even love the little magnetic magnifying glass (could someone tell me how I’m supposed to use it? I have it on the box in the photo). I’d buy again! Thank you iMethod!!

This color changing flawless foundation is perfect for my skin! I have redness and hate having the feeling of thick cakey foundation on my face, with this stuff I feel like I have just powder on my face! I included a before and after pic with just the foundation and was blown away by how much the foundation covered without being heavy or thick. It doesn't take much product at all! This foundation evened out my skin tone and gave me a healthy glow. I put a little loose powder over it and was very pleased with the outcome!

I bought these for myself, but didn't realize there is a warning on the back of the package to not use if your pregnant, which I am. I gave one of the 3 individually sealed mask packets to my mom to try out as I anxiously await the arrival of my baby so I can pamper my feet. My mom asked me for more! Haha she said she hadn't had soft feet like this since the last time she was able to treat herself to a salon pedicure, and she loved how the mask helped soften her dried out heels! She had calluses and was surprised to see how well this mask penetrated even the thick skin on them. I can't wait to give myself a salon quality foot pampering from the comfort of my own home!!

I've had this rechargeable razor since Jan'19 (little short of 5.5mos) I've recharged the battery twice but yesterday it was dead and gone - would not take a charge. I understood after I received this item that the only way to get a warranty was to have a FaceBook account. I deleted my FB and have no intention of opening it again. I wish that was in the Amazon description. As for the item - I really liked having multiple heads for different purposes all in one compact unit. It is easy to use and carry. The eyebrow head could be half as long. The length made it awkward to use. Also, would like directions on how to use those little square pink things. I have quite a collection from other eye brow razors and never got directions and don't know what to do with them ;-( All in all I would have given this a 5 star rating but the dead rechargeable battery after only 2 recharges and the FB requirement to get a warranty caused me to drop it to 3 stars at best. If I by another similar one I won't get rechargeable anymore.
June 24, 2019 Update - I have increased this rating from 2 stars to 5 stars due to the seller having contacted me and replaced the entire unit with a new one. I requested the replacement to be a regular AA battery non rechargeable and seller did indeed send that. I made that request because this isn't the first small appliance with rechargeable batteries that failed quickly so until battery makers can improve the products I'll stick to the tried and true disposables. All in all I am happy with this purchase and thank the seller for making good on their guarantee.

I agree with other reviews, calling fake in this one.  I’ve used this product for a long time and love it however, this is not it!  Does not smell the same and does not hold my style AT ALL!!!  I’m about half way through the first can and will throw both away (bought 2 pack) and go buy the real thing.
Ok

Super happy with this product so far. I randomly found it at Ulta and decided to try it out. After a couple of years of cheaping out on my highlights, my hair is in really bad shape and I am working to bring it back to being healthy and strong again. Was happy to find a multi-pack of this on Amazon since I plan to use it at least once a week for a few more months.

The product is easy to use - heats up well in the microwave and then is in a thick enough package that I don't feel like the hot oil is going to spill out as I open it. Putting it on my hair is easy and it stays well without dripping down my neck, which I was worried about since coconut oil gets runny when warm. I leave it on for a few hours and then heat my hair up periodically with a hair dryer. Then, washing out is easy and clean. I've only used this once so far but I swear that my hair seems to be in better shape already - it feels like it is thickening back up to its old state. I plan to use this at least once a week, before every twice-weekly hair wash if I have the time, until I get these locks back to a healthy state.
brush needs to be better and longer....but worth the money.....but not my favorite liner..

I purchased this on discount somewhere else and I use it as a facial spritz during the day and sometimes to set my makeup after im done.  It's got a nice cool quality to it.  No heavy scent but that cool feeling lasts a while and I like that. Good for air travel because it's 2.03 fl ounces. TSA won't care.  I'd even spray this on my hair if I was in a dry climate. One star off for the price because i feel this is a little too high.

I agree that it is hard to find this kind of heating iron with the brush teeth, so I ordered this thinking it would be more up to date than the v. old slow-to-heat conair I have.

well, this Helen of Troy heating iron is not any better than the old ones I have. it is sloooow to heat up !!! it also feels cheaper than my old versions. and although it has a plastic cap on the end of the heated part, it seems a little on the skimpy side and I would feel safer and less nervous if the protective cap was more generous. also, the teeth of the brush are rubbery, bendable...makes it feel even cheaper.

All in all, I wanted to return it --- but then I realized that by the time I paid all the postage, I would only get $10 back. So I kept it. But seriously, if I had bought it from a store, I would have taken it back.

I have never tried a lash primer and never really knew it existed until I saw this. Because I am getting older and we lose that wonderful thick lash look we have we are younger i thought it would be great to use to condition my lashes and keep them healthier and maybe keep from losing some. I didn't expect it to be white but it does make it easier to see when you apply it. I found it easier to apply by brushing across my lashing instead of brushing base to tip. I even used the very end of the brush so swipe across hard to get areas. I curled my lashes as usual, then applied the primer. I tried mascara immediately and also tried waiting for the primer to dry. It worked best for me after it dried. When I applied while the primer was wet it made my curled lashes droop and I couldn't tell I had curled them. But when I waited just a few minutes, because it does dry quickly, then applied I was very happy with the results. I would never apply , then curl for fear of pulling out lashes that might stick to the curler. I also use the product to condition my lashes while I sleep. I put on before going to bed each night. I think your lashes are just like your hair, they need care and conditioning to keep looking beautiful too. I like how this also helps make my lashes appear fuller and thicker too. I have really enjoyed testing this product and love the results. I did receive this primer at a special price to use and give my opinion on its performance.

This foot file seems to be well made and feels comfortable in your hand while using and can be used for a long time and not become uncomfortable while using. It comes with an extra roller, which is nice if you want to share with your spouse. It is rechargeable, but the fact that is in only rechargeable through a USB makes it a little more inconvenient for me and a lot of older folks that you might like to purchase for may not even own a computer. I would much rather it plug into an outlet.This brings my opinion down to 4 stars. I personally will use my android phone charger to charge mine. I fully charge the unit for 10 hours as recommended and then set out to work on these little country girl heels that are always rough and cracked from going barefoot. I turned it on and set the safety lock and went to work smoothing my rough heels. I found that using a quick side to side motion, instead of forward and backward like I thought I should do, worked great. It was a little time consuming but it does work just as described. And if you did this as part of your regular beauty routine, it would keep your feet in fantastic shape and would not take but a few minutes for each foot. I managed to get my heels in good shape and applied lotion when I was finished and was very satisfied with the results. I think now it will be easy to keep them in good shape with this little tool. When you are done using you can simply rinse under running water to clean. There is also a brush included to use for cleaning. The head pops off easily by pushing the button on the side so that you can clean that area. I received the foot filer at a special price to try out and give my honest opinion on its performance. I think it does an excellent job if you do it as directed and don't try to press down too hard. Just use a back and forth motion and repeat until you get the softness you are looking for.

When I first saw this product on Amazon, I was wary of all of it's good reviews. I have long hair that is prone to dryness and breakage, and have tried just about every shampoo and conditioner on the market to improve hair health. I am pleasantly surprised that this shampoo lives up to it's claims.

I want everyone to understand that this is, in fact, a shampoo; it is NOT a cleansing conditioner. In my opinion, that is a plus, as it's important to cleanse your scalp and hair follicles without adding buildup that a "cleansing conditioner" often imparts. This shampoo is sulfate-free and gives a mild lather. I feel like it cleans my scalp and hair sufficiently, without stripping. I color-treat my hair, and this shampoo has never stripped or lightened my color.

As far as moisture is concerned, this adds hydration without weighing my hair down. Yet, it is NOT drying to my hair as so many shampoos are. I have long, fine hair, so that's a significant point. If you read the ingredient list, you will see that this product contains many natural oils and humectants. Given that, I am continually surprised that it doesn't weight my hair down.

After use, my wet hair feels smooth and sleek, but I still need to follow with a conditioner for detangling. Again, this is a shampoo; it is not a cleansing conditioner. Since there is no matching Pure Body Naturals daily conditioner for this shampoo, I have been experimenting with some other argan oil conditioners sold here on Amazon.

No matter your hair type, I think this shampoo can add to your hair health. I highly recommend trying it.

This is the first time that I've used a mask from this line. And I have to admit that the packaging influenced my purchase:)
I really like the feel of the serum and the light fragrance. I, unlike other reviewers, couldn't fit it over my ears. Also the eye holes were way too small. Tip: use the peeI off backing and laid it on my neck and chest.
Left it on for 10 minutes and when I removed it I have small bumps all over my face, but now after 30 minutes, they seem to be going away. Once the serum dries it does feel a little tight on your face but it does not dry out the skin. I finished with a rich moisturizer to "seal the deal." The next morning my face felt very soft but still had a few bumps around the mouth area. My advice would be for those who have dry, sensitive skin, might want to be weary of this mask. Not the mask's fault, mind you, just not a good match for my skin. I would have given it 5 stars but took one off because of the bumps...

Wish I’d taken the time to read reviews.
Made in China....so into the trash bin it goes.

I really didn't know what to expect with these Unaone Compressed Towels but must say, I'm pleasantly surprised.

They are a little larger than a penny and about 1/4" high. They look like large size breath mints or antacid tabs (probably good idea to keep them away from kids & pets) and come individually packaged in plastic with an easy tear edge.

I was a bit concerned that you had to soak them in a cup of water to activate but was thrilled when I held the first one under a stream of warm water and it immediately began to expand. After squeezing out the excess water and unfolding, it is the perfect size wipe to tackle a quick clean or mess. The wipe is about the size of one you find in the antibacterial wipes, but much SOFTER! I would be willing to bet that you could also use a water bottle in a pinch and just pour enough water on the tablet to moisten and use if out hiking, running, etc.

I really like that you can throw these in your purse, backpack, glove box, diaper bag, etc. and have a wipe available for use at any time. With these, you will not open a package to find a dried out wipe if not used for a long time---you make them fresh each use!

Very handy, very versatile and a good quality disposable wipe each time. The price could be improved a little bit to make them about 10 cents each, but other than that, highly recommend! :)

I love this flat iron despite the one problem I have with it. I wish that the flat iron was skinnier. It’s difficult to get close to my head at certain angles due the flat iron size. If my hair was longer, this would not be a problem. I almost returned the product because of the iron size. But I made some changes to the way that I iron my hair & I think it will work despite the iron size.
The features I like about it:
-steam feature - makes my frizzy hair smoother than a normal flat iron does
-high temperature adjustable heat - makes it so I can iron my hair with less passes from the iron, even if my hair is wet when I’m ironing it - my hair is thick and usually requires more passes, even from a high heat iron, and I have never been able to dry my wet hair by ironing it with any other flat iron in the past
-setting buttons are on the inside handle - I was annoyed with this feature at first, but I realized that this makes it safer to leave plugged in when not in use, when you have small children - I have not had the problems I have had in the past with my kids trying to play with the buttons because of their location
-comes with quite a few extra tools including an extra steam compartment and an easy way to fill the steam compartment - the holes for the filling the steam compartment are really small and would be impossible to fill without provided bottle
-comes with chord Velcro strap - this makes it easy to keep organized despite having a long chord in a small bathroom

Despite my problem with the short hair, I decided to keep it because it works so well. I will also say that I don’t believe the steam feature is protective to hair damage. It just makes the flat iron way more affective with less passes.

First things first, I bought the copper red (#33) extensions in 22". When I bought them I had the carrot top, "ginger red" color, which these did not match, at all. It didnt bother me too much because I was fine dying my hair a bit darker so long as it was still red, which these are, but if you are trying to match a natural red hair I'd recommend trying a different shade.

My fiance applied these for me; he followed a diagram I found online for placement (google images), sandwiched my hair between two extensions then used my flat iron on the top bit to seal the extensions together. If you don't know what I mean, I highly recommend searching on YouTube for a tutorial or two.

I only bought one set, and it ended up being just about perfect for me because my hair is naturally very fine and I have trouble hiding a ton of extensions. I just wish I had two more "sandwiches" for the front as it does look a bit choppy at the front of my head. Luckily I have clip ins to help here when I dont want to clip the shorter hairs out of my face. If you have anything beyond thin, fine hair get 2 - 3 packs.

My only complaint is that they dont offer smaller packs. I wish they offered a half pack, so you arent faced with another $50 for a few more strands.

Aside from that the hair is very soft and I've been able to style it how I want without issue. I haven't washed my hair yet, but I'll update if I experience any issues there.
After a couple of hours, leaves my skin super oily and shiny.

I got this face wash for my son and am very impressed with it! The packaging is cool looking and fun and looks obviously designed for a guy. I think it has a great combination of ingredients. I like that it has very gentle ingredients and not some of the harsher ones that are found in most acne products. I am giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because I think it's misleading to claim there are only natural ingredients in here. Lauryl glucoside, decyl glucoside, and sodium cocoyl glutamate aren't truly 100% natural ingredients, although they are gentle and safe, and personally I would actually prefer a face wash with cleansing agents like this included rather than not. Some people might be might be sensitive to the essential oils in here but the majority of people most likely aren't, and again personally I'd SO much rather see things like chamomile extract, lavendar oil, and tea tree oil than a long list of chemicals!!! I'm super happy I found this for my son Peter and would most definitely order it again at the full price if it continues to work well for him. I think it's an excellent value for such a high quality product.

I wanted to give this sunscreen a rating of 5 stars but I don't think that would be honest. The description sounds so appealing, gentle and pure, but there are several things that really bother me. First of all, this is definitely NOT a natural product. There are tons of ingredients in here that don't pass that test at all (read the label!).  Secondly, the two sunscreens that are listed as active ingredients don't protect against UVA rays, only UVB. Titanium dioxide which protects against UVA rays also is in here but not labeled as an active ingredient, and it doesn't give a percentage. Thirdly, if you research ethylhexyl methoxycinnamate you will see that it is not considered to be an entirely safe ingredient. With all that said, I do like the texture. It is light yet moisturizing, and it feels smooth and even a little silky because of the cyclopentasiloxane (synthetic silicone) in it.  I think the description of this is misleading though, and although I don't hate it, it wouldn't be my first choice for a pure, natural, and entirely safe sunscreen. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
