Very good set, all sheets are diffferent. Size is decent, most of these stickers will fit on an adults nails. Some will fit on a pre-teens nails too. They do stick very well, and they dissolve under pressure and acetone-it takes a bit of time for that.  The details are really good!  Each sticker sheet measures 3 3/4 inches long and 2 1/2 inches wide.  There are some longer stickers - for those with longer nails this is great.  There are some stickers that no matter what won't fit on a normal sized nail and would have to be cut.  There are a lot of tiny hearts and star images that are super cool for little kids to enjoy or to add that little bit extra to a mani.  There is an assortment of flames, flags, peace hands, lips, numbers, uncle Sam hats, lots of hearts, butterflies, and birds. There are even a few high heels and vote checkmarks.  This is a fantastic collection that was well thought out and I'm super impressed.  For anyone with a need for speed to add decor to a mani, these stickers are the way.  We have lots of holidays that can be celebrated using patriotic stickers, such as Labor day, Presidents day, Veterans Day, 4th of July, Gold Star Mothers day, POW recognition day, and Pearl Harbor day.  These are all worthy of recognition with a special manicure.  These are easily lifted and placed using a sharp tipped pair of tweezers and they do stick well!  I even tried them without a top coat, and they stayed for 2 days.

I do like these, first off!  I like the color choices, and that these are already matte.  This is so easy for anyone who doesn't have a lot of time, but wants to do quick nails.  I really appreciate these.  There are a lot, and you have lots of choices.  I wish the maker gave an option for a round cuticle area, instead of these square cuticle area nails.  Looking at these from the side, you can see the space between my real nails and the fake nails...so for anyone who has a long nail bed, their real nails will more than likely show as mine do.  I will use these for nail art, I just can't see changing my real nail shape at the side walls to fit these, that can be hazardous.  The curve of these is good, fitting to the nail plate well.  If you use gel polish, this curve will be more drastic when the gel cures, so be aware of that possibility.  I'm dropping 1 star for fit at the cuticle, seller should give an option for a more round cuticle line too.

This is a nice Nautical gift set with 4 pretty polishes.  They are 13.5 ml each, and made in the U.S.A.  Initially I thought I would love Stay Nude the most, but it ended up being my least favorite of the set, only because it is pearl and streaks are unavoidable due to the type of finish it is.  All 4 have a shiny topcoat built into the formula.  The 3 cremes are all very sheer formulas, not super opaque.  The thickness of the formula for all of these is good.  If you like a sheer formula, where you can see your nail bed thru the polish, then these are your jam.  I did several manicures with each of them, and found that if I wanted a sheer look then 1 coat worked perfectly, otherwise 2 or 3 coats for full coverage and less peek thru of your natural nail and smile line.  I did 2 easy coats for each of my manicures.  The blue (Hypnosis) seemed to have the best coverage, and the formula for that was my favorite of the 4, it dried the fastest at 8 minutes to the touch.  They all go on easily, with a regular round brush (not flat) and they dry fairly well, in about 10-15 minutes each layer.  I did find that using my own quick drying topcoat that these wore much better, but from the manufacturer neither base nor top coat are required.  I did not get any staining from these, which I love.  The pink and white will both be really good polishes for doing either French tip or pond manicures when you just want a sheer base, where you do a layer, do art over it, then cover it again, and more art on that layer-it gives a layered effect that is fun to do.  The color palate is a fun one, with lots of options for artwork.  These are not quick drying-more of the typical 10 minutes per layer, and I expected them to be hardened on their own, without the help of a quick drying topcoat, but that was not the case with them.
This arrived with 2 of the brushes missing completely, and the dotting tool had a bent tip.

This is a nice spray bottle kit, it comes with 2 funnels and a sheet of labels, I found the labels too small for use, each one is approximately 1 inch x 1/2 inch in diameter, and not sure if it can be used in an inkjet printer or not. All 10 spray bottles included all the necessary parts, and the stem that draws up liquid was long in each one, none were short and I really appreciated that. You should be able to spray down to the last drop. I tested mine with rubbing alcohol, for sanitizing my phones. The funnel came in handy for filling the bottle. It made the job so easy! The sprayer does spray a very fine mist. I used it several times to clean some things then left it overnight with the cap on. Next day I tested it again. First off, the cap contained some of the rubbing alcohol inside it, which means the container will leak into the cap standing up. Not necessarily a huge deal breaker, but a negative for me. Holding it in my hand I got the rubbing alcohol on my finger too, so this may waste product just from this. Several drops every 24 hours may not seem like a lot, but if you make your own essential oil room spray then this could be an expensive waste. Lastly, I had an issue with the spray top, the angle is so slight I wasn't sure if I would spray myself in the face of I wasn't wearing eyeglasses. You have to be careful, ensuring you're spraying away from yourself. I did not get any leakage of the alcohol out of the cap, it seemed pretty tight. It did pool in the cap, didn't run down the bottle. I did get a rubbing alcohol ring when I set down the cap on my coffee table tho. Beware of that possibility whatever you use in these bottles.
All in all, a nice kit and I give it 4 stars.

A decent product for a decent price.  These are nice and flexible, making removal super easy.  They can be reused, once you clean them and sanitize them with rubbing alcohol.  These are more square at the cuticle area, great for those with a more square shaped nail bed, my thumbs are pretty square.  They come in 10 sizes (10 of each size) and the sizes are reasonable sizing too.  I have dual forms from another brand and half of them are unreasonably HUGE, whereas these are for normal people.  For my thumb I used size 2 and my other fingers fit 4-8.  They came in a plastic organizer case that is way smaller than my other case, so they don't take up a ton of room in my nail station.  The latch on mine didn't close tight, so I had to use a piece of tape, but I'm not taking off any stars because that didn't affect the usefulness of the product itself.  All in all, the C curve was perfect, easy to load, cure and pinch off.  I found these to be perfect for anyone who wants a square cuticle line, rather than a round one. I purchased this thru my Amazon Prime account and did not receive any compensation for this completely unbiased review.

This masking product does brush on easily and does work on the areas you want to protect, but it dries very stiff and is difficult to trim without it wanting to lift off from the plastic. And it is difficult to tell if an area is successfully covered since it has just a slight blue tint to it. When dry, I can't tell sometimes if it is still on the area I want to protect. If this product wants to be perfect it needs to be more flexible, stick to plastics a little more, and have more pigment in it to show clearly where it has been applied.

Pros: 1- It's not greasy
2- It's matte finish

Cons-NON

I found the only spray that doesn't leave your hair "shiny" and "weighted down" is "Sebastian Sharper Plus Extra Hold Plus"! The only drawback to this is the smell but it dismisses after a few. Those 2 together make a very good marriage.
I usually love there kenz Laurenz hair ties, but the glitter ones get tangled in my hair and pull it out in huge chunks. No thanks

Not original

They look so pretty. But, they don’t open properly.  You feel on the verge of either breaking them, or breaking your finger or nails, trying to open. Got open, placed on scarf. Now trying to remove. Got clip open, but it did not open jaw portion, which is now locked  on my scarf! Once I pry it open and get my scarf out, returning these ASAP.  Hoping it does not tear it up! Not worth destroying clothing. Sadly, very poor quality.

My sister is a huge Viktor & Rolf scent fan,  I purchased set for her as a Christmas gift. I priced the set at various places, including fine dept stores, and Groupon. The set was $2 less at Groupon, with a long shipping time.  But, as much as $50 more, at dept stores. The packaging and scent were EXACTLY the same as dept stores. Groupon also had exact same packaging.  At Viktor & Rolf, packaging, bows, etc, vary, depending on size, set, edition, etc. We would have returned if not right (as it was Prime). She knows her perfume, and loved it. I also have the eau de parfume (same sister bought for me from major dept store:). She too says this set, including bath gel and lotion is an exceptional deal. Now I want a set too!

i like the sponges, they're pretty dense but they do blend concealer and foundation, it just takes a little longer than a beauty blender would. it's a much heavier type sponge when dry and wet,  they retain water more since its a thicker sponge than the beauty blenders do. if you're someone that doesn't want to feel the weight of a wet sponge then this isn't the one for you. im totally fine with the weight of it and how it blends, it takes a little longer but it still works, now this isn't a dupe for the beauty blender since it doesn't have the same feel and doesn't perform the same way as the original beauty blender. i would suggest this to be used more for blending contour and baking since it actually grabs the powders pretty well and doesn't suck them up when the sponge is wet. i like them and 4 should last me a long while.

it's an oven mitt........an oven mitt. sigma is repackaging oven mitts as brush cleaners and selling them for almost 40 bucks and you can find the exact or almost exact thing on here or in your local drug store or supermarket between 5 to 20 bucks. it's an oven mitt........it's an overpriced oven mitt.
Fake product

I purchased this at local department store.  After purchasing the clerk said, "this is a really concentrated formula so you just need a tiny bit on the dark spot and you are not going to start seeing results until the bottle is almost gone."  I thought to myself, "ok, so what you are saying is it doesn't work."  Anyway, lesson learned.  I have one pretty large sun spot on my cheek.  I applied as directed morning and night and have been doing so for about 3 months.  I see no difference.  If you have to use the entire bottle before seeing results, well that could take a year especially if you are just using a tiny bit as directed.  Waste of money.  I have seen results using Clinique dark spot eraser.
Nice product.  Wear gloves or you will have purple finger nails for days.
Smooth don't last long

Unfortunately, this lipstick arrived broken. It was cracked in the middle and stuck to the bottom. It seemed like it had been that way for a while, not just broken in transit.

I was able to get it out and stick it in the correct side. It’s not secure, but it will do. I definitely can’t take it in my purse for use out and about as I have to pull it out with my fingers each time.

The color of the product is nice. The lipstick has good color and is also buildable. I found this particular shade flattering and delicate enough for someone who mostly wears neutrals.

I wasn’t a big fan of the pointed shape of the product. I’m getting used to it, but just not convinced it makes application more precise than a round one.

The longevity of the lipstick was OK. It definitely didn’t stay after eating or drinking - this is the kind of product you have to reapply every couple hours. It’s creamy enough but I wouldn’t say super moisturizing.

Overall, I wasn’t impressed by this product. I liked the color and texture, but the packaging, shape, and longevity were all nos for me.

This was my first time trying shampoo or conditioner in bar form, and I had the opportunity to try both from this company's line of products. My first impressions were very positive - the ingredients looked clean and natural, as well as being cruelty-free and vegan, I love that it’s plastic free (both the lack of bottle and the packaging), and that the scent options were relatively gender neutral. The bars were a little smaller than I expected, but ergonomically they fit comfortably in the palm of my hand and don't seem to be shrinking too fast after a week or so of use. I'm glad that they have different colors, so that I can differentiate between my bar soap, shampoo, and conditioner!

My experience using them was pretty good. It felt odd at first as I've only ever used bottled products, but quickly got used to it and could definitely see myself using more bars in the future. I tried both running the conditioner bar down my hair and lathering it up a little in my hand and applying that way. Between the two, I felt that I got pretty good coverage and results. My hair felt less tangled and I was able to work a brush through pretty easily once I got out the shower. When my hair dried, it seemed softer and healthier looking than it had previously, and my curls had a little more life to them.

I only have two concerns - the first is that I'm struggling to find a place to put the bars in my shower where they won't get misted by water and disintegrate more quickly that way. The second is the smell. Although it's not unpleasant, it reminded me a little of a scented candle, and was very strong. Three different people commented on the smell of my hair that week, which is not something that usually happens to me. My husband thought that I smelled like cologne! I could see this being a pro or a con depending on how you feel about fragrances. Personally, I found it overwhelming as I'm more on the sensitive side to smells.

Overall, I would consider trying this or a similar product again in the future, but only with a less intense scent.
