The file and buffer were great but BOTH nail clippers were uneven and did not create clean cuts. Whats worse is that the smaller one's handle popped off the first time I rotated it into the clipping position. I have been able to get it back on, but I cannot rotate it to closed, and even when I leave it open the handle still falls off half the time when I depress it.

It was cheap enough, and I;m pretty sure this shipped from china, so it's not worth the hassle to return or exchange> I will be keeping all parts, the clippers are still useful for cutting other things, like thread for sewing, or the plastic that attaches tags to clothing. The smaller one whose handle keeps falling off will likely end up in the garbage. the buffer and file work fine so I will keep and use those.

Overall I am super disappointed. The clippers are poorly crafted with the blades not lining up, the handle breaking off of one, both of these issues make them completely unusable for their intended function of clipping nails. That said, the file and buffer could easily cost the same or more than the whole 4 piece set.

I would not recommend this item to anyone, even someone looking for a good buffer and nothing more... spend more to buy just a buffer.
We have mice that keep making nests in our car and chewing on our fuel tank costing us lots of money. I'm thankful for a safe option that we can use as a deterrent!

I've purchased from this seller before and because I received such great service, I ordered more necklaces from this seller in the colors I didn't have.  This blue necklace is gorgeous.  The center stone borders a greenish-blue, but the stones surrounding the center stone and the "necklace" which are several cords intertwined with beads, are a true, sparkling blue.  The design is well done and will adorn the outfits needing these colors.  Again, it is more a choker style necklace with a short extension.  It works for me and my 5' 0" height so the ornament hangs at the right place.  If you are looking for a longer necklace, you may have to find an extension to make it work.  Overall, beautiful colors, beautiful design, great service.  It doesn't get any better than this!

In reading the comments I noticed that almost no one compared different shavers.
I have used a Norelco for years but I wanted something that was better and quicker to use on a two or three day beard. I have a Philips Norelco 4500. I bought the Wahl Smart Shave and the Braun 3040s.
After a two week trial I came up with the following observations.
On all three the blades float so they stay close to the face as you shave.
On the Norelco and the Wahl the head swivels too. It’s nice but I would not miss it if it were not there.
The Norelco is smoother and quieter than the other two. It is also the easiest to clean. It only takes one hand. Norelco recommends (and it is true) that saving in a circular motion works the best with their shaver.
The Norelco and the Wahl have Lithium batteries. The Braun has an NiMH battery. I like the Lithium.
I think the Wahl and the Braun shave closer than the Norelco but they are all close.
As for the trimmers, they all cut about the same. I would not buy a shaver without it. The Wahl is harder to manipulate. It has a nice metallic finish but that makes it hard to move up or down. It slips under your thumb.
The Wahl has the better battery and charge level indicator and a five year warranty. Wahl replacement head and blades are not on Amazon now. The Braun blades are easier to replace and the part is available on Amazon. Norelco blades are also easy to replace and available on Amazon.
I like all three shavers. For those with a light beard or with a medium beard and you shave every day I would recommend the Norelco. For those with a heavy or a three day beard I would recommend the Braun.

I suspect this is a knock off I got since there are both glowing reviews and terrible reviews.  Holding the stick against the arm pit does NOT work!  Even when I persisted, it also sloughs over when I press the product into the armpit (ugh) and gets caught under the cap so it oozes out.  Going into the trash can and will not buy again.
Didn't really work

I have been professionally trained to file nails. I have a license and degree in Cosmetology but I don't practice professionally. Nail filing is a skill anyone with a file can master. I bought this because I saw it was recommended for use with jamberries. I have some but I was interested in using it with my super thin sensationail nail shields. It's a thin flimsy sticker you can put on before applying gel polish which makes the removal much easier. I'd compare it to a super thin jamberries.
Unfortunately it didn't help as expected. I am painting my nails right now and was using the stock mini disposable file that came with the shields.
I found this file feels a little dull. I can't see any difference in using this or any regular file.
The nail stickers still have a raggedy edge and it didn't feel any smoother than when I use other files.
I am not interested in trying another brand/style at this time due to the blah results. It's not a must have for the arsenal.
I'm giving it an extra star because it is constructed nicely and I haven't broke it, which says a lot about its durability.
I can't handle rough nail edges it makes me cringe. I'm using it while I write this review and it's just confirming I don't need this.

I really want this on subscribe and save but Amazon only has a couple shades available. :( anyways a few years ago my skin became super sensitive and Almay consistently puts out products that don't bother my skin. This has pretty good coverage and you can build it up. I am rather happy with it. That is the only reason I am not giving it 3 stars. Here is my problem. I am colorblind and finding makeup that matches my skin by myself is a nightmare. For those of you who do not know colorblind is where we have a cone that is low in color which also affects other colors. We do not see in black and white. My green is low sometimes making certain greens look like a light version of goldenrod copy paper or as I say 1970's gold. Yuck... Anyways this affects how I view other colors and I cannot match makeup well. Certain shades will appear the same leading me to believe I have a match until someone (usually my cousin) points out my makeup looks ridiculous. Let me mention my cousins call me "educated" colorblind because most of the time I know how to compensate for color deficiency. I know color theory well. I wrote Almay about the problem because my only alternative was to drag my cousin to the store and have her "sample" shades. I am sure other customers and the store does not appreciate this so in the end I have tons of money wasted on the wrong shades. I know this happens to people with normal color vision but multiple that by 5-10 times you have done that and that describes my experience. Anyways I thought I'd write them and ask as Covergirl used to sell a 3 pack sampler of similar colors so you could find your perfect shade. The reply was to purchase full size products. I thought this lacked empathy as I wasn't writing to get free products. I was writing to find a resolution that would result in me being a long time customer. I don't think them going the extra mile to send something mini even if I had to pay was asking too much from such a large corporation. This leaves me felling like I should rate them 3 stars. While I remain a loyal customer they don't care about me. :( I wouldn't have minded paying for some sort of samples, but I guess they rather keep taking my money while I experienced trial and error finding a shade. Now while my cousins have not compared my makeup to mud since using this shade I haven't exactly had them inspect it closely for me after applied. I will ask to get a final opinion. The smart shade does not provide adequate coverage or I would go that route. I have that product also for lazy days. I rate the product a solid 4 stars for being a good product especially on super sensitive skin, but I rate the company 0 stars for not even considering people like me. They got my money so I guess they're happy. Still let wondering if this is the right shade for me.. *sigh* still holding on to the heap of bottles because I paid good money for it. Anyways I am leaving this review here because this is where I am going to order and the price looks very reasonable. Now if I could find the perfect powder... Btw their concealer sucks. Just use the foundation to build coverage and save your money. I will update after I get some more opinions on if this shade is for me. Gawd I hope it is. I can't keep spending all this money, and because of my skin conditions I absolutey have to wear makeup when going out so I don't feel like people are staring at me.

The curler arrived nicely boxed with directions.  USB charger cord is included.  You need your own usb outlet plug.  It charged easily.  The red indicator light shows that it is charging.  The light turns green when it is charged.  The curler was easy to use.  Just apply a coat of mascara then hold the blower close to your lashes to curl them.  My lashes are short so they curled in 2 seconds.  Directions said hold blower close to lashes for 20 seconds.  The air started feeling a little too hot for me after 5 seconds, 20 seconds would have been way too long.  My biggest drawback is you have to remove your contact lenses before using the curler.  It is written on the box and in the directions, luckily I read the directions.  Removing my contact lenses is an extra hassle for me since I have to keep one lens in at a time in order to see what I am doing.  I have tried it a second time and again the heat was too hot and I felt uncomfortable.  This product wasn’t for me because I am a contact lens wearer and the heat was too hot. Disappointing because it did curl my lashes.
Does not work!!!! What a waste of 25 dollars!!!

I do not want GREASY hair or weighed down hair! THIS shampoo and conditioner leave your hair clean, not weighed down and SHINY! I switch shampoos every now and then and find I have made another mistake ever leaving this duo! This brand is sold in my "upscale salon," and no wonder why! I want clean, healthy hair, READY to style and not worried about STUFF left on my hair before I even begin to put the STUFF on for styling. Know what I mean? I have HARD to please hair, hard to deal with hair, really. I have naturally curly hair which has now begun to turn silver and kinky and FRIZZY if left to its own desires. And, YES, I get what is left of the light brown hair, HIGHLIGHTED! What a mess I am really handing ANY brand of shampoo and conditioner. Oh, yes, sometimes in the back when my hair is shampooed at the salon, the associate will use something else on my hair, and I momentarily FALL for buying something new. THAT is before the build-up. That is before I get it home, only to find out that a one time use is FAR different than an every other day use of this new, supposed wonder. NOPE! BACK to GK which ADDS protein (keratin) each and every time I shampoo WITHOUT leaving GUNK on m hair. Yes, this conditions my hair BETTER than any other brand I have tried (Keune, BB and all the others!)! Boy was getting this DIRECT from GK (and proof that it was the REAL thing!!!) a relief as my hair fell back into line after the VERY first shampoo-conditioning after one of my stupid switches! The other products by GK are great too. You may have to buy a few and try them out and the different amounts of product to use, but you WILL get to as near perfection as YOUR hair can be. I know GK has done that for my straw-like, frizzy, curly, kinky, colored hair! Got even ONE of those problems? THINK of what it might be able to do for your hair!

LOVE these! They are long and thin enough to fold over for a total of FOUR separate cleaning surfaces. Now, I happen to use a Clarisonic, but use these for "personal" clean up if you know what I mean. They are foldable as I pointed out with FOUR surfaces before you may need to rinse out for further use. These are GREAT and one of the best additions to my bathroom I have EVER bought! I use the bag, yes, to keep the nap from changing in any way and to maintain its "grab." BUY these when available for they disappear quickly EVERYWHERE!!!!!!

It flipping burns like CRAZY!! Initially I loved the creamy feel, it was very smooth. That " oh this stuff feels nice," feeling was replaced by burning. My face was on fire. I looked in the mirror and I could see that my face was already turning red! I had only put on a thin layer, and literally I could see my skin getting red!! I didn't think it was suppose to burn, but I have it another second or two to see if it would subside- couldn't do it. I had to get this off my face ASAP!! I can't imagine what my face would look like if I could deal with the burn. It's like covering your face in icy hot and then sticking your face in water. That's the intense burn you feel.

I'm not sure what the hell is in it that makes you feel like you were slapped by Satan!! Apparently this is a highly rated product, but there are many that get this burn as well!!
STUNNING

I had surgery mid February that left me with 2 incision scars. They are not too bad but still figured I would try to make them less noticeable. I had to wait until the areas were completely healed per the instructions. I like that the scar cream comes in a pump that comes out easy in small amounts. The smell is a little strong for me but it doesn't stink. To make sure I could tell if it was working or not, I have only been using it on one side. I'm pretty impressed. I have sensitive skin and this had cause no irritation. The aide I have been testing on is flatter than the other one. I can actually feel the untreated scar but I have to look for the one I used the cream on. The color is also returning back to normal faster than the other. I'm glad to have found something to help because with 6 kids somebody always had a scar of some kind that we need to work on.

I received the renewal scar cream free in order to provide honest and unbiased feedback. All statements are based solely on my personal experience using the product.
Made my hair fall out, I am supper angery with this company. DON'T WASTE UR MONEY, THIS PRODUCT IS CRAP!!!!! As you see in my photos u can see what's wrong!!!

Lovely polish and this set of pinks are beautiful!
I have used this brand for a while now and I will not hesitate to use or order this brand.
Pictures below are nails that were completed almost 2 weeks ago!
Tons of cooking, cleaning, laundry and washing dishes by hand with no gloves has been going on.
Yes they have grown out with natural nail growth, they have worn off a tiny bit on the ends from wear and use.
After applying a clear base coat I applied one layer of Pastel Pink #139, then I did a mix of 139, 63 Pearl Pink and 252 Berry Burst and applied it with a stamper to get the marbling effect. Buy the time I got the colors to my liking it seemed pretty lumpy but a few coats of clear smoothed it right out and let it meld together in a beautiful mix. Then there are added layers of glitter polish and white stamping done over them plus adding clear top coats. No issues of drying, chipping, fading or peeling.
I felt this polish needed a true and tested review. This application is done on natural nails and no Gel polish or UV/LED lights used. The top coats were done with a wet and wild brand at the time of creating and no other coats were added after.
Before giving a review on a polish it should be tested on your fingers and toes.
Just because a Polish doesn’t stay on the fingernails well does mean it isn’t good. Try it on your toes too.
Did it chip and peel off of them the same way as your fingernails?
Then it isn’t the polish...it is either the application, nail or the way you use your hands.
Take responsibility and tell the truth.
Please make sure you prepared your nails and used the product properly before giving reviews.

This is a rapid review because I haven't fully utilized the entire pallet.Firstly I am very impressed by the packing and sophisticated look of this item. I was delighted to have received this product as a Christmas gift. Unfortunately Avon has an unfavorable reputation but unlike many I do not have an unreasonably low expectation for Avon makeup.They eye shadows in this pallet are amazingly pigmented plus the shadows feel creamy to the touch.Which both things are a sign of good quality. I continue to be impressed with Avon's makeup.
More often than not there is an imbalance of mattes to shimmers in many of the pallets I have seen or own.The Avon Ultimate Mega Mix N Go Palette has solved that with a well thought out combination of mattes and shimmers. I am eager to continue using this gift,
THIS SMELLS AMAZING!!!

This is the kids’ version of Curl Keeper and as far as I can tell, it’s the very same product just with different packaging and a slightly lower price. The ingredient lists are the same on both versions. I bought this version because it costs a little less. I’m not crazy about the price of the original Curl Keeper but I had heard a lot of good things about it and I wanted to try it.

I have 2C-3A wavy-curly, high-porosity hair and I live in a humid climate. I like this product. It’s a light hold, clear liquid gel. It seems to do a good job of defining my curls and smoothing the cuticle to decrease frizz, even when I use it alone or just with a curl cream. It’s also nice to use for a damp or dry restyle in between wash days.

I cannot say for sure whether I will re-purchase this. I do think it’s overpriced. There is a similar gel at Sa-lly beauty (the GVP version of Sebastian wet) that costs under 8 dollars. The Sally has several proteins and the Kinder does not, so this a great choice for protein-sensitive hair. I may repurchase to alternate with the Sally but most likely I’ll keep looking for a protein-free liquid gel that is priced a little lower.

This e-file works really well, except mine only rotates in one direction. It has a switch for changing directions but mine only spins clockwise. You might not think it's a big deal but it is actually helpful to have the option to switch back and forth. I'm exchanging it and will update this review once I get the new one, which hopefully will work as advertised.

The included bits are decent, although only the sanding bands work efficiently on UV gel overlays. I bought a separate ceramic carbide bit to use on my UV gels (2/32 is the correct bit size). The included metal bits work fine on natural nails.

EDIT: I received my replacement file a few days ago and it does rotate in both directions as it should. It is a little balky when changing directions and requires trying a few combinations of flipping switches and turning knobs before it will start up again. Really serious nail enthusiasts or professionals should probably invest in a higher quality e-file, but for hobbiests and home users, this one is pretty good.

EDIT 2: Just a day after my last update, the replacement drill died. It's only been used 3 times, and I had it for less than a week. The power light comes on but that's it. So back it goes, and off I go to find a different drill, probably for more money but hopefully with more reliability.
Order from Sally's

Worst nail polish ever!  Packaging and price are good but the product is horrible!  None of the colors come off with nail polish remover or even pure acetone.  Your nail beds and tissue remained stained no matter how many cotton balls you soak (the cotton stays clean while your nails are discolored).  I even soaked my feet in soap/bleach/water mixture without any success.  Who knows what ingredients go in this product that is made in China, I can only imagine.

This mask is unlike any other I've used. Unopened, it sounds like a heavy liquid when the container is shaken; I'm used to masks that are "solid" and extremely thick, but was looking for an exfoliating mask because my skin gets very dry and flaky in winter. Got this one because I was offered a discount in exchange for an honest review. Used it last night for the first time...

It should probably be well-shaken before each use, and it looks very strange. Kind of a greenish-grey pearlescence, and it is a "runny" mask. A little goes a long way, too! I was surprised. There must be at *least* 20 treatments in this little jar. Required less than two teaspoons to do my entire face and under the jawline.

It feels strange. Kind of an icy-hot sting in the beginning; interesting, but not uncomfortable. It doesn't feel as though it would do a lot of exfoliating, and it doesn't dry quickly (maybe it's not supposed to dry, at all). The instructions said to leave it on for 20 minutes, but I left it on for an hour. At that point, it was flaky. Rather than simply rinse it off, I rubbed it off with my fingers, and THAT was definitely exfoliating. This wouldn't work with any of the other masks I've used, and I really liked being able to easily/gently rub every bit off using my fingers. Post-rub, my face felt very dry, but after rinsing with warm water that feeling went away and my skin was SO soft.

Today when I awoke, my skin felt great. No dry patches. I did still apply my usual three or four drops of cold argan oil, just because the humidity is so low right now.

As-is, I like this mask much more than I thought I would when I first opened the jar (though it smells wonderful, again, it's very "liquid," which seemed strange before I'd actually used it). That said, I'll probably alternate between using it straight out of the jar and adding some bentonite to make it a bit thicker. Very happy to have this organic mask!

REVIEWS: Most of my reviews are 4* and 5* whether for items I received at a discount in exchange for an honest review, items I purchased at the regular Amazon price, or things I've bought elsewhere but like or hate enough to write a review. There are few bad reviews because I research every purchase I make, and junk even at a discount is still junk. I try not to buy junk (and I only exchange reviews for discounts with items I actually want and use). A bad review means I didn't do my homework (or fell for some crafty hype) and made a big mistake.

Although I've only been using it for about 10 days (give or take) I have not had any problems with irritation or any other problems. I'm excited and hope to see some growth and fuller lashes in the next 3-5 weeks or so.
The Customer service at Zenlash has been top notch! They are easy to communicate with and are always willing to answer all my questions!! They also share tips on using their product which always helps.
I wish all companies cared about their Customers like the folks at Zenlash (Zenith). The tube and applicator are a nice size. I love how thin the applicator brush is too! It goes on very smoothly and it's odorless. Again, I have not experienced any ongoing irritation. I did experience some mild stinging the first time I used it, but not since. I apply it nightly on each eyelid and get as close to the lash line as possible! The packaging is nice and the tube of Zenlash is very generous!
It's the applicator brush that really helps apply the product in exactly the right place.
I don't need any help with my eyebrows, but it's great to know that if I did, I could use it there also!
I'm very pleased so far! I'm amazed with the company's knowledge, the dedication to their Customers and the ease to communicate with them!!
It's obvious they put their Customers 1st, and really try to ensure maximum results! I appreciate that so much!!
I will write another update after some more time has gone by. I did so much research on what I should look for in an eyelash growth serum, and although everyone seems to have their own "proprietary blend" etc., Zenlash has been so open about their product's ingredients and I sincerely appreciate it! I will continue to update with reviews, and I'm so excited and I look forward to experiencing the great results so many of you have had!! Thanks so much!

Did not like these at all. They dont blend well, bands are thick and I dont like whatever they made these with. Seems like cheap plastic. They work for dramatic pictures for modeling but everyday these are a no go.
The bands are a bit thick, but they are good starter lashes the glam side.
Loved these lashes. They are super comfortable and great for everyday wear. The band is perfect and not super thick at all.

This primer is nothing short of amazing. The mist that a nozzle gives is a huge deal when it comes to coverage. Some times if the mist is too much its just too messy. But the mist on this one is so fine I barely felt anything on my face when I was applying it and had to be sure that I was even getting product on my faec and opened my eyes to check. I did use more than the recommended amount, which I found to be a bit on the low side since the size of the mist is so small the amount of product that you get out on a single spray is minimum. After I applied, I watched in the mirror as it dried, and the effects were amazing. My shine do go away and I could literally see my pore getting smaller. I could see myself using this alone on a hot summer day without makeup because the finish it gave was just that great. My makeup also went on very easy and smooth and felt as if it was gliding across my face and not going into every wrinkle and groove. I didn't wear my makeup anything close to 16 hours but I did make it through a 8 hour workday flawless. Defiantly a staple now in my makeup bag.
Tried to use as much and as many as i could to judge the effects. I didn't really notice anything different. Had a small tingling sensation when applied and left slim residue.
You get what you pay for.

This wig is a great value for the price. The hair is very soft and doesnt tangle. Minimum shedding, nothing major or beyond average. The density is on the low side so it gives a natural appearance. If you like big, diva hair you might now like the 130% density.

Makes one wonder when they definitely tell you "Unplug the shaver and do not allow it to charge for greater than 1 hour". Sounds like the old lithium ion safety problem strikes again. Pretty terrible outcome for forgetting to unplug the shaver- one morning.  I guess I can go get a $20 timer and plug it into that to make sure. But for a top-dollar device, one would expect the engineers to design in the required charge termination cycle ?

This is just an expensive bottle of clear polish. It does not strengthen my nails. They still bend. A better choice for me is the Dollar Store polish. It cost less and does the same thing.

Nail Envy is a product that will strengthen the nails. It strengthens the actual nails. It's not a quick fix. It is applied in polish form. After a few weeks, the nails get stronger, harder, and the damaged is repaired The nails will grow long and strong, if used as directed. . Nail Envy Strengthener is specifically for weak, red, peeling nails that have been damaged by wearing acrylic nails, gel polish, wear and tear, etc....It is their Original Formula and it's about 20 bucks. They have 2 colors....clear and blush. I recommend the clear only. The blush will streak when applied.

I was going cheap....hoping this would work as well. Nail Envy is more expensive, but that is what I'm going to buy. I know it works.

I purchased an sleep mask just like this in a store and, when it went missing, searched for it high and low until I found it here on Amazon. The mask blocks light well with little or no light leaking in around your nose and none around the eyes. The contoured eye coverings place no pressure on your eyelids. I never felt comfortable sleeping in a traditional sleep mask until I used this style. I can even open my eyes in my mask and my lashes don't even brush it.

The comfort in wearing meant I quickly adjusted to its use and now can't hardly sleep without it. As someone who has had trouble sleeping and finds napping almost impossible, having the routine of perfect dark when I sleep at night has allowed me to build a trigger. Now, when I need to sleep early, want to catch a nap, find myself in a plane, or other times I might ordinarily find it hard to sleep, I can place my mask on and it signals sleep perfectly. It's improved my sleep length and frequency, as well as reduced the time it takes me to fall asleep, which I think anyone could appreciate.

My only gripe is that, while I thought this one was exactly like my previous mask, there's a little difference. There's a little plastic piece on the side of the elastic that joins loops for the adjustment system and they sit very near my ears. I can sometimes feel it digging in and I never remember feeling that on my previous mask. For occasional use, you may not notice it, but using them nightly, the little part can bother me sometimes. My solution plan involves breaking the part and replacing it with something soft or hand-sewing that connection point. Customization is a very small price to pay for the amazingly comfortable contoured foam that makes up the main body of the mask.

This stuff is pretty amazing! I've just recently discovered Seche Vite topcoat, which is a flipping MIRACLE product - but once the top of my polish became basically bullet-proof it became very clear that my only obstacle to a really long-lasting manicure was getting the damn stuff to actually stick to my natural nails. I asked the googlemachine for suggestions, and taDAH! this popped up.

Although I typically wear pale sheer pink on my hands so that wear and chips are less obvious, I put this to the test with a cute new hot pink polish... and I kept it on for 10 days! That is unheard of for my nails. Truly mind-blowing.

Good stuff! A very inexpensive and easy way to extend the wear of your nail polish.

Grapefruit scrub for the body and face. This scrub has ingredients that helps clean your pours and remove toxins. It can help brighten up your skin and leave a nice healthy fresh glow. This scrub is rich in essential oils which have many benefits. The scrub can strengthen your skin and give you protection against more damage from the elements. The natural salts help exfoliate your skin. This grapefruit scrub arrived on time and was packaged well. It didn't have any wrapping around it but there was a top seal to it that you have to take off before use. It doesn't smell much like grapefruit to me. It's a little bit bland. I expected it to be very citrus-y and yummy smelling but it isn't. It's a very faint grapefruit scent. I used it and it feels okay on the skin. It exfoliates well. The scrub was very hard to remove and it left my skin very oily feeling. I had to wash the oil off of my skin. I tried it on some dry skin areas and it does help those areas. It exfoliates the dry skin and leaves a nice softness to those areas. That is what I will continue using this product for as the oil feeling is just too much on already healthy skin. Overall I found this body scrub to be too oily but works great on dry areas. It also doesn't have a strong scent.

I received this product for free or at a discount. The only requirement was that I give an honest review. There is no reward for a positive review and no punishment for a negative review. This was my honest opinion of the product. I only accept a free or discounted product if I or my family will use the item and want the item. I know that I rely on other reviews prior to purchasing an item and I hope that you found this review helpful.

I bought these clamps to replace some of my old ones that started breaking.  I had my old ones for 14-15 years but couldn't find the exact same kind for a good price.  These clips are not as good as my old ones but they do their job.  Simple and affordable.  They are also cute colors!

Overall, I liked this sheet mask but I would not buy it again because it was so heavily fragranced that I couldn’t bear it for more than 5 minutes. This mask is the first mask I’ve seen which contains kaolin clay. You leave the mask on like any other sheet mask, but after you take off the mask, you can see a thin layer of gray clay on your face. You have to rinse that off. After I rinsed off the mask and applied my usual Cerave cream moisturizing cream, I felt that my skin looked noticeably brighter.

These masks are expensive. They cost $6.00 each (a pack of 5 costs $30.00 on Amazon). Although the two-piece mask fit my face, did not slide off, and is the only sheet mask I know which incorporates kaolin, I found the floral, perfume fragrance overwhelming. A sheet mask should be enjoyable and not make you want to hold your breath.

Instead of buying this mask again, I want to try clay/kaolin/bentonite masks and continue to use masks with some of the same ingredients as this mask (e.g., niacinamide (brightens skin but can be irritating for some people), allantoin (soothing), centella asiatica extract (soothing), and dipotassium glycyrrhizate (potential brightening effect)).

ALTERNATIVE CLAY MASK: I highly recommend the ISNTREE Real Mugwort Clay Mask* ($23.60 for 3.38 fl oz). There is a strong earthy, herbal scent when you apply the mask, but it disappears quickly. I noticed decreased redness using this mask. It has been more effective than any sheet mask I have tried.

ALTERNATIVE SHEET MASKS: To brighten skin, try Keana Nadeshiko Rice Mask 10 Pieces Japan** (10 sheets for $9.50). The fragrance free masks contain glycerin (moisturizing), rice ferment filtrate (sake) and rice bran for a skin brightening effect.

* https://www.amazon.com/Blackheads-Whiteheads-Moisturizing-Sensitive-Extracts/dp/B07KQYWBP7/ref=sr_1_7?crid=3BHFM1SJVHDQD&keywords=innisfree+clay+mask&qid=1656954243&sprefix=innisfree+clay+mask%2Caps%2C43&sr=8-7

** https://www.amazon.com/Keana-Nadeshiko-Rice-Pieces-Japan/dp/B018FM03CO/ref=psdc_11061121_t1_B00IFROMCM

Thank you very much for reading my review. I try to write helpful and useful reviews that provide a solution instead of more problems, questions, and uncertainty. If you found this review to be helpful, please hit the Like button (as YouTubers like to say). Your feedback helps me know whether my reviews are useful.

I replaced my Norelco Spectra with this Smart-Touch 9190 XL and it works as advertised. I liked the Spectra, but compared to it the XL simply outclasses the old one.

The XL takes less time, shaves closer and is quieter. It also has a much bigger chamber to hold the cut hair. And the trimmer works well. According to the manual, it takes up to 3 weeks to conform to your skin and you may get some irritation until it gets broken in. I set it to sensitive and have had very little skin irritation from day one.

It has some nice features including a screen that tells you how many minutes you have used and how many you have left. Or, you can change the display to a battery indicator. It also tells you when to rinse, charge the razor and change the blades. Another nice feature is the travel lock. You hold the power button for 3 seconds and it locks which prevents it from accidentally turning on. The charging base has a little clock, but I do not see the point in that.

My old razor had the digital information screen so that is what I wanted in a new razor. However, if you do not need or want that feature then I would suggest getting the cheaper model. I think all the other features are the same on both, plus you would save a lot of money. Personally, I like the 9190XL but the choice is up to you.

Pros:

Faster shave.

Closer shave.

Information screen.

Easily rinses clean.

Holds charge for a long time.

Quiet operation.

Cons:

Pricey.
Find another product. It has no real power. (I used fresh batteries) so not happy with this.

I adore this wig, she has wonderful height and lots of attitude! That being said she does take a few minutes to style before your first wear. The bangs can be a little "anime-y" if you don't part them a little different than how they come. The wig's volume is achieved by an elongated cone in the cap, so she can be pushed down and styled as desired. In the pic I stacked her on top of a regular party city straight blonde wig with no bangs. She's hardy too! I wore her for about 5hours each night for a week and she was just as glamorous and curled as the first night. A great wig at a fair price

I had high hopes for this as a replacement or backup for a previous one from the same supplier but it's hugely different in terms of quality. I'll still keep it but it won't be for all day wear, just a run to the store kind of thing. Too big a bump at the back.There is a major static issue with this wig that I did not get with the other one I ordered form the same company.  It does state you should be able to style it and I did try but I dont want to melt it. I have several wigs, and feel like I understand their care but its not working on this one. I’d recommend skipping this one.

The haircolor does not work, even using with a bleaching treatment first. I bought the Splat brand of bleach and used it. I also bought the hair color. Inside each box, is a bleach treatment.  I feel like I got conned into buying double what I needed. The bottles of hair color in the color box, are premixed so you just open and apply. It goes on terribly. It's thick and hard to spread out. Even using two expensive boxes, I didn't have enough to cover the entire head adequately. I applied, and left on the max time suggested. Rinsed, and the top of my bleached head did not take the color at all. I'm left with my long hair in back, one shade - and the top and sides of my hair, bleached white.  Awful awful. DO NOT BUY.

This isn't really a gel, it's extremely liquidy and difficult to use. The color doesn't really show up because of how thin it is. I threw it out after trying it a few times. The applicator is also awful, far too large and ended up smudging the product all over the area when a smaller applicator would be more appropriate.

Got this because I have HORRIBLE allergies - and by horrible I mean that my allergy doctor had to create a higher dilution for me to start at because I reacted to almost everything they tested with an 11 or 13. HORRIBLE. So, most years I can't even go outdoors during the spring without having severe allergic reactions. I'm talking within minutes of stepping out the door having my eyes swell and itch, ears, nose and throat itch, coughing, sneezing (non-stop), etc. Every year I would end up spending the whole spring sick and on antibiotics & steroids. So, last year I bought this mask. I wore it every time I went outside and...guess what...no sneezing, no itchy ears, nose and throat and, best of all, NO ANTIBIOTICS/STEROIDS.

I really wanted to like this purple mascara. It is more of a grey purple, not a deep purple. As a result of that it does not really show up on your lashes and it even dullens the lashes and does not make your eyes pop, the way that mascara is really designed to do. Because I am the type of person that likes the try the unusual mascara colours, I went ahead and bought it despite the other reviewers warnings. So, I add my warning to the rest and would not recommend the purple.

I bought this Dr.'s remedy nail polish a few months ago when I was diagnosed with a nail fungus. I have been aggressively treating the fungus, but still wanted to have pretty toenails. My podiatrist recommended this brand specifically.

I did not expect to like the product. However, I love the color (I bought the red) and even more surprising I LOVE the consistency and the wear factor of the product. The polish goes on smooth, but not too thick. I usually do a base coat and one top coat, and I find that the polish is pretty tough-- I do not have to repolish for a week or so, which is what I found with only the high end polishes.

I highly recommend this product.
Not sure it did anything
I love!! Worth it

I really like this palette, but feel it should be noted that it is NOT as expected. Very nice colors, but more subdued than bold, more satin/shimmer than metallic. This is my first Ulta palette and I am happy with the quality. I only deducted one star because the colors are somewhat other than expected. I paid $12.

I specifically bought it for the green color, and I still like the green color, but it's not as bright or as metallic as the collection name caused me to expect. The finish is something of a shimmering satin, not metallic. The colors are somewhat subdued. The package says "jewel tones" which may be more accurate than the "metals" description, but still (to me) implies more brightly colored shades, with fewer earth tones. I would also expect a "jewel toned" palette to include a strong purple, and this only has the lilac (Dynasty). (The Royal looks purple but swatched brown with a hint of burgundy.) The colors are more woodsy than jeweled. The green is more mossy than emerald, the purple more floral than jeweled, the blue more night sky than sapphire.

The quality of the shadows is good. Neither buttery nor powdery, it's a slightly dry formula that nevertheless doesn't kick up a lot of product or cause a lot of fall out. I wear them over a primer, but I have been happy with their wear time. As stated above, pigmentation is good in that you don't have to build heavily, but it's also not a bright coloring.

A lovely bonus is that I actually love the brush that comes with this item! How often do you say that about a brush in a palette? It's not only soft and usable, it's unique among my brush collection. It's flufflier and less flat that most brushes of it's size, and it's also smaller and more pinpointed that most brushes that have a bit of fluffiness to them. Overall, I feel like it gives good control while still blending well. It's quickly become a favorite brush.

There may have been a naming crisis when creating this palette, lol. As the palette name is Metals, the subtitle is Jewels, and every individual shade is named with a royalty/gentry theme. The shares are: Noble (white), Lady (pale pink), Reign (earthy pink), Crown (gold), Dynasty (lilac), Royal (brown), Honor (platinum), Jester (silver), Armor (bronze), Fortress (green), Duchess (navy), and Duke (off black). No mattes, all satin/shimmer. All smooth, no fall out, some apply more evenly than others (drier formula). Swatched dry on dry skin in photo. Will build to brighter, more shiny finish.

I ordered this palette on a whim, and I've enjoyed it. However, if you are wanted super metallic finishes or bright colors, you should manage your expectations.
Found it cheaper

I had ordered this mirror because I figured it would help me pluck my eyebrows and they had a bunch of LEDs on it it looked like it would be extremely bright. So upon arriving a few days ago is pretty anxious to open it up and try it out and check for myself upon opening it it did feel really cheap it felt like if you meant it too hard you will snap its really made of all plastic. Also another thing I really didn't care for was that the light some cells were not even really that great I got brighter lights in my bathroom to help pluck my eyebrows the only thing this helps with his getting that close to mirror without having it looking at my face into the mirror in the bathroom. But the mirror itself is actually really good I just wish the lights would have been a lot brighter also I like how you were able to dim the lights that was kind of a cool feature but I kind of wish you would have came with a cord instead of just run off regular batteries because nobody wants to change batteries in the middle of doing their eyebrows because the lights went out on their mirror and hopefully you end up having some. But overall I really felt this led mirror to be just ok I didn't think it was all as good as I expected it to be I was hoping it was going to be a lot better than what it actually was but overall really was a decent mirror it's just cheaply made.

If you have any questions about this led vanity mirror feel free to ask me.

Also if you felt my review to be helpful please check this was helpful... Thanks!

I should have known better. The first order I received was expired, so I did not even bother to take the cellophane off to try it and look at the product.

Reached out to Amazon, and they were amazon (as always) and got a replacement out to me that I think actually came faster than the original order.

I eagerly tried it. I mean all those videos showed the same thing, they spread the green stuff on a persons face had to be real, right?????

Wrong!!! They show someone with a face full of blackheads getting this product smeared all over their face then when it is gently wiped it off and the cloth is turned over to reveal the results it shows hundreds of black heads that were miraculously wiped off.

Well, there were no instructions in English so I winged it. I spread it over my face expectantly knowing my face would look amazing as soon as I wiped it off again. It smelled nice, I will say that. I let it dry as it seemed to be a clay mask and then wet a cloth to remove it.

Would you believe not a single black head appeared on my cloth? Not ONE!

But here is the best part, in a couple days, not only did I still have the few black heads that were still smugly laughing at me from their cozy nests in my pores, but all of their friends and relations showed up for a party on my face. I have not had a break out like this in years.

Just like the good old days, only there are no lockers that I have to worry about being shoved into by the popular kids.

Without instructions or an indication of ingredients, I am frightened to use this product on my face... does it burn? How long should I leave it on for? Is it just soap and water to wash it off. I am not doubting the efficacy of the product but it is not high quality if there are no instructions.

*** Update ***
I have used this product twice so far & I am not noticing anything. That said, I don't have acne or other major skin issues. I bought this product to see if it would help with mild greasy pores, which I assume is quite normal. No noticeable change.

For me It did irritate the skin where the skin is most sensitive or thin. Specifically, I felt burning & had small patches of redness in and around my nose. If you buy this product I recommend keeping it away from areas of thin skin like nose, eyelids, etc.

From a value for money perspective, this product is meh! Doesn't help beyond soap and water. My kids do get a kick out of the green face...so maybe it is a better entertainment product than a beauty product!

I bought both this eyeliner and the makeup spray and was very disappointed with both!  The eyeliner has a sharp point which you think would result in a clean line but the eyeliner does not flow cleanly on your lid. The makeup spray came out in globs and ruined my makeup and felt grimy on my skin.  The eyeliner was like using a dried out permanent marker on your lid.  Wasted my money on two different luminess items!  Will not buy anything else from them!

I'm allergic to aluminum so I have made my way through dozens of aluminum free deodorants and antiperspirants. Some I've liked and some I've hated but this German Nivea, glass bottle, is legit. Most all natural deodorants can't carry me through my day and into the gym but this one can. With past brands I've told my friends at the gym, "I'm using hippy deodorant today so if I smell like Pig Pen- that's why." Another bonus is that it's clear so I've never had an issue of it staining my clothes.

This will be my 3rd purchase so I'm curious to see what I get because the first two were not the same label. Both glass bottles but different scents. I could really care less because they both worked the same and smelled pleasant.

Just like I thought. I received my 3rd order today and they get a 4 of 5 just because I've never got the same labeling. Weird.

Pros:
- fine tipped brush makes it easy to apply
- a fine wing tip is easy to draw, once the product dries and hardens on the brush a bit
- waterproof, smudgeproof, an accidental rub won't ruin it. a hydrogen bomb probably won't remove it.

Cons:
- reminds me of strong liquid latex; sticks to itself and pulls off in pieces. it's difficult to remove without a lot of soap and makeup remover. it gets caught in my eyelashes and hurts like hell trying to pull it out. rubbing it off has been the most effective method of removal after using makeup remover, but then the hardened substance gets in my eyes.
- because it's similar to liquid latex, it makes me (possibly irrationally) believe my skin can't breathe well underneath it.
- dries hard (latexy) in the tube
- if it remotely gets on your eyelashes (which it will), you can forget about using mascara. (see photo)

Other notes:
- it is glossy. I prefer matte, but this is subjective. (see photo. this was taken ~4 hours after application. dried and settled by then.)
- the handle is a little farther from the drawing tip than I'd prefer for finer control
- it took all the king's horses and all the king's men to unscrew the tube for the first time

I'd purchase this product again, if I can't find a comparable non-latex-like product.

This is my favorite shampoo. After using it, my hair becomes soft and voluptuous. I've tried other H&S products, and some of it left my hair flat and greasy-looking, but this one is dramatically different. The scent is also my favorite in the H&S line.

I really wanted these to work for me. I’m so disappointed because I purchased the two pack so that I could give one to my mom for her birthday and keep one for myself (it was a much better deal to get the two pack instead of just the single). I used it once and I was not impressed at all. It’s very cute and the perfect shade of light pink. But functionality was not there. I put my china glaze nail polish in it and put it on my middle and ring fingers of my left hand and started to paint my toe nails. Nothing bad happened but it really wasn’t better than just setting the bottle on the table. So I’m giving it 3 stars for the cute factor, and the fact that it held the polish fine. I read that if your polish bottle doesn’t fit just lift one or more of the petals until it fits.
Every time I purchase something online, I always check the reviews. I count on others to help me choose the best option. My reviews are always my honest opinion and I try to include photos if possible.
If my review has helped you in any way, please click the "helpful" button below so that I know! If you have any questions feel free to ask! Thank you!

As another review said, these little bottles tend to pop open if you fly with them.  I bought this set  and it came  in a nice heavy clear  plastic zip-lock bag, and when I got to my destination, two bottles were open and only the surrounding bag kept my clothing from being ruined.  I love the smell of the products, and I use the larger sizes at home, but I'll never travel with this "travel set" again.

I wish I had checked the others reviews prior to buying it for my sister!
As for my sisters feedback
1. smelt great
2. no improvement at all
3. was sorry I wasted my money

EVERY SINGLE review 4 stars and up with the exception of 1 only have one written review! I know after being an amazon member for over a decade that 98% of the one time reviews that give products 4-5 stars are fake and written by the products maker or seller! Over the years that have gotten smarter and started buying their own products to show "verified purchase" but all their friends and such that post will not buy the product and just post the review! Check them yourselves. Click "see all my reviews" next to their name!

As for the 1 5 star review that is not a fake - the review outright says... "No idea if it works, but love the smell" so that really cannot attest to the product working as advertised!

Find something else people... this product is nothing but fake reviews and a nice smell.

Okay so I’ve always paid 45+ dollars for the Beverly Hills Anastasia dip brow and wasn’t quite satisfied but so far that was the best I could find .. until now! This eyebrow pen is so easy to use you just sketch on your eyebrows and it looks super natural ! The pen has three points so they sketch symmetrically !! Then it comes with amazing tweezers , and eyebrow blade AND stencils . I highly recommend this product !!

After years and tens of thrown out pillows, finally found this. This has been used by someone who takes hot baths every night. The usual vinyl suction cups On pillows normally start failing within weeks as vinyl hardens in heat and soon stop providing suction. This had been true no matter the cost of the pillow. The material on this pillow feels like silicone, such as that on kitchen ware. In fact, it is as temperature tolerant as a silicone potholder! The suction cups, which is  molded as part of the pillow (not just attached onto the pillow), truly provide incredible suction. Bath oil usually sticks onto other pillows’ woven fabrics and even under the suction cups. But being that here, the suction is so strong, the oils won’t sneak underneath the cups. Even the surface of this pillow does not allow oils and soap scum to stick onto it. (would have loved to see a larger version of this such as one size of a clawfoot tub back). This pillow allows one to open the back up (for cleaning?). It was inspected after 3 straight months of daily usage with oils, etc...not a single grain of scum and oil stuck inside. Hence, no fear of mold, etc. It is not s super cushiony pillow, but rather, a support pillow. And if staying put and cleanliness is high on your list, this is fantastic!

While it is a very comfortable cushion, the suction cups are simply sewn into the mesh material.  To my surprise, the bottom two started being ripped out within the first week, two others above them are barely attached after 2 weeks. It seems that the lower suction cups while strongly attached to the tub, can not withstand the pull of the cushion wanting to float up. Therefore, the cups started ripping out of the simply sewn in threads.  Unfortunately, I don’t see how they can improve this unless there are better ways to attach the suction cups onto the mesh fabric.

I've been using Bare Escentuals "Bare Minerals" mineral makeup since about 2002. I've tried other brands but till now I just didn't find anything I liked as much, let alone better. Lately though the BE makeup just hasn't been agreeing with my skin. I'm getting older and my skin is a bit more sensitive these days apparently. The one thing I never cared for with the BE makeup was their use of bismuth. Anything with bismuth it just makes my skin itch. I've been reading about the negatives of parabens too, and I decided I wanted to get away from that as much as I could.

BE doesn't have that but it does use bismuth, at least they did as of the last time I ordered a big kit. After perusing Amazon and reading ingredient lists I chose to try this kit. Mainly because of the fact that this makeup doesn't have any of that and reviews here already are mostly positive. Also because I liked the eye shadow colors in the trial kit. These are colors I'd use a lot so I didn't feel like I was wasting money on colors I'd never use just to get trials on everything else. The jars are about the size of a BE eyeshadow, a little smaller maybe. The brushes weren't bad but they are small. I put them in my purse kit. They're useful for that, but not for much else. But they're sturdy. They're not losing bristles and they seem fairly soft.

For the most part I like this makeup. It's about the same grind as the BE mineral makeup, feels a bit silkier to me actually. It smells about the same seems maybe a bit less noticeable, the smell. It blends as well, but doesn't feel quite as heavy. The finishing veil is good. I have combination skin and oil in my t-zone and it did a good job of keeping me matte all day. The foundation covers well and doesn't make my face itch at all. The bisque is okay but I don't think it's got quite the coverage of the BE bisque. I did have to use more of it to cover things the same way. I kind of wish this kit had come with sample jars of the colored concealers as I would have liked to have tried those combined with their bisque. I think it might have worked better with that combo. I'm admittedly at a point where a simple bisque concealer is probably not enough for me. I'm getting dark under eye areas and have some red I need to cover now and again.

Their "glow" mixed with the pink blush is my new blush. It's too much for me as a bronzer. I have very pale ivory skin and it just does not work for me all over. Just a little too much orange, a little too dark but it did work okay as blusher over the pink they send you. Combining both that gave me a blusher that worked well for me. The pink blush they give you is just way too light and frosted for me. It just doesn't show up at all. It was the one product in the kit I just did not care much for. I would definitely want a darker more mauve or cinnamon toned blush rather than this one. The pink on it's own is pretty useless. I had to combine the two or forget it. It didn't even look like I had any color on my cheeks.

The foundation colors are decent. Their Fair #1 is actually a near perfect match for me but I'd probably never use the Fair #2 unless it was combined with the Fair #1 maybe. My skin is never that dark, not even in Summer. But Fair #1 I must admit I like that one. It's hard for me to find a foundation that's fair enough that's not too yellow, but Fair #1 works well. Fair #2 is just a tad too dark and just a bit yellow for me.

Overall I'd have to say this kit was a positive experience except for a couple of colors being slightly off for me. I do plan on ordering a big kit but I'm also going to email them and ask if they might send a slightly darker blush and just the Fair #1 x2 instead since they're supposedly picking the cosmetics as they pack for you. Can't hurt to ask, and if they do then their "Fair" kit will work very well for me and I can see myself becoming a regular with this one. I did not expect this product to be as good as it is actually. It was a very pleasant surprise. I'm used to spending a lot more on the BE product. This is much less expensive and in some ways I think I actually like it better than BE so I probably won't be a BE customer much now that I've discovered this.

I have been using a cleansing oil as step one in a double cleanse routine for 20 years now. Back then there was only one company from Japan that made such a thing that was available in the US. So for years, that is what I used. I decided to try this product simply to try something new. It has the same consistency as my normal cleansing oil, but didn't seem to lather or clean as well. It also left my skin feeling oily despite how much a rinsed it away.  It has a fresh, citrus scent and the bottle size it a tad bit bigger than my normal. That being said, I liked this product but probably would not purchase to use again. The cost is higher and I can't get past the fact it doesn't clean off makeup that well.
Didn't help at all... dropped my phone on the floor and my screen was cracked in 2 different places , I had to file an insurance claim for $175

Having mixed feelings, I fought with writing this review being that I'm a beauty industry pro and I usually purchase wholesale from an overseas vendor. Just for clarification there is a Loose Wave and a Deep Loose Wave. I have woren borh.
So after unpacking , the loose wave bundles were beautiful until I took it out of the net.... the curl dropped.. What was even more disappointing was the tangling/manageability and how dead/dry the ends were. Testing, by lightly -medium spraying with water and letting dry,I was able to see how much wave /curl was left.... No curl and was puffy/bushy very little to no wave . Usually with loose wave you can wash and go. Not the case here. I also noticed that some bundles lighten faster than the others. During the lightening process there was a toxic chemical smell, yellow residue and I noticed the hair was REALLY hot to the touch and there was a sizzling sound that made me extremely alarmed .. I immediately rinsed in luke warm water. Was afraid to process again so that I could get the potential color want not knowing if the hair was going burn due to how hot the hair was during the first process. Good thing it's for myself and not a paying client so Im fine with the color that I have. There isn't any unusual shedding even after the lightening process BUT it's still early!
To sum things up... I do not recommend using this company. Trust and integrity means a great deal in the business word. As a consumer on Amazon did read the vendors return policy before placing my order AND ALL of the hair vendors have the same policy BUT what I can't understand is how was I supposed to know the hair wasn't as the vendors description and have the problems that occurred without disturbing the bundles? I would have to give a refund if this was for paying client!! The vendor return policy implies they hold no responsibility for misrepresentation in the description so if once you've disturbed the hair... that's it! Classic case of "Take your money and run OR "Next". SMH!!!

I recently purchased this Sonicare toothbrush as the previous Sonicare toothbrush I had for 4 years died on me.

I enjoy this Sonicare Toothbrush a lot better than the last one I owned for several reasons:

1) The shape of this toothbrush head is oval and tapered at each end for better cleaning of my teeth. Plus the bristles aren't flat, but tapered which seems to give a better clean. (Verses the rectangular shape of the previous toothbrush head on last Sonicare toothbrush).

2)The neck of this toothbrush is angled forward, which makes it easier to position the toothbrush for optimal cleaning.

3) I also wear braces and really feel that the shape of this toothbrush head cleans thoroughly between the brackets and wire. Even if I didn't wear braces, I feel this toothbrush gives a cleaning. So recommend this toothbrush for people who don't wear braces as well.

4) Strong brushing action of toothbrush head is great too for cleaning teeth.

5) No need to have a toothbrush charger! Instead all you need to do is replace two AA batteries (battery life approximately 6 weeks) and you are ready to go!

Besides, who really wants to wait several hours for their toothbrush to be fully charged once the toothbrush loses it power. Also no need to carry a charger with you when you travel.

6) Great price for $39.99!

I have tried it a few times and my manicure lasted about 3-4 days each time. That is better than without it which only lasts me about 2 days. I definitely don't get a week like a lot of people. I am not particularly hard on my nails; I use gloves when I wash dishes, so I don't know if I am doing something wrong. When I do my manicure I clean my bare nails with alcohol and then I use the basecoat, then polish, and then I normally use Sally Hansen Insta-Dri Top Coat. It could be the top coat for all I know, but I use different brands of polish like OPI, Color Club, and many others. I'll probably try a different top coat and see if that does anything different.

This is not authentic Carols Daughter Product at least the one I got wasn’t. As soon as I got it I noticed there wasn’t any security seal. The smell is just the worst thing you could ever imagine, like baby powder x cheap perfume, so bad my head is pounding hours later. I got this because I’ve used carols daughter before and always wanted to try this almond leave in. I’m 99.9% sure this bottle didn’t contain not one drop of almond anything.
I was able to get a full refund and plan on tossing this bottle into the abyss and going to the store to buy an actual bottle of carols daughter.
TSA approved! Very sturdy.
Good toothbrush but the batteries are not replaceable so you need to replace the whole unit when they won't hold a charge anymore

I had my doubts, but his product really cleaned my hair well. I've been using for over a week and I love it. It leaves my hair feeling soft and moisturized and does not dry it out. I blow dry my hair, and it was very manageable and not at all frizzy after using WEN. It felt like a heavy conditioner when I put it on, but it cleans so nicely!
I've added my Before picture and two After pictures. the Before pic is first thing in the morning and my hair was very dry from using a cheap shampoo for weeks. The after pictures are after the first washing and blow drying.

I LOVE Coconut oil and use it for lotion and hair all the time. The nice thing about this product is that it's liquid and has different options on how you want to store it. The normal lid (after taking out the little stopper) is nice, but the pump is what I was excited for. I can use this on my massage clients, my dry ankles, or my over damaged hair quicker. Just a few simple pumps and I have more than enough.

Coconut oil is amazing at hydrating your skin, my favorite use is for my inner thighs so they don't chaff. Coconut oil stays smooth and oily for a long while, so be prepared! Even if it stays oily, it doesn't feel heavy, I don't even notice it most of the time. That's why it's my favorite oil to use when I give massages. Not as many of my clients have coconut allergies and they tend to enjoy the smell of coconuts. Some say it makes them feel like they are on a tropical vacation. You don't have to wipe it off either, your body sucks up that moisture and it makes your skin super soft! My leg has these scabs that won't heal and dry patches from when I had to wear a leg brace and this has helped the healing process more than I could have expected.

You don't have to trim down the pump tubing which was a huge relief because I always screw it up somehow. If that ever goes bad for some reason, the nice thing is you could switch back to the other lid. Usually when I buy coconut oil, it's hard and has to melt a bit, so I was thrown off that this stays liquid. Makes it easier when I'm using in my hair.

I love all of the amazing things coconut oil can do for the body and I would really recommend giving this a try.

I've only used this for about two weeks. Three times a day and while I haven't noticed a considerable difference, I am sure that with more use my sight double chin will tighten up. It is easy to use and can be used pretty much at anytime when you're not having to talk. The lanyard it convenient and keeps it from falling on the groundc if it were to slip from your mouth. It's comfortable to use as well and up definitely have a sore jaw after. Good product.

[[VIDEOID:1c65ad8d67c6bfdb51c54052bafc62a]] My daughter's hair tangles extremely easy after washing and conditioning it. She has 2c-3a hair. I purchased this brush hoping it would alleviate the detangling process as she is tender headed. Sadly, the brush not only failed to detangle her hair, she yelled the entire time I used it. The brush is heavier to hold than most brushes and it seems the separate bristles do not grab the hair well enough to separate the hair strands as it's being pulled through.

After giving up, I used a wide tooth comb which did the job effectively. I was really hoping this brush would've lived up to its description, but it did not.

My husband bought this for me with a kit in Las Vegas a few years ago Today I actually use it for the first time in about three years it’s still good I put it on between my eyebrow and above my lip it took it away  ( lines/ wrinkles unbelievable I am amazed  This stuff really works I am glad I kept it! I actually have two of these. Also a 24 karat gold peel face mask and a.m. p.m. day/ night cream Worth every bit of money you pay for it!
