The NeoCell overnighter collagen comes with about 20 servings in a $34.95 bottle, or about $1.75 per serving or day. The blueberry pomegranate flavor is not really perceivable as such; the flavor is sweet and artificial.

Collagen is supposed to moisture the skin and make it more elastic. However, intake of collagen in food form until recently was thought to be ineffective. This product does actually seem to firm, hydrate and restore my wife's skin. It has gaba and melatonin, so my wife tries to not take it prior to 20 minutes before bed. After starting this product, she's been having to get up during the night to use the restroom, because this is to be taken with 8 ounces of water. She would prefer to have this product in pill form, and to not have it include melatonin, which can help one fall asleep sooner, but may disrupt one's sleep cycle. So this product did not work well for my wife.

For years, I have purchased random brands of elastic hair ties whenever I need more, and they have all performed similarly. I assumed that the Minihope Women's Hair Elastic Thick Ties would be just like the rest. Not so much. When I stretched one of them for the first time, they felt stiff and brittle, unlike all of the other elastic hair ties I have used. These stretch to about twice the original size when pulled, while my others stretch to about three times or more than the original size.

Stretching a new Minihope Hair Elastic Thick Tie just three times, it did not return to the original size. I’m guessing these won’t last long, even though they are more expensive than the ties I usually buy.

Biore Cleansing oil make-up removing clothes come in a plastic box of 44 and are made in Japan. At first, my wife thought that these are small and thin, but she found that one was sufficient to remove makeup and mascara, with mascara top coat (which can be challenging to remove with other wipes). My wife has tried several brands before, including top-rated wipes, and all of them except for this one irritates her skin slightly. These do not! Her skin is pretty tough, and she doesn't usually have reactions to cosmetics.

There is a label on the inner package with Japanese writing, that's not translated into English on the package. It says to make sure to use the plastic box to store the wipes to ensure quality and peel off the sticker completely; don't remove the wipes from the bag; make sure to close the lid after use. I'd suggest that the manufacturer add a translated version on the package. The package says to use the entire package within 45 days after opening, so if you don't wear make-up every day, you may not finish the package before they start to dry out.

My wife loves these! Highly recommended, especially for those who have sensitive skin!

At first, I was excited to get this micro-needling device, but then I started to look into micro needling. Dermatologists said to take Vitamin C 2 for weeks before use, and avoid sunlight; avoid makeup; your skin may peel afterward. So, I was afraid to try it out. It turns out, that using this is not painful at all. But when used on my forehead, it looks like it has more pores. So, I decided to start taking vitamins, and planned out when to try this out, but I avoided trying it out before times when I planned to expose it to sunlight, along with one week before my (wife’s) period.

Finally, I had the right time to try it out, and it had no obvious side effects...no pain, no skin flushing, no damage, no problems with sunlight or wearing makeup. Because this is a device made for home use, it is much more mild than professional devices. You may be able to use this every other day.

The device is light weight, and rechargeable, but comes with batteries, so you don’t have to charge before use; this makes it easy to bring on travel. I wish I had tried it much earlier.

The head is supposed to be replaced every three months at a current cost of $35. You are supposed to use a new cleaning pad before every use, and it came with 5 pads; the replacement skin prep pads are $35 for 30 pads which will last you two months, using it two to three times a week, which is what the manufacturer recommends. The minimum monthly cost of supplies is about $38 per month. You also need to have isopropyl (rubbing) alcohol to use with the provided spray bottle to sanitize the micro-needling head.

I would recommend using sun screen after use, to protect your skin.

After the first few uses, I haven’t seen much effect, but my husband thinks my face’s skin looks better.

I purchased the 3 pack from this seller some time back. This powder is okay, but as many others have correctly observed, the scent does not "match" the wonderful scent of the soap. The three I received were also nearly expired, which given the price point was unreasonable. At this price point, each container should be very fresh.

Also, there is something in this that caused an allergic reaction in me. I applied liberally after I bathed one night and later went to bed. Lying in bed with my face touching or almost touching my arms/shoulders, I almost immediately began to feel a burning sensation. I leapt out of bed and looked into the mirror. My face was very red and had a burning sensation all over. I can wear this powder so long as I do not get it close to my face, so I do not wear it to bed anymore where my face can come into contact with my arms/shoulders whilst I sleep.

The scent is not bad, but it is a bit "perfumey," and it does not match the wonderful scent of the soap. In the final analysis, I would never repurchase this for myself or probably for anyone else.

B&BW had all of their body sprays on sale for $5 last Sunday, so I stopped in and picked up the new Magic in the Air (very nice), a back up of A Thousand Wishes (surprisingly very nice), and Golden Pear and Brown Sugar. This review is for the last.

Top Notes: Italian Bergamot, Decadent Pistachio Mousse, Sugared Almond Cookie.

Heart Notes: Caramelised Praline, Toasted Hazelnuts, Plum Blossum.

Base Notes: Silken Vanilla, Glazed Chocolate Wood, Whipped Musk.

As you can see by the listed notes, this is a sweet gourmand fragrance intended for the Autumn/Winter seasons. It is festive and has a bake shop vibe. In the top and heart notes I am able to detect the pistachio, almond cookie, and hazelnuts, but I do not detect either the bergamot or the plum blossom. As with most B&BW fragrances, this one dries down to the base notes within 15-20 minutes. In the base, I mainly detect vanilla and chocolate. I do not pick up on a musk note which is fine by me because musk is not one of my favourite notes.

All in all, this is a well blended, sweet, sugar cookie type of fragrance that is warm and comforting. If you like gourmand scents, especially those with a few or more of these notes, then I think you would like this fragrance. It is probably too sweet and cloying for warm weather, but on cold, windy, wet Autumn/Winter days this fragrance can be the perfect compliment to a cozy sweater in front of a warm fireplace. Smells good enough to eat! The one thing I do not understand is why they named it "Golden Pear" and Brown Sugar. The notes combined definitely give a brown sugar smell, but I do not detect any pear smell.

Recommended for those who like (or think they might like) sweet, gourmand fragrances.

I bought this to upgrade my lotion dispensing Norelco that's now 5 years old. The battery on it barely lasted one shave and it lived in its charging cradle except when drying.

Since I was so used to the old cradle and how it always was in it, I liked the little clock on this. But once I noticed it lasts < month the cradle is now a relic in my junk drawer! It seriously only needs about an hour to charge fully so there is not any need for the cradle. The tiny (not a huge brick that sticks in the wall) will fit inside the cradle or the razor.

When I first used my 9160XL I really irratated my skin, even being a long time Norelco user. But it went away in about a week. I still get red spots from irratation some times but heres my trick: wait until BEFORE you shower because soap strips all the oils off your face, making it hard to glide or try using a TINY amount of shaving cream, spread so thin you can barely notice it and then go over with a splash of water. If you use alot the Norelco could choke on all the extra cream and become less effective. I hardly notice any differences in irritation when using the <S N> dial (sensitive or normal skin)

The trimer is neat but I only use it to shave my unibrow when I am too lazy to actually pluck the hairs out. The trimer + the head array pop up with a flick of a finger. I was used to pulling open the head like my old Norelco but this is spring loaded. Some how when I was store drying it (the recommend to leave it wide open to air dry out the insides) the head came off. I was frightend! But it is designed to snap on and off easily.

The plastic head cover is working like it should. I just prefer my old head cover more because it was easier to tell which side is going on the top. But it is getting easier the top nub is alot smaller the my old one. The travel case is awesome, fits it like a glove and zippers up. Be sure to leave the cover on for double protection.

Be sure to look for a brush to clean the heads before you throw away the box. The packaging is so complex it took me a while to extract all of it's contents.

More cons:
- I don't like how the heads are unprotected during air drying... I wish the cover would fit while its opened.
- Orange? Bold color for something thats mainly blue, silver and gray.
- Maybe my drain needs draino but when washing out the chamber and heads alot of my hair gets stuck to the side of my sink, requiring splashing until it all goes. But it's kinda cool filling my sink the top then start draining and look up close at all tiny hairs it cuts.

I am been using this for 4 months now.

edit, now it's been 5 years and the battery still holds a pretty decent charge. Still working really well too. Only replaced the blades once so I'd say I got my monies worth.

This product was EXACTLY what I had been searching for! It is very soft to the touch and versatile. It is great if you're looking for something that can be used for many styles such as a head wrap, turban, hijab, scarf, etc. I will definitely purchase more in different colors.
So what did you find that worked well????
It grabs only the surface of hair, when I need to reach the scalp

New ingredients 4/2017 = altered effect. Used to be 7 ingredients, all of which were recognizable to a consumer ('rose hips'). Now it includes at least 20, including 'glycerin' and 'phenylpropanol'. P-anisic acid, anyone? I experienced insomnia and an upset GI system after using. A once trustworthy company going for the cheap.and hopefully losing lots of us.

Retinol used to be the first ingredient...Now this:

AQUA, GLYCERIN, 1,3 PROPANDIOL, RETINOL, CAPRIC CAPRYLIC TRIGLYCERIDES, HAEMATOCOCCUS PLUVIALIS EXTRACT, SODIUM HYALURONATE, HAMAMELIS VIRGINIANA (WITCH HAZEL) EXTRACT, XANTHAN GUM, ROSA CANINA FRUIT EXTRACT, CAMELLIA SINENSIS LEAF EXTRACT, CHAMOMILLA RECUTITA (MATRICARIA) EXTRACT, POLYSORBATE 20, P ANISIC ACID, PHENYLPROPANOL, PROPANEDIOL, CAPRYLYL GLYCOL , TOCOPHEROL, CITRIC ACID, BIXA ORELLANA SEED EXTRACT. I

I go through these like water!  Same formula, different bottles, for use on skin or surfaces.  I use it on counters, phones, keyboards, jewelry, leather chair, and am about to use it on wood floors (although I will wipe after a minute so area doesn't remain wet).  and many other things.  It does not sting as would alcohol based  products if you have cuts on your hands, and from what I have researched, it will actually help heal them!  A family member used it on her little daughter's eczema, and it cleared it up!  Use it on shopping cart handles and even on restaurant utensils especially during flu season.  No wiping necessary is a great convenience, also, so long as the surface will not be harmed when remaining wet for a length of time.  Constructive Criticism:  The bottles could be improved. Sometimes they are hard to open and close.  The plastic edge is sharp and you need to be careful when struggling with this as it can hurt your hand (especially if wet).  The stream setting on the bottle is useless to me and, in fact, is annoying since one has to remember which way to turn the nozzle for the regular spray or it will be necessary to turn often hard to turn on-off part back to off and then on again, turning it to the spray side.  The little bottles are overpriced, and it the company suggests not refilling from larger bottles, although they do seem to think it is OK if you are careful not to contaminate anything.  Would be nice if they did not discourage this as one is paying so much to be sure the product is effective.  It would also be great to have expiration dates printed on the label.  There are other products such as Lysol  that have jumped on the bandwagon that use the magic of hypochlorous, but I prefer Clean Smart because other companies do not state that their product can be safely used so diversely (perhaps due to the percent of active ingredient being higher in other products?).  Very important:  This product can be used around cats!  The company says, even if they lick it when wet, it will not harm them!  A helpful tip:  If you are spraying a surface where the product beads and you need to have the product contact the entire surface, what I do is use a paper towel to make sure the entire area is wet.  If necessary, spray twice.  If Simple Science is reading this, I hope they will consider the improvements I mentioned.

I'm 49 with decent skin aside from some minor redness/capillaries near my nose and a couple dark spots here and there.

I bought this for a quick 'more coverage than powder' solution for when I have last minute zoom calls for work.

While definitely good for the purpose I use it for, the coverage is moderate at best. Goes on well and stays on fairly well. Evens out most of my skin tone, aside from a couple dark spots. Definitely works better over a primer than just over moisturizer, which isn't a huge issue for me. And patting it on, as the instructions state versus swirling it on does result in a fuller coverage and nicer finish.

While in person it wasn't as blurred and flawless as a full makeup, it definitely was suitable for video calls or more casual days.

I didn't notice any transfer, but I did have to touchup my chin and nose after a few hours, which was very easy to do (no problem with old over fresh not blending well)

If feels very soft and light on my skin. Very comfortable. I almost forgot to take it off at the end of the day I first wore it, as it felt very natural.

For my purposes, this worked exactly as I hoped. I would definitely consider buying it again, although it is not a holy grail replacement for my liquid foundation.

So these are good in that they hold fine hair very well, but with that grip, as others have stated, comes the unenviable task of getting it out of the hair. You can roll it out, however that will wind any wayward hairs around it and result in a yank.

If anyone should use this, I would recommend it for someone with very fine, straight hair, not prone to any type of flyaways. Also, you'll want to make sure that you flatten down any frizz or flyaways before rolling it out over the pony. It can be done, but I'm not sure it's worth all the effort and toil.

I put it into my daughter's hair wet, with a silicone serum in it overnight. Even though her hair was sleek and still in the pony completely, the removal was problematic. I am sticking with the grippy Goody pony holders, although I am curious if they'll make design improvements, because there is potential. Her pony held well and it was super easy to put it in.

I've seen these steamer machines that are used to remove gel nail polish and while I've always wanted to try them, I was very skeptical and unwilling to spend the money on a gadget that may or may not work. But, removing the gel polish is the worst part or the thing I hate about gel polish: it's time consuming and so hard on the nail bed. I've seen mixed reviews online about gel polish steamers but I finally decided to try one.
This gel polish remover machine actually works. It was easy to put together and I was able to completely remove my gel polish in under 20 minutes. First and most important is to file the top layer of gel down first with a nail file before using this device. I was not able to get the gel polish offf without filing the surface first. I put about two capfuls of 100% acetone (you can use less) into the little tray and turned the machine on. Once it beeps, you can stick your fingers inside. It gets a little hot but it's not painful. After five minutes the machine will beep and I am able to scrape off most of the gel polish. I have to do a second round to get certain areas that just won't scrape off. And when I say scrape off, I mean easily scrape off not scraping and hurting the surface of the nail. I guess I should say push off the gel polish to remove it. I leave the remaining acetone in the tray and either reuse it or dump it. I would say this is easier than using aluminum foil or plastic nail caps because you do the whole hand at once. With foil or plastic caps, I never get my whole hand done at once. This was easier and I didn't use any cotton balls and I used less acetone.

The device is a little pricey. It's basically a warming plate fitted inside a contained area with holes to place your fingers. It's worth the money to me because I hate the process of gel removal. I like that the company provides four replacement plastic pieces for the nail holes. It took me a while to figure out what the replacement pieces were for but after reading one of the reviews I now realize what it's used for. There is also a second plastic tray to put the nail polish remover or acetone in. My only criticism is that I wish the device was smaller as I have a lot of nail stuff and this will just add to it all. It's not the fanciest looking device but it does the job.
COOL!

Be careful purchasing this product as there's a legal disclaimer posted for a reason!! If you've shopped around, you'll find there are some sellers asking a LOT more for this, up to $60 - those are the ones being sold in the original packaging, the hard plastic you pretty much need a chainsaw to get open. This version comes in a plastic ziploc bag with a cut-out version of the cardboard insert, and although the bottles look identical on the surface, the ingredients are not the same as the original!! The original was amazing, worked for bad breath after just one use - this version, not so much. It's missing sodium fluoride and propylene glycol, and those were apparently the magic ingredients, but I believe there's something about those ingredients that caused a problem for some pets, which is prob why they stopped selling it (and why other sellers are asking so much more $$$ for it).....unfortunately, it doesn't work without them. I wasn't paying attention, don't make the same mistake. You get what you pay for!!!

To all the negative reviewers, you need to understand what this product is made for!  It is NOT an everyday tooth cover colorant.  It is specifically for use on film, in photos or for costume wear.  It comes in other colors and you can mix them to get the color you need.  If I have an actor with a discolored tooth, this makes it go away and blend with the other teeth.  They also have black to make it appear you are missing a tooth.  It’s a shame people leave negative reviews because they didn’t know what they were buying.

We got these for $1 to review and they aren't even worth that!  They were too tight at first to use on eyebrows without my hand cramping... When I did get an eyebrow hair, it did not pull the hair out by the root, like my inexpensive pair from the drugstore..instead it breaks the hair at the base so you look like you still need your eyebrows plucked but now they are too short to grab!  How did they get so many stars then you wonder?  They sell them first on another website super cheap to get high reviews before they post here.... If you want them for eyebrows, good luck.  I will either toss them into the trash or put them in the toolbox to use for non eyebrow needs (like picking fleas off a cat, however not sure they will work well here either) so I can save my $5 eyebrow tweezers from damage!  Disappointed...

At first, I ignored the fact that this hooded dryer, dried hair by sucking air towards the area inside of the hood where your hair dries even though that is dangerous and most hair dryers  expell air, but that is the least dangerous part even though if you are sitting under it with loose hair or a plastic cap it can and will get sucked up into the fan. Whenever this hooded dryer is plugged into the wall your lights will flicker. The last straw was when the hooded dryer made a loud crackle and I almost got shocked. I jumped up so fast, thankfully I managed to be unscathed physically but right after, I packed it up and returned to sender! Zeny was not any help as they dont offer return shipping labels. My product was returned through Walmart.  This hooded dryer is not safe for anyone. Do not buy this product!

False advertising. There’s nothing NANO about these. The tips are HUGE. They’re 3 to 4 times the size of Bella Donna hair tips. I contacted the seller to ask about how to install and about the beads and was treated so badly I don’t think they should be allowed to sell on Amazon. I’m not kidding when I say I had to send 20 emails back n forth and I never got a straight answer. They said they know nothing about any beads. That’s a quote! I said, well then how do you install? I kept getting the run around. Finally I pointed out they had photos of beads actually on the listing and then they claimed they had a new employee that accidentally put those photos up. They finally admitted you need beads to install and said they would send me some but I never got them. They lied of course. The beads from Bella Donna are too small. All beads on Amazon are too small. I have no idea what to do with these. They strung me along for so long saying “the beads are in the mail”, I can’t return them. so I decided to make a YouTube video for you all! The good reviews must be fake on here. Because I can’t figure out how to install and they won’t help. I mean how do they stay in business? If I was happy I would return again and buy more. I work in the fashion business! I bought these for a photo shoot so I was looking for cheap. I don’t expect top of the line for the price I paid. But I expect polite helpful people who don’t insult me and I expect help telling me how to install them. That’s not asking too much!
Now let’s talk about the “hair”. I’m going to make a video review of this hair they claim is 100% real VIRGIN , but it says not to bleach it. It’s also so straight it looks and feels like doll hair. Why can’t you bleach it if it’s real virgin remy hair??! I have learned about how to test hair to prove on camera if it’s real hair. If you don’t care that it’s real hair then it is pretty. It is very soft and pretty color but it’s unnaturally stick straight and the tips are massively huge. Like a cigarette size. Thick n huge with wire loops on the end that you can not cut all of the way out. Why????
Why not include , with the hair , CLEAR instructions on how to install? This has NO INSTRUCTIONS AT ALL. No beads and you can not buy beads large enough to fit the ends. I think the reason they do not admit the beads is to avoid telling the size of the bead we need because then we would realize how big they are. If you want cigarettes in your hair then maybe you’ll be happy. It looks weird even in photos. Because I wanted these just for photos they didn’t have to be great. But these are a Total RIP OFF.

The original TVlink I did not have a optical input, so they added a crippled one to the Tvlink II. The issue is that virtually all modern TV sets output audio thru a optical connector and are set to Dolby Digital 5.1 by default. The Tvlink II will not respond to a optical signal with Dolby Digital. Why?? The Resound Reunite works fine with a Dolby Digital optical signal.

So, if your TV allows it, you can go into setup and muck around to change the audio decoding to PCM in order to make the TV link II work. Unfortunately, many Panasonic and LG TV sets will not allow you to change to force PCM output, so you need to buy a separate decoder. A high quality decoder is expensive, the cheap ones delay the signal.

So, my Tvlink II works with my Samsung TV once I changed the audio format, but not my Panasonic.

My hair is thin.. Not thinning but not thick. I found this very difficult to stay in my hair.. If you have thin hair this won't work for you.. The product is very nice but just won't work if your hair is thin.

I love this wig. It has lots of curls and the curls hold up very well. I couldn't wait to try it on but I won't be modeling it as it doesn't look quite as good on me as it does on the other girls. I didn't find the wig to be shiny at all. It comes with two wig caps and can be adjusted in the back of the wig for a more secure fit. Absolutely love this for the price you can't beat it. This is a good quality wig. I was shocked when it arrived. Very pleased with it. You know the old saying "You get what you pay for?" Well you get MORE than what you pay for with this wig. Very gorgeous

I wash my hands often, especially since Covid 19 appeared on the scene, and this dries out my skin and causes the fingertips to develop cracks that are as painful as paper cuts. I have tried every kind of hand cream I could find to remedy the situation, from those purporting to prevent such cracks to those advertised as ultra-dry skin salves to petroleum jelly. Nothing works. Then I decided to give Dr. Naylor's a try and bingo! I've used it for about 2 weeks, and everything has healed. Even my hand doctor--this is the absolute truth--noticed the difference! So I love Dr. Naylor's Udder Balm and am a convert for life.

However, the reason I didn't assign 5 stars to this product is that it's the messiest stuff I've ever used. It's like an ointment, but it comes in a can, and the can arrived leaking the stuff, even though the can was sealed. It's both sticky and gloppy. You need only a little bit to put on your hands (or feet) in order to get full coverage, so I imagine that the tin I bought will take years to use up. I have actually set it inside a small cardboard box to absorb the mess that exudes from the can. If you can accept this fact about the product, you will appreciate its benefits. If not, Bag Balm is less messy (but I can't stand the smell). The scent of Dr. Naylor's is, unlike Bag Balm, not heavily camphorated and not overly medicinal. The smell also evaporates as soon as the cream is absorbed.

i have always used this product since time began,,,,,have lighter hair naturally...but in winter went roots,underneath would go a lil darker, i did my own thing with this...put some in a flat dish,wet a small comb,the tips, in the product,then,run comb gently from root to end....underneathe,behind ears etc. just a whisper of it.....go to bed!!!!! whalah,in morning perfect sun worshipped NATURAL hair...Now, i have to order it online......it used to fizzz,goingdown sink....it would turn my fingertips white...u could feel it....NOW,it does NOT work the same...have to do this up to 3 times...no white on fingertips,,,it hasnt expired, dont know whats up!!!!cant speak for people who use it the way yor salonist would...

I have had one other brand that worked a bit better than these but they were a subscription. I am pleased with how these patches work. Especially helpful if you have a deep blemish that you can feel but not see yet. I place these on before going to bed and leave on all night. They adhere well and don’t end up stuck in my hair in the morning. I like that you get the visual on the patch that it was working.

I ordered this vintage retro elephant ring set for myself. I was really excited, and loved the look of the rings as pictured on the model. The rings arrived in a cute jewelry drawstring pouch. Each ring is just as it is pictured. The quality is good, and they look cool in person. I tried to put the rings on as pictured in the picture, but they were to small. I was so disappointed. I could not get the elephant ring to fit at all. I wish the ring set either came in a variety of sizes like sm/med/lg or that they could be adjusted by being open like toe rings. If you are planning to give these as a guft make sure that the recipient has thin fingers! They do fit my eight year old. I can fit a couple of them on the top part of my fingers, so I might try to wear them. I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest opinion.

I bought this set so I could try the products before buying. I was particularly interested in the serum. All the samples had product in them except for the serum which was all air in the tube. How am I supposed to know if I would like to purchase the serum? I feel robbed.

lace doesnt fully cover front. you can see The construction of hair when you put it up or pull it back in anyway. I guess you could make it work if you had some leave out in the front of your hair to cover up the parts that doesn’t have lace and where you can see the construction of the wig. but if you want to use bald cap method or have non of your own hair out like myself, this isnt the wig for you. also it doesn't have a high density of hair, which is actually ok for me because my head gets hot easily.

I want to be fair it does have a few really good qualities. I give credit where credit is due. The hair does feel nice and it is real human hair very silky very smooth. The body waves are nice and shedding is minimum to none. it does have a deep parting space where the lace actually is.

Though the packaging was nice and there were some eyelashes in there too and there’s a little bit of lace in the back that you could “put your hair up“ but again with how it’s constructed you would see everything if you do that. If the hair and the parting space were on a different wig with lace around the entire front I would actually recommend this wig and wear it. In the end because of the cons outweighed the pros for me I will be asking for a refund and returning.

I will start out by saying that I did not purchase my Wahl Smart Shaver from Amazon since I found it cheaper elsewhere.  With that being said, I'd like to comment based on my usage of this shaver thus far. First of all, I just recently used a Braun 9 series shaver. Unfortunately, this shaver does not have a cleaning/charging station but I'm not convinced that is a deal breaker. I am also puzzeld by some of the negative reviews here. I literally turned on both shavers, and in my honest opinion, the Wahl was slightly quieter. The Wahl does have some similarities to a Remington shaver. For example, the two inner blades resemble the Remington as does the sound of the shaver. The outter foil seems to be very unique to the Wahl brand. So in using the Wahl Smart Shaver, I found it to be very effective on 2+ days of beard growth as it went through the facial hair with ease. The shaver head is thinner which in my opinion allowed me to get closer than both Braun and Remington shavers. The hypoallergenic foils that have symmetrical and asymmetrical foil slots provided me with an exceptionally close and clean shave. Almost 12 hours after my initial shave, and I barely felt any stubble growth. To me that speaks volumes about this shaver. I was very skeptical about trying this shaver based on the prior reviews here and the fact that the Wahl shaver was cheaper than the leading brands (e.g., Braun, Panasonic, Remington, etc..). However, for now I'm glad I took a chance and decided to give the Wahl Smart Shaver a chance. Also, if you view other sites, this shaver ranks significantly higher than it does amongst Amazon shoppers. Not sure why this is but something doesn't make sense to me. So if you want a clean shave and also don't want to go into debt buying a shaver, I suggest giving this shaver a try. By the way I'm retired military and this would've been nice to use while I was active duty. Lastly, if you're still not convinced, please take into account that Wahl guarantees this shaver for five (5) years. Take a chance. You'll be glad you did!

Despite rinsing and wiping the exterior of this unit after each use, a pool of slime soon forms in the charging base. It's even worse inside the top of the handle, visible when the brushing element is unscrewed. If you want to avoid a disgusting mess, you really need to disassemble this unit every day for a thorough cleaning. That's a lot to ask for a tool that is supposed to make our lives easier. I used a previous Sonicare model for years without ever encountering this issue. My wife's toothbrush is identical to mine, and it has exactly the same problem, so there's pretty obviously a serious design flaw with this model.

A CHEAP FIX: The problem is that the gaskets in the brush head don't seal out liquids. One possible solution is a product called "Sonic Seal" [[ASIN:B001S2PLNK The Sonic Seal for E-Series Sonicare Replacement Heads (3 Pack of Blue, Pink, Frost)]] available on Amazon -- currently 3 for $16.95. Pretty expensive for what's essentially a toothbrush condom, so I tried making my own in three easy steps. (1) Take a latex glove and cut off one of the fingers. (2) Cut off a very tiny section at the end of the detached fingertip (the resulting small hole will stretch temporarily in the next step). (3) Slip the glove finger down over the brush head, leaving the tip end above the top gasket of the brush head, and pulling the rest of the latex down to where the brush head joins the handle. Voila, no more slime build-up. (Keep the glove on hand in case you have to make more protectors later on.)

Of all the wigs I have, this one is the softest. (I don't have any real human hair wigs) It is luxury and soft like mink. It is actually the color of a mink, too. Dark brown with a hint of red. The wave and bounce is nice. Thick, realistically long, and a full head of generous hair.  The fit is good with adjustable straps on the inside. The thing is tho...the thickness just looks a little fake at the top with a center part and no bangs or shorter pieces in the front. Yes, I believe I could trim it or pluck it or something but I am inexperienced at that and I never have done that to my wigs. I have washed them and gently brushed them and trimmed one piece out of the eye area, but this one would need more work than I know how to do in the front and center to make it look natural. It is a single uniform colour, which makes it look a little fake to me. I think this one looks great from the back and side and on the bed just lying there next to my other wigs, as I was trying my collection on today to compare. This one stood out as silky and luxury and rich and deep in colour because I mostly go blonde. But it just doesn't look real when on (me? Maybe it's just me?). I'm sorry. But I still like it. The length is fun and it feels so good and soft around my shoulders. It might be an "around the house fun wig" just for myself to feel happy to bake a pie or something, but I doubt I'd go to the store shopping with it.

This is by far the worst cosmetic product I’ve gotten since. Ever. The cap comes off and then this white brush is all you see. Then you turn and turn and click and click and pull
And pull and twist and twist and. All
You have still is a black plastic stick with a white brush at the tip. Sigh. Not buying ever again.
This product would probably be great for those trying for the beachy look.

As an owner of the previous model without the vacuum, I was looking forward to this new purchase. Bah. This item is heavier, noisier and more inconvenient than its predecessor. And for practically no gain! This shaver catches maybe 10% of the clipped hair with the rest of it flying all over the sink.

Stay away from this model.

Update: I've owned Norelco trimmers in the past, however based on my experience with this particular model, my next trimmer will NOT be a Norelco. The fan which drives the vaccuum rattles against the plastic housing, making a hideous noice while I'm trimming. The vaccuum action is terrible; hairs don't make it down into the receptacle, causing constant blockage. This in turn, scatters hair all over the place, worse than any conventional non-vac trimmer I've ever owned. (And no, my beard is not especially thick either.) I've finally had it with this model. I'm about to order a new trimmer on Amazon. No, it won't be a Norelco.

This Norelco (actually made by Philips) one was bought to replace an older shaver (I've used Norelco, Philips and Panasonics over the years.) This one is more efficient (faster, better shave) than my older one, and an amazingly amount quieter. What do you know- this time, "new and improved" really is accurate!
What I like: the shaver fits the hand well, the pivoting blade heads fit the face and as a result shave quite well. The battery strength indicator, consisting of bright LEDs showing the percentage of charge remaining in 20% increments, is very useful, and the flip-up hinged shaver head section is easy to clean with warm water (I still have to consciously force myself to do this!) They have also "shrunk" the half-egg shaped power transformer, and you can use 100 - 220 volts to plug / charge, a good thing for someone who travels globally as I do.
What I don't like: the pop-up trimmer is only fair - it works, but it's actually not as effective as the one on my old shaver! The deep well holding the head rotors shafts is not so easy to clean with a brush, particularly with the hinged head; they are still using a non-user replaceable NiCd battery; the gimmicky cutter head plate section with holes seems merely that - gimmicky, not useful for any real shaving.
Tips: After cleaning the head / blade assemblies, allow them to dry fully and spray-lubricate with something like "Shaver Saver." When power seems low, turn the shaver on and allow to discharge fully before reccharging - these are, after all, still NiCd batteries with the "memory" effect. These tips have allowed my previous electrics' battery - and cutter head assemblies - to last a long time (I have a heavy beard - even with a blade shaver, I have to shave again in the afternoon if I have a dinner appointment.)
Recommendation: This is a very good, easy to use, quick and quiet electric shaver - the best I have ever used. It packs easily for travel, and though it is a bit finnicky to clean, I like it because it does the job I need it to do. Given the several deficits, I'd never give it four stars if not for how it handles its ultimate function - shaving my beard.

This is the worst product I have ever lost money on.  I would give it a minus five stars if I could, it is so bad. The ends are very, very orange and orange permeates the background of the whole log look.  Cheapest material in the world, so flimsy. I liked that it was unscented and the serum absorbed into my skin quickly. You have to activate the vitamin by plunging the top of the cap in to release the powder. The cap has a dropper in it to help control the amount of serum comes out. The serum was quite runny and it would drip off my hand so I had to cup my hand to prevent it from going everywhere. The bottle is small and is best to used up within 2 weeks. I ended up getting 3 weeks out of this bottle. I used it day and night and noticed my sun spots slightly lighten up. It didn't irritate my skin which I liked. I applied this after toning and before my sunscreen. Good stuff but dislike how runny it was, it was like water. The lotion I didn't care for to much but I like the pouch it came in. You can use it after to store another toiletries, etc.

Love the convenience of this pen, just wish the gel would come out a better way. First off, it took FIVEver to expression the gel out. I think I clicked the bottom 50 times before a tiny bead of gel started to appear, I had to aggressively click and slam the pen onto the counter to get more product out. Once I was finally able to get enough product out, I dried my teeth (after flossing and brushing first) and wiped the silicone bristles onto my teeth from premolar to  premolar on my upper and lower teeth, I used the box it came in to fan and dry off my teeth. I did this before bed time so I wouldn’t have the urge to eat or drink after. The gel will become stringy once your inner lips and cheek touch the gel and there’s a mild taste to it.  So far I’ve used this pen nightly for 4 days and I’ve seen a tiny bit of results. You’re supposed to use it twice a day for 2 weeks. I haven’t experienced any sensitivity from the gel, partly because I’ll use sensodyne toothpaste to brush and the gel is formulated with potassium nitrate that helps prevent sensitivity. Other good ingredients include xylitol and natural antioxidants. Overall good product, just need a better way to get the product out without having to click it. Twisting would be a better option and maybe transparent packaging so you know how much product is left.

I like that this bar held its shape and that it’s easy to hold onto. The bar is about the size of a small mandarin orange. It lather ups my hair pretty well and has a slight rosemary scent to it. I’ll lather, rinse, repeat and go in with a silicone head massager. I’ll follow with my own conditioner. I’ll wash off the excess foam and place the bar back onto the paper it came in. I did notice that the shampoo did slight fade my purplish hair and made it look a bit brassy so I won’t use this too long often. Overall, good eco friendly solid shampoo, the price is similar to that of other solid shampoo brands. Be cautious with some colored hair though.

[[VIDEOID:f5186c2a8d0ee855988958b8d347349f]] The packaging is nice but I’m not a fan of the shape of the lipstick. When twisting to get my product the lipstick would retract back. It’s weird to apply it at the corners of the lips. Also, when I opened the cap, a bit of the lipstick corner smudged against the lid. It glides on easy, isn’t sticky and it’s very moisturizing the color is vibrant. It’s not an all-day lip product because this can easily come off when eating or drinking. For 13.99? Nah..not worth it. It’s cheaper and better long lasting lipsticks out there

The lotion is just okay, nothing too special about it. The consistency is definitely like lotion and more on the thinner side. I prefer a more creamy texture for hand creams. The scent is okay, more like a powder green tea type scent. Easy squeeze bottle and screw on cap. You get 4 nicely individually packaged lotions that would make a great gift or stocking stuffer. Wouldn't get this again.

It’s a great vitamin C ampoule but you need to use it within 3 mths. I keep it in the fridge to extend the life of this serum. It’s slightly thick like oil and has a very pale yellow hue to it. The scent of this stuff is faint and subtle but doesn’t smell bad. It’s kept in a dark glass bottle to prevent light when effecting the serum. It absorbs into the skin well and it has helped with my skin complexion. Great stuff!

This body wash isn't the best. You need at least 5-8 pumps for it to somewhat lather and coat the skin. I use a body glove with this wash by the way. The scent smells okay, however, it does smell like stuff you'd use to clean the bathroom or other household objects. Haven't had an allergic reactions to it. It doesn't really moisturize but doesn't strip the skin and dry it out. Great that it is vegan and plant-derived but there's nothing special about this body wash. I wouldn't recommend it.

These wipes are okay to use when your hands are feeling soiled. They're saturated and well stay pretty wet for a few minutes or so.  Unscented and doesn't leave my hands dry or sticky. The size of the wipe is a little smaller compared to other hand wipes. The wipes do have phenoxyethanol, which can contain trace amounts of 1, -dioxane (carcinogen) but apparently it's safe at low levels (FYI). It's stated on the box that they try to be zero waste, but honestly... not really. They come individually packaged in a plastic bag and in a box, which are both not biodegradable. It would've been better if the wipes came all together in one packet instead of individual packs. It would've reduced some waste. The wipes are expensive at $.90 each. Not worth it in my opinion.

Ok...
The best conditioner yet!
The shampoo cleans but doesn't lather..
I'd like to know if anyone else noticed this...on the 2nd shampoo maybe a tiny bit of lather.

Original comments
These are a 5" x 8 1/2" deliciously fragrant towelette.
There generously moist and stay damp between 10 to 20 minutes.

The packets open easily = 20 (2 1/2" x 3 1/2") packets in each bag.

The fragrance fades away in approx 15 minutes.

This is expensive for towelettes but this is higher quality without alcohol / chemical.

Perfect for well = everywhere.

This is a pliable / thin silicone bracelet that can lay between a regular mask / face.
> You don't need to have a mask with an opening, this has a hook on each side
to hook over the fold of the mask.

> While the hooks are nice for placement - I've not found any that stay in place
without them being taped in place.
> If you do have masks with opening - this bracelet fits inside with lots of extra room.

> If the ear elastics have a tiny bit of give / or are a bit loose, this can make them perfect.
It's not intrusive

> Can be cleaned and disinfected after use.
> Washable / reusable

3 1/2" wide - 3" tall - 1 1/2" deep

CONS
1. IF a mask already fits snug = this may make it too snug.
2. If adding inside a mask, may let that inside flap - flap against the face more than usual

The serum is rather like a Very thin gel with a lightly sweet, pleasant fragrance.
(reminds me of vanilla)
It's cloudy looking and doesn't feel oily / greasy, = soaks in very quickly,
actually during application.

> Instructions - apply on clean face morning / evening. (no mention of how much)
> Massage in and wait for it to settle.
Since it's adsorbed while applying it can seem the skin is begging for more serum,
even on already covered areas. Therefore I likely used more than may have been needed.
Gotta be aware to not go quickly through the bottle.

Skin looks more naturally alive, and feels soft and supple.
> However, this doesn't leave my skin feeling hydrated.

> SO - the purpose of this serum is of course to encourage / support the skins
Natural Moisturizing Factor = (NMF)
which in turn maintains the skins elasticity and supports synthesis of collagen which tightens the skin.
(> Which - the tightening effect is mostly how skin feels)
>>> Note that over moisturizing skin can actually weaken the skin barrier function
of self moisturizing.

This seem to be a good serum for problematic areas that more often get heavy wrinkles.
(forehead - nose - lips - eyes)

Comes in an attractive / quality / thick brown glass bottle - gold cap w/white dropper.
(total 3 1/2" tall - under 1 1/2" sq)
Expiration date on what I received = July 1, 2022 (stamped inside top flap of box)
5 stars

Well - Cold Pressed / Chemical free / Organic Aloe Vera sounded like a great product.
BUT after receiving it, and paying more attention to ingredients I'm sorry I requested it.

PROS

> And Citric Acid is OK ingredient for better absorption.

CONS
