> Phenoxyethanol is a BIGGY to AVOID = being it scores as one of the TOP 8 HARMFUL
chemicals to avoid in skin care.
It can have harmful effects on the brain and nervous system.
> Xantham gum - another less than healthy product often included to prevent ingredients
from separating. BUT can cause flue like systems and lung problems.

SDARA SKIN CARE could just as easily made a healthy product
BUT - with 3 of 5 points being negative
I feel this a 2 star product.

Bride to be writing this review. I was very shocked at the quality for a set that runs around 9 dollars . not plastic , good weight , just enough bling and very elegant ...I changed my mind and I am wearing this set with my wedding dress . BIG BANG FOR YOUR DOLLARS ON THIS SET .
DRIED THE CRAP OUTA MY HAIR ...WOULD NOT  EVEN GIVE IT ONE STAR

My sister has had her GiGiPro multi purpose wax warmer for years (she’s a professional, I’m a beginner) and I finally bought one! So happy with this purchase! The lo med hi controls are a total help! I start w/ hi to warm my wax, turn down to med to wax my Stache and chin, armpits and legs...turn to lo for my brows-decreases any melting wax going where I don’t want it to go...aka increases control of spreading wax. Love this wax warmer and definitely suggest this one for beginners and advanced users alike!!

Being wood and with a price of $35 I expected this to be a sturdy organizer, but I was VERY wrong. When I removed it from the box it was already broken! You can tell it has been banged or dropped judging by the scratch / dent on it. It's hard to show in pictures, but that whole side now moves and has cracks running down it. On top of the poor quality of this product, it's not at all what I expected. It's extremely lightweight and cheap wood, much more unfinished than it looks in the pictures, and the cups are smaller than expected - the largest one barely fits a normal sized hair dryer. Another note - be aware that the cups are varying sizes, not all the same size. If I could go back I would have just bought the metal one on eBay for half the price.

This stuff is amazing. I don't know what they put in my hair at the salon, but even with only washing my hair in cold, and not every day, it still was fading almost immediately. I mixed just a little of this half and half with conditioner and left it on the pink part of my hair for half an hour, and it boosted the color right up! At first I did that every other week, but right now it's been a good 2 and a half months (and I gave up on cold washes a month ago - I visited Peru where it is winter, and wanted the hot showers!), and while the ends have faded a bit, most of my hair is still vibrant hot pink. I think when I get my roots done I'll just have them bleach it and put this on myself, since it seems to work and stay far better than what they used.
Also, there's plenty in this bottle! I only have about a third of my hair pink, but it's long and thick, and I've still only used less than a quarter of a bottle after 3-4 uses. It doesn't need to be full strength to work, in my experience, so I expect this bottle will last a good long time.
As with all fun color dyes, this will stain everything! Be careful, wear gloves, put vaseline around your hairline, put a shower cap or something on while you're letting it set, or you'll have pink where you don't want it!

Edit - it's now been over 10 months since I last touched up the color, and 10 months since I gave up taking special care of it. That's nine months of HOT showers, and not doing anything special, just plain shampoo and conditioner as I would usually do. There were parts at the ends that were lighter bright pink with hints of peachiness, but the majority was still a very bright hot pink! Not as dark as freshly dyed, but still very bright and vibrant. I had a ton of roots obviously, but the color was still fantastic. Last night I bleached my roots and re-dyed, and now my hair is even more super vibrant bright pink. I'm very pleased. I've finally got to the bottom of the bottle, so I'm re-ordering. Atomic Pink is my color. (Also, highly recommend Manic Panic's Dye Away wipes. They do a great job getting the stray dye spots off your ears and arms, and help a bit with surfaces too.)

I am fully dedicated to how amazing this moisturizer is. I've been using it both morning and night with the serum from the same brand and the results speak for themselves.
Of course I'll always have one or two hormonal breakouts, but this has decreased my other acne, evened my skin tone, and really calmed down my overall redness.
I'm in my early 30s and just now getting more serious about anti aging skincare because I'm trying to avoid fillers for as long as I can.
This moisturizer is extremely rich and I only need to use a tiny fingertip size for my neck and face. It works great under makeup and doesn't feel greasy or heavy.
As far as the price tag goes, it's a lot...I personally don't think I could afford to purchase on a regular basis and really wish that it was more affordable because I feel like a lot of people would benefit from this cream.

This combined with the moisturizer has made my skin absolutely glow. I've been using just one pump for my whole face and neck both morning and night.
The scent in the serum is so light that it doesn't cause any irritation to my skin which is so rare.
The packaging is beautiful and looks gorgeous on my countertop. I do however have some trouble with the dispenser pump because it gets finicky and will only pump out product from one side. The component is made of plastic which is why I'm not giving it five stars. For the price you would expect glass or some sort of refill that was more eco friendly.
For those that have arthritis, the pump can be tricky to use because you have to press down fairly hard. Hopefully this is fixed in the future because it's a lovely product.

[[VIDEOID:9631aea0bf38c5a9cf1cb4863ad4559e]] I might be the only one who didn't like these. I just didn't notice much of a flavor at all and the texture was more like an oil which drove me nuts throughout the day. I kept worrying about it sliding around and moving my lip color underneath. I personally prefer a more sticky gloss. I did like how fine the glitter was so it didn't bother my lips or create any tingling effect. The scent was by far the best part and I loved the strawberry.

While I enjoy the versatility of this product, the logo was very intense and visible on the front of the warmer. It has a pretty blue light that surrounds the bottom when turned on and a great screen to let you know the temperature. I found it heated up very quickly and was an even heat that worked great for wax. I do wish the pot inside was coated or easier to clean between uses.
If you do use this warmer for its intended use it works really well to keep massage oil heated for lengthy periods and the knob makes it easy to adjust even if there is product on your hands.

This two part mask is great in theory. Each mask targets specific areas of the face for their specific needs. Immediately upon opening the package I noticed it was jam packed full of serum and used what was left on my arms and chest area. In a way it seemed a bit wasteful to include that much serum when a lot of people won't end up using it. I guess if you had some spare containers laying around you could pour it in them.
The forehead portion of the mask broke me out the next day after using it for some reason even though I stuck to my regular skin care routine right after and didn't use any additional products. I would still be willing to try other products from this brand though because I see so many celebrities using it.

I've been using this multiple times daily and it has a permanent home on my desk because of how much it helps relax my jaw and tmj. I'm absolutely in love with this roller because it doesn't squeak, doesn't tug at the skin, and because it's made of all metal it cools down quickly just by sitting out.
If you're looking to get an extra de puffing effect I highly recommend getting a glass of ice and putting the tool in there for a couple of seconds. When the temperatures got to the hundreds here I was reaching for this all day. I used it not only my face but my neck and shoulders and it was absolutely heavenly.
I personally love the extra long handle so I don't apply too much pressure when rolling away. I do use it "upside down" and pull rather than push which I'm not sure if you're supposed to do but it feels a lot better that way.
This tool should last a lifetime if cared for properly so the price doesn't bother me as an investment piece.

If you have smaller hands this will be difficult to maneuver. While I was using it to attempt to remove my fake tan in the shower it rolled all around and slid around making it difficult to actually target areas. I ended up getting frustrated and balling it up in my fist to use it like a loofah. Being so used to traditional green scrub cloths this hardly did anything. It didn't really remove dry skin or my tan for that matter.

The shampoo is super pigmented and worked pretty well. Maybe too well though, it stained my forehead and now my brunette hair with highlights just has a weird burgundy purple cast to it which looks awful and kind of ruined my hair color. The conditioner was really terrible though, it felt like just applying another shampoo. My ends were extremely dried out and frizzy after using and I had just had a haircut so they weren't unhealthy. I wouldn't purchase this as a set.

The before and after pictures do all the talking here. These days I'm constantly washing my hands and never really take care of my nails or hands anymore because why bother? This -stunning- kit was nice and heavy and felt extremely high quality. The bottles are actual glass (which means you can recycle them!) The roller on the oil is really well made too, it never got stuck like some cheaper ones do. I used this kit for about a week and the results were really amazing. My only complaint is the scent of the lotion is EXTREME. I mean I didn't think you could combine rose, frankincense, geranium, AND ylang ylang...but they did. It's really strong and hyper floral so if you're sensitive to scents I might skip out and just get the oil. The lotion does however apply really nicely and sinks in quickly.

Absolutely love this chunky pencil stick. It's a perfect dupe for Chili with maybe a bit more brown. While it's not ultra long lasting it applies smooth, and is easy to re apply. My only issue is the price. I understand this is an all natural kind of product and indie but 25 is a little steep for a pencil. You will need a special sharpener for this as well because it doesn't come with one on the other end. If it did I would justify the price.

I really wouldn't recommend this for a few reasons. I'm glad I used it on my hand first because if I used it in the shower or bath it would've ended horribly. The formula is essentially oil and sugar and the oil is extremely greasy and slippery. It took me three times of washing my hands to fully remove the oil. The scrub itself was really nice but even with that said the scent was so strong I developed a headache almost immediately. It's overpoweringly sweet and too much. I wish I could get past these issues because I would love to use it on my legs. I think it could make a nice foot scrub though if you're careful and wash down the bathtub after. Please be careful using this though.

I would absolutely use this in a heartbeat if it were my shade. It's the perfect neutral tone but too dark. It sheers out to a beautiful dewy finish. With the sunscreen included you save the extra steps. I love cushion foundations and this one feels really luxurious. You even get an extra refill included! There is a slight scent but it's more sunscreen than anything. I tried it on for a few hours and had no breakouts or irritation. Again, this would be my go-to cushion if they had a slightly wider shade range.

I really wanted to love these. Especially in my clothing shop I thought I could include them in my packages as a sample.

Until I opened one...
The packaging is eerily similar to an intimate product and looks really suspicious if you happen to pull one out of your bag in front of others.

The scent is a very powerful vanilla citrus that doesn’t seem to dry down much. My boyfriend complained that the scent was overwhelming and smelled like “old lady” perfumes and asked me not to wear it.

I also found the packaging to be wasteful, you can’t recycle any of it except for the box so if you do end up liking this sort of scent I would just buy the bottle instead.

Everything but the color is perfect. Admittedly I’m extremely pale, I can’t even find a MAC shade to match me; but this was SO yellow. The scent was fruity, almost reminded me of watermelon? And it applied beautifully with both hands and foundation brush. If there was some way to make this shade paler I would ditch my current foundation for this. It didn’t feel oily or cakey and felt like I was wearing a moisturizer.

While a lot of people have an issue investing in skincare I think it's one of the luxury things I like to splurge on. In my quest for switching to more natural skincare I came across this brand and wanted to try everything. This serum absolutely feels luxurious down to the packaging. The serum is lightweight and does NOT clog pores at all. It dries within a matter of seconds without leaving the skin feeling tacky. I notice an overall tightening due to the retinol in the product which lets me know it's working. However, the rose scent is painfully excessive. I have to hold my breath while applying because it will cause me a headache until it dries down, for that I had to take off a few stars. Overall the serum does seem to work well enough to replace my drugstore brand retinol.

This kit felt very cheap and dangerous. You really get what you pay for. The combs teeth were bent on both sets and very flimsy. The thinning sheers appear to have either been used or just made really poorly. They ripped my hair all the way down, and the scissors were not aligned at all so I couldn't use them. The blades on all the tools were very ragged and just felt cheap. I would not recommend this set to anyone with safety in mind.

I was hoping to find something to take off my makeup easily at night for those lazy nights where I can't be bothered. Normally I have a five step routine (I know it's excessive). I have very sensitive pale skin and tried to gently wipe off my foundation to start with and felt it just tugging really hard. The fabric itself is extremely soft, like a baby blanket. I thought maybe if I wet it and tried it would help, alas my skin broke out and I had to put it down.

The packaging is great, the seller seems like an excellent business person and really wants to take care of you as a customer. I feel bad taking off a few stars for that reason. These wipes might be good for someone with more hardy skin but I unfortunately can't use them.

I can see why some of the other reviews might disagree that these are not good quality but you have to consider that they're literally rubber bands. These elastics are absolutely adorable for both kids and adults alike. For the price you really can't beat how many you get AND the pouches they come in. Oh that poor bird, I love him! I tried to show in my second picture just how far you can stretch these until they may snap or lose shape. I think these elastics would be better suited for someone with fine hair or just smaller sections. They're certainly disposable which is something you should keep in mind. Please try to cut them before throwing them out too to be earth friendly.

Do not use heat on this hair! I took it out the box & washed (as I do with any hair purchased on Amazon or any other location). Something we all should do in the midst of a pandemic. I set it under the dryer on low heat for 10 minutes. I wanted it slightly damp for styling. The hair frayed & began to break off in chuncks. It cannot be human hair! Needless to say NOT HAPPY AT ALL! Waste of money!

I got this to help organize make up on top of our dressers and it does a fine job of that.

Quality: The organizer is made of plastic with rubber on top and the mirror comes apart from the set and then is used to clover the middle sections. The mirror is not on a hinge and only just slides into a slot when you want to use it, I would have liked for it to attach more securely or to be on a hinge instead.

How does it work? It allows you to push lipsticks and other cosmetics into rubber X shaped holes that hold the make up in place standing up. On the other side you can lay make up across divided rubber slots and in the middle there are bigger sections to hold a compact or other make up. It works well, the mirror comes off the organizer and slides into a slot to stand up and be used.

Overall, this is a compact and nice organizer for the top of any dresser or table. The only con is the mirror could have been built in a better way to attach it to the organizer more securely.

I got this to enhance washing my back and hard to reach places while taking a shower. Sometimes its hard to reach all of the area on your body or to give them a nice, sufficient scrub with a normal cloth or your hand or whatever you may use. This product will make it easier to reach those areas and clean them better.

Quality: This is made of a stretchy material that is of high quality. The bristles on one side are very well made, they do not break off or wear down easily. The product should last you a long time and is easy to wash off after using.

Does it work? Yes it works very well. This made it much easier to reach places on my back and to scrub them better than ever. It also can help you scrub rough areas like knees and lower legs when standing up in the shower. It works better than anything I have tried.

One side scrubs and cleans, the other feels more like a massage type feeling with the bumps on it. The sponge is also nice and worked well too. As you can see in photos/video the included hooks stay on my tile shower and hold the items in place when not in use.

No mirror effect. I've been wanting nail polish like this for a long time, loved the colors was excited until I applied it. Unfortunately it wasn't worth the money. Now it does stay on long, no chips and have been wearing it for over a week. I have to admit its very pretty. I applied 2 coats put clear and even tried to buff the polish before the clear and after.

These extensions are nice HOWEVER one package is not enough for a full head which is why I purchased 3. I have medium length hair, an inch or two past my shoulders. I bought these in 14inch (natural black) which is more of an espresso black. I should have purchased jet black. Normally, with high quality extensions like Bellami brand (for example, i do have these extensions as well which are close to 300$ at 200grams of hair, however they are VERY long which is why I found these because I needed a 14inch length) you can dye them darker if you NEED to. I would never trust dying these. They are soft, but don't feel durable and the strips are really thin. They do feel like real hair, and they are soft and shiny and look very very real, but using heat styling products on them and coloring them I would NOT do it. Also, I would recommend buying 4 packs if you have thick hair like I do. I'm going to keep them since I can use spare parts and lengths to go with my several other extension sets, but these just are hard to blend with your hair because they are just thin. I plan to use these to add length to my hair if I plan to put it up or something also.

Overall, they are good extension to have but I wouldn't rely on them to be your "go to full head" set. And DON'T order one package. Be sure to get 2 or more depending on the thickness of your hair. Make sure you also take extra care of them since the quality seems appropriate but they aren't top quality like some of my other sets. For the price you can't complain but I just have such a familiarity with extensions that I wasn't overly impressed with these.

They came quickly and were packaged nicely. The plastic case is reusable with a snap to store them. They were true to the picture and they come with the clips already sewn in. The wefts themselves could use more hair, maybe a second strip sewn to the clips.

I have previously used the Braun 7181 WD (orange colored) and was disappointed in it because I got a lot of ingrown hairs and the charge didn't last long. I wasn't expecting much from this epilator because I figured they are pretty much going to be the same, except this one has the exfoliating head.

Well, I was pleasantly surprised. The battery seems to last much, much longer on this one. I don't know how that's possible because I figured they were the same. I use the brush before epilating and the day after and my skin is even smoother than usual with no ingrown hairs. At first I was annoyed that this one doesn't come with the efficiancy cap for experienced users, but ended up finding that the included one works great. This one seems to work best with only water, but make sure you use the brush with soap before so the area is very clean. Overall I am pleased with this epilator and will continue to use it.

There are only a few small cons to the product. This only comes with one head and the exfoliating brush. For the price, they just include a few different heads. For some reason though, Braun has decided to make multiple epilators that seem to be the same, but each comes with a different head, rather than just making one product that comes with all the different choices. In my opinion they are just doing this to make more money.

The other cons were things that Braun has always done and doesn't seem to want to change. For the life of me I can't figure out why braun refuses to make a cap for their epilators. They even made a cap for the brush, but not the epilator. They also give you a drawstring bag, rather than one with a zipper.

If you think about it, combining a straightener and a hair brush makes perfect sense, but how long have so many of us been using a separate hair straightener followed by vigorous, frantic brushing with a hairbrush? In my case, almost 20 years! So this hair straightener/brush combo is brilliant and has cut down on my morning hair prep by at least 15-20 minutes! More importantly, this is a smart and effective straightener. You can program your desired heat settings, and it took less than 3 minutes for the brush to heat up. I really love the fact that the bristles stayed cool enough so that my hands didn't burn when they touched the heated brush. I also didn't notice the brush lose any heat as I put it down, worked on wet spots, or redid a difficult component (I was trying to do one of those chic, top-buns that require your hair to be extremely straight before it goes into the bun). I usually have to wait for other straighteners to reheat after each use or after I put it down, but that wasn't the case with this straightener.

I have medium density hair, so the brush straightened it immediately, but the bristles are deep enough that even the thickest hair could be straightned with little effort on your part. I also really appreciate how quickly the brush cooled down after I finished, so I can easily store it back in the fabric bag that came with the brush. I also love the hair clips they provided (the exact same as those used at my hair salon) so that I could hold up my top layers of hair while I straightened the hair at the bottom of my crown. Like everything else with this straightener, the combs were so well thought out that they fit into the bag with the straightener, so I could easily store the entire setup in a drawer, rather than cluttering my countertop. I wholeheartedly recommend this straightener as a first time addition to your hair care regimen or as a replacement for your old straightener and brush!
This is not human hair and I'm pissed!

[[VIDEOID:c90a143dced07dff7222aec252715475]] Im a hair stylist that own a hair salon...I have had my hands trough hair for over 20 years, and this is by far the worst hair I have ever purchased... I made 2 orders of the 360+Bundles. When I received the hair I opened the box and saw the plastic eye lash and the weaving cap, I was not impressed with that I wanted to see the product. I took one bundle of hair out the plastic bag and said OH HELL NAW... I ten begin to take all the hair and 360's out of the bag and said OH HELL NAW, AND WENT TO MY COMPUTER TO REQUEST A REFUND TO SHIP BACK...

See video, the hair on the yellow envelope is this hair review

Pro's: NONE

Con's:
There are way "TOOO MANY FLY A-WAYS" in each bundle. This is a big deal for me cause what if my client wanted to wear the hair flat ironed straight, it will look tacky with all the fly a-ways.

2. There are red, gold, light brown strands that over taking the bundles and closure. This is a problem if my clients wanted to be in sunlight you will see all the different color strands in the hair.

PLEASE TAKE NOTE: WHEN YOU BUY HAIR WITH SO MANY DIFFERENT COLOR STRANDS IN IT, THATS AN INDICATION THAT IT IS NOT REMY AND THE HAIR DID NOT COME FROM ONE PERSON HEAD, WHICH WILL CAUSE TANGLING, AND SHORT LIFE SPAN! BUT DONT BUY BUNDLES THAT IS BLACK BECAUSE THE COLORED THE HAIR TO COVER UP THE MANY DIFFERENT COLOR STRANDS...

9A AND 10A GRADE BUNDLES SHOULD BE COLOR 1B NATURAL WITH NO ORTHER COLOR STANDS!

I got these a month ago when I saw these featured on a YouTube hair video from a YouTuber I follow and generally, her advice on products is solid but these French pins?

The IDEA/CONCEPT is simple and tried and true. So no way to really mess it up, right? Well...

What I do like is the color and the paint or coding hasn't faded or chipped off. The slight curve allows for the in to rest against the curve of your head. The length is nice, and allows more versatility.

What I don't like is the material. For $10 at Target, I wasn't expecting something industrial but the material is very, very flimsy and not remotely sturdy. Not only that, maybe it's the coating on the pins, these things don't stay in for long, or at all sometimes. I have fine, long hair and these pins won't stay put if I don't use product. I usually use a leave-in conditioner so that helps to create texture and the pins seem to stay in longer. These might work better with coarse, thicker hair. It's too bad the material isn't sturdier--so don't think you can do anything while wearing them. The minute you start anything other than sitting and look pretty for however long you wear them, they will fall out without even trying. I had my hair half pined up with a barrette and then pulled the rest up in a twist and made sure the prongs were under the barrette so that it was more secure but it didn't even last half a day and I sit in a cubicle for 8 hours staring at a computer. Just getting up to get a cup of coffee or a printout from the copy machine or other basic tasks would easily loosen the pin.

These are merely okay if you're doing absolutely nothing but sticking a pencil to keep your bun in place work just as well. It's too bad since they are pretty but these are not that functional.

Bought this on a whim after reading lots of reviews about silver/gray/platinum semi permanent hair colors.  There are a few different varieties out there, but this one seemed to have the more positive reviews for this color.  I watched some youtube videos and gave it a go.  I used to buy box colors, so with this you need to buy your own gloves, a small brush to apply the dye and have a container to pour it into.  I am in my 50's and have let my hair go gray.  A previous coloring has faded out and left a slightly yellowish tint on part of my hair.  I applied this dye and didn't leave it on exceptionally long,  from start to finish maybe one hour 20 minutes.  The box says 40, but I read that some people left it on for hours.  Rinsing it off did not cause any staining in the shower as the color was not super dark.  I was pleasantly surprised with the mild color change when it dried.  My hair was shinier and the silver color changed the white to a nice shade of silver and the yellowish color was  95% gone.  Plus there was no awful smell.  I have had to wash it a couple of times already and I believe it is fading, but I am okay with that as I didn't expect it to last a long time.  I am now going to try the darker shade of platinum to see how that works out.  The photos I added of course don't truly show how it really looks, but it does make a color change.  I did make sure before I applied color that I had only washed my hair and did not condition or add any other products to it to prevent color absorption.

While the concept of the built in comb is a good one, this design just does not work well and don't count on the vacuum catching all your clippings because it can only hold about half the volume of a shot glass. I ended throwing mine away and switching back to my old Oster hair clippers with the snap on combs for my head and bought a small rechargeable Waring beard trimmer. The twist dial for the comb length on this unit can be wrong - I gouged my beard/sideburns once with this unit. The comb unit must be removed for frequent cleaning and putting it back on correctly takes a delicate touch. The large size of the unit and comb also makes it verr difficult to trim your moustache close to your nose. Don't waste your money.

This is a miracle in a bottle. You can literally use this for any part of your beauty routine! I had no idea this was supposed to be a men's product until another reviewer asked if women can use it. (For the record, it's an oil blend, it doesn't discriminate between genders. There's blue on the label not pink, get over it.) This lasts forever. You need SO LITTLE to do anything because it works so well. Which makes it definitely worth the price because it will last 6+ months.

List of things I use this for:

Split end remedy - After lightly conditioning (use less conditioner than normal) and getting out of the shower I use ONE pump and go from ends to about half way up my hair. It never leaves my hair oily and its really fights dry looking hair and split ends.

Chapstick - Don't lick it because I don't know if it's safe to eat, but if my lips get overly dry I put this on in the morning rather than chapstick, and then just leave it on. It will eventually absorb into your lips. Then apply chapstick regularly throughout the day. I would probably just use this all day but I prefer not to carry it around. It also leaves your lips shiny but NEVER sticky which is nice. I typically only use this remedy is my lips get SUPER dry but I'm sure you could use it on a normal day too!

Make up remover - It's oil, it removes make up. Put it on a tissue and rub it around the make up area. I guess you could leave it at that but I usually rinse really quick with soap and water. It's a really soft and soothing way to remove makeup without harsh chemicals and it keeps your skin soft even after removing the makeup.

These are awesome!! I got 16 bottles of clear wet-n-wild nail polish for $0.98. I added one color to each bottle of the color changing pigment. Shake it up really well and now I have 16 bottles of  color changing nail polish for super cheep!! They look just like the expensive polishes that are like $7 to $7 a bottle!! For sure will buy more pigment colors!!

I've very disappointed in this makeup. The glitter falls out of the pigment and flies everywhere all over my face. The actual pigmentation is nonexistent except for the "baby-blue" shade. The texture of the eye shadow is very dry and chalky.  Some of them are actually gritty feeling.

I decided to buy this to try to make my already curly hair more uniform in appearance. My hair is very long and it spirals to begin with. Silly me thought I could make it all the spirals look exactly the same.
I started out with perfectly washed and combed hair. Took me a few minutes to figure out that you can add extensions to the evil wand. I was trying to shove just the end portion through a cork screw curler, didn't work that great.
My one daughter, also with curly hair, was intrigued and asked what I was doing. I told her I was trying to be pretty!
First chunk of hair, ok, wow, that was painful! I tried not to let her see the tears in my eyes. 2nd chunk, ouch! 3rd chunk I was about ready to full blown cry! I told myself to be brave, there was no turning back. Chuck after chunk I literally felt my scalp screaming in agony! My daughter begged me to stop but I continued to recite, mommy will be so pretty!
I finished and noticed my face was bright red from holding my breath. I tried to relax and do homeschool with my kids but they kept cracking up laughing at me. The entire time I can feel throbbing in my scalp like a high-school band practice.
I couldn't take it anymore, they needed to come out. Wait, you pull them?? I slowly tried one by one and had to start holding onto my roots for fear I'd look like a middle aged bald man when my husband comes home from work. They were holding onto those curves for dear life! Yep, so kudos to you if you have hair of steal that can survive these curlers. I feel so jaded for thinking this was a clever concept.

DISAPPOINTED IN THE QUALITY!
I have another one that I have had for years .. accidentally packed it in my travel bag. Figured .. oh well I'll just leave it there since I travel a lot and just order another one for use at home. This looked similar so ordered it.

NOPE! not NEAR the quality! I would say perhaps 50% the density of the plastic handle! It absolutely will NOT hold up for the years I have had the other one .. AND the density of the brush! Skimpy!! There again .. about 50% the density of the one I have. Frankly .. I am going to dig my old one out of my travel things .. use that daily AGAIN because it will hold up for many more years .. this one I will put in my travel
AND hope it doesn't break in the travel process! Made in China??

UPDATE:
Just found the quality I was looking for at Sephora .. "SEPHORA COLLECTION Pro Brow Comb #21". Yes it is $15 instead of $9 .. BUT it will last for years like my old one. Just thought I would pass along the tip. I appreciate other Amazon Reviews helping me! The link is [...] .. but in case the link gets deleted .. I gave you the Exact description above!

This is the best it did after 35 minutes of brushing!
The temperature buttons are located on the side which is inconvenient to hold the brush. The top part of the brush is extremely hot, burn myself a couple of times, and my neck was painfully burn for a while.
The first picture is done with the Dasky, the second is done with my hair straightener in 15 minutes.
Product is from China which makes it impossible to return.
Eeww!

Norelco used to be German. The new Norelco is useful and adequate for touch-ups before that important meeting, but don't expect a really close shave. I get about 10 shaves per charge and this is a bear to clean.

Norelco seems to be counting its marks so it does not even include a small brush for cleaning the whiskers out of the rotary blades. If it had not been on sale for $49.99 with a $30 rebate (for 2), I would not have purchased 1 each for my son and me.

I'm a big fan of Lume products and this did not disappoint! The scent lasts all day and I didn't smell any body odor whatsoever after 24 hours. I bought the sandalwood and citrus scent which I really enjoy. Honestly I feel like it works way better than regular deodorant and is worth the price if you need a high quality deodorant.

I usually use Paul Mitchell, but wanted an alternative to give my hair a break, so I tried the Neutrogena Triple Moisture Shampoo. I love Neutrogena face cleanser and make-up, so I thought, what the heck. I was really disappointed with the results. After using this shampoo for two days, I noticed my hair's shine was gone and it looked really frizzy (even when using a flat iron). I went back to Paul Mitchell and within two days, my hair was back to it's normal shiny smoothness.

I think this shampoo is probably better than a lot of the cheaper store brands, but it just doesn't hold up to the quality of Paul Mitchell.

I'm 45 and my skin has changed dramatically over the past 5 years. I had to move from loose powder coverage to more of a "foundation" coverage to hid all the flaws. After trying several different products, I came across this product from Avon. So, it's a cream foundation that goes on very smooth. I only apply it in the morning and find that if I don't mess with my face too much, it stays all day. It covers very well. All the little sun damage spots, redness, etc are covered evenly and smoothly. It doesn't look like you have a foundation mask on, but I also apply it down along my jaw line and neck to make sure.

There are two cons to this product: 1) it tends to accentuate fine lines until it settles. I use a magnifying mirror and you can see the make-up in the creases. From farther away, it's not that bad. I also notice that as it settles into my skin, that seems to fade. 2) I have combination skin, and it feels oily on my skin after a few hours. It does not cause breakouts (actually, my skin is so much better since I started using this product), so I don't think it's doing anything, but just feels a little oily. It doesn't LOOK oily, it just feels oily and I can't wait to get home and wash my face. I'm not a foundation user, so this may be typical, I'm not sure.

Overall, I really like this product. The coverage is fantastic and far outweighs the minor "cons" I have listed above. Since I only apply it once a day, on work days usually, it lasts a long time. It comes with a round sponge and mirror compact. It is definitely Avon quality.

We had previously tried the GLO Science 10 Day Teeth Whitening Treatment - which is just the vials and the lubricant, but decided to try this higher tech approach and found that it does work quite a bit better than just the vials by themselves.

At first we were worried that it might be cumbersome, but the device is small like an mp3 player and hangs around your neck from a lanyard string. The mouthpiece is like having a sports mouthguard in and is barely noticeable after you've had it in for a minute or so.

Because you can wear it around your neck, it is therefore hands-free and you can go about other tasks while you're wearing it - which is helpful, because the treatments are four back-to-back 8-minute sessions; so it is 32 minutes altogether, every day for up to 10 days. If you're doing other things, you don't even notice that you have it on; the device glows when it is on and blinks when a session has ended.

We found the taste of the whitening gel to be pleasant, kind of sweet, minty. You don't have to try to not swallow while you're wearing this - it's perfectly fine to swallow some of the whitening gel - I did and there was no stomach upset or anything because of it.

The blue glow is kind of neat, like something from a sci-fi movie.

The whole thing - vials, device and mouthpiece, and instruction book come in a handy travel or storage case.

We really liked i! We're gonna order some extra vials so we can keep using the whitening device once the original supply of vials runs out.

We think it's worth someone trying out if they want whiter teeth with little or no hassle, because this Glo device is just super easy and really convenient to use. And it will brighten your smile!

I used this polish 2x, and the 2nd time I removed it, my toe nails were completely destroyed--white and peeling badly. When I tried to file the rough edges, my nails crumbled. I love the coverage of the Polish, the long wear time, and the many available colors, but I can't live with the damage to my nails. I strongly suggest you purchase one color and try other out before you buy a multi-pack.

I think these wipes are great, and they are super scrubby. They definitely are exfoliating. They have these little bumps on one side, and you can use the other side without the bumps, but it still is a bit scrubby on that side too. For me, I can't use them every night because I have sensitive skin and they are so exfoliating, but they are great to use a few times a week. I am a lover of cleansing wipes, I hate washing my face, so I am glad to have these for when I feel the need to exfoliate and get off those nasty dead skin cells. They work pretty well to take off makeup and other than the bumps the formula is gentle on you skin and doesn't cause breakouts. I kinda wish the cloth was a bit thicker or something so when I use the side without the bumps I don't still feel the bumps, that way I could use these more often, because I really like them. They don't have any harsh chemicals, or scents and are very soothing. I love that they have chamomile, cucumber and aloe, all ingredients I look for. They are refreshing and leave your skin super clean. Even my hubby likes them, and he is super picky when it comes to skin care products! I would certainly recommend these, and haven't found anything else like them.

I'm surprised at the good reviews. Maybe it's just me but the curler has little extended tips that actually hurt the skin when you try to get close to your lashes and it pinches.
I wanted this to work because I read you can heat this one with a blow dryer for longer lasting curls because its made of metal. But alas, I'm re-ordering the plastic Japonesque go curl. Even though they don't last long - I've gone through several - they allow you to get super close to your lash line without pinching and provide a nice curl.
FOLLOW UP: The company is really strange in their customer service response. The day after I posted my review they publicly posted a great reply on Amazon saying they would be happy to return my money. They then sent me a private email stating:

Rather than just leave such negative feedback simply contacting us and asking that we stop sending emails or even more simply just unsubscribing from Amazons email system would have solved this problem.

We are sorry that you feel that 3 simple emails warranted such negative feedback as you left but we do hope that you found our product satisfactory.

Have a nice New Year

Bella & Bear
.....................No I didnt find their product satisfactory as I said in my review. Very odd - think twice before purchasing from them. I wish I hadn't
What a pain over an eyelash curler

I purchased a multi-pack (direct from South Korea) that contains all of the types. They are different in that the essence is not at all watery, but rather a very thick gel. The masks can easily been worn for close to an hour before all the jelly is absorbed out of it. The overall fit is good, and there are enough cuts to fit a variety of face shapes.

The results are nice, and each mask does deliver what it sets out to do. The reason for four stars instead of five is because the remaining gel stayed very tacky (at least on me), even a few hours after removing it. So much so that I wound up wiping the remainder off with a damp cloth before finishing up with my other products. Products do tend to hover over my skin, rather than completely absorbing. So this observation may not apply if you are lucky enough to have the type of skin that absorbs products easily.

Are they worth trying? Yes, absolutely. Are they worth $10 each (the price on the page I'm reviewing is 10 for $99.99)? NO WAY. You can find a 10 pc pack for under $20 (including shipping), and I got a 5 pc pack for $12 and change.
This stuff smells amazing but DO NOT spend $47 on it, I bought it from tjmaxx/Marshall’s for like $10.

AMAZING SPOT REMOVER !!!
My husband got a stain on a new, and loved (Russian River Brewery) sweatshirt. It went through the dryer and we were thinking it was ruined. I went online and found this formula for removing spots: 1/4 cup glycerin (vegetable), 1/4 cup liquid dish soap, and 1 1/2 cups water. Put it in a spray bottle and use it like oxy clean or spray and wash. IT IS AMAZING!!! It removed the set-in stain completely! I was a hero for at least a couple of days! Then I tried it on an old favorite shirt of mine which has been stained, and washed and dried for years. After two applications, most all the stains are gone! You will never buy another commercial spot remover! Give it a try. Oh, the mixture also works great on a fingernail brush if you garden or whatever and get stained fingernails.

I have VERY sensative skin and when using a regular razor or a mach 3 I can only shave every other day or my face is a wreck. With this shaver I can shave every day or twice a day if I need to with no irritation. The shave is about as close as a single blade not at all as close as Mach 3.

I liked the moisturizing lotion better than the extra fresh gel. The gel has menthol and burned my face so if you have sensative skin I would avoid ever using it. The lotion felt great. For me and the ammount of lotion I use it is cheaper to buy lotion cartridges than new mach 3 blades. It could be different for you if you use more lotion though.

It works great in the shower and great at the sink. I even used it once when my water pump quit on me and without water it worked fine just using more lotion.

This shaver really works great and its great to be able to shave daily without irritation instead of skipping days to let my face heal.

This is better for people with sensitive skin than the HQ171 extra fresh. It feels smoother and doesn't make my razor drag or my face burn like the evil extra fresh lotion does. The lotion packs last pretty long.

For me it is cheaper to buy the lotion packs than buy new gillette mach 3 turbo blades. (this would depend on how much lotion you use) Although I don't get as close a shave I get way less irritation.

:( I have sensitive skin. This lotion has a irritating "cold burning" sensation. Yay menthol. I didn't get a close shave and i didn't want to shave with it because it felt like the razor was dragging across my irritated skin.

I was going to return my shaver until I tried the HQ170.

The HQ170 moisturizing shaving lotion is much more comfortable.

I started using this in hopes it would be a great anti-aging helper. Unfortunately, I didn't see any "help". My fine lines on my face never got better but it also did not get worse. It's a light weight oil that smells faintly of citrus. Through my time of using it, it did not clog pores or cause any type of acne. I was happy with that. Even though the product states "epic moisture", I cannot say that I felt that way. I live in a very dry climate and I don't think this is strong enough. Possibly in more humid climates it would do better. I also tried it in my hair. Again, it didn't make my hair greasy but it still barely tamed the frizz.
If you are looking for a product that has intense moisture, I would look somewhere else. If you are looking for a lightweight moisturizer, then this would be for you.
doesnt even smell like gummy bear, has a strong alcohol scent of floral again!!! i had to toss it,..i wont rebuy this scent is junk!!!!!!

This is a very straight forward razor with a stand up holder that uses a very low power magnet to keep the razor in place.

The razor itself is nothing fancy and I have been using it for about four days. I have not had any issues. The handle is a little awkward to hold when it gets soapy, but it is not a deal breaker. I do like the stand up holder because then the razor is standing and out of the way. I do wish the magnet was a little stronger.

There is one replacement blade, but apparently after that you have to buy a new kit. I could not find replacement blades for sale anywhere on Amazon.

This is an instant tanner. It leaves color where you put it and then even though I was expecting more to develop, it absolutely did not. The color that I applied was the color that was there. I put the lotion on at about 7 am when I got up in the morning with a lotion applying glove because other reviewers stated the lotion left stains on their hands. At about 6 pm when I took a shower I noticed a lot of the lotion simply washed off.

I suppose if you want a temporary tan for an evening out, this lotion would be a perfect solution. It does dry easily and smells quite nice. It is easy to apply, with a mitt, if you pay attention. Like I said, the color does not develop. I am not sure I would use it on my face.

We do not get out a lot, but I do go to a lot of doctors' appointments and hospitals and there is nothing I hate more than hospital soap. It is abrasive and it has a scent that is so distinct and it sticks with you for hours and hours after you have washed your hands. I loathe hospital soap.

These little soap sheets are simply amazing. Not only do they pack light - I can stick one little tin in my bag and it takes up almost no space at all, but the sheets themselves are tiny. The sheets dissolve nearly instantly in water, lather perfectly and the smell so nice. They are like a little bathroom oasis at the doctor or hospital. The scent does not linger though, so please do not be worried about smelling like ylang ylang for hours on end.

My hands always feel clean when I leave the bathroom and I have even used a sheet to wet a paper towel and wipe my face off.

As a 42 year old woman with shockingly pale skin I thought it would be interesting to try a sunless tanner. When I was younger I used Jergens sunless tanner and unless I was extremely careful and diligent I ended up orange, streaked or some combination of the two. I did not have high hopes for this sunless tanner, so I started with a small area on one leg.

First, this lotion does not have any real scent straight out of the bottle, but it does have a smell that develops once it is on the skin. It is not unpleasant and maybe the scent is dependent on the person, but it is there. Second, it is easy to apply. The first application I only put a tiny amount on my right leg and then immediately washed my hands. I let it dry for about one minute and then got dressed. Simple. Third, it takes a bit for color to appear. I started to tan in about 12 hours and by the next morning I was noticeably browner.

The second application I put on both my legs just like normal lotion. I tried paying attention to my knees and ankles, but honestly, I did not really. I washed my hands immediately, but must have brushed my forearm. I let everything dry for about one minute and then got dressed. The next morning I was tan and had a streak of brown on my arm.

I like this stuff. It is easy to use and the color lasts. My super pale skin accepts the color and I don't look nearly as translucent.

I am sort of a lavender lotion expert. I love the stuff. Most lotions that have lavender either smell like nothing or smell like an entire shop of flowers. Those lotions that do get the scent right usually are full of chemicals.

I had never heard of Kneipp before but I really like it. This lotion is not thin, but if you are used to a thick cream it will seem thinner. It does take a little work to absorb, but it is worth it. The scent is not overpowering and I think it does not linger, but is just right.

One complaint I do have is that the bottle had no safety seal. For $18 I would think the tube would come with a seal on the top. I was not sure if the bottle had already been used and returned. I just decided to go ahead and be brave and I'm still alive. Kneipp needs to add a seal on their tubes.

This is not a sticky or overwhelming lotion and does not leave your skin feeling greasy. Sometimes paying a little more for a product that really works is worth it and this is one of those times.

First, these are your typical sheet masks. They have normal directions - wash your face, apply, wait 15 to 20 minutes, remove. Simple.

These masks are however a little different in that they come packaged in a lovely little box, wrapped in tissue paper and would be the perfect gift to send someone. There are 12 masks, including two panda masks(!)

I like that there are a couple of each mask which will make it possible for both my husband and I to do a mask together.

We already did the panda mask and the scent was not overpowering. There is a lot of liquid for the skin to absorb in each packet and we did notice some dripping. This was solved by simply wiping the extra off with a washcloth. We did not rub in all the extra to our faces because it would not have been possible. The masks did not improve our faces to the point where we were amazed, but they were cooling while they were on and it was a fun Saturday, movie night thing to do.

These tattoos are fun. There is a ton to pick from and each butterfly is just a little different. They are easy to apply and the sheets they come on are not gigantic so cutting them out is not a huge chore.

Application is easy - take off the clear backing, press on skin, wet with a damp cloth for 30 seconds, remove paper.

These are the perfect size for a child's party or to give away as a prize.

They don't last an infinitely long time, which I'm sure parents would be grateful of.

The butterflies that show a shadow clearly in the description do not transfer that way in real life. Those tattoos look more like the butterfly is smudged and not 3D. If this is important to you I would simply cut the shadow part off because it truly does look like a smudge.

I liked these masks and although I did have some issues with the 'essence' and absorption, I did not have any allergic reactions. I have been using masks to combat skin issues I have been having from wearing medical masks. So far this mask has been one of my favorites.

- Extremely hydrating and cooling.
-Made my skin very soft and smooth for a couple days afterwards.
-Easy to use.
-Large enough to cover my entire face.
-Enough balm to cover my face, neck and probably my entire body.
-Mask did become invisible when I had it on. Not that this is super important, but my husband does a mask that makes him look like a robber and it was just an interesting observation.

-Has an insane amount of the cucumber balm - so much extra that I needed to wipe it off before I could actually rub it in after I took the mask off.
-The balm took forever to dry after I took the mask off. It was not bad, but my face did feel sticky for hours afterwards and I woke up with a tacky face in the middle of the night. Seriously, it was a lot of cucumber. I had to change my pillow case in the morning.

When the covid pandemic hit I had a very short pixie cut, which gradually turned into a mullet because I was unable to get a haircut. I am a creature of habit and I have been getting my hair cut by the same person every fourth Saturday at 9 am for the past seven years. I do not like change. A lot of things happened at the same time. The person who cut my hair moved away, covid shut down our world and my hair continued to grow. I was a mess. I tried using stretchy elastic headbands and found those stayed in place for about fifteen seconds. I successfully used felt backed headbands, but as my hair has grown longer I've found the hair in the back does not cooperate as nicely and the back of the band slips up constantly.

I decided to try these bands only because I am now desperate. They work. Huzzah.

I will say that I wish they were a little wider and in black, but I know they are meant to appeal to women and girls who want to accessorize and not to people like me who have on more than one occasion stated "my favorite color is gray". These headbands stay in place. I have been wearing the plain green one for about six hours in the kitchen, around our two dogs and doing laundry and it has not moved. Also, it does not pinch behind my ears, which I completely anticipated being a problem I would need to deal with, but I was wrong. I have noticed the felt backing has already started to come unglued, which means I am going to need to get the glue gun out and fix it. These are not headbands that are made to last for years. The price does reflect that fact.

As most of us are in quarantine and not currently getting regular hair maintenance, having weird hair right now is just normal. I am growing out a pixie cut, not by choice, but by mandate of the State of Michigan. I have experienced a number of difficult hair transitions during this stay home, stay safe period, all of which I hope to never experience again. Currently, my hair is just too short to tuck behind my ear, so it is constantly falling in my face, but thankfully, I am past the super trendy mullet stage.

When I had my pixie cut for seven years I washed my hair and dried it with a towel and went on with my life. No comb, no brush, no anything. It was really nice. Now that I actually have hair that tangles and needs attention I require tools. I have a brush with tight bristles that I like, but it pulls. I use leave in conditioner gel that seems to help, but I still pull a lot of hair. I have a very inexpensive comb that does absolutely nothing and I should probably just recycle it.

This specific comb and brush set is definitely not the fanciest around. The comb has some heft to it and it does a good job getting my part straight. The brush is very stiff compared to my other brush, but it does not pull all my hair out when it hits a tangle. I also like that this brush doesn't mash my hair down. I have thinner hair and this brush doesn't make me look like I have thin hair.

I don't use any styling products or tools, so I am not hard on my brush. I think this brush will hold up just fine in my hands, but I think if I person were using it with lots of accessories and products it might be a placeholder for a more expensive brush.
BIG, Bulky,

I would like to get behind this product, but I just can't. I've been using "ToothSoap" brand for about 10 years so I thought I'd give this new one a try.

First of all, you only get 0.3 ounces of product (Tooth Saviour) so it just not a good value. They claim there are 70 shreds, enough to brush twice a day for two months.

OK, well, I counted them, the 70 shreds claim is accurate. But the problem is, in REALITY, it DOES take about THREE shreds to effectively brush with these. MAYBE if you get two get quality shreds, you could use two, maybe. The picture of the shred posted here is very deceptive inmy opinion, the shreds, are very small, soft, and most are broken into tiny pieces. In any case, there is simply no way you are going to brush your teeth 120 times with 70 shreds, its just not going to happen, even if one shred would allow you to brush your teeth EFFECTIVELY (which it doesn't). In comparison "ToothSoap" shreds are longer and the "soap up" better than these. I use two "ToothSoap" shreds because I like to be sure, but if I had to I could use one, as long as a started out with some water in my mouth.

You get 4 ounces of "ToothSoap" brand for $20-$30 if you order from Amazon. (And I never order from Amazon, I signed up to the mailing list at the "ToothSoap" website and I always wait for them to offer me the buy one get one free deal, which they always do about every 6 months or so.

Even IF I were paying the Amazon price, this stuff is at least three times more expensve than "ToothSoap" brand. Yeah, it cleans as good, but its just not justifiable cost wise.

I've been using the shampoo, conditioner, and leave-in conditioner together, for about 3 weeks and I have noticed the difference in my hair already.  It's getting thicker.  The product smells pretty good, kind of grape-fruity.  If I had to critique something, I would say that it does leave a touch of weight on my hair, But compared to similar products I've tried, the extra weight is a mild side effect.  I will post an update in a month or so and let you know the progress. I'm also slightly annoyed that they make their logo so similar to OLAY, but I'm nitpicking.  Good product so far....stay tuned.

The InstaNatural Argan Oil Shampoo - With 100% Certified Organic Moroccan Argan Oil & Vitamin B5 - Best Holistic Treatment for Soft & Silky Hair - Deluxe Nourishment to Hydrate Dry Scalp - 16 OZ from InstaNatural makes my hair feel very soft. It also keeps the flyaways down as it it so hydrated that it no longer gets staticy. A little goes a long way. I received this product for a reduced price for a honest unbiased review.
