InstaNatural's premium shampoo features 100% pure Argan Oil that's imported from Morocco to ensure that your hair receives supreme care and protection.
Deluxe Nourishment from Root to Tip - Our specialized formula is enriched with Vitamin B5 (Pantothenic Acid) to not only keep the scalp healthy, but also to help preserve your hair's beautiful color and fullness. When paired with the certified organic Argan Oil, this professional grade shampoo can give any hair type strong, beautiful and salon-like results. That means no more clumps of hair going down your shower drain.
Reverses Pesky Hair Damage - Have you ever struggled with split ends or dry, brittle, frizzy, limp and lifeless hair? You're not alone. Whether your hair type is straight, curly, thin, thick, short or long, this Argan Oil Shampoo has all of the hair-refining ingredients your hair type needs in order to undo the damage leftover from heat, flat irons, curling irons, blow dryers and other poorly designed hair products out there. Treat your hair to the all-natural enrichment it deserves.
Enjoy Moisturizing, Flake-Free Benefits for the Scalp - Most men and women have dealt with dry and itchy scalp issues, but with InstaNatural's hair-refining shampoo, dryness and itching will be gone for good. This formula gets rid of all that uncomfortable itching and irritation so you won't have to brush away dandruff or scratch your head again.
Came broken.

I wish I could give this -☆ because it's awful. Let's start with the fact that I ordered the pink one & I was sent this tacky gold one. That would've been forgivable had the product not been such HORRIBLE quality. As seen in the pics the pin in the hinge is breaking away from the product itself. This is causing the compact to not seal correctly & start closed. Then the cover that closes over the actual foundation will not seal resulting in foundation  that drys out really quickly. I'm beyond irritated & hope this review steers you in another direction. I tired to give it an honest try even though I could see the issues. DON'T WASTE YOUR $$$

I have bought almost every other oil from 'The 2 Bits Man' and this is by far the worst one. I read reviews on this one like 'It smells like burnt wood' or 'The Canoeist beard oil smells like birch and cedar'. Either you guys are paying people to write reviews, or I received a bad bottle of oil. I guess it could be that my wife and I have a different sense of smell than everyone else? We both agree that it literally smells like damp cardboard. If you take the box it came in, soak it in water, tear it, then smell where you tore it, that's what it smells like.

Being from the south, I know what "burnt wood" and or "cedar" smell like... it isn't even close. I guess I could smell the birch... but it smells like wet, old birch firewood that has been sitting outside for a good while.

The ONLY reason why I gave it two stars is because its better than the unscented jojoba oils you can buy. Also, the outside of the bottle was completely soaked with oil when I got it. I assume this was from being on a plane with the pressure changes that caused some of the oil to seep out and get all over it. The cap was kind of crooked under the seal so maybe that was why?

This Hylo-Forte eye drop is nothing short of miraculous for me.  My eyes have been continuously gritty, itchy, dry, red and even blurry at times no matter what I did or what eye drops I used.  I read that eye drops containing hyaluronic acid, (which Hylo-Forte does) were recommended by the head of the  Johns Hopkins Wilmer Eye Institute.  So I ordered Hylo-Forte and some other preservative free drops suitable for carrying in pocket or purse.  When my order arrived I immediately read the package insert for the Hylo-Forte and put the first drop in my right eye which all that day had felt like there was a grain of sand in it every time I blinked.  I was astonished!!! The "grit" immediately disappeared and I quickly put a drop in the other eye.  The effect lasted for many hours with none of the previously mentioned symptoms apparent.  The package said the drops could be used up to 3 times a day, so even tho I probably didn't need to, I put them in my eyes before watching TV in the evening and again before bed.  In the morning the vision in one of my eyes was cloudy (as has been the usual case), but within 10 minutes of using the drops that cleared up and I have not used another dose for the rest of the day.  My eyes have continued to be comfortable, moist feeling and symptom free all day.  Additionally, the product has a very clever dispensing system which dispenses exactly one pre-measured drop per pump.  It's a very  nice feature since the bottle only contains10ml and I wouldn't want to waste any.  It is a very short time to have used this product and be commenting on it, but the results are so good and the relief so welcome I couldn't wait to post my review.  I will add an update to this review in a few weeks.

The nice thing about this toothbrush is that it uses the same heads as most of Oral-B's other toothbrushes. This is a basic model, which probably cleans just as well as their other models. The battery lasted me about a week of twice a day brushing, and the battery indicator tells you when you'll need to recharge it a few brushing sessions in advance. Don't ignore it too long, because it takes about 18 hours to charge it fully, but charging it about an hour should be good enough for one brushing. The charger is small and doesn't take up much room in a drawer.

The small head really works well for cleaning the sides of your teeth and between them. Oral-B talks about the cupping action and it really works like the polishing tools most hygienists use. It even seemed to dig food particles stuck between my teeth(!), but you'll still want to floss where no toothbrush can reach. If you have gum issues, this may be the ideal toothbrush for you.

The dual clean head got my teeth acceptably clean faster, but it's noticeably bigger and the precision clean head worked better overall for me. It's nice that they included two different brush heads so you can see which you prefer.

Unfortunately, the slower pulsing action seems to irritate my teeth. A week or two after I started using this toothbrush, my molars started to ache. I ended up returning it and going back to my other Oral-B, whose head looks more like a normal toothbrush which vibrates up & down very quickly. It doesn't clean along the gum line quite as well, but seems to clean the grinding surfaces of molars slightly better.

Oral-B also sells softer toothbrush heads which people seem to like and may be better for my sensitive teeth.

I added another star for Amazon's good customer service and considering that most people don't seem to have sensitive teeth. In general, just about any electric toothbrush will do a much better job cleaning your teeth, removing plaque, etc., etc. - much better than a manual brush. Try one. If you don't like it, a different type may be better for you too.

This has some pluses and minuses.

The pluses:

This doesn't irritate my skin and even if it doesn't do anything for bumpy skin, it does certainly make my skin very soft. I'm not entirely sure about its claims about dealing with skin issues like acne, as I'm a bit nervous to put this on my face. I figure that it could certainly be used for the occasional acne that shows up elsewhere (we all get it), as tea tree is well known for being a good way to treat acne. Still, I have heard that the base oil is good for skin as well, so that is a plus as well.

The main minus I have here is that while the smell here isn't awful, it's still strong enough that it gave me a bit of a headache. (That's another reason I probably won't be using it on my face.) I was able to deal with this by putting it on in small bits, which seemed to work well since the strongest part of the smell faded away pretty quickly. The remaining scent is honestly pretty nice and mellow.

I do have to commend the company for their packaging. While the bottle did leak during transport, the company was aware that this would happen ahead of time and packaged this well. I do wish that it didn't leak, but barring this I do appreciate that it was properly packaged so that the small amount of oil that leaked didn't get everywhere.

This isn't bad and it works, I just wish that the design was a little different so that I could lay it on the counter more easily.

The good of this is that you can use it on wet hair and it does straighten. There's only one button on this, although it's surrounded by several lights that give off the impression that they should also be buttons, which is very slightly confusing at first. It's easy to change between temperatures and the unit heats up incredibly quickly, which is awesome.

The downside to this is that the design makes it more difficult to lay down on the counter - if you have a sink that is slightly raised then you can prop it up against that, but I do wish it had something like some of the curling irons have. It also comes with a small bag, but I'm slightly worried about putting the straightener in the bag if it's even slightly warm, as it's the type of material that could melt easily.

I'm not really familiar with straighteners in general, but this does seem like it's designed to be similar to some of the more name brand, expensive items out there. I'm not entirely sure how the price compares, though. Overall this isn't bad.

I've had water flossers before - they're honestly pretty fantastic since they can get in places and in pockets where regular floss can't. If you get the right one and know how to use it, it's a lot like having your own dental assistant to help clean your teeth. My last water flosser gave up the ghost after I dropped it while moving (RIP water flosser!) so this seemed like it'd be good to try out.

Upon using this I immediately noticed that the lowest setting wasn't shooting out water hard enough for me, so I turned it up to the max. That worked better, but it still didn't have the oomph that its larger counterparts did. So if you're looking for a particularly intense water flosser, this isn't really going to be it. On the other hand, this would probably do well with people who want lower pressure.

The fact that this is handheld is pretty nice, although it does take a while to get used to since I'm used to the smaller water flosser nozzles. It's a bit like holding a really huge toothbrush in some aspects, if that makes any sense. The water being in the unit is an OK feature but if you like being very thorough and doing several passes, you'll more than likely need to refill at some point. That part isn't a big hardship as filling this up is a breeze and one of the nicest aspects of it. It's insanely easy to do and isn't needlessly complicated.

In the end the main draw for this would be that I can take it with me on trips, which I almost certainly will. It's far easier to pack into a travel bag or throw into a suitcase than a standard water flosser with a huge tank would be. I just don't think that I'd prefer this for daily use over a more traditional unit, especially since I like my water pressure a lot higher than that. Still, for what it is, it's not bad and it'd be a good little gadget for travelers.

I don't have a retainer, but I do have a nightguard and I figured that since it's made out of the same stuff you'd see for some of the mouthguards and the like out there, why not give it a try? I'm always a little leery of brushing since I don't want to ruin my brushes or potentially harm my nightguard. Soaking it in some mouthwash is helpful, but then that isn't the same as a thorough clean.

The taste of this is fairly nice. I like that it's not extremely overwhelming. You can wipe your guard down and it won't be insanely strong. There will be a hint of flavor, but overall it's not going to be anything that will knock your socks off. This might be disappointing for some, but it's still a better thing to taste than the alternative. If you have a guard of any type, you know what I'm talking about.

This will get into most of the crevices and areas of the average guard. You'll have to cram it into the more small areas, but it will fit everywhere. It seems to do a fairly good job of cleaning as well. I'd read that it could help get rid of stains and other discolorations, which is the biggest thing that appealed to me. So far I've done a few cloths and it seems to be helping a little. It's not a miracle worker, but then I wasn't expecting it to be and to be honest, I'd be more than a little leery of something that would remove all the yellowing immediately. After all, what would it do to your mouth afterwards?

This is a pretty good option and I'm curious to try the soaks to see what they would do as well.

I had another Norelco shaver for the last 5 (or more) years. The difference in the shaves is striking. Both less pain when my stubble is a little long and closer.

However, the reason this shaver is cheaper is that there is 1 battery inside it instead of 2. I know this because I took it in to be "repaired" because I only got 8 shaves to a charge. I talked (online) with Norelco and they said my shaver was broken. So, I looked up on the Norelco site a local authorized repair shop. I took it in and the guy opened it up. He said it was one of the "cheap" versions that has 1 instead of 2 batteries.

My old shaver, over most of its life, gave me 25 or so shaves before needing to be recharged. That's quite a difference.

What you get is exactly what you should expect, which is a large (30) number of little bottles that you can take with you if you don't use them while a guest. Which is a good thing, given that the current trend seems to be large dispensers, things that it would be difficult to take because they are large and taking them would be considered 'theft'. Not to mention that said dispensers are not as sanitary as little 'use once, then throw away' bottles.
So, good marks for hygiene and also for a decent body wash.

Indeed, for a while we thought then name was slightly misspelled because the product is somewhat fancy. It's clearly a good quality sunscreen and experience has shown us that the odds for a Korean cosmetics product to be good are quite... good.
This sunscreen appears to be no exception. Texture is light and face feels good if used when spending a few hours at the pool or at the beach, and we tried both. And, yes, this is for face only, mostly because there's not much of it and it's not exactly cheap so enjoy it while it lasts.

It's a good mask, according to my wife and daughter. They both tried it and, after they did, there was enough left for maybe one application. Strangely, the tin came only half-full and I don't know if it was so only because it was from a batch sent to Vine reviewers.
The mask gets pretty dry after application but skin underneath stays Okay. Of course, it has all the right ingredients so, no surprises such as allergic reactions, swelling or redness. It's probably something that you would want to use once weekly but not more often.

The marketing blurb says, among other things "this advanced man face care formula features stem cells to help revive the skin and smooth out imperfections".
Well... stem cells, if they were actually somehow harvested, in a cosmetics container, mixed with various other chemicals and ingredients would necessarily be dead and therefore completely irrelevant. And, of course, the stem cells would help address things such as diabetes and repair of heart muscle following heart attack, not zits on one's face. Not to mention that they would need to be live and 'human' cells. So, I am quite confident that the 'stem cells' claim is untrue and, even if it were true, the presence of dead stem cells in a cream would make zero difference.
Other than that, the cream is thick and, as other reviewer found, it has an aggressive smell that reminded me of Noxzema. So I would never use it during the day. At night, it would probably be Okay if used by men who sleep alone.

I am one of those who prefer water flossers to string-based flossing. Process is much cleaner and, in my view, cleaning is more thorough.
This Chinese designed and made unit works well. You fill it with warm water, select the mode, possibly select a specific pick - but I always use the regular one - and you start flossing away.
Item design and ergonomics are generally Okay. However, the manual is not exactly helpful but most of us should be able to figure it out, eventually. Charging is via a custom USB cable but there is no actual charging unit so you need to find one such as your phone charger. You only need to charge it once every couple of weeks if you use it once daily.
Overall, a useful item and it does appear to be durable. Time will tell.

Surprisingly, this small set, probably the smallest I've seen so far, comes with everything you will need for beard-mustache trimming and it could be used for hair styling for as long as your hair is not too long.
I would recommend it as a travel option because of its small and efficient size but it could also be used as the default beard or generally facial hair tool if your needs aren't anything special.

I've been used this specific shampoo only a couple of times as it was offered by vendor as a 'for review' item but we've been into Argan Oil shampoos for the past half year or so and we are very happy with the results. In fact our teenage daughter insists that whatever shampoo we purchase it contains the Argan Oil.

This shampoo provided a thorough, gentle cleaning of my hair and scalp and there is not discomfort or itchy feeling whatsoever after use which is a good thing. Our daughter likes it too but she observed that 'it smells funny'. I do agree that there is a strong, not necessarily unpleasant, smell for a brief few seconds while you are applying the shampoo on hair.

Additional facts worth sharing:

- It comes in a tube and a tube this size should probably last 2-3 months if used by a couple of people so, while the price is higher than what you'll typically see at a supermarket, it's not THAT high when spread over several months and it's worth the extra few dollars.
- While it's not stated anywhere, it seems to act as a conditioner. I would not use use a conditioner after this shampoo myself.
- For what is worth, the ingredients include: Aloe leaf extract, Argan oil, Xanthan gum and dozen of ingredients that are difficult to spell or pronounce but the maker promise that there are no petrochemical derivatives or parabens and that no animal testing was conducted.

The odds are I will continue to use this shampoo until I am made aware of a superior product. Until then, I am happy with it.
____________________________________________________

NOTE: If you are curious about Argan oil - apparently very good for both hair and skin - Wikipedia has a very good article.

According to my Amazon's purchase records, I bought this shaver back in June 2008 and I've used it almost exclusively up until recently when it was replaced by a [[ASIN:B000PKNPES Philips Norelco arcitec 1050 Men's Shaver]] not because it stopped working but because the Arcitec was on sale for a price where it made more sense to buy a brand-new shaver than to replace the old SpeedXL's shaving heads. As of now, the SpeedXL is still in perfect working order and it's likely to be one of my kids first shavers when they are going to need a first shaver (soon).

I am writing this only to testify to the quality of this product. I had no problems with it whatsoever, it never let me down, the battery still holds enough charge for maybe half a dozen shaves, runs as silently as on day one and it's a near-zero maintenance item, requiring nothing beyond the heads cleaning after each shave by placing them under the faucet. The one issue I had was that the skin on my neck got irritated from time to time but it was never anything major that wouldn't go away after a few hours.

Si, it's goodbye to the SpeedXL for me (hello Arcitec) but it's not this shaver's end of career. It's going to be in service, again, in about a year or two, who knows for how much longer :)

The Arcitec is replacing my almost 3 year old [[ASIN:B0012TLPBQ Philips Norelco Speedxl Men's Shave]] which served me well for all this time but, when the time came to replace the old 8140XL's heads I happened to notice that a brand-new Arcitec was available as a 'lightning deal' for some $35 more so I took advantage of the opportunity. After several weeks of using it I can say that the Arcitec is 'better' that the 8140XL and I am therefore pleased with my purchase. While the end result of shaving is basically the same which is not surprising because the Arcitec implements the same 'lift and cut' technology, it appears to be much gentler to my skin, the more flexible shaving heads better follow my face and neck, has a better grip, comes with a more protective storage/charger pod and, of course, is prettier.

But, let's go into some details:

PACKAGING, CONTENTS AND PRESENTATION

The shaver comes to you inside a triple-layered protective/defensive enclosure, hard plastic over cardboard over another clamshell (but easy to open) protective plastic layer. It's not totally bullet-proof but it probably ensures that most units don't suffer any damage while in transit.

Inside I found:

- The shaver itself
- Super-protective (for travel mostly) charging pod
- Cleaning brush
- Charging stand
- Sliding razor head cap
- 100/240V power cord
- User manual and warranty statement (English/Spanish)
- Quick start guide card

Taking the shaver out of its packaging, understanding its operation and making it work was relatively easy.

The manual, covering FOUR separate models is surprisingly well written to the extent that you are not annoyed by having to find the paragraph that applies to your specific model so, know thy model number (it's a 1050). It covers everything, from features, charging options, shaving tips and techniques, cleaning, storage and replacement of the razor head. I've actually read it and I am better off for it.

FEATURES AND OPERATION

Charging
--------
This is one of Arcitec's better features. The manual claims (verified) that it can take a full charge in about one hour and, once charged. I didn't count shaving minutes but, at least with a brand-new battery you won't need to recharge it very often. In 'emergencies', just 3 minutes of charging should give you 3 minutes of shave time.

There is no way to replace the battery inside the shaver but, based on my experience with Architec's precursor, my 2.5 year old 8140XL, this should not be an issue. After all these years the battery still allows me to shave several times before a recharge is needed.

You charge your shaver by either placing it on the charging stand or inside the charging pod. Philips recommends that you do not keep the charging stand continuously connected to the power outlet and I have no problem with that. One one-hour charge session keeps my shaver going for several weeks (I only shave 2-3 times per week).

Shaving
--------
The feature most of us buy a shaver for :)... It's okay, for an electric shaver. I won't say that "it's as close as a blade" because it isn't but that's not why I switched from blade shaving to electric some 7 years ago. I am using an electric shaver because shaving with a blade had my skin irritated, especially on my neck. The 8140XL was okay but my neck still felt uncomfortable. The Architec does NOT irritate my neck at all and this is a very good thing.

The above comes with a price. Shaving takes a lot longer. You need to go over the same area several times before all the hairs are 'lifted and cut' but that was a tradeoff I understood and I accepted. Norleco claim that the Arcitec has "50% more shaving surface" (compare with the old 8140XL claim of "up to 50% more shaving surface") is just marketing hype and always left me ask myself "50% more than what?". The reality is that the 3 heads together add up to a decent shaving surface, and the Arcitec's are not larger than the 8140XL's but I would not call them 'humongously large". And, again, contrary to marketing claims, shaving with the Arcitec or with just about any other electric shaver is not 'fast'.

As I noted before, the Arcitec is very gentle to my skin and this is the main reason, other than good looks, that I prefer it over the older model. Sometimes you need to go several times over the same neck spot because 'lift and cut' is good but not perfect but my experience with the Arcitec is that my skin tolerates it pretty well.

Trimmer
--------
A small trimmer can be pulled out when needed. I am not going to use it that much but I was able to successfully and quickly trim my mustache. It's a useful feature.

Other bells and whistles
-----------------------
When needed, a number of indicators/warnings discretely light up on shaver's body: low battery, charing indicator, needs cleaning indicator, travel lock and shaving head replacement indicator.

MAINTENANCE

I don't like spending a lot of time taking care of my shaving tools and the Arcitec does not need a lot of maintenance. Each of the 3 individual heads can be opened and the hair fragments stored inside are washed away in seconds. Any that don't go can be removed with the providing brush. It's possible to also use liquid soap or degreasing liquid (alcohol) solutions for cleaning but I haven't yet.

The trimmer, if used extensively, could use a couple of drops of mineral oil once or twice per year.

Norelco recommends that the full shaving head assembly is replaced once a year and an 'replace head' indicator should light up on the shaver when that time comes but we are not there yet and I will be making that decision when the time comes.

SUPPORT AND WARRANTY

There is a 45-day money back guarantee. Philips Norelco promise to fully refund your purchase price if you ship them back the product within 45 days of your purchase date. You will be paying for shipping and insurance and they are not responsible for lost items - therefore the need for insurance.

In addition, there is a 2-year limited warranty and warrants against defects and, of course, you lose coverage if you abuse your shaver or you try to fix it your self or through unauthorized repairers.

The 800 numbers you need to call for support or warranty service are printed on several locations on the box and on the manual.

Made in Holland.

DESIGN AND ERGONOMICS

'The looks' is clearly Arcitec's distinguishing feature. I like it but I'm not going to say more because everyone can see the images posted on Amazon's page. As I noted above, all indicators and warnings light up when only when needed and are invisible at any other time. The Arcitec's body shape makes for a very comfortable grip while shaving. I also appreciated the little suction cups at the bottom of the charging stand that add to its stability.

The charging pod, on the other hand, is a little too bulky and it's not easy to close/open and it can't store then shaver while the heads cap is on. I didn't take it on the road yet but, when I do I may appreciate how it protects my shaver but, on the other hand, I don't believe any of my shavers was ever damaged while travelling so I'm not so sure the bulkiness is justified.

Finally, I wish there was some 'case' to carry or store everything. The way the shaver comes, it's possibly to store it inside the pod but then the heads cap, the cleaning brush and the charging cord are 'outside' and they are easy to lose, especially the first two.

MY RATING

I am pleased with my purchase and Arcitec is now my 'regular' shaver. Losing the occasional red spots on my neck was very much worth it. Besides the comfortable shave the Arcitec comes with pretty good support (money back promise, 800 support number), looks good and, based on my prior experience with an earlier Philips Norelco shaver, is likely to last for a long, long time. Some of the marketing claims: quick shave, 50% larger (than what???) are a little bit exaggerated but... that's what our reviews are for.

I hesitated between 4 (I like it) and 5 (I love it) stars. If you expect the Arcitec to fulfill all the marketing claims, you may be slightly disappointed but if you know what to expect from an electric shaver and understand that real-world miracles are very rare, then a 5 star may be the fair rating. I will do a 4 stars at this time for a good quality, well designed electric shaver that appears to be an incremental improvement over previous generations but whose capabilities may be a little over-hyped.

For more than one reason, I haven't seen the insides of a hair-cuttery in more than a decade. Flowbee was my trusted hair-management solution for all these years until I had the opportunity to try Norelco's 'Power Hair Clipper', model QC5055.

I am unlikely to ever return to Flowbee now because the QC5055 does the job much faster, it's less noisy and delivers a much better quality haircut.

Operation:

Once charged, all you need to do is attach the proper comb (see below), select the desired hair length and proceed with cutting.

Hair-cutting tends to be a borderline traumatic experience for me - I'm a long hair type person - but this was a near-painless experience. I am looking forward to more future haircuts. It goes fast, smooth and easy. From time to time, you may have to clean the comb and/or the clipping attachment but that can be done quickly and easily. My wife gave me a near-professional-quality haircut in about 10-15 minutes and finished me with sufficient momentum to place our 12 yr. son under the cutter and 'even him out' as well.

What you get:

- The hair clipper body hosting the rechargeable batteries.
- The clipping attachment
- Stainless steel, self-sharpening cutting blades
- Large comb
- Small comb
- Stubble comb
- Charger
- Cleaning brush
- English/Spanish instructions
- Registration card with $20 coupon offer

Some specs:

- Battery life is rated at about 35 minutes.
- Charge time is 10 hours.
- Cuts hair from .12 in./3 mm to 1.61 in./41 mm.
- 15 length settings between the 3 combs (seven on each of the large and small combs plus the stubble comb)

Returns and warranties:

There's a 45-day money back guarantee promise if the customer can provide proof of purchase and ships the item, insured, to Norelco at own expense.

The 2-year warranty promises to replace defective products for as long as the customer didn't do anything 'unreasonable' and he/she paid for shipping the item to Norelco, preferably insured. Proof of purchase, of course, is a must.

What I liked:

Other than the surprising ease of use and operation and the quality of the haircut, I liked the easy cleaning and maintenance and the fact that, if needed, it can operate in a 'corded' mode. The comfortable, rubberized grip makes hair cutting, even self-cutting easy and efficient.

The brief manual is written in good English and is very good at illustrating cleaning and assembly and has very good advice on maintenance, preserving battery life and even some haircutting tips.

Issues:

My big problem and the only one so far is the lack of some case or storage box. With so many parts of which some are small and/or fragile, not providing some way to store them, protect them and keeping them organized is inexcusable.

Rating:

This would have been an easy 5-star if it came with a case. Since it doesn't, it gets 4.

I still recommend the QC5055 most highly but be prepared to supply your own box or pouch - I did - or risk losing combs or the cleaning tools or maybe misplace the essential charger.

The lifespan of this device seems to be quite limited. A couple of years ago, I bought 2 of these for my 2 boys. One of them stopped working after a couple of weeks - was able to return it to Amazon and get a replacement - and the other stopped after a little over one month. The replacement stopped working after about one month as well.

The big problem with this toothbrush is the battery compartment. Since it's using 'throw away' batteries, a bad thing by itself, there is a need for a lid to allow removal/insertion of batteries. At this price, the lid does not close tightly and water creeps in. Eventually, the entire thing stops working.

Pros for this toothbrush:
- low price.

Cons:
- short life due to almost inevitable water damage
- use of 'throw away' batteries

My recommendation: avoid.

Spend a few more and get a true Sonicare. You won't regret it. I've been using Sonicare tooth brushes for almost 10 years now. My first one was replaced after more than 5 years, mostly because I wanted a new one. My current is alive and kicking and it's likely to last for many more years if I don't choose to replace it.

Diving into doing my own manicures at home meant that I needed the proper lamp for curing gel polishes. After much searching I found the Mercase 72w LED/UV lamp with its additional usb and usb c charging ports. These additional charging ports are a complete bonus but make total sense. I can plug my e-file into the USB port and run the file with no problems. Port also charges my iPhone 7 just fine though the usb c port did have some issues with slow charging on my husbands S9. I love the smart “on/off” feature that it has and now my manicures take half the time since upgrading from a small 6w travel lamp. With the polish system that I am using, base coat cures in 30s, polish layers ( single layer) cures in 30s and top coat cures in 60s and being able to put my whole hand in with plenty of wiggle room is the best. The only thing that caught me off guard was that the husband saw the power supply and per the specs on the power supply, the lamp is only putting out 48watts, so a little odd that would be labeled 72watts if it’s only 48.

I am a serum junky so I feel like I have a pretty good idea on what to look for in serums! Hollyberry Cosmetics, Clinical Strength Hyaluronic + Vitamin C Serum For Dry and Problem Skin - Premium Skin Moisturizer Anti Wrinkle and fine lines. Brighten + Even Blemishes Quick drying, is AWESOME! I truly love most any serums that have Vitamin C in them. I have only been using this serum for about four days and I can already see a difference! My face has cleared up almost completely. It is a clear serum that is not too runny, which I love because there is not such a rush to just "throw' it on your face before it runs down your fingers. This serum soaks in rather quickly, so if you are like me, and have a whole regimen of serums, toners, moisturizers, ect, to put on your face, neck, and chest, following with make up, this is quite important to me. I can also see the brightening part of this serum working for my complexion, evening it out. I am only twenty seven years old, but I did a lot of tanning in high school, so I am trying to make up for the damage I caused to my skin, and its never too early to prepare your skin for aging that will come in the future. I have two children ages four and five, so I am tired quite often, which causes dark circles under my eyes, and this Clinical Strength Hyaluronic + Vitamin C Serum For Dry and Problem Skin - Premium Skin Moisturizer Anti Wrinkle and fine lines. Brighten + Even Blemishes Quick drying works for this as well! The ingredients are perfect in covering quite a few different problems, so its kind of an all in one, type serum, which i love! I am a very impatient person, so I like serums that I can either see or feel a difference rather immediately, than a serum that you have to use for a long time before seeing results, so if you are like me, I definitely recommend this serum!! I have spent all kinds of money on super expensive serums thinking that the more money you spend, the more results you will see, and that is just not the case.

Also, when I try a new serum, I do not use any other serums that are similar to this one, so I can get a good idea of what results this serum will really show. I like to add that in because even though I have many serums, if I were to use a similar serum to this one, I like to give it a fair chance! This one definitely passed!!

If I were looking for a disposable product that I could wear one time and then afterwards it breaks in various locations then this would be a five-star item. However, I was hoping that I could wear each one of these headbands more than just one time. This evening I lay my head down and right before I did I pulled the little plastic headband off and it cracked right above my ear. This is the second one that has broken of the four that I have worn so far. This is a little bit on the expensive side. If you think about it, it's just under a dollar a piece. But if you think about a differently that's a dollar a day that you're spending and if they break early in the day, then you might need to use a second one which is $2. I don't know. For now I will continue wearing them for another few weeks. I suppose until they all break in half. I feel like I need to buy metal ones with the little teeth built in. Not sure those exist though. Very disappointed.

The clip is very nice, good quality and looks really good in my car.  However, the oils that I have dropped in there, and I have used 4 different types so far, do not really smell up the car.  I have it on my air vent and I truly expected at least something.  But nothing at all.  I was thinking that it was because i am not running the heater, but it is summer.  who the heck runs the heat this time of year?  On the last hot day we had i was looking forward to getting into my car after a long day at work and smelling the essential oils I dropped into the unit that morning, but still nothing.  Is there a particular type of oil i need to use?  So far I am not impressed with it as an oil diffuser.  It is gorgeous, but does not do its primary function as far as i can tell.  Would someone be able to advise me on which brand of oils they use to make this work right and make my car smell good?

Lucille Ball's final words were "My Florida Water". This was the only perfume she ever wore. I just had to find out what she smelled like. It smells fantastic...light, fresh and kind of has a citrus scent. Best of all, now I know what Lucy smelled like.

I've been using this Neck Firming Cream Anti Aging moisturizer and Anti Aging Body Cream for the past week and although it's too early to review the benefits of long-term use, I can safely say that it's an excellent moisturizer. I like the texture of the cream and the way it absorbs into my skin without leaving any stickiness or scent.

I always use moisturizer after washing my face and body that's why my skin is in good condition, apart from under the eye and few lines on my neck. But to keep it that way as I get older, I need to include anti aging products into my daily skin care routine. These two products are packed with natural ingredient like Vitamin E, Avocado, Jojoba, Rosehip, Shea Butter, Coconut oil etc., which are very good for the skin and with continuous use it'll keep the skin young as both of these products are anti aging. I'm sure with regular use I'll see the results but I have to give time. Over all I'm happy with both the products. When applied, it absorbs well into the skin and leaves my skin very soft and smooth. Both of these products comes in large 4 oz jar and a little goes a long way. If you're looking for a great moisturizer and neck firming cream without spending too much money, this is a good choice. Please note I purchased both the products at a discounted price for my honest review.

It's great that it comes in a 5 pack so many family members can benefit. The top part and handle of this scrubber set are made of plastic while the spindles are silicone. The all-silicone scrubbers feel sturdier than this set.

It's smaller than some of the other scrubbers I've used, and the spindles are also shorter. The handle design does not lend itself to being hung on any hooks which I didn't realize I'd miss until I used this version. The small handle is fine for kids to grasp. Overall, I might have liked this set a wee bit more if I was able to hang it on something, but it still functions the way it is intended.

I've used different brands of power toothbrushes for the past 10 years. I started off with the Colgate battery powered ones, and they were good for dorm life but not a longterm investment. These Oral B brushes are great. They have different variations in the $20 price range, and they're great investments but keep in mind the rechargeable battery does eventually poop out (I've had to replace mine about every 2 years). This last part I don't mind because dirty mouths yield dirty toothbrushes! The instructions state that to properly clean after brushing, you need to remove the brushead and rinse under running water.

PROS:
This model has a rubberized grip, 2 minute timer (I didn't brush long enough before), rechargeable, never experienced overheating, since using these brushes my dentist says my gums look great, small enough to get precision cleaning

CONS:
Will most likely need to replace unit every 2 years or so, expensive brusheads (keep an eye on Amazon sales) - I might put too much pressure on my brush but I have to replace a brushead every 2 months although the savings in dental bills make up for that!

If you're new to power brushes, it takes some time to get used to the vibrations, but that's the cleaning mechanism.

REVIEWING: Ombre Wigs Short Bob Wigs 2 in 1 Curly Wig + Straight Wig Ombre Red Blonde Bob Wig for Women Synthetic Cosplay Daily Wigs(12", Rust Red Blonde)
*
*
This is a very unique wig. I believe it's best for costume/cosplay or every once in awhile. A week or 2 at best. I can see it being everyday for some with basic styling, hats/accessories, just not for me.

Ya gotta finesse a bit to get styles because the wefts will show & even the cap along the edges--Especially the temples (by the ears). Honestly, I feel the wig is a bit on the small side if you can't get your hair super flat. I couldn't get the wig pulled forward all the way wearing my hair how I normally do under wigs. I can usually grab any wig & it fits, so one that fits awkwardly for me I know is a caution for others who have to choose more carefully.

It's about average thickness of decent synthetic wigs. The fluffiness on the bottom makes it seem thicker. It's more 'full' than thick. There's a lot of wefts constructed closely together, so everything is concealed well enough.

It does shed a bit as does every blonde synthetic wig I've ever had. It's not necessarily excessive, but I get a bit of shedding everytime I comb it.

The part is done decently & can be blended to match your natural scalp.

I don't care for the style right out the bag. Although I love the waves, the curl curls too hard for my taste. I don't like the way the back looks at all. I did a quick straighten with my blow dryer, so it can def be done with heat (the photo with my hand in the neck of my shirt).

Overall, it's a pretty decent synthetic wig. I love the color, but wasn't impressed by the finish on the perimeter & the 2 torn loops at the back for adjusting (I now have to wear it at the tightest adjustment. I can repair by sewing but could be an inconvenience for some). Also, I feel it's kind of below the average size for a wig.

With that I'd say it's a bit steep, but maybe makes up for it in uniqueness & style opportunities . . . if you know how.

I've been using this product for quite some time now. I can say it feels great on my face and asures a sense of freshness and renewal energy to my pores. I believe to have become a recurrent user. My skin is very dry, for I have psoriasis, so I can confidently suggest to use this product if you have really dry skin.

I love that this is a liquid roll on non-aluminum deodorant! It keeps me mostly dry, but more importantly  it keeps the stink down!!! Very hard to find with non-aluminum deodorants as they are not anti-perspirant. I somtimes have to reapply mid day to maintain a fresh smell. On another note, I tried the Native deodurant that the internet seems to love but I was so much stinkier throughout the day with that. Nivea works a lot better for me and I will be buying again.

I received Valentia's True Glow Eye Cream for free to review. This is one of several products that I have tried from Valentia and I have to say, they don't disappoint. I feel like their price point is great and you're getting an amazing product. I have dark circles under my eyes thanks to having two small children and terrible allergies so when a product claims to lighten dark circles I'm always very hesitant. My dark circles are constantly a problem because of my allergies but I did notice a slight difference in color after using this eye cream for a few days which is something that I was definitely shocked by. Another thing that the product claims to do is to reduce wrinkles and fine lines and I definitely can tell that it definitely did that. I am still young but do have some fine lines starting to make an appearance and the True Glow Eye Cream did help with those. It also left my under eye area feeling very moisturized which is HUGE for me as I have very very dry skin.

Valentia's True Glow Eye Cream has some really great ingredients in it. It contains Vitamin C, Astaxanthin, Resistem, Organic Roseship Oil, and Arnica which all have wonderful anti-aging properties and help you keep your skin feeling and looking youthful.

The product should be applied twice daily, after cleanser. I feel like it absorbs quickly into your skin which is always nice.

As always with Valentia products, the packaging is a gorgeous white and gold which gives it a very high end look, in my opinion. I love the fact that it has a pump top which allows you to control how much comes out, that way you don't feel like you're wasting it. The smell is very pleasant, it kind of has a citrusy scent to it but it's not overpowering.

Overall, another great product from Valentia!

Product description:
Full Head Brazilian Virgin Hair 3 Bundles. Each bundle is 100grm (+/-5g) = 3.5oz
Grade 5A Brazilian virgin Human hair,100% Unprocessed human hair.
Brazilian Unprocessed Hair, Best Quality, No Tangle No Shedding, Soft & Wavy.
Body Wave Hair

What you will receive:
Unprocessed Brazilian Hair in 3 bundles

My thoughts:
Darlingbaby hair is more than I expected. The package of the hair is enough for a full head. The hair comes in 3 bundles. Each bundle is 3.5oz. This hair is 5A grade Brazilian Virgin Human Hair. The hair is soft and wavy, tangle free.
This hair can be straighten , bleached or curled.
I order a length much longer than I normally wear but was able to cut to the length I like without losing the body waves.

I received this product at a discount for a review. This is my opinion of the product.

A few months back a friend of mine styled my hair with a product similar to this which cost three times the cost. I was thrilled with the results, and wanted one for myself, but just couldn't see spending so much money on something that I'd rarely use. Imagine my surprise when I found this one online for a fraction of the price!

So does it work is probably all that you're concerned about. In one word: YES! I actually put this to the test of "only 8 seconds" to style! I put it at only 200% during my test, which is almost half of the reccomend end temperature for my hair type. I did this to give the product a true test. Sure, it worked excellent at the highest temperature setting, but what snoot those who don't want too much heat damage? Well, I'm happy to report that even at half the heat, and at only 8 seconds, this product worked beautifully! Wow! I simply did slow strokes through each section of my hair and the outcome was beautiful!
Now, with the test at full temperature and longer than 8 seconds, well that came out just as great as a flat iron. I found that this unit glided freely through my hair with minimal pulling. I passed the brush through each section slowly 2-3 times each. In the end my hair was shiny, smooth, and full of life!
The bristle portion is far safer than a traditional flat iron as well. The cord is extremely thick, and the unit has a nice weight to it. The temperature is easily adjusted by pressing the buttons next to the led display.
In conclusion: for a girl with extremely long straight hair, this unit performed beautifully. Sure, it takes a bit more work than a straight iron since heat is only being applied from one side as opposed to two. However, my hair was able to keep its bounce because of it! My hair is always so stiff after a use with an iron, not so with this brush. I highly approve. Sample provided for evaluation.

I am going to be straight up with you all. When I found out I was receiving these products to review I was sort of nervous. For one thing I have not used an eyelash curler since I was a teen. Second of all, I was really not sure at all about the hair remover. It looked like something that would be used in torture. Now that I have used them, (after my daughter took the initial test run and she turned out okay) I love them!

First of all they are pretty tools in pretty boxes! They are so girly and pretty and pink, and red, and I love that! I thought that being pink that my husband would leave them be as he is always using my tools, but nope, he got a splinter woodworking tonight and came out after getting it out of his skin and asked where the pink tweezers came from. I gave him the run down about it and he said they were a lot better than our other tweezers, which for the record were pretty good too!

Now I will say, the hair remover can be a bit painful but no more painful than trying to tweeze those delicate areas. It does the job a lot faster too. I have fair skin and light facial hair so unless in the sun you can barely see it but in the sun I look a bit furry, even at my lip line. I have used the hair remover on my upper lip and corners of my mouth and while it didn't feel great, it was not too bad and now I have a smooth lip! I also did my hairline and face. It works after you get the hang of it which didn't take long to do.

I was surprised with the lash curler. I remember the curlers from my youth, always sticking on my lashes, pulling them out, but I also do not remember them having the nice slick black stuff on them. I guess we have come a long way in non stick surfaces! I also learned my lashes are naturally longer on my right eye than my left. Interesting, never noticed that before. I can now have lovely curly lashes before applying mascara!

Lastly, the tweezers ... nothing can compare to a great tweezer! I hate when the ends do not come together completely, useless. These tweezers are perfect and really get the job done.

I like having my "girly" tools now, they are pretty to use, and I know it seems shallow, but when I have to pluck, tweeze, and remove hair from my face, I prefer to do it with something pretty rather than utilitarian!

And yes for the record I did get this free but I would never review something I do not personally enjoy using.

I’d been curious about whether pheromone perfume really worked, so after reading some reviews, I settled on this scent. My SO and I had hit a MAJOR rough patch..barely speaking for almost two weeks.. the day it arrived, I showered that evening and rolled some on the back of my neck, and a little on my wrists, then went down to plop on the couch about 18” or so from him..within 2 minutes, (I swear this is true) he turned towards me and in that sweet voice that I hadn’t heard in so long.. really seemed to be looking deeply at me and uttered ‘Damn baby. I don’t know what it is but you smell effing fantastic’ as he reached over and put his face deep into my neck. AFTER BARELY SPEAKING FOR OVER TWO WEEKS!! And now THIS?? You’re not getting details of how the rest of the evening went ; )
but I promise it wasn’t easy stifling a giggle while wondering if this stuff is REALLY that powerful..or what other forces were at work? And yes, three weeks later, the magic is still happening?? It’s not that expensive, I like the roller ball, the scent is very pleasant, and it sure does what it’s supposed to! Oh..I’d just started a new job and today my Mgr told me I smelled nice and I sent her the link! This is my story, every word is true and no one asked me to write this..
Just found the whole experience interesting and thought I’d share?
Order it and see what you think?

I have kind of mixed feelings about this soap. I love neem and I love natural essential oil based soaps. The design of this soap was actually really cool and I wasn't expecting it. It has a cool floral print with a lot of neem bark bits (I think so anyway?) that really help with exfoliation. The smell is a bit funky but it also is clear to me that it's only using neem and those essential oils listed, neem is a funky smell. I do feel like the feel was nice and it lathered and cleaned well.

However I think for the price the ingredients are kind of junky. You can see that they make a big deal about it having shea butter, etc, but that's way down on the list of ingredients. This is mainly a glycerin based soap with a harsh surfactant/foaming agent in it, Sodium Stearate, as well as a lot of other ingredients that I haven't seen in a long time in a natural soap bar. I didn't have a bad reaction to it and it doesn't have sulfates but I try to stay away from foaming agents and given the price I don't understand why they are trying to play both sides by acting like this is an "all natural" soap when it's a more traditional soap with shea butter, neem, and other stuff added. It's true though that glycerin based soaps can be less harsh on the skin but even the glycerin based soaps I've used don't have all these extra ingredients in them.

I don't think I'd buy this again, although my husband had no problem with it - check out Neem Tree Farms for legit neem soap.

My husband uses this kind of razor because he's committed to sustainability and doesn't like the disposable ones. For a long time he has had a shorter travel double edge safety razor from a brand name that's pretty well rated. I suggested that we get him a new razor of this type because he only has the one, which he kept leaving at his family's, and then his beard would grow out for a week! Easier just to get a new one and we were curious to try this non travel one and see if it stacked up.

The rose gold color is really pretty in my opinion and really stands out. It doesn't look feminine or anything, just almost like a light copper. It has the same kind of grip banding on the handle that we've seen on other razors but it's really well done. It doesn't look shoddy or imperfect and has a nice hefty feel to it.

We didn't want to use the included razors so we can't comment on that but my husband was blown away by how much better this razor was! We're not sure what it is exactly since he doesn't have a lot of experience with different kinds versus the one he's been using for years. He was really surprised how much of a difference it made in being able to shave more quickly like those pros on Youtube.

He's still perfecting his shave technique double edged safety razors and we're watching Youtube channels to learn more techniques but the brand apparently makes a huge difference. This is a really surprisingly high quality razor given the quality, brand, and price.

The only thing we noticed is that for some reason small hairs would build up under that razor more versus his old one but we're still figuring it out and the ease of use is worth it for now.

This is a really cute set of a silicone back scrubber and sponge. I didn't even notice until a couple times after using it that the sponge has a little bear face on it. Super cute! It also comes with some sticky adhesive and a hook to hang it, which I haven't used, but I appreciate it in the set.

The back scrubber was a really nice and sanitary way to wash in the shower. I really liked the nubs on it. In fact I end up using that one more than the sponge part and wish the sponge part had these little nubs which is why I'm giving it 4 stars. Also, the sponge part has a normal sponge inside, which to me decreases how sanitary this is. You can replace the inside with a silicone sponge that's just used for washing dishes and such and I do have one of these in the shower too when I need more exfoliation. But this is more than worth it for the back scrubber which is what I primarily got it for. I kept throwing away loofas and sponges I'd get because they'd get gross right away. Obviously this can't really happen with silicone. Give it a try!

I bought this tattoo pen because it had a reddish brown color and many others did not. I read some reviews that said it leaked or dried out or didn't last long ,but? It was not as expensive as some I saw and I decided to try it. I am glad that I did!
I normally use Anastasia products (Brow definer, Brow Wiz, dip brow pomade, powder and gel; different ones depending on day and environment) I am very happy to say I put this on quickly in morning over a sheer foundation(Bare Minerals Complexion Rescue) and then worked a sixteen hour day. The air conditioning was out and I had 84 degree air coming out.
( I got this fixed after 4 visits to House Supervisor) . If' I'd been wearing the Brow Definer and the gel I suspect it would have
melted off somewhat. This didn't budge and still looked just as nice and fresh as if I'd put it on. That truly impressed me!
So now? I have nice-looking, natural brows that take no time at all to do and that stay all day. It's almost as if they are actually my own brows!
Yet? As wonderful as they look and as long as they stay? When I got home I simply used micellar water to remove my mascara, brows and make-up, using cotton rounds until they wiped clean and then rinsed face with water.
I have had some say there is a leaning curve. That may be true for some people, but if you have used any sort of pencil similar to Anastasia's Brow Definer or Brow Wiz, even the Dipbrow pomade? I really do believe that this will be as easy for you the first moment you try it as it was for me. It was actually easier than using any of the above and I ended up with brows that looked like I grew them!
Finally, I have to say I was so impressed with the first few days of se that I ordered another one. This is a product I would not want to run out of and that saves me time in the morning. It's simply that good!

Since I originally wrote this review, I bought 5 of them, over time. All are still working.

I've used Sonicare since before they were bought out by Philips. One thing I hated in over 15 years of owning them is the battery dying out, it lasts about 5 years, and I've gone through 3 versions already. While a new brush will hold a charge for over a week, after 3 years, it will give about 3 days sometimes not, so if you travel with the brush you'll also have to lug the charger, otherwise you'll have a useless brush with no power sometime in your trip. The brushes still use NiCD, so you get a memory effect and to revive it you have to recharge best when the brush is dead; to do so you have to endure the increasingly weak brush stroking and it dying sometime while you brush. You can't just leave it on, all Sonicare's have a 2 minute timer, Quad Pacer or not.

This AA powered Sonicare I've had for 1.5 years, and it works as good as the rechargeable versions except it doesn't have Quad Pacer, not a problem. As a brush, it has the vigor and thus, the benefits of what made Sonicare famous.

I was concerned about Amazon reviews of water leaking into the battery compartment. I've tested the brush since then, and found what the weakness is; not cleaning the battery compartment O ring seal after each battery replacement.

Like many items used for water, you should clean the battery compartment O ring and its sealing surfaces thoroughly before resealing it. The head usually has toothpaste on it that is abrasive and gritty and will break the O ring seal if not washed clean out. All a user need do is during a battery change, use an old manual toothbrush to brush clean the open end cap until its clean of all debris. Wash the O ring with soap and water. Let both air dry to avoid getting lint on the cap or ring. Use a clean finger to wipe clean the interior battery compartment to insure its clean or clear of residual toothpaste, as this is the other half of the sealing surface that contacts the O ring.

When ready to seal, take a tiny dab of vasoline or silicone O ring lubricant between your thumb and forefinger, and pass the O ring through these fingers so it has a light coat of lubricant. This prevents the o ring from twisting as you insert the cap, and breaking the seal. Place the o ring on the cap, and push on the Sonicare. That's it!

I use NiMH batteries, and a new set lasts over 2 months, brushing once a day. I can even use my old used NiMH cells on this brush, and I get about 1 month.

The O ring should last over 5 years but if you know O rings, it AS568A size is -023, change them every 2-3 years. These rings typically cost 1c each, but the problem is finding them, usually they are sold in industrial supply houses.

The toothbrush has held up, so it won't die because of leaking or bad battery. For $25, this unit is an ideal Sonicare. Now if only the brush heads were cheaper.

To begin, I purchase this electric razor because the reviews were good and the price was similar to purchasing replacement HQ9 XL heads for my Norelco electric razor.  I've replaced the heads every year for 11 years and the cutting quality of the heads seem to decrease each year.  So time to try something new.  First thing i notice about this razor is that it is noisier then my Norelco electric razor. Now that has nothing to do with cutting ability but it is a measure of quality. Next, I discovered that you needed to figure out how to remove the protective plastic cover they recommend keeping on the shaver head to protect the blades. For me I kept popping the head until I figured out to remove the cover from the side and not the front where the release button for the head is located.  My Norelco unit does not have a protective cover.  Again, something to deal with but not an issue that would result in me questioning quality. However, after charging the unit for the required 8 hours it was time to give it a try. First notice that it didn't seem to shave any better than my Norelco shaver. In fact after using it for several minutes I did not feel it had cut my beard. Seemed I was feeling the same stubble. I try shaving again and it just didn't seem ti cut any better. In fact I got my Norelco unit out and finished shaving with it. Another thing I notice was that using the new razor did not feel as smooth going over my face as did the Norelco. What I notice was that the Norelco heads sank down into the shaver head which resulted in a large smooth surface for the razor to move across your face.  The new shaver heads sank down the same way but did not result in a large smooth surface area moving across my face like the Norelco.  So at this point I plan to order a new set of HQ9 heads and look into returning the unit.

After years of shaving, waxing and plucking I have finally found the solution to staying hair free without stubble, bruises or ingrown hairs.

I was skeptical of this type of product and assumed that it would be more like an electric shaver and really not be any different in terms of how long my legs would stay smooth.

I wish I had tried one years ago. I have sensitive skin and hair regrowing after shaving was causing a great deal of irritation. Because my hair seemed to grow back in a day (maybe I'm part Wolfman) I was shaving every day and because of the blunt ends my skin was itchy and uncomfortable nearly all the time. Underarms were always carrying nicks from razors. Waxing was better because the regrowth didn't cause itching. But it was time consuming, very messy and at times I actually bruised my skin by pulling the strips too quickly.

From the first time I used the Braun Epilator I felt this sense of relief that I had finally, finally, finally solved that issue! It does take a few passes to get some of the hairs but it is still less time consuming than waxing. And I have NO irritation afterward at all. Smooth skin that lasts. I do have to use the epilator 2-3 times a week to stay hair-free since hair grows at different rates. You can let all the hair grow out and then epilate to keep from having to repeat use, but I'm fine with using it multiple times a week.

I do make sure to moisturize to reduce ingrown hairs as this can be a problem any time the hair is pulled from the roots (as in waxing). Immediately after epilating, I use a cream or oil specifically formulated for use after waxing to minimize any chaffing in the area and keep the skin soft. And I use Tend Skin a day after epilating as I did with waxing which works for me to keep ingrown hairs from forming.

The other great thing is that I have already saved money by not having to buy more razor cartridges (very expensive for a good razor) or waxing supplies. And I'm not continually cleaning up wax spots in my bathroom or putting little pieces of tissue on bleeding nicks from razors.

The light is a great touch on this epilator. My eyesight isn't what it once was so unless I have bright sunlight it is difficult to see where I may have missed hair. With the light, I can epilate at night with just the bathroom light because the light on the Braun shines directly in the area you are working on.

I may have been concerned in the past that this would be too painful to use on a regular basis, but after the bruising, chafing and irritation I was getting with waxing and shaving, it wasn't a concern any longer. I shouldn't have worried about it. I don't consider this to be painful at all. It will probably be a little uncomfortable for someone who hasn't waxed or epilated before, but the sensitivity should go away with use based on the information provided. And you need to be careful using this in areas where your skin is loose. The skin needs to be stretched taut as indicated in the directions for use or you can catch some skin in the epilator. I only had to do this once to remember because that did smart a little. I have only used the exfoliator head once and it was almost too gentle, but is a nice option to have.

If you haven't tried this and you have similar problems with fast hair regrowth and irritation from shaving and waxing, I personally recommend this as a solution.

When they arrived I realized they werent meant to be headbands. Someone just took a string of elastic material and tied a knot in it and called it a headband. The knot then sits up under your hair and you feel the ball and the ends after the ball rubbing on your neck uncomfortably.

I tried and tried to glue these on. I got glue all over my hands and toes but I couldnt get more than 1 side to stick. As soon as it dried and I tried to glue the other side the other side popped up. This did lead me to another kind that did work tho. Buy the bandaid looking braces. They have this clear strip inside of the bandaid. You still need super glue but it will stay and then they do work. The relief after so many years or headache and pain was almost instant. I felt the pressure and relief all night. It didnt hurt tho it felt wonderful actually. I'll upload a pic of the type to buy. Glue it on 1 dot top of bandaid 1 bottom on both sides and stick it to your nail. Go on showering and doing your normal routine. In less than a week the bandaid part will fall off and leave behind just the strip still glued to your nail.  First pic is the kind to buy 2nd pic is how it looks as the bandaid is coming off after a week or so and 3rd pic is how it looks after it falls off.

Ok so I saw all the bad reviews and the score of about 50/50. I lost 95% of my hope. However I've had my 2 big toe nails in grown since I was pregnant with my son 17 years ago. I never get them totally out but I learned to live with it (as much as one could anyways). Lately though they felt like they were getting worse. I had noticed the pain alot more thoroughout the day. A good bit more than I ever had before even. So I decided these probably won't work but what do I have to lose? So I gave them a try. First i got the flimsy clear braces and no matter what i used they wouldn't stick.  So i sent them back for a refund. My suggestion is pass on those kind altogether. Then I bought these. These have the same clear brace inside the bandaid I try to stick them to my nails as is and I'm here to tell ya dont bother it won't work. Then I took 2 dots of super glue and put them on the top and bottom of each side. I pressed them down for a second or 2 and done. It's been at least a week and they're still going strong so that is the way to go people! So moving on now to my unsolicited honest review. The night I put them on I felt an odd pressure in my toe nail immediately that lasted all night. It wasn't painful just unusual to me so it got my attention quite a few times. I was pleased with that because after reading some other reviews I expected pain and soreness from it so that was a pleasant surprise for sure. Come the next day on I havent felt anything. I mean ANYTHING!!!! No pressure from the nail bed changing and/or more importantly NO MORE IN GROWN TOE NAILS!!!! I would have paid 20 times more if I had known these would actually work. Lucky me I solved the problem I've suffered with for almost 20 years now for a total of 3 dollars and zero pain for once! Double bonus!!! Who ever came up with this simple yet genius idea thank you thank you thank you. To anyone considering them if you follow my directions above you will be the next person giving them a 5 star review. Seriously look no further. I hope this helps someone else as much as it has me!

I used this as part of my Peg Bundy costume for Halloween. I had to make some adjustments, but in the end it worked and looked pretty good. First off, the wig cap itself is oddly large in the top. I think this is how it gets the height for the "bump" of the hair. But when wearing it, it's just empty space between the top of the wig cap and the top of your head. And it's not structured at all to help it hold that shape. So I did what any 80's-90's kid would do, and put bump-its on my head, underneath the wig to help fill out that part and give it structure. Also, a headband was necessary to cover up where the bangs meet the rest of the hair, as it was just really weird looking. Then a little teasing and a little aqua net and boom--good to go. I will say also that the wig cap rubbed on my ears uncomfortably, probably compounded by the fact that I had to wear a headband with it. I mean, it's a costume wig, so you get what you get with those, but this was my experience with this purchase.
