So I've never used a straightening brush before. I thought I'd dip my toes in with a budget friendly option. I'm sad I wasted even a cent on this item. When I use a flat iron, it smooths my hair. Makes it sleek. Tames the frizz. This straightening brush did none of those things. My thick and coarse hair looked like moderately straighter thick and coarse hair. Straight up (pun intended) it didn't even make my hair all that straight.

I took my time and worked in sections and layers. I went over each section repeatedly. When all was said and done, I spent as much time as I do with a flat iron and still just had to get out my flat iron to make it right. I feel like it needs to get a decent "grip" on the hair, so to speak, in order to do anything, but the hair just slips right through it for the most part.

If anyone knows a straightening brush that actually works, please point me in the right direction. I'd love something that helps cut down my styling time--ya know--the whole reason I thought to try one in the first place.

I've never used 'beard oil' before, so just for the helluvit decided to give some a try, and grabbed the trial pack (original scent).

The Oil:
At first I thought, "wow, this smells very 'real'"; as in, not an artificial, obviously fake smell. It was pretty strong, and ever-present. I was like, "hmmm, not bad, but also not sure if I want to smell like this to others". Didn't take long at all before I pretty much hated the scent. It's very 'cedar' like, I guess you could say. Sort of like you are sticking your nose right into a bag of cedar wood chips. At least that's what it smelled like to me.

The Balm:
This is pretty much just greasy. Feels and smells mostly like you're just rubbing Vaseline on your beard, though a bit lighter.

The package:
The presentation is actually really nice. Nice little velvet bag with a string, the balm/oil, and even a guitar pick.

The result:
Yes, my beard felt a *little* softer, and was a *little* less frazzled looking, though not much more than if I just comb it after a shower. I'm not really sure why I'm seeing so many RAVE reviews; it's not *that* great. I can take it or leave it.

The price:
Here's probably the bigger issue; it's around $6 for this trial, and you really only get about 1, maybe 1.5 uses out of the teeny tiny sample of oil (see pic). I actually feel like I got a little bit ripped off on the price for the amount you get. I'd like to see the trial priced more around the 3/4 dollar mark in total (incl. shipping, et. al.). I'd like to try some different scents, but there's not a chance in Hell I'm paying that amount again for even 1 more sample for that amount of oil, and there're a whole lot of scents to try before you find one that you might like. On the other hand, I saw they offer a trial package of all scents (the same tiny sized bottles), which is cool, but it's $30+ .... no thanks. Drop it to around $10 total and I'll try it. I'd also like to see them offer that same package, minus everything but the oils (no balms, etc.), just to see which scent I like, and make it around say $5 total.

All-in-all:
It's "ok". If I could find the scent that I like w/out dropping a fortune in the process, I'd probably buy the big bottle of it, or even bottle(S) if I found more than 1 scent I liked; possibly regularly. But currently, I think I'll just skip it.

This was my first attempt at using magnetic lashes; there's a small learning curve but oh my gosh - SO MUCH EASIER than the old eyelash glue that comes in a separate tube! They're very comfortable; like any false lashes they feel weird at first but after about 15 minutes I forgot they were there & wore them all day with no issues. They stay where you put them, they DO NOT budge until you pull them off. No glue melting or flaking off into my eyes, obviously that's a big benefit! They look super dramatic with pretty minimal effort.

I'm a little confused as to why it's best to apply the lashes when the eyeliner is half-dry but still tacky; is there glue built in to the liner as well as magnets? If you need to reposition them, you have to reapply the eyeliner because the lashes pull some of it off. The eyeliner is very wet when you apply, so be careful - you have to shake the tube before application, and when I pulled the brush out, it spewed eyeliner onto the wall (and it was not super easy to remove). So that's the learning curve part, now that I know I'll avoid those pitfalls.

The one unavoidable pitfall is that it is INCREDIBLY difficult to remove. I used 3 different types of makeup remover & still needed to scrub my eyelids for a good 10 minutes to get all of it. Not great for the eyelid wrinkle situation! I slathered on a lot of pampering eye cream afterward because my lids were a little sore. I guess I'm glad it won't wear off halfway through the day, but geez!

Anyway, despite the difficulty removing it, I'm pretty smitten. I used to love wearing false lashes but they were just so much trouble that I gave it up a few years ago. Now I love them again & they're easy!! I want to order all the lashes!

I wear a lot of makeup when I have to perform for movie parties, and my costumes are usually extremely hot, so I can use all the help I can get when it comes to keeping my makeup in place! This does seem to help a bit, I notice in particular that my cheek color stays on much better. When I don't use a primer, it's like my skin drinks it up within just a few hours. So it definitely helps with that.

I really don't see any change in the texture of my skin when I use it, no minimizing of lines or pores or anything like that. I was kind of hoping a nice little mist of vitamins might help (& feel good) even when I'm not wearing makeup, but to be honest it doesn't really feel much different. I tried for a few days & then I kept forgetting all about it - that's how dramatic the difference...wasn't. I'll still keep using it under makeup for performances, when I really need that stuff to stay put, but I probably won't rush to buy it again after I run out.

As you can see, my “before” hair is very badly damaged: drugstore dye every 3 weeks, regular exposure to the AZ sun/heat & pool chlorine, plus I haven’t gotten a haircut in nearly 2 years so my split ends have split ends. Yet this little flat iron somehow makes my abused, frizzed-out hair look smooth, shiny, and healthy! It also feels very soft, with nice movement & body. The photos have not been edited aside from brightening up my bad bathroom lighting, and I did not use any oils, sprays, or other product in my hair after the usual shampoo & conditioner. It took me approximately 6 minutes to style, not including time for the iron to heat up (it’s pretty fast, I just didn’t time it).

I dare say it might even work better than the $129 “professional” flat iron I got at a beauty supply store, though my old iron has been with me for 12 years so it definitely has some wear & tear. Still, it’s pretty impressive considering the very reasonable price for this one! The only minor drawback is the awkward control buttons, which are inside the handle & close to the hot plates, though I have not burned myself using them (yet). They’re also a little confusing and I have no idea what the strip of “infrared” lighting inside one plate is supposed to accomplish. So, I sought out the enclosed instructions and found this paragraph (verbatim):

“Amino-bond is produced with the photosynthesis of ambipolar light of 68000Hz(wave length 680nm) and the elemental amino acid made up of the horny layer of hair so that the hair fiber and its elasticity will be restored, the hair squama gap will be densified again and the cellularity and squama gap will be restored.”

Sooo...yeah. No idea what any of that means! But I really can’t argue with results. You definitely will not find a better flat iron at this price point. I’d give it 10 stars if I could!

This review is for the "Lash Splash" (blue) variety.

I have blond lashes, and the bright blue is very apparent on my lashes. It could be a fun color for someone, but as a middle-aged woman it's really not me. I am not taking off any stars for that... it might be exactly what someone else wants. (I had selected this product hoping it might be a good replacement for the discontinued Cover Girl Exact Eyelights in sapphire that I've been using for years. It's not the same color at all. The Cover Girl product is a soft blue-black; the SinfulColors is a bright blue.)

Because this color is so different from my natural lash color, I really have to be careful to coat the entire lash from base to tip to get an even look. But this mascara gets kind of clumpy when applying a second or third coat, so it's really difficult to get that even coverage. I needed to touch it up after a couple of hours, and had the clumpiness issue again.

[[VIDEOID:391d0888f396cc871e8fb3d7975aeb46]] I ordered this after I saw several commercials. I didn't expect much but wanted to give it a try. First let me say that I am mostly bed bound and a shower is hard for me and a luxury. So I need all the help I can get in Staying fresh and clean.
I got the three pack of the solid sticks thinking of better control and less spilling in my bags. The unscented is the one I was interested in first and the sage and peony next. I got pineapple and a sage with the unscented in the bundle for $36+.They all smell great. The unscented did have a slight medicinal smell but not bad. My goal was to smell the proof and not hide it with pretty smells. The first time I used it after my shower: patted everything dry and applied in all the private areas and even on my neck and under the breasts. Next morning I did a sniff test and all was good except for arm pits!😫 I also noticed that where my excess skin touches other skin with the product, it tends go stick. It seems to have a antiperspirant affect.
2nd time, I did everything the same. And my pits were better.
3rd time, finally, all areas were odor free. And yes, I did a 3(the day) no shower to do the test correctly!
Perhaps it just took time for my body to properly react to the Lume. I am so pleased and happy at the idea that I can feel a bit more confident if I have to leave bed to meet visitors or end up in the hospital before a proper shower can be had.
I like the solid stick as its firm but velvety not overly soft so that it smudges or breaks. Good product. Fair price consider that you don't use as much as with regular deodorant. It also washes off early with soap and water vs del which leaves residue caked on and stains my pits. This does not and my pits look and smell clean.
Thank you to the Lady Dr. Who came up with this product! Girl power!
Next I'll try the other two in the set. I'm waiting go see if they will make personal flushable wipes with Lume in it.
I'm a Prime member and I bought this myself.

I LOVE IT!  ALL THE COLORS ON THE PALET ARW PERFECT.  RJEY HAVE THE ROSE, GREEN AND YELLOW TO NEUTRALIZE AND THEY HABE SONE VERY DARK CHOCOLATE COLOR ONED TJST WORKED VERY WELL FOR SHADOW AND CONTOURING AROUND THE FACE AND THE NOSE AND DOUBLE CHIN.  THE HIGH HIGHLIGHTS ARE FSNTASTIC.  JUST SET THE POWDER TO SET IT ALL. THEN JUST ADD ALL YOUR MAKE UP.  YOUR EYE SHADOWS, LINER, MASCARA, BLUSH, BRONZER OR SHIMMER, LIP LINNER AND LIP STICK  SETTING SPRAY AND VIOLA !!  All the brushes work great.  I would like for them to be bigger the foundation and the setting brush. But over all they are fantastic.  They all work together great.  I do recommend a beauty along to do he blending.  But the rest --. OM GOODNESS its just such a great bargain !!!  Get it for Christmas presents. !!! Thank you to the seller for answering all my questions promptly.

Before receiving Jane & Co.'s Roller and Gua Sha, I had never really used anything like it on my skin before. For me, it was simply wash, dry, moisturize and occasionally use makeup.

The roller and Gua Sha that I received is supposedly made of Jade. To me, it looked more like New Zealand Nephrite or even Aventurine. The packaging and product are nicely done, complete with a handwritten note from the proprietress of Jane & Co.

There is a small pamphlet with a set of instructions that includes a contact number where you can send a text to receive a complete guide on how to use both the roller and the Gua Sha. Instantly, you are given a URl to download the free eBook to go with the product.

To use either the roller or Gua Sha you simply chill the implements in the refrigerator or freezer. This extra coolness helps to shrink the pores and ease any puffiness that might be present.

Wash your face as normal to avoid pushing any dirt or impurities in your skin with the roller. Dry your face and apply a moisturizing oil such as coconut oil, jojoba, or argan oil which are particularly nourishing to the skin.

Take your now-cool roller and roll over your face, from the center outward. The included instructions suggest to pay particular attention to the area around the nose and under the eyes to aid in the draining and circulation of the lymph glands in those areas.

To use the Gua Sha, again, cleanse the face, and moisturize with an oil that is beneficial for the skin. Never, Never NEVER use mineral oil on the face (or anywhere else on the body for that matter).

Using moderate yet firm pressure in a gentle scraping motion to ease out tension from the face. I confess I haven't quite gotten the hang of the Gua Sha yet, but I am still working on it. The coolness of these facial tools feels excellent on my skin and it definitely is a relaxing practice to get into regularly.

Edit: Oct. 10, 2014
BEWARE there are NO replacement brushes available for this model (EW-DL82-W)! I searched everywhere and ended up calling the Panasonic Parts Department. A call center rep told me that they DO NOT have replacement brushes! Unbelievable! But she said Amazon had them (which I knew was not true because I'd searched it already). She said the replacement part ID was "WEW0929". I confirmed the ID and that there were no spaces, dashes etc. This part ID does not exist on Amazon, making this is an expensive, disposable toothbrush.

* * *
I've been testing the Panasonic "Sonic Vibration" Ionic toothbrush for about a month. What impressed me right away is the size of the unit... much smaller (about 30 percent) than my previous rechargeable toothbrush of another brand.

I was intrigued by the "ionic" feature, though didn't see it explained in any of the literature that came with the toothbrush. I researched the generic topic of ionic toothbrushes and learned that they emit a flow of positive ions that reverse the surface of the teeth from negative to positive polarity, pulling plaque towards the negatively charged toothbrush head.

I haven't been to the dentist yet for my 6-month cleaning but will be eager to see if I get any compliments on the low plaque levels. I'll update this review afterward.

In a nutshell...

Pros:
* Compact size; 30 percent smaller than the other 2 rechargeable toothbrushes I've used in the past few years
* Case is great for travel
* Ionic feature (in theory) removes more plaque
* Timer feature helps you learn the proper pace from start to finish
* Easy to use; elegantly designed
* The 4-brushing modes ensures the right speed for the desired effect
* Included gum-care brushes
* Brush is going strong after 1 month - no signs of it needing to be replaced

Cons:
* Designed (in my opinion) for one person - not really family friendly as claimed. It's sort of gross removing the brush (wet) and it takes a little effort to remove.
* Difficult to find (so far) replacement brushes

Overall this is the best electric toothbrush I've ever used. Two thumbs up!

My toddler took a solid two years to get any hair worth brushing; we used this brush and loved it. It brushed her exceptionally fine hair very well and wasn't too rough.
We needed a second brush to take with us in our "car essentials" bag so I recently ordered it again. Something has changed between my original order and now; the density of the bristles is much thinner now. I'll upload a picture. I much prefer the older brush that I ordered September 12, 2020 (the brush in the right in the picture, labeled old) compared to the more sparse brush I ordered May 16, 2021 (left brush in picture, labeled new). Disappointing!
The product I received is 7.5 mL package instead of 10 mL package as claimed on the page....

I love this conditioner but not for the reasons most noted in the reviews. My hair is extremely fine, loose curls, moderately thick and easily tangles.Over time, my hair had become so severely matted that I could not run a comb or a brush through it.  I used the TRESemmé conditioner and even though my hair was smooth and soft, I could not untangle the mess. Pulling on my hair to separate the tangles was painful so I started cutting out the masses of hair instead. Thankfully, I remembered purchasing the Argan Oil Mask and decided to give it a try. I covered the tangles for over the 30 minutes with the conditioner, rinsed and was able to untangle my hair with my fingers. With the newly conditioned hair, I could separate the tangles without pain. Is my hair unusually soft with this conditioner? No, but it sure strengthened my hair and it seems so thick now!  This is a plus because prior to using this conditioner, I had cut out quite a number of tangles leaving all different lengths. I am extremely happy with not having to cut off an additional third of my hair!

Don't waste your money!  This is terrible quality.  It is travel size, but the brush part is smaller than my nail brush.  The bristles started falling out as I removed it from the plastic bag.  It may be boars hair, but it doesn't resemble any of my other boar hair brushes.  The brisles are very stiff and shiny black.  The company does not take returns, so I am stuck with a terrible purchase!  Very Disappointed!!!!

This is my first time buying real human hair but I know the stats and I did my research beforehand. If you are a first time buyer like me you won’t be disappointed with this company. I got my hair and was skeptical about it so I did the pull test and burn test. They both checked out and the hair has double wefts. I forgot to take a before picture but the hair looks just like the company demonstration. I washed the hair first with a co-wash cleanser and let it dry overnight. It doesn’t tangle bad or shed much. It curls well naturally or with heat. The middle picture was natural curls using twist with curling cream and Carol’s daughter mousse. The others were with a 1” curling wand on 330 degrees and coconut oil and Tresseme heat tamer spray. Coconut oil works excellent for this hair by the way. I recently washed my hair with it still on my head with sulfate free shampoo and conditioner. It’s hard to dry my hair underneath with a blow dryer but I still protect the weave like my own hair or better because it is very delicate. This hair is so soft and manageable I wish it were my own and I feel like this is how my hair should be. The hair is darker than I thought but I got used to it. It’s like a dark dark brown. I glad I found real human hair for a low price and 16, 18 and 20” was longer than I thought. I got a closure also because I am 10 weeks into needing a relaxer. The closure is ok but I wanted a more natural look but I still got the closure to look real. I’m in absolute aw of this hair. This is a real honest review and trust me, you won’t regret this purchase.
Update: I only lasted for 2 installments and the second one was pushing it.

[[VIDEOID:7209d8428f4a477d817241841f14470]] Every cat will be different. I have a smaller cat with not a lot of hair who likes to rub on everything. This has bigger scratchers than I was expecting thats a little too hard for smaller cats or cats with not a lot of hair. She was interested at first but I think the size of it is too much and would prefer more but smaller and less tough scratchers.

It includes 4 sticky tapes for each one which stick great to the corner of the wall, even taking it off and putting it somewhere else is great. It comes with cat nip that you can put inside it, which is really hard to do. You have to put it through one of the holes on the back and then a lot of it misses the hole, and when you're moving it around it can fall out but then once it's on the wall, the scent doesn't have anywhere to go. It would be better if it had air intakes on the front and a lid to open for the catnip. She was going crazy for it when I was putting it together but after it was on the wall she didn't care, she acted like she wanted to rub against it but didn't and I think that was because of the size of the spikes.
A marvelous product! Goes on easily, dries fast and, HOORAY, IT IS CRUELTY FREE! Now why on earth would anyone buy any other hand sanitizer???
WARNING! Thursday Plantation is NOT cruelty free. This company DOES test on animals!

I love the spray on my fine, curly hair.  It keeps it in place without feeling like a helmet.  The nozzle is very hard to push down to get the spray out.  I like just a light spray on the crown mostly.  I can easily pull my fingers thru my hair since it's not gunky like other sprays.

I wanted to love it and I did when it worked.  Pretty pink, durable long cord and light weight.  After only one month this one died on me.  I plugged it in, it got really hot and smelled horrible.  My husband said it was the circuit board that fried.  Too bad, maybe just a lemon.  Amazon is taking it back.

This has the same ingredients as Spa's Premium but they are watering it down. The first ingredient is water!!! When adding water, it will dry out your skin! Spa's Premium ingredients list: Dead Sea Mud, Organic Shea Butter, Organic Sunflower, Organic Aloe Vera Juice, Organic Vegetable Glycerin, Organic Jojoba Oil, Hickory Bark Extract, Organic Calendula Oil, Filtered Water, Xanthan Gum.

Plus these new masks are telling you to add a thick layer so you will use more of the product faster. Spa's premium tells you to put a thin layer. My daughter has horribly dry acne/rosacea skin and the Spa's Premium never dried out her skin. I would rather them not have water but instead use Apple cider vinegar but Spa's premium is the only one that has a small amount of water.

When ordering this I thought that I would be able to sue it even though I do not have long hair, unfortunately that is not the case. I have hair that goes a little ways past my shoulders if this helps give you any reference. Due to this I have not been able to really try this product out.

I had never used a water flosser before so was not entirely sure what to expect with this the first time.
It takes a little bit of practice (well it did for me at least) to not get water everywhere, I found the water pressure to be a little forceful at first but learned how to maneuver it to get it where I wanted it to go. It does leave my mouth feeling incredibly clean and I much prefer this to using old-fashioned floss. The different attachment heads are very easy to switch out. The only thing I'm not crazy about is there is really no way to clean/dry the water reservoir between uses. I've followed another users suggestion to rinse out with an anti-bacterial mouthwash occasionally which I suppose is better than nothing.

Overall I do like the PureRadiance Skin Cleansing system - it's easy to use and will work well for almost all skin types, however there are more affordable options out there, this one I think is a bit on the pricey side. The system comes with 2 cleansing heads: a 'normal' one for every day use and an 'exfoliating' one for weekly use. There are additional heads you can purchase separately, even one for sensitive skin although I find that the normal everyday one that comes with the system is incredibly soft and gentle. The system also comes with small plastic cover cases for the heads, a small charging base, power cord to charge the unit, and a small zippered case that holds only the unit itself. I was a little disappointed that they only included a small zippered pouch that only has room for the unit itself, but no room for the different heads, base or power cord. If you wanted to travel with this system you would need to put it all into a different (larger) bag.

The system is super easy to use - the heads snap on easily and remove just as easily. Once charged you are good to go, and the system is waterproof (but the charging base is not!), so you can even take it in the shower with you. You can use with or without your favorite facial cleanser, that's your option. A built-in 1 minute timer with a reminder 'pulse' every 20 seconds helps ensure that you spend equal amounts of time on all parts of your face and that you don't use the system for longer than you should. There are 2 speeds available - slow, and a little bit faster. It is very quiet, much quieter than my electric toothbrush. After 1 minute the system turns off, although you can easily turn it on again if you wish to clean your skin even more.

I find the base that the unit sits in inadequately sized given the size of the wand. The wand is a bit long and heavy, and when you set it down in the small and light plastic base it can easily tip over if not propped near something as tall as it is (for example I keep mine in the corner of my counter where 2 corner walls help keep it from tipping). While it is nice that the base doesn't take up much room, it seems like it needs to be a little more substantial to hold the wand while charging or drying.

I've been using this for a few weeks and it's done a wonderful job of helping remove dry, dull dead skin that is a result of the harsh winter air and is leaving my skin softer and smoother. Using it once a day seems to work well for me, but different options may work better for others - everyone has a different skin type. The system comes with a 45-day money-back guarantee which might help influence your purchasing decision if you're on the fence about whether you want to actually buy this, and it also comes with a 2 year limited warranty.
This made my skin even more oily than before.

This is, as of now,the only makeup I can use that doesn't clog all my pores and is not bright orange.  I have greenish toned skin, which is light and have a hard time finding makeup that doesn't make me look orange.  This one is pretty good in the shade Neutral. I also have unbelievably oily skin that becomes clogged even if I do nothing to it and this makeup does minimal clogging.  I like that it has a little Salicyclic Acid in it. I do not use it under my eyes or else I get drying and creasing because of the acid.

I can't see why this would get any good reviews.  The pink came out a horrible fright wig pinkish purple neon color.  It was horrid.  It also dyed a patch on the back of my neck which I couldn't get off for 3 weeks. It dyed my roots the awful neon purple color and then the rest was a light putrid purple. It made my hair feel gross and it kept bleeding out even if the slightest amount of moisture hit it. I can see this being good if you just want highlights or streaks, but for the love of all things do not try to dye your whole head.

I want to say first that I only use hot brushes on my hair, for years I have used the Conair instant hot brush and I wanted to see if I could find one with a longer cord. The Conair is a great brush but the cord is thin and short. I purcased a Hot Tools brush and it was great although I need at least a 1" diameter to use as I like to. The Helen of Troy brush is so cheaply made it almost looks like it is made out of one of the lids from a Starbucks coffee cup. The absolute worst, cheapest piece of poo ever. It takes so long to heat up that I never did see if it would get hot enough to work. DO NOT waste your money! I will go back to Conair until Hot Tools makes a larger barrel.

I used this product yesterday for my Halloween costume. The adhesive worked fine, but the remover caused a serious chemical burn. I had used the fake blood independently and had no reaction, but the whole area where the blood mixed with the remover caused a serious reaction (the blood was Kangaroo brand as well) The first photo is the prosthetic, the second is immediately after using the remover and the last is the next day. I don't know if this was a freak incident, but I would use serious precaution before using this product.

Most of these reviews sound like they were written by Sonicare reps.

I've been using Sonicare since they first came out. However, when they first came out they were owned by a small company in Washington that produced a quality product and had excellent customer service.

The original company was bought out years ago and the product has gone down hill. I'm sure if you read all the reviews, you will find many that complain about MOLD. My original Sonicare lasted 12 YEARS and never had a drop of mold in it. The next one - etype- I bought began to develop mold immediately. I wrote to the company, they told me to clean it. Bull, I'd have to clean it with BLEACH after every brushing. No thanks.

Typical of what so often happens when a major corporation wants a monopoly, the product quality slides and the prices go up. I will never buy another Sonicare toothbrush. They gouge you on the price of an inferior product built on a brand name with a huge reputation, then they gouge you on the replacement heads forever after. Well, I suggest looking around. There are a lot of excellent new ones on the market.

I gave it two stars because it does a good job cleaning - if you don't mind sticking something in your mouth that has mold over every surface under the brush. And please, don't tell me I don't "clean it good enough," that's corporate crap.
PRICE IS NUTS. I bought this several times & love it. But it was under $15-- or even less.  Check the direct Canadian  DECIEM website for fair pricing. THIS PRICE IS AWFULLY HIGH.

I didn't get the brushes picture or the eye dropper with mine but I love castor oil. I take it orally 3 times a week. It kills anything viral.  It works quickly in us or our pets.  Do you have a sick dog or cat? Sprinkle 1/4-1/2 tsp castor oil on kibble and add 1/4-1/2 tsp of food grade diatomaceous earth, then mix together so dry ingredient are mixed well with well ones.  Do not breathe or let animals breathe this.  That's the only caution in using it.  It also helps grow eyelashes, eye brows, and hair.  It will also detox your liver if you do an abdominal compress with heat for an hour.

The AMAZING thing about this 'miracle water'? it actually doesn't bead up like water on your skin, but SINKS in and ABSORBS into your pores, what we in the beauty industry call "high skin affinity". Your skin just DRINKS it up. You use it as the first step after cleansing and toning -- this mineral rich, fermented water will act as your "reservoir" BEFORE you pile on the serums and creams, locking in all the hydration so that the essence stays in your skin and doesn't escape.

I have gone thru 5 full-size bottles of SKII over the years and every time i use it, my skin feels rougher and rougher and the hydration level doesn't seem to go up. This doesn't happen with Cremorlab. Moreover, Cremorlab's essence absorbs better than SKII. (SKII can bead up slightly, so you have to work harder at pressing it into your skin). Both SKII and Cremorlab have fermented extracts and good-for-you water-based ingredients; however SKII costs $100 and Cremorlab only is $40 -- and i like Cremorlab's performance more.

The key points of this foundation:

-A thin, weightless, almost invisible veil that doesn't suffocate skin
-High coverage in a few drops
-Extra Long-wearing due to volatile carriers (i.e. like a L'Oreal infallible)

Because it's so thin, it doesn't have a lot of hydration so if your skin is extra dry, be sure to prime and moisturize first.
However it provides flawless, high coverage to mask all blemishes and discolorations. Long-wearing even in high humidity.

The only thing i don't like is that you have to shake it before use, which is a small qualm. It comes in a dropper style GLASS bottle (not plastic!).

FACT: The founder of Bliss is *also* is the founder of Soap and Glory, so it makes sense to replicate the success of Bliss' Lemon & Sage Body Butter with this *verrrry* similar-smelling body cream. Despite the name, Orangeasm doesn't smell like oranges--- it's fragranced with Bergamot and Lemon (the description states "green mandarins" for those not-in-the-know, to indicate that it's not a juicy or sweet scent -- but more rindy and zesty type. Refreshing and energizing, unisex, and a near-scent-twin for Lemon & Sage. The texture smooths and absorbs just like Bliss', and rapidly soaks in to hydrate without leaving any greasy trace. A definitively more reasonably-priced version of a bodycare classic.

Ingredients: Aqua (Water), Glycerin, Butyrospermum parkii (Shea) butter, Cetearyl alcohol, Glyceryl stearate, PEG-100 stearate, Vitis vinifera (Grape) seed oil, Prunus amygdalus dulcis (Sweet almond) oil, Mangifera indica (mango) seed butter, Theobroma cacao (Cocoa) seed butter, Dimethicone, Olea europaea (Olive) fruit oil, Phenoxyethanol, Dipropylene glycol, Limonene, Parfum (Fragrance), Caprylyl glycol, Sodium polyacrylate, Carbomer, PPG-20 methyl glucose ether, Citrus limon (Lemon) peel oil, Ethylhexylglycerin, Menthyl lactate,Xanthan gum, Tocopheryl acetate, Mica, Potassium hydroxide, BHT, Butylene glycol, Panax ginseng root extract, Citrus reticulata (Tangerine) peel oil, Linalool, Camellia oleifera leaf extract, Citral, Tetrasodium EDTA, Pogostemon cablin oil, Alpha-isomethyl ionone, Citrus aurantium amara (Bitter Orange) leaf/twig oil, Glyceryl acrylate/acrylic acid copolymer,Citrus aurantium dulcis peel extract, Schinus terebinthifolius seed extract, Polyester-3, Gelatin, Acacia senegal gum, Citrus aurantium dulcis (Orange) peel oil, Pelargonium graveolens flower oil, Gynostemma pentaphyllum leaf extract, Benzoic acid, Sodium benzoate, Potassium sorbate, Denatonium benzoate, Dehydroacetic acid, Lavandula angustifolia (Lavender) oil, CI 77891 (Titanium dioxide), CI 19140 (Yellow 5), CI 45370 (Orange 5), CI 16035 (Red 40).

OK first of all, I did not pay an outrageous price for this. Only $16 usd at a Hong Kong drugstore chain called Mannings. This foam is pure visual pleasure -- shake the pressurized can, and press down on the sides to expel a rose-shaped dollop of cleansing foam. Cue the squeals of delight and instagram envy from beauty junkies.

The foam itself does not remove makeup -- you'll still have to use a cleansing oil first. It's more of a 2nd step cleanser in your dual cleansing routine. If it were not in the shape of a rose, i highly doubt re-buying this --the performance is quite ordinary/basic. But the ROSE! adorable.

For me, the visual gimmick wore off after a while, and I found myself using a normal cleansing foam in a tube, as it was faster and easier than using two hands to pump out the rose each time. Fun to experience one time, but not a re-buy for me.

Not all Obagi products are made at the same place -- but i found out that this formula is made by one of the top skincare labs in the US--one that manufactures high-end dermatologist and clinical skincare brands on the market today. So knowing this, i knew there would be *some* efficacy to this product. I actually LIKE that ingredients are straightforward and not full of fluff:

Water (Aqua), Dipropylene Glycol, Ethoxydiglycol, Caffeine, Malonic Acid, Zinc Carbonate, Arginine, Laureth-9, Copper Carbonate Hydroxide, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Sodium Hydroxide, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin

To be honest--if you're looking to reduce eye puffiness and dark circles, this won't do much. If found no visible evidence of that in my use. BUT--it's really good at minimizing fine lines, plumping up the skin, and returning elasticity to the skin. That's why it's called "Elasti-derm", to help coax the skin into being more hydrated, refined, and pliant, thus reducing the signs of lines. Obagi's main active to do that is malonic acid, and I give a big thumbs up to the addition of arginine-- a powerful delivery vehicle to help drive the malonic acid further into the skin for more efficacy. As many in the skincare industry know, anything with arginine helps make the active ingredient even more "active".

The stainless steel ball is not just a "feel good" gimmick -- it actually helps to massage this serum into the delicate eye skin, further pushing the ingredients into the dermis. After using an entire bottle of this product, i definitely experienced a reduction in the signs of my fine lines. the skin was plumped up and the lines less visible, plus the texture more refined. Used in conjunction with a good eye cream and alternating with Vitamin C serum, this is a great addition to any anti-aging regimen. I would surely purchase again.

I take off one star because I do not like the plastic packaging, as glass is the safest material for stability, and plastic has a tendency to shorten the shelf life of a formula. Plus plastics are not as safe we think.

A delectable, delicious, sexy-yet-sweet scent. It has a soft, powdery quality that is evenly tempered by equal hits of sensual amber and smoky vanilla. Not boozy at all, and not frostingly heavy either.

For those who thought LM's other vanilla scents too were cloying and a diabetic sugar nightmare, (yeah, i'm looking at *you*, Creme Brulee) I highly recommend Ambre Vanille as a more grown-up substitute. It's a more chic, sophisticated fragrance that never veers to teeny bopper territory yet will leave suitors mouthwateringly longing for your sillage to return. It would be the perfect layering product for Histoire des Parfum's Ambre 114.

If you loved LM's pistachio body souffle, you will love this as well.
The best part about her souffles is that they last as long as an edp. i used it as a hand cream and i can't stop sniffing myself. I'm in love...

This is my first Epilator ever! And let me tell you.. I love it!!! But does it hurt first time use?! Heck Yeah! It actually took me a while thinking if I really wanted to use it or not. When I used it for the first time it was more painful than any other times after, so it does gets better, but you have to understand that your body has very sensitive places no matter how many times you epilate! So it comes with two different heads one for shaving/trimming and the other one for epilating, this option lets you change caps. A roller cap is to "massage" your skin while epilating so you don't feel much pain (I find it a little poky at times!), the other cap is for a closer epilating now I don't like to use this one in the shower because it doesn't slide as easy. It has a little light that does wonders! It helps you to see those few hairs that are stubborn and you missed. Now... some of the hair it only gets broken, but I think it depends on what direction the hair is and in what direction you are trying to epilate. I usually move my epilator in different directions and angles and it does the trick. I find that the knees area is the most sensitive, so no matter what it will hurt a little. Under my arms I always ask my husband to tighten my skin so the hair gets pull out and not broken. (by the way you HAVE to tighten your skin to get a better epilating).

Epilating is not going to give you that smooth feeling like after shaving that only lasts a few minutes anyway! Another fact is you WILL NOT go 4 weeks without epilating! That's not true! At least not for me!You will start to see hair after a week or two, but this are the hairs that break and are not pull so it will only be a few, very unnoticeable in my opinion. But the hair will grow thinner, so I usually epilate every two weeks, plus my hair grows faster because I take skin supplements and this makes it grow faster.
Battery wise... it lasts about 40 minutes enough time to shave for me anyway!

In conclusion... one of my best investments! No more shaving for me every 2 or 3 days! No more buying shavers, no more shaving cream and no more cuts! It's easy to clean and it isn't as loud as some review have mentioned! Not like a construction going on in your house!

[[VIDEOID:mo1AIMKIF774AF]]Prior to reviewing Savanaah's Organic Argan Oil i had heard of Argan Oil but I was not too familiar in what was or how it works. After doing a bit of research (thank-you Google) I learned that Argan Oil is fatty oil that has been used for centuries, and is especially effective as a topical treatment for dry skin.

While I can't make claims that the Argan oil made me and my wife look years younger we can say that it did help moisturize and soften our skin.... almost immediately.

Notes-

- The oil is quickly absorbed by your skin. You will notice you skin feeling softer within 1 minute of application.

- It can be used on hair, and while I personally have not used on my hair, I have been told that it is very effective as a moisturizer

- Two types of applicators are included- an eye dropper and a small pump.

- A very subtle to non-existent scent

- Produced through ecological friendly and fair trade methods

Final Verdict - While I wasn't too familiar with Argan Oil prior to receiving the sample our family is now sold on its effectiveness in treating dry skin.In fact, due to all of the benefits of Argan Oil we are also interested in food grade Argan oil for use on salads and bread!

Please Note I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review

At various times in my life I have rotated between using a razor vs a cordless shaver. While I prefer the closeness of a razor a cordless shaver does save time and money. The Arcitec 1090 is Norelco's high-end cordless shaver that has oodles of features.

Likes-

- Time display showing remaining battery life.
- Ease of cleaning the heads after use
- Suction cups on the base to hold the unit firm to counter-top
- Nick-free shaving
- The charging pod makes an ideal traveling case

Needed Improvements and/or dislikes-
- Not the closest shave - after shaving my face feels similar to what it is like 12 hours after using a razor
- Not sure why there is such a large cost difference between the Arctitec 1090 and the 1050. The 1090 has a time display and the charging pod, but I have hard time seeing that as to justifying the cost difference.
- Not sure if this product is actually an upgrade from the older "Lift-and-Cut" technology they previously advertised. My impression is that the new shave is about a wash with the old one.

Final Summary- While I enjoy the ease and comfort of the Norelco Arcitec 1090 I am not sure if the added features make it worth the additional cost over the 1050 - and thus costing it one star. However, as a whole I have no problems giving the product a hearty endorsement!

I'm so glad I found this product! It is easy for me to tint my blond eyebrows a darker color in less than 3 minutes. I was previously paying an aesthetician to tint my eyebrows every couple of weeks but she was charging me $15 each time and it was always a hassle to go in so frequently. But without any color on my eyebrows, I have to pencil them in or I look like I don't have any eyebrows at all because they are such a light color. Also, penciling them in or using an eyebrow powder never seems to look realistic so I really prefer to have them dyed. It is amazing what having darker eyebrows can do for your entire face! I feel like I need less makeup and still look pretty good when I go out as long as my eyebrows look okay.

To use this, you simply open the capsule and put the powder in a small dish or bowl. Then use a capful of the included developer and mix it together. Once you've made a cream out of it, you can apply it to your eyebrows. I am very careful to just apply this cream to the part of my eyebrows I want to tint, not my skin or hair below. It can really stain your skin and you'll have to scrub it off for awhile to get it off, so I recommend being careful. After a few minutes have passed, I take a paper towel, fold it in a square, wet it, and put some soap on it, and wipe the dye off my eyebrows. They are instantly darker! I started out using the medium brown color but I think the dark brown color gives a more dramatic eyebrow look and still looks natural. I have blond hair and still think the dark brown looks perfect to frame my face. If you are worried about it being too dark, the best thing to do would be to put on the dye for one minute, wipe it off and check the color. Then if it is not dark enough, use a little more and keep it on for a minute or two until it is dark enough. This product is pretty foolproof and once you get the hang of it, you should have no trouble at all. It saves me $$$ from paying an aesthetician every 2 weeks!

The color lasts only for a week to 2 weeks on me-- I don't think that is a problem with the product itself, but is due to the fact that eyebrows are shorter than normal hair and are constantly growing and falling out. Even when my eyebrows are dyed professionally, it only lasts up to 2 weeks.

I was excited to try the product. Please note, I bought this through their website, the specific type based on professional recommendation, this was not an amazon purchase - but I can't review there. I noticed I had to use a lot of product, and even then my hair looked weird. Then i was taught that you use a little, add water a few times and then rinse under cool - well that has turned into a disaster. Some tangles have been so awful that I had to cut them out.

I'm about to throw out half a really expensive bottle because my hair is dry, tangly, frizzy. Some of us don't want, or have time, to use 3 or 4 products to make our hair look great, much less figure out a "code" to get conditioner in and out of hair.

I know this product works amazing for several people. But if you are a person it doesn't work for, you'll know in a few uses. Don't force the issue on your hair.

I get my nails did every 2-4 weeks. The various nail techs have attempted to assure me that the new LED lamps "don't cause any damage". But I have a hard time believing that a device that makes my fingernails feel like they've been kissed by fire doesn't do ANYTHING to the delicate tops of my hands.

Because of this, I have been slathering my hands in an extra coat of sunscreen prior to each salon visit. But I knew this method was inadequate and that I needed something more protection - something physical.

I have worn UV-blocking gloves before (driving, etc). I have even tried to wear some to the salon with the fingers cut off, but the fluffiness from the gloves stuck to my polish and pissed off my hard-working nail tech.

So I decided to order these babies. And they work beautifully! The cover my hands entirely, leaving just the top nail/cuticle area peaking out. I usually give my nail tech a heads-up in the beginning of my appointment that I am (rightfully, slightly) neurotic and brought some gloves to wear for the light curing process. They have me put these on after they've done their usual drilling and filing, right before they apply the polish and top coat. I'm finally able to put my hands in the nail cooker guilt-free.

I bought these gloves in black so I wouldn't have anything that would interfere with my choice of nail color. They are made of a stretchy, sporty material.

I'm also going to be ordering more colors, because they would also make great UV blocking gloves for outside of the nail salon. Why? They give you essential UV protection while leaving your finger tips available for sweet, sweet access to your smart phone.

I just got my pink palette organizer and let me tell you, this is the real deal people! First thing I noticed was just how HEAVY the package was. I popped it open and pulled out the box.

It came in a professional looking box and was covered with padding. This puppy is solid! I took it out of the padded wrapping and inspected it for any damage. It was perfect, no scratches or irregularities. The pink is a gorgeous color and looks adorable on my vanity.

I put my palettes in immediately and it fits them all so perfectly. Even the wider Tartelette In Bloom palette fits I just put it on the bottom so it doesn't cover any of the other ones. I put it standing up on my dresser but it also fits in drawers.
These lift. They do not stick.

Well I'm glad to hear that it helped someone but for me it didn't do anything good. I have very long hair (past my booty :) and needed something that would soften my hair. I don't have split ends but sometimes my hair looks kind of frizzy and fly awayish. It left my hair feeling coated and did nothing to make it silky for me :( Used Matrix from Target and it worked great.
Way too tight for a woman's average adult size head.  Totally useless.  Not worth the hassle to return.

Originally purchased this at a discount retail store that buys up overstock for a fourth of this price.  No longer available there.  Cream has a pleasant soft scent and is a great daytime moisturizer.  Noticed the difference in my skin within a week of use.  Was using a vitamin C moisturizer before, but this appears to be better.  My skin appears to be brighter and softer.  Not greasy.  Works well under makeup.  I'm giving this

I liked it the first couple nights, because then apparently I slept on my back only. But then for one reason or another I started sleeping on my side, and I started waking up with blackish-grayish cast around my eyes. At first I couldn't understand where it came from, but one morning the grey imprint was so thick, that there was no more doubt. It is a shame, since the design is great - there is extra fabric not to let light peek in from under the nose, from the sides of eyes. They need to do something about the issue I described, because otherwise it is a great eye mask - dark enough to sleep well all through the night and morning. Have to give it only two stars because staining of my face is unacceptable.

This product did nothing to my blackheads. I have a combination skin, with blackheads only on my nose and some on my chin. I have been using this product as directed for more than a week now and I do not see any difference in the appearance of my blackheads. Will still keep using it until I finish the bottle hoping that it will work eventually, but looks like I am not going to buy another bottle of this useless product.
Wife purchased this and loves it, after 2nd treatment the difference was visible and lasts longer. Too expensive though, she won't use it like the manufacturer recommends.

We love these toothbrushes for our kids. In one of our children, it has DRAMATICALLY reduced the amount of tartar build up according to their dentist. They snap on & off easily, are sturdy and secure when on and unlike Oral B brushes, they don't have an odd 'window' in the arm of the brush so that saliva & gunk get in there that start stinking up the brush eventually. I think my only complaint about the brushes is that they are still hard to find locally but thankfully, Amazon has always had them in stock when we needed a replacement and at better than local prices to boot! Gotta love that!

I have since edited my original review. It seems that I purchased a set of replacement toothbrushes that contained 1 of each size when in fact the replacement heads actually are supposed to contain ONE specific size in different colors - one red and one blue. Each replacement box that I have purchased since then contain the correct sizes in each box. To clarify you will receive:
the specific size that you select (either the smaller 4-7 size or 7+ size). You get 2 replacement toothbrushes, one red and one blue in each box.

The jury is out, regarding these compressed sponges.  The feel too refined, and feel baby bottom smooth when I'm using them to clean my face with, per just previously having applied Cetalphil cleansing lotion.  I do know I won't be purchasing any more of these, at this junction,  Just not overly thrilled with these sponges.  I find it amusing reading the work "natural" in the title of this project.......I'm hard pressed to agree because they do not feel that way, to the touch. I do like the size, and shape of the sponges.  The shape makes them easy to grip despite the fact that they, to me, aren't exactly tactile.  I do realize the adage, to each, his (or her) own, and I know every person has a routine, and a way of cleaning their face etc, that's best suited for their skin type and needs.  I would suggest, for the most part, that you review your own routine, in regards how you will use the them.

Be careful! Read small print. You apparently are not getting the Angel powder as pictured but a refill only. I almost ordered but then read the last line of their description, refill only. False advertising?

After it warmed up, I used an instant-read infrared thermometer on the plates, and the temperature varied 80° or more from one area of the plate to another.  And overall temperature was over 100° less than advertised.  When my wife used it, got horrible results; uneven, not smooth.  At least the cord is plenty long, and swivels.  The temperature control wheel looks like it would easy to bump by mistake.

I wanted to like this and have it work out for me!  I gave one bottle a try - via the company website as they have single bottle options for the 8 ounce. I had an awful allergic reaction to this and lots of itching all over which caused me to lose sleep at night. It really surprised me that this didn't work as I do really well with unscented olive soaps with limited ingredients and this has olive oil and water in ingredient listing. I started to itch right away when ever I used it. It lathered fine for a hand soap.  It is also really thin and does not work at all when used for a body wash and you have to use more as well.  Not recommended!

After trying epilation for a few times using this device I have decided that I hate epilation.  It's too painful, and leaves my skin red and raw.  The skin looks soft, but you can still feel the hair.  I'm not sure how this Braun Epilator compares to others, but it's built with high quality, and has a solid feel in my hands.  I will not be using it again though, since I found it so enjoyable.  If you know you will use an Epilator, then this one seems like an excellent product.  However, since I'm not an expert, and probably won't try epilation again, I'm not confident.  The three stars is simply because I found this product un-usable by me.  Too painful, and not worth it.  I'll stick with my razor.

This popped up in my gold box, and I decided to give it a whirl since the idea of trimming my beard with no mess had a lot of appeal. The vacuum does half work. Unfortunately, catching half the mess won't change the need for clean-up--there's less to clean, but you'll still need to do it. So my main recommendation is that you shouldn't let the vacuum "feature" be your reason for buying this. If anything, it's a slight negative, because the opening for the vacuum gets in the way when you are doing edge trimming without the attachment.
The next down-side is the "memory" rechargeable batteries. Basically, unless you let the batteries completely discharge before recharging, they will hold less and less charge each time. This is mentioned in the folded up piece of paper that passes for a manual--you will want to read through that. Which leads me to my final gripe: That piece of paper is extremely poorly done--diagrams with no explaination, unclear instructions, etc. So you do have to read it, but you're going to spend some time trying to puzzle it out before you actually figure it out.
For all my complaining, the trimmer isn't completely without merit. It does do a decent job of trimming my beard, which is of course the main point of the thing. I also didn't have any real noise complaints, which seems to be an issue for other reviewers.
On balance though, my main recommendation would be don't pay for the vacuum, because you won't be getting what you paid for.
Broke in two third time using it
Nice mascara. Lengthens lashes nicely.

Yes, I loved everything about these headwraps. It took a little practice before I achieved this look.  The red was my favorite color of the 4 colors you get. The material is soft to the touch having a stretchy jersey cotton feel, but substantially strong, not flimsy or see through. It's fair to say that I'm a satisfied customer. If you're on the fence about buying these, I highly recommend them. They are worth it for the reasonable price. I hope to buy more colors.

Well… I tried them. Not a fan. Absolutely no disrespect to those who assembled these or shipped these, or who enjoy these or who are used to these… but I couldn’t get past the strange evolution of flavors, and the fact that although it is licorice root, it’s a stick I was sucking on and chewing on. A stick. I’m going to hold on to these in my freezer if “stuff” hits the fan with this world.. I’ll at least know I have a pound of sticks/licorice root to help me out.

This is probably the fifth conditioner bar that I have tried out and I must say but it has given me the best conditioning results in my hair. I have been able to get away with using it in my hair with nothing else or a tiny bit of argon oil after rinsing and I have very long hair. The drawback is that like many other conditioner bars, it is really hard to get enough to put in my hair without being in the shower for too long. I live in a High drought area so I do not want to take long showers messing around with my conditioner bar. A workaround has been to slightly shave  the top layer of the bar off with my fingernail and then rub the shavings in between my hands to create a lotion. I would love to see a way to be able to convert the bar of soap to a more liquid form in an easier way. For now I still have it in my shower, but I’ve gone back to using conditioner in a plastic bottle. I really appreciate the product.

Wish I would have known, but after looking into it we decided to make a solution with distilled water and tea tree oil and pink Himalayan salt. No need to be using bleach on my daughters skin. Returned at Claire's. $12 for bleach. Ridiculous.

So these do last longer than just painting your nails, but I recently used this product during a time that I took a two week break from sports. So, i would have thought they would have lasted much longer. They started popping off in a week. Doing nothing and they popped off in a week.

They do look nice and will use for a wedding or something, but I also find that atleast one nail tends to lose the polish when I drink too.

So, they look nice but do not last that long. It is very easy to just pop off yourself too once you realize another nail is gone.

I’m torn because I want to love this product but I feel like I was mislead with how long the product should last.

This shampoo bar is different from others that I’ve used - in a good way. It’s very dense and seems almost like a clay puck when you first get it, unused. This makes me feel like it will last a long time which is really nice.

The shampoo lathers well and has a nice but subtle smell. My hair definitely feels clean as well. Overall no complaints and I feel like it’ll last a while!

First off, I love that this puts an emphasis on natural and non-controversial ingredients. I have started looking for that in all my products now.

However, I think this misses the mark. It’s quite thick and definitely exfoliating, but it left a weird residue on my skin? I put it on at the beginning of my shower and just rinsed like I would any normal body wash - but my skin almost feels waxy now. Overall I would not order this again because of that residue feeling. Also, there is not a strong smell, which may be appealing to some but not to others.

This comes in such a cute box, perfect for a gift. The three items are 1. a pink jade roller with one smaller side and one larger side, 2. a roll-on bottle with rose quartz pieces in it (but no liquid), and 3. a micro needle roller. The latter is kind of scary as I’ve never experienced microneedling before, but eventually I think I’ll work my way up to it, maybe start on my arms or something to try it out.

The jade roller is nice but unfortunately the second I took it out of the box it was in two pieces, with the larger roller detached from the main handle. They say on their page though that if you let them know it was broken, they’ll send a replacement which seems very nice. For the time being I just kind of jammed the handle back into it and it seems fine for now.

The roller bottle with the quartz pieces in it is a little odd, I don’t fully understand the purpose or why it’s better than a regular bottle of serum, but it’s a cool way of applying any serum you want to put in the bottle.

These are nice and cool and soothing on your under eyes. I don’t have particularly bad dark circles or anything so can’t speak to that, but these are very refreshing and make your skin feel soft and moisturized after you take them off. There are a bunch in this package even though it’s a small container. Plus it comes with a spoon to remove them from the container so you don’t contaminate the rest with your fingers. The kind of gel covering the little masks is clear, and there is a ton of it in the container so that even if you take some time to use up the last few masks, they won’t dry out.

[[VIDEOID:3158725939fb8ccdffa1fd3ca1707063]] This is so cool. At first when I opened it, I thought the tiny little clamp looked really weird for a curler. The box is also huge when you get it and the whole curler is pretty long - definitely not for easy storage. When I used it though, the results turned out GREAT. Basically you work it by clamping the very end of a streak of hair, then pressing one of the arrow buttons to tell the barrel which direction to rotate. It rotates, picking up your hair as it goes. After a few seconds, just let go of the clamp and you have a curl! Brush it through and you'll get the results in the photo. There really wasn't any kind of kink in the end of my hair either as sometimes happens with clamps (as long as you don't rotate the barrel the wrong way from how you clamped it). One nice thing is that there’s a “home” button for when you rotate the barrel too far from where your thumb is to unclamp the strand - you can see it in the video where it kind of rotates back real quick to line up the clamp release with my thumb. All in all it was really quick, less than 15 minutes to figure the thing out and curl my full head of hair!

This set has everything you need for an electric toothbrush. In total it includes 6 brush heads (in the photo, one was still in the box), a charger, a case to hold the toothbrush and two brush heads for traveling, and the toothbrush itself with 5 distinct modes. Really you can think of it as having 15 modes because each mode can be on high, medium, or low intensity. The instruction manual describes each of the modes - they vary in rhythm and power. I used one of the weaker settings as the manual suggested because this is my first time using an electric toothbrush, which was the perfect amount of power for me! Have to mention that when this touches your lips by accident it tickles like I have never been tickled before, but I think that is to be expected from any electric toothbrush and just takes some getting used to. Overall, 5 stars - the color is also super cute, and you can't beat the very sturdy travel case! Just wish it had a compartment for the charger. Also impressed with its ability to hold a charge!

This is the first UV/LED gel nail polish lamp I've ever tried, but it's been amazing so far! It seems pretty standard, it has options for timing from 10 seconds to 120. The best thing about it is that you can set the setting, and it will remember the setting and turn on when you put your hand in via motion sensors! That's super convenient when you have one or both hands covered in wet polish! It plugs into the wall and has a cord that I've found to definitely be long enough, and it's great that you don't have to rely on batteries for it. 5 stars!
Nice! Works as expected and comes with a whole lot of refills which is nice. Not that you need to replace them all that often.

I used this Butecare Serum for 2 months to write this review.

Things I liked:
- I noticed longer lashes and eyebrows. It is especially noticeable when I apply mascara because my eyelashes are naturally light-colored.
- The applicator brush is soft and easy to use
- I still have plenty left after using for 2 months
- I did not have some of the issues other reviewers have mentioned (burning, allergies, etc.)
- Not very expensive

Things I didn't care for:
- I did not notice a change in density of lashes or thickness of existing lashes
- The serum is watery, so I had to gently massage it in after applying, otherwise it moved like tears on my eyelids
- I woke up in the mornings with sand-like dried particles in the corners of my eyes, which I don't normally experience when I am not using this product
this thing is WORTHLESS.  it won't stay in place so you can't really use it.

I have naturally black hair and the instructions said that the bleach will turn my hair the accurate color in 1-2 hours. However, it took 5 hours to bleach a small strip of my hair to dye hot pink. 5 hours! And it still didn't bleach all the way. The product itself is horrible. Instructions state that if you leave the dye in for 30 minutes, your hair will remain vibrant pink for 4 months. However, this product washes out of my hair with every shampooing, leaving my pink highlight a nasty, neon orange color. You literally have to reapply the dye and complete the entire dying process over again after every wash. It's so time consuming and such a hassle. This cape for hair cutting has a generous amount of material in the front but is lacking coverage on the back.
I used this while cutting my Husband's hair and noticed this only covered his shoulders about 6 or 7 inches down the back and left a gap in the middle.
There is not a snap to secure the cape. It is 2 metal hooks that can attach to each other at the end of the elastic gathering neckline. Normally you see this type of hook with sewn in loops or slots for the hook to latch to. The hooks can dig into the neck skin.
The neck area needs to be wider and adjustable more. My husband's neck was very tight in the cape, and it was uncomfortable for him.
The material is a soft nylon with Japanese style graphics and the hair just glides off the cape and onto the floor as expected.
The item needs an updated description as it currently states velcro neck enclosure and also a snap closure with elastic neck. I would also recommend less frontal material and bring some of the material to the back to provide more coverage on the shoulders and back in the design.
I bought this item at a discounted price. My opinions are my own and I was not compensated in any way for my thoughts.

Cute.

Does exactly what it is supposed to do. A couple tips and tricks I've picked up along the way:
1) There is a continuity buzzer that will let you know that you have completed a good circuit (remember the saltwater on your fingers!)
--> The buzzer length is about 8 seconds and then repeats. You can use this to keep the probe in for the recommended 15 seconds (two long beeps)
2) The tweezers are just ok. A person with 120 grit sandpaper and a bit of patience can get the surfaces mating perfectly and give the tweezers a positive grip
3) There are two included probes, and the super-thin probe wires are reasonably stiff, but also brittle. I've broken one already trying to straighten the wire after I bent it.
4) The process is NOT instantaneous... after treatment the hair will still feel firmly attached. Give it an hour or two for the chemical reaction you created to break down the follicle.
5) The process will almost certainly only kill "many" of the hair producing cells in the follicle, but not "all". You will see regrowth, albeit much finer hairs, which should fade with additional treatments.

I was nervous about getting this. There are SO MANY models and brands and reviews out there that I finally decided on one that was within my price range to try, but also had decent reviews. I've had this now for about 4 months and have not had any re-growth of the hairs I've taken out. That's what I was looking for - lasting results. That being said, it is tricky to get used to doing this. It's best if you have someone doing it for you. There are a couple of things to keep in mind: 1. You go one hair at a time, and each one took me about 3-4 minutes, and the instructions say not to do more than a square inch of skin at a time. So depending on how much of an area you want to do, and how dense the hair is it may take months and months to clear a significant area, and that's if you do it every other day. 2.) You will have unsightly sores. You are penetrating your epidermis and electrocuting the hair follicle, so you will get a scab on each pore you zap. I used the Tea Tree lotion they recommend on Amazon and it seemed to work fine. I don't know if it would have been the same without the oil. My scabs were there the same amount of time any other scab I've had has been on me - about a week.

So it's slow going and leaves scabs, but once the scabs went away my hair has not come back at all. It's been great that way! I'm really glad I bought it. The reasons I didn't give five stars is because it said, "Clean and Easy". It's not easy, and when something leaves you scabbed over, that doesn't scream "clean" to me. The other reason is because I had to zap each follicle twice on the highest setting before it worked. But I gave it four stars because it did work! So for the price, and once you get used to it, and if you have a way to hide the scabs for a week, then it's great. I'm happy with the results, which for me is the bottom line.

I bought this online from the Chinese E-Bay market called AliExpress for exactly $3.00.  It came in all of 3 colors:  Color one being super pale white, Color 2 nearly white, and Color 3, a yellow beige soon-to-oxidize-orange color.  I tried it, of course, but never used it.  Forget about how it wears, it is such a weird color it couldn't be used.  IF you're one of those women who can actually use these colors, might as well pay 3 bucks and wait a month for delivery direct from China.  This is designed for the Asian Mass Market where extremely pale skin is idealized.  It's nothing like what we're used to, color wise.  Undertone on the first two colors is obvious pink, the third color is a yellow.  Save your money unless you just want to play with something new and very different.  I had to smile when I saw it here for this amount of money.

For the low price, this is a great palette.  Especially because of the fact that every color on the palette is MATTE and that's almost impossible to find.  And the quality isn't low at all, it's nice stuff.  I have the one that is mostly shades of brown and it makes a really nice nude eye, or I can use the darker colors and smoke it up.  There will be a little bit of fallout during application but not enough that it's a problem.  The pans are good size and you get a lot of product.  It is slightly creamy feeling and therefore blends out really well.  If I use a good primer, I don't have to touch up at all in a 6-8 hour period.  The case is just plain black plastic with a little latch closure that is secure, and it's pretty sturdy.  I think it's a tad too big to carry around in my bag anyway, so it doesn't leave my vanity.  I DROPPED this on the tile floor and it didn't break and none of the powders cracked or broke up either.  I find my self going to it quite often when I just want to do some makeup and not spend all day on it.  Every color I want is present and it's easy to apply.  Really a nice palette for the money.  If I ever use it up, I'd reorder in a heartbeat.

Now for this part and I am sure you are wonder why this cloth is so long well you are now going to find out. With one had grab one end of the cloth and with the other hand take the other end of the cloth use it like you were shining you shoes. The harder you do this the better the results. It will make your skin really soft. Now some of the reviews have said that even though they thought they were clean that while using this really big wash cloth that lots of dead skin came off, and they said it was gross because it left a really dirty tub. Maybe I didn't get and dead skin off because I took a shower instead of a bath I don't now without taking a bath, but my skin was really soft. From some of the reviews they said to make sure that the wash cloths you get come from Japan and not from China because they said those were not any good. I don't know that for sure but I thought I should at least warn you what others are saying just in case they are right. I was mine every couple days because I rinse and wash with soap in the shower. I also I rewash myself to make sure all those dirty cells are off me. These should last for a while and can be used until they get soft and are not scratchy anymore.
