My hair is naturally bright golden blonde. I have been sick of it for a while and wanted to finally change it. I box dyed my hair for the first time ever what was supposed to be 2 shades darker about a month ago. It only got maybe 1/2 or 3/4 of a shade darker but at least it was something. I wanted to try again but was waiting a little bit before dying again so I didn't damage my very fine hair. Wanted to try this in the meantime to take out more of the yellow...

I washed my hair like normal and dried it until it was just damp. (Did not use any other purple products, just this one.) Put a bunch of this in so that all of my long hair was thoroughly saturated then let it sit for 20 or 25 minutes. Longer than what it says to do. Rinsed it out and let out a big sigh. It managed to somehow strip the little bit of color that I had in my hair and now I'm completely back to square one, fully golden and all. The only good thing was that it's hydrating as heck and smells decent, but it's probably better suited for bleached or already damaged hair and not natural blondes? I'm not sure but I will be looking now for a stronger purple shampoo rather than a conditioner or mask.

These are perfect for doing your own Gel nails at home. They were really, really easy to apply and seem strong. So far so good. I am on day 3 with these Guards under my OPI Gelcolor and excited about them. YAY! no more damaged nails! I didn’t have to use OPI bondAid with them. I only used the nail Guard on my bare nails but I did make sure there was no residue or dust on my nails before applying the Guard, I just applied 1 basecoat, 2 gelcolor and 1 top coat on top of the nail Guards.

They feel really strong, protected and stable. I’ve been doing dishes and everything....No peeling... No lifting.. No chipping. My nails still look as good as new! You can’t tell at all that the Nail Guards are under my gelcolor. I can finally grow my nails out without all the torture in taking gel or tips off and no more sanding down. Yep, supposedly you can use these under acrylic or gel TIPs too! maybe even tips that you glue on? that’s amazing! but I am trying Gelcolor first. We’ll see, I will update in two weeks but so far so good. There are youtube videos demonstrating how easy it is to take them off without any damage... These are amazing. Revolutionary indeed! I will update in weeks.

UPDATE: I LOVE THESE GUARDS.... that being said the truth is these lasted for exactly 2 weeks. I think I could of gotten longer if I capped my tips better with gel because the edge of my nail tips were the first area to start showing wear and ever so sightly the guards at the tip started to peel (2 weeks). It was soo easy to take the Guards and GelColor off, in a matter of a few minutes. My natural nail is perfect after taking them off... no damage, no dryness, no staining, no brittleness. My tips were white and not stained and my nail beds were a normal pink and best of all they have grown out healthy and are my own nails, YAY!!! I will never need fake tips again. I am sooo excite how well these worked. Honestly they never looked so good after taking off any nail color that includes plain nail polish which would stain my nails and dry out from nail polish remover. The bond of these shields sticks very well and strong. Also anyone having trouble with gel sticking to there natural nails because of their own natural nail chemistry.... this maybe be a great solution for you.

UPDATE: Amazing! I have figured out the PERFECT combination to make them last longer then 2 weeks, actually they last until I am ready to remove. Here’s what I do... I prep my nails using opi nas99 and opi bondaid then I apply the Nail guards, then I apply 2 thin coats of HARD gel I used iBD hard gel (nail builder) right over the Nail Guards, cap the end of the nails well, then I apply 2 coats of color gel (GelColor) and then 1 or 2 coats of OPI Top coat the OPI Top Coat is stronger then the gelcolor so I usually put 2 coats of top top but 1 is fine, it just depends on what you like, I like my nails supper glossy, a little thicker, this combination makes them super strong. Caping the NailGuard on the end with iBD Hard gel is the secret to gelcolor lasting longer. This combination last for weeks on end without any peeling or chipping. My nails are now super strong and protected, are healthier, my manicure stays for weeks on end and best of all it easily comes off when I am ready to take it off with no damage. The only thing is I have to use my regular UV light for the Hard gel (180 sec ea coat of hard gel) to cure and I use my LED OPI Light (30 sec ea coat) for my Gelcolor to cure but it’s 100% worth it!

These are essentially giant temporary tattoos very similar to the ones you sometimes get as novelty gifts and promotional material.
Like those, you simply peel off the protective cover, press the design where you want it, then wet the back of the paper holding the tattoo, until it transfers to your skin.
Rubbing alcohol helps wipe the tattoo off, if wear and tear and sweat don't take it out first.

The reasons I personally did not care for these:
- A lot less vivid on my skin, than in photos or against the paper
- There is no precut opening for your mouth; FYI, you get the best result cutting (carefully) an opening after you put the tattoo on, not before
- Very difficult to line up with your own mouth
- If you wear these over your mouth, the activity of talking, drinking, eating, etc... rapidly degrades the tattoo, causing wrinkles, gaps, tears, etc...

In my opinion, the best use of these temporary tattoos would be to create the illusion of a fake mouth somewhere else on you body, like your tummy, neck, back, hand, etc...
Honestly, I was just really disappointed with these all around.

I really like these press on toenails for special occasions in the summer.
After you finish a pedicure, you can glue these on, then slip into your favorite open toed shoes.
I would just keep three things in mind before ordering these...

1st, sizing is tricky. Turns out toenails vary widely in shape and size.
I was able to make my set work, but one of the nails looks wonky.
If you were getting these for a hugely important event like a wedding, I might order the two sizes closest to your toes just to make certain you could get an absolutely perfect fit.

2nd, these do not last as long as press on fingernails (at least not for me).
I am lucky if I can get these through a whole day without needing to reattach one of these nails.
To be fair, I am a bit of a klutz.
That being said, I think it's more a product of how much wear and tear most feet get on an average day.
You also tend to hit your foot harder, so one stubbed toe and you're going to have an issue.
The good news is these are super easy to reattach, plus you get a few spares to replace any nails that are completely lost.

3rd, preparation is critical to getting the most out of these nails.
Getting or giving yourself a pedicure before applying these is not just about making sure your feet look their best, the cleaning and buffing is necessary to get the best bond from the glue tabs.
You do get a little file to help you with this; though honestly, most people will prefer to use their own tools.

I really like these as a way to show off shoes and feet.
Attaching them takes very little time and the end result is quite elegant.
Still, I would consider these best for special occasions, not every day.

I am not sure what this spray is supposed to do.
"texture spray" apparently makes your hair "gritty" according to the can.
It is also supposed to absorb oil, so I suppose it's a deshiner.
On the product page it reads:
"This weightless dry texture spray for hair provides a manageable and light hold without the crunch. It has long staying power and keeps your hairstyle in place without looking or feeling stiff"
Consequently, I thought this would be like a light hairspray, but it's really not.
It smells nice and is easy to apply, but does not hold my hair.

In the end, I feel like this is sort of a body enhancer and mattifier, so maybe more like a waterless shampoo?
Honestly, even after using this I am still not sure.
I feel like this is going to work best for anyone with oily hair who wants to absorb the oiliness to give their hair more lift.
Where I think this really falls down is in holding hair, as well as clearly and consistently describing what it's for.

When I first began using these I really struggled with getting them on/off, particularly when trying to put my hair up in a ponytail.
The problem was that when I was pulling my hair out through the circular clip, it would get caught on the prongs spread out along the inside
After using these a while, however, I am getting better at putting the clips in and taking them out.

One trick I figured out pretty quickly is that twisting my hair before pulling it through the circle prevents it getting caught.
The other thing I have learned is that this is excellent for putting my hair up in a bun.
That's probably my favorite use for these because I get a nice symmetrical look and a very tight hold that keeps my hair up all day long.

Overall, I am very glad I stuck with these because, the longer I have them, the more I like them.
The clips which start out as kind of stiff and hard to open, also get easier to slide open and closed with repeated use.

In the end, I cannot promise these will work for every type of hair out there.
I can, however, confirm that they hold my long, fine, straight, and very slippery hair in place well.
That's a huge deal for me since my hair is exceptionally hard to keep up with scrunchies, clips, bands, and ties.

If you like the look of these clips, I do recommend getting a set, but caution that patience and practice will be needed before you are able to make the most out of them.

This cream has a very light fragrance, more botanical, than floral. The cream comes in an attractive little pot shaped jar and is made in the USA and contains imported materials. The ingredients are listed on the box, but printed in such a fashion that I couldn't read them even with my trusty magnifier.
For me this cream did not irritate, did not feel greasy, and left my skin feeling dewy. The illuminating factor I really couldn't notice. Over all a very nice facial cream.

This makeup is very different than any other I have used in terms of how it is stored and applied; however, I really, really like it.
If you are someone who travels or likes to touch up your foundation throughout the day, this might well be the perfect makeup for you.
It comes in a very well designed compact that holds the liquid foundation in a sponge in its own closed compartment.
The applicator sponge sits atop the cover to that compartment, so the entire thing is spill proof and well protected.

Applying the makeup I found that it blended very well using the included applicator sponge.
The coverage level is medium, evening out skin tone and obscuring imperfections, but not covering major discoloration.
Put another way, if you have a mole or blemish you really want to cover up, you would probably still want to use a spot corrector.

The foundation itself has a matte finish with a nice feel.
I've found I can wear it on its own or with a powder finish.

Color matches are always tricky, particularly online; however, I managed to get a pretty great one.
Unless I have been getting a lot of sun, my skin is pretty pale.
I'm basically one step up from ivory skin, which this Beige Color blended with extremely well.

To show how well it blends and how matte the finish is, I applied it onto one half of my inner forearm, then took photos in two different light settings.
In the photos, the bottom half of my forearm has the foundation on it, but it leaves almost no line and no shine.

As far as staying power is concerned, I would rate this is above average.
It stayed on well for me all day when I was not sweating, but would come off a little on anything that directly rubbed against my skin.
I also found this to be a gentle foundation that did not irritate my skin.

I can happily recommend this foundation compact.
I was truly pleased with both the design of the dispenser, which makes it perfectly portable, and with the performance of the makeup itself.

This is a pretty great exfoliating pad/mitt with one key feature I have not seen before.
The thing that sets this apart from similar products is that the inside is lined with terry cloth.
That small addition makes a major difference when it comes to using the mitt because you don't end up exfoliating your hand the entire time you are trying to exfoliate you body.

The external material does a pretty good job exfoliating.
It's rough, but not painful, so it should work for a wide range of skin types.
Obviously, you can also pair it with soaps and scrubs to enhance its ability to exfoliate.
Personally, I find this gentle enough to use every shower, yet textured enough to remove a lot of dead skin.

If there is one extra change I wish the makers of this mitt would consider for future iterations,
it would be to add a loop of some sort to hang it by, so it can be left to dry on a hook.
Still, I can add something like that myself or just hang it over a towel rack, so it's not a big deal.

I would definitely recommend this mitt to someone in the market for one.
It's perfect for a bath or shower, offering good exfoliation for your skin, while protecting your hand from unnecessary wear and tear.

I included a half make-up, half naked skin photo, taken with my phones portrait filter off, to give you some sense of how this foundation looks.
I was fortunate in that the time I spent studying the shades on the product page paid off with a pretty spot on color match for my skin, which had me very excited.

Regarding how the make-up went on, I actually found I got better results applying it with my finger than I did with the included make-up sponge.
I know using a sponge is better for your skin, but I found it just kept blending the foundation right off my face.
Whether that was a result of how I applied it, the foundation itself, and/or the sponge is up for debate.
Since you get two sponges included with the two bottles of make-up, you can experiment and decide what application method works best for you.
Side note, this is way too thick to be air brushed on and can't be diluted, so if you use an airbrush, this foundation probably isn't for you.

Regarding how the foundation looked and felt, I would say, standard.
This reminded me of pretty much every good quality foundation I have ever tried.
- It looks best after you first put it on
- It covers many, but not all marks and discoloration
- As the end of the day approaches, it starts to look "fatigued"
- It will wipe off on hands, clothing, etc... if you rub your face
- You need to put some effort into getting all traces of the foundation cleaned off at the end of the day
- For best results, you'll probably want to pair it with a spot concealer and finishing powder

Overall, this is a solid foundation that performs well, but is not exceptional.
If you get a good match to your skin tone like I did, I suspect you will be very pleased with this make-up set.
In the end, I would definitely recommend this, so long as you understand this is not the ultimate fix all your problems, find your prince, do your taxes, and make you smarter miracle in a bottle all foundations claim to be, but instead, a quality make-up that will give you good coverage.

This drill is POWERFUL!
And I mean that both in the sense of how fast and strong the drill is, as well as how long the battery pack lasts.

I have a rechargeable nail drill that I like, but it doesn't always work as fast or as long as I hope, so I was curious to see how this would compare.
Well, I was blown away.
This is like a rechargeable drill on steroids.

To be clear, there is still a wire connecting the drill to the power source/control panel.
While that cord is not a huge problem, it does handle differently than the rechargeable nail drills that are a single unit.
That being said, for me the trade off in power you get makes the two piece design well worth it.

One thing to consider before committing to this nail drill, which is AMAZING, is that as the saying goes, "With great power comes great responsibility".
Put another way, you need to be very careful when using this nail drill, particularly on the highest setting.
This drill can turn fast enough to: quickly heat up your nails, file right through acrylic and natural nail material, get away from you and damage the skin around your nail.
Basically, you need to respect the power of this drill when you are using it, particularly when you start out learning how to handle it.

Other things I really like about this drill:
- The remaining charge is digitally displayed on the battery portions, so you know exactly how much power you have let
- You select the power level with a dial; this allows you to adjust the rotation of your drill very precisely
- You get a wide range of attachments that cover almost anything you would want to do with your nail drill
- Charges with a standard USB cord, which is included (you need to provide an adapter or USB port)
- You change the nail bits by locking and unlocking them with a twist release; I find this is easier and makes for a more secure hold of the bits than the drill bits that rely on a simple push/pull mechanism
- Reverses direction quickly and easily

I definitely recommend this nail drill if you are in the market for one.
It is extremely powerful, has a broad range of speeds, allows you precision control of speed, has a long battery life, let's you know exactly how much charge is left, and comes with a great selection of accessories.

This lip treatment arrives in a well sealed package and is in an attractive container. The liquid in the container is clear and has a sponge top applicator. After I applied the liquid it started to feel prickly as if I had eaten a bit of hot pepper. The taste is a bit bitter and I should emphasize that it was not horrible, but it was there.
Did the lips look plumper, they seemed to be, but I am Not sure I will use it again.

It took a while to get this review together because there was a lot to unpack with this steamer and all the little extras that came with it; however, what stood out most was how fast and powerful the steamer itself was.
If you were thinking you'd be waiting around a few minutes for this thing to start producing steam, chances are you will be pleasantly surprised by how little time it takes for the device to start pushing out huge clouds of steam.

While the instructions that come with this set are detailed, using the device itself is fairly straightforward.
Simply be aware that the steamer needs to be plugged in to work; moreover, you will probably want to sit during its operation so that you can lean over it for a few minutes at a time.
That means you'll want to find a place where you can use the steamer comfortably, like a vanity or desk.

Other things to keep in mind as you consider buying this.
- The handheld, portable, rechargeable device is a mister, not a steamer. This wasn't completely clear on the product page, so I want to make note of it. Basically, the mister is a nice thing you can use to cool down and refresh your skin on the go.
- Packaging suggests two different types of water for the steamer and mister respectively.
- steamer = distilled water
- mister = mineral water
- The steamer's cord is about 2.5 feet long, which is something you will want to consider when decided where you will be most likely to use the steamer.
- The little extras like the headband with ears and the pore clearing tools make this a great gift to give someone who enjoys getting and giving facials.
- The manufacturer warns that acne which is hormonal in nature will not respond to the steamer
- The instructions also advise you not to use the steamer everyday, nor more than 10 minutes at a time. Accordingly, this is not something that is likely to add a lot of time to your daily routine, but rather something you will use once or twice a week.
- The steamer itself is cute and compact, so you're not giving up a huge amount of space if you get one, nor do you necessarily have to hide it in between uses, unless you want to.
- The steam produced is hot/warm and there is no way to control the temperature; however, you can easily regulate how you experience the heat simply by adjusting the proximity of your face to the steamer.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this facial steamer set as a purchase for yourself or as a gift for someone else who enjoys giving/getting spa treatments at home.
I personally like the effect it had on my skin; I felt as though using it has helped with both the cleansing and hydration of my skin.
Once you get through all the instructions, procure the right type of water for your steamer, and identify where you want to set it up, you will be rewarded with an easy to use machine that produces copious amounts of steam very rapidly

What I was expecting to get with this was not what I actually got...
Still, the real problem is that this hair accessory requires a lot of work, yet produces only a very casual result.

The set itself consists of: scrunchy with hair attached to it, a small black elastic tie, and some black hair clips.
In order to use it, you put your hair up in a bun with the elastic tie, pull the scrunchy over the bun, then secure it with the pins as needed.

The biggest issues I had with this set were the overall quality and the difficulty of use.
It also won't be much help to those with very thin/sparse hair because it only makes the end of your hair look longer/thicker, while doing nothing much for your scalp or hairline.
You also need enough hair to form a small bun to begin with, which limits the number of women who will be able to wear it at all.

The color I selected was a light brown that matches my hair well enough to wear,
though not well enough to make it disappear into my hair style completely.
Since you are ordering from a photograph, you have to simply use your best guess to decide what the right color for you would be.

Other concerns include that fact that the scrunchy shed several strands of hair pretty quickly and the accessories are very chintzy.
More likely than not, you will need/want to use your own pins to secure your bun before you add the scrunch element.
Personally, I had to fuss with this a lot to get it to look right and stay put; however, I am not naturally gifted in the art of coiffuring, so that may be a reflection on me, as much as the scrunchy itself.

In the end, I would definitely not recommend this for a formal occasion because it does look very tousled and I doubt that is something you can change.
If you are someone who likes to play with your hair, this might be a fun way to create the illusion of fuller hair.
Personally, I would rather this set either be easier to use, since it would most likely be used on casual days, or be more amendable to formal hairstyles, so that investing the effort of getting it to look good would feel more worthwhile.
this is a great product that I have used for several years, a solid bees wax based formula, especially  good on chronic dry spots, easy to travel with-no spills to worry about. long lasting bar

I am always up for a new eyelash serum since my lashes seem to get thinner and thinner as I age, but this one isn't quite right. I was immediately thrown off by the gaudy packaging, which included some sort of yellow make shift pillow and a heft box. Whenever I see expensive packaging I always think the product within it must not be that great. And in this case, I was right.

I have no idea if this helps you grow thicker or longer lashes as I saw no difference, but I have a hard time even applying this serum since the brush is so thin and flimsy. The bottle is also super cheap and feels and looks it on the counter top.

In terms of pluses, the box is actually made of real wood so I removed the lid and am re-using it to store hair ties. I threw out the cheap fabric and stuffing that created the "pillow" that the lash serum arrived in. Way overdone for a cheaper product--the manufacturer should spend the money on improving the serum and reducing the packaging.

I don’t know what product everyone else is reviewing, but these buffers are bottom of the barrel. They literally do nothing.  Weird grit level and oddly soft.  Wholly ineffective.  Maybe I got a bad batch, but man oh man I wholeheartedly do not recommend.

I bough this kit about a week ago. I wasn't sure if it was going to work. Once I used it I was impressed at how it actually worked. This kit has made my teeth a more natural white and I really love the results. I used it as instructed and had no issues. I finished my last treatment yesterday and I'm very impressed. I don't really drink coffee but I do have soft drinks and I haven't had any issues. Before using this product I had tested using white strips and hated every time I had to use them and in the long term the investment was the same and this provided better and faster results.

I didn't get to use the product so this is just a review on the packaging. I've read many reviews saying the tape seal on the box it comes in is broken but decided to take a chance. Oh so disappointed. Mine also came with sticker seal broken. Normally it's fine because products like these have those seals or the ring that would break off when you twist open the cap. This one didn't so I have no idea if it was ever used. And since it's going into eyes, that's kind of scary for me.
I did however try dispensing drops on my hand just to test the pump because I read reviews about people loving the pump. Personally, not a fan. It takes a few pumps for a droplet to drop. Usually other products would be fine after that initial pumping but this one just remained the same, needing 2-3pumps to dispense a droplet.
I didn't bother ordering another one because I didn't want to bother with the risk of its seal being broken again. I really nope they start using stronger seal tape that doesn't break if the box is bent or just put some tape on the bottle itself because for those who used it they say it's great.

I didn't like this at all. My hair is layered, so it was quite difficult to wrap my hair around the tubes. My curls also didn't last too long. It straightened out about 30 mins to an hour later. My neck was also hurting the next day. If you have long hair that's all the same length then maybe it'll work for you. But, it didn't work for me.
I HAVE WIDE FINGERS AND THEY FIT GOOD THANK YOU

There are no useful instructions on how to use this product. For something like this it typically matters how long it sits or if it is left to dry out. I took a guess and let it sit for one hour. I applied a line of the gel over the threshold of the shower where the door seal sits. This area often accumulates mold. The smell is not as strong as other cleaning solutions I have used, but there is a light chemical smell. It comes with a pair of disposable gloves but I did not use them. Since it is a gel it is fairly easy to handle without making a mess. After one hour I wiped it clean with a damp cloth. On the tile it works about the same as soap and water. It still required some scrubbing in certain areas. On the door seal it performed much better. The areas where the gel was applied cleared up not only the mold, but also the soap scum which would not wipe away with just the wet cloth alone. Overall it seems to work fairly well, but it is hard to say how well with no instructions provided. It may take some trial and error to maximize the performance of the gel.

I’ve got the KXAMELIE mountain green short nail set. It’s a lovely hunter green, as pictured, but that’s about it. They’re not nearly as nice or thick as advertised. I don’t think they’re UV gel, just plastic.

The instructions are vague and unhelpful for beginners and you have to carefully peel off a sticker just to read them. I really wanted to like these nails, yet the glue tab system is a real pain in the neck! You have to get it on your nail, wrestle off the plastic cover, hold under a hair dryer until it looks wet or your skin feels like it’s gonna fall off, pop the nail on and hope it’s straight, and then repeat over and over and over. I guess I could’ve used liquid glue but I didn’t have any handy that day so…. I will say the glue stickers were stronger than I was expecting. They remind me of those little glue dots you get on stuff in the mail sometimes.

My biggest beef with these is that they all come with jagged edges on the ends(however they were manufactured I presume) that snag on things and zero instructions on how to file or trim them. Just a tiny cardboard file tossed in.

Also, beware if you have small hands, which I do, so I’ve run into this problem a lot. The nail sizes are either a bit too small or too big. There’s no good in-between and you can see the gaps in the pictures. I prefer a little gapping to the plastic overlap digging into my skin. Trust me, they looked worse in person, tho. I was kind of embarrassed to wear them at work.

Overall, better than dollar store quality but not by much. Not for beginners due to the hassle. I wouldn’t try again as they only held up for a day. It was the rare color that lured me in.

This product is a perfect example of a good product compromised by packaging. Each of the four pampering products was lovely: the body butter was rich and moisturizing without leaving the skin feeling greasy, the scrub had a good texture that never scratched or left skin dried out; the body wash felt great and cleansing, and even the bath salts, the weakest offering in the bunch, left the water pleasantly scented with a fresh, sparkling pineapple scent. Indeed, if you are a pineapple fan the combination of all these products is heavenly.

But the creams and potions are difficult to extract from their packaging! Instead of bottles or pots, a sealed envelope is used, similar to the ones you might purchase loose tea in. It takes up less room and weighs less than traditional packaging, so this option is very environmentally friendly. I was able to squeeze the body cream and body wash out in a manner similar to pushing toothpaste out of a tube, but I wasn’t able to get everything. The bath salts shook right out, so that wasn’t bad. But oh, the scrub! I loved the texture of the scrub but it was impossible to get out. It wouldn’t squeeze out and it was too sticky to pour, so I had to try and reach in and scoop it out with my fingertips. I gave up after using less than half of it because so much of the scrub got pushed into the deep corners of the envelope that I couldn’t get to it.

I recommend skipping this travel option and buying full-sized products instead. They’re great to use and very moisturizing for the skin - I would rate most of them 4 or 5 stars if not for the travel packaging.

As a person who wants my makeup to stay put throughout the day, I'm always looking for something new that will hopefully work. I'm surprised with how well this helps my makeup last on my oil prone face. I also use this alongside my Revlon primer which is a spread on formula, and Urban Decay's All Nighter, but I saw how much of a difference it made when I started spraying on N3 Primer Spray after using Revlon's.

My face does get oily after my shift at work and I don't even do anything that would cause me to sweat since I have a desk job but this has curbed that shiny face a whole lot and I can get off work and look in the mirror and notice that my makeup is still in place and looking good unlike how it used to look before, patchy and uneven, almost as if the oil on my face started to make my foundation separate and I hated it because it looked terrible. I'm so glad I gave this primer spray a try.

The spray has a pleasant smell and I like that it's also a big bottle which will last me for a while. I am definitely adding this product back to my makeup routine once I run out.

This wig is more black than purple in real life, but I think it looks better that way. It seems to be a nice, high quality costume wig able to fit various head sizes. The tall braid standing up is thick and plump, not likely to deflate or fall over on its own, but it does make the wig a little unbalanced. A real person will be able to compensate easily, but my little foam head here was struggling.

This set came with a wig cap, earrings (one had a defect on the "gem"), a necklace that was lightweight, a spider clip for the hair, and two braid clips. I wasn't really sure what to do with the braid clips or how to clip them into the hair, as there didn't seem to be any flexibility in the prongs to get hair between them, but some searching revealed that they probably should be twisted up around the braid. I did that, as pictured, and you can see how I was able to hide the way the main braid was held in place with a rubber band at the end.

All in all, this was a fun little set that I think a fan of the movie Hocus Pocus will get a laugh at. It might not be the most faithful recreation, but if you don't have the time or skills to make this hairstyle for yourself, it will suit a cosplay nicely.

As a E.L.F. (A Super Junior Fan), I'm so happy to be trying out these sheet mask that my idols promote. This specific set of mask gives you a variety so you can really give you skin a bit of treatment for everything.

I gotta say I do love using sheet mask, they always provide my skin the extra glow and moisture it needs during the harsh winters. These face mask have plenty of serum on the mask and inside the packaging that you can lather on your skin. I purchased the aqua pack because I needed more moisture overall. Each of the different mask has a different purpose so read the description before you make your selection.

Each of the mask are individually wrapped so they're perfect to take on the go or in an overnight bag. All you need to do is open and unwrap the folded mask and align it with your face. Compared to many other sheet mask, these fit my face shape perfectly without having all these air bubbles. Leave it on your face for 15-20 minutes and then rub the additional juices and slap your face slightly so it absorbed completely. You don't need to wash your face again after using the mask.

Why? Why? Why? I've been using this gentle cleanser for years - so many that I can't remember when I first used it. I've loyally used it through 3 name changes, packaging changes, and now new branding and packaging (why the same blue that that everyone else uses and a teeny-tiny logo that you can't read? Does not stand out on the shelf.) and a new formulation. But, with this new formulation, it is the end of the line for me. They made sunflower seed oil the most prominent ingredient besides water. It makes the cleanser oily - my face, hands, and washcloth are coated in sticky, oily residue mess that I can't get off. Gross. If I want oil on my skin, I will decide to put it there - and it would NEVER be sunflower seed oil. I don't add sunflower seed oil to my food - why would I want it all over my skin, my largest organ? It's just awful. I use several Earth Science products - I really like the brand. But this is not going to be one of them moving forward. So sad, it's like a bad break-up that I didn't see coming....

First the good things. It works. In fact, I found the battery life to be outstanding. I took the toothbrush on a 12 day trip and it lasted that long despite only being rated for 10 days. It cleans your teeth pretty well. I also like the pressure indicator that lets you know if you're pushing too hard. Because it's fully functional, I don't feel like I can give it less than 3 stars. But here's why it doesn't get more.

First, the brush cycle. I've used other electric toothbrushes that also have the concept of a brush cycle, a beep, series of beeps, difference in the brush, whatever, that informs you to switch to a different area of your mouth. This toothbrush has that too and it works. Then it keeps working. The others I've used ran through the full cycle then turned off. This one, just kept going. You have to manually switch it off before it will stop. It's not a big deal since I know what part of my teeth I'm brushing, but it's part of the general behavior that I don't like.

Next, drool. Again, I've used other tooth brushes and I know that you have to maintain a good seal or you'll spray things everywhere and/or drool all over your chest. But with this brush, I was getting drool despite maintaining a good seal. I was very careful and always was leaking. Why exactly? I'm not sure, but I attribute it somehow to the shape or action or ergonomics.

Finally, the easiest to fix, I think the brush is way to strong. If I were to continue using this, I'd need a softer brush.

It might just be me, but I'm just not crazy about it even though it works adequately.

They made this out to be pocketable. It's not really, too thick, but it's also not crazy large like the Equigroomer is. I wanted to try this out before seeing if I should buy the equigroomer. OVERALL, impressed.

Pros:
-Dual blades, one for short hairs and one for medium-long hairs.
-EASY and reliable self-cleaning, retract the blades and easy to pull off the hair, also like how the hair (as long as you don't have a fan or a large gust of wind) stays on the surface of the comb. Making it easy to collect. and dispose of.

Cons:
-DOESN'T LOCK into position, so, I'd be mid combing my dogs and the blade would slowly crawl back inside and I'd only realize it since it would start to feel smooth, or there wasn't the expected resistance. SO you have to develop a combing method where your thumb sits behind the slider to keep the blades from retracting.
-CHUNKY, not bad for IN-HAND feel, but they made this out to be pocketable, it's not. I mean it is if you have baggy pants or cargo pockets. The thing is about 4x2x1 inches. It's that 1in thickness that kind of hurts the pocketability of this. THOUGH, if you're throwing this in a "CARE" bag like a pet version of a "baby" bag, then this isn't so bulky that it's going to greatly consume space.
-Cheap feeling, I know it's not expensive, but it does feel cheap. Like I don't know if this would survive a fall.
-Clogging- while I like that the simple act of retracting the blades pushes the hair out, don't know if the tolerance are there to prevent dander and dead skin from building up and clogging it.
-Questionable Shorthaired issues. I have one dog that is clearly medium haired, It's a dutch Shepherd lab mix; and the other is a foxhound catahoula. The foxhoud thinks the longer tooth blade is painful, but the shorter toothed blade is too short for it to be useful. The Dutch/Lab dog has zero issue with the longer tooth comb.

Tip:
-NOW this might be just logical and common sense to some people, but it took me a while to realize. The best results come from using this product PERPENDICULAR _|_ to the body. I was doing a 45 degree angle and it wasn't catching as much. Also, go with the grain of hair growth not against.

Conclusion:
I think it's a great travel comb, and it's well worth the sticker price. Short haired dogs may not like it and may make it hard to comb them with it, but medium and long will more than be fine.

I bought this for use in the shower as a body scrubber. Overall I was very disappointed.

Handle: There were burrs along both sides of the handle that made it very uncomfortable to hold. The length was great but the odd bend near the end essentially make the handle 3" shorter. You can't grip the handle by the bend and exert any force on the brush. The handle is very thin and the material is very slick, which combine to make it hard to hold with soapy hands. The contour of the handle does not lend itself to easy back scrubbing. I felt the handle dragging across my back as much as the brush did.

Brush: The bristles initially felt soft to the touch but when dragged across my skin they felt like needles. The wide shape is nice for covering large areas quickly. The thickness of the brush made it easy to get into the cracks and crevices of the undercarriage - just protect your boys from the stiff bristles.

Overall I think this brush is better suited to toilet cleaning then body cleaning.

-I’ve used lots of their products…and I always got compliments, but the final straw was their deplorable customer service. I figure if this is how I’m treated, then they most-assuredly treat all the other paying customers in the same exact manner. They wanted my opinion (not kidding – they really asked) so not only did I respond honestly, but I asked a question. Asked repeatedly. Rather than professionally answer my question, effectively teaching one customer at a time - waiting and waiting and waiting and waiting, continuing to ask. Ha, they tried to give me free products, and I refused them. I Just. Wanted. An. Answer - and not to be ‘bought off’, thinking that they were hiding behind emails, with no individual names, but ‘Team’ this and Team that. This may be a plausible solution for some, but not me. What an unequivocally repulsive way to treat a faithful and paying customer.

-I’m not sure what changed, but Lisa Crary (CEO and owner) used to care. Used to have great staff. Used to respond to questions. But certainly not now. The products are acceptable enough, but expensive, purchasing from retailers (I grew sick of the ridiculous price mark-up) as well as directly from Sanitas. Even directly from the manufacturer, still pricy, but shipping was too inconsistent.

-I’ve used FIVE cleansers (Glycolic Citrus, Enzyme Foaming, Milk & Honey, Lemon Crème Scrub, Lemon Crème Cleanser) seven types of treatment products (Brightening Peel Pads, Glyco Solution, PeptiDerm Eye, Essential Eye Essence, Hyaluronic Concentrate and the Serum, AHA kit, Retinol Peeling Crème, RejuvenA) three moisturizers (Topical C, Antioxident moisturizer, Vitamin C moisturizer) and three types of masks (Cranberry Lactic, Papaya Pineapple, Pumpkin Enzyme). Also, a few of the body products (Redensifying Lip Complex, Hydrating Sugar scrub, Brightening Hand cream, Foot Repair) and serums (Vita Rich, Vita C) just to try. The body stuff I positively hated, but I tried them none-the-less, since I *was a loyal customer. That’s just from memory, and there’s likely more. Oh, and their sunscreen. No one could tell me when it would be available again. The Moisture Mist too.

-Pppfffttt, the money I have spent with that line of skin care. The super weird expiration code nearly drove me nuts, but I finally deciphered it with lots of research and phone calls over time. Some of the numbers don’t mean anything, but the letters are the most crucial – indicating the year produced.
-To refrain from giving Sanitas any more of my money, I purchased online from that *huge retailer that starts with an a, that always ships so quickly – and got a few expired products. Good thing the return policy is incredibly stellar, however my time was still wasted. Well, I admit that’s on me.

-The packaging is nothing short of a nightmare, trying to get all the product out of the container being impossible, equaling a waste of money. Some of these products are in a pump style, in which case not all of the pumps even function. Of course, I called… they just didn’t care. I wish I’d save pictures, but anger forced me to toss it.

-Get this! Some of the spas, dermatologists, and estheticians that carry the Sanitas line will *sell to customers the free products given to them by the manufacturer to further promote their line. The audacity of such is so incredibly offensive, and Sanitas should have removed their products from those retailers – but they didn’t do anything of the kind, because they didn’t care. I can easily say I’m over them, and others should be very cautious.

-*Maybe what I have read on ‘job sites’ (where employees give their personal opinions about their employers, working conditions, work to life balance, management, wages, etc.) is unquestionably true, but it definitely can’t be good for the quality of products. *Maybe that’s the reason for the change. Whatever is the reason, I’ll never *ever use that skincare line again…

…and instead switched to a skin care line from the Far East. Don’t waste your time and money. Know this - there’s better products out there.

I love this brush.

It comes with a manual and is easy to use.

Power on by pressing the power button (on the side) for a couple of seconds
Below the power button, there is a PLUS (+) and a MINUS (-) button to turn the temperature up or down. The temperature can be seen on the temperature indicator on the back of the brush and, once you turn it to the max, you can watch the numbers go up until the temperature desired is reached (it goes pretty fast).
The temperature goes up to a max of 230, which is best for thicker and more unruly hair.
The pics I uploaded are pretty self-explanatory.

My hair doesn’t have deep or very tight waves but it gets wavy and frizzy if I just let it dry naturally, which is what I did to test the brush.
I set the brush to the max temperature and just brushed my hair naturally, brushing the same spot a few times but not separating the hair in small sections and brushing small section by small section separately.

I thought that the result was great, as it can be seen in the pictures. That is really my hair, the pictures are from the same section of hair before and after using the brush, and the brush not only straightened the hair but it also made it look silkier.

The brush works wonders for my type of hair.
I can’t guarantee that every kind of hair will have the same exact results and the brush will probably not make very thick hair with very tight and deep waves completely straight, but it will probably straighten and make smoother any kind of hair at least to a certain degree.

I don’t know if it is a long lasting product, as I have had it for less than 24 hours, but I do love the results of this brush on my type of hair.

I’ve had numerous rechargeable beard trimmers over the years but I just bought my second one of these (slightly different model number but definitely the same device) and I’m so happy with the product that I just had to write this review. (I am not being paid or compensated in any way, shape or form for this review.) A beard trimmer is the only thing I ever shave with. (Blade and electric razors give me razor burn and PFB.) I’ve used this product every other (sometimes every 3rd or 4th) day for 5 years. I use most of the attachments. The nose hair trimming attachment works great for when my nose hair starts to tickle (it’s never nicked me or pulled a hair out). The longest comb attachment is perfect for when my goatee gets too long - takes it right back down to my preferred length. Some of the shorter comb attachments are great for manscaping - although some care needs to be taken in the southern regions. Occasionally, I’ll snap on the foil shaver - for those times when my wife needs my face to be stubble-free (if you know what I mean ;) And it’s pretty much flawless when I use it without any attachments as a substitute for a razor/shaver. I would guess that it leaves my stubble about half a millimeter long (~ 1/64”) and the only time it ever pulls a whisker is when I’m shaving against the grain when my whiskers are too long. (In those situations, I need to cut with the grain first, then I can go against the grain to get a closer shave.)

The fact that it comes with a 5 year warranty is a big selling point. My first one lasted 5 years and 3 days (Is there a timer in there, or what?!) but I’m OK with that. (Obviously - I replaced it with the exact same thing!) $8 per year for shaving is pretty great! I can’t really give any specifics on the battery life but it seems pretty awesome to me. When it was new, I charged it about every 3 weeks or so. As time went by, that went to two weeks, then one, and for the past few months, I’ve had to plug it in and charge it after every use. I was going to try to replace the LiON battery but I couldn’t figure out how to take it apart without destroying the rubber grip around the handle. Speaking of the handle, the grip is so good that it’s hard to get whiskers off of it; I have to use the little cleaning brush that’s included. Needless to say, it has never slipped out of my hand; I’ve never dropped it. For those who are wondering, it runs off battery only. If it’s out of juice, you can’t just plug it in and use it.

If you’ve read the reviews on other beard trimmers, you know it’s a mixed bag out there... under powered, poor battery life, dies after a couple weeks, pulls hair out, etc. Not this one. Highly recommended.

So, this is nice and moisturizing but, for $60, I assume you are paying for some perkiness too. First of all, my wife ordered this accidentally but we kept it and she has used it for the last 2 weeks. As you might have guessed, she isn't suddenly perkier. Her words, not mine!!! Anyway, I am going to say save your money here and pass.

I own a hair salon and highly recommend these lashes to all my clients. I apply them to most clients. Maybe my little tricks might help you. I highly recommend this product.

For myself personally, I like to cut my lashes in half for daytime makeup. Cutting these lashes is fine because there are plenty of magnets.

Ladies, lashes are not 1 size fits all so gently and Modestly trim the inside edge(side closest to your nose) of your eyelash to fit to a size best for you.

The magnets stay firmly for DAYS if you use my method. KEY: you will ALSO need DUO eyelash adhesive AND a fine line sable paint brush from an art/craft store and your mascara. THE LASHES WILL STAY FOR DAYS IF YOU PREFER. Or I like to use olive oil to remove.

NOTE: mascara - liquid adhesives - eyeliner need 30 seconds to set both on your eyes and on the lashes BEFORE you bond the two together

1. Apply your own mascara to your eyelashes - I prefer monsieur big by Lancôme.
2. Trim the eyelash to the size you desire (I normally cut mine in half).
3. Apply the magnetic eyeliner with a fine line sable art brush from an art store.
4. Dab a little of the eyeliner on each magnet on the lash itself.
* I ALSO USE DUO EYELASH ADHESIVE AND LINE EYES WITH A FINE LINE OF THIS ADHESIVE YO MY EYES AS WELL AS THE LASH MAGNETS
6. Close your eye. Stick the lash in place.
7. Open your eye and Quickly make any adjustments and move the lash if necessary.
7. Clean away any smudging.
8. Smile because you’re super gorgeous! Air kisses to yourself in the mirror!

consistency is nice, easy to apply to hair and runs through nicely, damp hair and apply. it doesn't come out of the hair easy you will need soap

smell is a smell I enjoy, it is a very citrusy smell that isnt overpowering and wont mask cologne.

now the reason I gave this product the rating I did. it claims to be High Hold, Matte. the Matte side of it is true, it doesnt have shine and hair looks dry/natural depending on your hair color. the high hold is only present for the first couple hours of applying the product, I have had 3 out of 10 good hair days. just to give you an idea of what happens, I always comb my hair back or a bit to the side kinda like a side quiff. initially my hair looks great and keeps its form, after a while it'll start to lean over to one side more than it should readjusting can be tedious.

it honestly feels as if I have sprayed my hair with hair spray and it has volume and mobility with hold.
