I got this thing when I was working retail, a lot of long shifts standing stock still wih only a single 15 minute lunch break can kinda kill your feet especially when you're heavy. I got this thing to help me deal with the calluses and just oiverall roughness of my feet. By itself it does a great job but even using the black tip if you have feet like mine won't do you much good especially since that low grit means it tends to catch and stop itself due to thesafety feature built in to the device.

So some tips I found are:
Use this once or twice a week. It feels like it's made for that especially with the high grit white tip for fine filing and polishing

Use with a cheap dust mask and away from electronics. Trust me while most dust is dead skin as it is, this thing doesn't so much grind away deadskin and calluses as it vaporizes them. Nothing worse than having to dust a computer or going to check your phone and just realise the horror you've created.

Don't use pressure, the machine does the work for you and applying any pressure, especially witha black tip, will just flat out stop the machine.

And lastly and probably the most important, NEVER STOP MOVING. Even if it's a particurally rough spot or calluses, even if it's on low if you leave it in the same place too long you will give yourself a friction burn or, even worse, take of too much and leave your foot raw. Instead if you want to focus on the same area just rapidly tap the machine aagainst the problem area giving it a second or two to cool off in beteween. For the rest of the areas making sweepng, brushing, or lazy cricular motions work the best
The bristles are excellent, however the plastic is INCREDIBLY fragile. If you drop it, it will break.

Edit: I just repurchased this foundation and it is now darker than it used to be, for the exact same shade. Just wanted people to be aware of that! (End of edit)

When I tell you, I have tried every affordable foundation, and just about nothing works for my tricky dry, flakey skin. I also have hyperpigmentation that I like to be mostly covered up. This is high medium coverage, perfect for people with oily skin but works just as well for us dry skin people too!! Every time I wear it I am amazed at how incredible and natural my skin looks. I feel so confident, when normally I like to hide my skin with a mask because I’m so self conscious. I will continue repurchasing this forever!

I recently returned this Segbeauty continuous spray bottle and got the Beautify Beauty bottle instead. Although Segbeauty's bottle seems much more durable than Beautify's bottle and better suited for travel, what I like about the Beautify Beauty bottle is that it sprays similar to an aerosol but you must keep pumping it for it to spray continuous like that. Segbeauty's bottle must be pumped and then a 1.2 second mist comes out and it stops then you must pump again and sometimes you've got to pump a few times just for the water to come out. My hands hurt after using this bottle. Although Beautify Beauty bottle looks and feels cheaper; even the icon feels cheap, I like that Beautify offers a one year warranty if you register the product (if you gotta pay to ship, thats a con). I don't recommend this bottle only because the spray isn't Continuous and you've gotta pump it multiple times for water to come out, sometimes waiting a bit in-between the pumps just for it to work.
No es terrible me dejo el pelo seco

I noticed that the battery in the Oral-B rechargeable toothbrush I've had for two years seems to be wearing down as it will start laboring even before the battery icon starts to blink, indicating it needs to be charged. So, I decided to order a new one before my old one dies completely. This is a little different as a red light blinks when you turn it on/off if the battery needs to be recharged. However, it surprised me because when the red light started blinking, the brushing was as vigorous as when I had just charged it. My purchase also qualified for a rebate so am very pleased.

JUST TO ALERT PEOPLE WHO SEND FOR THE REBATE - My order came in a brown cardboard box with a large adhesive label with the UPC code - I cut that off (in the bottom left-hand corner of the rebate form, it does say to do that) and sent it in with the rebate form and my invoice - all of that was returned to me with a form letter that stated that the UPC I submitted was "not valid" for the rebate offer! I e-mailed Amazon and they were very nice and credited my card with the $20. I don't understand what is wrong with the Oral-B people that they are saying I submitted an invalid UPC since that was the only thing on the box!!

THIS PRODUCT IS INTENDED FOR ONE PURPOSE....."reduce the look of static and dynamic wrinkles"......AND I CAN TELL YOU I HAVE USED ONLY THIS PRODUCT FOR A YEAR AND IT HAS NOT REDUCED ANYTHING EXCEPT MY POCKET...MOST PEOPLE DONT EVEN KNOW WHY THEY BUY OR USE THIS PRODUCT....I GET A LAUGH READING OTHERS REVIEWS ON HOW IT MAKES THEIR SKIN GLOW.........HAHAHAHAHA...........IT IS SUPPOSED TO REDUCE THE LOOK OF WRINKLES AND IT DOES NOT AT ALL, PERIOD....

I own a foot filer (Amope-style) already and was intrigued by an electric nail filer. The product came well-packaged and with some toe seperators, which was a nice bonus. I also appreciated that it comes in a plastic, TSA-type storage pouch.

As for the product itself, there is still some work to do before it's a great product. Firstly, the fact that they do not offer refills yet is a huge deterrent. I've only used mine a few times and the heads are still functioning adequately, but soon I'm sure they won't (particularly the filer) and then it will be useless until they offer refill file heads.

Secondly, the file head itself could be of better quality, in terms of filing power. The buff and shine ones are pretty good, but not amazing, as it still takes a little longer than I'd expect to get great results.

Finally, because everything just work "okay", the end result is perfectly fine. Fine is not bad, but I can achieve a better, more fine tuned result with a quality multi-way filing block in only slightly more time. Changing the file heads vs using 1 block for my hands, it's a no brainer I'm better off just using the block. I have found the buff & shine heads useful on my toes, though, for a quick shine boost when I'm in-between polish and letting my toenails breathe. For my toes, the speed of the machine is a little helpful to be bent over lslghtly less long.

All in all it is a pretty okay little device, but for the price it's not quite "ready for prime time". I can only see this being beneficial to those with hand problems, such as carpal tunnel, arthritis, etc, because then not having to grip a block and make a repeated motion for so long would be helpful.

I did receive a discount on my purchase, but my review is honest & unbiased.

There are several badger brushes at this price point. This one is a decent performer for the price, but for more money, you will be able to buy a softer brush.

Packaging: The brush comes in an attractive box, so you can give it as a gift. The brown stripes in the resin give the impression of lacquered wood, and the silver-colored aluminum alloy trim pieces are without blemish. It’s a good-looking brush. And it fits nicely in the brush holder I have. Some of the advertising copy could use a good going over--it's awkwardly written ("best gift for gentleman"???).

Performance: For this price, you can get badger bristles. For more money, you will get softer bristles, and more of them. This is a modest-sized brush, but it is adequate for creating, holding, and spreading lather. When I used it, I could feel a couple of bristles poking at my face. Most of them were soft, but these few made the experience less than ideal. On a second use, they seemed a bit softer (but still noticeable), so perhaps over time the lanolin in the soap will work some magic. But on my more-expensive brushes, this was never a problem.

Value: A higher price is no guarantee of better quality, but my experience over many years of using a variety of shaving brushes says you will get more if you pay more. Still, this brush does work. And it is three, four, even ten times cheaper than other, softer badger brushes. My advice is to splurge on your brush and economize elsewhere. But if this is the price point you are shopping at, this one will do just fine.
The handle came off the first time I used the large brush.  One of the other handles is also coming off even prior to use.  1-star, poor quality.

The silicon back scrubber works well.  It feels like a back-rub instead of a scratch.  I can readily get to that middle back spot but the length is shorter than I would like.  I am 6' so this would not be long enough for someone much taller.  It does stretch but similar to a workout-band with resistance.  It did come with a little spongy scrubber and some suction cups to keep them hanging and drip-drying.  Overall it is a nice thing to have and looks like it will hold up for a while.

I'd like to start of by stating that I did not buy this as a medicinal product. I had already ordered this when a mosquito entered my home. I had two types of off repellent. One was in a pump bottle that I had previously used and the other an aerosol can. The pump just ran out so I used the aerosol can which my son probably almost finished. I usually say to spray our cloths, hats or supplies like sleeping bags and sheets, not our skin. I was in my home with a tank top night shirt since it's summer so I sprayed it on my hands and rubbed it on my arms and legs and broke out all over. I didn't think it was that bad at first, but it kept getting worse to the point I was ready to see a dr. I tried witch hazel, kosher activated charcoal, aloe, eucalyptus, tea tree, lavender and probably something else.

This body scrub came right on time. I figured, I tried everything else I cud think of, why not this. I washed, then applied the exfoliating scrub and let it sit on my skin for a couple of minutes. I would have left it longer, but I had an appt. to attend. To my amazement, by the end of the shower, the hives were almost even with my skin although I still itched terribly. I figured there was hope. Later in the day the itchiness lessened to the point of almost being totally gone and the hives didn't pop back up from me scratching. I never knew coffee was good for the outside of the body.

I am a skeptic and when I find something remarkable like this product and charcoal which we use for various things, I tell everyone I can about it. I'm a believer.

2016- I'm back for an update, sorry I took a while to get update. Turns out, I did react to the OFF, although there was no mosquito. The itching was stress related and the OFF brought out the hives. The continued use of the scrub and their lotion healed my skin back to normal. Of course when the stress of my son getting out of the hospital was set so I wouldn't continue to itch.

UPDATE: Since writing the previous five star review, the straightener stopped turning on after maybe ten uses. Currently in the process of seeking a refund.

I'm surprisingly pleased. I have long wavy (3A) hair. And it's thick. Super thick. Like, "I have to make my own ponytail holders because the regular ones aren't big enough" thick. And I live in Houston where our humidity can best be described as "lol good luck." Suffice to say, it's a little bit of a problem especially, during the wet season. I decided it was time to start looking a little bit more polished, and to that end I did some research and saw some really good videos on similar products and was directed here because of the low price and good ratings. Reader, it works. The temperature gauge is in celcius, but that wasn't really a problem. I used it on 205-210 and it only took me about 10 minutes to get my hair flat. And when I say "flat" I'm not talking about pin straight, which I had been a little afraid of. If I'd gone up to the 235 that may have happened, but 205 was just about perfect to leave my hair just a hint of a curl at the ends that looks like I intentionally put it there. I'd actually been concerned about that, because the last time I used a straightener I was in high school and I remember it gave me those super flat ends that look like you've straightened it. This is a much more natural look. I experimented with a few different things and what worked best for me was brushing my bangs straight up to give them a little more volume and then the rest of it I just brushed like it was a regular hairbrush. No sectioning hair, no going back with a curling iron to put texture back in, and no burns! The little rubber dealies do their job well, and I was able to touch them with the palm of my hand with no discomfort at all. It even got the super coarse curls around the back of my neck with no problems. I can run my fingers through my hair like a regular person without stopping to untangle anything!

My only quibble would be that the location of the buttons (right on the handle) made it difficult to use without accidentally turning it off or adjusting the pressure, but it does make a nice loud beep when it happened so it was more of an annoyance than anything else and it may be one of those things that gets easier once you're used to it.

This product line is hit and miss with my son's hair:

• Thick
• 4B-4C
• Low porosity

I waited to review this product after using it for a month and it did not yield the results I was hoping for. I do believe the photos I've seen that appeared to have more success were kids who had 4C hair or who were biracial. The 4C hair photos just looked average - no wow factor. I'm not too fond of the smell and it's not entirely clear what's recommended after shampoo and conditioning. Half of the bottles have a numbered system. After shampooing and conditioning; I add the oil and curling cream (which does not work as well) thoroughly rub in and my son's hair just looks milky/cloudy. However, the mousse which I use later in the week appears to enhance my son's curls better than the curling cream but leaves it feeling extremely stripped.

Also some of the items leaked upon arrival. Tried to support BOB but I had a unfavorable experience.

Pros: half the cost of a Sonicare w/charger, less bulky
Cons: None so far

First of all, I should state that I have owned this product for over a year, and I am still giving it five stars.

Here's why: I had a Sonicare Advance for about three years and it worked well during that time, but at the end of those three years I had to keep it in the charger at all times or it would die in the middle of brushing. I was sick of lugging around the bulky charger any time I traveled, so when I saw the AA-battery model at Target for $40 I scooped it up.

Now instead of having to rely on an internal battery and a charger, I just keep four rechargeable AAs that I swap out when one pair dies. This isn't something I have to do very often--a pair of AAs lasts about a month (that's with two two-minute brushings a day). I have also not had any water damage, so the brush still works as great as my old Sonicare ever did. I do try not to get water on the brush and dry the entire unit whenever I finish using it. In addition, I take it apart once every two or three months and swab the O-ring with alcohol to keep it clean. This seems to be all of the maintenance needed to keep it in top condition.

So, if you want a good Sonicare brush that takes up less space and is easier to travel with, I highly recommend this model. I recommend cleaning it once in a while and trying to keep water out of the insides. I acknowledge this might not help if you get a bad unit (as many reviewers seem to have gotten), but mine has been great and I figure it can't hurt!

UPDATE: I have now owned it for a year-and-a-half and it still goes a month on two AA rechargeables. Even though I stopped doing the maintenance described above it's still working like new.

If you're looking for a lip product that really, truly only needs to be applied once a day, this is it. This is my second LipTint from LA Splash (The other was Bellatrix/Belladonna) and both of these have stayed on my lips through 48 hours of wear until I decided to remove them. They lasted through eating, drinking, talking, sleeping, showering, exercising, and just about any other task you can expect to do throughout a day.

If you've never used an LA-Splash LipTint, the first thing you're going to say about them is that they're super drying. I've found that the drying effect is really what keeps this stuff attached to your lips until you decide to remove it. My best advice is to keep your lips in good condition before its use. When I do this, my lips don't get that cracked appearance people tend to complain about when using LA-Splash LipTints. They look more like the advertised picture. When I remove it, I do a lip scrub and put on a little more lip balm and my lips are as good as new. For the longevity you get out of this stuff, it's hard to complain.

This would get a 5 star review, but the color Gigi itself is much darker than I thought it would be and isn't the vibrant pink you see in the picture. I should have checked Instagram for what it would realistically look like on a real life human before purchasing it. I still absolutely love the color and wear it regularly, but it isn't what I was looking for. If you've already looked up pictures of people wearing Gigi and you like how the color looks, this will be a 5 star product for you.

Keep in mind this is hair on a budget. For the most part it is okay and you can make it work. I have been wearing it for a couple of weeks and I have minimum tangles. It curls very well. It is very thin at the bottom though. The closure had a lot of little short hair sticking up that was kind of irritating because it was hard to lay them down. The bundles have short hair in them too. Advice for this hair is to double all the way until you get to the top to have fullness. For the price, not bad!

One month update - I tried this hair to help my ladies get a more affordable sew in but wanted to test it first. I will still give this hair 4 stars because this deal is better than any deal at the Beauty Supply Stores near me. I have washed this hair three times now and have A LOT of shedding and tangles. I stood in the shower to wash and the hair has shedded so much that it will need to come out soon because it is too thin now. This is a good one time alternative until you can get a better quality of hair. I do not recommend this hair if you are planning on wearing it more than one month or need to do multiple installs. If you want full hair, this hair is not for you. I am careful of any product I use also. This hair takes a lot more work than other bundles I have used in the past. I will not purchase this hair for me again but I will recommend this hair to customers on a budget.
This sunscreen is really great and easy going on the skin. It’s not super thick and rubs and well. The smell is a normal sunscreen smell and not overpowering.

[[VIDEOID:4e1b2396d5a93e9cce845b966eb349e5]] Let me start off by saying that I loved this curler when I got it to work. It was so easy and so quick to curl my entire head but during the first use it kept randomly shutting off. Then the next day when I went to do my hair again I plugged it in charged it fully and it shut off and would not turn back on. I tried everything and I couldn’t get it to come back on. It makes me so sad because it did work great when it worked. Unfortunately because of that I cannot recommend this product.

I am 49 years young. I have been using this cream for about a month now. Twice a day. Small amounts. I can not believe how fast this works. My deep wrinkles on my forehead and expecially between my eyebrows above my nose, have almost disappeared. I ordered another bottle to make sure I never run out.

I received the topper hair piece and it is good quality for the money. It was a little thinner than I hoped for but we made it work. The color and texture was good but near the top edge the hair stuck up somewhat and found it hard to flatten down. It could be the way it was packaged (plastic bag) but it attached well. I wasn’t disappointed, just hoped for a little more thickness and coverage. I would purchase again since the part looked like it was a real scalp.

The only reason I did not give this product five stars is because of the packaging. The cap comes off in two parts for some reason. One part opens the dropper tip and the other opens the entire top of the bottle. When I went to fill the makeup cup of my airbrush I uncapped the wrong part of the Aeroblend bottle and before I realized it I'd literally dumped $24.50 worth of product down the drain... and on the vanity, and on the floor... :(

I used the makeup once before accidentally pouring the rest of the bottle out. But, from my very limited experience, Aeroblend is an amazing product. It evenly covered my very uneven skin and made it look almost flawless. Aeroblend blended perfectly with my actual skin tone (although maybe I just got lucky and chose the right shade on the first try) so it looks completely natural. I'd been using Art of Air makeup and had to do a lot of mixing and experimenting with different shades every time I put it on. Even then I could never get it just right. Aeroblend is very light (not heavy) so it didn't look or feel caked on my skin. It didn't even feel like I was wearing makeup. I definitely recommend this product, just be sure to pay attention when you're opening the bottle.

This is a very nice package overall. The brush and comb work great, and smell nice! The stork scissors don't seem super sharp, but they still work well and look neat! The box it comes in is alright, and it also comes with a cute little pouch to keep everything in. My boyfriend likes it and is taking better care of his beard with it.

These are the worst! The material is way too thin and weak. I tried these because Scuni ruined their awesome hair bands by adding their logo to them and creating a weak point. But these are still worse.

They majorly stretch out after just one use, and then randomly snap on the second or third use. You'll just be sitting there and feel this weird, crawly sensation on the back of your head, and then your hair starts coming down and you find a pathetic, snapped piece of plastic hanging in your hair somewhere.

Unless you don't plan on actually holding any hair up with these bands, save your money.

I've used Lume products before and have been happy! But this scent is an abomination worse than any BO your body can create on its own. I was so excited to try it: sandalwood perfumes and citrus/lemony perfumes and deodorants have worked well for me in the past so I had NO IDEA the horror that awaited me when I popped the lid on this one - REEK!! I decided to test one pit to see if maybe MAYBE it would change with my body chemistry and smell more pleasant but Ohh how wrong I was! The smell was gag-inducing!! I decided maybe it was just me... until my boyfriend took one whiff and stated that (sandalwood-citrus deodorant) is "possibly one of the worst scents I've ever smelled. Baby, why would you buy this!?" DO NOT GO WITH THE SANDALWOOD CITRUS SCENT. YOU AND EVERYONE AROUND YOU WILL REGRET IT.

UPDATE: The cucumber melon is 5/5 stars. The memory of the Sandalwood Citrus stank has still not left me...becoming ill even thinking about it 🤢

My maternal grandfather passed away some 40 years ago. After my mother returned from her out-of-state trip to be with her mother and bury her father, she gave me a small box containing some of his personal belongings. Among them was his Ever Ready PBT300 shaving brush. I had no use for it at the time. As I unpacked after a recent move I rediscovered this item and decided to use it. It was really enjoyable, so after a few months I decided granddad's brush should be properly retired and I should get my own. Since they no longer manufacture Ever Ready's, I looked here at Amazon. This was the brush I decided upon. It's ok.

It is definitely NOT my grandfather's brush - quality-wise. Grand dad was a farmer, and not a gentleman farmer. So he would not have paid a lot for his. So I thought this one might be similar in quality. I was wrong. It's very stiff. It does not do a great job with the soap lather. It also arrived with a very strong, musky aroma in the bristles. This is probably what badgers smell like. But as I am a native of southern California and we don't need no stinkin' badgers here, I am not positive. This aroma was also transferred to my face as well, for the first month of use. Just prior to the musky animal aroma disappearing, I was frustrated enough with the smell on me all day to look for another brush. Since my grandfather's brush had no aroma I knew it was possible to have one that was aroma - free. But was it a matter of quality or simply a matter of time?

I purchased a $70 Vulfix brush, hand-made on the Isle of Man in the UK.

[...]

It is much more like granddad's in color, feel, and use. It lathers very nicely. It's very soft on the face. It holds a lot of water. There was a slight smell (nothing at all like the SimplyBeautiful smell)that was gone after the 2nd use. If you are thinking about going with a shaving brush (and I LOVE mine and will only go back to the can for short travel trips), my advice is to spend the money and get one that will last for a few decades (like the Vulfix) and avoid the "badgery" smell - although it did eventually go away. I haven't made the decision to also go with the straight razor. I figure I will give the EMTs in the area a break and stick with the safety razor.....

I am a professional nail technician. Ordered these because I needed straight squares with straight side walls and some durability. These nail tips are very “ plastic looking” and split from the middle when cut. You have to be very careful trimming. Thick at the well so it fits kinda poorly almost giving it a bulkiness where I don’t need bulkiness at the well. I don’t like these tips.
One positive thing is , the tips is medium length. This is a plus for those who don’t want long length. Trimming the remaining length isn’t as wasteful compare to my longer nail tips. For that I give it one of the star rating.

Prepping the nails took longer due to the extra prep of bulkiness and slimming down sides. I trimmed files and applied acrylic cover it. Still not satisfied with the look. It has c curve but because nail tip is not strong and sleek looking, the C curve did no purpose. Applying and prepping the tips alone took more time then needed. Will not purchase again.

I received a discounted sample of this product to provide a review on amazon.

I am a healthy 64-year old male with skin that appears tighter and healthier than that of many peers. While I tanned during the first half of my life, I phased it out during the second. I only use lotion under my eyes where skin is noticeably loose and darker than the rest. Over the past five or six years -- part of this is genetic -- the skin at the front of the neck has become especially loose, while the furrowed lines on my forehead have begun to look alarming. I wanted to try Puressant Neck Firming Cream to see what effect it might have on these two issues.

After a three-week trial, during which I applied the product at least once per day, I've seen a subtle but real tightening of the skin on my neck, which appears to have reached maximum effect. I will assume that to continue this trend I might have to use the product indefinitely, but received no indication from product instructions about this. In any case, there are few products I use indefinitely and particularly those with such an extensive list of known and unknown ingredients. Having said that, I might use the product at intervals to reduce symptoms periodically.

The product has had no effect on my wrinkly forehead, at least not yet. I'll just have to live with it.

The cream has a clean, subtle fragrance (I wish it had none) and rather heavy consistency: A little goes a long way. I've not yet noticed any staining of clothes after application nor any side effects. If not for its moisturizing qualities, I might have awarded this product three stars, but it generates enough cosmetic improvement at a low price to merit four.

for me it was an unqualified failure.

I am trying to treat the knuckle of my right ring finger. It is arthritic and I have treated it very successfully in the past at a clinic that, among other things, used a paraffin bath. The bath was by far the most effective part of my therapy. I didn't want to have something so large to store at home so thought these gloves would be perfect.

I am unable to relate to other reviewers who mention the gloves fit almost any hand comfortably. I'm not sure how hands are sized but I can tell you I wear a men's right hand golf glove, size medium and it is a tight fit. The next size up would be the Cadet which, based on the sizes offered at the golf store fits right in the middle of men's sizes. Golf shops allow you to try gloves on without requiring purchase so this may be a good method to see if your hand will fit this product.

The first Paraffin Hands glove I tried would not allow my right ring finger more than half way into the finger of the glove. My little finger would only go in to its space by about 25%. Not wanting to force the issue, I left the glove alone and waited the prescribed 10 minutes. No benefit. The second time I tried the same glove, the plastic at the side of the middle finger ripped through to the inside wax while I was trying to get the glove to fit better. Again no benefit after 10 minutes.

The second Paraffin Hands glove fit much better, with the ring finger going in to its space about 75% and the same for the little finger. The other fingers went in about 90% being about 10% away from the tip of the glove and the space between fingers also being about 10% away from the palm of my hand. Gently pushing the glove toward my palm to get the best fit caused another break in the plastic of the middle finger so it followed its predecessor into the garbage.

This product still sounds like a good idea but the manufacturer really needs to enlarge the size although I am somewhat skeptical there is enough wax in the glove to give one the benefit I am looking for.

On the recommendation of my physical therapist, I am trying this product for bursitis in my hip. It does appear to relieve the discomfort. I am prone to stiff necks and tried it on my neck. It immediately had a profound effect-much faster than an NSAID. I will keep using this product.

Bravo to the company for the quality and descriptive BS they put into their advertisement video!!!
I DO NOT MAKE review entries unless it is warranted. THIS IS WITHOUT A DOUBT THE WORST RAZOR I HAVE EVER USED ON MY FACE!!!!!!
I have had better shaves with the HOTEL razors in emergency packs. My first pull of the razor (after my shower and shaving cream on my face) was like using a very very dull blade right out of the package!! Just like some of the negative reviews I cut myself two places on the 2nd and 3rd strokes on my face!! DO NOT BUY THIS RAZOR !!!!!

A total ripoff!! Trust me.....this is a very very bad product!!!

I bought this item 2 months ago. I worked so well, I couldn't believe it. The bristles were soft, it cleaned great, it was portable, and it didn't take up room on the sink. I thought it was wonderful and was very happy with it.

A few days ago, it started working intermittantly. I replaced the batteries. Still worked intermittantly. I replaced the batteries. It made a faint humming sound. I knew there was a problem and decided to look up reviews on the internet. I saw people were having the same experience and it was due to water leakage ruining the batteries.

I will contact the Philips Co. and let them know. I really love this toothbrush and hope they will correct the leak situation. When they do, I would definitely buy a new one.
I've tried to like this because everyone does but it creases like crazy on me (I only have one wrinkle under each eye) it's really thick on me. I just use it as an eyeshadow primer

Yes, the packaging is gimmicky and I totally fell for it, but I make no apologies. I bought 3 shades--PK01, CR01, and OR01--and they're all quite nice. That said, the PK01 is a bit lighter than I expected so I'll probably get more wear out of the other two.

The tints are pretty long-lasting. I was able to wear the OR01 all day yesterday, and even through lunch and drinking mugs of tea I didn't need to touch it up 'til the end of the day. (And, truthfully, since it was the end of the day and there was still a hint of color, I was lazy and just didn't bother.) The tints aren't noticeably drying, either--although I'm a balm addict and usually put some on over the color throughout the day. Luckily, this doesn't seem to have a terribly detrimental effect on the color. There is a slight taste, which is neither unpleasant nor pleasant--I didn't especially like it, but it didn't bother me. I'm not a wine drinker, but my guess is they don't really taste like wine, just kind of fruity.

The only other true tints/stains I've used are the Tony Moly ones and I think these compare favorably to those in terms of ease of application (I think these are more forgiving), durability, drying, and taste (the TMs had a more chemical taste). I don't dislike the TM's, but these are just better, IMO.

I'd recommend these tints, and will probably buy again, especially to try out the other other colors.

I love love LOVE this dye!!!!
(TL;DR at bottom)
I have medium to dark brown hair, and the thought of bleaching it terrifies me because the last time I bleached my hair in high school I absolutely FRIED it. I was pretty hesitant to see how well this pink would show up on my dark hair without bleaching it first. Boy was I surprised.
First of all, I have a LOT of hair. I needed 3 bottles of dye to cover my whole head. Hopefully you can use my photos to compare your hair length to mine and use what I said to help you determine how many bottles you’d need to buy.
I didn’t just pour it in my hands and rub it all over my hair, I actually sectioned out my hair piece by piece to make sure I got the dye on every last bit of hair as evenly as possible. This whole process took about 2 hours. Yes, it was exactly as awful as it sounds. Man were my arms tired.. After I finished dying it, I put all of my hair up in a shower cap / bonnet and let it sit for 5 whole hours. Excessive? Probably lol.
I swear I remember hearing once a long time ago that when you wash out hair dye in the shower you’re supposed to keep washing it til the water runs clear. Well I was in the shower for a good 40 minutes shampooing the life outta my hair before I just gave up and got out the shower lol. My shower water continued to run pink every time I washed my hair for at least a good 2 to 3 weeks.
Oh and as for the washing?? Yeah I hate cold water so I never did any of that stuff that you’re supposed to do. I continued to shower every to every other day, and I used warm to hot water every time. Yeah yeah I know the color won’t last as long, but screw a cold shower. I also switched to using Herbal Essences Color Me Happy shampoo.
[EDIT: I am now aware that Color Me Happy is actually horrible for colored hair. That shampoo still contains SULFATES, which is the ENEMY OF HAIR DYE. So yeah make sure you read the ingredients on your shampoo bottles carefully, because clearly Herbal Essences is a bunch of LIARS.]
So after 1 month of warm showers and Herbal Essences, the third photo is what I was left with. I’m honestly incredibly happy!!! The pink definitely faded a lot, but there was still enough pink in my hair to the point where if a stranger on the street saw me they’d be able to say “that girl has pink(ish) hair.” This dye has exceeded all of my expectations.
One thing I’d like to add, though. This dye does seem to stain plastic showers. It kinda comes off when you scrub it with acetone (nail polish remover) and some abrasive cleaners. Over time the stains definitely do fade. But I just wanted to give y’all the heads up in case your shower turns pink and you can’t scrub it all off in one night.
I’m about to re-dye my hair with this same dye as soon as I finish writing this review, so it might even be brighter and last even longer this time!
~TL;DR~
1. Shows up great on medium brown hair, but I let it sit for 5 hours before washing.
2. Long hair (or at least mine) requires 3 bottles.
3. Stains plastic showers.
4. Color stays in nicely after a month of daily warm showers and using Herbal Essences Color Me Happy shampoo & conditioner.

It didn't work out so well for me. Though that does not necessarily mean the product will not work out for others. If you never wore one before, you would think you would just hook it on like a backpack which you kind of do anyway. It also includeds a useless piece of paper with instructions on how to put it together except they leave out the most important part. Amazon also has a video on how to put it together from the manufacturer which is also useless because the most important part that you need to know, is only a frame or two as if they knew it was going to be difficult to put together and didn't want the viewers to see it. I tried it on over my bareback without any undergarment shirts. I also tried it on over a t-shirt. In both cases there was absolutely no signs of correction on my curvature spine. The "Y" shape piece in the back, rode all the way up to my neck instead of staying in the area of the curvature. As far as being comfortable, it was okay. You just felt the strap coming out from underneath your armpits and over to your shoulder to be velcroed onto the strap. You would feel the pressure of the strap against your skin or over your T-shirt/undergarment top but that's all it was. The pressure gives you the illusion as if your back is being straightened out. But in reality, it didn't do not one bit of correction. Not even a little. Maybe for my particular curvature, my particular curvature may be beyond repair/correction. I may end up returning it.
goes on very easily and doesn't leave a white residue but does leave my kid looking a little shiny/oily
Good quality...

I've been using a corded version of the Braun Silk Epil for a few years now so I was super excited to try this cordless version. Truth be told, I haven't used the rotating brush head yet, but I LOVE the epilator! They've made so many improvements to the design since I received my last one. The unit charges pretty quickly. I didn't time it but it couldn't have been more than 20 minutes after plugging it in from completely dead that I found it fully recharged. The contour of the unit is also improved, and I love the changes to the on/off dial. It was very easy to accidentally slide the on/off switch on my older model, but this requires two fingers so you won't be accidentally turning it on or off when you don't intend to. The new contouring head is also fantastic. The older model did not pivot with the contour of your legs, but this one works perfectly. The rounded epilator head is protected by the pivoting frame so that when it meets your skin, it is always in the right position. I had jabbed myself a few times with the older model as I was getting used to it. Not painful, but annoying and not effective. It's impossible to do it wrong with this new pivoting head. Overall, I don't feel that it's less painful than previous versions (and underarm hair is still excruciating and I will not do it!) but if you keep up with it every couple of days the pain is extremely minimal. The worst will be when you've let the hair grow out for a while and then do it all at once, and even then it's bearable. I'm glad to see they removed the cold pack from this version because it never helped with the pain despite the claims that it would and the ice on my legs was more uncomfortable than the actual epilating. The weight is just right, not too heavy to fatigue your hands but not too light as to feel like you don't have precise control. And of course, my skin stays smoother longer and epilating removes a lot of the dark spots that are left behind with regular shaving of my very fair skin. Definitely worth picking up for first timers or if you have an older corded version!

I bought this brush at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I'd seen all the wet brushes being sold at our local salons, but I never bought one because it seemed a bit gimmick-y. Having given this one a try, I'm kind of wishing I'd bought one sooner! The bristles are soft and flexible, and it never hurts to pull it through my hair. It detangles hair quickly and is easy to clean. My 4-year-old complains occasionally that it pulls at her tangles, but it is relatively rare, and a HUGE improvement over her old brush.

EDIT 2/12/18: Unfortunately, the little balls on the ends of the bristles started popping off late last year, and the bristles really hurt without them. We're tossing this one and have bought actual brand-name wet brushes as replacements. I think I like the brand-name brushes a bit more, though it's hard to compare when it's been over a year since this brush was new. Hopefully the brand-name ones last a bit longer.
This dryer is just sad....SLOW turning brush, does not heat up well.  Got what I paid for.  Returning it.
