I was going to use these for Halloween to greet trick or treaters (muah ha haa) but I got lazy and did not end up wearing one. I did apply one just to write this review and it applied the same as any temporary tattoo with water. I first applied lipstick and put the back of the tattoo on my mouth so I could see where my lips would need to open. Then I cut out a little piece for my mouth and that worked well when applying the tattoo. But honestly, they should have thought of that when selling tattoos that go over your mouth. You have to somehow find a way to create an opening for your lips. So, based on the hassle of creating my own opening, I don't think I would order these again. However, overall these tattoos work just fine.

I was really excited to receive this product because I thought I might find an easier alternative to blowdrying and flat-ironing my hair.  This brush styler is extremely thick and awkward to hold in my opinion. It has a lot of weight and bulk to manipulate while you are styling your hair.  The buttons are at a weird position making it hard to change the heat levels unless you stop what you are doing and actually move your hand to look at the buttons.  I thought it felt a lot hotter than my hair dryer with less options to reduce the heat.  I liked it better without the brush rotating but felt like it actually took a lot longer to dry with this styler than my blowdryer.  I received a compliment that my hair had more body today but I felt like it was more frizzy than usual.  I like my hair better when I flat-iron it and today I just felt like I had poofy 90's Jennifer Aniston hair.  I'm just not thrilled with this device.

I am not sure what happened to my product this time.  I have used this product for several years.  It is typically white, porous to the touch, but applies with a smooth texture and pleasant fragrance.  This time, it was as though the product had been altered, however.  When it arrived, it was not in the usual box, but rather in a plastic bag. It was brown in color and smooth, almost greasy, with an unusual odor.  When I opened it I actually joked that it appeared as though someone had added bacon-grease to the jar, as it smelled similar to the left-overs in a cast-iron skillet after someone had fried bacon.  I was hesitant to put the product on my face because I honestly did not know what was in that jar....but I do know it was not StriVectin Instant Facial Sculpting Cream.  I believe this was an unusual instance and not the typical scenario for purchasing this product.  I have ordered it through Amazon several times and have been please with product, price, delivery and packaging.  It just wasn't like that this time.
I love this for no makeup days. I just put a little under my eyes and on my brow bone and it makes you look like your glowing!

Loved loved loved the look and design but it broke after one hour. I plugged it in and it started getting cool but then stopped cooling all together and my products got damaged. I tried unplugging it and restarting and everything and nothing I could do it just broke. This is common with this product. Save your money and get a different brand.

I like the idea of this product as an eco friendly alternative to bottled conditioner, shampoo, etc. It smells absolutely amazing. That being said, it's not super easy to use on long hair. It takes me several minutes to lather enough conditioner off the bar to just somewhat coat my hair.
This next part is in regards to my hair results after using this for a few weeks. Note that I have very curly, frizzy, dry hair and have never found a product that has actually helped any of those.
My hair feels very light after using this conditioner, which is nice but it also means it's not doing anything for my frizz. Right after getting out of the shower, my hair doesn't feel particularly soft as it has with other conditioners, but once my hair is dry, it feels as soft as it normally does. The scent from the conditioner usually completely goes away by the time my hair is dry, take that as you will. The ends of my hair have been getting more tangled than normal and I often find multiple tiny knots that often won't brush out and end up breaking. I'm no expert on hair so I don't know if this is due to the conditioner not doing what it needs to do or if my hair is just ready to be trimmed again. Either way, it started shortly after switching to this conditioner.
Overall, I do plan on sticking with bar conditioner to reduce waste but may look into other options to see if I can get better results.

Bought these because I was looking for something to massage my itchy gums. Though my dentist has not said anything about gingivitis, I am pretty sure I’m borderline there. I have very sensitive gums and have been struggling for years to find toothbrushes that do not stab at them and make them bleed. One time, I tried the floss-tip toothbrush’s & they were SO sharp, they stabbed tiny holes in my gums & they got infected. Since then, I’ve tried Extra Soft Toothbrush from Di Qiu Ren (which was so dense, it did not dry, and got moldy very fast), back to my regular soft bristle toothbrush, which still irritates my gums and makes them bleed, and these silicone bristle brushes.

These silicone bristle brushes are very gentle on sensitive gums and have not cause ANY bleeding. Though, it does take longer to get plaque off the teeth, it’s great for my sensitive gums. The downfall, is if you brush your teeth too soon after eating oily foods, the residue sticks to the brush and it very difficult to get off. Most of the time, I just throw it away and use a new one. So far, one brush lasts about a month before it gets residue on it or starts smelling weird.

I don’t know if these are good for oral hygiene, but so far, my gums appear better and have built up a tolerance to contact & appear less sensitive to flossing and brushing. I will likely purchase these again to help with my gums, but will continue looking for cleaning alternatives for teeth.

For reference, I have dry, sensitive skin. I tend to be VERY careful about the cleansers I purchase because many cleansers can be very harsh; even those meant for dry skin. However, I do wear sunscreen and makeup, and both need to be fully removed at the end of the day. Most gentle cleansers do not remove makeup well. I used to use micellar water, but I hated wasting all of those cotton pads. Oil cleansing seemed to be exactly what I needed.

This cleanser smells a bit citrusy due to the begamot oil. It's a nice texture; not so runny it runs down my hands, but not too thick to spread on my face. I need 3-4 pumps to effectively cleanse my face. It does a great job with my (non waterproof) eye makeup as well as foundation - my face is clean! I was surprised how clean it rinsed off - no oily feeling remained at all. My face just feels soft and moisturized. I do follow with a lotion cleanser just to be sure, but you could definitely use it as a stand-alone cleanser. Sometimes I use this in the mornings when my face is feeling particularly dry and it makes my skin feel awesome!

The ingredients in it are great, the price is reasonable, and it's vegan and cruelty-free. Most importantly, it works!

I've only tried a few different shaving soaps in my time wet shaving. TOBS (Taylor of Old Bond Street) Sandalwood has been my go-to for a few years now. My only nitpick is the fragrance...which is an oddly clean and powdery sandalwood that projects across my entire bathroom. The fragrance also has some decent longevity, and I can still pick up notes of it while I'm getting dressed and putting on cologne, which it sometimes clashes with. I guess my takeaway is that I needed a change from that scent. Mitchell's Wool Fat soap seemed like a good alternative, and from what I could tell from skimming forums and reviews, it doesn't smell nearly as strongly as TOBS.

I'm pleasantly surprised so far. It lathered in my hard water relatively well. Just bloomed it in hot water for a minute beforehand and went to work on it with a medium body boarhair brush. The soap had a slicker feel than I'm used to and the lather had slightly less structural integrity than TOBS but my shave didn't seem to suffer for it. Like I usually do, I used the remaining lather I'd made to wash the rest of my face, which worked like a charm. The post shave was just okay. I honestly felt like I'd done a worse job on my neck than I actually had. Might have been the switch to a tallow soap, might have been the lanolin but my neck skin felt a little roughed up and gummed up, even after my post-shave alum block and witch hazel. As my skin dried and everything calmed down, I could finally tell that I'd actually gotten an extremely close shave and had miraculously avoided any damage in the usual spots around my adams apple. Good stuff.

The fragrance is also a nice surprise. The Kent company, which markets and sells a repackaged version of this same soap in India claimed it had elements of Pine, Patchouli, Lavender, Musk, Cloves, Nutmeg, Cedar, Sandalwood. I now see what the folks on the forums meant when they called that BS.
It does have a clean lavender note up front, a bit of soft powdery musk in the middle and a nebulous slightly woodsy note hanging out somewhere in the background. All the other notes they claimed are MIA though. This is a very subdued version of a classic old-school barbershop scent. No long distance projection, no longevity past the end of the shave.

Actually, now that I smell my hands hours later, I can actually detect a bit of that musky woodsy accord hanging around. After it managed to trigger a sense memory of helping my aunt shear sheep as a kid, I now realize that I'm actually smelling raw lanolin. So I guess with that in mind, I'd have to reframe this soap as mostly smelling like lavender and lanolin.

Which I could definitely get used to.

I was really looking forward to getting this hairdryer based on all the glowing reviews. It is a bit heavy, but it's solid, and very good quality. The first time I used it, my hair felt and looked dry. I thought maybe it was the gel I used. The next day, I tried mousse, and still dry. By day 3, I used Fructis Marvelous Oil, which always works well for me, but it was still dry and frizzy. In addition, my hair did not dry any faster than it does with my "Conair 1875 Watt Pro Styler / Hair Dryer with Ionic Conditioning." I stopped before my hair was completely dry because of how frizzy my hair was, so I couldn't really style it the way I wanted. Plus, that red light bothered me. My ordinary hairdryers will glow red in the nozzle when they're about to go, and that's all I kept thinking about. Granted, if the dryer were as great for me as it apparently is for others, I would have got over that, but it isn't. Overall, it's just not for me.

i'm a big fan of hydrocolloid patches - i've tried at least 5 different brands at this point and have had many different experiences.  my experience with these have been a bit slower than with the others.  with some of the others they help to bring the blemish to the top and then promote healing.  these did not seem to help in the progression process, it does however seem to help with the healing process. basically for me, these seem to work better only once the zit is popped - whereas some others seem to help you make it poppable and then heal and some of the others even help to stop it from ever even becoming a zit.  so they have some decent benefits, just not all of the benefits of some of the others.

first the elephant in the room - read the ingredients and you will see there is formaldehyde. technically this is terrible but it is somewhat manageable. be in a ventilated space. personally i turn the bathroom fan on while i am using it for the whole process - especially during the flat iron part. i also turn on a regular floor fan pointed into the bathroom, whatever i can do to keep the air moving.

ok - now that we have covered that - the actual product. it's sooooo easy to use. the process is so simple and easy. the directions are super easy to understand and follow and there are pictures included. it's pretty quick - you can get through it all within an hour once you get started on the actual product. just follow the directions.

then for maintenance between treatments there is a shampoo and conditioner provided. these are EXTREMELY thick! like the conditioner is so crazy thick it's almost too difficult to get it out of the bottle. it's a workout. but it's all good to help maintain though.

now - the results. i'm not disappointed at all. i know it's working. it's not a crazy perma-straight situation though. this is NOT salon results. let me repeat that ... NOT salon results. i have super natural curly hair - i can still wash my hair curly. the same amount of curls as i have always had. when i do wear it curly though, i also still have the same amount of frizz. it's sad and true. that said though - it's when wear it straight that the product shows it's worth! the picture i have posted it right after coming after getting caught in the rain. in the past my hair would just revert back to the full on curl, no waves just the game of 'how big is my hair gonna grow?' watch party. this time though ... i ended up with a style that i actually like! something i could easily still get away with wearing for the rest of the day/evening. as rainy and muggy as it has been lately - i can dig this and appreciate it through and through.

so all that said - do i wish it did a bit more for the curly hair frizz ... yes. but for the price and the fact that i will probably get 4 treatments out of this set - i think the system is worth for the investment - cost and time.

they're OK - the main thing is that you really can't do much with just two at a time - if you use one on each side, you end up with more of one little hill on each side. with two on one side you can get a bit more of a cascade volume fall, but then you have to stop and do them on the other side. at a minimum, two sets will get you some decent volume up front or whatever section you choose to use them - i think though i would probably prefer 6-8 to create a total up top volume look - 2-3 more sets of these. the next kind of issue is remembering to use them - i'm straightening my hair if i am drying it and you really have these in during that process because of the smoothing brush process that's part of that - so then i have to remember once i am done drying to go back and use these before i do any flat iron or curling things.

to get some up top volume - they do kind of work - i would just suggest determining how much volume you prefer in terms of where all on the crown and order based on that - for me it's 2 on each side up front, then 2 more rows of one behind it.

great concept - and apparently more effective for some skip types. it doesn't quite pull all the gunk out for me, however it will bring pore clogging things to the surface making it easier for me clear the pore myself. i was pleasantly surprised to find though that it doesn't create blemishes. that's a weird thing to say, i know. but you know how when you get a facial, sometimes within the next 36 hours you end up with some new friends on your face? well this doesn't bring blemishes to the surface, just helps to clean up the pores.

I wanted to like this product, but overall I'm not particularly impressed with it. The lipstick design is cute, but the entire device is covered in a cheap hard plastic that attracts dust and smudges, and doesn't feel particularly durable. The gemstone tip looks dull and cloudy, and has bubbles within it. Not a pretty pink rose quartz like in the product photos. The stone also doesn't feel perfectly smooth, but somewhat coarse or tacky.

I'm not really certain what the difference between the red and blue light modes is; They both seem to head the gemstone head. The 'button' being a touch sensor makes it easy to switch modes on accidental during use. Perhaps one of the biggest flaws of this device is that the motor is in the base, and the vibrations are extremely weak. This means that you can barely feel the vibrations at all during use. Additionally, the charging port is completely exposed on the bottom of this device with no water-resistant cover, so there's the potentially to accidentally get liquid on it if using this product to encourage product absorption.

Overall, I'm highly disappointed with this product. I think it's a really cool idea, and the heat emitted from the stone feels nice, but I feel like the overall execution of this product is poorly done.

Overall, I'm fairly satisfied with my order of this spa set. The first thing I noticed is that everything smells fantastic! A strong coffee fragrance wafts from everything in this kit, and all three body products contain real coffee. The scrub was my personal favorite scent-wise; I find it smells just like a caramel lattee.

The body bar is nourishing and non-drying, but it is exfoliating due to the coffee grounds, so I wouldn't recommend it for everyday use. I do personally wish it was a tad larger, as it melts down quickly during typical usage.

The scrub is quite dense, as it doesn't contain added liquid. However, this means you get a lot for your money, as you only need to use a little bit on damp skin to get good exfoliation. I like the addition of almond and coconut oil, as it keeps it from being overly harsh, and makes it quite hydrating.

A little goes a long way with the bath soak. I love using it in a foot bath; It leaves my feet feeling nice and soft, and the aroma is relaxing and pleasant. It does dye the water a light brown due to the coffee, however.

I like the candle, but I'd consider it my least favorite out of this set. It has a nice burn time for its size, and it's in a beautiful black candle tin with a lid. However, I found the amount of scent it provided while burning to be underwhelming.

Overall, I really like this spa kit, and I think it'd be fantastic for any coffee lover. It's a little expensive at the current price, but if the candle was a little stronger, and the bath bar was a little larger, then this would be a five-star product.

I really wanted to like this product, and I love pineapple, so I was super excited when it arrived. Unfortunately, I was let down by the quality of the actual products. They make a cute gift set, but that's really all they have going for them.

I love the smell of pineapple, but I found the scent of these products to be unpleasant. They smell very cloyingly sweet and artificial, and not much like pineapple at all. The whipped body soap had a nice texture, but it left my skin dry, and it took a lot of product just to get clean. The body butter felt sticky and greasy, and not all that luxurious. My skin was left a bit tacky, and not very moisturized even after it was absorbed. The bath soak is alright, but it has the same unfortunate scent as the other products, and you really don't get much product, so it's more appropriate for foot soak than a bath. The body scrub was probably the best product out of the bunch, and it creates a nice lather when mixed with water. It left my skin soft, but unfortunately was also quite drying.

Overall, I can't recommend this product. The presentation of the product is adorable, and I love that it's vegan... but the quality of this skincare product set just isn't very good.

I have had problems with acne all my life, and I find relief in being a picker and a popper. I also have a teenage daughter who follows the picking and popping type behavior. I've found these tools make it so much easier to get to the hard to reach or deeply embedded blackheads and blemishes and reduce the amount of scarring and marks left by using other things that weren't reall designed for this purpose. They really do help the removal process without damaging the surrounding skin or spreading the bacteria which can lead to even more breakouts.
This blemish kit comes with six double sided tools that are made from 100% stainless steel, a zippered leather storage case with elastic loops which hold the tools in place, and an instruction sheet on how to use and care for all of the instruments. This makes the storage and sanitation of these instraments easy and convenient.The tools are definitely of good quality, four of the six have textured grips and are easy to hold on to, the other two are squared. The lance and spoon extractors are stored in the grip, and you simply unscrew them to remove from grip, then choose the desired tool and screw it back in to assemble for use. I really like the lance provided instead of the needle tip lancet, and it's just as sharp. The leather case is nice and small so it would be easy to take in your purse or overnight bag if you should want to travel with it. The elastic loops are tight which makes it a little difficult to replace them, however, I like they have a secured fitted placement.
The directions are very clear and basic. It isn't hard to figure out which tool works best for each blemish. Honestly, everyone is different so I don't believe there is one way or one tool that would be more useful then another. That's why this varity is so great.
For the best results, it is important to sterilize the tools you will be using with alcohol, and to wash your hands and face with cleanser and warm/hot water. This step is necessary to open the pores and gain maneuverability. Find the appropriate tool and place it over the blackhead and press gently, removing the nastiness by force. If you press too hard you could damage the skin. If you are dealing with a whitehead, puncture it with the lance for removal. It's important to wipe the tool with alcohol prior to moving on to the next blemish, as to not spread bacteria. After you finish with the extractions, it is important that you cleanse your face using cold water. This rinse will help in closing the pores to avoid them becoming clogged again. Don't forget to sterilize any used instruments prior to putting them back in the storage case, you don't want to spread the bacteria.

I read a lot of good reviews on this hair care product and decided to try it for myself. First, I have fine hair that tangles easily after washing and detangler products are a must and I'm quite particular about what I use. I actually prefer spray over cream products, but over all the Total Vitamin Leave-in cream did distribute through my hair better then most creams I've used, but it didn't help entirely with my tangles. I cant really comment on the effectiveness of the Keratin Heat Protector since I don't cook my hair with blow driers, and curling or flat irons. As for the Argan Oil Serum...it's good, but ranks second from my favorite Marrakesh Argan Oil serum.

Overall, these products are okay, but nothing to write home about. My biggest concern was when I was using these 3 products, my hair seemed to fall out...and I mean hair loss by the clumps. Never had this happen before. I didn't panic right away and blame it on the products, but after a week or so, I discontinued using Milania products and went back to my prior products and immediately noticed no hair falling out. So did the Milania products have something to do with my hair falling out? I can't say for certain, but I did read a review here that someone else experienced hair falling out too. I understand that everyone's hair & scalp is different and mine seem to react poorly, so use your own judgement call on whether you want to try these products.

Aside from "possible" hair loss, the products smelled incredible, distributed easily in hair, and didnt leave any residue feeling in my hair. So my final judgement on Milania hair care is that it's basic stuff and, in my opinion, overrated and didn't live up to all the hype. It didn't get my tangles out with ease, didn't leave my hair silky smooth soft and frizz-free as boasted. Its okay, but not "great"...expecially for the price. There's other products out there that work just as good or better for less money.

First off I don't really think of cotton candy much when I smell this scent and I've tried nearly every cotton candy scent everything from Aqualina pink sugar to gale hayman delicious cotton candy to bodycology to yes even that iconic cotton candy we all wore as a teen by body fantasies. It's more closer to a vanilla scent but with a strong almost caramel-y tone to it, it reminds me far more of vanilla bean noel by bath and body works rather than most if not all cotton candy scents I've ever tried. Not a bad scent but for me I need my sweet Gourmond scents to be stronger than this and last much longer than 30 minutes to 1hr at best. If you love a quality sweet smell that's stand alone this might not be for you I think a 3.5 would be more fair it's close to a 4 but just not quite for those reasons. However I don't regret this buy I use it to top up other scents since it's nearly a brown sugar vanilla sort of caramel scent it goes well with most sweet scents (strawberry pound cake, Scarlett kiss, dark kiss, Oahu coconut, Hawaiian hibiscus etc) to intensify it but-- cannot really for me last alone if I rebought it it would be to use as that-- a topper scent. Also, not a bad scent for someone wanting a cheaper dupe for Eilish but again not as strong and not as lasting. So I'd bet a younger lady such as a teen or preteen would like this one vs myself who likes a sweetsie scent I just need it stronger, more longer lasting.

I'll start off by mentioning that I have very long and somewhat thick and curly hair and am hardly successful in the art of using fancy hair accessories. I have been using it for a couple of months and I am SO thankful for this!! I'm not going to get into a professional review because I'm not a pro and haven't used any other 'reverse' curling wands so....
Apart from using the plain old irons with the horrendous clamp, I had been using my friggin' CHI straightener to make my curls (have had bad experiences with actual curling irons and tend to avoid them) and while it did actually curl my hair it was sooo time consuming and hardly worth the trouble. This has cut my getting ready regime in HALF! It takes me anywhere from 10-20 mins (as apposed to a good half hour or more!!) to curl my crazy long hair depending on if I'm being particular about each curl.

I have very small hands and while the glove is a tad long in the fingers, I definitely don't mind the extra protection from the heat and it doesn't personally affect my maneuvering of the wand. I actually don't mind that there isn't a temperature control but I wouldn't mind being able to change the temp. either. It does not take long to heat up. I love the swivel cord and it has a decent length to it. The packaging is pretty nifty....I like that I can pack it up after each use to store it neatly, but to each their own.

As far as the actual curling....it is a breeze! A bit strange at first but quite simple to get the hang of. I'm not sure if it is just my hair, or maybe the products I use, but I've never been able to keep a curl for past 8 hours or so but my hair will keep THESE curls all day!! But again, this could just be my products....still impressive. I love that I can change the curl variety easily with this. The ONLY thing I've not loved I think may just be flaw in my technique, but sometimes the very narrow end will make a strange start to the curl so I might have to redo the top bit of the strand but it is so darn easy to fix I can't even stress about it.

This did come with shampoo, but I gave it to a friend since I don't use products with sulfates. But it smelled really nice.
I've not been able to splurge on a nice curler in a very long time, so coming from having basically none to speak of, this has been an amazing buy.

Here is my honest review:
I wanted to add some length to my short and damaged hair so after some research decided to purchase tape in extensions. I scheduled an appointment with the professional who could install these. My first mistake was that I didn't read those negative reviews for these tape-ins. Wish I did. Hair looked good at first, soft and the color was matching mine. It came with some extra tape-ins. After the appointment, I loved the hair. However, my stylist said this was not real human hair but quality synthetic hair. I didn't believe her.
As recommended I used 1 pack of 100 grams and 2 packs of 30 so the total was 160 grams and I have tin hair. Waited 4 days and washed my hair. It wasn't as hard as expected. One extension came off. I replaced a tape in and reinstalled myself. Wasn't hard. The first two days I had a headache I guess because of the extra weight. It went away on the third day. After I dried my hair, the extensions were dry and curly. I purchased straight hair. Used an iron to straighten it out. After 7 days my scalp was itchy and the bumps were all over the scalp due to the glue in the tape-ins. At that point, I just wanted them out. Thank God I was able to find a good tape in remover. Ladies these are not real human hair extensions. Save your money. I attached the picture for reference.

The ones I received don't even look as good as the picture. I expected it to be cheap considering it was only two dollars. What really shocked me was that this company actually bought this item from wish then sent it to me. That's messed up.
Ok quality...... definitely not as full as picture.

I have dark, thick hair on my head but for whatever unfortunate genetic reason, I have very light and thin eyebrows, and fill them in with makeup every single day. I have never dyed them before. This dye darkened them to match my hair perfectly, and my method of application gave me the perfect shape with no skin staining or irritation.

First of all, I only used about 1/4 of the powder in the capsule because I could tell that would probably be more than enough (and it was), so this stuff is going to last forever.

Instead of washing my face beforehand, I used a dry microfiber cloth to wipe off my eyebrow area as clean as I could. I think the fact that I didn't wash my face meant that my skin had a small layer of oil on it for protection against staining and irritation. A little oil also will not hinder the hair coloring process.

I used the included application brush, putting very small amounts of the dye on the brush and applying it in light, careful strokes. The movement is like sketching in a sketchbook instead of drawing solid lines all at once, and I did not have a pile of dye on my brows at the end.

I know that with my hair, I need to leave dye on it for a long time, so I left this on for 10 minutes. I rinsed the dye off with cool water to avoid opening up my pores. I checked my brows and thought they could be a little darker, so I re-applied and left on for another 5-10 mins. Total of 15-20 mins.

Finally, I washed it off for good with a gentle unscented soap, using my fingernails to help get all the dye off and exfoliate the skin underneath and around my brows, so I was left with no stains.

And that was that. I have eyebrows now! I can even TOUCH them! I can't believe I never tried this before, this will be a staple in my life now.

I bought these to use when for when I color my hair, blow dry or need to clip up my hair when I curl it. These clips will not hold a lot of hair so I twist my hair and have the clip hold the end. This works out well as the clips grasp the hair tightly. I am not concerned about the clips breaking. They have held up even though I'm not gentle on them.
My hair does at times get caught in the teeth but slips out easily.
These are great for use while styling or other needs like coloring but these are not for use once hair hair is styled. They will not work as a claw clip to wear out. Thought I would put that in my review as some might thing that is the purpose of these clips. They are holding hair up during procedures or while styling.

I bought mine from Walgreens, since I didn't want to wait for shipping. I have only ONE complaint - that there is only one pair of gloves in the kit. It didn't make me take a star away, since I do have boxes of gloves at home anyway - but I also did research on this coloring system before I bought it and used it. I checked youtube videos and I looked through reviews for people that have used this item. I actually weighed and measured out 1/2 of the bleach powder and liquid before mixing in a bowl - so I didn't waste any.
I colored just my bangs and some of the hair a bit further back on my crown. I bleached first, and followed the directions completely. I did find the bleach a bit runny, but it didn't matter since I just used foils to go under my sections as I painted the bleach on (And later, I did the same for the dye) I used Pink Fetish AND Lusty Lavender. You really need to ensure you use enough of the coloring since your hair WILL soak it up quickly, so you need NOT to be skimpy.
I painted it on and rubbed it in with my gloves hands before wrapping with the foil. I finally cleaned up any drips etc and covered with a plastic cap.... I rinsed and used shampoo (yeah, I didn't look) and it faded the color quite a bit... still cute but I wanted NEON. I waited until the next day, did it again and Voila! PERFECT!
You need patience, some experience or a friend with experience, a steady hand and about 4-6 hours to do a great job. Get extra gloves, clothes you don't care about (and a couple trashed towels), vaseline or conditioner to go around your hairline, on ears and neck, some foil and a plastic cap - and a rat tail comb for sectioning.

2 of my cats regularly walk under a U shaped wire brush toy to groom themselves. Another likes to go chew on the brush. The 4th cat always grooms his chin on a prickly squishy ball.
The brushes that arrived are hard plastic. Instructions were not included, so I had to revisit the website before pouring catnip in the back of the wall brush. Everyone sniffed it but only 2 tried to rub up against it. At first I had it secured to the bottom of a stool, but once I attached it higher up the legs, the cats nudged at it. It’s been in the cat room for over a week. The cats have not paid it much attention. I moved near the other grooming toys, but no improvement. Maybe the catnip is not so potent or maybe I need to pour the entire bag inside? Not sure? Will continue to move brushes to new locations & see if interest gets peaked.

I decided to purchase a scar remover treatment in order to lighten eczema-related scarring on my lower leg that has lingered since childhood.  After reading positive reviews regarding the Protege Flawless product, I thought I would give it a try.  The consistency is disgusting, the color is gross, and the "scent" is an odd fruity-type scent that isn't pleasing by any means.  Every time I open up the jar, there is a very unappealing product inside.  Nonetheless, I went ahead and began using it and after only a few weeks, I have noticed a small difference.  My scarring does look lighter, so that's a good thing.  However, I think my product has already turned stale!  I have closed it tight after each use, but it seems to have changed.  It looks the same, but the "scent" is now completely atrocious!  There's not a trace of that barely "fruity" scent anymore.  It has turned into a putrid smell, and I almost can't even bear to use it.  It seems as if almost overnight it turned from barely fruity to entirely unbearable.  I can't even put my finger on what it smells like now.  The best way to describe the smell is "chemical," which leads me to think this may not be as natural of a product as the company claims.  I've rated this two stars only because it seems to have done something for the better, but I am going to switch to another product.  This is much too expensive for it to turn stale so quickly.

I was hesitant reading reviews before I purchased this item.  The reviews were so mixed I wasn't sure what to think.  After looking at it for several days I bought it anyway to give it a try.  I bought the rechargeable one.  I don't understand what the negative reviews were all about.  My feet are AWFUL.  I have a thick layer of dryness around my heels and the inner part of my big toes.  This isn't something to use one time and then expect your feet to be smooth forever.  You have to use it every couple of weeks or so.  My problem is I do not put lotion on my feet.  I hate the feeling, it makes my feet feel dirty.  I wear flip flops all year long (live in Arizona where it's hot all the time) and I'm sure that's the reason they are so terrible.  After one use you can feel a major difference.  It basically works the same as the foot files you would use except for since it's electric you don't have to do that whole scrubbing back and forth.  If your feet aren't that bad off you may not want it.  This is a definite great purchase, in my opinion.  I do recommend you do it outside as the powdery stuff that comes off your feet when you use is goes all over the place.  I have a ped-egg and it's basically the same except the ped-egg has a catch all compartment that the powder goes into that you empty later.  The ped-egg also kinda cuts your feet all up so a few days later you can feel the hundreds of little straggly skin snag on your sheets at night or on your socks.  I do it in the grassy part of my backyard and there's no clean up.  The first time I pretty much had to sweep and vacuum my bathroom floor right after.  It's a pretty nasty thought considering it's dead skin cells that are all over.  I've had it a couple months now, used it about 5 times and it doesn't seem that I'm close to needing a refill yet.  I would absolutely recommend this product.

These make my face turn beet red and make its feel veryyy hot. I have never had problems with any other brand of makeup wipes, ever. I never even buy hypoallergenic ones so its a big surprise to me that i am reacting this way.
Good

Latest update: I have to remove a star from my original five-star rating. The nail polish doesn't stay on for long :(

I saw this kind of nail polish some years ago and thought it was really cool. My wife wanted to get it but it was a bit too pricey at the time so she never got it.

Times have changed and we were able to finally get these. As UPS dropped off the package, my wife tackled him and grabbed the box because she was so excited. She ripped the box wide open and started doing her nails right there in the grass. Okay, okay that's not really true. But she was really excited and did try it out right away - the UPS guy was not harmed.

I'm a dude so pink is pink. I ordered pink and the product is pink. Looks good. In the bottle, and when it is first applied, it looks like regular metallic nail polish. No big deal, right? Well, they include two different magnets, each with a different design. After the polish is applied to the nails, you have to immediately place the magnet over the nail while being careful to not actually touch the nail with the magnet. Hold it there for a little bit (I think it said 15 seconds), then it magically has a cool design. I think it's really cool how it does that.

My six year old daughter was amazed just as much as I was. Actually, maybe a little less than I was. Lol. We told to get to bed early and then if mommy and her wake up early enough before school, then she can have her nails done with Magnetix. She's pretty excited. Yes we are very excited family tonight...haha. Seriously, it's pretty cool. My daughter said she can't wait to go to school to show her friends.

I received this product at a discount in exchange for me to try it out and leave an honest, unbiased review.
I returned this product the day I received it.  It is made of some unbreakable plastic, and it has many rough edges from the plastic molding.  The design on the front of the mug is cheaply done.

Received the hair on time. Ordered 2 groups (which were 6 packs in all), but I still don't think it was quite full enough. The hair comes in 3 (or in my case 6) individual packs (PIC) with a twist wire going through. Care must be taken to not let each piece slip off until you are used to the loop because you may lose the grip of the loop. The loop holes are pretty small so you'll lose some strands if you cant get a hold of the loop properly because the hair will unravel if you manipulate it too much (PICs). Also the hair is a bit too shiny to look natural (PIC) although I still got compliments. It comes with hair clips and a loop needle package (PIC) with each order so I wound up with two needles and two sets of clips. At this point I've had it in one week and though it still looks ok, there is a lot of frizzing up at the root so I'm not going to be able to wear it for a month like i planned, I can tell already. Didn't notice any real shedding though the unraveling makes up for it. It'd probably better to order an extra pack if you want to wear it for a while since you should switch out the individual locs as they fray. Lastly the metal clips that are included are nice to cap off the look, but they tarnish pretty quickly.  The hair is veeery soft and 18" is the length I wanted it to be.

I applied this to my 5 year olds blonde hair. I did not want to spend a future at a salon because.... she is five!
She DOES love the end result but I will say, if you want a successful process I have several important notes.
1. I can NOT speak to the bleach because we did NOT use it. I hear BAD things about it.... so, read other reviews if applicable.
2. Product is messy! That said; count on the NEED for 2 person application. Do NOT attempt to self apply this product. Will absolutely regret it and ruin your home and clothes.
3. Count on purchasing extra items AND plan for 3 hours from prep start to finish. I will explain why.
EXTRA ITEMS: This product will ABSOLUTELY stain hand, face and scalp. Purchase: extra gloves, vaseline, and hair dye removal!
GLOVES: It only comes with one crappy pair of gloves. For best result, swing by Sally's beauty and buy SEVERAL good pairs of gloves. OR buy some of those thick bathroom cleaning gloves that come to your elbows. this way you can use them and take them off and on easily to both apply AND rinse hair.
VASELINE: COMPLETELY coat ears, forehead, neck, etc with a THICK coat of vaseline to avoid staining
DYE REMOVAL: Swing by sally's and buy a bottle of hair dye remover BEFORE you start. This will get on skin and you will NOT get it off otherwise.
EXTRA TIME TO APPLY: I have applied this product in 4 different colors to both my own hair and others hair. I have NEVER gotten good coverage without having to apply it TWICE. (including this application. pictures attached are product of applying BOTH colors twice for an hour each time) For the vibrant color you will want, count on applying, waiting an hour to rinse. Blow dry and reapply for ANOTHER hour. Do not think you will "quickly" apply this product like a box of normal 20 minute color. You will be disappointed.

Overall, as I said, my daughter is happy with the turn out and I saved money so in my case, it worked out.
However, I have experience with this product so it was successful based on ALL the above notes.
Also, I DID experience severe staining to her scalp and it will NOT come off so far even with the hair dye remover. I did not apply it close to scalp but she is young and her hair is so thin, it bleed right through and left big nasty looking spots all over her little head. That said, I ONLY applied this to the underneath of her hair as an ombre look... so I can keep working on getting it off in the next few days.
I would be much more upset if I had this all over her head.
It is very not natural blond like bad bleach,very yellow
For small head and some red colour streaks in between,no way man with long hair can put it on if he want change hair style

I don't know if this wig is a knockoff or what, but this is the first time that I've ordered a wig that was so terrible that I didn't just keep it since it was under 20 dollars.

It's super shiny and the fibers are low quality. Imagine the look and feel of the wigs in Halloween stores. But honestly I could fix and look past that.

But what I can't forgive is that horrible section they are calling bangs. It seriously looks like the wig was parted in the middle and then they decided to turn it into the pictured hairstyle. However instead of reworking the wig the just added the bangs in front of the freaking part.

It looks terrible and the hair won't lay right because of the placement. Unless your planning on always wearing a hat I do no reccomend.

I really wish I took a picture before packing it back up, but I didn't think to when I tried it because I didnt want a reminder of how bad that wig looked.
Dries out quickly and gets very clumpy. Clumps get inside your eyes.

When I received mine, (the small white round), it was brown cardboard. I mean, it still serves its purpose, but I was expecting acrylic. I was hoping the cardboard is a lay over you peel off, but nope, I just ruined it a bit trying to peel off the brown, it's all board cardboard with a white foam board inbetween, which I think should be FAR cheaper than $10, and it's nothing what advertised. =(

I use retanoids, AHAs and vitamin c serum so ceramides go nicely in my routine and my skin really appreciates them. Im on the look out for a new ceramide based cream so I hoped this would fit the bill.
It is a thick white cream with no odour, spreads easily and feels nourishing on the skin without being too greasy.
On my face it sadly broke me out. But on my hands where I have eczema, It was a miracle cute! No steroid cream has helped nearly as much. I'm really happy I found my new favorite hand Cream shame it didn't work for my face!!

The comes received are very brittle and
Next to impossible to get a tight fit. I have had a tooth break off of two pair just trying to get them to interlock in my hair. They are better than none but nothing like my original pair from years ago. Those are made of a much more flexible plastic that interlock easily and as tight as you need them. My hair is very thin and using them for the first time I could not get them to fit tightly. They kept letting my hair fall out and loosing through out the day, very irritating.

Well a few uses later and this is the result in the attached picture. The breakage occurred attempting to seperate either while in my hair or prior to putting them in my hair.

Look for the France Lux combs, they have tapered teeth thus slide apart and together easily. They are more flexible vs the brittle plastic of the combs in the above picture.
My hair gets caught on the edges.  I sealed the edges with high temp hot melt glue, but I shouldn’t have had to do that.  Now that I did that, it’s usable.

I have used this for many years and am so glad to see it here at Amazon.  I used to have to order it from Australia & pay a lot for shipping.  I have a problem with "raccoon eyes" from smudging.  Waterproof mascaras don't work for me.  This is the only mascara that doesn't leave any darkness under my eyes.  When you take it off, it's little tubules that coated your lashes so it's easily removed.  I have even swam with it and as long as I don't rub my eyes when I come out, it stays.  This is a great product as are the other items in the Mirenesse line!

These are the best curlers ever made!!!

I have thick long, red, Irish hair, down to the middle of my back. I've always wanted to put those huge model-like curls in my frizzy lion's main but, it takes over 2 hours to do it with a curling iron and, my hair is so thick and heavy, I've never been able to use curlers of any variety... Until now! :D

Pros:
Hair raps evenly, stays up, doesnt hurt, is the most comfy to sleep on, only takes 16 curlers to hold all of my hair (most curlers, over 40 due to volume) and leaves no dents in the ringlets!

There are so many other pros... The curl is protected inside the foam and does not require the cap! Doesnt feel heavy/is comfortable with all of my hair wrapped!

There are only 2 cons: You NEED a lot of hair for them to stay securely in place. A short, thin layered curl isn't gonna stay. Thin, shoulder length hair isnt gonna stay. I had to put much more of my hair in a roller than i normally would, which was MUCH BETTER for my needs! :)

They also do the typical foam curler, gets-tangled-in-your scraggly-ends thing. I had to snip a couple out at the very end, but I've let my hair grow wild and untrimmed for a few years, now, so, Those frizzy ends never do well in foam! :)

I gave up on led polish a year ago since having my hands under the led light made them old (irreversible - like terrible sun damage - without the tan) and made my nails paper thin. This is going around Facebook

While I have a bit of discoloration around my cheek bones in two areas, they're not something I focus too much on when looking for a facial moisturizer. I've been on search for something to replace my Clinque Moisture Surge because while it works MOST of the time there are seasons my skin WON'T take it. I wanted something with a bit of a thicker consistency as well.

I picked this up because it has the term "Night Treatment" in its name so it fit what I was looking for.

I really liked the consistency of this product. The fact it also includes Vitamin C is a plus as well. My skin felt so refreshed and hydrated the next day (well like, three days later cause you know, it has to adjust and stuff). The only thing that I don't like is the scent, I felt like it was too strong for me. I tried applying less to see if it would lessen the scent and while it SORT OF did it also didn't. It's something I'm not really sure just yet I can live with or not. Which is sad because I like this product!

This is one of those products what tries to wow you with great packaging and high quality materials. Seriously, the packaging for this thing is better than a $450 watch I got recently. It's top notch.

RAZOR HANDLE - C
This thing is so heavy it borders on ridiculous. It's solid metal. If you dropped it on your foot, it would hurt. It feels good in your hand until you try to use it. There are no good grip points and the entire thing is smooth. Once it gets wet, it's a nightmare to hold and use.

BLADES - A
The blades are some of the best you'll find. Super close shave and they last a number of shaves. You really can't beat them.

CREAM - F
Garbage. This stuff is better than nothing, but that's about it. I used it once and then threw it out.

BASE - A
Yes you get a base to hold your razor. It's heavy, has a rubber bottom and it stays put.

USEABILITY - D-
Bad. If they have the best blades, how is it bad? The head that holds the blade is so big, that it gets in the way. Why this is not an issue for most parts of your face, it's a big issue when trying to shave under your nose. I had to grab a second razor to reach that area. They went for form over function with this one.

If you want a super heavy razor, that will last forever, then skip this one. You are better off with a blade from Supply. They do a very similar thing. Big high end handle and then try to survive off of the blades. The big difference is, their razor can shave your whole face.

I bought one of these to keep my hair trimmed to a buzz cut, thinking to eliminate those pesky trips to the barbershop.  It worked pretty good except when cutting your hair, rather than trimming a beard/moustache, you have alot more hair to vac.  And this trimmer actually handled that quite well the first couple of times, until I cleaned the unit and almost lost the little spring that allows the vac window to slide up and down for cleaning.  I did manage to bend the little spring which is very small and quite delicate and now the trimmer vac system works much less efficiently.  If you clean it, beware of the weeny spring.  Use tweezers when removing the spring and putting it back and too if you do take the spring out, place it someplace where it can't fall or get knocked off.  The other item that proved to be a challenge on this trimmer is the adjustable head lock.  While cutting my hair the last 2 times the lock slips from a higher setting down to a lower setting and in my case I had a much shorter buzz than I intended.  I'm keeping this one for my mustache, but intend to purchase something else for my buzz cuts.  So if like me, you're considering this trimmer for more than your beard/mustache, BEWARE.

Let's start with the good:
1. It does give great definition
2. It does have a slight hold
3. Smelled good and a pretty color gel
4. Had no flaking, mind you I did the L.O.G. method, so I left out the cream to avoid flaking from what many experience
The bad:
1. The definition only last for literally 24hrs and half of that was tied in my scarf, then it started frizzing up
2. Shrinkage was insane after I did a flat twistout and pin up method for stretch, which always works
3. My hair felt moisturized when I took them down and thru the next morning but half way thru the day my hair was dry as a bone. This was after I did the L.O.G. method, that was a horrible mistake.

All in all a complete wait of money but it wasnt over priced to that was a plus. I have issues with frizziness due to my high porosity but I just desl with it but I find my definition last longer when I use a buttercreme of custard. I will just stick with Entwine Couture, no one has even me better definition & moisture at the same then them. If you have high porosity 4c hair stay away from this product it will not work.

The Gonex hanging toiletry bag works for short weekend trips, though I doubt it would persist through the rigors of camping or a multi-week, international journey. The bag is very lightweight, which is good for a backpack or small suitcase, but the thin materials of the bag appear as though they will wear out pretty quickly, especially when frequently loaded with heavy bottles of body wash, shampoo, and the like. I like that I can hang this bag on the back of a bathroom door (see photo), but the hanger on the bag is plastic, which limits the amount of weight you can hang in this bag.

I seldom fly or make long trips, so the Gonex bag meets my needs on short, overnight trips. If you are a person who camps or takes long journeys, you may want to try something a bit more sturdy and durable.

I recently completed treatment for Breast Cancer and am still taking medication to prevent a recurrence. The entire regimen took a major toll on my skin among other things. I tried just about every lotion there is out there from bottles that cost over $70 to ones that cost under $10, and I finally stopped what I was doing that was not working and returned to what I have used for years on my feet.
From the time I was a child growing up on Texas my feet would crack open from being so dry and my mother would pull out this lotion, it was in the same bottle and looked exactly as it does today. I remember thinking about it and just remembering what the bottle looked like, I would ask every person at every drugstore to help me find it. Then one day at the grocery store I ran across it while looking for something else! I was so excited that I grabbed the bottle and forgot what I was originally looking to get.
This has worked for me all my life and it took me two years of using so many different types and wasting so much money on other things that I thought would be better.
After just two days of using this on my hands twice a day, my hands look better than they have in over six months. It doesn't make your hands sticky, which is what one would think after first pouring it into your hands. It is almost immediately absorbed and just works on repairing my hands and skin all over my body. This stuff is amazing, I have now removed all lotions from my bathroom and bedside table and will only use this from now on. At my age I should know that if it ain't broke, don't fix it! Trust me, no matter how dry your skin is or what shape your skin is, this is the magic in a bottle that will work for you. Stop spending you hard earned money on expensive creams and lotions that promise impossible results and go with something that has been on the market for many many years, there's a reason it hasn't changed and is still out there.

I love to put these in the fridge so they are nice and cold and help with inflammation and redness even more. I find that they are quite moisturizing and have not experienced any breakouts from using them. I don't find any night and day magical changes in my skin but I do enjoy incorporating them into my skincare routine. Perhaps the drastic benefits take a long time to see but the immediate ones I do notice are moisturizing and plumping the skin. These are affordable and feel nice. I don't experience any burning in my eyes like other cheap masks have previously done. I recommend these if you are looking to add to a crazy # step korean skincare routine or want a little addition for a pamper night in. I also appreciate the variety of types!

Does not work for brushes that are larger than a pencil. Honestly only works for small eye shadow brushes, does not spin fast enough for anything else. And when I say "works" I mean that it will spin the small brushes, but it doesn't ever get them cleaned completely. I don't know if this is because of the brush shampoo I was using or the machine though. I tried 3 different brush shampoos and nothing worked. When it is drying your brush it ruins it by distorting the shape of your brush. I cannot get any of the brushes I used this with to go back to their normal shape. They all look like they've been back teased with a comb. I am really disappointed in this and wish I could get my money back. I do not recommend. It does not work.

But I have to write a review of this!!!
I have like the most pin-straight hair ever... ive tried curling irons, crimpers, scrunching, braids and even pin-curls (yes, what they did in the 1950's!!)
My hair does NOT keep a curl. I've used 400 degree irons resulting in barely a wave... ive even had my hair professionally curled. And the curls lasted for about 2 hours before I was a frizzy disaster. For the last few years I had all but given up on my dream of a head of locks. Until now that is!
I saw this bed head rock n roller for just 30 bucks on prime.. I figured I'd most likely return it but wanted to try because of the reviews. And I am sooo glad I did! IT WORKS!!! HALLELUJAH! IT ACTUALLY WORKS!
My hair curled with EASE! Like so easily! I am seriously shocked... and so happy with this purchase. 2 of my good friends have already purchased this since they saw me with curls! They know how my hair is impossible to curl, but they saw it themselves!
Ok about the actual product... it has heat setting from low to high and anywhere in between, you can make big or small curls with the bumps (either spiraling over the bumps for bigger curls, or in between bumps for tighter curls.....or a fun messy mix of both), it has a nice long cord for easy movement and it heats up in literally 90 seconds.... no more waiting 10 minutes for a potential fire to start. I tried using the glove but it just got in my way of seperating hair.. you dont need it though anyway. Best part about it... it actually curls hair! (Imagine my surprise lol)
I played with it as soon as it arrived.. I put some curls in my hair and my 5 yr old daughters hair too... we were in for the night and after I easily gave us 2 happy heads of locks we went to sleep. THE NEXT MORNING I woke up with damn near perfect curls still in tact! The both of us did! I didn't even use hairspray! And I am like the energizer bunny in my sleep and my 5 yr old is...well, 5. We all know how they move in their sleep! So I was totally shocked that they stayed in all night! Im putting up a pic from the morning after we curled..still in pjs lol... i didnt take one that night, bc i was planning on doing it better before posting a pic lol but i have to share the morning after pic bc it was such a wonderful moment in my life lol; to realize I could now curl my hair after 29 years of life!
So overall, yes! Buy this product! Do it!! You wont regret it! And, if you are like me and have trouble curling your hair, well THIS will do the trick! I definitely recommend it!!
Thank you bedhead!
Thank you amazon!

BOMB. I don’t remember the last time I got hair this good for less than $50. But I was on a budget and I needed some hair extensions so I bought it. Let me tell you this hair is AMAZING. It is soooooo freaking soft, and bouncy. It does NOT tangle at all and it doesn’t shed either. No smell I am beyond impressed and satisfied because i was expecting your typical “looks good the first hour, then it starts tangling and shedding”, but no. Not this hair. I glued in the whole 16 inch and like 3/4 of the 14 inch bundle and my hair looks super thick yet natural, and I still have an entire bundle left. I slept thought the night and did absolutely no overnight prepping, wrapping, dubi, tying up, or any of that, I literally just fell asleep with my hair down just as I had it, and not even that made the hair tangle or mat,  It was still just as soft and bouncy. Let me start off by saying this; I have been wearing hair extensions/weave for 8 years now and I know the difference between good quality hair and cheap quality hair. This hair IS NOT, and I repeat, IS NOT 8A hair. Thats why Im giving it 1 star, this is false advertising. The hair isnt so terrible but it is definitely not 8a. Same ingredients as CVS brand & Target brand Muscle Rub and the store version has a higher concentration of Menthol 10% vs 1.5% and Methyl salicylate 30% vs 15%. Melaleuca is mostly known for anticeptic properties.  It's the other ingredients that relieve the pain and inflammation.  Don't waste your money.  Many of their products are not natural as they claim.  Bars have several variations of fructos syrup and corn syrup under different names,  their extra relief dry skin cream is basically glycerin, vaseline & dimethecone.  There are way better products out there that are truly natural.

I am taking a break from overlays and needed something for my weak nails. This product did nothing to help strengthen my nails as a stand alone product. After a few days I put on a Sally Hansen topcoat and my nails immediately felt better.

So I went on a search for Chloe dupes trying to save money. Most dupes are UK brands that we can't get in the US. Cute had mixed comments but I purchased it figuring if I didn't like it I would gift it.

1. Scent comparison: It is a perfect dupe. I put the real thing on and the Cute, different wrists. No highly noticeable differences. Remember this is a dupe so expecting a 100% match is ridiculous but as I said I couldn't tell a difference*.

I’m not even sure where to begin. This seems to be another one of those awful sellers who will just send you anything in hopes you won’t return it. They even sent a card offering freebies for a good review so beware.

As you can see from the pics, the unit I received was horribly constructed. There were huge gaps between the tracks meaning there’s no way to wear/style it without the tracks/gaps being seen. As you can see from the first picture, there’s a weird, very visible seam stitched right over one of the tracks at the very top below the lace. There were threads sticking out everywhere and very unusual red and silver strings near where the tracks were sown in. I’ve been wearing lace fronts for a very long time and have never seen a wig so badly made! The only good thing I can say is that without measuring the wig did seem true to length (26 inches) and the hair was soft although it did fall short of 180% density (probably because of the huge gaps between tracks). Amazon hair sellers are always hit or miss as you never know what you’ll get. This was definitely a miss. Sending back ASAP.

I have been using Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Lemon Sage Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner for a couple of years.  It has always performed as expected and made my thin, fine hair more manageable and a little fuller feeling.  The last time I ordered it, however, it did not perform or even smell the same as previous purchases.  My hair did not feel clean after shampooing, or more manageable.  In fact, by day two it looked a little greasy.  I subsequently developed dermatitis around my hairline and down my neck to the point where I had to consult a dermatologist.  She suggested it could be my shampoo and told me to stop using this product.  My dermatitis went away and after about a month, I tried using the Paul Mitchell Tea Tree Lemon Sage Shampoo and Conditioner again.  My dermatitis returned almost immediately.  While I suppose I could have developed an allergy to a product I have been using for a couple of years, I question whether this product sold on Amazon is genuine.  I will not order any more cosmetic products from Amazon due to their self-admitted counterfeit problem. Caveat Emptor.

Bare-bones, just the tools and a case, but the tools are of pretty good quality (I was pleasantly surprised). The sparse packaging is typical of stuff from Asia (just a guess), but you also get the lower price that comes with that. I prefer it that way (less stuff in the landfill).

If you're expecting a manual with it, then this product is probably not for you, safety-wise, and I mean that most respectfully. I guess it might say "Insert in ear, please be super careful". This is the kind of thing they usually don't sell in the US (at least from a big company) due to liability. Especially with the ear, the rule is "Only let a doctor do it" (like it is for so many things). Let me tell you, the doctors I've seen don't want to do it either (would you?). They give you the 'yuk, that's beneath me' look and refer you to earwax drops (which never worked for us). I guess what I mean is that if you're looking at buying this, you've probably tried to clean your ear with other (usually unsuitable) objects (Q-tips, etc) without much success, so you have some experience on what's safe to do and how you might use this. Again, you have to be super careful.

Now my short experience with this is to clean out the wax of another (elderly) person, not my own. I don't need it (yet), tho I suspect it's much more effective when you can see what you're doing, which you cant on yourself. Also, I think by restricting your cleaning to what you can see, you're less likely to go too deep (like you might on yourself). It works really well on dry, flaky wax. On more wet, viscous wax, I cant say. Compared to what I've used before, it's no contest. I'm really happy with it. So much more wax than I've been able to get out before.

There are three tools, each with its own usefulness that is apparent or you can figure out as you go. One is for (dull) scraping (looks like a round paw), one is for twisting/catching loose stuff (bulb-shaped spring), and one seems like a combo of both (looks like a mace w/three ridges). The last one has edges that are a little sharp, which you might need (use gently), but can be painful on the delicate skin of the inner ear. I've seen bleeding from using a Q-tip too much, so be careful.

I would clean these after every use. I use isopropyl alcohol (cheap from walmart).

The plastic case is plain and flimsy, like a throwaway case, but is actually very useful (so don't toss it). You need something to hold the tools, and it's just the right size and transparent too. I need to get better at opening it (press down where the single retaining tab is). There's plenty of places for air to get in to allow the tools to dry. Convenient.

i am a hair stylist. i work in a busy salon and i always have someone in my chair. i have guests from all walks of life, all ethnicities, and all hair types. quality tools and appliances are a must, something i don't compromise on.

i have used three different types of clips in the salon. i have used smooth metal clips, plastic butterfly clips, and croc clips. the smooth metal clips work well for holding foils in place, but they don't do well for sectioning off large sections of hair. butterfly clips work well for sectioning off hair but not for holding foils in place. butterfly clips are also limited by their size. they come in two sizes but even the larger size isn't always big enough for some sections of hair. croc clips will do everything. they are long enough to hold foils, strong enough to hold large sections of hair (they have the expansion bar that bends to allow them to grip and hold large, bulky sections of hair), and they are versatile enough to be perfect all on their own. with croc clips, i don't have to have some of all the others in my station drawers. croc clips are the other clips all rolled into one. i don't foresee that i will ever use a different clip.

the Rioa croc clips are pretty standard. they are stamped with the brand name of "toni & guy," a well-known name in the styling community. i have purchased several sets of "toni & guy" croc clips from other merchants (including professional beauty supply stores) and the Rioa clips are equivalent to those.

Thank you for reading, and if my review was helpful to you in any way, please click "yes" below.
Comb is hard plastic with sharp tines. Was expecting something more along the lines of a flexible Goody comb. Also came from China so took forever to get here.
