These reusable clip on silicone toiletry containers with clips are just what you need for toiletries on the go! I've been looking around for something to make my own hand sanitizer and these certainly fit the bill.

They come in a pack of 6 for less than $13 in various colors which make it easy to distinguish the contents. Constructed of a high grade silicone, they are sturdy, yet translucent enough to be able to tell when the contents are almost done. They are designed with an open space on top to insert the double clips provided, making this them the perfect container to "hang" around and keep on hand, whether to your keychain or to a backpack, you can keep them on hand.

The large mouth on the container makes it simple to fill no matter what you are filling it with. Even dense cream will go in easily, no to mention it's easier to pour liquids into as well. The removable cap has a snap in pin closure (see last photo) similar to those found on many toiletries, so it's meant to keep liquids in and secure.

These silicone travel containers are a great deal for the price. Don't hesitate if you are looking for an on the go solution for your liquids and creams.

I don't know how everyone else is faring constantly wearing a mask in public, but thank goodness for inventions like these inner silicone brackets for face masks! I am so happy I decided to order them.

To begin, this is a genius idea! Finally a way to put an end to all that "air sucking" I've been doing for months with cloth and medical grade face masks alone. These "frames" keep the mask off of your face and give you ample room to breath in the mask without compromising safety! It makes your mask feel "roomier" without making it bigger, creating gaps or changing the actual mask itself.

They come in one standard size which seems to work for everyone in the family, from the oldest to the youngest, the biggest to the smallest, offering relief for each and everyone. While it may not be effectuating much of an actual or quantifiable difference in the air flow inside of a mask, it most certainly feels that way that to us all.

If you are struggling even just little bit with mask wearing, these are a must buy! Even if you aren't struggling, but could benefit from an enhanced fit/better airflow, do not hesitate. Such simple design, such a big improvement over mask alone!

I have purchased a lot of faux hair buns/extensions/ponytail scrunchy type pieces and I have got to say that this piece is hands down the best one I have ever gotten!

The "hair" is beautiful. As with all hair pieces, it is a bit shiny right out of the bag and isn't wearable like that - not if you want it to look real anyhow!. I always start by brushing the hairpiece a bit and adding some dry shampoo to dull the shine a bit and make it look more like my own hair.

I purchased this in the long, curly one piece extension - almost like a curly boa. It is long! Too long for everyday use for me, so I did carefully cut about 8-12 inches off of it after I took these photos and tried again. I purchased it in the natural black which was perfectly matched to my own box dye black hair.

What I like best about this piece is the versatility of styling. I wrapped it twice around my little nub of a ponytail (I have chin length hair) carefully securing it with bobby pins along the way. If you want this to stay on at all, you are going to need bobby pins and a lot of them!

I continued by threading the rest of the extension through what I had already put on and let this drape a bit down the back to create some volume for my headscarf. That's when I realized I had to cut it a bit. I would have had to loop it around twice more to set it in place - but that would have been way too high for everyday use. A special occasion might warrant that much extra volume, but certainly not a day running errands. So cut it I did and it worked perfectly.

I highly recommend this product for someone looking for a nice quality hair extension that is easy to use and offers almost endless possibilities!

A NEW VERSION

I recently picked up the new edition of Oz Pearlman's Born to Perform Card Magic DVD, which was released in 2013. I was curious how it compared with the original DVD that was released in 2003, and in this review I'll summarize what the differences are, and what the contents of the new edition include.

I bought my DVD of the 2013 version directly from the creator, Penguin Magic, but it's also available elsewhere online including at some retailers and sometimes on Amazon. The nice thing is that in addition to sending you the DVD of the new edition, Penguin Magic also gives you access to a digital download of both the 2003 version and the 2013 version, so you get the best of both worlds. Both videos are videos in *.mp4 format, with the 2003 video being 753 MB in size, and the 2013 video being 1.43 GB in size.

LENGTH

The new edition is billed as an updated/expanded version, and that's clearly evident when you compare the length of the two videos:
2003 version: 1 hour 44 minutes
2013 version: 3 hours 48 minutes

DIFFERENCES

So what's the difference exactly? Well for starters, Oz himself is now 10 years older, and has a lot more professional experience under his belt. He has a new look and even a new smile. Everything has been re-filmed and the explanations have been re-done from scratch. Most of the content covers the same material, but not exactly - I'll mention what exactly those differences are in the next section.

CONTENT ON THE ORIGINAL 2003 EDITION ONLY

Not everything that was in the 2003 edition of the DVD is found in the 2013 edition, and several sections from the original have vanished. These are the following:
a) Controls: - Classic Pass; - Hindu Shuffle Pass; - One Handed Top Palm; - Elmsley Count
b) Forces: - Riffle Force

CONTENT ON THE NEW 2003 EDITION ONLY

The new edition is about twice as long, and that's because some of the explanations are more detailed and elaborate, but also because it has some new material. Here's a list of all the new topics:
a) Controls: - Gamblers Cop; - False Overhand Shuffle
b) Forces: - Dribble Force; - Spread Cull Force
c) Flourishes: - Swivel Change
d) Routines: - Slop Shuffle; - Card to Mouth; - Blossom Production

COMPARISON

It's a pity to see some material from the original version left out in the new version, especially the Riffle Force (given its popularity), and the Elmsley Count (given that it is used in so many tricks). I'm also curious why a decision was made to eliminate the Pass, although this is a more advanced move that is typically beyond the scope of beginners, and perhaps that's why it was removed. If material was going to be added, the Glide would have been an obvious addition as a fairly basic sleight, so I'm surprised that this continues to be an omission from what is intended to be a good introduction to fundamentals.

But the additional elements are very solid, and the increased number of routines in the new version will especially be welcome to many people. What I like most, however, is the fact that the sleights and moves are taught in a little more detail, and I think the more elaborate explanations here are very helpful.

Oz himself appears to have lost some of his youthful innocence, and comes across a little more brash and almost over-confident. I'm still not quite sure what to make of his new business suit attired persona, or whether I prefer the younger Oz. But he is still an excellent teacher, and that's really what this video is all about. It's always been an excellent choice for relative beginners looking to get a good handle on the fundamentals of card magic, and overall this enhanced version only makes a good thing even better.

RECOMMENDATION

Oz Pearlman's "Born to Perform Card Magic" DVD has always been applauded for being a great introduction to the fundamentals of card magic, and one of the better entries in this genre. The updated and expanded 2013 edition takes something that is a proven success, and expands it for a new audience that may not be familiar with the original. It still deserves to be one of the top recommendations for new magicians, and continues to be an excellent starting point to give beginners a good head-start with their card magic.

- BoardGameGeek reviewer EndersGame

Beware if you are planning on using this to cover gray hair. I bought this because I recently had surgery that affected my hair (medications and anesthesia) made my hair very brittle and I began loosing it. My stylist recommended we try this since it was all natural and would not hurt the new hair growth.

This product was a joke. My stylist mixed to specifications included with the henna, mix with water apply and wait 45-60 mins. This stuff smells like baby food, and felt like mud on my hair.

After 60 mins he washed with water, per instructions. My hair was limp, and dull. There was no color change to the gray hair, and the dark hair seemed a little darker, but not much.

I waited the 48 hours like it said before washing with soap (non dandruff shampoo since this could cause your hair to turn green) this was not on the packaging but was included from the shipper on invoice. I had to lather, rinse 3 times before my hair felt clean, then I had to apply a conditioner and let it sit for 5 mins to get the hair to feel tangle free.

So in the long run I ended up still having the gray hair. Which was the reason I ordered this to cover it. I followed all directions, and even ordered 2 shades darker then my own hair.

Guess I will use the remaining powder for tattoos or fertilizer in my organic garden.

This works great! You just have to know how to use it correctly. The double curler band allows you to use less hair on each curler so that the hair dries faster and curls faster. Here IS MY 2 HOURS TO PRETTY CURLS METHOD: Part upper hair at crown of head,  and put hair from the upper head at crown,  in a pony tail for later. Snap the curling system closed, so that there is 2 round circle bands to use to curl with, and put both around head like a double crown head band. Push the top curling band where pont tail is for later use. Separate the bottom layer of hair into two parts... left side and right side and use only the bottom circle band curler for the bottom portion of head. Begin curling in left side by spritzing a little water onto the hair at root and curl it under band tucking it under and around curler one time only and then in next pass, grab a little more hair with it and continue going around the curler band. Keep spritzing new hair with water each time you pick up a new piece of hair and add that hair to the previous end of the one you just curled, until the whole left, bottom  side is done. Then start on the bottom right side of hair. When finished,  the  whole bottom curling band  will be filled with the hair from the lower portion of. Now it's time to take out the pony tail that was  on the grown of head  and put that hair under the second curling band and separate the left side of hair from the right. Start curling the left upper part of head as you did the bottom portion... spritzing small portion of hair with water at root and curling it once around the band and then pick up a little more new hair, spritz it with water and curl together with the former portion around band until all left side is done and now do right side. DO NOT SOAK HAIR.  Only LIGHTLY MIST IT a little with water or it wont dry in 2 hours. Dont curl too big a portion of hair at a time either, or it won't dry in two hours. Wait about 1 hour to 2 hours and remove curlers and you will get beachy type ringlets that are big. It takes about 10 minutes to wind hair around curlers. Lovely curls.

I rate the unscented version of this fragrance five stars. It lathers and rinses well (I tried it out not only on my baby, but also on myself, to test it on long, thick hair). It leaves hair fairly manageable, even without additional use of a conditioner. It does have a noticeable soapy smell, but it's not unpleasant. Best nontoxic shampoo I've found for my baby thus far. (We also got the Earth Mama Angel Baby Non-Scents shampoo, but it didn't leave baby's hair feeling manageable, and my husband also thought it left his hair smelling like vomit.)

HOWEVER, parents of babies with sensitive skin please note that the scented versions contain SYNTHETIC FRAGRANCE (or at least the pear scent does). I wrote to the manufacturer to inquire about it, and the below is the reply that I got. I thought it was pretty sketchy that the manufacturer did not disclose this in the product description (and in fact includes misleading information - saying the product is 100% plant-based, and only that "Aroma May Contain Fruit Extracts or Fruit Oils"). Our baby has sensitive skin and a history of eczema, so we got the unscented version, with which we've been very pleased. Just wanted to sure in case this is helpful for other parents of babies with sensitive skin.

------------

Reply From Paradise Island Organics customer service, 3/14/14:

"I heard back about the Pear Scent from the manufacturers. The Pear scent is synthetic and does not contain any real pears. The pear fruit does produce an essential oil, however, it takes 20 tons of pears to produce about 3 ounces of essential oil, which is why it is not available to purchase. But, the synthetic pear scent we use is free of phthalates, parabens, nitro musk, sulfates, glycols, petrochemicals, formaldehyde or formaldehyde releasing agents. Using pear extract or flavor is an option we are looking into for the future, but it depends on how strong the extract or flavor is on how well it holds the scent in personal care products. Some particular fruits hold the scent much better than other fruits. But, we will certainly look into having our chemist test it to see if the pear extract or flavor scent would hold well in our shampoo for the future.

If you have any more questions, let me know and I'd be happy to help.
Have a good weekend!
Sincerely,
Camille Scott
Sweet Baby Shampoo"

Let me start buy saying I wasnt paid to buy this product or sent a free bottle.  I saw that the reviews might have been fluffed but decided for the price it was worth a shot. The scent isnt bad, kinda beachy, its not great, just okay. The color however is nice. Before this i used paint it black and other variations of those cheap 13ounce brands on here. The only one that seemed to work okay was the tingle one and I hated seeing people I knew after the tanner, hugging them, then remembering I had to remind them their face might burn off in the next 20 minutes. So to save the embarrassment I decided to find a not tingle tanning lotion that worked to give me color.  This one clearly has bronzers because my nails and in between my fingers can get stained since I leave it on a few hours after the tanner.  I would say watch out for this, it can be a good thing and a bad thing, good because you know you will get color but bad because it can leave your hands sorta strange looking, its not as horrible as a sunless tanner product and shouldnt stain clothes but be aware of it. I've been getting into nail art, uv gel polish, and nail stamping plates of late, and acetone was chewing up my nails so they were dry and thin.  I saw that this product was being offered during Prime Day, so I decided to purchase and try this product.  I have tried it on both regular polish as well as uv-light cured gel polish.  I must say, I prefer to use this on normal polish only.  It gradually removes the polish, and leaves a nicely scented, moisturizing residue behind that really conditions my nails.  I was much less successful using this product to remove my uv gel polish, but I'm also not surprised.  I may read more reviews for tips, but I am content just using this for removing regular polish and nail stamping art.  Now here is the miraculous part...  I had nail stickers on my nails for 3 weeks, and for whatever reason (the acetone, the pre-application buffing, etc) to put those on left my nails SUPER thin.  They would split and flake if I even tried to grow my nails out longer than my fingertip.  I noticed that after using this to clean my nails after my weekly cuticle removal process, my nails looked really moisturized and clean.  Then, I would top off my thin nails with Sally Hansen Hard as Nails so they wouldn't be so plain.  I'm not sure if it was because the SHHAN sealed in whatever essential oils are in this remover, but my nails grew so fast and bounced back stronger than ever so I was able to grow them out very long past my fingertip!  I literally could bang my nail tips on any surface and I could feel the strength.  I think this will be my go-to recovery method for my nails whenever the same issue arises in the future.

I responded that I would take the replacement and once I had the chance to check it out and make sure it didn't break after the first couple of uses, I would CHANGE my review. As soon as I received the replacement, I started getting e-mails from Simon asking me to remove all my pictures and to give the product a 5-star rating. I ignored the e-mail at first until he repeatedly e-mailed me telling me to remove the photos and give a 5-star rating, neither of which I agreed to. I wanted to make sure it was not defective before I reviewed again. The replacement does seem to work, but before I could write this review I received 7 e-mails (between 4/18/19-5/9/19) from Simon pestering me about removing my bad review and photos and leaving a 5 star review. The last time he e-mailed he tried to bribe me with $50 and a makeup train case. I angrily responded that if he e-mailed me one more time I would upload screen captures of all his e-mails and bribe attempts to my review. That did the trick and he hasn't e-mailed me since. I understand that negative reviews affect the sellers in a bad way, but I also understand that reviews are there for a reason. Had I seen a review such as my own before I purchased, I would not have ordered this product. Yes, I do have a steamer that now works, but the shady business practices of this company angered me. Now I know why the product has such good reviews! They are bribing and pestering customers to change them! Beware! I will not purchase anything else from this company ever again. My 2 stars are now strictly because of the customer service behavior, not the actual product.

This product should be used at .5%
I had countless batches of lotion grow mold within only a number of weeks, because I was following the directions on the label. Germall Plus is used at .5%, but this product is so viscous, I assumed it was a more concentrated version. I also assumed it was safe following directions on the packaging.

The product itself deserves 5 stars, as it is the easiest and most effective preservative I’ve worked with (once I started using it correctly). This is actually the second bottle I’ve purchased with these instructions on it. The other bottle of Germall Plus was purchased on Etsy over a year ago, and both have the name HalalEveryday on the label somewhere. This isn’t a small issue. Luckily, I figured this out while still using the first bottle.
But since the products have the same name and same wrong instructions, I figured I would try to save someone the time and money I lost. It’s worth purchasing- just don’t follow the instructions on the bottle for .2%

I want to start by saying that most of the poor reviews of the SilverWhite line are written by people who clearly don't know what they're doing. This is for light hair, as in WHITE or platinum blonde. If your hair is not light enough, you won't get the results you're looking for, and that isn't the product's fault. With that in mind, these colors are a wonderful alternative to custom silver formulas that require mixing many shades!

I've been dyeing my hair silver for years and I've tried just about every brand of "silver" dye out there with various amounts of success. My hair is naturally a cool dark blonde (ranging from level 7 to 8) and I have to bleach my roots twice to get them light enough for a proper, no brassiness silver. I currently use the Wella T18 toner + 050 for the length of my hair, and do my newly bleached roots with Schwartzkopf Slate Grey + E-1, which fades and blends nicely as new roots grow out. I use Fanola No Yellow shampoo to maintain it. This is a 1:1 dye, meaning you should use the same amount of developer as dye. The great thing about this line is that the dye truly doesn't have any warm undertones (with the exception of the dove grey, which is still cooler than most silvers). I like to add a little E-1 to the slate grey because as with every dye, no matter what brand you use, the cool pigment is the first to fade and adding this extra purple gives it a little more staying power.

I've found that the slate grey does fade more quickly than you would expect from a permanent dye, as it is meant for hair that is naturally grey and has a transparent quality that helps match new grow out; this transparency will also make it VERY obvious if you have any brassy areas or your hair isn't light enough to begin with. Using 20 vol. developer instead of 10 (as is recommended) helps with permanency. The lilac shade also seems to last longer than the other three.

As for being true to color, the slate grey tends to come out darker than shown, and you have to pay close attention to processing time with the silver, which does lean slightly blue and can really take over if you leave it on too long. The dye is relatively gentle since you're using 10 or 20 vol, but don't be tempted to let it process for more than twenty minutes. Both of these color issues will fade within a couple washes if you do though.

TLDR:
These are really great cool shades with little to no warmth and stay true to that as they fade, but
- You MUST have white or near white hair
- Most SilverWhite shades fade quickly, so use 20 vol. developer
- Slate grey is dark and silver leans blue; don't over-process unless you want that

It's too soon for me to tell if this is really working but the surface of my nails looks better.

The problem I have is with the applicator. They use a lip gloss applicator and the fuzz started coming off the first time I used it. I am now using bare plastic to apply it. (just ordered some eyeliner wands to replace...hope they fit the tube)

GONNA JUMP IN HERE WITH MY LATEST UPDATE IN CASE YOU'RE TEMPTED TO STOP READING. Still love this product and....YAAAYYYYY....my latest (direct) order has BRUSHES instead of foam/fuzz things on the wands. They earned a fifth star for this. So happy!

UPDATE: Three months later and all the peeling areas on my nails are gone. I've had no more splitting and my nails are definitely stronger (I insist on using them inappropriately sometimes and they no longer show signs of wear and tear at their tips.)

I think the people upset with lack of progress are either not using the product as recommended (twice a day) or just aren't waiting enough time. This is not an overnight fix or a magic "blink and your nails will be longer" elixir. Your nails need to grow normally but, being stronger, will attain length without breaking.

NOTE: I file my nails daily (in one direction) with a fine glass file to make sure there are no rough edges from day to day. I've done this for years, though...it's not the reason my nails are so much better now.

Expensive? Yes. Worth it? Absolutely.

FINAL UPDATE: Since I also use a cuticle oil that supposedly has strengthening properties, I decided to ask the Rejuvica people two questions (separate customer service representatives). This product does NOT penetrate the nail...it stays on the surface. And if you wash your hands, the product washes off. I'm going to stop using this product when it runs out. If my nails suffer, I'll go back to using it but put some kind of protective wax product over it immediately. If my nails continue to look good, I'll just stick with my cuticle oil (Barefoot Scientist).

There's something in this mask that causes my forehead (mostly but not exclusively my forehead) to break out in large red itchy bumps. I've tested it six or seven times to make sure it couldn't be something else coincidentally causing those bumps and it's definitely this product. I use it in the morning and by that afternoon the bumps/itchiness have started.

I use quite a few different mud masks without issue. I have another brand of manuka honey mask...no problems. There's either something in this particular mud that disagrees with me or else the combination of the two ingredients seriously aggravates my skin.

The mask goes on well and feels OK while it's on the face but I've never noticed any good reaction to say that its effectiveness is impressive. It's a mud mask. Unfortunately for me, it's a mud mask that isn't destined to be used.

The information on the pamphlet that came with the eye drops was interesting; it stated one ingredient keeps the eye moist, it is naturally found in the eye, body. Another ingredient is a vitamin that doctors use to help the cornea... heal.
So I figured these might be good for pollen, mold exposure allergy increased by airplane fumes (low flying jets that go to the airport over my apartment.) and 2 other chemicals in our air; neighbors e-cigarette and drug pipe vaping fumes and laundry mat constant white cloud blowing out into the air, into our apartments; bleach, chemical soaps...

Many of my neighbors have the same uncomfortable feeling. Increased in spring, late fall by certain pollens. We live next to a marsh.

I been taught by natural eye doctors to avoid eye drops. But; for the first time in my life I thought I might try these until my eyes, nose get used to the air here (if that is possible), or I am able to move.

The drops felt nice the first night; but next day I had extreme dry eyes, dizzyish, crawly kind of feeling in head, sinus. Then much itching! I was walking to the store and on the way sniffled. The itching seemed to spread from the eyes tear drainage system into the nose and up into the sinus by the nose/eyes and forehead. Awful strange, strong itching.
Next day (I never took the drops again, have thrown them away); the eyes are very soar and sinus has extreme pressure, crawling feeling and pain. I think the eye drops caused the pollen, mold, chemicals to flow through from the eye-tear drainage tube into the nose, then up the sinus when I was sniffling in the rain yesterday. Today pain still bad but itching less. Following day two; no drops for 3rd day; pain, itching less. Pain gone after days no eye drops. Went back to using humidifier.

Maybe the drops are good for other conditions a doctor might apply for. I do not know. I definitely have decided to go back to my usual use of a steam humidifier, natural food, natural methods, natural medical and eye, nutrition doctors advice. And to keep looking a for a better place to live. After 2 moves in last 3 years; I think this time I know how to avoid a bad real estate deal.

Eye doctor, driving test recently says eyes, eyesight is very good. But got allergy to whatever is in the air. And the air’s chemicals can cause dry eyes.

These eye drops definitely do not work in certain situations, and can make a eye, sinus pollen, mold.., allergy... worse.

I’m a sucker for a good brush set. It’s even better when it comes with case and a sponge!

So the case is very sturdy and feels well made. You can use it as a brush holder and you can use it store brushes. I am using the shorter half as a brush holder and find that it blends in nicely with my other holders.

Now I’ll do a brief breakdown of the brushes and sponge.

The lip brush is great and it blends in my lipsticks really nice.

There are three brushes for eyes- eyeshadow brush, blending brush and angled liner. I have tried these and they are very soft and work very well.

The powder brush is a bit smaller than I would personally like for powder. It’s not quite dense but in a brush that is used for powder products that’s okay. When I’m buffing in the powder I don’t want the brush to be too dense or it will move the foundation around. I’ve been using this brush for blush because of it’s smaller shape and it’s working great.

Now the final two- the foundation brush and the sponge. I decided to do half of my foundation with the brush on one side, and the other half with the sponge on the other side.

The foundation brush is a typical brush of it’s kind. It did not make the foundation look streaky and applied very smooth.

The sponge is the most interesting piece in this set. It doesn’t feel super soft like a Beauty Blender or a Real Techniques sponge. It feels like a softer stress ball and feels a bit rubbery. I’ve never had a sponge like this. I soaked the sponge in water and drained the excess as I would do with any sponge. It felt heavier but did seem to soften a bit and did expand in size. I dabbed the foundation on my face and pressed the sponge around to press the product in and I got a really smooth finish. The sponge did not seem to absorb much product.

Overall I think it’s a very nice set!

I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review. I did not get paid to do this review and my opinions are 100% honest.

Let me preface this by saying that the colors are pretty and generally well pigmented (I use it with Too Faced Shadow Insurance). My issue is that many of the colors are very glittery - I like shimmery shadows, but we are talking big chunks of glitter here in several of the colors. If you're familiar with Urban Decay's "Midnight Cowgirl" shadow family you'll get the picture. Basically the entire palette is gliterry, except for two matte shades. If you get this, make sure to put a tissue under your eyes to catch the fall-out or you'll look like a disco ball. I'm talking serious fall-out here.

The colors are:

Full Moon: Glittery Champagne
Night Light: Supremely Glittery rosey pink (this one has a chalky texture, making it impossible to apply without massive fallout.)
Spotlight: Matte Beige
Nightcap: Shimmery medium tan
After Hours: Chalky glittery medium beige
Moonstone: Glittery deep tan
Cocoa Star: Matte chocolate brown
Eclipse: Glittery Chestnut brown
Night Fever: Glittery Chocolate brown

The positives: The packaging is cute, the colors are fairly pigmented, Too Faced includes looks cards so you can get ideas on looks.

The negatives: This is only a good palette if you already have a nice collection of eyeshadow and you want something to throw in your purse when you're going out of town and know you'll be partying (and you have the patience to deal with massive fallout). You can definitely make some work appropriate looks, but these are more glittery than shimmery, making it a bit juvenile. Some of the shadows are chalky too. I also have the Urban Decay Naked palette and the colors are MUCH better, as is the quality of the shadows. Personally I think Naked is also a better deal. It's $50, so $14 more, but you get more colors, the shadows are better quality (creamier and smoother), and it comes with a nice brush.

I find that I don't use this palette much. It isn't a palette that has an obvious place in my makeup collection.

Updated: I am still experimenting with this palette (I brought it in my makeup bag on vacation and left my UD Naked palette at home) and I've definitely created some nice looks that are completely appropriate for daily life. I just don't LOVE it. The problem is, I have the Urban Decay Naked palette. The colors are similar between UD Naked and TF Natural at Night (warm browns and champagnes) but the Urban Decay colors are shimmers (I love shimmers) and many of the shads in the Too Faced Naked at Night palette are glitters. That makes the TF colors much harder to work with due to fallout. Ultimately, this palette is 3.5 stars to me. It has nice colors and you can create some great looks (provided you put tissue under your eyes to catch the fallout), but the UD Naked Palette is just better in my opinion in terms of pigmentation, ease of application, and blending.

I have thick curly coily AA hair.

It smells a tad too strong and perfumy, and does remind me of waterfalls and springs. It is thicker and creamier than other Suave naturals. It provides great slip, makes my hair soft and fluffy hours after drying, and my hair curls instantly, which lets me know my hair is moisturized.

Waterfall Mist is a great conditioner but not the best Suave bargain. You can find it in stores for as low as $0.85-$1, but it's only available in 12 ounces, whereas Suave Coconut is $1.50 for 33 ounces. So in the long run, this particular scent is not the best purchase for your money. My favorite Suave is Everlasting Sunshine and Coconut, which work even more amazingly on my hair but come in larger sizing with more pleasant scents. For this reason I would not repurchase this particular scent again even though I had a great experience with it. If you don't mind paying the same price for less product and really like the scent, then this is a great buy for you.

This polish is so sheer and streaky.
I love the brush sure but the quality of the polish itself is horrible.
I have to do three coats and the end result ain’t worth the extra time and patience it requires.

I enjoyed this body wash.
Doesn’t smell like much which I like.
Lathers well.

Never has a peel off mask removed a layer of skin.
Be very careful.
I’m always able to use them to this area which is the high cheek not the under eye.
Never any issues before with other products but for some reason this one it was.

This co-wash has some interesting ingredients for its self-proclaimed title of a "cleansing co-wash" but a quick look- up of the ingredients doesn't reveal a cleansing agent. It is a moisturizing co-wash made up of mainly oils & butter which are good ingredients to use during colder months. I've used this product 3 times (twice after a hot oil treatment) and had more positive results after the hot oil treatment, rinsing with warm water: my scalp felt cleansed and curls were moisturized with minimal frizz. When I used it as a straight co-wash & rinsed with cool water, my hair felt overly coated & slimy and only felt clean after a prolonged rinsing.

Positives: Able to work the product throughout hair after initially applying it to my scalp & roots; very thick product so a little goes a long way; hair felt moisturized after rinsing; brought curls to life; fairly cheap at Beauty Supply stores.

Negatives: Strong unpleasant scent that lingers after rinsing (smells like cherry cough syrup); can be too heavy for thin/fine hair if too much product is used or if not completely rinsed out; hair didn't feel 100% clean after rinsing; difficult to find on the ground.

Although the product is giving me a good base to begin my wash day regimen during these colder months, I can recreate the same effect by adding oils to any cheap conditioner so I won't repurchase it.

These nail strips are adorable, I really love the print. There’s florals, paisley and stripes of green, blue, yellow and orange, on a glossy white background. There’s a bit of a 70s vibe to them. Other then the cute print these are just awful, do not buy them even for pennies. They’re super easy to apply. I just applied then last night. This morning they’re already chipped, and all I did was sleep. One of the nails completely came off. Do not waste your money, time, energy or excitement on these.

Lately I’ve been into these nail strips they last me a solid two weeks, apply easily and are much less expensive then going to a salon. I decided to try the Incoco Coconut nail strips, unfortunately these are a  big let down. These nail strips come in a pack of 12. The design I got is called poppy path. They’re white with some 70s style, geometric flowers and leaves. Not my favorite pattern, but the price was right. These come with a little nail file and a cuticle stick. I like the size of these strips, they perfectly fit my nail beds, and are very easy to apply. The excess can be removed with the nail file. And that’s it. Nails are pretty looking for a day. Then they chip. I’ve tried other stops that have never chipped in weeks. This chipped the next day. It also cracks. Isn’t the point of these that they last longer then regular nail polish? They don’t at all. The cracks are just weird. I don’t do any type of hard labor, and if I did it wouldn’t be in my nails. These shouldn’t have cracks. I will not be getting these again.

The hair is really beautiful but it did not meet my expectations. It smelled HORRIBLE out of the package. The shedding was minimal and the wefts are well made but there were multiple colored strings coming from the weft of the hair.

The curl is very loose and curly at the top and more coily at the bottom. I have 4a-b hair and this does not blend all that well with my natural hair. This hair is fine and silky textured at the top but the bottom and to be more course/kinky.

It held up well to hair dye. I used Revlon Color Silk boxed dye to darken the hair to black and the curl pattern remained. I ordered the 16, 18, 20in. and made a upart wig and only used two bundles; 20 inch on the bottom, 18in in the middle and top. I will use the leftover bundle to make clip-ins or a ponytail.

If you have courser textured hair, it may be a good idea to go with Afro Kinky Curly not this regular curly/kinky curly.

Do you have migraines or Meniere's disease or just have a sensitive head? Don't get any of the pulsating Oral B brushes. They will just make you nauseous or trigger a headache.

I have used the classic Oral B electric brush for many years. A fantastic simple white design by Braun of Germany - since discontinued after Braun was bought by an American company. Now I have the simple low end non pulsing model. Essentially the same guts and head as the classic but with an ugly, over stylized, blue body.

When the battery started to die on my classic model, I picked up a pulsating Oral B. It is really banging away at your teeth and does as good a job as the non pulsatinging. But it vibrates your jaw and skull like, well, a vibrating electric tooth brush! After a month, it was just too much for me. I went back to the dieing battery original, but soon got its replacement as a gift.

The verdict: I'm in my 40s and I've had about 6 different dentists (moving from job to job) in 5 different states. One was a professor at a dental college. After each visit, they all proclaim my teeth are in excellent shape. I use the cheapest Oral B electric brush (non pulsating) in the morning and before bed with Colgate Total. I also floss just one time before bed and use the Crest rinse for night time. I get them cleaned every 6-9 months.

Save your money and get the cheapest Oral B electric toothbrush. I think it is on sale sometimes for about $10.

I was pretty disappointed when I first opened them the box was nice and all but the hair felt super thin. Plus I missed where it said these were the thinner strips. It does include 20 though. I was ok applying them with the tape they came with despite the reviews. in case I hated them, that way they'd be easy to take off. Surprisingly i didn't. But of course one package isn't enough and the hair looks super thin compared to mine even though my hair is thin to begin with. I did order two which is why i bought them (2 of these equaled 1 at the beauty supply store pricewise). As far as quality they feel ok so far only 24hrs. When I went to curl them I smelled some type of chemical like when they perm hair so that was unsettling. I Hope to post another picture once I apply the 2nd package in my hair. My own hair is pretty long id say 20 in but these being 24 in you can see the difference so hopefully the 2nd pckg will help. I am used to clip ins and taking them off at night so I will not be able to do a 3rd pckg if it doesnt do the thickness I am looking for.

Follow up review after wearing for about 3 months they are actually surprisingly good. They dont keep curled as I would like but that's not a deal breaker for me. I have had to reinstall them not all of them but a couple here and there and replace the tape. But the hair blends in with my hair seamlessly and they are easy to brush and maintain.

Wow! Please be careful with this. I did as instructed at 45 degree angle and this left a grayish stain/mark on my tooth. Once I was finally able to remove the stain with floss and electric toothbrush, I found that it left a track down my tooth as if I had used a chisel and it also left a bunch of little dots as if I had picked at it. I will post pics of my tooth once I get a good close up. If you have sensitive or fragile teeth, In my humble opinion, I do not recommend. Be extra careful.

In the interest of full disclosure, I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I generally find some good in the products I buy, so I rarely give such low reviews; however, this product had to be the exception. The smell was terrible. The gel was the overwhelming smell of dollar store floor cleaner: a powdery, artificial flower smell. I applied it to my face anyway, because sometimes good products have bad fragrances that quickly dissipate, and you can continue to use the product. That wasn't the case for this gel. The smell was not only bad, it was also strong.

The scent lasted for over an hour until I washed the product off. I wish I could tell you how it actually performed, but I get migraines that can be induced by certain smells/perfumes, and the smell of this product qualified. That was enough to dissuade me from wanting to use it again. If you're sensitive to certain smells, I would recommend that you avoid this eye gel, unless I somehow received a defective one.

If you're not sensitive to smells, then this product might be fine for you, but I can't weigh in on that.

Of course I purchased these because one of my favorite beauty vloggers spoke so highly of them on her YouTube channel.  I do not have a store that carries them, and I was excited to purchase them on here.  To be honest they swatched horribly when I did finger swatches.  Usually that is not a good sign because it is so much easier to pick up pigment when using a finger, but once the product was on my finger it would not transfer to my hand or arm.  I expected very little from these shadows after that.  Well, these are every bit as good as what the beauty vlogger said they are!  They go on the lid very nicely with a brush.  I experience very little fall out when putting these on my brush and on my lid.  I have used them with the LA Girl HD Pro Eye Primer and the NYX Proof it! eye primer.  They work great with either of those and blend like a dream.  I wish my pictures did them justice.  I have included a couple of looks I have created using both palettes in combination with each other and a shimmery shadow (not a Beauty Treats brand shimmer shadow) and one very downplayed look with just the neutral palette.  The two palettes work great in conjunction with each other.  You can really create a ton of looks with just these two palettes and be good to go.

I love the Colourpop Ultra Matte Liquid Lipstick! I ordered StingRAYE from this seller. It was cheaper when I purchased it than it is now. :/ The prices for all the colors have gone up a bit. It was darker than anticipated, but I absolutely love the color. It starts off lighter when wet and gets a little darker as it dries. I loved the product so much I ordered more. This seller is charging quite a bit for this item. I gave it a 4 because the color wasn't quite what is pictured. I did check out swatches online, so I think it may just have a different look on different skin tones. As all mattes go, this does dry out the lips. I always put on lip balm before I apply it, which affects its ability to last as long, but I'm ok with that. I recommend this product for sure.

This opens all lilies and bergamot, heady and strong. It dries down quickly to a soft jasmine with a touch of gardenia and a hint of rose, amber, and cedar. The fragrance remains true from drydown until it fades completely, which is a good six hours or more; surprisingly long for eau de toilette.

The sillage is a bit more than moderate. You can keep it closer to yourself by spraying it below the waist. I always wear fragrance below the waist, usually at my knees to allow it to float up rather than away. That way I can enjoy any fragrance I wear without bothering other people.

Not quite a soliflore, but close. It smells almost like jasmine green tea, except that hint of gardenia. I wear it by itself or layer with a woody or rose fragrance. I think jasmine is wearable all year long, and it doesn't belong to a particular age group. This is a quieter fragrance than Tea Rose. It's cheerful yet cozy, and easy to wear.

Because of the generous size and the nature of the fragrance, I sometimes use it as a room or linen spray. Sometimes it's hard to believe something so pleasing and universally appealing can be found for such a small price. Kudos to Perfumer's Workshop for this treasure.

These did not work for me.  The natural part is way to pink.  They make your nails look sore.  The sizes are too big.  I could only use 4 out of the range of sizes.  Just all round not great.  Would not buy the again.

I bought the oil for my boyfriend who has a nice goatee. The bottle is a nice, very generous size and it has a plastic insert in the neck that lets you shake out a few drops without spilling out too much. This is turning out to be a nice addition by Beardsman as the other brands I have reviewed didn't have this and they became oily messes. It smells like a neutral oil - once applied there was no scent. I make my own soaps and lotions and whatnot but I have never made a beard oil. Now I'm not going to bother as this oil is priced very reasonably and it is really very nice. Beardsman Spirit has a regular customer in me now!

Now for disclosure time. I got this as part of a reviewer program. Trust me. You want me reviewing this stuff because I have no qualms about saying something is garbage even if I got it for free. I tell it like I see it. If there was something to be wary of here I would point it out but I couldn't find anything significant to criticize. I will by this beard oil again! If you found this review helpful, please check 'yes' below. Thanks

Edit May 16, 2019:  I just sent the second brush cleaning machine back to Amazon for a refund.  The first unit I had stopped working not long after writing this review.  It just stopped working.  It would not charge.  I sent it back and decided to give the product a second chance.  The same thing happened.  And before it died, after the first use, it held the charge for a shorter time, each time.  After fully charging it would die after cleaning maybe five brushes.  I'd rather use a brush cleaner that takes batteries.  I am going to get some rechargeable batteries and shop for a new cleaner not made by this company!!  I have had a similar makeup brush cleaner but I think the motor may be going on it and one of the rubber attachments is tearing and it eats batteries like crazy, so I decided to get this one.  Oh wow!  My other one had one speed and this has three.  The highest setting is crazy, in a good way.  It dries brushes so fast; less than 10 seconds easily.  The attachments handle all my face and eye brushes without a problem: even the ones with oddly shaped handles.  There's only one brush that it doesn't do well with, which is a large, thick facial fan brush.  The brush shampoo I used was ecotools shampoo.  You just need a drop in the water bowl.  If you add more you'll have the bowl overflowing in foam.  It also did all my brushes (a lot) without running out of power on me and it charges quickly via the USB port.  Yeah, no more going through all those batteries!

I love this product. The gel is similar to what I've used before, but this product takes it the extra step with the mouth piece and the light to help solidify the whitening gel. It's quick and easy, and it turns off after the eight minutes so you only need to keep track of how many times you've done it in one sitting. My teeth were pretty white already, but it helped brighten them up from some quarantine coffee usage. After five days I have a bunch of gel left over for a touch up whenever I feel I need it. It's a professional whitening  from the comfort of your own home!

This is the first time I've ever purchased a foot file. From my pictures you'll see how clear it is I should have bought one a long time ago. The only time I ever get my feet filed is when I get a pedicure. Maybe once a year. Having the ability to do that at home will definitely help me keep my feet looking, well, normal.

The wood on the file looks really nice and it comes with a suction cup and string so you can hang it up if you want. The red side of the file is quite coarse to help really clean up your feet, but causes no discomfort at all. The black side is also coarse, but less so. It helps with smoothing. Overall it seems well made and like it will last quite a while.

I haven't had it long and have actually only used it once, but just once made a huge difference. I did not follow directions and soak my feet for 10-30 minutes in salt water. I simple took a shower, dried my feet, and used the file on both feet for 5 minutes total. If I had soaked my feet I'm sure I would have got even better results. I also put aloe lotion on my feet after. I never put lotion on my feet and they're usually very dry and cracked because of that. I intend to use the file every day for the next couple days briefly after I shower until I get my feet looking good. After doing so I'll add the lotion as part of the regimen. Using the file is going to help keep me conscious of keeping my feet hydrated so it does more than just file. :-)

After using the file I rinsed it off in the sink with mild soap. It took 10 seconds to get all the skin off and looking brand new again. If you have calluses or other rough spots on your feet this file is a great way to take care of that with little effort. I definitely recommend it.

I received this file at a discount in exchange for my honest review. All thoughts are my own and have not been influenced.

So glad I found this! It has helped a lot with the dry skin on my face and hands. I also use it on my elbows where I have severe dry patches (eczema) and I have seen a dramatic difference. My skin is softer and significantly less dry. I just started using it on my feet yesterday so no real results yet, but based on my experience so far I think it will make a big difference. I have very dry feet and callouses. I love that this oil is so versatile and can be used all over for so many different reasons. I think it's even making my nails stronger. The pump works great and lets out just the right amount so I don't waste anything. A little oil goes a long way, even for larger areas, so it will definitely last quite a while. I also appreciate that it's not greasy on my skin. It rubs in well and I haven't experienced any acne or oily looking skin.

Disclosure:
I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest review. I have not been compensated in any way, nor promised any future promotions. I have no affiliation with the company at all, and I am not required to leave a positive review. All thoughts are my own and have not been influenced.

It does whiten but about 4 days after using it I noticed the tip of my tongue was inflamed, sore and covered in white bumps. I noticed after searching on the web for a cause that others have had this problem too or worse. I stopped using Optic White and my tongue is getting better-slowly. I am 54 years old and had never had this problem before.

When I initially read reviews for this, I was excited to see people complaining about it being tedious and painful. That's honestly what I was kind of hoping for. Guys. Let's be real. Getting this done professionally is also tedious and painful, but you're on someone else's schedule. I'm so here for the convenience of just being able to sit down and do this tedious, painful task on my own time, while watching season after season of Always Sunny in Philadelphia. A few things I learned:

1) using salt water rather than just regular water is crucial.
2) you can't do this to someone else, it don't work. It means PERSONAL when it says personal. I'm going to guess it has something to do with science/electrical current, but I don't actually know, I just found that I couldn't help my sister out with the little black hairs on her neck, but when she held the wand herself, it worked fine.
3) yes, that's lye.
4) yes, those are burns.
5) aquaphor.

It's performing the job it's meant to do, which is a painful, tedious job, but it absolutely does what it says it will do. The only reason I'm not giving it five stars for fulfilling it's intended purpose as described is because of that annoying beeping. I don't understand the purpose of that. It's irritating. Why not use a pleasant LED light fade on the box instead?? Something that doesn't scream at me? Maybe?

There had to have been other design options.
Not curved enough to fit the curve of the eye. Doesn't stick! I've used lash glue, Elmer's glue stick..etc..won't stay on!
My wig arrived on time and  in great condition.  It fits ok, could have been a little larger but it looks great and I look good in it. I  recommend it and amazon to my coworkers.

This is not the same HeelTastic I've been buying for years. First, it smells different. The new scent is much lighter and, to me, less pleasing than the old scent but not bad. The color is different as well. The new color is white, whereas the old color is more champagne or a pale gold. Coloration could be the age of the older one. They seem to go on the same though. Same viscosity, same melt and spread.

The thing that gets me is that the product is only 1-1/5" deep (and 1-5/8" diameter). So much plastic for such little product! The old container is 4" tall; the new one is 3-7/8" tall. Only the height of the lid is different, since the bottoms of the lids align and the containers without lids are the same height. There are some slight packaging differences, and the ingredients list is quite different, though the logo font is the same.

In my case it took three weeks to get these. If I'd known all this, I would have just gone down to BB&B (three dollars cheaper) and bought the stuff there. I think I will do that anyway, just to compare them. (My old bottle is almost used up.) Both containers claim to have 2oz of product, but I don't know.

In summary: Too much plastic! Very little product! Almost 25 percent more expensive. I do not recommend this product.

This advertisement is called BAIT AND SWITCH! The picture shows two bottles. HOWEVER, in the description, it repeats the 16oz TWICE! In the lower description, it reads 2x..... and it states “POUNDS””...
The Seller has described this product in PLURAL form. It INFERS multiple product.
AGAIN, when a Seller INSINUATES something about a product, EG. Advertises in plural and sends you in single, it’s A BAIT AND SWITCH!!! I cannot stress this enough!!!
THEN , TO MAKE THINGS WORSE, I received a leaky bottle!!!
TALK ABOUT INSULT TO INJURY!!!
Seller MUST change it’s wording on this one!
DON’T STAND FOR THIS... REPORT IT TO AMAZON!
Love the length and curl it’s really good for the price
Nice color but very sticky and it burned a little
I love the color but it's very sticky. Also my lips kinda burn after using it

I hate when electric razors tout they give shaves as close as a blade.  They don't... ever.  That said, this one does pretty good.  I'd say at the time I shave, it feels almost as close as a blade, but I get a shadow around 1pm as opposed to 6 or 7pm.  To get a really good shave with this razor, you have to use it for 21 days, as the manual will tell, to let your skin get used to it.  Actually, I used it for almost a month before I was happy with the shave.  I have also found it does better with regular shaving gel (like Edge) than it does with the Nivea pack it comes with.  You will also get a closer shave if you shave more frequently.  It seems to do better with shorter whiskers.  If I shave at night after shaving in the morning, it is pretty darn smooth.  If I wait a whole day, it does not feel as close after a shave.  Couldn't give it a 5, but I would go 4.5.

Bought Yaki Straight Wave Human Hair Extensions Weft Weave Natural Black Color 100% Unprocessed.

This company is selling synthetic hair and they're lying to us to have us spend our hard-earned money on something that is not truly what they're advertising. And they're taking advantage of a large demographic of people who may not be fully educated of their rights. This is criminal at the very least. And they deserve to be arrested and criminal charges bright up against them and prosecuted for unjust business dealings.

Flat ironed the hair @ 350 degrees and it burned CLEAN OFF. I don't have a choice I have to install it now that it is here. This right here is no different than the 10 dollar pack hair that looks really nice but is CRAP in short order. I thought I was getting a deal but all things considered I overpaid like hell.
I do know how to take care of this kind of hair and make it last but it's a lot of work. To curl it, put it in the style you want using flexirods or or a large circle brush and hit it with a blow dryer. Never wash with shampoo, use cold water and fabric softener... that's right, FABRIC SOFTENER BECAUSE IT'S PLASTIC.
I'll upload my video to show the hair burning off like doll's hair later on.

Edit: I came back to really express my anger. How do you sell kanekalon, call it remy and not be reported to the better business bureau? How do they even get away with this? Nothing short of robbery. If your hair is on the way and you're reading this, plan for a refund immediately!

*Do not wear these while sleeping. (I even got a bigger size, accidentally)
My ankles and hands had their circulation restricted, which resulted in the "pins and needles" feelings.
When I first tried these on, the tightness didn't feel bad, at all. I could move my fingers and toes, and flex my hands and feet. I didn't realize the grey Large was actually a Men's Large, I thought it could fit women too. Well, these do fit even though they are a little big.

*Gloves do not work on touchscreens!
I cannot get the two fingers to work with my phone, while wearing these. But, for whatever reason, the Thumb works. Also, just the right thumb works, the left glove doesn't register when trying to use my phone or tablet.

*Silicone covered on the inside
Both the gloves and booties are fully silicone covered on the inside. This makes it weird to walk in the booties, but they have the anti-slip designs on the sole, so you shouldn't slip while walking. As for the gloves, the silicone completely seals moisture inside, which will result in your skin not being able to breathe if worn for a long length of time. My hands were sweaty when I had to take the gloves off during the night, after trying to sleep with them on. Same issue with my feet. So I will suggest you only wear these for an hour at a time.
Recommend
Absolutely garbage… they sent 20 strands of hair, and i can tell it’s not good quality just the feel of it. I don’t like it. And it took so long to come.

I really wanted to like this product because I love blow dryer brush stylers but this one took a long time to get my hair styled and not frizzy. I had to go over each piece of hair a couple of times to get it dry and styled without it also being frizzy. It does look nice in the end but took a while to get there. I also didn’t like that towards the end of the brush there’s not a large enough space to grip the brush so I can use to hands to twist without burning myself. I guess for the price it’s a good product there’s just some adjustments I would make. It does have a lot of power and heats up quickly which is good.
cool gadget ...but couldn't get over the fact that it looks like a small wenis

I'm puzzled. The box said "Costco" on it and had both French and English written on it. It seems like a a version that would be sold in Europe. Even tho these are called "Original Makeup Eraser" (the brand name) they seem to be a dupe (tho not at dupe prices). There is not a band for your hand across the small ones. There are supposed to be different textures on each side--one for cleaning: one for exfoliating. BOTH sides are the same (no exfoliating side). In reading reviews it's clear customers got different versions of this. I got my first wipes from a distributor in US. Another version of what looks like the same 9 pc set is sold on Amazon for 2x the price. The description for that one says:
"The Original MakeUp Eraser is a premium, patented, polyester cloth made up of millions of tiny hair-like fibers that work together to create a "suction" for all dirt, makeup, & oil in your pores. Double-sided to erase makeup with the short fibers side & exfoliate the skin with the long fiber side (side with tag). The Original MakeUp Eraser is a premium, patented, polyester cloth made up of millions of tiny hair-like fibers that work together to create a "suction" for all dirt, makeup, & oil in your pores. Double-sided to erase makeup with the short fibers side & exfoliate the skin with the long fiber side (side with tag)."
I do not believe what I received is the REAL product. No matter what the name. Deceptive.

I was really excited to try the Nano Botanix | Detoxifying Cleanser Gel; I liked the idea it could reduce redness, among other things. With all of the things it is free of (Parabens, PEG, Petrols, Mineral Oil, EDTA, Phthalates, Sulfates, SLS, Gluten, Artificial Fragrances) I felt confident it would work for my sometimes-sensitive skin.

I was wrong. This cleanser caused me to have a mild itchy reaction. It's hard for me to believe that it doesn't have any artificial fragrances, as it has a heavy scent. The cleanser is thick and almost takes a moment to go on well; you've got to make sure your hands and face are wet enough or the gel is a little too thick to spread.

A small note regarding its packaging; I would prefer some kind of top that could be opened and closed with one hand. This one has a traditional screw on-screw off top that was a bit cumbersome once I squirted cleanser into my hand. I rate this cleanser at two stars.

Item arrived as promised and no bottles broken. Most of the polishes take two coats to cover opaquely. A few take three coats to cover. A few of the cream colors are patchy so you need to be careful to apply very thin layers and allow to dry completely. They dry down to a semi matte finish in a few minutes so you’ll need a shiny top coat. The colors are all very pretty and I will use them often. I will update on wear later and maybe give a higher rating.
Junk
cute case but does NOT fit Verizon version as stated

Really bummed about these lashes. The kit comes with 3 tubes of lash glue and it’s a good thing that it does because 2 of the tubes were super dry and didn’t allow the lashes to adhere at all. The 3rd tube doesn’t really have much juice in it though either after applying the 2 lashes to my eyes there is like hardly any left in the tube. The lashes themselves are really thick and nice looking. Not sure if I’ll be able to reuse them or not. I’ll definitely have to order more lash glue to even be able to use all the other lashes. Once on they are really pretty and I suck at putting lashes on so I’m glad it wasn’t a total flop.

Let’s see. I was looking for a nice, inexpensive mint green pallet. It’s hard to find a genuine mint green. No one had left a review of this, so I decided to take a chance. First of all, the shipping took forever. I ordered this April 25, and I didn’t receive it until May 22, almost a month later. I’ve received things faster ordering them from China! Then, once I got it, I tried it out (see pics). The colors are nice, but not extremely impressive. The matte colors are very powdery and get all over your face. The shimmers are nice. I usually dust my eyes with powder, after I apply eyeshadow, to set it, and then apply more shadow, if I need it. I lightly dusted loose powder in my eyes, after application, and I dust very gently. Most of the shadow came off. So I reapplied. The color was nice, but the matte shades faded a lot, after two hours. The shimmer stayed, but the pigment wasn’t as strong, after a few hours.

So do yourself a favor. Buy a mint green palette from a store where you can get it faster, and where the color payoff is better.

This is truly an amazing product for the price! I was shopping for an eyeliner and waterproof mascara for the first time in years. I ran across these and was immediately attracted to the beautiful, unicorn 🦄 packaging. I know, I know. Pretty packaging doesn’t mean a quality product. But in this case, it does!

Omg! The eyeliner is amazing!!! I’m not good at drawing a cat eye (or taking makeup selfies, obviously), but this glides on very easily! You can easily make a very thin line (which I like most the time) or draw a thicker line. Also, I’m not a huge fan of waterproof mascara because every one I’ve ever tried in almost every drugstore brand, and even brands like Clinique and Estée Lauder (love me my Lauder!) haven’t impressed me one bit. Doesn’t improve length or thickness. Holy Spider-Lashes, Batman! These gave me long (and my lashes are naturally long), thick lashes! I honestly wasn’t expecting much, but I’ve honestly never seen such an impressive waterproof mascara in my 20+ years of doing makeup! I applied both of these, when my family and I went to the beach two weeks ago. I normally don’t do makeup at all, when going to the beach because I know sweat and sea salt water (love boogie boarding) will wash it all off and leave me with raccoon eyes. Not this stuff! It outlived my eyeshadow, and at the end of the day (talking 10-12 hours later) I still had eyeliner and mascara on! Talk about waterproof! Plus, the rainbow sparkly pattern is so stinkin’ beautiful! It matches my Docolor Unicorn makeup brushes perfectly! Love displaying them on my vanity! I hope they never quit making this stuff because I will definitely buy again, when I run out! I’m also going to see if they makeup a regular mascara. You NEED some sparkle in your life, and for the price for two AMAZING products, this can’t be beat!

These 18 inch human hair extensions are easy to apply, are pretty unnoticeable once in, and look pretty good. I did find however that for some reason, they did not want to curl as easy as my natural hair. Overall, they blend well, the color is pretty much spot on to the picture, and they work well.

I haven't had a hair cut in over 2 years. Its kind of crazy, but between going through IVF treatments, a pregnancy that we were on pins and needles about, and then COVID hitting, I haven't had my hair colored or been inside of a salon since January 2019. Now that I have a 13 month old, finding time by myself to go is nearly impossible.

With that said, my hair is crazy long and healthy. But going through postpartum, I ended up with some hair loss that is now in the process of growing back. I used to love getting Keratin treatments in the salon because it always made my hair feel so good, look super shiny and healthy, and just overall made me feel good. I was anxious to try this at home Keratin system to see if I could get similar results, and much to my surprise, I did! Not only is it easy to do, but my hair looks, and feels so much healthier! It really did wonders on smoothing out some of the frizzy dead ends that need trimmed, and created a sort of gloss look overtop my hair. It brightened up my naturally dark ashy hair color, and was just what I was looking for.

Definitely recommended for anyone with long hair looking to revitalize your long locks!

This peel and reveal lip color works pretty well. It was easy to apply, I had no issues with it cracking or coming up, and reminds me more so of a stain. The downside that I found with this lip color is the actual color itself. It seems like you can only select colors that are either super pink, or super red. I tend to favor more natural and neutral lip tones. Perhaps because the way the product is made and works you cant do a neutral lip color but I'm not a huge fan of the pink.

So overall as far as false eyelashes go, these are pretty good.

Magnetic lashes have become sort of a craze here in the last year or so, and I can see understandably why. The key however to applying them is to make sure you have a quality magnetic liner for application, and patience.

I'm not huge on wearing false eyelashes or makeup on a regular basis, however for things such as family photos and an occasional date night out, it can be fun to get dressed up and feel a little "extra".

The lashes themselves are really good quality, the liquid eyeliner goes on pretty well, but my only beef is that it can be sometimes difficult to get the magnet part to stick. But once it does, they look fairly natural.

I'd definitely recommend people to give these a try. They are priced well for having 6 pairs, can be reused, and the set contains everything you need to try them out. Overall, recommended.

As someone who has been doing at home manicures for several years and trying out several different types of products ranging from acrylics, gel polish, powder dips, and now polygel. Poly Gel nails remind me a lot of acrylics, but are a little bit easier to apply, and you can get good length without having to use artificial tips. I was worried not using tips would make them more prone to breaking but so far I have not had that issue.

Using the liquids and the nail shapers, its actually quite easy to put on. I've had relatively good luck getting them to last about the same length of time as acrylics, roughly 2 weeks. This set has some nice color options and seems to be high quality. Overall I'd recommend to anyone wanting fancy nails but to save some money, to definitely try at home manicures at home, using this set is a great place to start. Its important to know though that you need a UV light which is not included with this kit. Regardless, I still recommend it!

Overall, this is a pretty decent kit if you want to forgo a trip to the salon. It has all of the products you need to complete your lash perm, however there is a bit of a learning curve to it. Once you get the hang of it however, it goes pretty smoothly. I myself have used several different kits, and this one ranks in my top 5. The results were pretty good and there was noticeable lifting of my lashes. I estimate I will be able to get roughly 3 perms out of this kit in total which is pretty good, especially considering the price. It says it can last upwards of 4 weeks, but I guess only time will tell how long the perm actually lasts. Regardless, you cant beat the price for an at home DIY.
Surprisingly the "EXTRA DARK" is crystal clear. Wow!!!! What a dissapointment. Not sure this is the real deal.

I got this to be able to do my nails from home.
Pros:
* Much nicer in person. The images listed don't do it justice. The box it comes in, the plastic that holds it, and the machine itself is sturdy.
The drill bits can be stored in a little case that pops open when you push the button on the mid-bottom portion of the case. The best part is that it can be stored in the bottom of the machine itself, so you don't lose them.
* The drill is powerful and it has a knob so you can make it faster or slower. (The origional images were lost so I had to retake them after I had tested it. Sorry, I like to take picture of it before use. So excuse the arcylic bits from the nail.)
* It was powerful enough to file acrylic nails but it did get warm around the last nail. Not hot just warm it was pretty good for shaping all 10 acrylic nails.
*Grip it well but just gradually add pressure to the nail if you are a beginner until you get the feel of it.
*You have to hold it down for 3 seconds to turn it on after plugging it in. It will turn blue for forward motion and push it again and the light will switch to red for backward motion.
Cons:
* The reddish-brown filing pieces, that attach to one of the bits, has 4 pieces but they are flimsy. They don't look like they will last very long and they are thin.
*The dial can be adjusted but there are no numbers or levels. You just move it around until you think you have the speed you want. I don't like that because if you know a certain level you are comfortable with you to have to make your own markings with a sharpie or something because it's kinda hard to remember where you had it for a certain nail (real vs acyclic) or for certain drill bits. (minus half a star)
*There is no "click" when putting the drill bits in so you just have to push it in as far as you can. However, I did this and sometimes it would fall off, so I had to push it in as far as I could. (minus half a star)
Conclussion:
All in all I would recommend this for yourself or as a gift. The images from the seller should be updated somehow because their photos make it look kind of cheap or tacky but it really isn't once you see it. It has a good weight to it so it isn't cheap material (but the reddish-brown file did seemer lower quality). The machine itself is really good and we are all in quarintie so they are much cheaper and safer than going to a nail salon. Plus it is powerful enough for acrylic.
**Disclaimer: I got this product free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
Not really natural
Been using this about a month can’t tell nothing different don’t waste your money

(I have 3b-3c hair) SO Y'all.... So I ordered it thinking although it was pretty much exactly the size of my blowdryer's nozzle it would fit but alas I had some trouble getting it on. HOWEVER. that was definitely my own mistake and mine only!! My solution was to pop the plastic topper with all the bumps out and push and stretch it out from the inside after trying to get it on as good as you can. I finally got it on and washed today and wow!! Compared to the diffuser that came with my hairdryer I can tell a SIGNIFICANT difference in how much better this diffuser actually diffuses the air throughout vs. my old one. Drying took around the same time for me, however I had much better curl definition than ever before! I would contribute this to the soft silicone construction which forces you in a way to be more gentle with the way you dry as well as the wide circumference of the circle which allow you to push the hair up in good sections easily. Im sooooo happy with this product and definitely recommend it.

Second update taking down another star... these are junk !
Taking down one star, as it breaks the tops easily. I wish I had returned it since I can’t use 3 of them with my boys due to girly colors, no way they would accept pink and purple . So I am updating the review as the flip top cap breaks off and the container is useless.
I have boys and my complain is the colors:
The item works and it came empty, but we filled with our favorite sanitizer and it is super good to hang at back packs and lunch bags. However from the 6 we could only use 3 due to the colors, it came more pinks than shown and for families with boys this is an issue.
