Wow! I've tried a lot of different Argan Oil shampoo and conditioners (and sprays and masks and hot treatments etc) and I can 100% say this is my All time favorite for no other reason than how incredibly fast I'm seeing a difference in the ends and improvement on breakage. I color my hair and have been for close to 10 years now and just in the past year or so I've started having really bad problems with breakage and split ends. I've tried probably 10 different brands or more with some kind of argan oil treatment and it really helps. But I didn't get results like this from anywhere else, and I've tried some pretty pricey stuff. After like, 3 days of use I happened to look down at my hair one day and it just hit me that I didn't have any frizz or areas that looked wild and untamed from breakage, the hairs that would normally have 2 or 3 splits or frays were just smooth all the way down. I tried to take a picture of the hair up close so you could see but couldn't get a clear shot at such a short distance. The color looks richer and has a healthy looking shine, it isn't greasy or stringy like you might worry about with Argan Oil.
This stuff even smells amazing! I usually like coconut scents, it's always been my favorite, but this smells more floral and a little spicy, which maybe sounds weird but I think it's soooo good.

It lathers up surprisingly well for an Argan Oil shampoo and I don't have to use much for my bra strap length hair. My hair is really thick, too, but a good quarter sized dallop works out to be about the right amount for me. I do the ends and body first and work my way up to my scalp, backwards from how I use regular shampoo. (I do this because some brands seem to leave my hair oily if I don't get it rinsed out well, that Argan Oil can be stubborn.) I usually let it set for a couple minutes while I wash my body so the hair can absorb the nutrients before I rinse it away. I follow it with their conditioner and my hair gets sooo soft when it dries. I really can't stress enough how well it helps my hair. I know everyone responds differently but for me, it's better than anything else I've tried. I'll be ordering this again for sure.

I did receive my Argain oil shampoo at a promotional price for testing and evaluation purposes. I was not paid for my review and was asked only to provide whatever feedback I may have about the product, whether it be positive or negative. I welcome both positive or negative feedback as well. My review is solely based on my experience and honest opinions of this shampoo.

I have color treated hair that I've been dying for about 8 years now and I have to really maintain it to keep it healthy and looking smooth. I learned some time ago how much better my hair looks when I use Argan Oil treatments and would do them once a week or so to make my hair super soft and pretty. I started using shampoos and conditioners with Argan Oil when I saw how well my hair responded to it. Some brands left my hair feeling heavy and oily so I really wanted to find a good clarifying shampoo. I started with just a little bit so I could gauge how it would work for me but once I lathered it up in my hair I realized how much a little bit can cover. I don't need nearly as much as I do of most other brands. I washed it that night and followed it up with my regular conditioner, another Argan product. My hair felt really clean. I have a lot of hair and at the top I couldnt feel the heaviness and resistance I had been from over moisturizing. The smell was ok, I like something that is stronger and prettier, this one just kind of smelled like soap, and it faded quickly after It was dry. As long as my conditioner smells good I don't mind it too much but if you're planning to use it alone you might notice. I think it worked well for getting it clean without leaving it dry or feeling like straw. I don't feel like my hair is as soft as with most Argan Oil shampoos, at all, but I think it'll be a good one to use intermittently to clear the buildup from all of my oil rich products.

I was surprised and disappointed at the ingredients list when I looked. From a company called InstaNatural that boasts this as a holistic treatment I didn't expect to see so many chemicals. I would have preferred more familiar ingredients, and natural, obviously. Argan oil isn't even listed until the second to last ingredient. I like how it worked but I'm not sure how hard it would be on my hair if I used it regularly.

I've been dying my hair for almost 10 years and have done plenty of damage from the harsh chemicals and styling that I've put it through. I started using argan oil masks to repair some of the damage I've done but the one I was using was more expensive then what I could afford to use regularly and was way too perfume-y for my taste. I have been trying Opulent's shampoo and conditioner lately and noticed how much better my hair was starting to look within the first week. That prompted me to look up their hair mask hoping that I could find it at a reasonable price. For this 8 ounce jar I'm paying less than half than I was with my previous product. This scent is so much better too. I use mine about once every two weeks to keep it looking healthy and strong. After shampooing I towel dry my hair and apply this throughout the body of my hair. I tend to apply much less to my roots because my hair gets greasy easily. After washing my body and shaving I rent the mask for my hair and holy cow! the difference can be felt right away. My hair is smooth and the brush slides right through it, I'm so impressed! I think I will be a lifelong customer of the Opulent line. The prices can't be beat and the results are to die for. I'm so excited to have found them!

Grammy® 18 Inch Long Straight Nature Full Head Clips In Human Hair Remy Hair Extensions Clip Extensions Human Hair Clip 7pcs ( #99J Red Wine Burgundy) ...

This is a review for Grammy 18" long straight nature full head clip ins. The hair extensions arrived as planned and they were attached to cardboard the length of the hair to keep safe. They were then wrapped in a plastic bag to cover hair. Upon opening the hair I did not smell any kind of smell to the hair. The hair is soft to the touch and was the right color that I had ordered. As with any extensions, you receive in the mail first thing you must do is use a hot iron and get the creases out from shipping. When combing through the hair there were no tangles or missing hair. I did have a little bit of shedding but that is to be expected and was not enough to have a second thought about. The hair straightened great with no problems. The hair is sewn onto a small comb metal clip and I did not see any loose clips.

The quantity: The hair is what I expected it to be. When I compared the two matching pieces together I did note that one has more hair than the matching piece. (You will see in pictures that I have included in this review). However, this was on the two smallest extensions and not any other piece so for me that is not a big deal because I usually do not use those pieces.

The quality: This is my second hair extension I have ever owned. The first one I bought I paid quite a bit of money for and the hair was not near as soft as this one from Grammy. The quality of this hair is what I expected it to be but with softer hair. I am very pleased with the quality.

In my opinion, if you have somewhat fuller hair than one package should give you the fullness you are seeking. With that being said, if your hair is really thin and you are seeking a full thick head of hair look than you might need to go with 2 packages. I would but then you run into how to clip all the pieces in your head. You must have hair to clip these on for them to stay in place.

How I manage to be able to keep the extensions in my head all day all night and even sleep in for 2 nights if I want is by starting with clean dry straighten hair. I then part my hair every spot that I will be clipping an extension to and I spray with a strong hair spray let dry and then I take a small man's comb and tease just at the base of my hair close to my scalp, that gives the clips something to hold them in tightly no matter what I am doing.

I hope that this review has helped in your buying decision. I have posted pictures that I hope will allow for you to see each piece and the clipping device. Thank you for reading and if you have any questions or comments please feel free to post. I have added 12 pictures and I hope this is helpful.

DISCLOSURE: Product received to test with the option to review. No financial compensation is EVER accepted, and a vendor may request that item be returned. I reserve 4 and 5-star ratings for products I would either recommend to others or buy for myself. This is a great product that I would highly recommend.

Trying to save you some time reading through all the reviews.  From my own personal experience, and that of many others I have seen on this and various other sites for reviews on this product, it just does not work well at all for course body hair, so do NOT purchase it for that.  To be fair, it may work better for it's title area, but I still have to give it one star, because it makes bold claims to remove body hair for extended periods of time over your entire body (which it failed miserably on for me and many others).  In fact, even on some of the positive reviews, people indicated it was like "a close shave" and that they have to use it very frequently, which goes against the company's claims.  A lot of hair removal gels and creams remove hair to skin level, so that is not really effective (or pleasant, as it leaves you with almost immediate stubble).  It also seems to be a cheesy company run out of somebody's basement, based on the Ziploc bag packaging, photocopied instructions, and weird 1960s children's glove.  If you have course body hair, this stuff is not going to help you, unfortunately.  So, buy it for your balls, but not for your body if you have course hair.  Major failure in that respect.

I should have heeded the less than favorable reviews on this product.  Near as I can tell, this brush is not 100% boar bristle.  When I fist got the brush, I ran my hands over the bristles.  About ten of them fell out in the sink, they were un-naturally v shaped, folded in half.  A natural hair, cannot be made to hold this shape, unless this is its natural shape.  Last I checked, boar bristles are straight.  Then there was the burn test, hair should ignite and go to a soft grey ash.  This curled back from the flame into a ball, that when crushed was very black like charcoal.  The brush makes my hair go very flat to my head and have a lot of static when touched.  The rubber pad, could be contributing to this.  The wood handle is nice.  This may have some boar bristles, but this benefit is lost due to the "other" bristles.

This teeth cleaning kit consisting of an ultrasound toothbrush and a “flosser” was fun to use. The rechargeable toothbrush is comfortable in the hand, requiring no actual conventional brushing. You just hold the toothbrush head over the tooth surface and let the ultrasonic waves do the work. It even gives warning beeps telling the user its time to move on to a new section of your mouth. The unit gradually builds up intensity over multiple sessions so new users can get used to the vibrations. One warning would be that if you have extensive repair work on your teeth (I had a chip filled on my front tooth) you may want to ask your dentist if its safe to use. If you use the brush correctly there is no problem, but if you accidently touch the hard plastic part of the brush head to a repaired tooth area it could cause damage. It has not happened to me yet, but I can see it happening.

The flosser is more interesting. You fill a small resevoir on the flosser handle with water or mouthwash, press the flosser head between your teeth, and press a button. This sends a blast of water and air between your teeth. It doesn’t hurt. It seems to be effective and possibly more effective than a string type floss. It is definitely more comfortable than using a string flosser. Only the front spaces of your teeth need the treatment so accessing the inside of your teeth is not necessary. It is a messy process if you do not have your mouth closed, as the water can spritz out of your mouth or make you drool, but with practice you should be able to minimize this (or use it in the shower).

Battery life seems good so far. Both the flosser and toothbrush have their own charging stand. No plugs are used (except the AC wall plugs). You just drop the brush or flosser on a stand with a metal stud to begin the charging process. It can take several hours to reach full charge.

I like using these the brush as it seems to be a bit more thorough than the average toothbrush. There are vibrating toothbrushes that act more like conventional toothbrushes available and you may like them just as much. The flosser, however, is truly unique, and if you are like me, a person who never flosses, you may find yourself actually enjoying the process.

Pros:
Colors aren't as vibrant as the Seller's page indicates.
Each band is individually wrapped.
The bands are soft, lightweight, and stretch well.

Cons:
The bands themselves are pretty narrow; so they won't do well with longer (or thicker) hair.
Wide variety of colors.

It's nice that this bonnet is larger than most others to accommodate longer hair, but there is not elastic in the head band, so it can fit pretty loose on your head.

If you have short to medium hair, this will more than likely not work for you because it will easily slide off while you are sleeping... or slide down and cover your eyes while you're sitting up, reading your phone.

The material is nice and smooth, but that's about it.

Incredibly easy to use and to clean.
Brush your dog or cat as you normally would, and after a couple of strokes, take a look at the bristles. You'll be amazed at how much hair this brush has accumulated (we have medium to short hair cats).

I would not recommend this brush for pets that have long hair, unless you're looking to groom just the top layer of fur. otherwise, you can not reach through all of the fur to get to the base to fully smooth and groom your pet.

Instead of using your hands to try to grasp all of the hair to clean the brush, you simply press the button on the back, which pushes the brush pad forward and gives you a 'pillow' of pet hair that is EASILY removeable!

Highly recommend this pet brush!

Everything is very lightweight, which is nice, but the toothbrushes are so light that they tip over VERY easily. Also, unlike other typical toothbrushes, there is no flexibility to them. After repeated use (and rinsing), the handle just doesn't feel as clean and comfortable to me.

No tray was included (as the product picture shows), but that's fine. I wouldn't be keeping my toothbrush with an exfoliating pad anyway. Would have enjoyed the exfoliating brush more if the handle loop had just a little more space to allow me to fit my hand through it to hold the brush properly.

The comb has very wide teeth, which is good for long, thick hair just after washing. But if you don't have long, thick hair... it's pretty much useless. Would've been nice if the handle of the comb had a notch or a groove to allow for a better grip.

I’m a 29 year old, very pale woman who’s been self tanning since 16 years old. I’ve tried just about everything I’ve ever ran across and now it was time to try this. Hands down, this is the best can tan I’ve ever used. I’m very thrilled about finding it!! First off, the smell is very light, and nothing like the average self tanner. I can smell most self tanners from a mile away and immediately recognize the smell, but NOT with this. Also, let’s be honest, if you are seasoned at all with self tanning, you know self tanners make your armpits stink. This is the only self tanner I’ve ever tried that doesn’t do that!!! It has instant color, so you can see where all you’ve rubbed it in, rather than just guessing, in order to get that flawless tan we’re all looking for. I personally use gloves underneath the mit that comes with it. It works out wonderfully for me. I did my research before purchasing this product, and I noticed bad reviews from a different seller with the same product, which most all were saying the exact same thing..... the can is messy. I’ve used this exact can 4 times by now, and I’ve never had a mess with it leaking until this last application. If you experience this, here’s what you do!! Mine would squirt all over the bathroom every time I attempted to spray more. So, I wiped the can clean, effortlessly pulled the spray part off, then wiped it from underneath and also wiped on top of the can beneath where the spray top sets. Wipe it completely dry!! Put it back on, and carry on. No more leaky issues whatsoever. Very easy fix!!! I can’t stand to read a negative review on a great product simply because the reviewer didn’t use their head and fix the problem. Overall, this is by far a 5 star self tanner. It doesn’t wash right down the drain after your first shower like other tanners seem to do. The color is good, and it lasts! I’ll be keeping this stuff in stock for sure.

Also, I recommend rubbing in some moisturizer on the knees, heels, ankles, toes, elbows, and knuckles before using, and remember to go light on those areas to avoid orange patches. After all, it’s still a self tanner! And I purchased the back strap that helps you rub it in on your back, I recommend that too!! I’m telling you, this is the way to get your HEALTHY, beautifully flawless tan. This is it, guys.

Happy tanning!!!

First for a disclosure: I didn't buy the Plexiderm on Amazon, so you can believe my review or not.

Now for my review: I was concerned, despite many online videos that show this product in action, that it would be a scam product. And that's just because of the reviews here on Amazon. NOT! I tried it and it worked EXACTLY as promised. I watched in my makeup mirror as one eye bag disappeared before my eyes- fun! It didn't leave a visible film but I have very light skin especially around my eyes, so this product might leave a chalky looking film on darker skin. (They recommend mixing the product on the palm of your hand with your foundation 3:1 if that is an issue)

Next: This is a TEMPORARY fix, just like makeup is. It will only last 6-8 hrs depending on whether you sweat or have oily skin (both things will cause it to 'disappear'). Some bad reviews here reflect frustration over the bottle dispensor (you have to pump to prime it and must be careful not to overpump and waste product)- for me, maybe i got a new and improved bottle type, but I didn't encounter any problem whatsoever!

As for price and quantity- yes, its expensive and yes, you'll be lucky if one bottle lasts you a month. As for me, I don't intend on using it every single day unless I get hooked. :0 Each bottle has only 0.5 mls in it but you only need a teeny tiny drop each time.

Lastly, i think your review will depend on your expectation. My expectation was that the product would do what it said (temporarily de-puff some eye bags) and it does exactly that so how could I take any stars away from them? The cost was fully disclosed beforehand as was the product performance. All in all, I'm now obsessed! And I'm 100% sure that this product is in every single makeup artist to-the-stars bag these days.

Its being sold at an amazing price, even for costume jewelry, so I'm giving it 4 stars (would have liked to give 3.5 stars if it were possible...anyway, if it had cost upwards of $10, I WOULD give it 3 stars).  Its a fun piece but here's something helpful I wanted to tell potential buyers: its got  'gold' or 'brass' looking metal accents, NOT silver. The picture on my computer makes it looks turquoise and silver AND gold, but you really have to know that the 'metal' looking accents will be  brass colored (bright yellow gold) with plastic turquoise.  So much so, that I wouldn't even pair it with sterling silver earrings.  That being said, I find it helpful to have a costume piece with this coloring because sometimes you need something to go with gold- and that's not a usual combination with turquoise.  What else helpful can I tell you?  Its very lightweight and the 'stones' are plastic but surprisingly, once on, it looks very nice!  I'm thinking it would be fun for cruise or Island wear, wherever you are in very warm climates, because of its light weight.  I would not recommend it, however, as a gift, because it 'feels' cheap and lightweight plastic-y when you handle it (even though it still looks nice on).

This is a clip-on human hair extension.  Here's why I love this product (and have bought several): 1) its human hair. I find that the synthetics cause me to itch where the ends touch skin when it swings/sways, but the human hair doesn't.  Plus its softer than synthetic.  2) you can wash, color and curl this.  I hot curl mine all the time (one of the 'con's' is that the curl doesn't hold from wearing to wearing).  If you had to color or wash this, you could. I've done both too!  But needs to be handled with great care!!! 3) its one unit, so its easy to apply. It has 4 clips across the back where you clip it up under your hair in back to gain a bit of length and alot of volume.  Keep in mind that this one is only 10 inches. That means that it will come just about to shoulder length (depending how you clip it in). It is NOT a long hair extension (look to 15-17 inches if you want long hair).  Other info/tips: The colors shown online are slightly off from what the piece will actually look like, but the descriptions are good. They will NOT take this back if you wear it, brush it out, etc. - so be sure to know the color you want before you order.  This company sells a wheel of colors for about $20 (you'd have to inquire directly with them for current price of their color wheel) and if you never ordered any from them before, I'd recommend getting that wheel to be sure of what you will get under each color number/name.  That being said, and you still want to chance ordering from the online descriptions, remember there will be some 'forgiveness' to the color you order because its clipped under your own hair and gets kind of mixed in.  I would recommend a shade darker than your own color, rather than lighter.  Lastly, if your hair is VERY, very thin...you may find that clipping in a full extension like this one is not practical (won't hold or blend well) and it may pull uncomfortably at your own hair and even cause breakage.  Along same line, I would not recommended this for people with bald patches.  But for thinning hair perhaps due to aging, or because your own hair was never the thickness you wished, or for a fast dressing up of your own hair for special occasions- this extension is ideal and you will love it like I do!

Shame on you Trader Joe's! This is so unlike you to foist this kind of inferior product off on your loyal customers. This is a new lotion that replaced the good lotion previously sold with a different label. You got rid of the good stuff and sold us this greasy, dry-your-skin- out garbage. This is just plain awful. Bring back the good stuff! Buyer beware! Some of the review,, on here, are for the older previous edition of this product, which I touted to all my friends. There is nothing at all good about the new stuff.

I really don't understand people who think the flavor is so heinous. It's a little strange, but nothing that's going to make you gag. I also wouldn't say that it tastes are smells like synthetic chemicals. These come pretty fresh sealed inside the packages and are at first really easy to peel and loosen the fibers. Once it dries out, you will need to employ the water-soaking method, which makes it simple enough. Just make sure it soaks for at least an hour for very easy handling. I've been using the same stick for months. It usually takes about a week or two for the end to get ratty enough to cut and start over again. I wouldn't say this stick eliminates flossing. It depends on the way your teeth are situated. I have some problem spots that I absolutely need to use floss for. That being said, I've noticed a significant reduction of plaque that is removed with a floss after brushing with a miswak (vs. after brushing with a good conventional toothbrush or even a sonicare toothbrush). In my personal experience, a miswak works better than a Sonicare. However, if you like the convenience of the Sonicare, stick to that. It depends on each person's habits and personality. You can damage your enamel with a Sonicare, so please be careful and follow the instructions carefully. You really don't have a problem with hurting gums or the enamel with a miswak. It is also the perfect travel toothbrush.

Pros: Lasts a long time, is completely natural, no need for toothpaste, minimal flossing, travels easily, gentle on teeth and gums while getting into nooks and crannies better than a traditional western brush, dental study shows improvement of gingivitis with regular use of miswak.

Cons: Awkward handling for back of teeth, must peel to get a new layer, some people don't like the taste, not easy for children to use.

I am relatively new to solid colognes. I own this sampler set, Oak City Beard's Sandalwood Bourbon, and a sample set from another company. The other company's set was my first venture into solid colognes. I liked the variety it offered, and their colognes usually lasted most of the day.

I expected the same from this set.

I will admit, I liked variety that this offered, which is why I ordered it. Now that I've had time to try out each one, here are my thoughts. (Please note, cologne can smell different on each person, so what didn't work for me, may work for you.)

Barista - I don't drink coffee, so the thought of smelling like coffee all day was not a selling point for me. I figured this would be my least favorite of the four. When I opened the tin, it smelled like a 30-year-old motel lobby. A powerful scent of cheap black coffee, with a hint of musty cigarettes and pleather couches. I was not impressed. Still, I put it on and the smell changed to more of a 1990s coffee shop. Fortunately, the cocoa smell came forward more once it was on me, and the coffee was not as strong. I don't hate it as much as I thought I would. In fact, I kind of like how it smells on me.

Woodland Ranger - My favorite out of the bunch. While you may think it would make you smell like a Christmas tree, it's more of a clean outdoors scent.

Snow Leopard - I love me some sandalwood, so this was the one I really bought the set for. It says there is peppermint in it, but I can't smell it. Also, I feel like the vanilla overpowers the sandalwood. Not as good as I had hoped. Not bad at all, just not what I expected. (This one also seems to dissipate quicker than the others.)

Uncle Jack - I smell the bourbon and a trace of tobacco, but once again, the vanilla is the stronger scent here. It's definitely not a bad smell, probably my second favorite of the pack.

As I mentioned in the headline, the colognes are just not as strong as I hoped for. I mean, I don't want to overpower everyone in my general vicinity, but I do like to smell the cologne throughout the day and none of these do that. Perhaps I'm not putting enough on. Like I said, I'm new to this whole solid cologne thing.

It appears that, due to an observational study finding a small correlation between talc and cancer, many now believe that ‘science has prove talc bad‘. This is due, primarily, to ubiquitous misunderstanding of what constitutes ’science’ and how enormous a difference there is between the reliability of actual science and observational studies—the former, after repeated and properly-designed experiments, provides a strong basis for causal inference, while observational studies provide little more than a reason to conduct an experiment. Of course, we never hear about any actual experimental results, i.e. actual science, with things like this, because, either the observation result was merely promoted as a sensational headline and the people who conducted it know very well a minor correlation doesn’t even justify the time and expense of an experiment, or because experiments were conducted and didn’t produce the sensational result.

Unfortunately, when media takes advantage of this widespread misunderstanding, good products are removed from shelves and good companies producing good products lose money. Here, it appears the company chose to give in to the hysteria, which is a shame. I suspect that, if their actual customers had much of a voice, they’d find out this was a bad decision. They may find out anyway after people get tired of gelatinous gravy covering parts of their bodies after rubbing corn starch on them and sweating.

I use the product on my 16 month old grandson's hair. He has very thick and course hair. The only problem I see is the curly cream (step 5) , it has left white residue in his hair. I rub thru it very well to get it out.  Every child/person hair is different. Also, i have felt after using the curling cream (step 5) it dries out his hair after about an hour or so. So I just stopped using the cream and I feel it works better for us. It makes his hair so soft and it detangles it so well that I can comb thru his hair with my fingers. The oil makes it shine. I hope they could work on the curling cream to take out the residue which I think is what dries it out. I will continue to purchase the product.

Packing was not the best and super messy with all the pieces going everywhere. The brush bristles aren’t as soft as other brushes I’ve used, but still soft and leave hair feeling nice. The two smaller combs are easy to use and go through hair nicely. The clips are a bit intense and bigger.

I was excited for these, because my brushes always leave sparkles and color all over my make up bags. But these did not work well!! They are so so small and couldn’t even make it up the stick of my brush. It kept getting stuck and was too small. I ended up breaking off the brush part from the stick because of the force I was trying to use to move the silicon up. The small eyeshadow ones were way too small to get the hairs in. It’s almost impossible to get all the hairs into the covering, and not get them sticking to the outside. Also not sure why they have suction cups on the back side of them. Overall it’s a pain to even attempt to put the silicon on the stick and then over the hairs. Not worth it and doesn’t work well. I know a lot of people love these eyelashes, but they were a miss for me. I really tried my best to apply them correctly, but they didn't stick well unfortunately. Such a good idea, but just not for me.

I really wanted to like this as I am generally a fan of Conair's products. However, I have to agree with many of the other reviewers that this is basically a glorified toy - and one that doesn't work. The term "braider" in the title is misleading - all this does is twist hair and it has a tendency to get the hair caught in it. Disappointing.

At first, I wanted to give this a 4 star review. Initially, my biggest issue was the eyeliner applicator isn't the best. The brush itself is too long so it's hard to be precise and it got product all over my eyelashes. Personally, I would probably rarely if every use these as I don't wear eyeliner very often and never as thick as you have to apply it for these. Even if it would stick with a thinner line, the magnetic base of the eyelashes is pretty thick so it gives the impression of a thick eyeliner. I think you would have to draw the actual eyeliner thicker than the base so you can control the shape. But I recognize that this is more a makeup style preference than a default of the product.

And then I went to remove the eyeliner. Holy mother of fire demons did that burn so bad! My eyes and skin can be a little sensitive so I'm always extremely careful with what I use to remove makeup and how I remove it. I was being extra careful not to rub as I didn't want to risk getting in my eyes but it still hurt so much. And it was not easy to get off! I always use waterproof mascara and eyeliner so I'm used to that but this was a whole other level of stubborn. And it took a while for the pain to fade completely and my eyes were red for the rest of the day. So yeah, never putting that stuff back on.

Looking at the other reviews, this doesn't seem to be a super common reaction but if you have sensitive skin or eyes, I would pass.

Don't waste your money on this one ladies. It is a old fashioned wig with lace attached in the front. There is NO HAIR LINE JUST TRACKS OF HAIR. This wig has no hairline for you to pluck or customize the hair🤨 With this being said there isnt anything that you can do to make this wig look realistic. I went ahead and spent $200 for a human hair wig and it was worth it! I finally found a blonde that matches my skin tone perfectly. Most were too light colored (Platinum Blonde). However, it is NOT the same blonde that is in the photo. It's mostly propylene glycol, which is a byproduct of processing oil. You know, the stuff we power our cars with. Does not belong in skin care. CERTAINLY not organic

I've had this stuff for a few days. It should be called Miracle in a Bottle. I'll be 53 this year. In just a few days of using twice, morning and evening, it's reduced the wrinkles under my eyes and the ones beginning to form along my chin area. Our hands always give away our age, no matter how well we take care of our faces. So I've been using it on my hands as well. It certainly turned back the clock!

I was given the chance to test this out in exchange for an honest and unbiased review, and I was so excited to receive it. It's a big, kind of bulky, five barrel hair crimper, and it's awesome.
My hair is pretty easy to curl, but it takes a while, and as a mom of two boys, I hardly have time to spend curling.
This thing saves me so much time if I want to add texture and body to my hair. I set it on a medium setting and held it in place for about 10-15 seconds. Once I released it I moved to the ends and did the same. It was quick, easy, and just works.
One thing I noticed, and this may just be with my hair because of how it is, but if I tried to re crimp a section that was already wavy, it would just get frizzy and wouldn't look as good as if I got it on the first try. Easy enough to work around, just worth mentioning.
Another note, not a problem enough to be worth removing a star, but definitely worth mentioning as well, the power indicator light doesn't go solid once it has reached the set temperature. It is like a strobe light show, but just flashes until you turn it off.
That made it kind of difficult to know when to start, but I just turned it on before I started my makeup and it's definitely ready by the time I go to use it. (About two minutes later)
The waves it gives look great, especially if you use product made for curls, and it adds SO MUCH body and makes it really easy for Bobby pins to stick.

After reading countless reviews on and off amazon on this product I was convinced to buy it.
My fiance and I both love exfoliating I have thin fair sensitive rash prone skin and he has tan thick eczema prone skin with kp and major ingrown hairs all over his body and 2 to 4 hairs per follicle shaft so he's always looking for things to improve his skins texture and help exfoliate the hair and sebum demons out.

We've bought countless products pumice stones scrubbing pads brushed towels etc.

It isn't as intense as some of these reviews will have you thinking. You can use it on your face and private parts just don't apply pressure in those areas.

I bought 2 because it was more cost effective and both were meant to be for my fiance but after hearing his glowing review of the towel and him telling me it wasn't as rowdy as many of the reviews lead on I asked to borrow it.

He knows how sensitive my thin China white German Irish skin is and how easily it tears and is irritated and he assured me as long as I paid attention to pressure and didn't give into the urge to scrub like hell (you will understand when you buy it) it's very thin quite long and the texture is firm and course and gives this irresistible scratching every inch and itch feel that could quickly lead to over exfoliation and abrasions.

But if you use it responsibly it is amazing and is the best I've ever encountered for scrubbing that stubborn back and really exfoliating the way you do the rest of your body.

After telling him how much I enjoyed it and accidentally taking a 2 hour shower 🚿 🙃 he told me to keep it since we both love it so much and he would use the spare.

It's amazing for getting hard to reach corners and middle of the back and scrubbing the tops of shoulders. I think it's about 3 feet long. I thought being 5'0" it would be too long and too much for me like some of the reviews suggested.
All my fiance and I can say to that is just ball or layer/wad it up for more precision and all over scrubbing and grab the ends and use the length to your advantage for your back shoulders back of the neck and so forth.

We will absolutely recommend these purchase more for gifting and repurchase a these wear down.

Great product for not just the price and multifunctional use but also theboverall efficiency and amazing full body clean smooth and soft feeling.

It has already after one use helped bring hundreds of his ingrown hairs all over his body to the surface as well as beneath the skin blemishes that otherwise may have taken weeks or longer to fully surface to be treated.

It also instantly improved his dry itchy skin.

I nay, We! Cannot praise this product high enough.

Honest Review:

First time purchasing from this buyer. I received my item on time. This unit is not 180% density, its more 130%-140%, I would have been shocked if it was 180% at this price point. I do not believe this unit is 100% human hair because it will not hold a curl...it has NOTHING to do with the hot temps the east coast is experiencing, because I curled the hair in my home at 400 degrees and it simply will not hold a freakin' curl.

It forms a curl; however, within minutes the curls were gone, I could not even get out the house before the darn curls were gone. I say it has some human hair because I can smell human hair while curling. I tried curling the hair closer to the root; however, it would not even bend let alone curl. The curls I was able to form were closer to the end, and those curls were GONE in no time. Two Stars because the hair is soft, arrived on time and 20" as stated.

I will not purchase again from this seller, because I am not confident I will receive what I paid for.

Top it off (gloss) is a big hit. It does a great job with sealing your gel manicure and lasting a long time. I appreciate that isn’t too thick and gloppy.

The matte top coat is an odd duck. It’s not suuuuper-matte, but it works really well for my purposes. I have a crazy nail (after a little accident) with a thin vertical strip that constantly splits. If you imagine that would be painful, you would be correct, so I cover that nail in clear gel polish. The matte-ness is pretty close to the sheen of a natural nail so it’s not immediately obvious unless you look super close (and even then). So I don’t have to wear nail polish if I don’t want to, but if I do, I can just paint regular polish over this. And if you use a non-acetone polish remover, you can even switch shades without this coming off.

The only reason I knock off a star is because the matte isn’t impervious, and it will pick up fabric dyes and other colorants fairly easily. Sometimes I’ll look down and notice that one nail is looking pretty grey (like the lenses on sunglasses), which is frustrating.

Take off is not too bad. Those crazy clips that hold cotton pads to your fingertips and some acetone will make short work of this in about 15 minutes with no scratching that damages your nail plate. People whine that gel is bad for your nails, but if I remove it properly, it doesn’t hurt them a bit, at least not in my experience. In fact, my nails grow pretty long and strong with this on.

I've recently started cutting my husband's hair, so I was on the hunt for a cape. This one is definitely going to make do, but I'm disappointed with how short it is on him. It wouldn't even come close to draping over he back of a chair to send the hair sliding to the floor instead of down the back. It's a decent material, and fit his neck (17"), which is nice. It also has a second Velcro area to make the neck much smaller for a child. It is longer in the front than it is in the back which just doesn't make sense to me because most hair that's cut is behind the shoulders. I will continue using this, but I wouldn't buy again.

It's already set up to use - all you have to do is attach the wheels!  It comes with two different foot massage pads which easily snap into  place at the bottom of the unit.  It's relatively heavy so it's nice that it does have wheels.  It stands at about 19" tall.  The water level is about 6" so you get a good amount of depth around your feet / ankles/ mid calf range.  This thing can also fit a wide variety of sized feet!  It feet my husbands size 13 very easily!  My six year old daughter loved this as well.  The panel is LED touch screen. If you need a lot of space for your make up brushes and a place to keep them tidy/organized, this bag is for you!! This bag is approximately 10.5" by 7" approximately. It's black in color and made from high quality non-woven fabrics. It has two zippers for easy closure. It has the name of the company on the outside of the bag on the corner in white - "Louise Maelys". Okay, so once you unzip it and open it - on the left, you have a mesh zipper pouch on the top half. That little pouch is is about 5.5" long and 3" tall. It's mesh so you can see through it. On the bottom half of that left hand side, there is 3 elastic pouches. These little pouches are 5" tall and about 2" wide. Elastic at the top of them so it can hold in your brushes/tools/whatever. In the middle of this organizer, is another zip up pouch which moves back and forth. It is also mesh, so it's see-through. It is 8" long and about 5.5" tall. It zips up. The cool thing about this pouch is that it snaps in to the middle of the entire organizer so if you want to remove it - you can! Just unsnap the two snaps and remove! Love that feature! On the right hand (or back side of the organizer), is a ton of little compartments for your brushes. On the top row, there is 9 little elastic pouches for your brushes. These are the smallest ones, about .5" wide so these would need to be for tiny and slender brushes. This row of little compartments goes down 6". Next row is just a pouch. About 6" long and 4.5" deep. No elastic or anything - just a pouch. Last row, on the bottom, is 5 elastic pouches. These are about 1" wide and just about 4" tall. These pouches can hold fatter, more wide, brushes. On the backside of the outside of the bag, there is another zip up compartment. There is also a nice handle on the top of the bag so you can carry it easily. So many lovely options to hold your brushes and make up supplies! LOVE it. I checked all the seams and stitching on this - everything is flawless. It does have a tiny bit of a "plastic" type odor to it, but I'm sure that will go away once it airs out more. Overall, this is a solid five star from me. It's a great affordable option for your make up brushes and tools. It was packaged nicely and arrived in plenty of time.

I bought this brush for my 3 year old daughter’s long and curly hair but she did not like it. I tried it with her detangling spray and it was pulling and tugging too much and she wouldn’t let me brush her hair with it. Then I tried it in the shower with conditioner which normally works great for detangling her hair but the handle and back of this brush are so slick that it kept slipping out of my hand. I really wanted to like this brush but it’s just not for us. I feel like may be if you have straight or wavy hair it may work better but definitely not for my tender-headed 3 year old. She likes the Wet brush with the boar bristles better but it does take longer to brush with it. I’m trying to return it but I have to pay for shipping now-I thought it was Prime when I ordered it. This was a mistake on my part. We may just be stuck with it because I don’t want to go through the trouble of shipping it back and just getting a fraction of my money back!

"You get what you pay for" applies here. Bought the hair for a wedding I was in so I wasn't exactly looking for the best of the best (quality/longevity wise). When it arrived, it felt great and looked great (even though it's not as wavy as the seller's pic) but had an unpleasant smell to it, telling me it was probably shipped overseas to the warehouse. The smell lingered but got less noticeable after two washes and a deep condition before installation. When I did the washing, I was disappointed to notice that it did not curl at all. No versatility meant I would have to keep straightening my hair to blend it (I usually wear my hair natural... Bye bye curl pattern!). I've never known Brazilian hair to have 0 curl to it. It straightens very well though!

Sooooo...I've had it in for a month and while it looks okay, it has been tangling and shedding like crazy, even after careful handling (brush 3x day, condition every week, wear scarf to bed). I also have to blow dry or flat iron it or it will look ratty. Still, this was an amazing deal and when I take my sweet time to condition, detangle, blow dry and flat iron my hair and the extensions, I look like a fat Pocahontas and I love it. I might take it out, boil or perm it curly and give it another try if it hasn't shed too much. The hair isn't terrible, but I would probably not recommend it to a friend. Maybe a coworker.

Also, I appreciated the free lashes!

I was really excited to receive my cream however..when I recieved it there were alot of chemicals on the ingredients list that weren't on Amazon and it doesnt have a good score on the EWG.I wonder why hmmmm Phenoxyethanol...I'm new to the organic..natural world but Ive done my research and the jury is still out on this one.Wow I contacted the seller and told them I was pregnant so I'm trying to stay away from chemicals and I would like to return the item they responsed and told me I would have to pay for shipping. I never return items but its not my fault all of the chemicals were conveniently left off of the ingredients list! I didn't think the unit was working, it has vague instructions, but just touch it to dry bare skin and you'll feel it. I did not come wit a AC plug, (minus one star for that), you'll have to use one from another gadget, I used my tablet one. When it is charged, press and hold the button in until it beeps and lights up. There are two levels of power, I think, press the button one more time, the indicator light on the power button is orange, press it one more time and you'll see red. It runs for 3 minutes and then shuts off. You can use it a total of 30 minutes in one day. Diagrams in the booklet show you which way to use it effectively. This is important- you need to use a hydro gel or a oil, like rose hip oil or such like I do or you will feel a slight electric shock against your skin.
Have I seen improvements? YES. I had a NUface facial and this gadget seems to being doing as well as the NUface mini. I use it every day and I notice tighter skin, less redness, and less wrinkles. I use it just 3 minutes every morning. For the price I think it is a nice portable massage. I use it also with my cellulite cream on my legs and without changing anything else, the cellulite is fading (been only a week).

I'm really not understanding the good reviews on this product, it just doesn't make sense to me. This thing has no power at all - it might be different if it was variable power and this was the "low" setting, but it just bogs down completely the minute it touches your nail or tough skin. The attachments really are lame too - they each are supposed to have a different purpose, but each one performs about the same. It is battery operated or AC plug in. The battery power you might as well forget, but the plug in (which I used) - again just not enough power. It does come with batteries. Switching out the attachment heads is very easy, they just push in and pull out. One drawback to the electrical plug in option is that the cord on the main unit is coiled and quite short. When I plugged it in to the extension cord next to my bed, I had to put the plug in part up on the bed to have enough leeway to use the unit. Very stiff coil.

It has a few attachments for acriylic nails - which I wouldn't use - anyway, not worth the money in any way.

I bought two of these from Amazon Pantry to use for detox baths. I am so surprised at how effective a treatment good ol' fashioned Epsom Salts can be! I find we are beginning to use this for everything! Sore backs, nausea, any kind of bodily pain, stress, metal detox.... you name it!
It seems the magnesium enters your body through the skin Immediately, and magnesium is an excellent rapid pain reliever. It REALLY. really helps! It also is very calming and it is one of those minerals your body sucks up endlessly when you are under any kind of physical or mental stress, so it needs to be replaced for us to remain peaceful.
It is also said by detoxers that the sodium binds to toxins in your body to pull them out. Of course I can't see that happening, but I do feel relief from pregnancy nausea, which is exacerbated by toxins like metals.
I can also report that when I soak in it I can scrape off a dark substance from my skin, which people report finding at the bottom of the tub after much more expensive and intensive detoxing. This happens even when I go in clean, so I think it is coming from contaminants being pulled out rather than from the outside. Who knows, but it feels good.
In the past I'd always thought of soaking in Epsom Salts as an old wives tale or something people used to do before they had real medical options. After using it for a month or so, I can't believe everyone doesn't use it! We've experiences marked relief from different types of pains and discomforts, and also think it speeds healing of open wounds by killing germs. It even leaves our skin soft and I could swear it is lightening liver spots on my hands.
This is now a go-to remedy in our home and I consider it a must-have staple.

I have a two year old and a very social husband so bathtime is pretty much my only alone time.  I love being warm and relaxed.  This bath pillow really adds to the experience.  I didn't realize I was missing out on anything.  When I saw this, I totally bought it on a whim.  I am anything but disappointed.  It's comfortable and warm immediately so I don't have to lean against cold porcelain.  I have back problems and this makes leaning against my back just a little easier.  I may just live out my dream of being a mermaid and never get out of the bath now.  🧜🛁

We are getting older. It's true. If we except that truth we can focus on making it much better. One of those things is truly finding great skincare that matches the healthy foods we feed our bodies. Insta Natural Youth Express Age Defying Moisturizer is one of those perfect skin matches. It helps balance redness, tighten and tones the skin, aids dryness, and improves those stubborn fine lines and wrinkles. I don't know about you but I like radiant, healthy, and glowing skin. Why not try a product that can help you achieve just that.

Insta Natural Youth Express Age Defying Moisturizer has Botanical Hyaluronic acid, Vitamin C, Vitamin B5, MSM, Cocoa Butter, Green Tea, Aloe Vera, Coconut oil, Jojoba oil, Sunflower oil, Rosehip oil, Flaxseed oil, Avocado oil, Lemongrass, Evening Primrose and more nutrients working together to give you the maximum benefits to your skin.
