I've been diffusing essential oils for almost 30 years, ever since I purchased my first diffuser from Whole Foods back in the 1980s. This diffuser is not representative of the latest generation of diffusers, but it fits nicely within the last generation. The latest generation of diffusers are not waterless, cordless (rechargeable) and portable. I have both types of diffusers in my home and much prefer the latest gen.

This is a nice diffuser but is slightly more expensive than it should be, even with the ceramic appointments. Like all water diffusers you put water in the chamber with a few drops of oil and let it go. The light is nice but doesn't serve much purpose other than to remind you that the unit is on when you cannot see the cold steam. I'm not a fan of the whole thing being lit because it does cause me to take a second look if my eyes slightly open while I'm sleeping. I prefer a thin band of light. Of course on this unit you can turn the light off.

It doesn't come with any oil which is actually good. I find that when an oil is included in with a diffuser it's often the cheapest brand around and smells awful. It might be enough to turn a newbie off of diffusing if they don't know that high quality oils exist. I recommend Plant Therapy.

I don't buy into the claim that this can be used as a humidifier because the output is just not strong enough. After shut-off there is always water still left in the chamber. This is not a good thing because if you want to change oils, you have to diffuse water with vinegar for a couple of run-throughs and then wipe down the inside. Of course there is nothing wrong with left over oil if you don't mind a blend, but sometimes I want one pure smell for a specific purpose.

I'd never used TRESemme before. I've been loyal to the Gold line of Patene products for many years, with sidetracks along the way for some specialty items like Miss Jessie.

My hair is very dry Caribbean hair with a 4C curl. To me basically all shampoos are relatively the same, with the exception of White Rain and Carol's Daughter that turned my hair into a solid block of concrete. I can't speak for the whole line of TRESemme, but this Botanique line is rather nice. I love the lather and it leaves my hair nice and soft.

The conditioner is really great if you prefer to cowash your hair, which I do frequently. I love that it has coconut oil because sometimes I give myself a pure coconut oil hair mask treatment and that is extremely messy.

There is nothing outstanding and backflip worthy about this shampoo and conditioner. It leaves my hair nice and clean, soft and tangle free (but I do use a wide-tooth comb as I condition). I would recommend it to a friend.

I'm a lash-addict! I have all the really nice mascaras (Chanel, Bobbi Brown, Dior) and for a year I got regular eye-lash extensions twice a month. I really wanted to like this but I can't. I put it on morning and night for five days straight, and I always woke up (and spent the day) with itchy eyes. I tried to convince myself that it was something in the air, but when I forgot to use it I was just fine. So I stopped using it and I was just fine.

However, I do believe in the concept. My family in Jamaica swear by putting coconut (or castor) oil on the lashes daily to keep them supple. When they're moisturized they don't fall off as fast, and putting on mascaras certainly aid in drying out the lashes. I try the oil-on-the-lashes thing but I've made the decision to stop using this product.

I haven't been using this item long enough to report on any discernible difference in my face but I can speak to a couple of other interesting tidbits.

I know that these have been in use for generations and they must work because people swear by them. If that weren't proof enough, I use my Clarisonic Uplift daily, and it comes with an attachment that does the exact same thing that this roller does, only with using technology. The instructions on this roller is to use it for 5-10 minutes a day, 2-3 times a day. That's a lot and I don't know of many people who care to carve out time to do this, but if you're sitting quietly watching TV or even reading, you can do it absentmindedly. With the Clarisonic, you're supposed to use it with a moisturizer or a serum but with this, you use it on a dry face. With or without a lotion, the massaging affect is exactly the same.

The jade roller feels cool across the skin (even if mine does squeak a little) and it feels wonderful. I'm not sure it does anything if you're rolling it on your chest, but it feels amazing if done with a bit of pressure. It comes in a nice little Asian-inspired embroidered bag, so it doesn't look bad if you want to leave it on your bedside for easy access. I'm going to continue to use the Uplift each night but this item doesn't require a battery and I can whip it out anytime.

For the price, I have to wonder why this item is not listed under Amazon's "luxury beauty" line. Like many reviewers, I was put off by the sheer amount of packaging that came along with this item. It wouldn't be so bad if they didn't tout how conscious they were of environmental issues, but I've purchased Chanel with less packing, come on!

All of the beauty and skin care products I consume are luxury, at the moment I've been using Dr. Gross's skin care line but until I could get back to Sephora, I've been using Purity cleanser. I was hoping this product would be a suitable replacement but I'm not convinced so let me tell you about the photos.

Each night I cleanse my face with Purity using Clarasonic's Uplift with the Revitalizing brush. I follow this with micellar water (by Borghese) and then a serum and moisturizer. The whole thing takes about 7 minutes (it's therapy, don't judge!).

Upon waking, I swabbed my face with the micellar water and then took a picture of the cotton ball along with an untouched cotton ball for comparison. And by the way for the uninitiated, micellar water is the best skincare product to come out since mascara was invented. I was sure that my $349 Clarasonic erased all traces of dirt no matter the soap, but the micellar water never lies.

On the second morning, first thing, I used the Clarasonic with the Radiance brush and three pumps of LaClaire Foaming Botanical Facial Cleanser. Two pumps did not create a bit of lather. Then using micellar water, I swabbed my face again and there you have the picture of both -- no cleanser and cleanser.

You can see that there is still a lot of dirt left behind after using this cleanser, certainly less than no cleanser at all but there is still some there. There is less dirt left after washing with Purity so I wouldn't call it a miracle cleanser, it's really just "okay."

My skin is ridiculously sensitive, so finding products that won't set off some kind of irritation, breakouts, etc., is nearly impossible. I hadn't used a cica cream before, but the reviews were positive enough that I wanted to give it a try.

The texture is interesting - it's less a cream and more like a gel that's almost runny. It absorbs fairly quickly into the skin and doesn't leave behind any kind of greasy residue. It does help with redness and dry patches, and at this point, it doesn't seem to cause breakouts.

I have to say, though, that I was hoping for longer-lasting, even cumulative results, because I apply this at night and right after I rinse my face off the next morning, it's almost like I never used the product at all. Maybe it's a matter of me having to use this twice a day (at least), but given the high price point for what is, in fact, a pretty small tube of product, I feel like I would go through the cream much too quickly that way.

Still, it does help a bit and doesn't seem to cause any issues, so this is one of the very few products that I can see myself continuing to use long-term.

I have heard so many good things about Real Techniques products, but I'd never had the chance to try any of them. When this product became available to me, I jumped at the opportunity to finally see what all the fuss was about. After using it and reading reviews, all I can say is thank goodness this sponge evidently isn't indicative of the line's overall quality, because I found it to be pretty terrible.

The packaging says it can be used wet or damp, and in all honesty, neither of those ways worked for me. I tried using the flat top and it basically didn't do anything. I then tried using some of the side facets, and those were a little better but not by much. When dry, it took a fair amount of time and effort just to get it to blend or even to just apply and spread products. When damp, it moved the product around somewhat, but what it primarily did was absorb foundation and concealer. As for using the tip around the eye area, it was almost totally ineffective for me when it was dry; when damp, it felt almost too flimsy and squishy to do anything. Ultimately on both occasions, I had to put the sponge aside and just use my fingers or a super cheap wedge sponge from the drugstore to finish blending everything - both methods worked exceedingly better than this sponge, by the way.

The one thing I appreciate about the sponge is that it's latex free, which is good for people like me who are allergic to seemingly everything. Other than that, this product - at least for me - was a fail (and a ridiculously overpriced one, at that). I'm still eager to try other Real Techniques products, but this is one for which I won't be reaching again.

I have previously purchased a different brand of printable temporary tattoo sheets that worked perfectly. These are not good. That or perhaps the package I was sent were old or not kept well. The instructions say to print the tattoos on the white paper on the glossy side (make sure to reverse your designs - which the packaging neglects to remind you) with an inkjet printer. That part seemed to work fine. Then you have to take the yellow sheets and peel the yellow part off and carefully (this part took 2 people) lay the very sticky adhesive sheet over the printed tattoos while carefully squeegeeing out the air bubbles or being careful not to create them. Even after burnishing down the clear adhesive sheet as much as possible, it did not seem to completely adhere to the ink sheet. After leaving it alone for a day it seemed better but when peeling the clear layer off (to apply the tattoo) it was taking the tattoo right off the backing (the part that is supposed to come off with water). In my experience with the other brand, I was able to use the tattoos as soon as they were assembled! I would really not recommend wasting your money because these do not work very well. And the learning curve for assembling the two sheets will probably cost you one sheet.

Here's the real-talk on this: the first ingredient is aloe, and rubbing it on my face doesn't seem to have much of a discernible effect that's anything other than what I feel like I'd get from rubbing aloe vera gel on my face. Aloe is great, so that's cool... I'm just not sure why you wouldn't just buy a nice organic aloe gel instead.

The moisturizing effect with this serum is very mild. It's not sticky or runny, but it's also not super moisturizing. I generally apply it, let it sink in, and then apply straight jojoba oil as my moisturizing. So, as far as effectiveness, I guess if you're super into hyaluronic acid and know it does something for your face, this stuff is probably great? For me, I saw no difference compared to straight aloe.

Ok, first: I LOVE THE PRODUCT DESCRIPTION FOR THIS LOTION! It's made from the slime of snails fed only oriental raisins"!?

I like the light fragrance, and loved the way it felt on my skin -- it gave my skin a great dewey quality that I really liked.

Unfortunately, after a few days of using it, I got an enormous deep pimple on my cheek... and I almost never break out! Bummer, because I really loved the feel and smell and idea, but the weird totally-out-of-skin-character zit that I got tels me that it's not for me.

I buy this from zo medical website so I know what it should smell like And look like
Not AUTHENTIC ! Had to return

I received NOTS brand 28 Day Remedy on June 12th as a promotional item from the company. This product is available with Amazon Prime Delivery so it came in about 3 days. This is nice because I don't like being without my skincare for more than a few days.

I have been using 28 Day Remedy twice a day for 10 days now. I have had serious acne problems in the past and usually I would have to use multiple acne care products to keep my skin clear. For me this serum by itself was enough to keep my acne problems away. I did however incorporate this into my normal skincare routine, meaning I used this after my normal toner and followed it with my normal moisturizer.

I really like this serum, it absorbs very well into the skin, which for me is the biggest factor. It does not leave a tacky or sticky film on the skin. Also, a little goes a long way. Before, I have used other Korean brand skincare and serums like Skin&Lab Dr. Color Effect Red Serum and also Zymogen Ferment Houttuniya Cordata Extract Serum. I would choose 28 Day Remedy above both Skin&Lab and Zymogen. 28 Day Remedy is more effective for my skin regeneration and healing than Red Serum without the stickiness. Also it absorbs better and quicker than Zymogen and is more effective against acne on its own.

This product did smooth my skin texture and any breakouts I had starting were gone by the next morning. Overall this is a very good product especially if you have had problems with acne in the past. I am giving it 4 out of 5 stars because the price point is a little high for most people. But this product does do what it promises on the packaging and is a quality product.

-Sonya H.

For those crafty and mechanically inclined this is great. I have been a salon frequenter for years. I now do my own powder dip (LIKE SNS, Red Carpet Color Dip, Kiara Sky) and use this to break the sealant before removal, to shape my nail and buff if after removing the powder acrylic, and to shape the powder dip after application. Use with caution, and START WITH LOW SPEED and move up. Not much instruction is included so I recommend reading more about how to use each drill bit/head

It gives a clean and refreshing scent both the shampoo and especially the conditioner.  The shampoo cleans very well while still managing to both rid the hair of oil and maintain its softness and the conditioner adds further softness and style-ability.  The products can never be "Guaranteed" because they are not from a professional store however it seems that it works well and I am glad to use this product.  I formerly used just P Mitchell Tea Tree Special shampoo & conditioner however I like this just slightly better.  Has less of a "medicine" scent and more a pleasant scent that sticks with your hair throughout the majority  of the day and just smells clean.  I can recommend this product, however it is still overpriced.  I have a friend who is a hair stylist and she can get them for a much discounted price as a licensed professional so I think the stores online that sell these can do a better job with pricing to be competitive because when I buy them through my friend with her discounts, the product is still sold in guaranteed form even though it is not a hair shop itself.  Come down on price and then you'll get more stars!!! :).

Pros: it came with everything pictured, a lash applicator, the tube of “eyeliner glue” and 5 pairs of lashes in varying thickness. The box itself was nicely packaged. For reference, I used the thinnest/most natural pair at the top for my review.

Cons: the tube of eyeliner was either sitting so long it completely dried up, or the glue caused the eyeliner to adhere to the inside of the tube, but it was almost impossible to get ANY of the liner on my lid.

When I finally got a line to go on, it was akin to what attempting to using a dried up Expo on whiteboard looks like- I had to scrub the pen on my eyelid in an attempt to lay down any product at all, resulting in a very pitiful looking eyeliner application.

I fixed the lashes to the appropriate area, and within 5 minutes they were coming off at the corners. I tried to remedy the overall result somewhat by adding my own liner, and that example is on the second photo, bottom right corner (photo with eyeshadow applied).

The lashes themselves were the quality you’d expect from a multi pack at this price. Some of the individual lashes had fallen out as I opened the package as well.

Final thoughts: just use eyelash glue and get quality lashes. It doesn’t take any more time to apply and at least you can apply eyeliner to suit your taste.
Overpriced! Don't buy! These masks look cheaply made!

I LOVE and use Evanhealy Rosehip Oil all the time, however the one I ordered from Amazon smelled bad and was an off color.
I am saying this having bought this same product about 7 other times either directly from the supplier, or at one of those fancy stores.
It is normal for each batch to be different. I have seen differences in color, and some small differences with smell, however this specific product was way off.
I would not buy again from Amazon, but from the supplier or stores.

This material seems quite waterproof without a shiny plastic coating on it, which results in a softer, quieter shower cap. So I'd say it's a really nice shower cap if it fits you as is!
However, for adjustability you can untie the bow to tighten it up if necessary, but you end up with a gaping crease behind the bow (and unless you're more talented than myself- a bow that doesn't stay aligned, and looks much worse than the one it came with). I tried to swing that gaping opening and bow to the back of the cap for a shower, but of course it still let water in underneath it.
If you anticipate having to tighten this as I did (skull diameter measuring at 22" around where the cap sits), I would look elsewhere.

First & foremost, this wig is not even secured on my head properly....whatsoever!! It could've slid off at any given moment, but thank God it didn't!!

I wore this wig on my birthday "11/06," but was supposed to had a 28 inch blonde wig installed for my b-day. I didn't have time make it to my hair appointment and threw this on my head at the last minute. I didn't bleach the knots, pluck it, or style it and it ended up working out. I cut the lace and put it on my head in less than 10 minutes...and was out the door !!! I'm upset that I didn't get to style it because it would have been so much better. The pics above are after wearing it for 2 days. I'm so in love with the ruby red color and the softness of the wig. I will definitely buy another one soon.

All in all it worked for me and my needs, and I have nothing negative to say.

This was a 24 inch 13×6 human hair lace wig. I didn't think I would like this wig because the curl pattern wasn't what I wanted. The wig actually grew on me, so I decided to keep it. I didn't think this curl pattern would look good on me, but I actually fell in love with it!! The wig was true to length, no tangling, no shedding "for me," and lasted for good month. I don't wear human hair wigs often, so I'm just describing my experience with this wig. So far, this was the best wig that I have purchased. I would definitely recommend this GEM and would absolutely purchase again.

I had previously ordered the silicone strap extenders to connect the elastics on my masks, but they weren't as great as I initially thought.
I don't have ears. I also don't have fingers. I lost them as a result of the injuries I sustained in a fire 16 years ago, which makes many things more of a challenge to me. And while many masks have very narrow elastic bands, that isn't always the case, and they must be pretty narrow to go into the notches on the extender.
If I could put the mask on at home, connect the elastics, and leave the mask on throughout my time away from home, that would be one thing. But it's not as easy and convenient as one might believe. If I put it on & simply take it down below my chin while en route to take a drink or something similar, the elastics go slack, & come off of either side of my mask. It's 100°F heat index right now, and leaving my mouth and nose covered the entire time is just not an option. When I'm in a store & having to constantly pull the mask back up to where it belongs (because it can't ride above my ears like most people) is a REAL pain when you have no fingers. You end up touching your face one way or another, & we all know that's a big "no-no"!
THESE HEADBANDS are the answer to my prayers! I can wait until I reach my destination to put my mask on - and take it off again once I'm in my vehicle with ease! I can even do it over and over if I plan to make multiple stops while I'm out & about! I haven't been THIS pleased with anything else throughout this whole pandemic!

This is my first time ordering dreadlocks extensions.  I had no idea what to expect.  They came without any instructions at all. So upon first look and feel, they are scratchy and wollish looking. However,  I read some of the other reviews and Dae that you are supposed to wash them first to soften them up. That would be GREAT information if there were any instructions included. I can see why this product is getting poor reviews, because people don't know how to soften them up. I don't know how to put these in. So, I suppose I will hunt down a YouTube video. I see the price has dropped 40% I think that better represent the quality for these dreadlocks extensions.
what a  POS... i might as well be shaving  with a  spoon...

66 Scrunchies for $7 is a great deal. The value for the quantity is there. I liked that this pack came with scrunchies made from different fabrics so I could try them and see what I liked. It has cotton, chiffon, velvet, and satin. I thought I would be more impressed with the satin and the chiffon, but they look/feel pretty cheap. I didn't expect to like the cotton ones, but those are actually my favorite and they look nicer and better in quality.

This comes was a good variety. Fabrics, colors, and designs. Some of the colors and patterns aren't very pretty, but some of them are great colors. The nice part about a package like this is choosing which ones you do like out of it. I passed the bag on to my sister so she could choose some she liked.

As for the functionality, I like scrunchies that wrap around my hair twice. These do, but it feels a little tight. I'm hoping that with time they will stretch more so my hair isnt quite as pulled. Maybe if they elastic was slightly bigger I would like these ones more.

Overall, still a good product. Still worth the value, but not my favorite Scrunchies.

First the good news...

This razor is much better than the reflex action. It is almost as good as a real blade but still not quite. I believe it may be the only head design that good on
the market which is why I rated it 5 stars.

Now the not so good news...

I bought it as a gold box special. If you pay full price you may need a second job
for the privilege of shaving! It feels mucho cheesey when compared with the older
razors. The design is attractive and flashy but it is over designed to the point
that it is actually less convenient to use. My example would be that you must open
each head individually to clean it and I wonder how many times this can be done before one of the heads breaks off.

My advice is to keep and eye out for a deal or wait until your old reliable shaver
fails and then bite the bullet. I am use to Norelco gouging me on the price of the
heads but now they are gouging on the price of the razor as well. When buying remember it is the type of head the razor uses that matters. The flashy crap just gives them an excuse to further increase their profit margin.

I wanted to try a synthetic fiber brush since it is impossible to dry your natural bristle brush sufficiently before packing it up on the day of travel. I was looking for a brush that I can use, shake out and pack within minutes. For use at home, I've had over the years a couple of natural badger brushes of varying quality, ranging from lower grade black only brushes to very fine silvertip. So, trust me, I know how they feel.
This brush is for me virtually unusable.
When i try to lather up, i spray water and soap all over the bathroom. Try as i may, i couldn't prevent the spray. When these synthetic bristles are deflected even only a little, they spring back with a snap. It appears that the spring back force increases linearly with the amount of deflection. And all the fibers move almost in unison.

This is very different in natural bristles where more force bends the hair further, but it isn't like a linear increase in force. During the lather, the bristles conform to your face and the circular action seems to gently bent the hairs in one or the other direction. The brush also spreads a bit, as fibers are pushed and bent a little. Once you lift the natural hair brush off your face, the bristles don't string back all at once. Some fibers may return to their approximate straight form, but the water and soap mixture will clump some of them together.

I want to be clear that I don’t object to a different brush feel. As long as it does the job of lathering up and isn’t so coarse to feel like sandpaper, I’m fine. This synthetic fiber, on the other hand, are best compared to very playable, soft steel springs. Even when I tried to lather up very slowly and gingerly, each fiber literally snapped back to its original position. When you lift the brush off your face, all the bristles are back in place as if you just upacked the brush.

In summary, this brush is far from coming close to the feel of badger bristles. I cant use it without spraying soap all over and I wish I could return it, but it appears I’m stuck with this thing.

When I first saw this product at a warehouse roadshow, I was sticker shocked! I thought to myself what kind of baloney are they trying to sell now??? The rep sampled the scrub and then this moisturizer on the back of my right hand. I compared my right hand from the left and my right hand was noticeably lighter in color with less lines AND baby's bottom smooth/soft. Amazing! If these products can do this on the first try, I can only imagine what it'll do to my face long term. I was sold on the product and purchased the large set. Also purchased the regular one for the body since my family has a history of eczema. I do have to say that the price is very high, but you do get a lot in the bundle. This company also has a money back guarantee. So there's nothing to lose trying it out to see if you benefit from it.
This would be nice to give to family as gifts...not the bundle but individual pieces per person. Use sparingly because a little goes a long way and you need to pat the cream on your face. I was spreading it onto my face until I read the directions on the paper it came with. Patting it on makes a difference. Hope you have as good results as I'm having. I've been using this moisturizer for two weeks. I've also used La Mer. I noticed results much faster with the Infinite Aloe Gold.

This is going to be a lifesaver for me. For 40 yrs I've struggled with chin and upper lip hair.  Back in the day it was way too expensive for a single mom to go to laser treatment which was the ONLY option.  I even had one girl call me out on my dark chin (I plucked but had the shadow by 5pm). Then, they came out with the at home devices but they were $359 on shopping channels and generated poor reviews. So, no luck there. By accident I ran across this having no clue they were now very affordable.  I couldn't believe it. Now, it's mine and after ONE treatment I already have a bald spot on my upper lip which makes no sense after my first try! THANK YOU for helping me regain some self-confidence. Plus, I NEVER leave reviews due to time constraints-but just had to come here and tell my struggle for so many years.

These are just "okay".  3 doesn't go along way and I can't get these to stay in my hair BUT to be fair...I do not have long locks.  I am chin length.  I would suggest ordering at least 2 packages of these.  They was soft but they don't seem to stay put.  I will continue to try to use these though.  Maybe I can find a product that will help these stay in.  I like how comfortable they feel on my head.  No pulling, no tangles, and not hard on my roots.

This is a wonderful bath brush.  Very durable, I've posted photos of exactly how "thick" this is compared to my last brush.  The bristles are soft yet durable, the handle is well made, THICK will last!  As you can see from my photos, my prior brush (6 months old) was really quite thin, ready to "crack at any moment".  The massage side is on a soft/sponge-y base so your massage is very comfortable and not overly course.  The wood is coated well so over time it will not cause splinters (ouch).  My husband is 6'4 and loves this.  The ONLY improvement and I do mean ONLY... the handle could be longer and curved.  This is why I didn't give this the full 5 stars making it perfect.  A curved handle along with a longer one, would make it easier to reach your back (especially for the arthritic).  Please note the last photo of my OLD brush cracked...this bath brush WILL NOT because it doesn't have that weird plastic base.  It is made of bamboo throughout, except for the nice cushy base on the massage side.  So, all in all, I would recommend this durable brush

This is just OKAY.  Seems like if you press too hard, it won't spin but you aren't supposed to press so who knows.  Great price and features so, I just don't know.  It works but you need to be on the side of caution or it won't spin.

This piece is a little longer but not too long. It's not too heavy and doesn't  even look like you have a hair piece. Very, very easy to use and blends in perfectly. There are several colors and lengths to choose from. I bought 2 in different lengths because I loved this so much.  I've gotten many compliments on my hair! Great product and covers my seriously thin hair on top of my head and crown area. THANK YOU!

Great topper! I had no idea I could cover my embarrassing thinness and was just browsing ideas. This human hair crown popped up and I thought I would give it a try since I have tried just about everything else. This crown is AMAZING! It fits great, looks wonderful and I feel terrific. For once I'm not ashamed to go out. I have hair. Thank you so very, very much.

Great suction and actually pulls out the blackheads. I initially bought one for my niece then she showed me her skin and raved about how great it worked to clear her forehead so I purchased one for myself. I like that you can adjust the suction power to your liking.  I recommend this product.

This definitely is not the Miracle Skin Transformer of the past and the ingredients are totally different.  More like a CC cream.  Somewhat sticky when  applied and doesn't have the velvety finish of the original. These people shouldn't be allowed to use the name of the formerly great product.
Works exactly as described.  No issues whatsoever.

I have a disability that makes it difficult to put on a regular mask with ear loops.  I hoped that this would make it easier.  The first 2 attempts the loop pulled off the mask before I even got it close enough to get it around one ear.  There was no information with the package, just the extenders in a plastic sleeve.
Too soft

Pumice stone (made in Korea)
It's a regular pumice stone; if you've seen one, you've seen them all. This one fits in the hand nicely and has a pleasant minty scent. I admit I've never found these very useful, and probably won't use it much because they're hard to clean. The one I received is smoother and a different shape from the one in the picture.

Wooden foot massager (made in China)
I used to have a similar one and lost it, so this was one of the reasons I bought the kit. I like this a lot because the ridges are not as deep/pointed as they are on some rollers. It's relaxing without being painful, and feels great on the sides of the feet too. I even like rolling it between my hands. My only complaint is that the wood is a tiny bit rough in places. Not anything I feel when using it, however.

Wooden foot brush (made in China)
I was disappointed in this brush because the one I received has flaws in the wood that make it look grimy. If I were buying this set in a shop, I would have looked through them all and picked one without a damaged brush. However, it's still functional and the bristles are a nice balance between stiff and soft. You can use it to clean your toenails or simply brush it on your feet to get the blood circulating.

Tea tree oil foot scrub (made in the USA)
This is really nice, it has a fine grit that works well without irritating. You get a full size tube and don't use a lot at a time, so this will last a while.

Tea tree oil foot balm (made in the USA)
This is the star of the show, it's heavenly. Smells refreshingly minty, makes your skin soft. Works on any dry skin, not just feet. I couldn't resist using a lot of this, so even though you get a lot, I have a feeling I'll be buying more fairly soon. I really notice the difference right away. I can easily see this becoming a must-have staple.

Bag
It comes in a plastic bag with a green cord drawstring. The plastic is thick enough to make it reusable, though the foot massager sticks out the top. It's nothing special, but sturdy enough to store the set.

Overall
All together, the kit is very relaxing to use after a stressful day. I'm definitely going to check out more of the Earth Therapeutics products that are made in the USA.

The balm and scrub are both vegan, however the brush has boar bristles, so this would NOT be a good gift for a vegan. However, it would be a great unisex gift for just about anyone else, especially people who are on their feet all day.

Not pleased with my purchase. Received as described. Sealed boxed product. Earths Daughter, wooden, padded brush set. Larger brush & small brush. OUCH! Really wanted to love this set. They are beautiful, however very painful. They literally rip the hair out of my scalp. I thought maybe it was due to my hair being a little damp, tried my other brush, no pain. Tried this set again & just not worth the tears. Appears to be the way the brush is made. When applying pressure the pad does not bend evenly causing a gap between the pad & bristle ends, here it grabs the hair, as you pull away it closes the gap with you hair in it & pulls it out by the root. The little brush is nowhere near as bad as the larger brush. Hopefully, maybe my Grand daughter can get some use out of it. Disappointed with my purchase, would not recommend. Can not comment on static & such. I received this product at a discount for my honest review. I did not receive monetary gain. My reviews are based on my personal opinion, quality & results after use.

I bought this as someone who had scalp issues all my life 🥵 i hoped this would help and provide relief to my dry scalp, but it isn’t doing it for me. I have been using it for a little over a month now. When i purchased it they only offered a two pack, and i see now they offer one bottle, so if you are set on buying this i would recommend buying just one first to see if it’s for you.

While i think it’s a cool product, it is heavily perfumed, which in my experience, for skin that is a lil sensitive is a really bad combo. I found that I would sometimes get irritation from the scent, which could be my fault as I bought the product knowing it was not un-scented. I am not a dermatologist or skin expert but i think a more gentle possibly drugstore moisturizer would be better for the skin, & also much more costly. I have not done research looking for dupes, so obviously my statement cannot be backed.

I think it’s a cool product in theory but the execution for me just wasn’t there. The perfume along with the price per ounce led me to my distaste for the product.

Overall I would not recommend the product, and i feel so awful leaving this review😢 Just do you our research, many people have loved this & i super duper wanted to it just didn’t work well for my body chemistry.

This is the best price for the desktop software and desktop payroll (for one year).  And, its great software once you get it working!  But after one year, you will get a message from QB telling you to pay four-hundred bucks for the next year's payroll, which is crazy.  SO I bought the next years bundle of desktop&payroll from Amzn for about half that cost.  The desktop upgrade from 2018 to 2019 went easy.  But the payroll upgrade that came with the bundle was a nightmare to get working, and still continues to be even after many calls to their tech support, which is next to impossible to find a phone number for them, even though they say you get a year of payroll support.  HA, try and use it... lots of people documenting how to deal with issues on the QB web sites, but when none of that works and you just need to talk with them, good luck.  I have an error message that specifically says, contact  their tech support to resolve it.  But no phone number of link to contact them.  So I googled the QB inuit tech support and found a phone number, which worked this time, but their message when they answer the call says the line will no longer work in the near future, and to use their online-chat session instead.  Too bad you can't find a nice link in their program for that chat tool.  I'm sure with more time on the phone and help from them that this will be fixed, and then life will be good for another 10-11 months, but I dread the upgrade process again next next.

This product basically asks you to take a three-day vacation from your normal skin-care routine and only use the contents of a total of nine pretty small (0.05 ounce each) foil packets. You follow the three step process each night for three nights then only use a wet cloth to "wash" your face in the morning.

Because this product makes great promises in a VERY short period of time, (and for $20 for a small amount of product, let's be honest!) and because I read reviews before I make purchases, and because I was able to purchase this product at a discount in exchange for evaluation and my HONEST review, I have swallowed my pride (uhm, ego??!!??) and am not only going to share the process for this product but also, several of my "naked face" photos - before, during and after. This way you, my fellow Amazon buyer, may not only read my opinion BUT also decide for yourself how much difference this product made in at least this instance for me.

BASICS- I am a woman, former Marine and (ugh!) a smoker. I will be turning 50 in June 2016 and although I have (so far) not found any actual wrinkles, other than a couple of minor horizontal lines on my forehead (thanks Dad & grandma for the genetics!), I DID have fairly prominent acne from about 13 until after 30 (& even a couple now!) leaving scars mostly on my cheeks and chin. I also was a serious sun worshipper, getting as brown as I possibly could, including tanning beds, outdoor activities, the Marine Corps and beach/pool lounging (anyone my age group remember baby oil and iodine? The worst thing you can do for your skin?? Yep! That was me!). It honestly is a miracle I don't look like a raisin. I do have discoloration & brown patches all over my face. I stopped actively tanning just after my 40th birthday and now always wear sunscreen at least in my facial moisturizer. I do have a pretty good routine now because I want to try to preserve what I have and fight Mother Nature and gravity as much as possible, but my face needs some work.
ALL PHOTOS WERE TAKEN AT APPROX THE SAME TIME, IN THE SAME PLACE WITH CAMERA AT APPROX THE SAME DISTANCE FROM MY FACE (too close!!) AND IN THE SAME LIGHTING. NO FILTERS OR PHOTOSHOP USED.
BEFORE PICTURE- The "before" photo,
(hopefully these will show up in the proper order but in it I am wearing a grey t-shirt with black "squares" and a pony tail) shows the brown spots, scarring and general lack of "glow". This was the night I began the process.

THE PROCESS- Three steps/Three days
STEP ONE "Gentle Prep Cleanser"- The cleanser is a pearly white color (see photograph) The directions say it removes makeup, but as you can tell from my "before" pic, I did remove my makeup with a makeup remover cloth. I did this for two reason: 1- Because I didn't trust that the small amount of cleanser would actually remove makeup and clean enough and 2- Because I wanted naked skin to evaluate the cleanser itself. I need not have worried. The cleanser cleans the skin and prepares it for the "peel" product at step two. The cleanser was very pleasant "clean" smelling and although it foamed very little (see photo of this step) it amazingly did a great job of further cleansing the skin and removing every trace of makeup (I know this because I used a white wash cloth to rinse my face - no I didn't photograph the dirty cloth!). My skin felt quite clean, but not "squeaky/stripped", which is good, IMO.
STEP TWO- "Non-Irritating Pro Peel". This is a clear gel (see pic) which had a slight astringent smell to it. This is applied to the now clean and towel dries skin using fingertips. The directions say to keep it on for 5 minutes, or 2-3 for sensitive skin rinse them pat dry. I felt no tingling or burning at all, just the alcohol smell which is no big deal. This product does not dry like a mask and it doesn't turn white like some chemical peels are supposed to do. In fact, on the second night, I got distracted and left this on for over 10 minutes and still had no discomfort at all. When rinsing, be careful to avoid the eyes. After this step, my skin did feel kind of tight but not in an uncomfortable way at all!
STEP THREE- "Radiance Renewing Deep Moisturizer"- OH MY GOODNESS!!! I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this moisturizer!!! I am going to try finding this alone for use as a night cream. As you can see from the photos of the "dots" of moisturizer on my face, there was not a lot of the cream in the packet & I thought it would not be enough (I ALWAYS treat my neck all around and my chest area with the same process as my face!) but - again - I was wrong to be worried. This moisturizer feels so very good! I honestly wanted to use it all over. When I find the moisturizer alone, I will edit this review and add the name of the product! This cream was the perfect way to end the process.

All three steps took less than 15 minutes per night.

The "after" photo was taken this morning because I wanted to allow the third night's process to fully work, so the lighting is a bit different. If anything, the daylight is harsher than the night photos and I took this picture even closer so I could really see.

RESULTS- It is usually difficult to be objective about your own appearance. At least it is for me. I look at this face each day and see all my faults. However, I honestly can say that I have noticed smaller pore appearance and brighter, smoother skin. Putting on my makeup this morning was so much easier and to my great surprise, the makeup actually lasted well the entire day without the blotchy, tired appearance I usually find by the end of the day (the photo of me with makeup shows that my hair has definitely fallen and my eyes look tired but the foundation held up pretty well!). I did do an informal survey of a few friends, texting only the before and after photos for their candid opinions. The feedback was quite good! I am an "average looking" woman, and this product did not make me suddenly a Cover Girl, but in my honest opinion, this product is a clear winner! At the $19.99 price point, I am definitely going to be repeating this "Three-Day Vacation" again... Perhaps up to four times a year!

I do enjoy testing products and sharing my experience, and hope the information I share helps other Amazon customers decide if a product is right for them, so if you find my review at all helpful (either good or bad for the product) please let me know by selecting "yes" in response to the question "was this review helpful?" At the bottom of this review. Also, please feel free to ask me any additional questions you may have. I am happy to help as much as I can!

The crochet hair is really nice when you take it out of the packaging and first do a style you want. It his very good with making different style using the hair as you can see in the picture I have posted I did a half crochet curly hairstyle with braids at the top using the crochet hair.

After just a week the crochet was really tangled especially in the back. It was great for the entire week and then that's when the hair starts to tangle. I even tried using certain products on it to help keep it from tangling more but before the end of the second week I had to take it out.

I wouldn't recommend this hair because it got too tangles quickly and only lasted em the week even after wearing a head scarf and bonnets to keep it form getting dried out and tangled.

This mask does not work like the ads show.! Very easy to apply and starts drying quick.
This is not for sensitive skin when in 2 minutes my left cheek started to burn so I washed it off with water and then with my face wash. I would not get, its not fast results like the ads say, its more like it will work over time.

Packaging is nice love how the bottles shows what color of the polish your picking.  Nice color glitter polish however they are not long lasting.  I did my nails in both matte and gloss look and within two days my nails with the gloss top coat peeled off.  My base and top coat bottles were relabeled so I don't know if that had something to do with it or not.  The nail polish is thick because the glitter so you will need to give it a good shake or tap it a bit in your palm.

This hair is very, VERY frizzy.  The frizz is so unattractive.  The twists kind of hide the extra hair when it’s all together but when  you go to run your fingers through the hair it is impossible to miss.  I do not recommend.

There are pros and cons to this hair.  This hair is very soft and very stretchy, so it can be pulled back out of your face. I love that this came with a crochet hook.  The T27 color is pretty BUT it is very frizzy, especially on the blonde ends.  It came straight out of the package frizzy, so I was very disappointed.  It looks like hair that has been in someone's hair for 2-3 weeks before I received it.  it's possible to make the 5 packs work, but I would've preferred to have 6 packs of hair included to make sure there weren't too many gaps without any colored hair, especially since my natural hair color is dark brown.  Overall the hair is just OK.  Next time I'll go for hair that is a better quality.

These nails were not good quality to me.  They didn't even last 3 hours, and I was really shocked.  The nails weren't sturdy and bent easily.  I went to an event, and they were popping off.  This is a no for me.

These were bar none, my favorite of any stick-on nails EVER.  #1, they have the peel-and-stick convenience I love.  This is the only brand I've found that has such an easy application, plus the glue is very evenly applied already.  The thickness of the glue really helps to fill in the gaps.  #2 they're SO flexible!  You truly get a better fit than with more rigid ones.  The flexibility, I think, also makes them stay longer because the slight "give" makes for a bit of a shock absorber.  I'm a full-time typist, and this set lasted me 3 weeks!  (ok a couple fell off the last week, and I had to get out some double stick tape to stretch it to the full 3 weeks)  #3  I LOVE the almond shape.  I trimmed off just the very tip to make a short coffin, which you just can't buy anywhere.  #4 the cuticle area is beautiful... fits flush and is rounded (no sharp ridge like a lot of them), and the cuticle area is VERY thin and flexible.  The one thing I didn't like... you can't really use the yellow unless your nails are very perfect and short underneath, because you can totally see thru those.  I just replaced them w the red and used an orange as accent.  I'd have preferred if they were all one color in this instance, because the yellow was so transparent.  I wish I'd bought more of these at the store, because I wouldn't pay this price for ANY nails, but these jellies are BOMB.

It comes in a nice looking metal can. It says it is a MEDIUM SHINE and a MEDIUM HOLD styling aid and my years of research trying endless styling aids to tame my 80s' bowl do genetics concurs 100%. Seriously though, my hair has like 5% body to it so I shifted to short/shorter hairstyles about 5 years ago which are easier to control. My hair is on the thicker side and very straight

It most definitely looks like a putty with a semi-firm smooth texture and a white color. The SNIFF does seem to have notes of black pepper and pipe tobacco but they are dulled way down likely to avoid being overbearing or offensive. The HOLD is flexible and can be molded/shaped. There is a slight oiliness or greasy "to the touch" feel but that is quite normal when you're talking about "medium" or "high" shine hair products.

I used it on my "mini mini faux hawk" and it allowed me to form it together on top and it held which not all medium/medium products accomplish. I emulsified it in my fingers and applied it to DRY hair. I am very happy with how it works for this style of cut. All in all, a nice product which works splendidly for my favorite style of cut.

My hair is super straight, fairly thick and has about 5% body to it. Without hair product it would form a "bowl do" in 2.2 seconds or less. My typical hair styles that I do myself since the pandemic are a Semper Fi look, a mini mini fauxhawk and a buzz cut since I work in the loss prevention/security field.

The REVIEW:

-- I didn't find it to be too greasy or oily to the touch. If you like the "wet look" there is going to need to be some oil or glycerin so I'm okay with a certain amount of oil or glycerin to get that medium to high shine I prefer.
-- You need to apply it to DRY hair. I emulsify it and apply it to my hair (I built it up in very small amounts to avoid overdoing it) and it covered my hair pretty well and adhered well which is always easier on dry hair. I did need to touch up some spots since I just gave myself a "mini mini fauhawk" and a couple areas were fighting back.
-- COLOR = pearl white and has an airy light look to it like it was aerated or a tiny bit of mousse was added (but it surely wasn't). That mousse look is gone once you dig into the top and begin working with it.
-- SNIFF = light pleasant fragrance but I can't place anything beyond that. Nothing offensive. I wish it had a citrus scent (i.e. grapefruit, orange or lemon) but this is fine.
-- CONTAINER = not cheap looking; nice printing and quality materials with clear directions and ingredient list
-- FIRM HOLD = firm hold but not extreme or super hold thus it allows some give or flexibility in the hair
-- SHINE is MEDIUM = this is true but it leans toward a high shine
-- TEXTURE = firm to the touch but has some flexibility so your hair isn't entirely locked into place; not crisp or crunchy but it is firm
-- For my "mini mini fauxhawk" hairstyle it works quite well and allows me to form my hair at the top and it holds in place. My favorite styling products had high shine and medium hold, but this product is making me re-think my preferences.

SUMMARY:

For my wants and needs it works really well on my preferred "mini mini fauxhawk" style. It really is what it says it is. This is a real gem of a styling aid.

The surface is sufficient in size for "man grooming" or barbershop activities.  There is a quality foam padding inside so you can stand upon it and groom without needing to schedule a chiropractic appointment.  I'm not a huge fan of the large slit on one side for inserting or removing the foam as I'm concerned miscellaneous hair may get trapped inside.  If strips of velcro were located in this slit it would be a better feature.  Also, while the material is pretty effective at sliding the hair off with a few firm shakes it is not a "perfect science" and some hair will surely remain.  This is especially true if you are are a fairly hairy beast with dark, coarse hair.  I hit that "hair shrapnel" with the hand vacuum.  All in all a good product if you haven't yet hit the wall with pain-in-the-ass (literally and figuratively) "male grooming" and gone the wet/dry shaver route to insure an easy clean-up.

I hate this eye mask so much and the super annoying constant emails from Dr. Jenna Zigler the creature of the product. The strap was so uncomfortable I cut it off! 20 seconds in the microwave would do NOTHING! I heat mine for 88 seconds and it still doesn’t stay hot for more than 2 minutes!! Mine has never burned. I don’t know what people are talking about. It’s too hot to put directly on my eyes but if I only microwave it for 20 seconds it’s useless. I put in the blue sack until it cools down then I can use it for about 2 minutes. 15-20 minutes yeah right!! Also the opposite side gets all fuzzy. Just look at my pictures. It is definitely NOT worth $18.00! You’d be better off boiling hot water and using a face towel to put over your eyes or using an activated, disposable hand warmer like Hot Hands that stays hot for 3 hours. Expensive and not reusable, but they work.

To start things off, I am not someone that is obsessed with makeup. You can normally find me out and about without a single trace of makeup on my face. I bought this product because I suffer from dry skin; specifically in the winter. This is an issue that also leads me to have rather dry lips. Though, kissing my boyfriend doesn’t really help with that issue either.

What I expected:
-A lipstick-like product that exfoliates.
-No real scent or flavor.

What I got:
-A very creamy exfoliating system that comes in lipstick form.
-A very pleasant mint scent/flavor.

This thing works! And it’s not at all harsh or rough while exfoliating. I just rub it in small circles along my lips to buff off the dead skin, and then use a wet washcloth to remove said skin and exfoliator. I have yet to buy the vitamin E stick, but I just use my favorite hydrating lip balm, or my jojoba oil that I use on my face to rehydrate my lips. I swear, this thing takes years off of your look.

If you’re someone like me that has dry skin, I highly recommend this product. If you’re someone who uses matte lipsticks, this thing will be your new best friend. Either way, you will not regret this purchase. If anything, you’ll wish they sold these in bulk!

Well I was excited and ordered the musk oil took 4 weeks to get here. Could not wait to open but guess what? Did not even smell. I was soo disappointed. Well I might try the cologne spray. Can anyone tell me which to buy that smells like it suppose to?
Crap... unless you like Kelly Clarkson chunky highlights.

My once beautiful long hair is finally growing back in from chemotherapy for breast cancer. I had had it bonded by my hair salon about 6 months ago with Cinderella bonds that shed like a cat almost immediately and had hair that was split and damaged before I ever even washed it.

I took a chance on ordering 2-18 inch packs of #613 and 2-16 inch packs of #613 of Sunny hair. The hair looked beautiful and was a perfect match for my own color, but there is no way of telling until it's been washed, conditioned and blown out over a few weeks to really know how it will hold up.

My stylist, who specializes in hot fusion bonds, put in 1 pack of the 18 inch Sunny hair (50 U tips) and one pack of Cinderella hair (25 U tips) 5 days ago. I have very fine hair and a tiny head, so more would not have been possible (this amount also equals a full head of hair for me). We are experimenting to see which hair holds up better.

After one wash, conditioning and blow dry yesterday, the high priced Cinderella hair was tangling in the middle, while the Sunny hair stayed tangle-fee, but did shed quite a bit. The Sunny hair has more weight to it than the much more expensive hair though and combed out better.

One star off for how huge the actual keratin U-tip are and the shedding. My stylist tried to cut some of the tip off with great difficulty. This is an FYI for those with fine hair or those who want to be able to pull it back without the bond showing (the more expensive type has much smaller Keratin u-tips).

I will update this review after 4 weeks in, but for now, I'd like to thank other reviewers for their input as it helped me choose Sunny hair. You were all correct in saying the hair is thicker than most online hair, even though each strand is a bit different in strand width, health and quality. As the industry is unregulated, it's hard to know what you're getting and with blonde hair, just how much processing went into coloring the hair (causing damage).

If my Sunny hair holds up well, my stylist, who does at least 10 hot fusion bondings per month on clients, will be ordering directly from Sunny hair instead of the company that charges $125-$150 per pack. We are both hoping this is the case.

I hope others will try this brand and leave reviews on their experiences. Also, if this is your first time with bonds, please remember on length that it's not going from the top of your head. The lower layers will fall much longer - I'm 5'7 with a long neck and the 18 inch lower tiers fall just a few inches above my waist.

UPDATE: please don't buy this hair if you value your natural hair.
It's impossible to remove the bonds without breaking your own hair.
It breaks, frizzes, knots up like crazy if in a warm climate.
I loved those first packs until summertime. Absolutely awful in heat and humidity. I couldn't get a brush through the hair. It would just snap off. The knots were horrific. I had my hairdresser try to remove and this is more like crazy glue on the bond than keratin.
These can barely grasp a hair. They’re really terrible. I do not recommend this item.

1790 Best Daily Natural Nourishing Botanical Shampoo - Moisturizing, Volumizing, Sulfate Free Shampoo For All Hair Types -Women, Men - Heal Dry, Damaged, Dandruff - Colored - Anti Aging Hair Care
from 1790 - I have very fine hair and the past few years it's gotten frizzy for some reason. It also tends to be dryer than it use to be. This shampoo lathers really well and tames the frizzies and leaves my hair soft and shiny. It's also not as dry as it had been prior to using. I can't tell you exactly what is smells like. I don't love it but it dosnt really bother me either and it dissipates after washing. You really only need a small amount to get a good lather going. Since it's a rather small, 8 ounce sized bottle I won't be sharing it with the family either. This one is just for me. I love a good shampoo and this fits in that catagory for me. It's all natural and made in the USA.

This shampoo is safe for all types of hair. It's recommended for hair loss or thinning hair It's recommended for preventing hair loss. It adds body, thickens and improves the scalp. I feel great after blow drying my hair. It hasn't looked this good in years! It's given me more confidence. I couldn't be happier. I've tried many Reskin products and I've yet to be disappointed. Skederm Ultimate Eye Cream ~ I don't know that I've ever even said this before but I noticed a difference the very first time I used this eye cream! The packaging is very pretty. It's a beautiful blue cannister with a great little airless pump  which dispenses the perfect amount. It's 0.5 ounces but using it only on the eye area should last quite some time.  You only need a very little amount of this cream. It has a very faint scent to it. It's so faint I can hardly smell it at all.  The cream goes on beautifully. I have lived in Florida most of my life  so unfortunately I'm starting to see signs of fine lines above my eyes which I can't believe and they just make me feel older! The first thing people notice are your eyes, right?  They looked terrible and I wanted to take care of this quickly, if possible.  So when I applied the cream,  they immediately faded. Of course I know they're not gone but they're not as noticeable. My eyes also get a little puffy underneath  but the cream  has helped out with that problem as well.  I do have to say that it didn't soak in to my skin as quickly as I had hoped for but after seeing the results I can deal with that. It's not sticky at all! I thought it was at first and realized it was from one one of my vitamin C serums. This morning I scared myself looking in the mirror! My eyes looked I had been rough! So puffy underneath! I did not believe anything would help this mess out. Honestly! I used the cream and once again my eyes bounced back to normal. I mean, they looked so bad I didn't want to leave the house. This is by far my Favorite eye cream ever! I just can't say enough about it!  I've been using it twice a day and will continue to use this to see if there are any  permanent  results. Because of the retinol (vitamin A) I have hopes that there will be!  I received this at a reduced cost for my  honest  and unbiassed review of this product. I really like it and will definitely purchase it  again once it's gone as long as I continue getting good results from it. I do hope my review has helped you in some way.

I will be the first to admit I hate taking baths; it bores me out of my skull. But because I have chronic pain, I've occasionally taken Epsom salt baths or bubble baths with a fantastic product called Muscle Soak. I found the salts were no longer really helping, so I thought I'd try these magnesium flakes. I take magnesium daily but a boost through the muscles that ache sounds great.

I was floored at how quickly and completely they dissolved. The tub wasn't done filling and they were fully absorbed into the water. With salts, I have to get in and stir repeatedly to get the crystals to dissolve, often in water that's hotter than comfortable. So that was promising.

I got in the tub and lay back, focused on the flower print on the wall....and was ready to get out in 15 minutes, but I wanted to give it the full 30. I wasn't magically relaxed or calmed by the bath as other reviewers are claiming. (You literally can't tell the flakes are there, as the water isn't salty like it is with Epsom salts.) I wasn't whisked away to a lush garden in my mind. I was just lying in a bathtub with pleasantly hot/warm water. While I was in the water and for up to an hour after I got out and showered, I felt a limited, temporary reduction in the tightness in my upper back. I put on a compression shirt to help things along but had 9/10 pain. When I can next score some Muscle Soak, I'll be going back to that. The bubbles are at least something to play with! And it is more effective on achy muscles.

This is not a magic cure for stress or pain. I'll use it to soak my feet when they ache, but don't expect miracles. If Epsom salts don't make a big difference, these flakes probably won't either.

I ordered a number of sample colognes from eBay recently after reading an article about the top rated colognes available on the market. This one was on this list and it is easy to see why. It's difficult to review colognes for obvious reasons, but I have a collection of about 10-15 fragrances and have sampled dozens of other ones, mostly referrals by Jeremy Fragrance on YouTube. So hopefully I can provide some valuable points of reference.

I have never smelled a scent that lit my eyes up like this one did when I first sprayed it. It's hard to describe it because I've never smelled anything like it, even with my experience wearing a number of different fragrances through the years. It is the perfect blend of sweetness and masculinity, with subtle notes you'll catch whiffs of throughout the day that you didn't notice before. This is the kind of fragrance that will turn heads and get you a lot of compliments.. For me, this cologne is a standard to measure others by. It's in my top 3 of all time along with Acqua Di Gio Profumo and Versace Pour Homme.

I think it is definitely a summer-only fragrance because of how colorful and bright it is. It has great staying power and a little goes a long way. Wear this on a first date and even if you're dull, you'll still probably get a second one because of this fragrance.

If you're on the fence, you can buy a small sample on eBay for like $8. I would be hard-pressed to find anyone who doesn't love this scent, especially at this very reasonable price.

I love bourbon. It's far and away my favorite type of liquor, but this soap really missed the mark for me. I know everyone's tastes and preferences are different, but I was expecting a rich bourbon smell and this soap just doesn't present that in my opinion. Initially when you dispense it, there's a strange plastic-y aroma. That's followed by what reminds me of a shot if you mixed NyQuil and bourbon together. It's extremely repugnant and left a lot to be desired. The Gambler body wash was the same experience. I personally wouldn't buy either again.

Or, for those who prefer to view all events in a positive light, someone should be promoted. I was fortunate enough - or so I thought - to receive the [[ASIN:B001A0GDQE Philips Norelco Arcitec 1090 Rechargeable Cordless Men's Shaving System]] last year and although it is not a comparison of equals, I now also have the Cool Skin 8040x. The 1090x is Philips/Norelco's flagship razor and this one is more of a middle of the road competitively priced product so any comparison is unfair...for the 1090x. For the last month, I've alternated between this razor and the 1090x, and my impression is without reservation, the 8040x delivers a superior cut. I've finally found a cordless that eliminates the need to keep some manual razors in reserve. Whomever led this product development team is making the top tier team look bad.

Notwithstanding bells and whistles, the primary function of any razor is to offer a smooth, comfortable shave and this rechargeable gets the job done with aplomb, with or without utilization of the moisturizing system, whether employed as a wet or dry shaver. I'm not a real big fan of products that obligate additional expenditures for consumables like the Nivea Conditioner but I realize it is a nice feature for those who may need the conditioner to avoid skin irritation. I would recommend Nivea and Norelco team up to produce a fragrance free version as this product does conflict with other scents the consumer might use. It is not my practice to use the conditioner every time I shave (every other day) but at my present rate, I would anticipate the initial conditioner supply will last at least six months.

Cleaning the shaver is a snap. Just turn it on and wash the heads under hot running water. I wish the upscale model cleaned as efficiently, but then, as I facetiously stated in another review my primary use for that pricey unit is as a display item now.

This razor's tracking system follows facial contours (head in my case) quite efficiently and does not require anywhere near as much pressure to achieve a close cut on stubble as has been my experience with the top of the line model. Additionally, the relatively compact size and shape is easier to manipulate. The 8040x also has a detachable trim head that can be used for close grooming and you can actually see what you're doing, another advantage over the premium model. Just pull off the tracker head and lightly press on the trimmer attachment.

Charge time for a full charge is about four hours for 40 minutes of shave time. There is a 9 minute quick charge capability that provides enough power for a three minute shave. The charging stand has a reasonably small footprint although for convenience and my take on durability, the charging cord has to be unplugged but remain attached to the base. The inexpensive plastic retainer does not look as though it would withstand multiple rotations. The travel locking feature is a nice touch but the travel case is a joke.

Yet, for nearly $150 less than the top of the line model and superior shaving capability, I'll figure out how to securely pack it.

Not sure what this formula is supposed to be. It goes on very sheer, has a light purple color, certainly NOT neon. It dries very quickly but is MATTE. The color in the bottle is accurate but only when you put on 5 coats and then use a topcoat to get a shine. You can see the difference in the sheen: one is without a topcoat (and is matte) the second pix is with the Sally Hansen Insta-Dri in 'Clearly Quick'.
This is horrible. Not the usual Sally Hansen quality at all. This was a loss.

My daughter's hair is poker straight, thick and will not hold a curl. Enter: The TIKTOK curling iron!
This was easy to use and gave her some fluffy waves that look amazing.
This takes a lot longer than a regular curling iron due to the fact that you can only do small pieces at a time. YOu have to move the iron down the length of hair after about holding it for 15 seconds (YMMV)
We use a hair protectant and some styling spray and her waves lasted about 8 hours. That's a win in my book.

Love this multi-head curling iron. My daughter's hair is very straight and she needed lots of curls to wear with her halo hairpiece. I curled both of them identically for a seamless look.
The curling iron heats up very quickly and you can read the temperature as it is rising. The barrels do not have clamps. You have to wrap the hair around the various barrels and hold it for a few seconds. There is a heat proof glove that makes this very easy so you don't worry about burning your hands.
I had to use some heat spray and hold on my daughter's hair and it did not stick to the barrels. I accidentally put it down next to a plastic bag. The bag melted on the barrel but was easily wiped off with a tissue. There is a straightening brush attachment that you can use as well.
The barrels are easy to fit into the handle: just line up the pins, push down and turn to lock them in place. Where you push them in does not get hot so you can change out your barrels while you're doing your styling.
The cord on this unit is 6' long.
Great value for multi use curling wands.

I don't often leave a one star review but here it is.
The wire that connects the jade pieces to the handle is exceptionally thin and brittle.
The large end jade had dislodged during shipping so I tried to put it back.
The second I tried to bend the prongs together to hold the jade in place, they both snapped at the base.
All in all: not good quality. It does come in a pretty box, so there's that.
I have since seen this same item on Ebay for a dollar. That's what it is worth IMO

Gorgeous lashes. The strip is a bit stiff but once you heat it with the hairdryer and get the bend the way you want it, it stays put.
There are a variety of styles but I like the more natural one the best.
If you use a quality lash glue (Kiss) then these will work great for you. Again: the only issue was that they band was a bit 'flat' straight out of the package. It was easily fixed.
I have been able to wear these many times with no lash fallout or damage.
I did need to trim about 25% off them, but they are still full and beautiful.

I have 2 standard poodles and their hair needs daily attention. As their hair texture is very tightly curled and soft, it tends to mat easily.
I love these brushes for raking their hair and then fluffing it up.
The comb has rotating pins so that it will glide through their tangles easily and not pull.
As anyone who has brushed a tangled cat or dog, you know that any discomfort that they feel will likely mean that you will get some teeth marks on your hand and the dreaded 'smile' with all their teeth showing.
This set comes in a pretty canvas drawstring bag and has solid bamboo handles. The grips on the handles have raised silicone pads to keep your hand from getting fatigued...and to prevent them from slipping when Pooch or Kitty decides to grab it and run off.
I'm happy with this set. You get all 3 grooming tools in the set: pin brush, fluff brush, pin comb.
Makes my dogs happy and keeps their hair looking awesome...till they roll on the grass :)
If this helped you, please click 'yes' below. Thanks

I love the cooling feeling from this thick gel. It has a unique push down applicator that you can simply swipe off the amount you dispense to put it on your forehead, under your chin, around your neck or around your eyes. As it dries and sinks into your skin, it makes it feel a bit tighter.
There is also a moisturizing feel to it as well. I realize that this sounds contradictory: moisturizing, plus tightening but it does work.
I find that the results last, for me, about 3-4 hours. This is not an issue, but I feel worth noting. This isn't an all day formula.
This formula has Hyaluronic Acid and vitamin E oil in it. Although the list of ingredients is lengthy, what I base my decision on is: does this work?
This does. The puffiness under my eyes, the crepe-y neck, the small lines on my forehead have all benefited from this gel.
A little does go a long way. This is also perfect to use as an overnight serum on your skin.
Very happy with this. Love the pump, love the product, love the results.

I am always sceptical when I see advertisements on TV for products that seem 'AMAAAAZZZZING! MUST BUY NOW!!'
I wasn't too sure what to expect with this. I thought it was gimmicky, but I am happy to be proven wrong.
This is so much easier to use than a flat iron.
I like that it has a digital LCD that shows you what temperature the brush is heating up to. It gives the heat range that your hair styling should be at depending on thickness, etc. I set mine to 230, the hottest setting and it worked great for my thick, curly hair.
It heats up very quickly and the hand grip is comfortable. The cord rotates from the end and the grip on the back of the wand feels nice in the hand.
The rubbery nubs on the ends of the bristles offer some flexibility, but they are not as flexible as your hairbrush. They are also shorter, too.
The way that you do this is to start with clean, well brushed hair. As the bristles are short, they will not detangle for you. Have your hair prepped and ready. If you use a smoothing serum, it would be perfect to add it before you start with this.
You simply brush it over your hair like you would a hairbrush. You can brush from underneath or on top to make sure that all the hair gets close to the heated plate of the brush.
You can spend more time on areas that you want straightened more but I found that my doing my hair in pieces (held up with an alligator clip) worked best for me.
In order to get to the roots at the scalp, it was very easy. The brush is easy to angle towards the scalp and it gets about 1/2" away from the scalp easily and starts straightening from there.
If you hair is damp, you will see some steam, but you'd expect that with a curling iron or flatiron, too.
This actually worked so well, my kids wanted to try it out and they loved it!
The only concern that I had was that if you hair is the type to come out when you brush it, it will come out when you use this, too. The issue was removing the hair from the straightener. It is HOT. I had to work quickly to sweep the excess hair from the brush to toss. I will keep a wide tooth comb by this the next time I use it so I can run it over the bristles and remove the hair.
All in all: I give this a strong thumbs up!
I can't speak about the others on the market, but this one really does what it says it will do. It is way better than a flat iron. It covers more ground and feels more comfortable in the hand. Its a natural movement to brush your hair and this is no different.
Excellent new beauty tool! Very happy that this does what it claims to do! Part of my daily hair regime now!
If you found this review helpful, please click the 'yes' button below.
I have personally used the product and tried my best to reflect my experience with the product so you can make a more informed purchasing decision. Hopefully my review includes the information you would want to know before ordering.

Still waiting for the results. I don't have terribly thick eyebrows so I wanted some of this to try out. I've been applying it at bedtime and before I put my makeup on. It is a nice light viscous oil that doesn't weigh down my brow hairs. Perhaps knowing that I've put something on my eyebrows makes me not fuss with them as much. Time will tell, but so far, I like it. I can use my Anastasia BH brow kit over this and it doesn't change the application at all (I dust a bit of setting powder on before)
I like it and will update if there is anything significant to tell!
