Very light feeling, clear serum that sinks into my skin with no stickiness at all. It doesn't feel 'tacky' on my skin, but I'm so dry that it just soaked it right up!
The glass dropper is long enough to reach the bottom of the glass jar. Looks and feels very 'vintage, like something off of an Apothecary's shelf. If you're not a fan of the dropper, you can just use the bottle top that it comes with.
I didn't notice any discernable scent to this. Not floral, not perfumey, just clean. As soon as I rubbed it in, there was NO smell left on my hands. It just disappeared. This is one for the beauty stand. Very good quality and I'm happy to have been able to test this at a reduced price from the company.

I was looking for a manicure device for natural nails. According to other reviewers, this doesn’t work well on acrylic or gel, which I’ve never used, so I thought I would give it a try on my natural nails. It was a good decision! It was also a good price, which was helpful since I have never used one and only heard of “nail drills” when I searched for emery boards. I couldn’t figure out who would want to drill their nails! It sounded like a torture device! It turned out to be easy and painless.

This is a great little manicure kit. I got it yesterday, charged it, and tried it today. It’s very easy to use. The instruction manual told me everything I needed to know to use it, including that it shuts off after two minutes, but you can simply turn it back on. For me, that’s not a problem. It is not faulty if it shuts off after two minutes. It’s supposed to do that. The device has two speeds, and it can reverse directions.

I was concerned about vibration, but this didn’t vibrate noticeably to me. I really dislike using an emery board or other manual file because it feels uncomfortable. Filing with this little machine was so much better. It even has a light that shines on the work area. I also used the fine sander to smooth my nails, and then polish them. It was very easy, and the shine is amazing.

It is rechargeable through USB. It comes with a cord that has a special end to plug into the manicure tool. The other end plugs into a USB wall charger which is not supplied. Again, for me that was not a problem as I have quite a few of those in the house.

The kit comes with 1 grinder to file nails, 2 coarse sandpaper disks, 2 fine nail file boards (look similar to sandpaper disks, but much finer), and 2 EVA polish rollers. It also has a small bag of 10 extra assorted sticker, of the types I just mentioned. I am not sure how long each one lasts or how to order more if I need them. I couldn’t find the information in the Amazon description or in the manual that came with the kit. I’ll keep looking.

I charged this in the bedroom overnight. When charging, the device has a light that flashes during charging, but stops flashing and remains on once charged. It’s pretty bright on a nightstand in a dark bedroom. I’ll probably charge it during the day! The first charge took about three hours.

I hope this continues working as well as it did on my first try. As of now, I highly recommend this MiroPure kit. If that changes for any reason, I will update this post.
Does not work

This product line was my FAV up until 10 minutes ago when I was applying it to my lips as I do nightly before bed time. Tonight there was an unpleasant taste and smell. When I turned on the light in my room to investigate what the hell happened to my lips I discovered BLACK MOLD had grown on the balm and it was now on my lips causing me to have a sneezing fit. Oh my GOSH! I looked it up on the internet to see that this is very common with this brand. Last week, I bought one for my very sickly grandmother because she always had commented on wanting to try it when she saw the commercials on tv. I feel bad having to take it back. I don't want her health to decline any more God forbid she gets a batch like mine.  I guess it's back to Burt's Bees for me.

[[VIDEOID:64f33f3faedf2b4f07d181b2c211a1e9]] So I just got this and may update later.
First off, seller tried to send first class (which is under a pound), this was marked 4 lbs. I’m glad the post office didn’t hold it or penalize Me at least.
First impression, love the heart. Very surprised that so much quality went into that and then the interior was just so cheap. Stacked nozzles that don’t stay together, a base that isn’t secure, and not a snug fit: one cat outburst and this things caput! Inside is a small container but it lasted a few hours more than I expected, although with the one hole, you can’t tell that you’re even diffusing anything unless you use a whole bottle of oil. It’s just too little being dispersed which is probably why it lasts longer. I like the concept, even my kids said it was cool, but def needs better construction to stabilize and make max use of the product.

Update- I took the extenders off and just use the base and it disperses the smell much better. It also lasted about twelve hours which was surprising for such a small vessel. I’m still taking off a Star bc of the cheap base. For the heart quality, there needs to be something not only more aesthetically pleasing but safer.

Update -3 weeks later and it no longer works. We aren’t sure if it’s the base or the cord. We tried everything in our end w sev outlets and USB boxes so we know it’s not ours. Asking company to send a new cord. I really don’t want to return it but I bought it for use, not decoration..
I emailed the seller and they had us ship back the base-they refunded postage and we had a new base in less than a week. Very pleased with the quick turn around and help I received.

We have a lot of dogs and they’re chihuahuas. They are known for having notoriously bad teeth as a breed even when you do everything right. Our littlest has been losing teeth left and right and is at the age where cleanings are too scary with her size. She would realistically need a cleaning much more often than yearly because the plaque builds up so fast.

I bought this as a shot in the dark, as we have burned hundreds on every product known to man. I mixed the product parts together in the large bottle and sprayed 4 of our dogs’ teeth as instructed. After a SINGLE application, our girl with the bad teeth had a 25% reduction in plaque. Our other three had a reduction of 40%, 60%, and 90%. I am not joking - this stuff has carbolic acid in it and it WORKS. The two components mixed causes some type of fizzy reaction and really works between the plaque and teeth/gums and between teeth. I tasted it first myself to be sure it wouldn’t be traumatizing to our pups and it tastes like flavorless alcohol free mouthwash.

Since, I continue to spray once or twice a day as I remember to and the plaque keeps disappearing. I did check with my dental tools to be sure it wasn’t just bleaching the plaque and it is not- it’s physically breaking off their teeth. I don’t know how we will get larger bottles of the stuff with the number of dogs we have but it’s true, it works. I paid my actual money and used it on my real dogs. This is not a paid or discounted review. Please give this a shot on your Littles!
All the same brushes

In the photo the color appears to be a dark russet. Actually it is more brown plum. I've been disappointed before with LeChat nail colors not photographing well so this will be my last one.

However the Seller got it to me very fast and I will order from them again.

I bought this giant pack after trying the 16oz tea tree oil cleansing conditioner and did some crazy calculation on the total/average cost of different ways of purchasing this really expensive hair cleansing product from multiple sources.

Obviously, you can tell I'm quite convinced by this product, or else I wouldn't invest so much work/resources into getting it. Because these things take a while to use, I will be updating my review as I finish each flavor included in this set. I will not be using the Sweet Almond Mint, which is too oily for me and I'm sure you can find plenty of review on other package sizes.

* Overall Impression *

1. Great reduction in hair loss
2. Great increase in manageability
3. Quite expensive for regular use

A lot of people say "this product changed my life!" I don't want to exaggerate my excitement. I think to be very fair this product made me discover something I never experienced with other commercial shampoos - "near zero hair loss after wash".

I was a heavy shedder and I was used to losing a lot of hair everyday. With this product, I hardly lose any piece of hair at all during the day, with everything else being the same as my old-shampoo days. I have to say I don't know how it will compare to shampoo during hair wash with an equal comparison (i.e. same washing technique). WEN requires you to comb your hair during washing, which causes hair to shed when I wash my hair. I did not comb my hair while I was using shampoos so I didn't know if combing in wash would be the same. All else being the same, I lose about the same amount of hair during washing using shampoo or WEN. The no hair loss during the day is amazing though. I might have been allergic to the commercial shampoos and never knew it. My hair now feels significantly thicker when putting into a pony tail.

Another great discovery is that WEN makes my hair very smooth, light but not necessarily shiny. It dries faster after wash. It also feels easier to manage - my hair now stays in the right shape - this is especially true after the 24 hours. My hair would have started to feel lumpy and oily if I had used shampoo, but WEN keeps my scalp evenly moist a little longer. With these two improvements, I no longer use styling products or a blow dryer.

* Impression on the Flavors I Have Tried *

Tea Tree 5 of 5
Fig 5 of 5
Cucumber Aloe 3 of 5

Very short, I would recommend people with oily/combination skin type stay away from the Cucumber Aloe. Somehow it feels more water-based I had to use more to wash each time. At the same time, even though I make sure to wash it off completely, my scalp/hair started to feel oily sooner than when I use tea tree and fig versions. Both Tea Tree and Fig are great for oily/combination type. They make my hair feel clean and refreshed. Fig makes my hair feels extra smooth and it is the richest/densest of the three.

* How Long Does a 32oz Bottle Last? *

When the WEN TV infomercial says the 12oz starter version is a "30-day" supply, you need to understand that it is for people with very short, thin, or little hair. For someone like me with long, very thick Asian hair going to mid back, the 16oz tea tree bottle survived barely one month with washing at least every other day.

Two other things to keep in mind:
The 32oz pump holds more than a 16oz pump, but less than twice the amount.
Each flavor varies in its moisture strength. As mentioned earlier, I had to use more Cucumber Aloe to achieve the same effect I can do with Tea Tree and Fig.

I made a chart documenting my process of finishing up the 32oz Cucumber Aloe bottle. In total there were about 250 pumps, which lasted me 50 days with 30 washes, average 8 pumps per wash.

* How Much Should You Use For Each Wash? *

I definitely recommend strictly following the WEN instructions when you begin. That is, use the large amount as instructed by WEN, follow the steps to rinse, massage, comb, leave in, rinse off. This will help you see how the proper use can really change your hair as they've claimed. However, this is an expensive product so we all want to use it efficiently. Once you have formed the proper washing habit, start reducing the pump number little by little until you find your optimal dose. I found my optimal to be about 1/2 of the recommended amount for my hair length. Given the amount of hair I have, I'm sure many people can save more once you've started using it.

On average I use:
Tea Tree 16oz - 15 pumps per wash (haven't started the 32oz bottle yet)
Cucumber Aloe 32oz - 8-9 pumps per wash
Fig 32oz - 7 pumps per wash

I gave this two stars because the water pick works fine, but I wanted this package for the electric toothbrush.  That part is just terrible.  It's hard to explain it, but it vibrates in such a way as to being causing me pain.  I can't finish the brushing because of the discomfort.  I feel it in my nerve endings.  I didn't know if it was just me so I asked my wife to try it and I didn't tell her my experience so as to not bias her.  She too found it uncomfortable although not to the extent I did.  I just have no use for this product.

This is my favorite scent that BBW ever made.  It is not a sickeningly sweet scent like a lot of the other BBW items that are supposed to smell like food.  The scent lasts all day as well.  I don't think it smells a whole lot like chocolate personally, it just smells good.  Also, after you have it on for a while it keeps smelling better and better.  Unfortunately BBW has discontinued this scent and replaced it with one that doesn't smell very good at all.

This is Very poorly made. The smaller roller wasn’t even connected to the tool when I opened the box. I managed to get it back on the wires but it keeps coming off. The worst thing about this tool is the grinding that is heard and felt as you attempt to roll it across your skin. Other brand of this tool I have looked at have a bar that goes all the way through a hole drilled through the stone roller. This one has small indentions drilled In Each end of the roller and two wires that clamp into the roller, settling into the indentions. When you try to roll it, the metal grinds into the stone and this makes for a very rough and unpleasant sounding massage. I thought the whole point to these type of tools it to pamper and relax the user, not make them feel like they are surrounded by chalkboards being assaulted by fingernails.

I took 2 stars off for frustration! It does not come with the plug, only the charging cord that is attached to the charging base. The other end is a USB, you need to either go downstairs to borrow your phone plug or buy one if you can just buy one?!? I was a little disappointed in myself for not realizing it’s not a Phillips SoniCare, it’s not a Phillips at all, it’s just SoniCool. But it does come in a very well made box, heavy duty, like Apple products type box. It also comes with a hard plastic storage/travel case. Seems very well made, although I doubt it’s made in the USA. You can tell by the instruction booklet. Not proper English, but easy to understand. The brush head can only go on one way. If you look at the attached photos there is a flat spot where the head attaches. Then if you look at the end of the brush you can see where that flat spot fits. It comes with 2 brush heads and 2 tongue brushes. I have not yet used it so I will have to edit my review. But it seems it will do what it’s supposed to do. I love the timer idea. Another thing to note, the instructions state Do not leave it on the charger! Only charge when needed. And charge for 15 hours upon opening and every time the battery is completely drained in order to have the best battery life.

[[VIDEOID:9d6b73448b9c4669051332c7b4e0f4e9]] I was actually shopping for another cream eyeshadow stick by Julep that I really liked and found these instead with a blender BRUSH instead of a foam pad. I loved the one I had of the other brand, but the sponge blender kind of burned when I used it. It was just too rough for the eye area (mine, anyway).

At first I thought this set was just one eyeshadow stick and I was trying to figure out how to choose which color or purple I wanted. Then I saw that it was SIX STICKS and each color had its own blender brush. OMG! This makes it an amazing deal! There's not a single shade of these that I won't wear and I usually wear about 3 colors from the set at once.

These colors are really pretty as well as very soft and flattering. I used the video to show the colors on my light skin since a lot of times I'm wondering how something will look on me. These are frosty shades of purple, meaning they are sparkly. A lot of them are kind of a brownish purple, which I was happy to see.

Each end has a cap. The brush end is where you twist to raise and lower the stick. The brush is very soft, like a regular makeup brush. You can put the cap from the colored end over the brush cap and it stays on. Totally handy!

I was wish each cap on the color end was the color of the eyeshadow, but then I realized the color is written on the side in the color of the shade. Now I can find the one I want much faster. The cream eyeshadow glides on wonderfully without dragging your eyelid. It blends easily and looks so nice. If you're looking for waterproof all-day color, this isn't it. Otherwise, this is a great set that you'll have so much fun with. I prefer cream makeup now that I"m older and these are probably the best eyeshadow sticks I've had.

The best things about these sticks (aside from the gorgeous purple colors)? That each stick has it's own blending brush. You don't have to worry about mixing colors on your brush or even using your own brushes. The brush on the end is what sold me and I'm just so thrilled they are as soft as they are. Couldn't be happier.

This is the best little set and I'll buy it again when I use it up. I'd love it if they came out with a burgundy set and I'd also buy a smoky set (hint, hint, hint). A smoky set would be wow. The only thing that would make these better is if they had their own little bag. I caught myself wishing for that the other day.

I specifically bought this brand because customer reviews said they didn't smell strongly. I have asthma and strong smells give me an asthma attack, but it's nice to have a smell-good in the shower. I've used bath bombs, but shower bombs had never occurred to me until I saw them on amazon. What a nice treat! They came nicely packed and none of the bombs were broken.

As soon as they came, I jumped in the shower to try one out. Let me just say that I take super looooong showers. Like until the hot water runs out lol. The bomb lasted my whole shower and didn't leave a trace when it was all gone. I couldn't even tell where it was, so it didn't mark or stain my shower at all.

Other reviewers complained about the scent being too weak, but I thought the strength of the scent was just right. If it were any stronger, I'd have had an asthma attack and that would've sucked. It was enough scent that I felt like I was treating myself, but not strong enough to bother my lungs. Even an hour later, I could still smell the scent of the shower bomb in the bathroom. Beats the heck out of the usual Hints de Kitty Litter lol

Anyway, I think these shower bombs are lovely and I have no problem recommending them to my friends. Even my asthmatic friends lol

It's me again. That Irish girl with the picky skin :)
This time we are trying Clia Natural Facial Moisturizer.
I like when a product has an easy to read ingredients panel, either on their product, or the accompanying box. If not, at least have on their product page a complete list of ingredients so I know what's in it, so I can make an informed decision if this is a product for me and my sensitive skin.
The box I received this product in was a simple, plain cardboard box.
The writing on the label is miniscule at best.
I blew up the attached images so I could read what it actually said. One of the first 5 ingredients is Palm Oil. I'm not a fan of Palm Oil for environmental reasons. The growth and harvest of palm oil is not kind to our planet. That's my personal feelings on the matter.

The cream itself is very rich and smooth without a chemical smell, more like your typical face cream.
I did the back of my hand test first to check for a reaction. There was none, so the next morning I applied the cream to one half of my face for the "face" test.
This cream is VERY rich. Just lightly tap your fingers on the open jar, and you'll get just the right amount. A little goes a long way.
I applied it to my forehead, cheek and neck. It absorbed fairly quickly with no greasy residue.
DId it pass the no breakout, no hives test? Yes it did, and my skin felt softer throughout the day without drying out or leaving any dry patches.
Overall, it's a good, luxurious feeling lotion, but with that Palm Oil in there, i'm not 100% on board, so, I'm really at 3.75 stars on this product
Disclosure: I received this product at a discount for my honest review.
I always buy this product. I get my hair professionally straightened at the salon. My treatment lasts about a year because I only use this product.
REALMENTE NO SE QUE HACE ESTE PRODUCTO, NI ES HIDRATANTE, NI CIERRA POROS, NI TIENE FRAGANCIA NINGUNA .. SIMPLEMENTE NO ME GUSTO , GASTE MI DINERO POR GUSTO...

I used once and tossed. It was awful. I had to wash with soap, then milk to remove the effect. It didn’t tingle, it didn’t plump...it burned. It took about 15 minutes to deactivate it. As it’s currently unavailable I don’t even know what the price is? I can’t recommend it as it was one of worse items I’ve reviewed in a decade of vine products. Terrible

3.5/5 Rating

I have sensitive, dry, acne prone skin with occasional bouts of plaque psoriasis. My main concerns/wants are products that are gentle, don't strip my skin and cleanse well.

This was my first foray into oil cleansing and the double cleanse method. I used [[ASIN:B004RRGXKI Neutrogena Fresh Foaming Cleanser, 4 Count]] in conjecture with this cleansing oil. This oil is a great, basic, no frills cleanser. I usually needed 2-3 pumps because my dry skin would soak up the oil and I needed extra to actually cleanse. It has a flora scent which while I didn't feel over powered by, I didn't love either. The oil does a great job taking off daily sunblock and makeup. I did not use it to take off eye makeup but micellar water instead because I found it did not take off mascara well at all.

I never broke out when using it and always felt clean after washing with it. It didn't strip my skin but it didn't appear to help it either. After finishing the bottle I eventually went to [[ASIN:B00EJ9RUKQ The Face Shop Rice Water Bright Cleansing Milk]] which serves my ultra dry skin better. I would recommend this to someone new to oil cleansing or someone wanting a good, basic oil.

Sadly, this polish remover doesn't work well.  It took 5 cotton balls full and quite a lot of effort to remove a set of fingernail and toenail polish.  This wasn't gel polish, just a standard, at-home mani/pedi.  I don't really understand why, as it says it is acetone polish.  It behaves more like a non-acetone polish in my experience.

I really want to like this product, because I like the company and it's mission and quality.  However, the fragrance of this product makes it impossible for me to want to use.  I've tried it about three times now, and it's very light and offers some nice texture.  But the fragrance is some sort of baby powder... now if you have not had children, this may be a pleasant smell for you, but for me, the association of this scent is that of diaper change/diaper pail.  I used it a few times to see if I would drop the association and it wouldn't bother me, but it didn't go away I am sorry to say.  Ironically, it is probably the natural sensibility of the ingredients that makes the association so strong.  If they were to make this product with another scent, I would definitely give it a try.

I have the razor where you have to unscrew and take apart to change the blades and it is very scary and have to use extreme caution when using that kind. This one is super simple and easy. Definitely recommend.

Oh no! I had such high expectations for this to help my daughter with her tangles. It is nothing more than a brush that waste batteries. It did nothing for frizz with the ionizer, it did nothing for the tangle with the vibration. There is a light on top of the brush and the sound of vibration but nothing really happens except noise. I guess you could say it did something if you took way too long to brush through a small section of hair. Which I think if you took extra time with a regular brush it would do the same thing. Going to return. Complete waste

Beurer Foot Bath Massager, Water Tempering, Relaxing Vibration Massage and Bubble Massage Functions for Tired Feet, Includes 3 Pedicure Attachments, FB21 by Beurer North America. Of course, our feet play an important role throughout our lives as they have to bear our full weight: and each foot has 26 bones, 22 joints and 107 ligaments that may all need care. Beurer North America says that this foot bath will be a simple and convenient solution for sore and tired feet. The bath has three setting functions (water heating, vibration and bubble massage), an integrated water heater. The infrared light points will support the soothing effect of the foot massage. The three exchangeable pedicure tip can deliver a cleansing foot care treatment. The massage-assisted foot bed, Beurer states, will stimulate the feet; the detachable roller attachments will give a soothing foot reflexology massage; the double-walled housing ensures better thermal insulation. It includes a removable splash protection guard, convenient draining outlet, infrared light points to support the soothing effect of the foot massage.

I expect Beurer North America is a branch of a German company, and I am as awed by German engineering and technology as anyone else. But Beurer’s claims that this device can deliver a professional quality luxury spa experience are, frankly, silly. The item is more of a novelty than anything else. To begin with, I know nothing about German bathrooms, but in this country, any electrical outlets in bathrooms seem inevitably to be near the sink. The cord provided is not long enough to allow the item’s use in the tub without an extension cord, which, considering the well-known risks of mixing electricity and water, adds an unnecessary element of risk. So you will probably end up sitting on the toilet seat, or may have to bring in a chair. And the gadget is messy; you’d better put it on a towel. That being said, it did make my feet feel marginally better after a long tough day. Will you find it useful? That depends on how much you’re willing to spend on it, and whether you have room for one more bathroom gadget of limited utility.
Cute set.

I've been using this type of product for hair removal for a number of years now (maybe 5?) so I have some experience with these kinds of devices. I long since stopped shaving my underarms because the stubble grows in faster than a man's 5 o'clock shadow and is painful and this kind of hair removal solves that problem. As far as pain goes it's not so much that I'm used to it as it is that hairs have different growth speeds and once you're on a roll using it regularly you don't have that many coming out at a time and it's less painful for that reason. I was excited to see this product come out because it had some great features others have not had before, such as a light to see hard to view areas better and a detachable brush for exfoliation, as well as features some others have but I have not had before like the ability to use it without the cord and the ability to use it wet.  I just cannot understand why it only comes in one speed when on. I found that it broke rather than removed hair at the fast speed, which can lead to some painful ingrown hairs. Slower speeds give a device time to actually get a good hold lower down on the hair and remove it. I think there is a perception that it's like ripping off a band-aid and that it should be done quickly to be less painful, but I find it less painful and more thorough with a slower speed. It's not a bad product; it's just not as good as it could be.

I got these for hand sanitizer or lotion. I've had several other small bottles, but of the more "traditional" design, which are wider all around which means that they take up more space in my purse. I liked that these were slimmer so I thought that it would free up some of the space in my purse and they did. I no longer have to fumble around trying to make it fit with my other items in my small pockets of my purse. Now I just simply slip it in.

I also like the little carabiner that it comes with because I can clip it on my purse, on my car keys or a lanyard or whatever and carry it alone if need be whereas you cannot do that with the more normal usual travel size containers.

The design and material feel of this bottle makes you feel like you might not be able to squeeze as much product out as you normally can with the other bottles, but I've had no issues so far. I haven't had it spill or anything like that. I really like them!

I've seen these type of curlers around for a while now and had been curious to try them out. However, upon opening them, I was disappointed by the size. If you have long hair and a lot of it, one pack will definitely not be enough, as is the case for me.
I was confused as to how to put them on. However, luckily for me, my sister knew how to do it since she had seen someone else try out this same style of curlers, but from another brand. Since she knew how to apply them, I told her to try them out for me and let me know, because I knew I'd end up frustrated.
Here's her take on them: They are tricky to apply at first and it takes a while to apply them, so make sure you have something else to keep you busy while you do this. However, once you know what you are doing, they're no longer tricky, but they are still time consuming. It takes time to section out the hair, put the curler in, roll it up, and repeat. Also, it is best if you do this at night if you are someone who has a sensitive head and is prone to headaches from wearing certain hairstyles. I put these on at around 3 p.m. and wore them for the rest of the day. After applying them, I was lounging around and watching a movie. Since I was laying down, I didn't notice any discomfort. However, once I was sitting up, it wasn't long before I felt a tension headache coming on. So, I would say that these are not good for someone who is sensitive to pressure from hairstyles. They don't look heavy, but there is a certain weight to having your hair "pulled" into the curler which can cause discomfort. I decided to sleep with them on, and was able to sleep just fine, since I didn't have any of the curlers directly on the back of my head. Upon taking them out, I had some nice curls, but I also had some wonky ones. I don't know the exact cause of that (rolled wrong, hair not pulled in correctly, moved during sleep, etc). However, I still liked the results and the curls held up for me, despite not having using any curling cream, gel, or anything.
All in all, they're a good product to try out and they allow you to get some curls without heat styling, but they can be tricky to use.

This headwrap is beautiful. I really like the pleated design, and it is nice and soft to the touch. Not soft like cotton, but almost like a satin. The length of this headwrap is very long, which means that it is very versatile and can allow for the use of different styles. I did not buy this to use as a turban in the normal sense, but rather as a head wrap/ scarf tie, which means that I could technically cut it in two or more pieces and sew it to use it. It could also be used as a scarf, thin shawl, or decorative cloth.
Overall, I really like it, however, I will say that it is somewhat sheer, which I was not expecting. I was expecting it to be a solid fabric without sheerness. So, take that into account when ordering it.
I for some reason expected this item to be 'only' beeswax. Nope, it's not. It's not even one of the top ingredients.

Takes practice, it keeps snapping shut while I'm rolling my hair, then you have to snap it shut in the correct direction because it only snap shuts one way, but once you've got it figured out it works great. I have thick long hair. I'm still practicing, though.

UPDATE: Both hair piece fell apart already. The clothe in the middle comes loose. At this point it's not worth the hassle anymore.

Hair dyes work as deposit on your natural hair so if your natural hair has been bleached prior to coloring then chances are your natural hair is also dry & damaged under the color dye. Salermo Color Reverse removed most of the demi-permanent color I've been using. It works pretty good for having no bleach or ammonia-(however it does have an ammonia smell, so expect that). I'd recommend not using it more than twice depending the condition of your hair. For my hair, I'm using it just twice. The 2nd time should remove all of the rest of demi color in my hair. I'm very satisfied with this product.

My intent is to do an overall color much lighter but I had to remove the hair dye in order for the next color to hold. I'm very satisfied with the amount of color it removed.

I got 5 days out of them, glued-on.  The thumb tips literally melted the second day and I had to cut them short. The nails faded and started cracking on day 3 and I could not wait to change them on day 5. I won’t buy this brand again.

I cannot get these things on my lashes.  I am a pro with glue-lashes.  I wear them every single day, and it takes me about a second to apply them.  I keep seeing these magnetic lashes, so I've tried a few of them.  The ones with the eyeliners don't stick to my lashes at all...ever.  So I thought maybe the kind that stick to each other would work.  This "applicator" might work for people with round eyes and long eye-lashes, but it's useless for my hooded almond eyes.  It pinches like crazy.  I can't get the magnets to stick no matter how I apply them.  They stick together when they're not on my eyes...they're hard to get apart.  But they just don't work on my eyes.  These lashes and the applicator are glaringly cheaply made.

This works exceptionally well for an aluminum-free alternative.  Most of the time, I will use Nivea antiperspirant once or twice a week, and supplement it with this deodorant. Antiperspirant seems to last through washes, so I don't need to apply it every day.  I don't have the kind of body that can go with using only deodorant, and often times even antiperspirant fails.  This Nivea deodorant really does work for getting rid of odor, and because it dried in the armpit, it seems to make a seal that stops sweat a bit.  One word of warning...this deodorant has a REALLY STRONG scent.  If you are bothered by fragrances, you may not like this at all.  It definitely clashes with perfume for a few hours of wear, and if applied at night, I found the fragrance to be annoying and it game me a headache. There are other aluminum-free Nivea formula with different fragrances that I'm going to try to see if their perfume is less pungent. Also - it smells like "deodorant" even though it's a fresh scent.  Anybody near to me could be thinking "Wow, she wears a lot of deodorant."

This is a fluffy, thick, buttery white cream in a plain white plastic jar. The bottom of the jar has an unfitting sticker that says Best Neck Firming Cream, 2 oz. With Hyaluronic Acid, Coenzyme (CoQ10), Licorice, Vitamin C, and other ingredients which appear to be scribbled out. The writing on the sides of the jars is ridiculously small and the words are blurred to the point where they are unreadable.I can read the directions (apply to face and neck) but I dislike being unable to read the ingredients and manufacturing information. As far as the product itself goes, this is a terrific basic tightening/softening cream. Its texture reminds me of Desitin Diaper Rash Ointment (and it smells a bit like Desitin), but it does get absorbed into skin.  The first time I applied this, I generously "coated" my neck, and once coated, this becomes a soft of collar of skin smoothers and plumpers. If you don't mind the packaging this is a good buy.
These are cute little highlighters but not worth $6! They are $1 on the ELF site. They are very natural looking on the skin.

I bought one of these from ulta in the color gold and it was awful, it truly wasn't worth a cent.  It was dry, brittle and painful to use.  It  breaks off when sharpened .  Im 45yrs and this is the worst eye pencil I've ever used.  There is no glide or creamy feeling at all. Just awful..

I bought this on sale and didn't have high hopes. The stencils don't have a lot of variety. They're basically the same size and style, just a different arch or thickness at the tail. If you have thin brows, you won't find one that fits. They're not super flimsy like I expected, but I have very hooded eyes and it's hard to keep the stencil in place without too much skin forcing the stencil open wider than it should be. The stamp dries quickly. One stamp and it's out. You have to shake it and let it settle a bit to get thr product to come through again. I use a brow brush and swipe it against the stamp. The product does last. Very waterproof and long lasting. If you mess up, it's hard to remove. I bought the light brown and it's a little dark. The brow pen is awful. It's a red shade. Very auburn and it's like using wet paint. I do use some of the stencils to make a Dotted outline of where I want my brow tails to end, but that's about it for me. Fuller brows might work better, as you can use the stencils to shape them. I don't think I would buy this again, but I would if there was a more taupe shade. Having this formula in a pomade type pot would be a good idea!

I received a complimentary bottle of this serum to review on my blog. I really love it. I had finished my old retinol serum, which I liked and was ready to purchase another bottle until I was asked to review this serum on my blog. I like that this product is light. It has the same lightness as OZ Natural's hyaluronic serum. A little goes a long way. Two pumps of the serum is the most you will need. The serum absorbs quickly into the skin. Allow a full minute to go by before you apply another product over it. That initial absorption you see is just ti drying faster on the top layer of skin. It takes about a minute for serums to absorb deeper into the skin. Allowing this time prevent the pilling when you a moisturizer too soon.

Give this product about four weeks to see any real results. Retinol products take months of use to see any impact on deeper issue like lines and wrinkles. Initially you will feel a surface difference where skin my feel smoother or even softer. A couple of weeks later you may see some lighter scars fading. If you are battle crow feet apply a little of this serum at the corners of your eyes (don't get the product in eyes though) before you apply your eye cream. The two working together will give you better results.
Ends thin..

This is a Korean face balm, that is supposed to sooth sensitive skin and cover up redness on the skin. The instructions and all the ads on Amazon are in Korean, and I HIGHLY recommend that the sellers switch this to include English instructions. I had to go to their website in order to find out the ingredients and what it was supposed to do for the skin, and most people aren't going to do that.
To continue, the balm contains 2 plant ingredientspine sprouts and centella asiatica roots. The cica pine water helps sooth and moisturize sensitive skin. The color in the balm comes from calamine powder, which helps cover red areas of the skin. It is a 100% vegan formula. The balm comes in a compact with a puff applicator. The puff is eco-friendly and anti-bacterial. This is meant to be applied as the last step during the skincare routine and before you apply your makeup.

Overall, I found this product easy to apply. You dip the poof into the cream balm, and then apply it to the skin. It has an almost creamy texture on the skin, and absorbs in quickly. It has a slight white cast when I used it but that went away as it absorbed in. I was hoping to use this as a color corrective on red areas on my skin before I applied concealer (I currently do not use foundation). Overall I think it is nice, but it really hasn't gotten rid of any redness on my skin. I do like the way it feels though and I think it helps my makeup go on smoother, so I plan to keep using it.

No, no, no, no, no... tear free?!?! So if you read the description above it says MULTIPLE times how “mild” and “gentle” this stuff is! And YES, they did indeed use the EXACT phrase “Tear Free”....BIG LIE!
My 1 year old daughter got literally just some SUDS in her eye (the shampoo that sometimes drips down the front of your forehead) not even full on shampoo, some suds, so watered down and she was SCREAMING!!! Her poor little eye was BRIGHT pink too when she finally stopped rubbing it and screaming!! Now... I usually use Johnson and Johnson and all sometimes the Honest Company... she NEVER EVER EVER EVER screamed this hard before when this has happened!! Johnson and Johnson she barely notices it! I rinse her eyes and pat it gently.. she is good. Honest Company eh, she’ll rub it for a bit but no crying or real pain, just irritation. But this stuff... oh no! My poor daughter!! I guess I’ll have to use it on myself because it’s EXPENSIVE for 8oz!! I wanted to try it because it being cruelty free and “more natural” products. No thanks!! I’ll go back to what I used to use! So sad... great idea... but whatever you put in there had my poor baby panicking! She was crying so hard and violently rubbing her little eye, ugh, broke my heart. Never. Again. Garbage product!! LITERALLY.
DMSO IS AN AGENT TO HELP TRANSFER  OTHER MEDICINE.  A sore or strained muscle for me needs a rub of 10% Menthol.  When applying that and then the DMSO over it, it works fast.

Ok so half way through 1 eyebrow I was trying to get the liquid out, giving it a good couple shakes, that didn't work so I gently pushed on the tip to get some flow, was able to finish my first brow, then nothing more would come out. A couple more shakes and the whole thing came apart. I'll give it this, though, tried washing the first brow off so I could match with my old pencil and it was pretty hard to get off so it's definitely smudge proof. Pity I have to go around with 2 different looking eyebrows today.

I'll be honest here, these are pretty standard tips and so there's really not much that could go into a detailed review. I'm using them under my current mani and built up with poly gel then did a gel marbled design. All that gel on top is making them nice and strong and the tips are holding up great. What I love though is that there's just so many for a good price. And since I'm obviously not going to use every size myself I have a couple friends with larger hand/nail sizes than me I can easily share the rest with them so I imagine this would be a great purchase for someone with their own mani business.
Arrived super fast!!!

Basically, I have to change the batteries every WEEK.  EEK!  No way!  I cannot afford this toothbrush--and since I stopped using it after third battery change, it may self-destruct-- just as they say.

Works wonders. My husband and I were trying to guess what it's made of. From smell we guess pantiene conditioner, elmers glue, and some sort of latex. Dries in a few minutes time and works like it should, peels right off. Smells great! And arrived quickly, two weeks.

...doesn't he? (How else does he maintain such an even, three-day growth for months at a time?)

I have the T770 model depicted above, so I've been a happy user for nearly two years. In his review, Reuben gives good tips on the use of this trimmer: take your time when you use it and clean it out after every use. The first results in even trimming; the second allows the vacuum to work best. Yes, a few hairs will show up in the sink, but with one swipe with a damp tissue they're gone. The adjustable comb trims beard, mustache, goatee, etc., to any length a user might want. In addition to the trimmer, the mustache and sideburn clipper gives a precise and neat edge; to use it, just remove the comb.

Taking the T770 apart to clean the blades is easy; getting it back together properly requires careful assembly in good lighting and some patience. I wish Norelco would simplify the re-assembly mechanisms and process. But even that, since I have now mastered it, does not truly lessen my liking of this product. Nor does its charging time; the T770 holds its charge for around two months (and I use the trimmer 2-3 times a week).

Should I drop and break this trimmer, as I did with a previously owned Remington, I will replace it with another Norelco. It's been great to have said good-bye to scissors.

Pretty sure this stuff is actual magic.

My foundation survived, without so much as a SMUDGE, in near 100 degree heat with crazy humidity, for over 12 hours for an outdoor wedding. I covered some pretty massive breakouts and redness around my nose and chin, and they were still nearly invisible by the end of the night. Even in perfect weather when I'm covering up blemishes it doesn't normally last until the end of the day.

My skin usually breaks out after a day of wearing heavy foundation. I've worn this under my makeup three times now, and haven't had a single issue with a breakout the next day. I'm not sure if it's acting as some kind of barrier for my skin, or it's simply a coincidence.

This stuff is pretty drying, so if you have normally dry skin I'd recommend massively moisturizing at least a half hour before using this. Apply with a cotton ball or cotton round, let it dry (your skin will tighten like you're using a face mask), and then apply your makeup as normal. I'd also recommend a setting spray afterward just for some extra protection.

Because it's so drying, it's not something I'd recommend for every day wear. But for special events or the occasional night out? Absolutely worth it.

The Listerine Pump is great for everyday Listerine users. Unfortunately they do not fit on generic or store brand bottles of Listerine or ACT. This problem can be solved by buying one bottle of Listerine and refilling with off-brand or sale priced products though. Simple solution. The pump is great for keeping the bathroom counter clean. Pouring Listerine everyday leads to little drips and drops here and there, which become sticky. The pump helps to minimize the mess. Overall, I recommend this product for anyone who is a daily Listerine user.

I recently received the Professional Hair Straightener Brush Best for Beauty 40W Digital Electric Straightening Comb by Magnifeko. I opened the box up, slide the brush out and plugged it in. It turns on by pressing and holding the power button. It automatically heats to 180 degrees Celsius. This can be controlled with the + and - buttons in increments of 5 degrees. On my first try I let it heat to the 180 degree mark. It blinks with its current temperature as it heats until it reaches temperature. I brushed out my hair to make sure it was free of knots (I have read other reviews where these types of straighteners do not work well in removing knots, they just get caught). I clipped up the top layer of my hair and began brushing. Within a pass or two through each section, my hair was straightened and the summertime frizz was removed. I repeated this process on the top layer. The entire process took less than 5 minutes. The low heat worked well and cooled quickly. I was able to clip my hair back to continue applying my makeup without developing a mark in my hair. It also did not leave my hair feeling dry or damaged like my flat iron typically does. It was such a pleasant change of pace to achieve the look I wanted without feeling like I did additional damage to my hair.

We have recently had 90 degree days with 80-100% humidity. The Professional Hair Straightener Brush Best for Beauty 40W Digital Electric Straightening Comb by Magnifeko cut right through the frizz that I had developed throughout the day and left me looking primped and ready for a dinner date with my husband in seconds. I have generally straight hair, but it tends to get frizzy and wavy especially in high humidity or after working out. The Professional Hair Straightener Brush Best for Beauty 40W Digital Electric Straightening Comb by Magnifeko will be a great tool to bring on my upcoming vacation to the Caribbean! This worked so well, I will definitely be buying this product as a gift for family and friends this Christmas.

I hope you found this review helpful. If so, I'd appreciate you clicking the "helpful" button!

These are the flexible, plastic, 3" roller picks. Not the ones Diane makes with a stiffer, metal shaft inside the plastic.
They fit into and secure the magnetic rollers Diane makes, as well as Velcro/brush rollers.

They are not white, despite the item description stating they are and despite the packaging marking them such. They are creamy yellow, very beige, off white, whatever. I'm not sure it matters very much, but if you have a white color scheme going on in the bathroom or on your bedroom vanity table, be aware these picks won't match with that.

Minus one star, because some (about 10%) of the picks are not polished, smooth or well-finished. Some have leftover, ragged plastic from the molding or manufacturing process still attached at the points/ends and along their length. This can make them a bit difficult to quickly insert into the rounded holes of some plastic rollers, and they may also snag your hair when removing them.

I can only use this product on just washed, very wet hair, otherwise it acts like glaze and seems to mat and mesh it together.

If used in my dry hair, it leaves a cast or coating that flakes off and makes it look dull and dry.

On wet or drenched hair it performs very well, distributing evenly and leaving a well defined curl pattern that lasts for a long time. When fully dry, hair is still very soft and touchable, holding its shape.

The smell, however, is a big fat negative for me, both wet and dry. It is VERY strong. If you sweat during exercise or get rained on, it comes back and can be overwhelming. If you do a lot of gardening, get ready to be buzzed by every flying insect known to man if you've just washed your hair.

It works. Used one way, it works really well for me. I just can't keep using it daily or as my go-to hair product.

I am a Caucasian of Italian descent, with very heavy and thick, spirally-kinky/curly hair, with very high volume and lots of frizz.
Love this!! Stunning!

I bought this brush for my bf as he's recently grown out a beard and doesn't like purchasing these sorts of grooming products for himself. I'd previously bought him another beard brush ([[ASIN:B01AYMHBLY this one]]), but it's larger than this one and doesn't have any sort of carrying case. He had to travel recently and went without that brush since he didn't want to crush it in his travel bag, so I wanted to get him something a little more portable. This item arrived in a box that would be nice for gifting, along with the metal tin for transport. The curved bristles are a nice touch that contours well to his face, and the bristles do a good job of straightening and conditioning his beard. The size is a little small for his hands, but given that it was purchased with the intent of bringing along for travel, he doesn't consider it an issue.

I was able to purchase this item at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. The reduced price has in no way affected my opinion of this product.

Well, I purchased these same lashes without the dandy little tool. I had such a bad experience, but I was determined to get those little ****s on my eyes. Well, the tool was of no help whatsoever. Those little lash pieces still fell and fluttered around. I could not even find one piece until I looked in the mirror and found it on my nose. I even watched YouTube to get tips. One model put hers on, claiming that it was easy after you get the hang of it... but even her lashes did not fit next to her eyelid. There was a space of about 1/16 of an inch. She said that they look really good "from a distance". Hey Hey Hey... from a distance??? You've got to be kidding. How many of us want to stay across the room to look good??

In addition, I really don't know whose eyes they are made for. These lashes do not follow the contour of anyone's eyes who I know. Who has straight eyelids??? These lashes look like wings on your eyes. They stick fly out at the edges and I could not find any way to get them to fit the lid, short of a lot of nail glue.... that sort of defeats the purpose of them.

Now I can look back at this experience and laugh. I'm quite certain that an observer would have found it to be hilarious to watch me. At the time, I saw no humor in it. This was funny enough to be on the "I love Lucy" show. I would have loved to see Lucy and Ethel trying these out.

The concept is great.... wow!! But, it makes me wonder if the developers did these to determine the lengths that we would go to for beauty.

In closing, I even tried to get ahold of the company.... and wouldn't you know, there was no contact number on their site. Amazon was gracious enough to receive them back from me. Thank goodness for Amazon's commitment to trying to ensure that we are satisfied.

Now do you see why I procrastinated in doing this review??? I have never submitted a review as negative as this. BTW, I finally admitted to some friends my experience with these.... and they confessed that they, too, returned their magnetic lashes.

I have very fine hair but a ton of it. Won't hold a curl, flyaways everywhere, zero volume, cowlicks and swirls galore, static nightmare in winter, a large scar running through the thinnest part of my hair, dry scalp in winter and oily in summer. Basically, the kitchen sink of hair misery. For these reasons, I wore a short pixie for many years but grew it out when the salons were closed in 2020. Now I have a bob and product has been such an expensive hot or miss learning curve I've thought about cutting it all off again. I tried Verb Ghost on a recommendation from a friend and can definitively say it's the reason I have kept my hair longer. The shampoo has a very rich lather that cleans thoroughly but doesn't over dry. The conditioner is buttery (like a light hair mask) and leaves my hair feeling moisturized but with no weight at all and no oily scalp. With both products, a little goes a long way. The scent is incredible and - this is critical - refreshingly light. Overwhelming scents have been a big problem for me with longer hair. I was so impressed with the shampoo and conditioner, I ordered several other products from the Ghost and Volume lines with equally impressive results. I'm a fan.

Of note, like some other reviewers, my order arrived with some shipping damage (shipped by Amazon, not Verb) but I called Amazon and they made it right immediately.
Waste of money!

There was a definite learning curve for this.  I’ve never owned either an electric toothbrush, or a water flosser.  First time out with the flosser, I got all wet.  I had to Google how to use one.  Apparently, it is a messy ordeal unless you’re very, very careful.  After the first couple of uses, I had the same issue referenced by other reviewers, that the water pressure would randomly be very low.  It seems the rubber seal that connects the tank to the inner workings of the machine does “grab” properly.  I’ve found that by taking the end of a standard toothbrush and gently pressing down on the seal before turning it on results in a machine that works normally every time.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE how water flossing, combined with the electric toothbrush leave my teeth!  The difference between this and just a standard toothbrush is palpable.  In fact, combined with the fact that I was 25 the first time I saw a dentist, I’m surprised I haven’t rotted my teeth out at this point.  It’s addictive how clean my teeth feel!  Oral hygiene has never been something I think about, it was just been something I had to do.  Now I actually look forward to it, just so I can run my tongue over my teeth to feel how clean they feel.

Love this stuff. I have a Luminess Air, and do not like their foundation - too expensive and they don't have the right color for me (all of them seem to be on the redder side). Aeroblend works great in my Luminess, the color is perfect, and it feels smooth - not cakey or moist (best word ever). It also applies much better than the Luminess foundation and lasts all day. You do have to shake that bottle pretty well to get all the pigment to mix. The color has just the right amount of blue in it so it counteracts the red tones in my face. It's also a lot less expensive for a larger bottle.

I bought this because of the positive reviews and it arrived quickly. (the product I usually get was out of stock) So I used this right away on myself and another nail tech tried it too, she loved it! After about a week we hadn't run into any lifting issues with the base coat and the top coat was still nice and shiny. So I started using it on some clients and it has worked really well! Now after using it for a good 6 months I would definitely recommend DND base and top coat for most clients.

I'm a licensed Instructor and nail tech, I've been doing nails for almost 20 years, I do gel polish by leaving the base coat on. (basically by doing a fill every 2 weeks, not a new set.) I only remove the gel polish color and prep the re-growth and apply base coat to the new growth. That said, the only issue Ive had on a couple clients is the base coat can get a little soft after several months if my client's hand are in water and/or chemicals a lot. So I need to remove the entire base coat and start all over every few months. This isn't the end of the world but to avoid having to do this, I use a different base coat on clients who are hairdressers or for those who have their hands in water a lot.
That is the base coat only and on just a few clients. I haven't had any issue like that with the top coat. I have since re-purchased this duo several times. I will continue to do so. :0)
This makes my makeup station feel very professional, and it look great! Love it!

Just receive the hair and running my fingers through it, it's tangled!! The ends are thin!!
Never again!!

I've worn these the last few nights and they're quiet comfortable.  I normally cannot stand anything on my feet when I sleep as they get hot and feel itchy.  Having dry and thick skinned heels must be a genetic thing as I've struggled with it my whole life.  Every morning after my shower I have to put some kind of moisturizing product on my feet.  I've tried everything from vitamin e, shea butter, and urea creams.  But I wanted to step it up a notch and put something on while I sleep so I bought these.  at $10 a pair they are quite the investment.  When they arrived they came with ZERO instructions.  Just a plastic bag.  I had no idea what to do with them.  I didn't even know what the ingredients were.  I had to come back to the listing to find out it had different oils infused in the gel pad.  Even then it suggested we soak and prune our own feet then apply a moisturizer .  So after my self done pedicure I put these on and slept comfortably.  The next day my feet did feel softer.  But I beg the question.... was it form these socks?  I have my doubts as I'm pretty sure it is because I scrapped all the dead skin off and put my own moisturizer on them.  Not impressed with these socks at all.

i LOVE this thing!  after six years of daily use, it is still going strong!  sometimes the bristles don't always hold short fine hair very well, but a very light spritz of hair spray before you start will take care of that problem.  one cool feature is the square slot in the blue "cool tip" end (you have to look for it cuz it blends in with the other curved indentations all around the edge) - if you turn the tip so that slot lines up with a row of bristles, you can slide the bristles out.  this makes it much easier to clean - and if you use any hair product, you know that's a big plus.  just be aware that the blue tip can get turned (especially if you hold it when curling your hair), so check it occasionally to make sure it's not lined up with a row of bristles; otherwise, they could slide out unexpectedly.  but i absolutely love mine!
Nice wig easy to maintain long braids  all or even a can be glued on or sewd on the wig is full of braids I'm happy with this product looks real

I'm really disappointed in these brushes. I use distress inks alot, I like to ink blend and I've been doing it for years. I thought these brushes would be good for that but they're not. And much too expensive! I get better results using my ink daubers, TH blending tool or a soft make-up brush. Save yourself some money - there's other brushes on the market that do better. I've tried all four sizes and one thing I noticed, these brushes leave a heavy "splotch" wherever you first meet paper. I've tried them on free-hand, stencils and taped images and I never get the effect I want. The bristles are just stiff enough that they leave too much ink at once, even when I start brushing on scrap paper off to the side then I spend too much time trying to blend. I thought these would be easier, not more work! I gave them 3 stars because they do fit my hand nicely. I like the way they feel, the wood handles! But I'm going back to my old methods, sometimes they work best.
An update: 2 months after receiving these brushes, the hairs started falling out of 3 brushes. They're useless now.

I got this product a few days ago and have been using it twice a day since receiving it. I got it as a rebate in exchange for leaving a review.  So to start off I'm going to say that it is very messy!!! I had to clean my sink after each use, not just rinse it down the drain but actually getting the all purpose spray out and wiping it out of my sink. This stuff gets everywhere! it got on my shirt while I was brushing and well that stain didn't come out. I won't blame the product because its probably this way with all charcoal powders and I could have been more careful. I was actually very delighted with the flavor! In my opinion it tastes really good! bonus points to them for that. As far as whitening goes....I'm not quite sure this is even whitening my teeth? I've taken before and after pictures and haven't seen a difference besides the fact that it really leaves my teeth smooth! I think this product is great for cleaning the teeth, As for whitening though id say I haven't seen a difference and I've been using twice a day for four days. I will continue to use this product for probably a month because I've seen some reviews saying results take a while. I will update with results

This so called gel polish is horrible. It has a bad odor, won't harden, and too thin. I don't know what this is but its certainly not gel polish. One thing for sure its not even nail polish. I didn't have to use nail polish remover to remove the polish after 5 minutes. It came off with with and/or a dry cotton ball. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME ORDERING THIS SO CALL GEL POLISH!

The set of soaps arrived in 2 days, a set of six soaps individually wrapped in the red box as shown in photo.  The box was in a cellophane bag, tied with ribbon and a label which included " mah johngg tile soaps designed by Barbara Metzer"  "made in China for Copa Judaica."  There is an ingredients label on the back:  sodium palmate, sodium palm kernelate, water, glycerin, titanium dioxide, sodium chloride, phenoxyethanol (antibacterial agent)  dexpanthenol  ( moisturizer), disodium EDTA.  The soaps were not the same tiles as shown in the picture, but that didn't bother me.  I got 2 winds, 5 Bam, Birdie Bam, 3 Dot and a Crack.  The white part of the soap looks like it was formed and then run through a stamping machine for various tiles and then filled with color.  The colors in my set are red, green and very very dark navy and the greens and red are darker than shown in picture.  The soaps have a green bottom.  I haven't used them yet as they are for a gift exchange.  I like them, they are a cute gift for a mah johngg player.  It's a niche specialty item so you will pay more - it's about $2.80 per soap tile.  They're fun, sure to delight and what I figure is I'm not going to be buying these but once or twice so the cost is OK.  I also like the other reviewers idea of putting one soap on her guests plate as a small gift....I may have to do that for an occasion, nice idea!

I have oily/combo skin and I am always on the hunt for some good powders. This powder is super finely milled, very soft, and great at setting my face makeup without making it more cakey. Bonus, there is no fragrance whatsoever (you would be surprised how many powders I have come across with a scent). However, this does not extend the longevity of my makeup wear. It did not hold back my oily complexion and it while it did make my skin look soft at the beginning of the day, by the end my skin looked a little more textured than it already does. So, I think for me, this powder is a no-go but someone else may have better luck with it.

I do not think I will continue to use this gadget. For one, like others have said, it is larger than it appears. It is kind of hard to get into my mouth and biting it is not really ergonomic. I followed the directions in the description and boiled it so that when I bit down, the clear bits became an impression of my teeth. However, I did not find that to be much help later on. I used this a couple of times and while I did find my jaw feeling sore afterwards, I do not feel comfortable using it for the long term. My jaw is not in good alignment (something I need surgery for but can't afford) so I got this with hopes that it could help support my jaw and keep it from getting worse. I also have a hard time with jaw discomfort from teeth grinding and my dentist said that exercises can help alleviate that issue. Due to the large size and ill-fit, I fear that it could do more damage to my jaw and bite than help. I think overall this is a lost cause for me but maybe someone else will have better luck.

I ordered this tape specifically to use with my wedding dress.  My dress had been too big, and after alteration the straps did not lay flat on my body.  Even using a lot of tape, it wasn't strong enough to hold down the fabric which was sheer with some beading.  I think this product would work well on regular clothes, but I wouldn't recommend it for a wedding dress.
I love the concept--but after having it and using it myself.  I realized I could have made one VERY easily at a fraction of the price

This is the biggest waste of money. It doesn't work at all! Mine came to me totally dry and empty. I filled it with my own nail polish remover and it leaked out when i tried using it. I tried using it with the tip pointed up, and that worked except for the fact that the tips get covered with the polish that I was trying to get off from around my manicure and lost the point shape very quickly. I'm really annoyed and disappointed by this product. Don't waste your time or money with this. You are much better off just buying an elf concealer brush for $1 and dipping it in nail polish remover. I would give this a score of negative three stars if it was an option, and I'm not a harsh critic by any means.

I am blown away by this shampoo. The bottle didn't look like much, but when I opened the lid to take a whiff, I totally fell in love! This is the best smelling shampoo that I've ever used! It is so luxurious and smells better than other all natural argan oil products. It even smells better than my salon high end shampoo. This shampoo left my hair feeling soft, looking shiny and healthy. This is the very best you'll get. I will literally never buy any other brand! I was given the honor of trying this product just for honest feedback. I could put something bad if I wanted...but there is not one bad thing to say! Buy this, it is AHHMAZING.

I like the product. I honestly think the packaging of this is one of my favorite. The silver top makes it seem really luxurious.
Aside from packaging, the coverage of this is really controllable but I'd say its about medium coverage. I have really really bad hyperpigmentation on both of my cheeks from cystic acne, but this did a decent job of lessening the pigmentation. However, you could still see a bit of my hyperpigmentation.
Consistency is the main reason that i gave this four stars. It's not extremely dewy especially compared to the typical korean bb cream. But it is a bit sticky on the skin, so I would recommend setting it with a powder. I have EXTREMELY oily skins, so I did need to reapply this throughout the day. But that didnt matter too much because this is really easy to carry around with me.
I've tried the missha magic cushion, ohui cover cushion, iope cover cushion and this one. I personally like this one the best.

This is horrible!!!! It’s like a glue that makes lipstick look like your trying to peel off a gel mask!!! What did Sally’s Beauty sell me!!!! I do not even believe one review on here or anywhere else that’s a positive!!!! Do not waste your money. I will sell you mine cheap I’d sell you mine if you love it!! It’s going straight to the trash can!!! I waited to late to try it to return it!!!

Its good, but not great!
So I got this Tuesday 2/2/16 and just got around to use it today. I am a 46 yr old Latina woman with very thick, processed hair. My hair is very dry and I am trying to use less damaging tools. My hair is dry in these picture too. I actually wear a bun everyday to work and I had washed my hair last night. So my hair is dried at this point. As you could tell from my before and after pictures its actually works ok. I am giving this product 3 stars cause it actually took 15 mins to get this look afterwards. It actually takes me that much time if I would of used the hair dryer and the hair dryer look is a lot smoother than this look.

The temperature actually gets up to 230c which is equivalent to 446f which really doesn't seem to be that hot. especially because I was holding the bristles with the palm of my other hand when I was brushing it through. (I don't suggest for anyone to do that ok?). And the on/off buttons are literally on the side where I actually have my thumb for more grip to it. Which I hope if this manufacture decides to remodel this, they should really think about moving it cause I kept press the "minus" button and the temperature would go down.

I am going to keep this cause I think my 11 year old would enjoy it more than I did especially because she always seems to be burning herself with my flattener and it just seems safe for her. She also has better hair. A bit wavy, but It actually would be better for her.

Good Luck to everyone and I hope my review was helpful. Cause lord knows there is many reviews here that are not to useful for me. :-)
Just Ok.

This is an outstanding foundation primer. It very much reminds me of a "smashing" other brand in the texture and application. This particular product is one that will last you a long time (meaning great value). One small pump, about the size of a pea will easily prime your entire face (and neck, if desired). It goes on smoothly, there is no dragging or pulling of the facial skin.

A primer allows you to use less foundation, think of it as priming the walls of your house before you paint. It goes over the imperfections, giving you a perfect area to work with.

I never skip the primer step, and it pays off in dividends. You will find that you look considerably younger. Perfection can be yours...

Friends and new friends, if this review has been helpful, please click YES. If I've left anything out, please feel free to ask questions. I rely on reviews, videos and, photos when making my decision to buy a product online, and I would like to know if my reviews HELPFUL to you…. I would also like to know if I need to add anything. I take pride in offering descriptive reviews and honest feedback.

ABOUT ME: I have been an Amazon Prime customer for quite a while and I really enjoy writing reviews – I love shopping actually, and love sharing my finds.
I received this product on a promotional discount from seller for exchange of my honest unbiased review. I am not associated with the seller in any way. I don’t receive any remuneration, nor am I required to give a good review. The discount I get does not influence my feedback or review.

My personal criteria for products:

• 1 star (I do not like this item or product). I feel it's a waste of money. Would never use it again. Would not recommend. Either throw away or return it.

• 2 star (Not a big fan): Would not purchase again nor share it with my friends, but may still have at least 1 positive thing about it.

• 3 star (It’s Fair): Product has both positives and negatives, and I may or may not continue using it. It might be a better item for another person. If I think of who may like it better I will likely write about who I think it would work for.

• 4 star (Pretty, pretty, pretty good – to quote Larry David): Item is accurately described. May have 1 or 2 things I might potentially change, but not a deal breaker. Would recommend it to friends and family.

• 5 star (It is perfect and I LOVE it!) Practically perfect. Amazing quality and a must have. It means I’m “Over the Moon” with it and would not only recommend, but would purchase for others and continue to purchase for myself.
good.

These all look the same when they’re listed, so I just went with this one as it was the cheapest. Bad move? Maybe. There were seams of jagged plastic that my hair got tangled in. The “hands” didn’t line up perfectly, so there were weird gaps in the holes where the air came out, which my hair got stuck in and ended up losing a few strands. I then got my nail file and used the coarse grit side that I never use on my nails to “sand down” the rough edges from the seam, and around the holes. I had to keep sanding because I’d test it, feel the area that snags, and then file again. By the time I finished, the whole thing was sanded down and looking awful. Can’t return it now! I used it once it wasn’t snagging all my hair and breaking it off, and it did work. Heat was coming out of the “tips of the fingers” and my roots were dried, and the rest of my hair could air dry in all its undisturbed curl pattern glory. But it was still kind of snaggy and I was just so over sanding this thing as it took way longer than it should have, which honestly, it should have not had to be done at all! If I had to do it all over again, it’d just buy the bright green name brand one that was double (maybe more?) the cost of this, and not waste time screwing around with sanding this thing.
Stopped working on first use

OK so I was somewhat sceptical of how well this product was going to work. I got home from work and opened it up. I took a before picture of my eye before cleaning and with my normal makeup. I then took a picture of my eyes with no makeup. The directions are super simple. and are listed in the box as well as on a paper provided. You can curl or brush your eyelashes as normal before applying. I try to brush them first to help separate the lashes and make for a more natural look. So, I took the first tube(aptly marked Step 1 and 3) and applied to my lashes. I then took the 2nd tube( also marked Step 2) and applied the dry fibers to my lashes. Then back to the 1st tube and apply again. Now according to the directions you can do this several times. I was so impressed after just one application I stopped. Seriously impressed! First, it doesn't LOOK fake. I hate clumped up lashes. Second, They feel weightless. I can't tell that I have mascara on.That in itself is amazing. It added length and color without making the lashes feel like I have anything on them at all. I asked my husband to see if he noticed and got a "Wow! That's impressive" so yeah, definitely 2 thumbs up here.
I would recommend these to anyone who likes to lengthen and darken their lashes. I have used a variety of mascara- from store brand to Sephora and Ulta. THIS is about to replace my Sephora mascara.
My pictures are listed in the following order: (1) Original Makeup (2) Cleaned eye (3) Step 1 (4) Step 2 (5) Finished Product 6-8 are how the product arrived. I Love the box that it came in. They fit in there perfectly and there's a little gray bag too!
I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review[[ASIN:B01FEO69PG NEW 3D Mascara Fiber Lashes (FREE Brush) - 100% Natural & Waterproof Gel, Lengthening & Voluminous Plus (USA Seller), Original Old Formula, Not Younique Moodstruck Moonstruck Black Prime 2 in 1 Set]]

This product leaves the skin soft enough and feels nice but my concern is more about ingredients. I like to see my skin care's first ingredients be more like the heavy hitters like glycolic or lactic or even natural like aloe so I was disappointed regarding this one's contents.  First is water and second is witch hazel. Which I likr, but three and four are glycerol stearate and peg-100 stearate. Peg 100 is a mixed bag of reviews and some even question the safety of it regarding get use in skin care.  It's disappointing because it leaves my skin feeling amazing but I do like more natural ingredients for the first couple ingredients than this product has.

Heating element did not work, nor did digital pad work properly. Very disappointed. Item was defective yet
I have to pay for return shipping. If it was a question of I had changed my mind I have no problem paying return
shipping, but this was defective. Know that if you purchase and return this seller does not pay return shipping
costs on defects.

This eye cream did not work for me at all. It has a very cooling feel when you apply it under your eyes, but it failed to
relieve any puffiness, or bags. I purchased it specifically for that reason. For 50+ skin, Im not a former sun bather, so I
have very good skin on my own, but the bags under the eyes have become more pronounced lately & looking for something
natural/organic to reduce or help alleviate the issue. This one did not do it. I applied AM & repeat PM for several days
without having unreal expectations. It just did nothing for me. But the company is very nice & has good customer service.

I just got this in a few days ago. It is very powerful for regenerating healthy glowing skin, zapping wrinkles, & hydrating
thirsty skin. I used it all over my face, neck areas and skin has a very velvety glow. My make up went on very smooth
& a lady I had lunch with said I looked like I was getting more rest. Apparently I looked tired. Unhealthy skin can make you
look exhausted. I've been reading a lot about Marine Collagen combined with Argireline , Hyluronic Acid, so I did not have to purchase
these 3 ingredients seperately, & this is high "medical grade" serum, not cosmetic grade, so you get a much more powerful hyrdration
into all layers of the skin. It leaves no residue. I wait at least 2 hrs before applying make up or pore perfectors/illuminators etc. to give
it proper time to feed your skin. This perhaps should be called Feed your skin because that is what it is doing. Good stuff. I have tried
so many products that have failed to deliver, so am glad I finally hit on this 5 star Silver Cream Serum Very good stuff. And this price
is much more reasonable than the others that did not work. This one contains the most Argireline/Collagen I could find in a blend.

I know it says "Men's" on there, but I am a woman, and I use this razor. I just happen to have very coarse hair on my legs. Lady shavers don't do it for me.
