In fact, I've always had to use 2 razors, a men's for the legs and a women's for the underarms. I know, more information than you wanted, but it's relevant.

This razor is the only one I have ever had that works for everything. Oh, I had some really nasty razor burn before I got the hang of it, but since then, it's been great! No cleaning and maintaining 2 razors any more.

I have found with this razor, that putting pressure on it is a big no-no. If I do that, it will tear up my skin big time. I have to just sort of guide/glide it over the area, no pressure on it, and it does a beautiful job without the razor burn. Now, I honestly don't know how that would go for a guy and his face, but that's how it works for me on ALL parts I shave.

This razor only needs charged about every two to three weeks. There is no indicator system on this razor, and when it needs charged, it just quits. If you keep playing with the on/off button, it will run for 2 or 3 more minutes, but that's it. It takes one hour (about) to recharge, much better than any razor I ever had before.

This razor is easy to clean, just run the head under the sink, shake the water off, and let it dry out. I do that once a week. Easy peasy.

Like I said, I've no idea how my experience might translate for a guy. I gave it 4 stars because of the lack of a recharge indicator. Other that, it is wonderful for me.

Purchased less than four months ago and already it has fallen apart (see photo). So why am I buying another one? Well, my wife likes the way it works, the way it travels and the fact that it fits her hair drier perfectly. And you know the old saying, "Happy wife, happy life." And it does make her hair look terrific. This time she'll be more careful when removing it and try not to remove it when it's hot. She will also pull it off by the sleeve and not the diffuser itself. I'll let you know if that helps. But honestly, Curly Company, it really shouldn't fall apart after only a few months use, should it?

I've it about a month now, it is easy to comb with my short hair, but it really looks like a plastic one to me. I hope I'm wrong, or it's too pricey to have a plastic one that it's not my intention to purchase it at the first place.

*****EDIT*****
After found out the comb is made of real wood, it's worth of 4 stars instead of two. The reason is's not 5 b/c the wood mark in the surface is man-made. In my opinion, it's look so unauthentic, that's why I've doubt at the first place.
It's a great comb for daily uses.

All of the colors look amazing! I tested a few of them on a piece of white cardboard and can't wait to try them all! Unlike other gel polish brands this one gives you two ways of easily identifying the colors. Each bottle has a clear opening in the front of the bottle as well as a color sticker on top. Those are very useful but some colors are still hard to make out so I had to open them to get a better look.
I applied the base coat and found that it was a bit thicker than expected. I have used some other brands of gel base coats and the consistency is generally thinner. Most of the polishes are light but not to the point of being watery. It's the same consistency as non gel polishes which I prefer. However, some of the glittered polishes that have confetti included are pretty thick and almost chunky. I'm not sure that it will last long based off the consistency at first use. I hope they do last because those are some of the prettiest colors. I love that unlike other brands of gel polishes that I've used, this brand's glitter polishes are not opaque. It's both shiny and the color is dense. I put on the color A708 first cured it then topped it with A707 while leaving some of the color A708 visible. I then layered it with the color A712 on a diagonal so that some of the color A708 would still be visible. I know the colors are hard to make out from the photo. I realized after the fact that I probably should've started with the color A707 or A712 first. I used number A707 and A708 alternating on the remaining toes. I finished it by putting a gloss top coat and cured it with the UV light. I set it to 60 seconds for three rounds just to make sure the polish dried fully. It has been two days and so far so good. The photo of my toenails were taken on day two.
Overall, I love the color selections. They're very pretty hence why I chose to use 3 colors at once. I can't wait to use the rest of the colors. I really love this set. I like to paint my toes colors that are compatible with the current season so these color selections are perfect for my seasonal needs. I wish the bottle sizes were a bit larger but I guess they make up for that by offering a lot of color selections. Also, you don't need to cake on the polish. A little goes a long way. The only drawback is that the base coat seemed a bit too thick so it may not last, but it could be an isolated case with this set. It's not a deal breaker though, which is why I'm still giving it 5 stars. Plus you can always buy another base coat.

These faux locs are nice. The hair is soft but it does frizz easily. I found it challenging to install the single faux locs. I found that some strands were not easy to thread through. They are light but when you have several they do have some weight to them. You receive 5 packs with 15 strands per pack. You also receive two jewel packs and the crochet needle. The back and sides of my head are shaved so I only needed about 2 packs, but not the full 2 packs. I only needed the 2 full packs because I had to redo a couple because the hair either got too frizzy or it wasn't wide enough to thread and hold the hair through. The hair is okay but I'm not sure if I'd use it again. It'd be more likely to do so if the hair was made more hollow in the center to make it easier to thread my hair through. Also, I noticed in dim lighting that the base of the hair looks reddish instead of looking dark brown. It got the job done but I'm not sure how long it'll last. So overall, I'll rate this hair okay/fair. I'll update later on how well it held up.

I was so excited to try the poly gel and thought it would be so easy but it wasn't that simple. You receive a set of 8 colors. The tubes are small so I'm not sure how many uses you'll get out of it. I think you'll get about 2 full uses per tube maybe 3. I had a hard time with this poly gel. I squeezed a small amount onto the nail former and smoothed it out evenly. I put a thin layer of base coat on my nail and cured it. Then I put the nail former filled with the poly gel onto my nail but it wouldn't stay in place. The former kept lifting from my nail. I tried putting more and putting less to see if it'll help the former stay in place but it didn't work. I cured it for 120 seconds twice and even then the center of my nail where the former lifted from didn't turn solid. I even have a couple bubble pockets. Also while curing, the poly gel flowed to the right side of the former and created a thick dried buildup underneath the nail. I think the shape of the former is what caused this and because the former needs to be lighter. I came to this conclusion because I have used another poly gel brand where the former was feather light and less curvy and was able to cure the gel completely and the former stayed in place until cured. I didn't have any buildup underneath my nail either and got it on the first try. Otherwise, the poly gel was very easy to shape after being cured. I used the clear and I love how natural it looks but it feels like I have an acrylic nail. I might use it in combination with the nail extention in the future. Hopefully that will stop the buildup from happening. It also comes with a free gift of glitter. Overall, the set it okay. May be better suited for more advanced users.

This hair is really nice. It's called a five pack but you only receive one package. It is called a five pack because you get five twist ties with about 8 stands off hair per tie. It also comes with a crochet tool. I untwist the hair to braid it into my hair. It looked frizzy when I did that but once it was braided it was no longer frizzy. It did lose its curly pattern though and became lengthy, at least 12 inches. The hair is easy to install. I didn't include photos of the install because the base of my hair didn't blend well with the hair. I plan on trying it again once my hair grows long enough for cornrows. I'll update later when I try it out again. Overall, very good hair.

A very light weight oil used as a skin moisturizer (that's what my research on Squalane oil turns up, there's lots of other stuff, but this is the main reliably cited benefit offered). My wife tried this product out, using the entire 1 ounce over a period of about 2 months. She is very positive in her impression, saying that of all the products she has tried, this one seems to have a reliable effect in reduction of micro wrinkles and skin moisturizing. It goes on light and leaves no oily residue.

The big issue is that the product is easily 8 times the price of other squalane oils. Given that the single ingredient listed is the oil you have to wonder if the oil is cold pressed by seraphim from plants tended by nymphs. I ordered an alternative product and my wife says that she is satisfied that the new product is good as well. I'll take that as meaning the alternative at a fraction of the cost is effective and a better value for the money.

I'm the proud owner of a rather glorious handlebar moustache (though I say so myself). So when a 'stache wax or grooming product comes available on Vine I'll usually request it if it's anything in the neighborhood of what I usually like.

I like firm or strong hold waxes with significant tackiness. I won't even consider a wax unless it either states a strong hold or a tacky hold or both. As a reference my other favorite common varieties of moustache wax include (in order of preference descending):
Firehouse Moustache Wax - Tacky (Wacky Tacky)
The Vintage Grooming Company - Death Grip
Can You Handlebar - Primary

All of these are either exceptionally tacky or very strong in hold or both. I have tried many other waxes by various brands over the last several years but the ones above are my favorites and the ones that I feel are most worth mentioning in comparison to this product.

I would rate this wax as slightly less tacky than the Firehouse Moustache wax Tacky and slightly less stiffness than the Can You Handlebar Primary wax. Death Grip has it's own unique and weird properties (and I don't love the way it smells) so it is hard to direct compare :-)

As far as my general ranking I'd put this solidly in the top 5 waxes I've ever tried though, probably just under the three above and maaaybe 5th place after maybe Fisticuffs Strong Hold (which also has some pine resin for stickiness).

Unscented is good! Nothing worse than a cloying scent right up under your nose holes all day long!

Anyway, it has a strong hold for shaping if you like a strong curl as I do, combined with a tacky hold if you get a lot of stray and fly away hairs as I do. While my "go to" product is still Firehouse Tacky, and this has not replaced that, this is a worthy offering. The tree embossment on the wax is cute and I kinda dig that they give you the recipe.

The price point at the time of this writing is very fair. If you're in need of a good strong hold tacky wax I'd say give this product a shot!
overpriced...and slips off my head. ugh

Better than expected. Didn’t know what to expect for under $5. But I was pleasantly surprised! Received exactly as described and pictured. Packaged each individually in sealed plastic bags all in a nice big white gift box. This were perfect! They are sturdy and held up my thick curly hair. The size is perfect for sides. They didn’t hurt and surprising didn’t break like other have after moving them around several times. I would say I would order more, but there were so many in the pack. I don’t think I will have to. I will however see if the seller has other sizes and different sizes. I will definitely buy from this seller again. Very happy with my thrift purchase. Happy to see quality can still be had without breaking the bank.

UPDATE: not long after writing this review and daily use. Sadly several of the teeth started breaking off the combs. Plastic is bound to do that, give out. For $5 & such a large pack, they were bound to break. Just sad it happened so quickly. Overall, can’t beat $5 & the size. The combs still hold my hair even with a few of the teeth broken. Just be aware that they are a bit flimsy and if you wear them regularly....well...you probably shouldn’t, if you want them to last. Or simply buy another $5 set an replace them as they give out.

This isn't the typr of glass file I'm used to.  Maybe it's better and I'm using it wrong.  It feels like there's a fine metal file inbedded in the glass. It doesn't do much,  it's so fine. I bitmap like finer grit, but this left me unimpressed.

I have white skin. Like, white white.My arms and face generally see a little sun in the summer and darken slightly, but I take care to wear SPF so I never see much change. My legs, on the other hand, are a problem. White. Blinding.Horrifying. I've tried many self tanning products in the past, mostly lotions and foams. They all worked okay, usually with streaking and the dreaded orange tone, but what is a girl to expect?
I can tell you now, there's more out there for us than orange legs. This yea is the first in 3 or 4 that I have actually chosen to wear shorts. I figured, I'm too old to care what people think about my stretch marks, white legs, weird veins. So I bought a Loreal spray bronzer a few weeks ago. I was left with horribly streaky legs that I had no choice but to cover up. I can deal with my own legs, but streaked legs? I couldn't do it. I found this Bronze Doll spray and I decided to give it a try. I've never used a mitt before and I was curious.
I waited until the streaking from the last tanner I tried was completely gone before using this, because I wanted to give it a fair shot. Immedietely upon spraying the product into the mitt and rubbing it on my legs, they were transformed. I can't lie, it looked like I was spreading paint on my chunky white calves. It was almost a purple color. I was shocked, but I kept going. I rubbed the product onto both legs, being as careful as I could. It had a really pleasant scent, almost tropical, but it went away when the product dried. Dry time was about a minute- but I didn't put my shorts on for a few minutes after that. I didn't notice any transfer whatsoever, either on my clothing or my white bed sheets. By the time I went to bed, the color had settled to a nice bronze. Not too dark, but very noticeable. My legs ended up a little splotchy, but I know that it was due to user error. I woke up with nicely tanned legs, for the first time in years.
Then I took a shower. As soon as the water hit my legs, it turned brown. I can honestly say, I wasn't expecting that. I rubbed my legs a little and no additional product seemed to come off. When I got out of the shower, I saw that the color had been reduced by about half, but was still obvious on my skin.I will reapply tonight to help with some of my mistakes from yesterday. This is a dark enough product that I think I can only use it 3 times a week if I want to look normal, and I pretty much do. I love the way it makes my skin look. I love the way it makes my calves (my most hated body part) look! I can't say that I will try it on other parts of my body, but I will being using it throughout the summer on my legs.The mitt makes an obvious (for me) difference in ease and quality of application. I am very happy with this, and I will repurchase it if I run out before September, (which is when I will most likely go back to covering up all the time). I was able to purchase this product at a reduced cost in exchange for an honest review. All opinions are my own. When I repurchase the product, I will happily do so at full cost.

I have baby fine long blonde hair that needs help defining my layers and needing texture so it doesnt go and stay flat straight. I washed my hair the night before and put it up in a bun and slept like that. In the morning it creates nice waves but with no help the waves are gone in about 1 hour.
I let my hair down and I am putting this through the test. My hair is about 5 inches above my butt, its that long.
After taking the cap off I was greeted by a smooth looking clay the color of a creamy petroleum like "butter". 1 swipe of my pointer finger and rubbing my thumb together leaves a nongreasy, non sticky feel. its a smooth feel like it absorbed in my skin which is GOOD!
I paid close attention to my ends, layers and i "chunked" out the pieces to give em definition and a small kick up like. I used some on my bangs to define the side way that I swipe them so they are put of my eyes.
Humidity is a killer here and 5 hours later I have no greasy stiff crunchy look. My bangs are hanging out like they did when I applied the clay. My hair is not a big poof nor is it flat. The ends are still kicking it nicely and my waves are still nice.
Okay final test which no clay or gel or wax has ever passed! I swiped my finger across the jar to coat it. tap your finger and thumb together a few times grab a tissue or a piece of toilet paper! Not 1 shred came off and stuck you to huh!
This is a great indication how gentle this is on your hair!
I got this for a discount for my honest feed back, the above is my own opinions.

Nice nice and nice! Nice way to pamper your feet with out the elbow grease of doing it manually on your own. I put a towel down to collect the skin "dust" but there wasnt really a need for this.
It provides a very nice spa like shaving of those harden skin patches, and callus's and the attachments offer a nice smoothing buffing of your skin.
It wont chop your skin but it buffs it down, wont cut your skin but polishes it for you.
This pays for itself in 1 use compared to the spa prices.
The attachments are easy to use, remove and clean. They come off nicely then tap into the trash can and see all the skin it removed using very little elbow grease.
This requires batteries which you need to supply but its a small price for the results you get from using this.
Over all this is a great product for great feeling and looking summer feet!
I gave this 5 stars because it deserves every single star I gave it.
I got this for a discount for my honest feed back, the above is my own opinions

This is a really nice body brush. You really dont need an exfoliation scrub with this, it may be to much abrasion. This does a really nice job on it's own. I use this on my feet and knees and elbows. It does a nice effective job scrubbing away the old dry skin to reveal a healthier skin tone. Over all this does a wonderful job. I got this for a discount for my honest feed back, the above is my own opinion

Thank you, Jeanette! What a lovely sweater. I haven't worn one like this since George and I were in Ireland, right before Dennis was born. That was our last trip abroad, wasn't it George? Well, thank you. What a treasure.

Okay, let's see who's next? Oh, here's one for Dennis. A nice big box for Dennis. There are you, Dennis. What do you think's in it? My goodness, you ARE giving that a good shake, aren't you? Why don't you open it? Just open it, Dennis. All right, don't throw the paper, Dennis. Watch the elbows--Aunt Jeanette is sitting right next to you. That's better, okay. What did Santa bring you? That's right, it's a Peepee Doll! Just like the one from the birdyplane.

....Because it's what he wanted, George....Well, you're not the one who has to spend 16 hours a day listening to him scream "Peepee Doll", are you?....Well, I don't think any of us knows "how this is going to end", and you're being needlessly negative.

Jeannette, Dennis saw it in SkyMall and became a little obsessed. And now you have it, don't you, Dennis? Your very own Peepee Doll.

Now let's see what old Kris Kringle brought for Aunt Jeannette... Dennis, what are you doing? Dennis don't do that. Not in front of guests, Dennis. Not ever, and especially not in front of guests. Yes, you have one too. Now put it away. Of course yours is bigger-- because that's a doll baby and you're 42. Put it away, Dennis. All the way. Jeannette does not want to see it, Dennis. Look at her face, look at the cues. Does she look happy? I think she looks frightened. Put it away. There we go. Good choice.

Okay. Now let's see what old Kris--Dennis, don't do that. Don't put those in your mouth. Those are not for putting in your mouth. Dennis? No one cares how many you can put in your mouth, Dennis. It's not funny. If you're the only one laughing, it's not funny. Put them back in the box. Don't throw those at Aunt Jeanette. I don't think she's enjoying it. Dennis, if you can't play nice with the Peepee Doll, Daddy will have to take it away...George, you most certainly WILL get in the middle of this...because you are his father...Dennis, put the penises back in the box. Dennis! Do not throw the penises into the fire. Dennis? Dennis! That's it. That's enough. George, take the Peepee Doll from Dennis. Right now. You just lost the Peepee Doll, Dennis. No more Peepee Doll for Dennis. Grab it, George! Both arms, dear, hold on with both arms. Let go of it, Dennis. Let go. Let go. Let your father have the Peepee Doll. Good...okay. Are we all calm now? Dennis? All right, that's good.

Now, let's see, what did old--Dennis! Put down the tree! Dennis, you put down that Christmas tree this instant! Put it down! Don't you even think about putting that in the fire, Dennis. George! George, give Dennis back the Peepee Doll! Put down the tree, Dennis, and Daddy will give you the Peepee Doll. There we go. Okay. Let's all take a deep breath. Everyone just, just take a deep breath and calm down.

Well, my goodness. We've certainly had some excitement, haven't we? Now, let's see what Kris Kringle--Dennis, don't look at your Aunt Jeanette like that. Staring is very rude, Dennis. Dennis, sit down! No licking, Dennis! We don't lick our guests! Don't--Put Jeanette down, Dennis! Put Aunt Jeanette down this instant! George, get the shot! Dennis, no licking! Get the shot, George! Go limp, Jeanette! Go limp! We don't lick guests, Dennis! George, the neck! It has to be in the neck!

There...there...there he goes. There goes Dennis. Okay. Bedtime for Dennis. Good night, Dennis. Okay. Leave him there, George. He's perfectly all right. It's just a mild horse sedative. He'll be fine a few hours.

Well, my goodness. Is everyone all right? Jeanette? Everyone's all right, okay. Let's just... let's all have a seat. Scone, Jeanette? No? Okay. Let's all just...stop crying. George, please stop crying. There. There, that's better.

Okay. Now, where were we? Ah, yes. Let's see what old Kris Kringle has brought Aunt Jeanette...

I use this clay to wash my natural type 4 hair. I've been using this clay for months now. I really don't see a need for shampoo which causes me tangles and itchy scalp. I can detangle with this clay! After reading that they are using clay to absorb INDUSTRIAL OIL SPILLS, there is really no need for shampoo, even if I use silicones or grease on my hair. I love it and I'm not looking back. I don't care what anyone tells me, my hair and scalp thank me after using this. Give it a try and see if it works for you too.

I’ve dont have any known allergies nor have I had an allergic reaction to any other oral care products over the years, I also don’t have any know oral health “issues” I simple bought this to strengthen enamel and whiten teeth. But after using it the night before I woke up with a scary swollen mouth, tongue, cheeks, gums and lips. Be very careful with this product, use a small amount to test before rinsing your entire mouth like you normally would.

This same product is being sold for $32 every where else. The pic shown is from a very common website It starts with a W and ends with mart.
Awesome hair products but horrible mark up. Seller is taking advantage.

I'm 41 and have combination / breakout prone skin. I combine this Vitamin C serum with 4-5 drops of Orange essential oil. It has helped with controlling breakouts as well as fine lines and wrinkles.

Here's my face washing routine: (twice a day)

Step #1
Wash my face with Alpha Skincare Refreshing Face Wash.. Pat dry

Step #2
Combine a full dropper of vitamin C serum with 4-5 drops of orange essential oil - let dry (tip: I use a hair dryer on low to speed up drying time.)

Step #3
Apply a thin layer of benzoyl peroxide cream (I use Dr. Song, 2.5% benzoyl peroxide advanced acne gel.). Let dry completely

Step #4
(Only once a day before bed.)
Apply glycolic acid
(I use Alpha Skin Care, Intensive Rejuvenating Serum with 14% Glycolic AHA 2 oz)

The brush is very soft, soft enough to use on your face or your more sensitive spots, but still stiff enough to clean those callouses on your feet. It won't remove all the callous, but it will get them clean LOL. The loofa side is soft enough not to be irritating on the skin, but it is very small AND someone thought it was a good idea to put a rope loop sticking through the loofa so you actually end up trying to scrub your body with the rope instead of the loofa. VERY annoying. They should have found a better place for that rope loop - like attached to the back of the handle. And the neck of the handle is built at a pretty severe curve, makes it so that if you try to scrub yourself with the loofa you will just smack yourself with the bent part of the plastic handle instead.

The brush side is pretty good and the plastic handle is comfortable and solid, but I'm tall and also disabled with limited range of motion in my shoulders... so for me the handle is too short by almost a foot. That, combined with the bad design decisions they made on the loofa side... this is one of the worst shower sticks I've seen.

Alright, so I bought this for my sister since she's in cosmetology... First, I made the mistake of only really paying attention to the picture, only one comes in the mail. But the scissors don't really look the way I expected, they're pretty small on the pin itself. Also, I kind of thought this was a barrette type hair clip, it's more like a Bobby pin - but as you can tell from my pictures, it doesn't even have the bumps a normal Bobby-pin would have! I had to add another Bobby pin with this to even make it stay in my sisters hair when I first put it on her (it was a surprise gift in an up do I was trying out on her) so I was kind of disappointed. She acts like she loves it, but she hasn't worn it yet... And she was looking at it weird when she was first examining it. Probably because the scissors look a little weird being so short on the pin and because it's not even a pin that will stay in by itself. It's decent... But I'm glad I only spent about $2 on it.
Car

I just reordered the same exact masks, but they sent me a totally different brand. The new brand is called "FRYLR" the old brand (the one in the photo of a working mask) was "TEMI". TEMI masks are great. FRYLR are simply awful. The first one on the top was already broken in the box. None of them look like they're going to hold up, even the ones that aren't broke. They're badly put together and not stuck on properly.

Since Amazon doesn't allow you to choose who you're getting them from, or tell you who you got them from last, it's all about luck when you order. 50/50 you get the good TEMI masks or the crappy unusuable FRYLR masks. It's the same purchase button. Either that or they replaced the good masks with bad ones. The "TEMI" mask is the one in the photo that contains a face.

If you're the gambling sort, here's the original 5 star reviews over the "TEMI":
TEMI
Positives:
1. You can breathe! Unlike with every cloth mask out there. It's still uncomfortable because you're still re-breathing your own exhale, but you won't pass out. So if you have health conditions, this type of mask is probably the best option you'll find.
2. You can see through it, allowing lipreading and ability to see a smile and so forth.
3. Comfortable on the ears
4. Keeps you from touching your face, which is part of the reason cloth and surgical masks are a bad idea.

Negatives:
1. Chin indent doesn't go away for a while and can irritate.
2. Touches the average sized nose.
3. It does fog up, but the fog disappears if the weather's not cold, so "fog resistant" might be a better description.

Wore this to the bus and the post office, and was allowed to ride and others seemed fine with it. It's an excellent way to go where you need to without being denied the ability to get necessities done, yet still breathe.

It comes in a pack of ten.

I love getting my face threaded.. it is so good to have to hair gone from your face.  Your skin looks better, your products work better and if you wear makeup, it goes on so much better.  I live an hour away from the lady who does my face.. so I can not always get to her.. and I am SO HAIRY lol.. this is so helpful for me.  It takes care of my face when I can not get to her.  Takes two secs to put the string on and then boom you are doing your face.. or wherever you need it lol.. .. My tips.. have your face nice and clean, make your face taut wheever you are doing it, after you are all done.. I use that green anti bump shave gel.. rinse your fac4e with warm water, pat dry, then put a little on your hands and then glide all over your face and neck.. or whereever you did it on your face.. this will prevent bumps.. and hey.. no makeup or harsh chemicals  creams etc the rest of the day.. unless you want bumps.. so there you go.. :)

SMALL! I purchased this to replace my old Goody mirror I had for years after my daughter accidentally broke it. This looked like the exact same style, but it's much smaller. I did find the correct size on here. I will attach the link at the bottom of this review if you're looking for that size. I was upset that this was a no return item. I still like it, and it's a quality mirror.

POSITIVES- This is well made and very sturdy. It's lightweight and easy to hold. I can see my whole face, which I didn't expect at first. I'm uploading pictures of both mirrors so you can see the size differences, and aside from that, they're pretty much made the same. This will be great for traveling, or even if you have a safe way to carry it in your purse or a makeup case. Just make sure you're ordering the correct size you're looking for. Both sizes ordered came intact on my first order.

Link for larger mirror in my picture is:

https://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B001UO87DC?psc=1&ref=ppx_pop_mob_b_pd_title

My 7yr old, and I were so excited to get these to hold her many, many large Jo Jo Siwa bows. I was expecting the ribbon to be a little thicker, and longer. It holds 4 large 8 inch bows comfortably. Possibly 5, however because the ribbon is really thin, it doesn't hang straight when holding, organizing, or using. The ribbon twists around, and doesn't hang straight at all. There just isn't enough space for what we need either. I think these would be great for smaller bows, tho. They look just as pictured. I'm just now learning about the different types of ribbon out there to hold the larger bows more stable. I have not found or purchased a new set, yet. I think if these were longer, it might not have been a complete miss for what I was looking for. The set with the crowns and the ribbon rings as the hooks, do fit over my daughter's dresser draw knobs, which I was hoping, and looking for when ordering. I'm still giving them a 3 star review, because they would be nice for other's needs as I've mentioned. A suggestion would be to make much longer ones. Another foot or 2, and possibly use a heavier ribbon material.

I'm not upset with the product itself, as much as I am upset that I didn't realize that these are not ideal for a lot of large bows. They are pretty!

Update:
This primer is really growing on me. I've tried acouple other's since making my 1st review, and it makes me appreciate this primer much more. It's very smooth, and silky going on. Leaves, a very mellow, yet bright look on your eyes, which looks really pretty alone! Eyeshadow go's on smoothly over it, and I do think it helps it pop the color out. It's not tacky on your eyes like some. I would say it's better by itself, and to help making the application of eyeshadow easier, and help's shadow stand out. It does dry quick. The con's are, I can't really tell a difference in my eye makeup, or shadow lasting longer. &, I do still wish it came with more, because it doesn't last long at all. I only wear makeup once in a while, and I've already ordered another one, after 5 or 6 wears, and I probably have maybe, 5 or so wears left. Maybe! It's hard to tell because of the shape of the bottle. Will update when it's actually gone. If you're planning to use it daily, I'd say it will be hard to keep it in stock. I think I'm going to only use it by itself, when I don't want eyeshadow over it, so I can stretch it out, because that's my favorite thing about how this primer looks. Wish they offered a bigger size. Or, anymore at all. They're sold out as I'm writing this, and my 2nd bottle hasn't arrived, yet. Almost ordered 2 more, and I wish I would have now.

Original 2 star review, upon arrival, before actual use...
Came really quick. Still has 33 days left on estimated time. Came within the week. Packaged very good. A little too good, and hard to open. Product is in a pretty bottle. I am a little disappointed with how much product there is, however. It's also kinda thick down in the bottle, and looks like it could dry out fast. I haven't done my eye makeup, yet, so can't speak on the quality of the product as a primer. I will update once I do my eye makeup. I would give more stars if it had come with a little more product. :(
Band is sturdy, but cut too short for any adult head size comfort. Caused a headache after wearing a short amount of time.

The fragrance is divine. Smelled it on my first trip to Maui and loved it. While in Hawaii I was in a store and someone dropped a bottle and it shattered to the floor. I was shocked to see that the ceramic decorative bottle is at best a holder for a very small vial contained within the neck of the bottle. The tiny vial is what holds only a 1/4oz of perfume. I would have been incensed if I had made the purchase thinking that I was getting a full ceramic bottle size portion of the fragrance, only to find out too late that there is only a quarter ounce of fragrance in that LARGE bottle. Buyer beware. The fragrance is lovely, just beware your $40+ dollars is buying a decorative ceramic bottle, that is hiding a vial inside that only holds a 1/4 oz of the previous oil you want.

I used Hibiclens while I had an active Staph (MRSA) skin infection. Hibiclens, in addition to 10 minute bleach baths, gave me peace of mind that I could sanitize myself and not risk transmiting the infection to others.

Please read the directions very carefully!!! This product can cause PERMANENT eye damage if it enters the eyes and is not immediately flushed out.

It is not meant for long term use over large areas of the body. After the infection responded to treatment (debridement, followed by oral antibiotics, Bactrim and Clyndamycin simultaneously) and stopped oozing, I switched from Hibiclens to regular antibaterial liquid handsoap from the grocery store. Those products contain benzalkonium chloride, which has been shown to be effective against MRSA.

Hibiclens is a highly effective product, but it contains powerful active ingredients, and must be used with caution.
The Good genes was empty

I contacted Paula at Makeup Planet to see if I could get the colors I wanted of these nail polishes instead of getting just a random batch. She told me absolutely and just to email her the colors I chose. I went to the Sallly Hansen website and picked 20 colors, then I emailed them to Paula. In just a short time, she had sent me the package with every single color I'd requested. Paula really went out of her way to help me, and i have never received such phenomenal customer service from any seller I've dealt with on Amazon. I was kept up to date through emails on when my package was sent, the tracking number, etc. Paula even emailed me once to let me know that a few colors I'd chosen were no longer available and she took the time to find colors that would be close to the ones I wanted. She even listed a few of each so I could look them up and make an informed decision. She was so helpful, I can't believe it! If I ever want to order something again, and if Makeup Planet is one of the sellers, I would choose them every time! Best Customer Service EVER!

Now, as far as the nail polishes themselves go, my gosh, they are wonderful. What I like most about this particular brand (specifically the Complete Salon Manicure from Sally Hansen), is the brushes themselves. They are thicker than any brushes I've ever had with nail polishes. They hold so much polish that it makes it very easy to apply. Just one swipe and your entire nail is covered! The white polish called "Let's Snow" is wonderful. It will cover in just one coat with no streaks. I like to use two coats, though. The other colors are absolutely gorgeous, especially the "Red Zin," which is such a deep red, it's a blood red like I've never seen before. I got a wide array of colors, and I tried each one. Not a disappointing one in the whole lot! I am absolutely thrilled with this purchase! And the price is just perfect for as many bottles as you get in this set. Way less than you could ever find in a store.
Honestly I'm confused why it says, colorful wigs for white women... can we not wear any of the other wigs? Are they only for non white women? Smh
Took a while to get here but that's ok. The colors aren't the same as what we ordered but still very pretty. Daughter loves them.

These work as advertised. Big enough to fit my large fingertips without hurting them. They are a hard clear plastic with a metal rod and a metal spring. Make sure when you get yours to check the back end to see if the springs are aligned in the slots. If not, slide them with a fingernail or tool until they go into the slot. The batch that I received have metal springs that barely make it into the slot, which makes the spring pop-out if I open the clips all the way. If the springs were long enough, these would get a 5 star rating from me. As they are, I cannot recommend them. However, I do like that they come individually wrapped so they could be gifted in sets of 5 or 10 and the receiver would know the clips are unused.
Nothing to like.  Absolutely worthless.
Have only been using for one week, but my skin feels very supple.  I'm in my 60s and I love this product so far!

The first tub I received, the tub was badly cracked all over/damaged. That is obviously the shipping's fault. But the cracked tub was the least of the problem. The butter inside on the first 1/2" layer was very soft & wonderful, like firm vaseline texture. But underneath that first 1/2" layer, it changed into a very grainy sand paper like texture! The texture felt like someone mixed beach sand in it! It hurt my skin, and when used for my hair, just rinsed sandy stuff back onto my skin. The process was a little drawn out to try to return it, but the company made it right by sending me a new batch, as the first one was completely unusable. The second batch is different altogether. Very hard like wax, but at least it is smooth and not like sand mixed in. I had to use a spoon to dig to the bottom, it is that hard and began to bend it, to see if the under layer is smooth or grainy. It is still smooth but a little courser than what is on the top of the tub. In my other tub it was so soft I could just push my finger in and down to the bottom of the tub. Furthermore, reading on here, it sounds like each batch is strikingly different. A more consistent quality and texture is very needed, and perhaps some new quality control measures or personnel is highly needed and appreciated.

Instead of just "up to 1000 q-tips" that will biodegrade in the landfill, now there are up to 1000 q-tips AND a piece of silicone that will sit there forever. As other reviews have pointed out, this is useless for its intended purpose. I was using a q-tip almost daily and wondered if there was something better, and now I feel foolish for falling for green marketing on a piece of silicone that won't biodegrade and can only be down-cycled, at best.

Kinda annoyed.. was so so excited to receive this steamer today after having it recommended by a friend to open the package for a BROKEN measuring cup.

I thought — okay I can just use a measuring cup I have at home but then realized the hole to pour the water in has specific measurements and is pretty small. This really is a bummer.
Scam, do not buy.

They are thinner than I like and wish there was options for double thickness because the quality is Amazing. I buy the Halo hair wire and add clips and remove the wire. I cut the halo into 2 wafts because they need to be ear to ear width and they are not. I get #60 and fill a bowl with purple shampoo and water and wash the extensions and it's a perfect platinum. These by far are the best quality for the money on Amazon. I just wish they had options for fuller double or triple wefts.

Ok first thing you should know is this wig is white with light golden brown roots. The cap size is perfect for normal sized head without much excess which is a problem with wigs. Hair is silky and shiny, a little too shiny so use dry shampoo spray and this will help. You also need to use makeup foundation along the hair part so it will look more realistic as a hairline part and match your skin. The back will need a straightener to smooth out after taking out of the bag. This is a cute wig but not platinum blonde, more of an ice white color. Picture shows a yellow platinum color but it is not. It is white. Trendy with the popular colors right now. Fit is great and quality is superb.

I just received this so I haven't worn it except to try it on. I will update with photos. I agree with the other reviewer that stated some of the reviews are from people not knowing how to wear a wig. Companies need to send products to people who know how to use the product. Clearly this is an issue for some because this wig is of superior quality. Especially for the color, length, texture and of course price. If you do not know how to properly cut a lace front wig to look natural, then google videos on how to do this before posting uneducated reviews. Not fair to this company. I've been in hair and makeup for over 20yrs and this is a great company to buy from. No I did not receive my wig for free. I paid for it. I actually bought 3 wigs from them within the last 30 days.
Note: Pictures are with the wig right out of the package and not styled. Still looks amazing
Update: I've now purchased 3 of this style. I added long bangs and cut the length shorter using a razor comb. Added layers so the curls look amazing. Do not straighten it unless you want to lose the curl completely. If you want to change up the style, purchase one to straighten and keep the other curled. That's what I do. I also purchased the asymmetrical bob length from same seller. Amazing quality and price.

This brush is the perfect size for your purse but it isn't very good quality. When it arrived the first thing I noticed was that one of the holes was empty where bristles are supposed to be. Not to mention there were two sticker labels on the brush that left a sticky residue when I removed them, on the wood handle and back of the brush. I may use it from time to time if I remember to throw it in my purse as a quick bang brush. The bristles are very soft and don't work to brush out my hair anywhere but my bangs. And I have very fine straight hair so would not recommend this to anyone with thicker hair. May work on little girls or my sons hair just for a quick brush through but definitely not ideal for everyday use.
I received this product for free or at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I have received and fully used the product before posting this review.
This ponytail gave me an attitude blocked my ex, shut down an argument on Facebook and bought tickets to see Lizzo all in the same day. Proceed with caution!!

This is my 4th organizer from this company, they make really great quality acrylic organizers!! I bought this smaller palette organizer because I was running out of room in my larger one because of all my smaller palettes taking up space. I love it because fits a ton of different sized palettes. Longer palettes can even fit if stood up on their sides. I honestly don't own a palette that won't fit in either this organizer or the larger one..even the large Morphe 35 color palettes fit!! I have included some pics for comparison. I wrote a review for the larger palette organizer that has more details if u want to check it out.
I actually got this for $15, which is an amazing price!! If you havent checked out their website, definitely do! I signed up for their email newsletter and they frequently send me discount codes which is awesome. Also, if you go to their website, and then click on their link to follow them on Instagram or Facebook they give a code for 20% off! Which is how I got this for an amazing price! Really awesome company, I will definitely be buying more of their organizers! They help me display and keep my makeup chaos in order!

The palettes in my smaller organizer are:

1st-Becca x Jaclyn Champagne Face Palette
2nd-Becca Champagne Glow & Afterglow
3rd-Viseart Neutral Matte palette
4th-Hourglass Ambient Lighting Edit
5th-MUFE Tin Palette, Medium
6th-ABH Sun Dipped Glow Kit
7th-ABH Gleam Kit
8th-Violet Voss Holy Grail Palette

I really love this palette holder. I was using letter sorters, but they didn't really fit my palette and I had to use too many. This keeps them all in one place, and pretty compact (for 10 palettes) It is sturdy acrylic, that will probably last forever. It fits the Large Z Palette perfectly and the MAC Pro Palettes (older slim version.) I wish it were about an inch wider so I could put my Viseart palettes together, but overall I am very happy. I read on the Alegory website they were coming out with an oversized & small palette organizer, so those might be worth picking up also to organize by size better. I love to look at pics to see what will fit into certain organizers, so I included a pic of mine. In case it is hard to tell, these are what palettes that are in it: (Front to Back) 1.Viseart, 2. Becca Champagne Glow, 3.Viseart & Hourglass Ambient Edit, 4.ABH Contour & Becca Afterglow, 5,6, & 7 are MAC Pro Palettes (old version) & Large Z Palette in last row. Hope this was helpful!

Update: Added some new pics of some palettes people have been wondering if they fit. I honestly haven't found a palette that WONT fit. Morphe palettes DO fit, they just have to lay on their side. I have found that if you put all of your palettes on their side you can fit WAY more in this organizer. I currently have 15 palettes fit in mine, so this has been very handy! I love having all my palettes at my fingertips, it really encourages me to use all of my palettes more instead of being in a drawer forgotten about. The new palettes im the pictures not listed above are the Anastasia Glow Kit, Too Faced Sweet Peach, MAC Pro Large single sided palette, Violet Voss Holy Grail Palette & Morphe Palettes in the back., the rest are on the list above.

How can a shampoo and conditioner duo (or individual bottles) that costs $50 per bottle always come with at least 1 broken pump every time? GKhair? I notice you don't answer these questions in the "question" section, only questions about smells and which product to choose.

How can all the $3-5 hair products in the grocery have working pumps and you can't get a pump to work for $50/bottle? Yes, at 33.8 oz it's a longer pump and has thicker product, but that is NOT the issue because the pumps don't even pop up after unscrewing (well, trying to) to attempt to pump shampoo or conditioner. I turned my sister onto your products years ago and now she has the same problem I do.

I like the product and have strong allergies to fragrance, so it's hard to find a product I can tolerate and I usually stick to it until the fragrance gets changed. But when I have to use the conditioner like a big dipstick and get wasted product all over because the pump won't even unscrew, it's ridiculous!

Please fix this as you will see many comments mentioning this problem - clearly it's not just me and my sister (who live in different states and get the product from different places). Don't you care about your customers sticking around??

I want to give my honest opinion on this Hair the reason I gave it three stars was because the smell I ordered three bundles and the smell was very strong and really hard to get rid of.
My first impression upon opening the hair was that it was very soft and very wavy looks exactly like the pictures however it seems to me that there is something on the hair making it have that exact pattern for every bundle. I’ve been buying here over 20 years and I’ve bought a very expensive top quality hair for a 19 1/2 of those 20 years. I was seeking hair that is cheaper because I’m tired of spending so much money on hand. For the money of this hair it’s really good I washed the three
Bundles and felt that they were very soft very slick when washing no shedding while washing but the pattern was different after I washed the hair which is fine for me in order to get the curl pattern back I had to use promax gel and leave in moisturizer. As far as tangling yes there is tangling all hair tangles. That is the most important thing to me is that hair doesn’t matter and shit I’ve had bad experiences the last few months with chatting with other hair so I’m happy to find this I do like the hair I will order it again for the price you really can’t beat it all though let me add I did sell the wefts because I’m paranoid! I couldn't use this product at all. Any time I tried to apply to my under eye it would burn really badly. I would have to immediately wipe it off. I always used a clean face when I applied this and it still burned.
I didn't even get to use this brush I was so disappointed. As I was trying to remove the tape around the plastic covering the handle snapped in half.

One of my favorite beauty YouTubers wears false lashes and I have always been so envious of how much they make her eyes pop. I have tried regular strip lashes before that you glue in and I can never seem to get them on or if I do it takes several attempts.

I saw the YouTuber try out some magnetic ones so I thought I would give them a shot. I didn't want to invest a ton of money in case they were a total flop.

I decided on these and glad I did. The case the come in is really cute and I like how there is a mirror inside.

At first I thought there were no instructions so I was like "what the heck". However once I pulled up the plastic insert to remove the magnetic eyeliner, I saw them underneath.

I do recommend doing your eye makeup as normal and if you wear black eyeliner, put that on first and then put a small amount of the magnetic liner on top of that. Let it dry and out them on. BAM! Lashes were easy to apply and I didn't feel like they would fall off. I do think they might be a little too wide for my eye because I could feel them quite a bit in my inner corner. I might try trimming them, but not sure yet.

This product is amazing.  I am almost 65 and have had trouble with blackheads on my nose.  That's the only place I get them.  They were impossible to remove until I tried this product.  I have only been using it for 5 days and my problem has been solved.  No More Blackheads.  My pores are noticeably smaller and the ugly blackheads are completely gone. The skin become soft after use so you don't have to put moisturizer on after just getting everything off.  Might not be the same for everyone - I have normal skin and only ever had a problem with my nose. I did notice a slight burning in the area it was applied to but HECK the results were way worth it.  Thank you, Thank you, Thank you for a fantastic product.  I will purchase again and rave about it to all my friends.

so cute. Sticks pretty well with short hair but no so well with long hair. Spruce your outfit with these. The design is very simple. It's very hard to see it and appreciate it. However, I do like the color and almost retro look.

Very light weight but I didn't like the look. I didn't like the feel. When you touch them they feel like plastic. Can get better quality at the hair store. They look super fair. Very uncomfortable. Would not purchase.

I'm not sure if how I applied it is what made it not work or if the product just doesn't work at all.  There was no directions on how to use the product which is the reason for the 1 star it might have been more but I could not get over the fact that it did not come with instructions. I did try and it didn't work but that could because I put it on wrong because again there was NO instructions included with this product.

My makeup was staining my facemask & it was difficult to breathe under my it, so I was looking for something that would protect my expensive mask.  Also, inhaling & exhaling air made my facemask expand & retract!!  Not happy, so I ordered the 3D face bracket & WOW what a great product! Mask is now clean, breathing is better, and I also found that if I put a few "stitches" to secure the mask in place, and to avoid potential loss of the bracket, it worked even better for me!!!  When taking off the mask, I was concerned I'd lose the bracket.  If I want to wash my facemask, I just snipped the stitches & stitched it up again.....not really a big deal & now it's perfect!!!

A couple of years ago my hair was in rough shape from bleaching and coloring. I found out about Olaplex shampoo. After a couple of weeks of using the shampoo my hair was in such improved condition I was seriously impressed. So I invested in the No. 5 conditioner. It was okay, but really no more effective than any decent conditioner. After a few months, I had had a hair cut, continued using Olaplex No. 4 shampoo, and my hair was in pretty healthy shape. But, I figured I could make it even healthier by using the No. 0 and No. 3 method. The first time I did it I didn't notice anything, at all. So I thought I'd try it again. Nothing. A few weeks later (considering the availability of the trial sizes) I gave 0 and 3 another try. That time my hair was dry, rough, and flyaway. Anything but sleek and well-bonded. As for the No. 8 mask, again, nothing outstanding. The take-away: I love Olaplex shampoo, both the regular and their purple for blondes shampoo. As for the rest of the Olaplex line of products, I am not at all impressed. They are so pricey, but tend to either do nothing or damage rather than repair. Aside from the shampoo, I'm calling Olaplex way overrated.
Both the pointy tip and stamp tip were completely dried out when I originally opened the package. Very disappointing!

I have been using this brand of shampoo for almost ten years. They have changed more than just the look of the bottle they have changed the formula. It not as good. Also they no longer sell the clarifying shampoo which we do need to use. I am no longer a customer

This company gives a free bob wig if you give a 5 star review. I shop online alot and rely on reviews for help so I'm not going that route. I'll give a real review instead.
This is not a terrible wig but for the price point I've had much better. Hair is beautiful but sheds. All wigs shed, yes, but too much shedding for the price point. I'm used to kinky straight or italian yaki hair that allows for all styles but this wig does not hold a curl from a hot tool very well. Great if you want to just wear it in its natural state or have time for no heat options but for me, that's a deal breaker as part of the reason I love this texture is for all the styling options. The hair is not as thick, root to ends and before I cowshed this unit, I ended up having to cut about 2 inches from it because the ends were so scraggly. I'm harder on this texture when reviewing as this is my go to texture and I've purchased this texture from no less than 10 vendors over the past few years so my knowledge on what it should be like makes me that way.
With that in mind, I would not purchase this item again. At this price point the quality should be better and the hair more versatile. On the plus side, the preplucking was decent, though I had to help it out a bit. Nots are not bleached but are very small in the front so I was able to clear that up fairly easily. I know people care about the wig smells so I will say it smelled wiggy but not stinky out of the box. Hair is soft and flows nice as well. I'd post pics but they'd be misleading as, since I'm so used to this texture, I've hooked this unit up but, for newbies this wig is more work that its worth- again, price point considered. You can get better quality with less work required elsewhere. Again, this is an honest review. Even though the 5 star review tactics turned me off, I can say that it's possible I got a bad unit and this is not the norm but I given I've had cheaper units with the same issues, I think this is just the product. Anyway, hopefully this was helpful.
My Fiancé Got Theses For Me Because He Knows I Like Purple. They’re Red 😒 Don’t Waste Your Money Nothing Like The Picture.

I had a hard time believing the only other review of this product. She made it sound so easy and non-hurtful. My opinion may be jaded because I am old Senior Citizen and have had all the little hurts to fill a lifetime diary. Maybe hurt is the wrong word.....maybe the right word is JUST different than I anticipated. I also do not feel educated in things like this well enough to do something to my face.

However, I asked all the other retirees in the dining room today and some said their daughters/granddaughters had used something like this and thought it worked wonders. Unfortunately, I can't use their statements....only my own.
And for me. I just didn't like it enough to continue doing it again.

I thought this was a REAL braid tool but it only twists the hair. It was not what I expected but no ones fault but mine. Yes, it does twist the hair and if your child has long hair, this will probably work fine. It did not do so well on my g.granddaughter's shorter hair.

If she was older, I think this would be fine. I did try it on a long haired doll and it did twist it but I left out a step, I think, because it untwisted in a short time. I then had my neighbor try it on her own hair. I just can't seem to get past that it doesn't really braid....hence the 2 stars and that's the only reason.
It's metallic and I love the variety of the colors!. What I don't like is that it's not very vibrant...  the pictures are not accurate with the result unfortunatly.

Super bad experience... came dry, not pigmented!

I don't recommend it
I was not very impressed.. it acts just like a regular cheap mascara, nothing impressive about it.

I have used this to treat some rogue hairs on my face and have been successful. The hairs are on my cheek bones above my beard line, nose tip, between my eyebrows and a single one on my ear. Many of them have not grown back in a month after first treatment. I treat every 1-2 weeks. Whatever does come back I have treated again and there is less to treat each time.

It's more tedious than IPL for sure, but the success rate per treated hair seems good. Also you can be very precise with this.

My technique is:
Grind some salt in a mortar and pestle to get a fine salt powder, put it in a small container with filtered water. Get a small container and put rubbing alcohol in it. For the container I just use a two sided measuring spoon from my kitchen. Maybe an old contact lense case would work good too, just don't use it for contacts after. Clean my face, then use my fingers to spread rubbing alcohol on the follicles I'm going to treat. Dip and wisk the end of the electrolysis pen in the rubbing alcohol to clean it. Get in front of a well lit mirror and table. Make sure the tip of the electrode is perfectly straight and fully extended - - mine was a little curved at the end and needed straightening. Dip into the salt water solution the index finger that is on the hand that will hold the pen. Hold the pen on the plastic parts with your other fingers. Fully insert the electrode into the follicle to treat. Touch your salty index finger on the metal band to electrify the electrode. You will hear a buzzing for a few seconds, then a pause, then buzzing again. The pause means treatment for that follicle is done and you can move on to the next. Though for good measure sometimes I prolonged the treatment of each follicle for an additional 1-2 buzzes, I don't know if it's necessary. Maybe that's best reserved for stubborn hairs. You will see some white puss looking fluid come out of the follicle, supposedly that's lye, which kills the follicle. When done with all of your hairs for the session, take a pause before tweezing hairs and cleaning your face. Here is a good time to put away your tools, brush your teeth or whatever. Sanitize your probe with rubbing alcohol. Meanwhile this will give the lye time to work, let's say it's 5-10 minutes. Then you tweeze the hairs and clean your face. You can use your extra rubbing alcohol to wipe on your hair follicles to help sanitize them.

Another tip, make sure your probe is fully in the follicle during the shock. The probe needle should dissappear inside, and your skin should not dimple inward from the probe pushing it down. Don't touch the skin with the probe sleeve/nozzle, but be very close. You can also use two hands to hold the probe for stability. Your dominant hand can hold the top part of the pen, and your other hand hold the tapered bottom part and brace the side of your hand against your face. I have shaky hands and this helped me to keep the probe in place.

My nose tip hairs seemed to all die out in 1-2 treatments. Cheeks I started with a lot but each time it gets easier with less and less hair. That single ear hair was one and done. Between eyebrows, I started with a bit of a monobrow but it's getting very thin. Overall a success and I plan to continue to treat other areas in the future.

This review is mainly for the liner. I put these on the day i got them and loved them. I don't wear makeup super often so after that they sat unused in the cabinet for about a month. When I went to use it again the outside of the eyeliner felt greasy or oily. I figured something had spilled on it, wiped it off and went to apply. When I tell you this stuff was dry, i mean DRY. I had to keep putting it back in the tube and shaking it to get anything out and as soon as i started to apply it would dry out and just drag against my eye. I'm assuming whatever is in the liner separated and leaked out. I think they would be fine if you're going to use them regularly but if you're like me and dont have time to do makeup everyday, good luck i guess

I am going to confess something, my feet are hideous. My family make fun my feet all the time and call them barney rubble feet. I basically walk around barefoot almost 24/7 and never go for pedicures. I would go for a pedi but I am too embarrassed at how bad my feet were. I will be the first to say I neglect my feet, they are (or should I say were) very callused and stained. My heels had deep cracks from neglect and three years of being barefoot almost exclusively. Today my callus remover came and I have to say I am impressed. I shop on amazon ALOT and it takes a lot for me to go out of my way to write a review but this gadget deserves one.

First, out of the box it looks to be a heavy duty machine. Thick power cord and a decent weight but not cumbersome. It looks built to last. It has enough power on low to do a major overhaul on the hardest and deepest of calluses. User beware this thing packs a punch. Don't spent more than a couple seconds on an area or you will feel the burn quick. Try just tapping the head on your calluses. Go against the direction of the spin because it will run off on you. It's strong enough to sand down thick toenails too. My feet have never looked this good.

No worries for lack of power on this thing, if you are looking for a gentle buffer this isn't it so if you feet are in decent shape look for something a little less aggressive. If your feet look like they walk over hot coals from time to time, this baby will take care of that in one quick session. My feet are super smooth and look like brand new, albeit a little sore.

Priced the old way at 5.99 each was worth it, with additional $6 shipping, I only give 2 stars, without it it's worth 5 stars. When they drop their shipping fee I'll buy more for 5.99...

Long before "dermaplaning" became a popular beauty trend, many women all over the world were using versions of razors like this to clear away their peach fuzz. It gives your makeup a smoother surface to settle on, makes your skin feel nice and soft, etc. I've been buying women's eyebrow razors for this purpose for ages, and those always worked fine, but I wanted to try these because they're bigger and would cover more surface area at once. It turns out that's a blessing AND a curse, as these are a little unwieldy and can be hard to use in spots like the upper lip, chin, and jawline.

Also, these are really easy to cut yourself with, so be careful! The guard on them is basically non-existent. Not only is the blade itself sharp, but so is the handle. The handle is a pretty sharply-cut material that isn't comfortable to hold at all.

BOTTOM LINE: I don't recommend these. You can get better razors for cheaper prices out there.
