There are only a few reviews on Castle Forbes' Special Reserve Neroli. A couple are on here, a few randomly online. You have to dig for them. So if you're reading this, you're more of a fragrance lover than the average Tommy Bahama fan. Put simply, CF Neroli is not a popular EDP, nor is the brand. You have to know some things about fragrance and have a specific knowledge about neroli itself, to have come searching for Castle Forbes version. This is how I came to know this brand and EDP myself.
My view is that it's not worth the cost of 160USD. That's a lot of money for a 3.4oz. bottle. CF has a nice brand image, the EDP presentation is great, and the quality of the materials used are outstanding. However, the scent alone falls short.
Neroli Reserve starts out wonderfully: crisp orange and neroli, combined with greens like pine, grass and hedges. You feel like you're at the beach, sitting just where the sand dunes meet a lush forest. This lasts for about 20 minutes. Then the "woody/musky" basenotes kick in, and this is where CF got it wrong. It deteriorates into a powdery, barbershop, very British scent. It's something your grandmother (not grandfather) would have worn if she lived in London in 1865. Designer houses today try and replicate this a bit, usually just producing a floraly, loud, baby powder vibe (see MDCI Invasion Barbare). This basenote scent is what then dominates for the next 10 hours, more if you've sprayed any arm/chest hair. The woods aren't masculine woods, just faint tree bark really.
The EDP strength is phenomenal; this stuff lasts. The only problem is whether or not you like to smell like a woman, particularly a powderpuff with flowers. I do get some faint whiffs of neroli, but it's overpowered by the floral powder. I would not recommend this for a man, and unfortunately, would recommend Tom Ford's Neroli Portofino over this. A different vibe for sure (more aquatic), but TF's neroli sustains.
Overall, 3 of 5 stars just because the ingredients are so good, but the scent isn't as much neroli as it is the musky amber that CF used. Bummer.
This one has so many chemicals in it, plus, Methylparaben, which is poison

I bought this because.............

1.) It gets a lot of reviews on YouTube and Lalique seems to get a lot of respect as a company.
2.) It's supposed to be a good example of a Vetiver fragrance
3.) Vetiver seems to be a big category for men's fragrances.
4.) As a newcomer to men's fragrances, I had no idea what Vetiver actually smelled like.
5.) This stuff is widely discounted and it seemed like a low risk option to learn about Vetiver and answer some of my questions.

So how does it smell? Great! I loved it from the first moment of the first spray through the dry down right up until it disappeared on my skin.

Reviewers use words like "dark, brooding, mysterious, and serious" to describe this. I don't get any of that. It just smells good. It makes me happy. No, it's not a light citrus smell for summer days. It's a heavier, richer smell that's probably better for an evening out.

Personally I find this a lot like the Dolce & Gabbana The One EDP I also bought. The smell is totally different but with both these fragrances.........
1.) I just liked the smell from the first moment.
2.) The concentration is Eau De Parfum for both.
3.) The longevity, projection, and sillage seems similar.

And speaking of performance, this is NOT "beast mode" stuff. It's more subtle. And as a newcomer I'm learning that can be a good thing or a bad thing depending on the circumstances when you're wearing it. But for the most part, subtle is safer and understated is the classier way to go. So for both the D&G The One EDP and this Encre Noir A L'Extreme these impress me as grown up fragrances that come off as sophisticated scents for grown men who wear suits for a living. I think this would be out of place on a guy in torn jeans, sneakers, and a tee shirt.

So performance..........
Longevity - I find it's gone in about 5-6 hours. That's fine. I can always respray if I want.
Projection - Maybe arm's length at most. That's OK. It's not "in your face", it's subtle. Someone needs to be within 3 feet to really pick upon it. If you respray after a few hours you won't offend people.
Sillage - Again modest. I really don't see you offending a room full of people as you walk through and leave them choking and gagging.
Uniqueness - This is not your typical men's cologne smell in my limited experience. It's different. It may get people thinking / wondering about what that smell is. In a good way.
Compliments - I've only asked one woman what she thought and I was surprised that she really liked it. A good start.

Personally, I think this lives up to the reviews and the hype. if this is what a good Vetiver cologne smells like, I like it. I haven't tried the original Encre Noir or the Sport version. This L'Extreme version was recommended as the best and most wearable choice and I'm happy I gave it a shot.

Highly recommended.

I was hoping for a masculine tool kit when I ordered this item. Unfortunately, I did not notice the cutesy little smiley faces carved into the backs of the clippers. The case is okay -- not luxurious (feels cheap) but looks alright, though the latch doesn't hold it closed really at all. It serves as more of an alarm, really. You hear a little "pop" and it comes flying open, so at least you know it's about to spill everywhere for a tenth of a second before it does.

But the worst thing about it is the tools themselves, which feel like they're made from maybe a rigid plastic or some of that "compressed powder" material rather than metal. All of them flex and bend out of shape even with the simplest tasks.

I would not buy this again, nor would I gift it to an enemy.

If we're completely honest, we've been conditioned by manufacturers these days to accept rubbish without complaint. Quite true, you can dial into their computer and navigate circles around their voicemail system for a few hours until your anger dissipates. Or is transferred to computer answering systems. Whichever comes first.

Happily, however, such is not the case with the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer.

Not only does this eager little trimmer solve several problems at once but it does so with a composure and aplomb that will sweep away the corporate fog and, suddenly, everything else you own will seem completely and utterly inadequate.

Trimming whiskers used to be such a chore that the ZZ Top look began to show some sense, if not appeal. The constant recharging, sweeping up afterward, seemingly endless search for single-tasking components that had wandered off and an assembly/disassembly process for cleaning the tool that would make Bill Gates weep. Philips, however, decided to go in a slightly different direction.

For a start, the battery holds on to a charge with a grip that would make Chuck Liddell cry. It doesn't last mere hours, days or weeks. Under standard use, mine lasts well over a month. Even when the battery light does begin to blink, what it really means to say is, "Pardon me but, at some point in the next several days, when it isn't too much of a bother, could you please plug me in for a bit?" Nothing urgent about it whatsoever. And once the lead is connected from socket to trimmer, a scant hour will have it fully refreshed and ready for another month on the road.

Then there is the all-in-one design. Unlike most trimmers, which require that you dig around to find the correct attachment in order to trim your left eyebrow now that you're done with the right, nearly everything is built directly into this sleek little unit. The only exception is a neat little detail trimmer that stands eternally at the ready in its own clear and obvious pocket inside the travel pouch. That's it. Nothing else to search out when you're dashing to work. It's all right there.

Not everyone who sells a "vacuum trimmer" truly means it. Most generate just a bit of wind, sufficient to scatter your whiskers over the widest possible surface. I firmly believe my last vacuum trimmer was designed by a consortium of housekeepers seeking job security. The T980, however, actually captures every single whisker, every single time. And then there's a Turbo button that doubles the already adequate force of the vacuum's suction so that you can give yourself that wind-blown look if you so choose.

But, by far, my favorite thing about this trimmer is the way it feels. It sits in your hand as if it were custom designed specifically for you. It's lightweight and nimble around the bends, falls effortlessly into its case when deeds are done and assembles as if there is an invisible force guiding your hand at every step of the way. I am genuinely amazed at the simplicity of removing and replacing the grille guard. For a time, I thought it must be drawn together by magnets. But it isn't. It's just a set of exceptionally well designed tabs and slots that quickly correct a hurried approach and seat the grille home with a satisfying, subtle click.

Most products on the market today are slapdash clumps of flimsy plastics and mechanics that are carefully designed to fail at the worst possible time. And, for some reason, we have accepted this corporate abuse in the hopes that prices would compensate us somehow. But they don't really, do they? When you've re-purchased the same device five times because it keeps breaking, whose interests are truly being served?

So, then, the T980 is a warning shot fired over the bow of companies everywhere who treat their clients like stupid, slobbering monkeys, devoid of choice or rights. With it, Philips is saying, "See, everyone? You needn't accept rubbish in exchange for your hard-earned money. We've done it properly and at a price point that is competitive." And why wouldn't we honor that?

I wish my hair grew faster.

Ok let me start out by giving a little background.  My wife and I have ZERO experience with construction.  We have over the past 20 years begun DIYing our home.  We did a complete makeover of out 1978 yellow steel tub and yellow toilet with vinyl floor.  It was hideous.. We spent a year researching fixtures and construction methods for making our own walk in shower.  After looking at the costs we found the ariel to be cost contender with the amount of renovation we would have to do and to get the wow factor we were looking for…Don’t get me wrong it was not the cheapest but it was surprisingly cost competitive and seemed fairly simple assemble.  We did just that – the bathroom took 1 week to complete and the shower was 2 days for the 1 week.  I found the instructions fine with a few issues with the electric EFI circuit I was lost on but the folk where we purchased it from were awesome with the tech support.  We got ours from atlasusa.com.  The only issue we had which is well documented is the drain.  I underestimated the importance of installing a dedicated drain and simply used the supplied flexible drain provided.  After a couple days of very slow drainage, I was able to fix the issue quickly and it has worked flawlessly every day since July 2013 (over 6 months).  I use the steam function nearly every day and the shower uses very high quality hardware.  I did remove the hair catcher and the other junk they had in the original drain and if I were to do it again I would have put in a permanent drain and scrapped the provided drain from the beginning.  We smile every time we use the shower and everyone who walks into the bathroom, still 6 months later, comments on the shower.  I could not be happier.  With the new drain we do lift the floor up once a month, just to make sure its clean and working well down there.  The wood is holding up great so far even with daily use and I would recommend this project to anyone.  By the way it was a perfect fit as a replacement for our existing bathtub.  Fits snug wall to wall…If I could attach a picture I would, but it looks and works great!  This was 100% installed by 2 middle aged people in 2 days with 1 phone tech support call....

My review is for this vacuum cleaning a house that has Michigan sand that keeps being brought in from the dogs and even the human shoes. The carpet is a tight knurled dark pattern, and also a couple of area rugs that are low pile, and a wood floor. Eventually the vacuum started making noise after a week. Little tiny noises here and there that reminds you of a bearing that starts making noise on your car's serpentine belt pulley system. I'm a mechanic, so when I heard that noise I instantly knew it was a bearing in the spindle. Or time to get louder and louder and I had to replace it and I bought it Factory Direct. And then that was great and quiet for about a week, and then a few noises and trips here and there of the bearing. Obviously these bearings suck and they're letting dust inside of them or something. No other vacuum we've ever had in the last 25 years in this house has had a problem with the bearings going out on the spindles. And look how many reviews there are. Plenty of high reviews for people that are just glad to have a roller that made their $250 vacuum like brand new again instead of having to go and she'll of a couple hundred dollars more for another vacuum. But the sad truth of it, is that it is a low-quality part even though it is Factory Direct. This is the real deal. No second-hand plastic injection mold factory making knockoffs. It is the real deal. And the real deal just sucks. But I'm going to continue buying two of them a year because this vacuum is so awesome.

My wife asked me to order her some makeup remover, and I selected this product (she's so trusting!).

At the end of our day, I got out my notepad and watched her remove her face. Here's what she remarked on:

- The box it comes in is really pretty!

- The oil removes makeup well and leaves her skin feeling soft (I verified this with a smootch on the cheek).

- But, then she started complaining about the tiny pump dispenser and how hard it was to use when her hands had gotten oily. She dropped the glass bottle a couple of times as the force of pumping pushed it right out of her hands. Oh the complaining that ensued!

- A bit surly at this point she then went on to remark how the product smells like "a hippy's underarm."

The product works, the glass bottle and tiny pump is a poor combination given the oily nature of the product and it stinks. She wasn't impressed.

Having used regular razors all my life, this was my first experience to an electric razor. I was quite disappointed.

I gave the Norelco 8040X a solid week of use, thinking that it might get better over time (as their manual suggests). It did not.

Every morning after shaving I had to manually touch-up using a $2 Bic razor. This product did not come anywhere near my skin no matter how light or hard I pressed it against me. Maybe that's just how electric shavers are? I'm not sure, but they can't be this bad.

I was however impressed with the battery life (a full week on a single charge) and how quiet it is. With the shower running, I could barely hear the motor. It's waterproof, so I can use it in the shower. It comes with a nice travel case.

The sideburn attachment is a nice thought, but there was no ear/nose trimmer which I have seen in $20 Norelco sets.

As for the moisturizing part, the lotion smelled nice but it didn't really add to the experience. And from what I can see it's very expensive.

It's back to my $2 razors for me.

[[VIDEOID:b14cd0f9653d596a9e42bffb8555aec7]] This thing really packs a punch, do not look directly into the flash. OK, with the warning out of the way, I’ll say that if you’ve never used or seen on these hair-removers you’re in for a treat. It’s a simple method that you do yourself in the comfort of your own home. I won’t go into all of the possible use scenarios, I’ll leave that up to you to decide. So instead I’m going to talk about how it works and one thing that I think makes this one a more versatile option than others out there.

So the difference between IPL (this one) and laser hair removers is that the laser ones work only on hair that is actively growing. You have to kind of time your treatments to line up with the hair-growth cycle until you’ve gotten all the follicles. IPL (Intense Pulse Light) has a different wavelength of light and it has a broader spectrum which will target hair follicles in all stages. The caveat is that IPL probably takes more treatments to get the job done, but since this device is rated for 999,999 pulses, I don’t think that would be an issue.

The reason I think this particular model more versatile, is that it does not require a seal against the skin in order to fire. We purchased a different device that required a good seal against the skin (presumably to prevent exposure to the light), and while it worked very nicely, it was a real challenge to use in the curves and crevices of the face where making a perfect seal with a 3-inch flat surface is impossible.

This device comes with a very good instruction manual. If you read it thoroughly and plan your strategy you’re very likely to get good results. I tried to show it in my video but unfortunately, the lens or the camera sensor just doesn’t pickup the wavelenghts of the light. Believe me, it’s bright, and it’s really a trip to see the hairs just evaporate. Just make sure to protect your eyes and follow all of the safety indications.

I am a 30 year Norelco user who also owns a five year old Norelco 6885XL which was the top of Norelco's line when purchased. Don't fall for "the latest is always better" line.
It’s a robbery!!!! You should be ashamed!!! $34 for bottles that normally should cost $0.82 each!!!

Much of the hand sanitizer we have been using is ETHYL alcohol (ethanol) based. THIS sanitizer is ISOPROPYL alcohol based. Note that historically most hand sanitizer has been based on isopropyl alcohol whereas ethanol has been used in things like alcohol that you drink of as a gasoline additive for oxygenated fuels (for environmental purposes) as well as other purposes. Isopropyl has been used in hand sanitizer and "rubbing alcohol" among other things. Both are now approved for use in hand sanitizer. Ethynol-based sanitzers are becoming much more common due to high demand and supply constraints on Isopropyl-based sanitizers.

The interesting thing is that the CDC and WHO have different guidelines for hand sanitizer effectiveness for these two types of alcohol:
CDC: Ethyl - at least 60%, Isopropyl - at least 70%
WHO: Ethyl - at least 80%, Isopropyl - at least 75%
You can see that it is interesting that the CDC recommends higher concentrations of Isopropyl whereas WHO recommends higher concentrations of Ethyl. Curious. Rather than dig into too many details on the difference, the easiest thing is to find a way to meet both...

The most common ethyl alcohol hand sanitizers that we have been getting (and the most common out there) are 70% -- which exceeds CDC 60% threshold, but is below the 80% WHO threshold.

THIS SANITIZER has an ISOPROPYL concentration of 75% which exceeds the CDC 70% threshold and meets the WHO 75% threshold.

Clearly these thresholds are not hard limits as indicated by the difference of opinion between CDC and WHO, but it is mildly comforting to meet both recommendations if you can do so with no downside or extra expense.

WHAT I LIKE:
* Easily squeezes out of bottle in controlled amount as a gel
* Rubs in easily and absorbs within less than a minute to leave no noticeable residue or tackiness on your hands
* Aloe helps to keep your hands moist, fighting the drying effects of the alcohol
* Small bottles are easy to take in car, backpack, purse, etc.
* Scent is minor and dissipates quickly (we're not using this for its smell after all)

SUMMARY:
A cost effective way to keep you hands sanitized when you can't use soap & water. Meets both CDC and WHO guidelines for effective hand sanitizer formulations.

Soap
Bottle Opener
Wine Bottle Stopper
2 Flower Petal Bath Bombs
Greeting Card

Pros - This is a really nice, complete gift set. You can send it directly and it comes nicely presented and all the things look really pretty in the box. Because of the bath bombs and soap it also smells lovely when you open it.

Cons - It has a greeting card in it to "Add your special message" but if you send it directly from Amazon obviously you can't do that (they suggest adding your own on the Amazon gift option). Also the card is inside the box - so if you had it shipped to you to give to someone you would still have to open it in order to fill it out.

Overall - this is on sale at the time of the review for under $20 and for that price it is definitely worth it. The cup and candle alone would be worth that.

What you get - 3 Unicorn style spa-style terry headbands.

Pros - these are cute and make a change from the normal bow or cat ear styles.

Cons - The ears don't sit equally either side of the horn and they aren't moveable. The bands are also smaller than others I have. Even though they don't say they are designed for children I feel that these may have been designed that way.

Overall - a little overpriced for what you get but might make fun teen party favors if they are having a spa or make up party.

What you get - a cute tin with 100 bobby pins - 50 multi-colored and 50 black

Pros - if you wear a lot of wigs or you want your hairpins to stand out these are fab. Honestly, I wish the whole box was the colored variety rather than just half of it - and the tin is really cute. The pins are a good size too - not the mini variety.

Cons - the colored pins don't have the litter rubber protectors on the end so they tend to snag a bit. For the price I think they could have had them all colored - not half plain black (which interestingly did have the ends on them)

Overall I will probably continue to use the colored ones as they blend in better with the wigs I use, but wish they had the ends on them.

What you get - 10 packets of dye (no mix needed)

Pros - the dye is ready to go. Put it on - leave it - rinse it out. It does dye the beard - VERY dark - it definitely works.

Cons - the process takes longer than it says on the packet (even the instructions have a longer time than it says) and it dyes the hair AND THE SKIN - which is impossible to avoid as it gets between the beard hairs. The stain on the skin has to fade - nothing got rid of the excess dye on the skin leaving a very fake looking result.

Overall it was a pass from us - will not be using any more packets.

I only recently discovered the trick of using white liner rather than black for some interesting looks. This is a good liner - it doesn't irritate my eyes at all and is definitely good value for money. My only issue is that even with several coats it doesn't look as white, or stay on as long, as some other brands that I have used. Having a 12 pack means though that as I often lose things I have extras on hand which is nice.

So I wear and review a lot of wigs and I have started breaking the review down into sections that I think will be helpful.

Color - The color is very similar to the person pictured wearing it in the examples but not the one that is on the mannequin look. This wig is very light silver / grey. It is not that fake, overly shiny texture, and is the same solid color throughout.

Styling- This has an adjustable headband and is fairly easy to fit and style. As it is a costume wig you have to be careful if you are looking to pull it back for anything as the amount of hair in the wig is really designed more for it to be worn as is (which is normal for this kind of price point)

Comfort - This wig is light and comfortable and there is plenty of airflow. This was a little weird around my ears (because my head is a little smaller) but nothing too difficult. This would be suitable to wear all day although I personally wouldn't.

Overall - I really liked it but for what it was - a costume wig. If you are looking for something for a Halloween type look this is perfect.Great for pictures and videos but not one I would probably wear out (other than possibly to a costume party if it completed the look) just because I have others that look way more realistic.

I am not a big traveler but this definitely has the essentials all ready to go in an FDA-approved clear bag. The items are decent quality but probably the most useful things are the bag it all comes in, and a little card that tells you all the things that you should be wiping down, a couple of which I hadn't thought of. I also hadn't thought of taking my own pillowcase before but having seen that it makes total sense. Yes, you could probably get all the things in it a little cheaper, but for convenience, this is a win. (I am also noting it as a possible stocking stuffer present for those people that are difficult to buy for and this would be an alternative to those who chocolate of bath products won't work for).

This lipstick is a really nice vibrant red color and stays on well without being drying. It did have a little bit of an unusual taste, not unpleasant, but enough that I noticed it hence the 4 stars. Other than that the coverage was great, it didn't smudge, and it looked fabulous. I will definitely be wearing it often.

This is a cute pink wig. The short waves make it pretty easy to wear but the bangs on it were super long and I had to trim them quite a lot to get it to look good. It is comfortable and would be great for cosplay but I couldn't quite get it adjusted enough for it to become one of my gotos that I would actually wear as a daily option.

I have lots of crowns that I use for various costumes. Full circle crowns are always harder to work with but this was made extra tricky from the fact that there is a very badly placed seam at what should be the front. Although it is sparkly - it is definitely not as well made as many of the others that I have that have been in the same price range. It is described as "Rose Gold" but it is definitely more "Gold Gold" in reality. Overall lackluster and disappointing.

This set of lip liners are a great set of Reds - and the colors are great. The only problem for me was that they are a little hard which means sometimes they are a little scratchy and harder to get the perfect lines. For the price though you are getting a good selection with pretty much any shade of Red liner you could need.

This crown is absolutely gorgeous. The detailing is really lovely and it sparkles beautifully. It comes packaged in a lovely blue box which conveniently could double as storage for it.  As with many complete circle crowns the wear and fit is an issue. This is definitely on the smaller size - and it is a little tricky to get it pinned in an acceptable position. The other note I have is that it is really heavy, on the plus side it doesn't feel like it will fall apart with the slightest movement - but between that and the size - sadly it probably won't become one of my regular pieces.

This definitely moisturizes, there is no question about that. I found that because of the texture (it's almost whipped) that you end up needing to use more product than with many of the options. Not sure that my skin would be stressed - but it definitely goes through a lot with the amount of make-up I put on it.  It is supposed to be fragrance-free and there's definitely not a perfume element - but maybe there should be, It smelled weird to me. I can't put my finger on what it was exactly just that I didn't really like it, but I can be picky over scents so that might just be me. Overall it was good - but not great - but also it's a mid-range rather than a higher price product which should be taken into account.

In England when I was younger, if your eyes were tired or puffy my mum would always tell me to put used tea bags on them. This is what these patches are like! 15 minutes wear and your eyes really do feel better - especially if you are suffering because of too much screen time. Don't be put off by the fact that the instructions aren't in English. Just take out a new pair, place on closed eyes for 15 minutes, and discard. You won't regret it!

This was just too big for my mouth - no matter how much I squished it.  I can't really say as to whether it would work or not because I couldn't really try it and nobody else in the house thought it looked like something they wanted to try. I am an adult - so feel that this should have been able to be small enough for everyone- but it was not!

I have always been a fan of black eyeliner. I never considered using anything else until now. I LOVE how bright this makes my eyes look. The pencil can be used in various ways but by far my favorite is to use it as an eyeliner. It's amazing quality, and although a little more expensive than I would have looked at before trying - now I'm a convert! I can't believe it took me so long to give it a try!

The Rose Quartz roller that comes with this is really nice., and I use it ALL the time. The micro needling kit - not so much. I am assuming that these are supposed to be one use and disposable (as there are NO options for changing/replacing the needle heads) - which could be a good thing in that at least you know for a fact it's clean. I read a lot about this and generally feel that it should be left to professionals! There is no way to tell what shape the little needles are on this (which from reading is pretty important), and there are LOTS of things that can go wrong. I am all about doing stuff at home - but I personally don't think a disposable micro needling kit is one of those things.

This is a great kit, for when you REALLY want your make-up to be on point. The primer gives a really great base and helps the foundation to look smooth and not crack, the ONLY downside is that for me, it doesn't allow my skin to breathe enough and I end up with breakouts if use it more than on the odd occasion which is a shame.  That being said a little goes a very long way, and on the days when I need my make up to be extra perfect then this gives me great results!

These are great! I am a big fan of the liquid liner over the pens. Super easy to use and you can have professional looking lashes in 2 easy steps. This set has a nice variety of lash styles from every day to super dramatic which is nice. They say reusable - I don't reuse mine because my eyes are super sensitive so can't comment on that part but I have seen that lots of people do reuse them so it is probably personal preference but I couldn't say how many uses you might get out of each pair.

I wear a lot of wigs - and am always looking for anything that can make them easier to wear. This product definitely worked, was easy to use, but I am not sure that it is worth the price. I have other items that have worked as well that weren't as expensive.  If this was a little cheaper though it would be fabulous for cosplayers that use a lot of different wigs / toppers.

My daughter has thick hair which sits a couple of inches below her shoulders and takes forever to dry so I hoped these would be a good solution. Sadly although they are super soft, they don't absorb enough if you have longer / thicker hair.  My hair is shorter and thinner than my daughters and although it worked better on that - it still wasn't much better than a regular towel.  Very cute - but disappointing results.

These are very convenient to throw in your purse when you are on the go, especially with everything going on at the moment. Working out at just under $1 a use they are pretty good value for money. They don't have a harsh scent and they aren't drying on your skin which is always a plus. A good product!

This wig looks super cute once you get it sorted. The bangs are long, and needed trimming, which is pretty normal for me, but this one was a little trickier to get adjusted correctly and I ended up using extra clips to secure it. Short wigs are often harder to work with because there are less places to hide the mistakes, but overall I ended up with a very cute look.

I needed a peacock clip for my vikings cosplay and this worked really well. Having the 3 separate pieces allows for lots of variety and styling options. The only downside is that the glue on one had completely dried up and the gem had fallen off in the packet. Super glue handled that but it did stop it from getting 5 stars.

These are really good purple options. The crayons make it easy to use for underlining the eyes. It was a little tricky to use as a shadow, with more being needed and it definitely took more work to do that, but as a general addition to my make up I was pleased.

The color on these are strong, but they feel a little waxy for my preference. That being said they do stain quite well and there was a variety of red shades which means there would be something for most skin types. Just not one I can see me using on a regular basis.

I used the copper and the white/silver to create the effect in the picture. I love that the color was long lastig and definitely shimmery.  It didn't flake off as some glitter based ones do.  I found the best effect occurred if I let a layer dry and then added more - to build up the shine but if I didn't wait long enough between layers it did get a little clumpy.  Overall a fun addition for the holiday / party season.

This lipstick is the sort that is great to pull out of your purse in places because it just looks super classy.  The color is nice and vibrant and it doesn't dry out your lips.  The effect is quite matte so I will confess I added a staying gloss over it - but purely for visual effect. My skin tone was failing to pull off the flatter red. It didn't need it for moisture.

I wear a lot of wigs for cosplay purposes and am always looking for anything that can make life easier.  This definitely helps grip the wig in place although I did use it with wig clips as well.  There was definitely less slipping around the front area, which can be an issue with them sliding back.  It was a little tight for me and I don't have a big head.  2 hours of wearing it and I was ready to pull it off. For short term use it is a nice addition to have - for if I am just going to be doing a quick set of pictures or a short video, this would never last on my head for the day though,

I love these easy eye treatments and have used several varients.  This is a little dryer than some of the others used and definitely pulls a little more.  The results are OK but I think it loses a lot from not having the extra moisture left to dab in when you remove them.  Personally I prefer them with a more gel type feel.

This set is great for anyone possibly looking to try a slightly different look.  12 individual, full size lipsticks all in fall / Halloween type colors.  For truer color, as with many lipsticks, several layers work better.  The color lasts really well even through eating and drinking, but comes off easily with remover!

These were one of the easiest mask type products I have used.  The application process literally takes seconds.  Peel off and place on face and they stay there.  I left them on for 15 minutes and could definitely tell the difference afterwards.  As the package describes there is a little residue left when you take them off which yu just dab in.  Over all I was pleased with the effect, but not pleased enough to want to pay $7 for just the one set.

Ok, I do not typically wear hats, head wraps, anything in my head, but due to my recently becoming the victim of a hair coloring debacle, I purchased 2 of these wraps (black and beige) to camouflage this eye-assaulting color. (It was either cover it or stay indoors for a month lol).

As annoyed as I am about having to camouflage my hair for the next few weeks (until I can get the color corrected), I'm equally as pleased with these wraps! They are soft, comfy and super stylish. My go-to style is the top knot - so easy, so fast, so cute! I've gotten many compliments and have even been told I look "exotic" wearing it. Lol. They're a great solution to my temporary problem. I'll probably even wear them after I change my hair color. Very happy with my purchase!
Whyyyyyy aren't more brands making brown?!?! Please make brown lashes too!! Please please!

Like "Amazon Shopper" I too read many good reviews on this electric razor--both on amazon.com and several magazines. For the life of me I cannot seem to get a close shave, going back and forth over areas to no avail. The accompanying literature seems to say that the closest shave might not be obtained until after 30 days of use. Let me tell you, it has been 21 days and still terrible. In the meantime, you are not supposed to use a regular razor (presumably while your skin adjusts) so basically you're walking around as a stubbly gal, even though you are shaving every day! At least it hasn't cut me yet.  I am very disappointed in this product.
It works
Where I can inquiry more diferentes needles sizes

Not for me. As a stylist, I personally love boar round brushes but wanted a friendly alternative. I don’t like the bristles on this brush they are very scratchy to the touch.  I bought this for personal use and I found that it’s good at stretching out the hair for super straight and smooth blowouts but it went through my hair horribly (personally). I used it on my mom’s hair and it worked perfectly, smoothed out her hair and gave nice curls (we have different hair types). Works great on straighter hair and ultra curly-thick hair but I personally find it’s not so good on the in between. It’s super lightweight and you will love it if it works for you, I wouldn’t say it’s completely horrible it’s just not for me at all and I’ve worked with so many different round brushes I can’t even begin count. Just depends on your hair but in the end, I would not recommend.

BUYERS BEWARE OF DESCRIPTION. It says 5 LARGE, when in reality you get 5 multi-sized and mine only came with 1 actual large sized pouch. I'm a freelance makeup artist and I needed these to pack unexpectedly for tomorrow and now I am out of luck. I was supposed to at least get 2 red tagged ones but the set only came with one. The one star is for the incorrect product description in the title and me getting 4 bags and 1 clear toiletry bag instead of 5. ZUCA has GREAT quality products, I can depend on ZUCA when I am on set or traveling but buy them from another seller.

I wanted to like this. I really did. But it’s not constructed very well. I’m just gonna run through everything one by one.

1) It feels very cheaply made, like cheap plastic.
2) It took me 5 mins just to get the head to come off to replace it with a different one. It’s so difficult to turn, I almost thought I was gonna have to go and got some pliers lol
3) In the manual it does specifically say that it’s normal for the unit heads to get warm with use. It got HOT almost immediately after turning it on. Not okay!
4) It PULLED the hair on my eyebrow...ouch!
5) The power button is awkward. You have to push it in so far that it’s almost impossible unless you have baby fingers. And it’s definitely not easy with long nails!

Overall, I think this product was definitely a miss. Try at your own risk, but this won’t be used by me ever again

DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!!! I was very pleased with it and wish I would have looked more at the reviews before purchasing.They come with 6 but EVERY SINGLE one was practically empty!!!!!! You would think it would be at least half ways full but NOPE it literally has nothing in them and for that price they should be giving the customers what we pay for...I will NEVER buy anything from this company again and Hoping I stop someone from wasting their money on this ..Not only do they short you on the product but it dont stay on or come out right..you can do the top coat and cure it than try to apply the powder,but it just rubs off ...DO NOT WASTE YOU MONEY IN THIS!!!!!!!

This is a great product, I've bought it before. I tried to buy it again, they had it on the subscribe and save, I ordered it because I needed it, and now it's out of stock. Why would you do a subscribe and save if you didn't have any in stock! I want my item!
Only received half of what was supposed to be there.  How can I get the rest and has anyone else had this problem?

I purchased this hair to add to my locs and to make loc extensions. When it arrived I was immediately disappointed when opening the package, the hair was yellow and looked plastic. I tried the burning test and it did burn as human hair does, but it was going up fast almost as if whatever was on the hair was flammable. I immediately washed the hair with purple shampoo and it turned out beautifully! After washing I was happy, it wasn't yellow anymore and burn testing again confirmed it was human hair and it had lost that coating the seemed flammable. It has a very nice curl pattern after letting air dry. I bought the 30 inch and I will say that it was disappointing how thin the ends were. Normally hair will thin out at the ends some but this bundle the ends were extremely thin.

Pros: Good price, long length, actually human hair, colors nicely, turns to a beautiful platinum after a purple shampoo, nice curl pattern (kind of like beach waves)
Cons: yellow color (removes pretty easily though), seems flammable before being washed, extremely thin ends

Because of the cons I couldn't give this hair 5 stars, I'd rate it a 3.5 I probably will search for a thicker bundle before I'd purchase this one again.

Too short!

Wig that was received seemed like it was shorter than what I requested. It is a good wig though would be better if it was the actual length I ordered.

I recently received this product, I have very sensitive gums but I read that this kit's gel was good and not painful. I dont feel any discomfort. I've done 2 treatments so far it's all great. I'll be buying the gels separately. Also this is a cheaper alternative to the dentist. I went to the dentist around 2 years ago and the gel was strong and I couldn't finish the time of the treatment. This gel is a lot more gentle and I dont have any theeth sensitivity after using it.

I wanted to strip my hair of black dye after 10 years of dying it. And begin embracing my grays. After first use, I saw little change but did notice the texture of my hair getting softened. I applied the Color Reverse the next day and I started seeing the black stripping away. I do this with dry hair and wait 20 minutes before rinsing and shampooing it. My hair use to be naturally black but with the black dye slowly stripping, it’s fading from black to brown and eventually from brown to blond until white is shown or natural hair color is revealed. I’ve decided to wait 2-3 days before reapplying the Color Reverse to avoid dryness of my scalp and hair. It really strips out dyes and oils. So be patient because it will not work in one application, especially if you was dying your hair for years like me.

Because of Covid-19 I haven’t been able to get my hair cut. Head wraps are a perfect solution. I love the stretch in the material and the solid colors easily match outfits. Plus learning to tie the scarfs  is so much fun.
I didn't see much results for my grey beard but it did work for the hair on top of my head. Ive used better products elsewhere

This iron did not work for me. I did not realize it was a brush iron when I purchased it which is my fault. I though it came with an extra brush. Once I received it I thought OK I will give it a try. NO. That was a waist of time. Tried again and again. Did not work on my hair. I would not recommend this brush iron to anyone with curly kinky thin hair and not so sure it will work for thicker hair either. However I can say that the seller promptly refunded and even told me to keep it. Its now in my closet awaiting  use by possibly a visitor who has thicker hair than me and who is more adventurous and very patient.

I really like the drying power and cooling button on this dryer. It has plenty of settings for drying. Plus the cooling button to burst in some cool air during regular heat drying. My only complaint is that its a little long which I needed to get used to in order to dry my hair comfortably and so not great for travelling. This is my first Ionic dryer and I did still notice static while drying but not so bad and because it has various heat settings and strong wind power that also has a lower setting then I really can't complain. Its a great dryer. I don't think my hair has ever dried faster without any damage. My hair is healthier now than it was with my old small dryer which took much longer to dry.
Its a thick green substance that left my face really dry and made me breakout. I do have sensitive skin, so I try to be careful but this isn’t moisturizing in the slightest bit. I do not recommend.

I did my own acrylic nails for years. A few years ago I just got tired of the maintenance and let them go. It took over a year for my nails to grow out from the damage; they were so trashed.

Recently I had started doing poly gel nails but truthfully, they are a pain. They're are pain to get on, and they're a pain to get off, although they look great and last forever when you get them (when you get them right).

I saw these and had flashbacks to the '70s press on nails. They were ghastly. And they flew off at the worst possible times. But I figured what the heck.... as cheap as these are, why not?

Again, I'm trying to let my nails heal, so I used the tabs and not the glue. I love these tabs. Super easy. Super sticky. And the one that I didn't get on right just rolled off super easy.

The glue tabs included were a little narrow for my nail beds so there's a little color variation by the cuticle where there isn't any glue. But I also ordered some other tabs that were a little more substantial and I will use those next time.

Within taking these out of the package I literally had a full set of nails in probably 8 minutes. And they don't look half bad, considering I didn't file them to make them the perfect size etc.

I accidentally ordered the short which are way too short for me normally but, I'll wear these until they come off because they look cute. Even short they look better than my trashed/split/broken nails. I will update when they start popping off.

This "groomer" is very hard. I would not rub my cat with it. My cats do not rub themselves with it either. My cats do not even sniff at the catnip when I put some on this. I have left this on the floor of my home for days and my cats show no interest in it at all.

This is a great starter set to see if you like the Arisson brand enough to get their subscription service. This is also a get set to travel with because it comes with a trial size tube of shave gel that smells nice.
ok so this is a very wet mascara and can get messy, it does make the lashes appear longer but has no volume

I had ready this wax is a flexible wax. Yes, all similar waxes flex to a degree but this one is supposed to be a bit more elastic. That's to help it wrap around tricky areas (ankle bones, knees, etc.). It's also supposed to work well for large areas. I prefer to wax myself, and I don't have assistance. I also like to wax everywhere. I waxed my own back with this stuff and it actually worked. I did larger sections, and was reaching behind myself to both apply and remove the wax. It did indeed stretch and flex well so there wasn't any wax or hair breakage. The hair on my back is the typically fluffy vellus hair. It showed up after I had my second and I just don't like it even if it's not super obvious (or even visible 90% of the time). Admittedly that hair type did make it difficult to see, but again this wax wasn't too fussy. I'm 100% positive I applied it in the wrong direction at times and removed in the wrong direction too. Still, worked great.

I also tested it out on my legs. The hair there really varies from fine and barely visible blonde to thicker and quite dark (and rather stubborn to remove in places). It did a decent job on most of my legs. In the areas where the hair is a bit more stubborn I really had to work in smaller sections to get a good result. But in areas like my thighs I was able to do wide areas with ease and little left behind. On my thighs I have small areas that grow in different directions for no reason. I thought I'd have to do second passes, but I rarely did.

All that aside, I don't think this is the best wax for everyone. If you have a lot of very fine or fluffy vellus hair on large areas. Especially if it's on tricky areas like the stomach or behind your shoulders, and areas such as my upper arms where the hair literally grows both up and down in the exact same spot. This will get the job done. If the hair is even a little bit stubborn, you will probably run into some issues. For those places I'd say the pink version (their Best Loved wax) is a fantastic option.

I got this today and tried it out right away. I only had a couple minutes and was happy to discover it blends quickly and easily. I’m fussy about makeup and don’t like the look of anything too obvious. After initial application I used my hands to gently wipe away excess and help it melt into the skin, it made a big difference. As an aside, it was very difficult to wash off my hands so I suspect it won’t transfer all over the place. It lives up to its name and imparts a lovely glow but doesn’t look oily or greasy. So far I’ve had it on for five hours and it still looks pretty good. I did spray my face with a bit of water and blotted with a tissue. That really smoothed the areas that we’re looking a bit dry. I need to swap to a heavier winter moisturizer and and had done no skin prep prior to application. Given that I can’t judge this too harshly.

As to the shade, it’s not prefect but close. I wear Cream in Hourglass Vanish foundation. I think that makes me close to NW15-20 in MAC. I feel like the cool tone version of 21 would work better, but this one is neutral enough I can make it work. A lot of times neutrals lean too warm but this one doesn’t seem too which means it’ll work for more people. I think depth wise it’s okay, but If you’re at all darker than me get the next shade up.

At under $13 this is pretty incredible. It doesn’t come with a refill, but given the price I’m not going to complain. Please note if you’re buying this only for the compact my AmorePacific cushion doesn’t not fit in this at all. So if you use anything shaped like that it won’t work. You could just swap the sponge with the actual product though. I will for sure be keeping this case, my kids love it too!

In the photo I’m also wearing Hourglass AL powder in Etherial Light, blush in Luminous Flush (also on eyes), and lip gloss in Cosmic Pink.
I JUST STARTED USING IT A COUPLE DAYS AGO SO I HAVE TO WAIT TO SEE ANY RESULTS; HOWEVER, I LIKE THE TEXTURE.  IT JUST GLIDES ON.  I'M 59 BUT I DON'T HAVE DEEP WRINKLES AROUND THE EYES.

Love the makeup.  Does feel refreshing.  BUT!  You can get it at the Clinique counter for 32$.  This feels like price gouging.  Don’t get me wrong I love the convenience of amazon but really $18 more than what you can buy it for at the store?  Disappointing to say the least.

The description states this is a high quality women's wig and the picture seems to show that as well. The blonde wig that I received is not what I expected, based on the listing. The hair quality was okay - although not quite as realistic as the picture. The wig was adjustable and felt okay while I was wearing it. However, there was not any way that I could arrange the wig that the weave of the skull cap did not show. So, the only way that I could wear this wig was with a hat, scarf, or headband. I was not expecting as high of a quality as the listing indicates, but I was expecting to be able to wear it by itself. I am disappointed.

I received this item free in exchange for using it and providing my honest, unbiased feedback. The price I paid had no bearing on my review, as I have no relationship to the seller and I never guarantee a good review.

I love temporary tattoos. They alway me to enjoy my creative side, without the pain or lifetime commitment of real tattoos. AND I can change them often. I have used the smaller kind many times, but this is my first time with a larger size. When I got them and went to apply them, I noticed there were no directions in the package. I took a chance that it was the same as the smaller ones I had used previously, so I remove the sticky clear paper and applied the tattoo with paper to my arm. I took a damp paper towel and held it on the tattoo for about a minute. I then slowly remove the paper backing. It worked just fine. I did have on little bubble in the design, but I pushed on it a little and it looked liked the rest of the tattoo. This has stayed on very well as I am going on about day 5 and it still looks great. The tattoo covered a good percentage of my upper arm, so it is definitely noticeable. Overall, I am enjoying wearing my new tattoo and will be looking to see what other designs this company has.

I received this item at a discount in exchange for using it and providing my honest, unbiased feedback. The price I paid had no bearing on my review, as I have no relationship with the seller and I never guarantee a good review.
Not really worth it.

Let me start out by saying that I do not have sensitive skin. When I applied the bubble mask, it burned, and in fact my skin kept burning for hours afterward. Whenever you feel something fizzing on your skin, it doesn't mean that "it's working", what it really means is that irritation is taking place.
The mask is also extremely soapy and hard to wash off, it reminded me of washing laundry detergent off your hands. In fact, I wouldn't be surprised if that was precisely how they made it foam - by adding laundry detergent.
I suggest you read up on skincare (reputable, scientifically supported sites like beautypedia.com) and stay away from products like these.
Left my hair filling dirty

This is hands down, the best face brush. Not only is a lot more affordable than the clarisonic, it is a lot softer. I couldn't bring myself to spending $200 on a clarisonic especially when I felt the brush. I have sensitive skin but large pores on my nose. I really was looking for something that was soft but cleaning. I looked into the soft 310,000 bristle brushes, but after reading reviews it would take way too long to dry to be able to use everyday. The Elishacoy brush is super soft but small enough to dry during the night and during the day. I use it in the morning and the night with my cleanser. I only use it for about 10 seconds on each area of my face. Avoid the eyes the skin is very fragile.

PROS:
Soft brush
Two different settings for speed
Fits in hand well
Silicone cover battery to make it waterproof
Ultra-affordable for quality
Made pores appear smaller

CONS:
Korean brand you can't go to store to buy brush replacements

I was looking forward to using this pump, rather than taking the cover off the Listerine bottle every time to use it. Although the items was "as described" (which had no dimension listed, only that it fit either the 1 or 1.5 liter bottle of Listerine ONLY)  I had no idea how HUGE this would be, once attached to at least a one liter bottle. The pump goes approx 2 inches above the lip of the already large bottle, with no options for use on smaller sized bottle. I already had a 500 ml bottle, which is about as large as I'd want at the bathroom sink, but I had to go out and find a liter bottle (or larger) in order to use this. Had I been able to purchase one that fit the 500ml (1 pint) bottle, I would be far happier. To add insult to injury, Amazon prime wouldn't sell me the 1 L bottle. Once I tried to purchase it, the product became a Prime Fresh product, which is a service I don't use. Just be aware, this isn't a dainty bottle on your bathroom counter sink. Once attached, it looks like a commercial sized bottle. Would not re-purchase.

I have easily, over the years, purchased 100+ orders on amazon.com.  I received my order for this little beauty a few days ago and felt COMPELLED to write my FIRST review.  This thing is freaking amazing!  I don't think I am ever going to shave again.  And I'm a young man, but with old-school taste; straight razors, safety razors, badger brushes, the whole nine yards.  As much as I enjoy a classic shave (I keep a lined up, close to the face beard), it takes a lot of time and prep, which is not practical with a busy schedule.  This little detail trimmer has the T-blade which I have always LOVED, and it is able to be zero-gapped.  However, right out of the box this thing cut razor sharp and is shave-worthy close!  Its super small too; fits in palm of hand.  A single AA battery powers it, and to be honest it doesn't sound or feel powerful, but somehow the results speak for themselves.  This thing trimmed my line-up on my neck and cheeks with precision and never once nicked or pulled a single hair.  Right off the bat it looked like I was shaving with my straight edge, the lines were that crisp.  I highly recommend this product.  Its like $20 something bucks and comes with a lanyard (which I originally thought was kind of stupid but its so small and light, I feel it can easily fall off the sink and break so I would use it just to be careful).  Buy a pack of batteries and enjoy barber style edge-work from the privacy and convenience of your own bathroom.  I am still going to purchase a 5-star detailer (corded) in the future but this is a great first step into "dry shaving."  Wahl certainly impressed me and its going in my travel pack for sure.  Fresh face on the go is worth its weight in gold to me.

This case is beautiful on the outside, but has given me nothing but problems. Sometimes the box will lock, and sometimes it won't. Sometimes it will unlock on the first try, and sometimes it will unlock on the 10th try. Sometimes the key keeps spinning, and spinning...and spinning. As you can gather, the lock mechanism and key on this case isn't great, so I wouldn't trust this as an actual "lock box." I would definitely look for something that utilizes a better made lock and key.

The lid also has a very hard time staying open on its own. Not only that, but the material on the inside is very cheap. While I love the color and the compartments on the top for holding things like eyeliner pencils (or regular pencils) and other flat items, I expected the quality to be a bit better.

I have another Vaultz case that I bought 2.5 years ago that is very durable and reliable when it comes to the lock, so I expected this to be better.

Maybe, just maybe, i received a defective case.

I am a toothpaste snob and have always bought the best such as Rembrandt, Mentadent, or Crest 3D because good toothpaste (including a Sonicare toothbrush) is so much better/cheaper than dental work.

The Optic White looks unimpressive as just a plain white paste. No stripes, twin tubes, sparkles, or any flavor-bursting crystals or strips. I was not expecting much, but after using it, I am so impressed with this that this will become my new toothpaste. It has a lot of silica in it, so it feels more abrasive than others, but it does the trick (along with some nominal amounts of hydrogen peroxide) to actually whiten my teeth as good or better than any other toothpaste I've used.

It also comes with a relatively high amount of fluoride at 0.76%. This is compared to the Crest 3D at 0.243% (or triple) while the Crest Pro Health lists 0.454%.

Additionally, I've found with a lot of toothpastes such as Crest Pro Health that they contain some kind of ingredient (one of the gingivitis or plaque chemicals) that tends to dissolve my mouth. With those other toothpastes, I get an annoying slough-off of a layer of mouth skin. I asked my dentist, and she said it is one of the chemicals and likely an irritant to my gums. Well, this Colgate Optic White does not have that ingredient yet cleans my teeth really well. I'm sure that Colgate has done their homework, but it is too early to tell if the additional silica will result in increased enamel wear.

Another note about Sparkling Mint is that it is really a bright mint flavor. Your mouth will feel really sparkling and cool which I kind of like, but some may find the flavor too strong.

I would highly recommend this toothpaste.

This is a great little headband for securing your facemask if you've either worn a rash on your ears due to bands or just need it a little tighter on your face for a better seal. The little buttons are very secure on the headband and to me don't seem in danger of popping off. The cloth is very soft and firm on the head so it stays in place pretty well through the day and isn't super thick so those in hotter climates won't be sweating through terribly and soaking the band.

I'm giving this 5 stars because it DOES do what it's supposed to (stays on the head, secures bands around the buttons, etc) and feels good and soft but sadly my head/face is just too petite for this to work with a mask so I'm having to stick with my children's sized masks or the ones that go around the back of my head to ensure I don't have gapping around my cheeks or chin. The headband does it's job, masks are just too big/wide for me to actually have them work together.

So it IS a very good product, it's just not enough to solve my personal issue and that's not a fault of the headband so it would be unfair to rate it poorly because of that. In all likelihood for the vast majority of people, this will work perfectly

However, I still use it as a plain headband! I like that it's so firmly in place that I can use it to hold my hair back when I wash my face and do my skincare routine and works great when I'm excercising and don't want a mess of curls flying into my sweaty face. So it's still serving a great purpose for me even if I can't use it with masks!

If you need a mild chemical exfoliant and want to cut out products from your routine, this might be the serum for you. It's a weaker concentration of retinol but with that trade, you get a less harsh serum that still keeps your skin hydrated and has a lesser chance of causing irritation. You can most likely use this as a serum/cream combo. Likely a big bonus for those with sensitive skin.

I've taken a break from my usual Tretinoin cream due to the extreme sun in my area but I do still need to keep up with chemical exfoliants and retinol has the added bonus of fighting acne like Tret does. My skin is definitely smoothing out again and looks more even, but it's a very very subtle improvement so I'm not sure if those that have significant texture issues or need a lot of brightening or fading will be pleased with this as it most likely would take a while to see visible results.

It's not a bad product but with such a low retinol percentage it is quite expensive compared to other retinol serums/creams on the market and also comes in a small bottle. I do like it but I don't think it's something I'd purchase myself if only because of that.

I got this to help with my ear and nostril piercings. My ear piercings had tightened up after many years of not wearing jewelry. I could barely fit standard earrings in but the left side would hurt after a short time and I would have to remove it. My piercer stretched them just to a 16g. My nostril gets a little sore and irritated when removing and inserting jewelry for cleaning.
Even though I shower and scrub my ears and jewelry daily I sometimes get that funky yeasty cheesy smell. I found out that can happen when they have been stretched, even if just a small amount.
I also wanted something to make inserting earrings and nostril rings easier.
So enter Smelly Gelly. Something I tried to put on my skin and jewelry.
Pros
Cute little tin.
I would imagine even with this small amount that it would last a lot time.
After cleaning and applying in the morning I didn’t notice a cheesy smell at bedtime like I sometimes do. Although by morning it was back and yes I used fresh pillowcases.
Low product price

Cons
Shipping is an extra cost. Not prime and not free.
It’s a hard wax. Even warming it with my hands it stays just a hard, tacky wax.
It didn’t lubricate my jewelry to make it any easier to insert.
It smells like oil that has gone rancid.
I had to stir it up to get any scent besides old oil to appear.
The only faint scent that came out when stirred was maybe of eucalyptus.
When used in my nostril jewelry I was stuck with the rancid oil smell all day.
It did not help with nostril irritation from changing out jewelry.

I first started with the GLO teeth whitening system with my dentist. The system that you can get done at your dentist provides a stronger gel for a quicker and whiter result... So at the dentist i was only able to sit through three rounds... I think my experience was hindered by a lack of the dental technician using the system properly and keeping my gums protected properly. We had to stop after the third round (after an hour) due to a very painful jolt of burning like my nerves in my gum/tooth were being burned. So we could not continue. I plan on mentioning this at my next visit that i think my results could have been better. So these are things for you to mention if you’re starting at your dentist. The treatment and take home kit all together is around $600 so this is not something you want done wrong.

As for the take home kit i really enjoy the packaging you get. The system comes in this sleek compact case with your mouth guard, light, lip balm, and ten gel packs. Be sure to charge your unit ASAP because it takes a few hours to fully charge. I really like that you can be hands free with no discomfort while using this system. The at home system has continued lifting my teeth and causing ZERO sensitivity (thank goodness!) i will update when i have finished a few more treatments.

•picture is after on top and before on bottom. The top shows some imperfections because some spots got whiter than others. This has been getting better with the at home kit that i do a few times a week. Bottom isn’t bad but now my smile is very bright!

The first thing I noticed when I used the product was the delicate scent. It's very nice and stays on you for awhile. So, you pump out the 'gel' which I would call soap except for the fact that it doesn't lather much. Instructions say to pump in your hand then apply to face. I tried that, but my face felt too dry, so I moistened it a little bit and then applied the gel. I rinsed it off well and patted my skin dry. Within seconds I felt my skin drying up. If you have really dry skin, you know what I mean - that taut feeling you try to avoid. I had to get some cream and moisturize right away. I'm guessing there must be something like alcohol in this makeup remover. If you have oily skin or perhaps you're trying to remove a heavy foundation - this may be a good choice for you. But since I wear light makeup and have very dry skin, I can't use this. I'll try it again in the summer when my skin produces more oil as the scent is really nice and makes it worth a second try.

I was immediately enchanted with this hairpiece from the second I tried it on. I've tried wearing it a few days in a row now, and I'm not tired of it yet. First, I'll start by saying that I ordered it as an add-on item in "dark blue to peacock green." With Prime, it only took two days to get to my house; very fast and convenient shipping, and the hairpiece was encased in a clear plastic bag; I threw that away, as I keep my extensions in a silk hair case. This hairpiece is actually pretty high quality for synthetic, eccentric hair, so I would suggest something like that to keep it safe and untangled when you're not wearing it.

In my opinion, the product images do not really do this hairpiece justice. I can't say anything for other colors yet, but the dark blue to peacock green is pretty true to the product images, with sapphire blue roots and aqua-blue tips (although I will say the hairpiece I received is not half-and-half blue and green like the picture; mine is like an ombre gradient, approximately 2/3 blue and 1/3 aqua tips).

Many of the reviews here also have mixed comments on the thickness of the hairpiece; maybe the people who say it is "thin" are comparing it to their own natural hair? I will say that this piece is very thick for a single-weft hair extension. A weft is like a curtain of hair with a seam holding it all together at the top. I wear extensions almost every day after a butchered haircut took 12 inches of my hair. Authentic human hair extensions come in wefts of varying widths, usually one clip wide or four clips wide, and the hair is very thin because the wefts are meant to be layered on in sections, like natural hair. This blue hair extension is 5 clips wide--wide enough to fasten on your head from ear to ear. Because of my experiences with authentic human hair extensions, I was expecting this blue piece to be thin and underwhelming, but I was wrong and am very happy about that.

I also have an asymmetrical haircut that is close-cropped on one side, so this extension is actually too wide for me to wear across my nape (as the model does in the product image), but I am still able to use it. I curve it to clip from my left nape to above my right ear and it suits my needs and still looks real, despite its unusual color.

Since there is so much hair on a single weft, as other reviewers have stated, this hair extension is a bit heavy. That may take some getting used to, as improper clipping could cause some discomfort and irritation from pulling on the roots. However, once you get practice putting it in, you will learn the best way to clip it without any tugging or pulling of the hair.

It is synthetic material, and while I noticed that mine was shiny, it was not like "Barbie hair," as some reviewers said. I did not need to rub any baby powder in; I just wore it to work for a few hours a day and the shine eventually dulled to look a little less like synthetic material. I will try to add some photos to this page of what the extension looks like in my (straight black) hair. I also noticed that it became easily tangled after a few days of wear. This is not really a problem; I am afraid to brush it too often though, as it sheds (which is normal, but I want it to last).

Lastly, despite being synthetic material, I have tried straightening it on the high setting on my Conair flatiron with success. You can also use a razor or scissors to make any modifications to the style or length, if necessary.

Overall, I think you will be very satisfied with this product if you buy it. I liked it so much that I placed an order for dark pink/light pink and yellow/lime green. These were not add-on items, however, so I will be waiting until mid-August to September to receive these other hair extensions. Hopefully they will be as nice as the blue/peacock green, because I was not disappointed!
a bit of a learning curve but it helps me maintain my body waves.

(This product was sent to me for review.)

This is a nice, light cream for skin that is probably less dry, sun damaged, and aged than mine. My other shea-butter products leave a more lasting "deeply moisturized" feeling on my arms and chest. By contrast, this product (applied twice, a few minutes apart) leave a non-greasy, nice, soft feeling that is more appropriate for day use, especially when I have business engagements or don't want to smear cream on nice clothing.

I've had little luck in finding on the Oz Naturals website the precise meaning of the first ingredient, "organic herbal infusion." A few other consumer websites conclude that the term refers to water in which herbs have been macerated. Given that dry skin needs water, I don't mind that this is the first ingredient (followed by palm oil and sweet almond oil), but I would find more forthcoming to say "organic herbal-infused water." (Also, what kind of water? Tap water? Filtered water?)

Also, the gluten-sensitive folks should note that this product contains wheat germ.

(Note: I received this as a review product.)

Because my skin tends on the dry side, I avoid any product that says "mask." That's because most masks are drying to my skin. But this product claims to be moisturizing, so I tried it.

The product is clear, without the clay in many masks, so there is no spooky cracked mask-effect after 15-20 minutes. But it does dry "taut."

The benefits of rose hip oil seem straightforward enough, but this mask does not feel oily. I'm also not sure what pro-vitamin B5 and an amino acid complex will do for my skin; I doubt published studies are devoted to this.

The mask leaves my skin feeling soft and supple but definitely ready for moisturizer. I don't have the time for a regular routine with this mask, and I'm not sure it's worth it for me.
